# Ponto

[Ponto](https://myponto.com/) is a paid third-party service that enables
companies and professionals to connect multiple bank accounts to a
single platform. It provides a unified view of all transactions within a
single interface. When integrated with Odoo, it automatically
synchronizes bank transactions directly into its database.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Using Ponto is subject to applicable fees.
::::

::: seealso
\- `../bank_synchronization`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} - [Financial
institutions connected to Ponto](https://www.isabelgroup.eu/banks)
:::

## Configuration {#accounting/bank-synchronization/ponto/configuration}

To connect a bank with Odoo using Ponto as the third-party provider,
follow these steps:

1.  Set up your email address: Click the profile icon in the upper-right
    corner, select `My profile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    fill in the `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
2.  `Create a Ponto account <accounting/bank-synchronization/ponto/ponto-account-creation>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} if needed.
3.  `Connect Odoo to your bank <accounting/bank-synchronization/ponto/odoo-connection>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.

### Ponto account creation {#accounting/bank-synchronization/ponto/ponto-account-creation}

1.  Access the [Ponto website](https://myponto.com).

2.  Click `Login`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then
    `Not a user yet?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and follow the
    instructions to create a new account.

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    Use the same email address as the one `used for your Odoo profile
    <accounting/bank-synchronization/ponto/configuration>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
    ::::

3.  After logging in, create an `Organization`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} and provide the necessary contact details.

4.  Give consent to Ponto to access the bank account data.

5.  Click `Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Add account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then
    `Choose your bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, enter the
    bank account reference, and follow the on-screen steps to complete
    the linking process.

6.  Add all relevant bank accounts that need to be synchronized with
    Odoo, then proceed to the next steps.

### Connection with Odoo {#accounting/bank-synchronization/ponto/odoo-connection}

When
`connecting a bank to Odoo <accounting/bank-synchronization/first-synchronization>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} using Ponto as the third-party provider, follow these steps:

1.  When connecting to the desired bank, make sure Ponto is selected as
    the third-party `Provider`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
2.  Select the account(s) to grant Ponto access to account balances and
    transactions, then confirm the selection.
3.  Authorize Odoo to request account information and initiate payment
    orders.
4.  Select the specific bank account to connect.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- Make sure to check the consent checkbox to allow information to be
shared with Odoo. - Select all accounts that need access and
synchronization, including those from other banking institutions.
::::

::: seealso
`Update synchronization credentials <accounting/bank-synchronization/update-credentials>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

## Vendor payments with Ponto {#accounting/bank-synchronization/ponto/payments}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Before managing vendor payments with Ponto, make sure the following
steps are completed:

- `SEPA Credit Transfer is activated (SCT) <accounting/pay_sepa/activate-sepa>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.
- `The SEPA Credit Transfer payment method has been added to the bank journal
  <accounting/pay_sepa/activate-sepa-bank-journal>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.
- `The vendor's bank account has been marked as trusted <../../payments/trusted_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}.
- The `Account Online Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  ([account_online_payment]{.title-ref}) module is `installed
  <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

To register a vendor payment using Ponto, follow these steps:

1.  Go to `Accounting --> Vendors --> Payments`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and create the payment. Fill in the relevant
    bank `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, select
    `SEPA Credit Transfer
    <accounting/pay_sepa/registering-payments-sepa>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} as the `Payment Method`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, and enter the
    `Vendor Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then click
    `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
2.  Go to `Accounting --> Vendors --> Batch Payments`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and `create a batch
    <accounting/batch/creation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. Select
    the same bank `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Payment
    Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and click
    `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to select the
    payment created in the previous step.
3.  Click `Initiate Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
    connect to Ponto and follow the steps to sign the payment.

## Troubleshooting {#accounting/bank-synchronization/ponto/troubleshooting}

::: seealso
`Bank synchronization troubleshooting <accounting/bank-synchronization/troubleshooting>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

### Why has the authorization expired? {#accounting/bank-synchronization/ponto/troubleshooting/expired-authorization}

Every six months (180 days), the connection between a bank account and
Ponto must be re-authorized via the [Ponto
website](https://myponto.com). Failure to do so will result in
synchronization stopping for those accounts.

# Bank synchronization

Odoo synchronizes directly with your bank institution to automatically
import all bank transactions into the database. It supports over 26,000
financial institutions worldwide and relies on multiple
`third-party providers <accounting/bank-synchronization/third-party-providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} to connect with banks.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To use this service, a valid Odoo Enterprise subscription is required.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To check if your bank is compatible with Odoo, go to [Odoo Accounting
Features](https://www.odoo.com/app/accounting-features#part_5), and
click `See list of
supported institutions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Bank & Cash`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.
::::

::: seealso
`transactions`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

## Configuration {#accounting/bank-synchronization/configuration}

### First synchronization {#accounting/bank-synchronization/first-synchronization}

To synchronize the database with a bank, go to the Accounting Dashboard,
click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and select the
`Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} card. In the
`Add a Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, select
the relevant bank and click `Connect`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- Alternatively, click the `fa-ellipsis-v`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(vertical ellipsis)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
icon of the `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} journal, and
`Connect bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or click
`Search over 26000
banks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the Accounting dashboard. -
Depending on your bank and country, you can select the
`Type of account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and/or choose
another
`third-party provider <accounting/bank-synchronization/third-party-providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} to connect with the bank if needed before clicking
`Connect`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. - If your bank is not
listed in the `Search for an institution`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} window, scroll down the list and click
`fa-plus`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Add new bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to create a bank
account manually. Fill in the `Account Number`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`SWIFT Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and click
`Connect`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. A bank journal is then
created and named using the account number. Note that in this case, the
bank is not synchronized. - If issues occur during the first
synchronization, check that no firewall or proxy is blocking the address
<https://production.odoofin.com/>. Make sure your web browser allows
pop-ups and that any ad-blocker is disabled.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

When setting up bank synchronization, accounting transactions are
automatically recorded from the date of the last transaction +1 day
(e.g., if the last transaction date is 31/12/2025, the recording starts
on 01/01/2026). If the journal contains no transactions, all available
past transactions are retrieved. To limit the retrieval period, go to
`Accounting -->
Accounting --> Lock Dates`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and
set a date in the `Lock Everything`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Some banks are in a `Beta`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} status,
meaning they\'re not yet fully supported by third-party providers. This
may lead to bugs or other issues. Although they can be used, Odoo does
not provide technical support in this case. - The
`third-party provider <accounting/bank-synchronization/third-party-providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} may request more information to connect with a bank. This
information is not stored on Odoo\'s servers. - To view all past
synchronizations, activate the
`developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and go
to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Online Synchronization`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.
::::

### Manual synchronization {#accounting/bank-synchronization/manual-synchronization}

After the
`first synchronization <accounting/bank-synchronization/first-synchronization>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, bank journals are synchronized by default every twelve
hours. To manually trigger synchronization, go to the Accounting
dashboard and click `Fetch Transactions`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} on the relevant bank journal.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Alternatively, activate the
`developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Online Synchronization`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, select the relevant bank, and click
`Fetch transactions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Some banks do not support automatic transaction fetching. For these
institutions, an error message appears during the automatic account
synchronization, prompting the user to disable the automatic
synchronization. This message is also logged in the chatter of the
online synchronization. In such cases, disable the
`Automatic synchronization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option in
the corresponding bank\'s `Online Synchronization`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and make sure to perform manual synchronizations by
clicking `Fetch Transactions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the
relevant bank journal. - For some bank institutions, transactions can
only be fetched up to three months in the past. If older transactions
are needed, they can be
`imported <accounting/transactions/import>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.
::::

### Update synchronization credentials {#accounting/bank-synchronization/update-credentials}

To update bank credentials, activate the
`developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, and go
to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Online Synchronization`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Open the connection that needs to be updated,
click `Update Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
follow the steps.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- The steps may vary depending on the third-party provider, as each
provider follows its own process. - When updating bank credentials, make
sure all accounts are selected for synchronization, including those from
other banking institutions if applicable.
::::

### Third-party providers {#accounting/bank-synchronization/third-party-providers}

Odoo relies on third-party providers to securely connect to your bank
accounts and automatically import transactions and financial data into
the database. The following providers are used:

- [Plaid](https://plaid.com/discover-apps/) (supported in the [United
  States of America and Canada](https://plaid.com/docs/institutions/))
- [Yodlee](https://www.yodlee.com/) (supported in Europe)
- [Salt Edge](https://www.saltedge.com/) (supported
  [worldwide](https://www.saltedge.com/products/account_information/coverage))
- `Ponto <bank_synchronization/ponto>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
  (supported in Europe)
- [Enable Banking](https://enablebanking.com/) (supported in
  [Scandinavian countries](https://enablebanking.com/open-banking-apis))

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

When
`connecting a bank to Odoo <accounting/bank-synchronization/first-synchronization>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}:

- Depending on your bank and country, change the default third-party
  provider when selecting the bank, if necessary.
- Make sure to check the consent checkbox to allow information to be
  shared with Odoo.
- Select all accounts that need access and synchronization, including
  those from other banking institutions.
::::

::: seealso
\-
`Bank synchronization troubleshooting <accounting/bank-synchronization/troubleshooting>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} - `Salt Edge bank synchronization troubleshooting
<accounting/bank-synchronization/troubleshooting-saltedge>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} - `Ponto bank synchronization troubleshooting
<accounting/bank-synchronization/ponto/troubleshooting>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

## Duplicate transactions {#accounting/bank-synchronization/duplicate-transactions}

When importing transactions, some may appear
`duplicated <accounting/transactions/duplicate>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} due to the same online transaction identifier or the same
currency, amount, account number, and date.

## Missing transactions {#accounting/bank-synchronization/missing-transactions}

Missing or pending transactions are entries that the bank has not yet
validated.

To find missing and pending transactions, access the
`bank reconciliation view
<accounting/reconciliation/access>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, click
the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `(gear)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon, and select
`Find Missing Transactions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

To import a posted missing transaction, select it and click
`Import Transactions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Make sure the connection with the bank is active to find missing
transactions. - `Pending`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
transactions cannot be imported.
::::

## Troubleshooting {#accounting/bank-synchronization/troubleshooting}

::: seealso
`Bank synchronization troubleshooting - Ponto
<accounting/bank-synchronization/ponto/troubleshooting>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

### Synchronization errors or disconnections {#accounting/bank-synchronization/troubleshooting/synchronization}

To report a connection error to [Odoo
support](https://www.odoo.com/help), activate the
`developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Online Synchronization`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, select
the failed connection, and copy the error description and the reference.

If the connection with the proxy is lost and reconnection using the
`Reconnect`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option isn\'t successful,
contact [support](https://www.odoo.com/help) directly. Provide the
client ID or the error reference from the chatter.

### Why is the synchronization not working in real-time? {#accounting/bank-synchronization/troubleshooting/real-time}

Synchronization is not designed to work in real time, as third-party
providers synchronize accounts at different intervals. To manually
trigger synchronization and retrieve bank transactions, go to the
`Accounting Dashboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and click
`Fetch Transactions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Alternatively, to synchronize and fetch transactions, activate the
`developer mode
<developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Online
Synchronization`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

Some providers restrict refreshes to once per day. If transactions have
already been fetched, clicking `Fetch Transactions`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} again may not retrieve the latest data.

Transactions may appear on a bank account, but cannot be fetched if they
have a `Pending`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} status; only
transactions with a `Posted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} status
are retrieved.

### Why do my transactions only synchronize when I refresh manually? {#accounting/bank-synchronization/troubleshooting/refresh-manually}

Some banks implement additional security measures and require extra
steps, such as an SMS or email authentication code, or another type of
`MFA (multi-factor authentication)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. As a
result, the third-party provider cannot retrieve transactions until the
security code is provided.

### Why are no transactions visible? {#accounting/bank-synchronization/troubleshooting/visible-transactions}

There are a few possible reasons for this issue:

- No bank accounts were synchronized during the `first synchronization
  <accounting/bank-synchronization/first-synchronization>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.
- There may be no new transactions available to fetch.

If the bank account is correctly linked to a journal, but posted
transactions still aren\'t visible in the database, contact
[support](https://www.odoo.com/help).

### Why are no accounts shown after synchronization? {#accounting/bank-synchronization/troubleshooting/no-account-appearing}

During the synchronization process, a bank institution was selected, but
no bank accounts from this institution were authorized during the
`first synchronization
<accounting/bank-synchronization/first-synchronization>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

### Saltedge troubleshooting {#accounting/bank-synchronization/troubleshooting-saltedge}

#### Why is there an error when deleting a synchronization in Odoo? {#accounting/bank-synchronization/troubleshooting/saltedge/deleting-error}

Odoo can\'t permanently delete the connection established with the
banking institution. However, it revokes consent, which prevents Odoo
from accessing the account. The error message indicates that the consent
has been revoked, but the record could not be deleted as it remains in
Salt Edge.

To delete the connection, connect to the [Salt Edge
account](https://www.saltedge.com/dashboard) and manually remove the
synchronization. Once this is done, the record can be deleted in Odoo.

#### I have an error saying that this account has already been synchronized {#accounting/bank-synchronization/troubleshooting/saltedge/account-already-synchronized}

The bank account has already been synchronized with Salt Edge. Access
the Salt Edge [dashboard](https://www.saltedge.com/dashboard) to check
if a connection with the same credentials exists. There are two options:

- If a connection with the same credentials exists in Salt Edge but has
  not been synchronized with Odoo, delete the existing connection and
  create a new one from the Odoo database.
- If a connection with the same credentials exists in Salt Edge and has
  already been synchronized with Odoo,
  `update the synchronization credentials
  <accounting/bank-synchronization/update-credentials>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} to reactivate the connection.

::: {.toctree titlesonly=""}
bank_synchronization/ponto
:::




--- SOURCE: finance/accounting/bank/foreign_currency.md ---

# Manage a bank account in a foreign currency

In Odoo, every transaction is recorded in the default currency of the
company, and reports are all based on that default currency. When you
have a bank account in a foreign currency, for every transaction, Odoo
stores two values:

- The debit/credit in the currency of the *company*;
- The debit/credit in the currency of the *bank account*.

Currency rates are updated automatically using the web services of a
banking institution. By default, Odoo uses the European Central Bank\'s
web services but other options are available.

## Configuration

### Activate multi-currencies

To work with multiple currencies, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings
--> Currencies`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and tick
`Multi-Currencies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Under
`Post Exchange difference
entries in:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, provide a
`Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a
`Gain Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a
`Loss Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and then click on
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

### Configure currencies

Once Odoo is configured to support multiple currencies, they are all
created by default, but not necessarily active. To activate the new
currencies, click on `Activate Other Currencies`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} under the `Multi-Currencies`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} setting or go to `Accounting --> Configuration
--> Accounting: Currencies`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

When the currencies are activated, you can choose to **automate** the
currency rate update, or leave it on **manual**. To configure the rate
update, go back to `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Settings --> Currencies`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, check
`Automatic Currency Rates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, set
`Interval`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to your desired frequency,
and then click on `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. You also
have the option to choose the `Service`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} you wish to obtain currency rates from.

Click on the Update now button (`ðŸ—˜`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"})
besides the `Next Run`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
update the currency rates manually.

### Create a new bank account

In the accounting application, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and create a new one. Enter a
`Journal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and set the
`Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to [Bank]{.title-ref}. In the
`Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, enter a
**short code**, a **currency**, and then finally click on the
`Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to create a new
account. In the pop-up window of the account creation, enter a name, a
code (ex.: 550007), set its type to [Bank and Cash]{.title-ref}, set a
currency type, and save. When you are back on the **journal**, click on
the `Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, and in
the pop-up window, fill out the `Account Number`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of your
account, and save.

![Example of a created bank journal.](foreign_currency/foreign-journal.png){.align-center}

Upon creation of the journal, Odoo automatically links the bank account
to the journal. It can be found under
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Accounting: Chart of Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

## Vendor bill in a foreign currency

To pay a bill in a foreign currency, simply select the currency next to
the `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field and register the
payment. Odoo automatically creates and posts the foreign **exchange
gain or loss** as a new journal entry.

![How to set a bill currency.](foreign_currency/foreign-bill-currency.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Note that you can pay a foreign bill with another currency. In that
case, Odoo automatically converts between the two currencies.
::::

## Unrealized Currency Gains/Losses Report

This report gives an overview of all unrealized amounts in a foreign
currency on your balance sheet, and allows you to adjust an entry or
manually set an exchange rate. To access this report, go to
`Reporting --> Management: Unrealized Currency Gains/Losses`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. From here, you have access to all open entries in
your **balance sheet**.

![View of the Unrealized Gains/Losses journal.](foreign_currency/foreign-gains-losses.png){.align-center}

If you wish to use a different currency rate than the one set in
`Accounting -->
Configuration --> Settings --> Currencies`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, click the `Exchange Rates`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button and change the rate of the foreign currencies in
the report.

![Menu to manually change exchange rates.](foreign_currency/foreign-exchange-rates.png){.align-center}

When manually changing **exchange rates**, a yellow banner appears
allowing you to reset back to Odoo\'s rate. To do so, simply click on
`Reset to Odoo's Rate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Banner to reset back to Odoo\'s rates.](foreign_currency/foreign-reset-rates.png){.align-center}

In order to update your **balance sheet** with the amount of the
`adjustment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} column, click on the
`Adjustment Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. In the
pop-up window, select a `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Expense Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Income Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to calculate and
process the **unrealized gains and losses**.

You can set the date of the report in the `Date`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field. Odoo automatically reverses the booking entry to
the date set in `Reversal Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Once posted, the `adjustment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} column
should indicate [0.00]{.title-ref}, meaning all **unrealized
gains/losses** have been adjusted.

![Unrealized Currency Gains/Losses report once adjusted.](foreign_currency/foreign-adjustment.png){.align-center}




--- SOURCE: finance/accounting/bank/internal_transfers.md ---

# Internal transfers

Internal money transfers can be handled in Odoo. At least two bank or
cash accounts are needed to make internal transfers.

::: seealso
`How to add an additional bank account <accounting/bank/create>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

## Configuration

An internal transfer account is automatically created on your database
based on your company\'s
`localization <../../fiscal_localizations>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} and depending on your country's legislation. To modify the
default `Internal Transfer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} account,
go to `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and
scroll down to the `Default Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section.

## Register an internal transfer from one bank to another

When money is transferred from one bank or cash account to another, that
amount appears as two transactions on the corresponding journals,
whether the transactions are created manually, via import, or via
`bank synchronization <bank_synchronization>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. When reconciling the transaction, select the
`Internal Transfers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`reconciliation model <reconciliation_models>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} button. This reconciliation model button writes the
transaction off to the `Internal
Transfer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} account.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Remember to reconcile the transaction for both the outgoing transaction
on the journal that sends the payment and the incoming transaction on
the journal that receives the payment.
::::

::: example
Take, for example, a transfer of \$1000 from Bank A to Bank B:

- Bank journal (Bank A)

    **Account**                     **Debit**     **Credit**
    ------------------------------- ------------- ------------
    Bank A account                                \$1,000
    **Internal transfer account**   **\$1,000**   

- Bank journal (Bank B)

    **Account**                     **Debit**   **Credit**
    ------------------------------- ----------- -------------
    Bank B account                  \$1,000     
    **Internal transfer account**               **\$1,000**
:::

::: seealso
\- `reconciliation`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`reconciliation_models`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::




--- SOURCE: finance/accounting/bank/loans.md ---

# Loans management

Odoo\'s loan management gives a comprehensive list of all loans
undertaken by your company in order to maintain a holistic and
forecasted view of upcoming due dates (e.g., cash forecast). Set up
amortization schedules---or import them---and let Odoo automatically
handle monthly interest and principal adjustments so that your financial
reports are always accurate with minimal effort.

## Create a new loan

Create a new loan by going to
`Accounting --> Accounting --> Loans`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. When creating a new loan, there are three options
for how to create amortization schedules:

- importing it from a supported file;
- calculating it from multiple input values (e.g., the
  `Amount Borrowed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the
  `Duration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, etc.) using the
  `Compute`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button;
- manually filling in the lines of the schedule.

In each case, three different fields are required for each line of the
amortization schedule: the `Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
the `Principal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the
`Interest`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

The `Amount Borrowed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Interest`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Duration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields will be red if the
sum of the lines does not match the total of the amortization schedule
lines.

## Loan entries mechanism

When the amount borrowed is credited to a bank account, it should be
transferred to a long-term account (defined in the
`Loan Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab). Then, upon the
validation of the loan, Odoo creates the necessary journal entries so
that there is always a holistic and forecasted view of upcoming due
dates. The entire process is completely automated with a long-term and
short-term principal reclassification mechanism.

For each line of the amortization schedule, Odoo creates the following
entries:

A payment entry on the same date that

:   - debits the principal amount to the long-term account;
    - debits the interest amount to the expense account;
    - credits the payment amount to the short-term account: this is the
      amount that will be withdrawn by the bank.

A reclassification entry on the same date that

:   - debits the sum of the principal amounts of the next 12 months to
      the long-term account;
    - credits the sum of the principal amounts of the next 12 months to
      the short-term account.

A reversed entry of the reclassification entry on *the next day* that
simply reverses the previous one.

With this mechanism, month after month, the short-term account is always
up to date with the current short-term due amounts.

## Closing a loan

By default, a loan will be closed whenever its last payment entry is
posted. However, it can also be manually closed (e.g., because it is
being paid off early) by clicking on the `Close`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button. A wizard will appear asking from which date the
loan should be closed. All draft entries after this date will be deleted
too.

A loan can also be cancelled. In that case, all entries will be deleted
even if they were already posted.

## Loans Analysis Report

By going to `Accounting --> Review --> Loans Analysis`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, you can access a report with a pivot view of your
ongoing loans. By default, the report shows the principal, interest, and
total payment for each year for the duration of the loan.




--- SOURCE: finance/accounting/bank/reconciliation.md ---

# Bank reconciliation

**Bank reconciliation** is the process of validating
`bank transactions <transactions>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}. Many
of these transactions are matched with counterpart items related to
business records such as
`customer invoices <../customer_invoices>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, `vendor bills <../vendor_bills>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, and `payments <../payments>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"},
while others that may not have a matching counterpart item (such as bank
fees) can be written off
`manually <accounting/reconciliation/set-account>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} or with
`reconciliation models <accounting/reconciliation/model>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. Not only is bank reconciliation compulsory for most
businesses, but it also offers several benefits, such as reduced risk of
errors in financial reports, detection of fraudulent activities, and
improved cash flow management.

Thanks to the
`default matching rules <accounting/reconciliation/reconcile>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and customizable bank
`reconciliation models <reconciliation_models>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, Odoo selects the matching items automatically when
possible.

::: seealso
\- [Odoo Tutorials: Bank
reconciliation](https://www.odoo.com/slides/slide/bank-reconciliation-6562) -
`bank_synchronization`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`transactions`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

## Bank reconciliation view {#accounting/reconciliation/access}

To access a journal\'s `Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} view, go to the
`Accounting Dashboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and either:

- click the journal name (e.g., `Bank`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}) or its `Transactions`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} button to display all transactions, including those
  previously reconciled, or
- click the `x to reconcile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
  to display only unreconciled transactions. To include previously
  reconciled transactions, remove the `Not Matched`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} filter from the search bar.

![Reaching the bank reconciliation tool from the accounting dashboard](reconciliation/bank-card.png)

The `Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} view is composed
of lines for each transaction of the journal with the newest displayed
first. Each transaction has a date, a label, a partner (if set), `action
buttons <accounting/reconciliation/action-buttons>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, and the transaction amount. Each line can be expanded to
show additional information and buttons.

![The user interface of the bank matching view of a bank journal.](reconciliation/user-interface.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Once a `transaction <transactions>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} is
reconciled, the suggested action button(s) is replaced with the
counterpart entry/entries it was matched with or the account(s) it was
written off to.
::::

### Transactions {#accounting/reconciliation/transactions}

Every `transaction <transactions>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} is
linked to a journal entry that debits/credits the journal\'s main
account and its suspense account until it is fully reconciled. At that
point, the suspense account is replaced with the account of the
counterpart item or, in the case of
`manual matching <accounting/reconciliation/set-account>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, the selected account.

::: seealso
\-
`Duplicate transactions <accounting/bank-synchronization/duplicate-transactions>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} -
`Missing transactions <accounting/bank-synchronization/missing-transactions>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

#### Possible action buttons {#accounting/reconciliation/action-buttons}

Up to two suggested action buttons are available as primary buttons, but
all available action buttons are displayed when the transaction is
expanded. The following action buttons are available depending on the
details of the transaction:

- `Set Partner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Open a search view
  to add a partner to the transaction.
- `Set Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Open a search view
  to manually select an account to write off the full amount of the
  transaction with this account. If necessary, `edit the line
  <accounting/reconciliation/edit>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to
  change the amount.
- `Receivable`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Write off the
  transaction to the receivable account of the partner.
- `Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Open a list view of sales
  orders belonging to the transaction\'s `Partner`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} (or proceed directly to the form view if only one
  relevant sales order exists). Select the relevant sales order(s) and
  click `Create Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then
  return to the `Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} view
  and match the invoice(s) using the `Reconcile`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} action button.
- `Payable`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Write off the
  transaction to the payable account of the partner.
- `Reconcile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Open a search view of
  existing items from records such as customer invoices, vendor bills,
  and payments. Select one or multiple items to add counterpart items
  with the corresponding accounts of those items.
- `Batches`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Open a short list of
  `batch payments <../payments/batch>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}. To
  view all batch payments, click `Search More ...`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}. Select a batch payment to add a counterpart item for
  each payment of the batch with the corresponding account of each
  payment.
- `reconciliation_models`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}: Each manual
  reconciliation model that could apply to the transaction is displayed.
  Click the reconciliation model\'s action button to generate the
  counterpart items defined on the reconciliation model.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To remove the partner from a transaction, click the
`fa-times`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `(close)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon next to the partner\'s name.
::::

Click the `fa-chevron-down`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(chevron down)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button next to the
possible action buttons of an expanded line to display any of the above
action buttons that are hidden due to space limitations, as well as the
following:

- `Upload bills`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Upload one or more
  bills to be `digitized
  <../vendor_bills/invoice_digitization>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.
  After digitization, the bills are available for matching via the
  `Reconcile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} action button.
- `Manage Models`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Open the list view
  of `reconciliation_models`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.
- `Open Journal Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Open the
  journal entry of this transaction.
- `Delete Transaction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Delete this
  transaction.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Uploading bills from the `Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} view does not automatically reconcile them with the
active transaction.
::::

::: seealso
`../../../essentials/in_app_purchase`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

## Reconcile transactions {#accounting/reconciliation/reconcile}

When possible, Odoo automatically reconciles transactions based on their
fields.

If no partner is set on the transaction, the transaction\'s
`Label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is compared with the
`Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Customer Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Bill Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Payment Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of existing
invoices, bills, and payments.

If a partner is set on the transaction, the transaction is instead
matched with invoices, bills, and payments of the partner based on the
`Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The following rules are
used in a sequential order to identify and apply a match:

- Exact match
- Discounted match: for payment terms with discounts for early payments
- Tolerance match: within 3% to account for merchant fees, rounding
  differences, and user errors
- Currency match: when the transaction is in a different currency than
  the invoice, bill, or payment (with a 3% tolerance for exchange rate
  differences)
- Amount in label: if the invoice `Amount`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} is found in the transaction\'s
  `Label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

In addition to using these fixed matching rules, transactions can be
matched automatically with the use of
`reconciliation models <reconciliation_models>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. Otherwise, reconcile transactions manually by following
these steps:

1.  Expand the desired line among unmatched bank transactions to display
    all available action buttons.
2.  Define the counterpart. There are several options for defining a
    counterpart, including
    `matching existing items <accounting/reconciliation/existing-items>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}, `manually setting
    the account <accounting/reconciliation/set-account>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}, matching with `batch payments
    <../payments/batch>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, and using
    `reconciliation model buttons
    <accounting/reconciliation/model>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
3.  If the resulting entry is not fully balanced, add another existing
    counterpart item or write it off by
    `setting the account <accounting/reconciliation/set-account>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} of the remaining amount.

### Existing items {#accounting/reconciliation/existing-items}

To reconcile transactions with existing items related to records such as
customer invoices, vendor bills, and payments, click the
`Reconcile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} action button, select the
matching journal item(s) in the list, and click
`Select`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If the `Partner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set, this list is
automatically filtered to only include items related to that partner.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Use the search bar within the
`Search: Journal Items to Match`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
window to search for specific journal items.
::::

If a transaction amount is lower than the invoice or bill it is
reconciled with, the transaction is fully reconciled, but the difference
remains open on the counterpart item. The remaining amount can be left
open to be reconciled later or the invoice or bill can be marked as
fully paid. To mark the invoice or bill as fully paid,
`edit <accounting/reconciliation/edit>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
the line, click `fully paid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To reverse this, `edit
<accounting/reconciliation/edit>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the line
again, click `partial payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

If a transaction amount is greater than the invoice or bill it is
reconciled with, the transaction is only partially reconciled. The
remaining balance can be reconciled as any other transaction amount.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Existing items of draft entries can be matched. Eventual automatic moves
(like currency exchange or cash basis moves) are created in draft
simultaneously with the reconciliation. Posting the original entry also
posts the automatic move.
::::

### Set account {#accounting/reconciliation/set-account}

If no existing item matches the selected transaction, you can still
write off the transaction manually: Click
`Set Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then choose the
appropriate account. To write off only part of the transaction,
`edit the line <accounting/reconciliation/edit>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} to reflect the correct value and reconcile the remaining
amount as desired.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If the partner is set, write the amount off to their receivable or
payable account directly by clicking the `Receivable`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} or `Payable`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`action button
<accounting/reconciliation/action-buttons>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.
::::

### Reconciliation models {#accounting/reconciliation/model}

Use `reconciliation models <reconciliation_models>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} to create custom rules that can be applied automatically or
manually via custom buttons for operations that are frequently repeated.
These custom buttons allow you to quickly reconcile bank transactions
manually and can also be combined with other reconciliation models and
with counterpart items when reconciling transactions.

::: example
An outgoing bank transaction for \$103 is partially matched with a
vendor bill for \$100, leaving \$3 of the transaction still
unreconciled. Use the `Bank Fees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
reconciliation model to create a new counterpart item for \$3 and
reconcile it with the remaining \$3 of the bank transaction.
:::

## Edit lines and unreconcile transactions {#accounting/reconciliation/edit}

To edit a counterpart item, expand the line, click the
`fa-pencil`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `(pencil)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon, and edit the necessary fields in
`Edit Line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When the counterpart item is an existing journal item, some fields are
read-only.
::::

If a transaction is partially matched with a counterpart item, use the
link to mark the invoice as `fully paid`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} or to switch back to a
`partial payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

To unreconcile a transaction, delete all counterpart items associated
with the transaction by clicking on the `fa-trash`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(trash)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon.

## Netting {#accounting/reconciliation/netting}

Netting (also known as AP/AR offsetting) is the process of balancing
incoming debts from and outgoing debts to the same partner. Reconciling
the incoming and outgoing debts creates a new journal entry that
balances the debts. Two main scenarios exist:

- `A bank transaction balances <accounting/reconciliation/net-transaction>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} (either fully or partially) the incoming and outgoing
  debts.
- `No bank transaction balances <accounting/reconciliation/net-no-transaction>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} the incoming and outgoing debts. This situation can occur
  either when the debts balance each other completely or when the debts
  remain unbalanced.

### Netting with bank transactions {#accounting/reconciliation/net-transaction}

When a bank transaction balances (either fully or partially) the
incoming and outgoing debts, reconcile the bank transaction from the
`Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} view like any other
`existing
items <accounting/reconciliation/existing-items>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}:

1.  Click `Reconcile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the
    transaction.
2.  Select all the relevant counterpart items on both the payable and
    receivable side.
3.  Click `Select`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
4.  If a balance remains, depending on the details, the following
    situations are possible:
    - An invoice, bill, or other item is not fully reconciled, and the
      remaining balance can be
      `reconciled <accounting/reconciliation/reconcile>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"} with other bank transactions.
    - The bank transaction itself is not fully reconciled, and the
      remaining balance can be
      `reconciled <accounting/reconciliation/reconcile>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"} as in any other situation.

### Netting without bank transactions {#accounting/reconciliation/net-no-transaction}

When no bank transaction balances the incoming and outgoing debts, there
is nothing to reconcile from the `Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} view. However, the debt amount is visible in both the
account receivable and the account payable. To balance these debts so
that they no longer appear on the partner ledger, follow these steps:

1.  Go to `Accounting --> Accounting --> Reconcile`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}.
2.  Select the journal items that debit or credit the account receivable
    and account payable and represent the debts to be netted.
3.  Click `Reconcile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
4.  If the debts don\'t balance each other perfectly, a
    `Write-Off Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} popup window
    appears, allowing you to decide how to resolve the remaining
    balance:
    - Select `Allow partials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to only
      partially reconcile the account receivable and account payable and
      leave the remaining balance open.
    - Use a
      `reconciliation model button <reconciliation_models>`{.interpreted-text
      role="doc"} to write off the balance.
    - Manually choose an `Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
      and optionally adjust the `Tax`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}, `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
      `Label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
      `Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
      `To Check`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields.

The items are then matched, and their balance is removed from the
partner ledger, representing that no payment is due for these debts.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The workflow is the same whether there are only two equal debts in the
receivable and payable accounts or multiple debts in each account.
::::




--- SOURCE: finance/accounting/bank/reconciliation_models.md ---

# Reconciliation models

Reconciliation models are custom rules that complement the
`default set of matching rules
<accounting/reconciliation/reconcile>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and
enable more advanced automation of the `bank
reconciliation <reconciliation>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} process.
These models are especially useful when dealing with recurring flows
like writing off bank fees or `cash discounts
<../customer_invoices/cash_discounts>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.

::: seealso
[Odoo Tutorials: Reconciliation
models](https://www.odoo.com/slides/slide/reconciliation-models-6858)
:::

## Configuration {#accounting/rec-models/config}

To access reconciliation models, go to the
`Accounting Dashboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, click the
`fa-ellipsis-v`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(dropdown menu)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} menu on the bank
journal, and select `Models`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} under
the `Reconciliation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

To create a new reconciliation model, click `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

Reconciliation models can be either `Manual`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} or `Automated`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
Manual reconciliation models appear as `possible action buttons
<accounting/reconciliation/action-buttons>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} when `reconciling <reconciliation>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. Automatic reconciliation models apply automatically to
transactions that meet the reconciliation model\'s
`matching conditions <accounting/rec-models/conditions>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Each reconciliation model is configured with `matching conditions
<accounting/rec-models/conditions>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to
identify the relevant bank transactions and `Counterpart
Items <accounting/rec-models/counterpart>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
to be generated during reconciliation.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To create an activity on the transaction, select which type of activity
to create in the `Next Activity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

If a record matches with several reconciliation models, the first one in
the *sequence* of models is applied. Rearrange the order by dragging and
dropping the handle next to the name.

![Rearrange the sequence of models in the list view.](reconciliation_models/list-view.png)
::::

### Matching conditions {#accounting/rec-models/conditions}

A reconciliation model\'s matching conditions determine to which
transactions it applies.

The following fields can be used to restrict the reconciliation model\'s
availability to transactions that meet the conditions:

- `Journals`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Partners`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  `Is lower than or equal to`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Is greater than or
  equal to`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
  `Is between`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and enter the
  amount(s).
- `Label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  `Contains`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Not Contains`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or `Match
  Regex`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and enter the transaction
  label\'s matching condition.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

[Regular expressions](https://regexone.com/), often abbreviated as
**regex**, can be used in Odoo in various ways to search, validate, and
manipulate data. Regex can be powerful but also complex, so it\'s
essential to use it judiciously.

To use regular expressions in a reconciliation model, set the
`Label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
`Match Regex`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and add an expression.
Odoo automatically retrieves the transactions that match the regex
expression and the conditions specified in the reconciliation model.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

A transaction must meet all conditions for the reconciliation model to
be available for it. If no condition is defined (i.e., if all fields are
left blank), the reconciliation model will be available for all
transactions.
::::

### Counterpart items {#accounting/rec-models/counterpart}

Each line in the `Counterpart items`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
tab creates a journal item with the specified details:

- `Partner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the partner, if
  any, to set on the journal item.
- `Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the account, if
  any, to set on the journal item.
- `Amount Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select how the
  amount of the journal item should be calculated:
  - `Fixed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Use a fixed amount.
  - `Percentage of balance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Use a
    percentage of the remaining balance of the transaction, regardless
    of the transaction total.
  - `Percentage of statement line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    Use a percentage of the transaction total, regardless of the
    remaining balance of the transaction.
  - `From label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Use a percentage
    from the transaction\'s label using regex.
- `Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the amount to be
  used on the journal item. This field will be either a fixed amount,
  percentage amount, or regex depending on the
  `Account Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select a tax, if any, to
  set on the journal item. This field is hidden behind the
  `oi-settings-adjust`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `(settings adjust)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon by
  default.
- `Analytic`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select an analytic
  distribution, if any, to set on the journal item.
- `Label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a label, if any, to
  set on the journal item.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- While neither the `Partner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} nor
`Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields are mandatory, at
least one of the two must be set for the reconciliation model to work
correctly. - The reconciliation model can be used for
`partner mapping <accounting/rec-models/partner>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} if the `Counterpart Items`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} include a `Partner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
but no `Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

## Default reconciliation models {#accounting/rec-models/defaults}

In Odoo, different models are available by default depending on the
company\'s `fiscal
localization <../../fiscal_localizations>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. These can be updated if needed. The following
reconciliation models exist across most fiscal localizations.

### Internal Transfers

The `Internal Transfers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
reconciliation model is used for making `internal transfers
<internal_transfers>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} from one bank or
cash account to another by moving the entire transaction\'s balance to a
liquidity or internal transfer account. To fully transfer the amount
from one account to another, this reconciliation model must be used on
both the incoming journal\'s transaction and the outgoing journal\'s
transaction.

::: seealso
`internal_transfers`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Bank Fees

The `Bank Fees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} reconciliation model
generates a counterpart item that moves the remaining balance of a
transaction to a bank fees account (that varies by `fiscal localization
<../../fiscal_localizations>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}) and
includes \"Bank Fees\" in the `Label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
of the new item that it creates. This reconciliation model is only
applicable to transactions whose label contains \"Bank Fees\" due to its
`matching conditions <accounting/rec-models/conditions>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

::: example
An outgoing bank transaction for \$103 is partially matched with a
vendor bill for \$100, leaving \$3 of the transaction still
unreconciled. Use the `Bank Fees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
reconciliation model to create a new counterpart item for \$3 and
reconcile it with the remaining \$3 of the bank transaction.
:::

### Cash Discount

The `Cash Discount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} reconciliation
model generates a counterpart item that moves the remaining balance of a
transaction to a cash discount account (that varies by `fiscal
localization <../../fiscal_localizations>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}) and includes \"Cash Discount\" in the
`Label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the new item that it
creates.

::: seealso
`../customer_invoices/cash_discounts`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

## Partner mapping {#accounting/rec-models/partner}

Partner mapping allows you to establish rules for automatically matching
transactions to the correct partner account, saving time and reducing
the risk of errors that can occur during manual reconciliation. For
example, you can create a partner mapping rule for incoming payments
with specific reference numbers or keywords in the transaction
description. When an incoming payment meets these criteria, Odoo
automatically maps it to the corresponding customer\'s account.

To create a partner mapping rule, configure any `matching conditions
<accounting/rec-models/conditions>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, such
as a specific transaction label, and then configure the
`Partner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and any other relevant
fields in the `Counterpart Items
<accounting/rec-models/counterpart>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} tab.
Setting an `Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is not mandatory
for partner mapping.




--- SOURCE: finance/accounting/bank/transactions.md ---

# Transactions

Importing transactions from your bank statements allows keeping track of
bank account transactions and reconciling them with the ones recorded in
your accounting.

`Bank synchronization <bank_synchronization>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} automates the process. However, if you do not want to use it
or if your bank is not yet supported, other options exist:

- `Import bank transactions <accounting/transactions/import>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} delivered by your bank;
- `Register bank transactions <accounting/transactions/register>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} manually.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`Grouping transactions by statement <accounting/transactions/statements>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} is optional.
::::

## Transaction view {#accounting/transactions/view}

The list of transactions for the bank journal is displayed in the
`Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} view. To access it,
go to the `Accounting Dashboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
then either:

- click the journal name (e.g., `Bank`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}) or its `Transactions`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} button to display all transactions, including those
  previously reconciled, or
- click the `x to reconcile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
  to display only unreconciled transactions. To include previously
  reconciled transactions, remove the `Not Matched`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} filter from the search bar.

Unreconciled transactions display the following information while
collapsed:

- The date of the transaction
- A button linked to the chatter. The icon of this button can vary:
  - The `fa-comments-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    `(comments)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon displays only
    on hover and indicates that there are no attachments or activities
    for the transaction.
  - The `fa-paperclip`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    `(attachments)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon indicates
    that there is an attachment on the journal entry.
  - The `fa-clock-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    `(activities)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon indicates
    that there is an activity scheduled on the journal entry.
- The label of the transaction
- The partner of the transaction (if one is set)
- Up to two
  `action buttons <accounting/reconciliation/action-buttons>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}, depending on the details of the transaction
- The balance of the transaction

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- When the chatter of a transaction is open, a blue tag highlights the
related transaction. - The chatter can be opened and closed by clicking
the `fa-comments-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(comments)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon and the
`fa-times`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `(close)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon in the top right of the view. - Once a transaction
is `reconciled <reconciliation>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, its
action buttons are replaced with the labels of the item(s) it was
reconciled with or the account if it was reconciled with the
`Set Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} action button.
::::

## Duplicate transactions {#accounting/transactions/duplicate}

Duplicate transactions occur when either by human error or
`bank sync <bank_synchronization>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} error,
the same transaction is created multiple times. The duplicate
transaction view identifies potential duplicate transactions so they can
be selected and deleted. To access the duplicate transaction view, first
access the `Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} view by
going to the `Accounting Dashboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and clicking the bank journal\'s name, then open the
`fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Actions`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} menu and click
`Find Duplicate Transactions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Potential duplicate transactions are identified based on their amount,
date, and account number, or (if the transaction is created via
`bank sync <bank_synchronization>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}) the
transaction ID.

Select a `Starting Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to view the
corresponding potential duplicate transactions, then select the
transactions to delete and click `fa-trash`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `Delete Selected`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Any transactions created by
`bank sync <bank_synchronization>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} that
the bank sync provider determines to be potential duplicates are
displayed in the `Provider Duplicates`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab. This tab is only visible if there are any
potential duplicates according to the provider.
::::

## Import transactions {#accounting/transactions/import}

Odoo supports multiple file formats to import transactions:

- SEPA recommended Cash Management format (CAMT.053)
- Comma-separated values (CSV)
- Excel (XLSX)
- Open Financial Exchange (OFX)
- Quicken Interchange Format (QIF)
- Belgium: Coded Statement of Account (CODA)

To import a file, go to the `Accounting Dashboard`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, click the `fa-ellipsis-v`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(ellipsis)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon on the
`Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} journal, and select
`Import file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Next, select the file
and upload it.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Alternatively, access the transaction list by: - clicking on the
`Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} journal\'s name, then clicking
`Upload`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} - dragging and dropping a
file on the bank journal on the `Accounting Dashboard`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} - dragging and dropping a file on the
`Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} view
::::

Certain file types such as CSV and XLSX, then require setting the
necessary formatting options and mapping the file columns with their
related Odoo fields, after which you can run a `Test`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Import`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} your
bank transactions. Other file types are mapped automatically.

::: seealso
`/applications/essentials/export_import_data`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Register bank transactions manually {#accounting/transactions/register}

You can also record your bank transactions manually. To do so, go to the
`Accounting
Dashboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, click the
`Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} journal\'s name, and then on
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The
`Partner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is optional to ease
the reconciliation process, but the `Label`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields
are mandatory.

## Statements {#accounting/transactions/statements}

A **bank statement** is a document provided by a bank or financial
institution that lists the transactions that have occurred in a
particular bank account over a specified period of time.

In Odoo Accounting, it is optional to group transactions by their
related statement, but depending on your business flow, you may want to
record them for record-keeping and organizational purposes.

To access a list of existing statements, go to the
`Accounting Dashboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, click the
`fa-ellipsis-v`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(dropdown menu)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon next to the
bank or cash journal you want to check, then click
`Statements`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

To ensure the ending balances of your bank statements in Odoo align with
the ending balances of the statements that are provided by your bank,
create an opening transaction to record the bank account balance as of
the date you begin synchronizing or importing transactions. This is
necessary to ensure the accuracy of your accounting.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To access a statement\'s transactions, click
`Transactions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} directly from the
`Bank Statements`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} list view or open a
statement and click the `Statement
lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button.
::::

### Statement creation {#accounting/transactions/statement-kanban}

The `Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} view displays
transactions from most recent to oldest and groups them by statement,
with any recent transactions that do not belong to a statement at the
top. To add transactions to a statement, hover on the most recent
transaction that should be included in the statement, and click the
`Statement`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button that appears on
the upper separator line. Doing so creates a statement from that
transaction down to the oldest transaction that is not yet part of a
statement.

![A \"Statement\" button is visible when hovering on a transaction.](transactions/statements-kanban.png)

In the `Create Statement`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window,
fill out the statement\'s `Reference`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, verify its `Starting Balance`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Ending Balance`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, add an attachment such as a PDF of the statement if
desired, and click `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Transactions can also be added to statements from the list view. Select
all the transactions corresponding to the bank statement, and, in the
`Statement`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} column, select an
existing statement or create a new one by typing its reference, clicking
on `Create and
edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, filling out the
statement\'s details, and saving.
::::

### Statement viewing, editing, and printing {#accounting/transactions/view-edit-print}

To view an existing statement, click the statement amount in the
`Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} view or click the
statement name and then the `fa-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(Internal link)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon
in the `Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} list view.
From here, you can edit the `Reference`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Starting Balance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Ending Balance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Attachments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Manually updating the `Starting Balance`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} automatically updates the `Ending
Balance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} based on the new value of
the `Starting Balance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the value
of the statement\'s transactions. - If the
`Starting Balance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} doesn\'t equal the
previous statement\'s `Ending
Balance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or if the
`Ending Balance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} doesn\'t equal the
running balance (`Starting Balance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
plus the statement\'s transactions), a warning appears explaining the
issue. To maintain flexibility, it is still possible to save without
first resolving the issue.
::::

To generate and print a PDF of the bank statement, click the
`fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `(gear)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon and click `fa-print`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `Statement`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When a bank statement is generated to be printed, it is automatically
added to the `Attachments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if no file
was attached when creating the statement.
::::




--- SOURCE: finance/accounting/bank.md ---

show-content

:   

# Bank and cash accounts

You can manage as many bank or cash accounts as needed on your database.
Configuring them correctly allows you to have all your banking data
up-to-date and ready for `reconciliation
<bank/reconciliation>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} with your journal
entries.

In Odoo Accounting, each bank account has a dedicated journal set to
post all entries in a dedicated account. Both the journal and the
account are automatically created and configured whenever you add a bank
account.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`Cash journals <accounting/journals/cash>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
and accounts must be configured manually.
::::

Bank journals are displayed by default on the
`Accounting Dashboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the form of
cards which include action buttons.

![Bank journals are displayed on the Accounting Dashboard and contain action buttons](bank/card.png)

## Manage bank and cash accounts {#accounting/bank/manage}

### Connect a bank for automatic synchronization

To connect your bank account to your database, go to the
`Accounting Dashboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and on the
kanban card of an unconnected bank, click
`Search over 26000 banks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Select
your bank from the list, click on `Connect`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and follow the instructions.

::: seealso
`bank/bank_synchronization`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Create a bank account {#accounting/bank/create}

If your banking institution is not available in Odoo, or if you don\'t
want to connect your bank account to your database, you can configure
your bank account manually.

To manually add a bank account, go to the
`Accounting Dashboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and on the
kanban card of an unconnected bank, click
`Search over 26000 banks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then,
click on `Record
transactions manually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (at the bottom
right), fill out the bank information, and click
`Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Odoo automatically detects the bank account type (e.g., IBAN) and
enables some features accordingly. - A default
`bank journal <accounting/journals/bank>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
is available and can be used to configure your bank account by going to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Accounting: Journals --> Bank`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
Open it and edit the different fields to match your bank account
information.
::::

::: {.toctree titlesonly=""}
bank/bank_synchronization bank/transactions bank/reconciliation
bank/reconciliation_models bank/internal_transfers bank/foreign_currency
bank/loans
:::




--- SOURCE: finance/accounting/customer_invoices/cash_discounts.md ---

# Cash discounts and tax reduction

**Cash discounts** are reductions in the amount a customer must pay for
goods or services offered as an incentive for paying their invoice
promptly. These discounts are typically a percentage of the total
invoice amount and are applied if the customer pays within a specified
time. Cash discounts can help a company maintain a steady cash flow.

::: example
You issue a â‚¬100 invoice on the 1st of January. The full payment is due
within 30 days, and you also offer a 2% discount if your customer pays
you within seven days.

The customer can pay â‚¬98 up to the 8th of January. After that date, they
would have to pay â‚¬100 by the 31st of January.
:::

A `tax reduction <cash-discounts/tax-reductions>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} can also be applied depending on the country or region.

::: seealso
\- `payment_terms`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`../payments`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

## Configuration {#cash-discounts/configuration}

To grant cash discounts to customers, you must first verify the
`gain and loss accounts
<cash-discounts/gain-loss-accounts>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
Then, configure `payment terms
<cash-discounts/payment-terms>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and add a
cash discount by checking the `Early Discount`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} checkbox and filling in the discount percentage,
discount days, and `tax
reduction <cash-discounts/tax-reductions>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
fields.

### Cash discount gain/loss accounts {#cash-discounts/gain-loss-accounts}

With a cash discount, the amount you earn depends on whether the
customer benefits from the cash discount or not. This inevitably leads
to gains and losses, which are recorded on default accounts.

To modify these accounts, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and, in the `Default Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, select the accounts you want to use for the
`Cash Discount Gain account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Cash Discount Loss account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

### Payment terms {#cash-discounts/payment-terms}

Cash discounts are defined on
`payment terms <payment_terms>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}. Configure
them to your liking by going to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Payment Terms`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and make sure to fill out the discount
percentage, discount days, and
`tax reduction <cash-discounts/tax-reductions>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} fields.

![Configuration of payment terms named \"2/7 Net 30\". The field \"Description on Invoices\"
reads: \"Payment terms: 30 Days, 2% Early Payment Discount under 7 days\".](cash_discounts/payment-terms.png)

### Tax reductions {#cash-discounts/tax-reductions}

Depending on the country or region, the base amount used to compute the
tax can vary, which can lead to a **tax reduction**. Since tax
reductions are set on individual payment terms, each term can use a
specific tax reduction.

To configure how the tax reduction is applied, go to a payment term with
the `Early
Discount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox enabled, and
select one of the three following options:

- 

  Always (upon invoice)

  :   The tax is always reduced. The base amount used to compute the tax
      is the discounted amount, whether the customer benefits from the
      discount or not.

- 

  On early payment

  :   The tax is reduced only if the customer pays early. The base
      amount used to compute the tax is the same as the sale: if the
      customer benefits from the reduction, then the tax is reduced.
      This means that, depending on the customer, the tax amount can
      vary after the invoice is issued.

- 

  Never

  :   The tax is never reduced. The base amount used to compute the tax
      is the full amount, whether the customer benefits from the
      discount or not.

::::::: example
You issue a â‚¬100 invoice (tax-excluded) on the 1st of January, with a
21% tax rate. The full payment is due within 30 days, and you also offer
a 2% discount if your customer pays you within seven days.

:::::: tabs
::: tab
Always (upon invoice)

  Due date          Total amount due   Computation
  ----------------- ------------------ ---------------------
  8th of January    â‚¬118.58            â‚¬98 + (21% of â‚¬98)
