# Argentina

## Webinars

Below you can find videos with a general description of the
localization, and how to configure it.

- [Webinar - LocalizaciÃ³n de Argentina](https://youtu.be/S5xlANeXja0).
- [eCommerce - LocalizaciÃ³n de
  Argentina](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5gUi2WWfRuI).

::: seealso
\- [Smart Tutorial - LocalizaciÃ³n de
Argentina](https://www.odoo.com/slides/smart-tutorial-localizacion-de-argentina-130) -
`Documentation on e-invoicing's legality and compliance in Argentina
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/argentina>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Configuration

### Modules installation

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Argentinean localization:

  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name                                                                                   Technical name                       Description
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------ ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Argentina - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                            [l10n_ar]{.title-ref}                Default
                                                                                                                              `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text
                                                                                                                              role="ref"}, which represents the minimal configuration to operate in Argentina
                                                                                                                              under the `AFIP (AdministraciÃ³n
                                                                                                                              Federal de Ingresos PÃºblicos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} regulations and
                                                                                                                              guidelines.

  `Argentinean Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                    [l10n_ar_reports]{.title-ref}        VAT Book report and VAT summary report.

  `Argentinean Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                  [l10n_ar_edi]{.title-ref}            Includes all technical and functional requirements to generate electronic
                                                                                                                              invoices via web service, based on the AFIP regulations.

  `Argentinean eCommerce <argentina/ecommerce-electronic-invoicing>`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_ar_website_sale]{.title-ref}   (optional) Allows the user to see Identification Type and AFIP Responsibility in
  role="ref"}                                                                                                                 the eCommerce checkout form in order to create electronic invoices.

  `Argentina - Payment Withholdings <l10n_ar/payment-withholdings>`{.interpreted-text    [l10n_ar_withholding]{.title-ref}    Allows registering withholdings during the payment of an invoice.
  role="ref"}                                                                                                                 
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Configure your company {#argentina/configure-your-company}

Once the localization modules are installed, the first step is to set up
the company\'s data. In addition to the basic information, a key field
to fill in is the `AFIP Responsibility
Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which represents the fiscal
obligation and structure of the company.

![Select AFIP Responsibility Type.](argentina/select-responsibility-type.png){.align-center}

### Chart of account

In Accounting, there are three different
`Chart of Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} packages to
choose from. They are based on a company\'s AFIP responsibility type,
and consider the difference between companies that do not require as
many accounts as the companies that have more complex fiscal
requirements:

- Monotributista (227 accounts);
- IVA Exento (290 accounts);
- Responsable Inscripto (298 Accounts).

![Select Fiscal Localization Package.](argentina/select-fiscal-package.png){.align-center}

### Configure master data

#### Electronic Invoice Credentials

##### Environment

The AFIP infrastructure is replicated in two separate environments,
**testing** and **production**.

Testing is provided so that the companies can test their databases until
they are ready to move into the **Production** environment. As these two
environments are completely isolated from each other, the digital
certificates of one instance are not valid in the other one.

To select a database environment, go to
`Accounting --> Settings --> Argentinean
Localization`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and choose either
`Prueba (Testing)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Produccion (Production)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Select AFIP database environment: Testing or Production.](argentina/select-environment.png){.align-center}

##### AFIP certificates

The electronic invoice and other AFIP services work with
`Web Services (WS)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} provided by the
AFIP.

In order to enable communication with the AFIP, the first step is to
request a `Digital
Certificate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if you do not have one
already.

1.  `Generate Certificate Sign Request (Odoo)`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}. When this option is selected, a file with
    extension [.csr]{.title-ref} (certificate signing request) is
    generated to be used in the AFIP portal to request the certificate.

    ![Request a certificate.](argentina/request-certificate.png)

2.  `Generate Certificate (AFIP)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    Access the AFIP portal and follow the instructions described in
    [this
    document](https://drive.google.com/file/d/17OKX2lNWd1bjUt3NxfqcCKBkBh-Xlpo-/view)
    to get a certificate.

3.  `Upload Certificate and Private Key (Odoo)`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}. Once the certificate is generated, upload it to
    Odoo using the `Pencil`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon next
    to the field `Certificado`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    select the corresponding file.

    ![Upload Certificate and Private Key.](argentina/upload-certificate-private-key.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

In case you need to configure the Homologation Certificate, please refer
to the AFIP official documentation: [Homologation
Certificate](http://www.afip.gob.ar/ws/documentacion/certificados.asp).
Furthermore, Odoo allows the user to test electronic invoicing locally
without a Homologation Certificate. The following message will be in the
chatter when testing locally:

![Invoice validated locally because it is in a testing environment without testing
certificate/keys.](argentina/local-testing.png){.align-center}
::::

#### Partner

##### Identification type and VAT

As part of the Argentinean localization, document types defined by the
AFIP are now available in the **Partner form**. Information is essential
for most transactions. There are six
`Identification Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} available by
default, as well as 32 inactive types.

![A list of AR Localization document types in Odoo, as defined by AFIP.](argentina/identification-types.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The complete list of `Identification Types`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} defined by the AFIP is included in Odoo, but only the
common ones are active.
::::

##### AFIP responsibility type

In Argentina, the document type and corresponding transactions
associated with customers and vendors is defined by the AFIP
Responsibility type. This field should be defined in the **Partner
form**.

![Select AFIP Responsibility Type.](argentina/select-afip-responsibility-type.png){.align-center}

#### Taxes

As part of the localization module, the taxes are created automatically
with their related financial account and configuration, e.g., 73 taxes
for `Responsable Inscripto`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![A list of AR Localization taxes with financial amount and configuration in Odoo.](argentina/automatic-tax-configuration.png){.align-center}

##### Taxes types

Argentina has several tax types, the most common ones are:

- `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this is the regular VAT and
  can have various percentages;
- `Perception`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: advance payment of a
  tax that is applied on invoices;
- `Retention`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: advance payment of a
  tax that is applied on payments.

##### Special taxes

Some Argentinean taxes are not commonly used for all companies, and
those less common options are labeled as inactive in Odoo by default.
Before creating a new tax, be sure to check if that tax is not already
included as inactive.

![A list showing less common Argentinean tax options, which are labeled as inactive in Odoo
by default.](argentina/special-inactive-taxes.png){.align-center}

#### Document types

In some Latin American countries, like Argentina, some accounting
transactions such as invoices and vendor bills are classified by
document types defined by the governmental fiscal authorities. In
Argentina, the [AFIP](https://www.afip.gob.ar/) is the governmental
fiscal authority that defines such transactions.

The document type is an essential piece of information that needs to be
clearly displayed in printed reports, invoices, and journal entries that
list account moves.

Each document type can have a unique sequence per journal where it is
assigned. As part of the localization, the document type includes the
country in which the document is applicable (this data is created
automatically when the localization module is installed).

The information required for the `Document Types`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is included by default so the user does not need to
fill anything on this view:

![A list of document types in Odoo.](argentina/default-document-type-info.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

There are several `Document Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
types that are inactive by default, but can be activated as needed.
::::

##### Letters

For Argentina, the `Document Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
include a letter that helps indicate the type of transaction or
operation. For example, when an invoice is related to a(n):

- `B2B transaction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a document type
  `A`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be used;
- `B2C transaction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a document type
  `B`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be used;
- `Exportation Transaction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a
  document type `E`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be used.

The documents included in the localization already have the proper
letter associated with each `Document Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, so there is no further configuration necessary.

![document types grouped by letters.](argentina/document-types-grouped-by-letters.png){.align-center}

##### Use on invoices

The `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on each
transaction will be determined by:

- The journal entry related to the invoice (if the journal uses
  documents);
- The onditions applied based on the type of issuer and receiver (e.g.,
  the type of fiscal regime of the buyer and the type of fiscal regime
  of the vendor).

### Journals

In the Argentinean localization, the journal can have a different
approach depending on its usage and internal type. To configure
journals, go to `Accounting --> Configuration -->
Journals`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

For sales and purchase journals, it\'s possible to activate the option
`Use Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which enables a list
of `Document Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} that can be
related to the invoices and vendor bills. For more detail on invoices,
please refer to the section `2.3 document types
<document-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

If the sales or purchase journals do not have the
`Use Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option activated,
they will not be able to generate fiscal invoices, meaning, their use
case will be mostly limited to monitoring account moves related to
internal control processes.

#### AFIP information (also known as AFIP Point of Sale)

The `AFIP POS System`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is a field only
visible for the **Sales** journals and defines the type of AFIP POS that
will be used to manage the transactions for which the journal is
created.

The AFIP POS defines the following:

1.  the sequences of document types related to the web service;
2.  the structure and data of the electronic invoice file.

![A AFIP POS System field which is available on Sales journals in Odoo.](argentina/sales-journal.png){.align-center}

##### Web services

**Web services** help generate invoices for different purposes. Below
are a few options to choose from:

- `wsfev1: Electronic Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: is
  the most common service, which is used to generate invoices for
  document types A, B, C, M with no detail per item;
- `wsbfev1: Electronic Fiscal Bond`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  is for those who invoice capital goods and wish to access the benefit
  of the Electronic Tax Bonds granted by the Ministry of Economy. For
  more details go to: [Fiscal
  Bond](https://www.argentina.gob.ar/acceder-un-bono-por-fabricar-bienes-de-capital);
- `wsfexv1: Electronic Exportation Invoice`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}: is used to generate invoices for international
  customers and transactions that involve exportation processes, the
  document type related is type \"E\".

![Web Services.](argentina/web-services.png){.align-center}

Here are some useful fields to know when working with web services:

- `AFIP POS Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: is the number
  configured in the AFIP to identify the operations related to this AFIP
  POS;
- `AFIP POS Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: is the field
  related to the commercial address registered for the POS, which is
  usually the same address as the company. For example, if a company has
  multiple stores (fiscal locations) then the AFIP will require the
  company to have one AFIP POS per location. This location will be
  printed in the invoice report;
- `Unified Book`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: when the AFIP POS
  System is Preimpresa, then the document types (applicable to the
  journal) with the same letter will share the same sequence. For
  example:
  - Invoice: FA-A 0001-00000002;
  - Credit Note: NC-A 0001-00000003;
  - Debit Note: ND-A 0001-00000004.

#### Sequences

For the first invoice, Odoo synchronizes with the AFIP automatically and
displays the last sequence used.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When creating `Purchase Journals`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
it\'s possible to define whether they are related to document types or
not. In the case where the option to use documents is selected, there
would be no need to manually associate the document type sequences,
since the document number is provided by the vendor.
::::

## Usage and testing

### Invoice

The information below applies to invoice creation once the partners and
journals are created and properly configured.

#### Document type assignation

When the partner is selected, the `Document Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field will be filled in automatically based on the AFIP
document type:

- **Invoice for a customer IVA Responsable Inscripto, prefix A** is the
  type of document that shows all the taxes in detail along with the
  customer\'s information.

  ![Invoice for a customer IVA Responsable Inscripto, prefix A.](argentina/prefix-a-invoice-for-customer.png)

- **Invoice for an end customer, prefix B** is the type of document that
  does not detail the taxes, since the taxes are included in the total
  amount.

  ![Invoice for an end customer, prefix B.](argentina/prefix-b-invoice-for-end-customer.png)

- **Exportation Invoice, prefix E** is the type of document used when
  exporting goods that shows the incoterm.

  ![Exportation Invoice, prefix E](argentina/prefix-e-exporation-invoice.png)

Even though some invoices use the same journal, the prefix and sequence
are given by the `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field.

The most common `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} will
be defined automatically for the different combinations of AFIP
responsibility type but it can be updated manually by the user before
confirming the invoice.

#### Electronic invoice elements

When using electronic invoices, if all the information is correct then
the invoice is posted in the standard way unless there is an error that
needs to be addressed. When error messages pop up, they indicate both
the issue that needs attention along with a proposed solution. If an
error persists, the invoice remains in draft until the issue is
resolved.

Once the invoice is posted, the information related to the AFIP
validation and status is displayed in the AFIP tab, including:

- `AFIP Autorisation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: CAE number;
- `Expiration Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: deadline to
  deliver the invoice to the customers (normally 10 days after the CAE
  is generated);
- `Result:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} indicates if the invoice
  has been `Aceptado en AFIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and/or
  `Aceptado con Observaciones`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![AFIP Status.](argentina/afip-status.png){.align-center}

#### Invoice taxes

Based on the `AFIP Responsibility type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, the VAT tax can apply differently on the PDF report:

- `A. Tax excluded`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: in this case the
  taxed amount needs to be clearly identified in the report. This
  condition applies when the customer has the following AFIP
  Responsibility type of **Responsable Inscripto**;

  ![Tax excluded.](argentina/tax-amount-excluded.png)

- `B. Tax amount included`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this
  means that the taxed amount is included as part of the product price,
  subtotal, and totals. This condition applies when the customer has the
  following AFIP Responsibility types:

  - IVA Sujeto Exento;
  - Consumidor Final;
  - Responsable Monotributo;
  - IVA liberado.

  ![Tax amount included.](argentina/tax-amount-included.png){.align-center}

#### Special use cases

##### Invoices for services

For electronic invoices that include `Services`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, the AFIP requires to report the service starting and
ending date, this information can be filled in the tab
`Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Invoices for Services.](argentina/invoices-for-services.png){.align-center}

If the dates are not selected manually before the invoice is validated,
the values will be filled automatically with the first and last day of
the invoice\'s month.

![Service Dates.](argentina/service-dates.png){.align-center}

##### Exportation invoices

Invoices related to `Exportation Transactions`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} require that a journal uses the AFIP POS System **Expo
Voucher - Web Service** so that the proper document type(s) can be
associated.

![Exporation journal.](argentina/exporation-journal.png){.align-center}

When the customer selected in the invoice is configured with an AFIP
responsibility type `Cliente / Proveedor del Exterior`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} - `Ley NÂ° 19.640`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
Odoo automatically assigns the:

- Journal related to the exportation Web Service;
- Exportation document type;
- Fiscal position: Compras/Ventas al exterior;
- Concepto AFIP: Products / Definitive export of goods;
- Exempt Taxes.

![Export invoice fields autofilled in Odoo.](argentina/export-invoice.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The Exportation Documents require Incoterms to be enabled and
configured, which can be found in
`Other Info --> Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
::::

![Export invoice - Incoterm.](argentina/export-invoice-incoterm.png){.align-center}

##### Fiscal bond

The `Electronic Fiscal Bond`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is used
for those who invoice capital goods and wish to access the benefit of
the Electronic Tax Bonds granted by the Ministry of Economy.

For these transactions, it is important to consider the following
requirements:

- Currency (according to the parameter table) and invoice quotation;
- Taxes;
- Zone;
- Detail each item;
  - Code according to the Common Nomenclator of Mercosur (NCM);
  - Complete description;
  - Unit Net Price;
  - Quantity;
  - Unit of measurement;
  - Bonus;
  - VAT rate.

##### Electronic credit invoice MiPyme (FCE)

For SME invoices, there are several document types that are classified
as **MiPyME**, which are also known as **Electronic Credit Invoice** (or
**FCE** in Spanish). This classification develops a mechanism that
improves the financing conditions for small and medium-sized businesses,
and allows them to increase their productivity, through the early
collection of credits and receivables issued to their clients and/or
vendors.

For these transactions it\'s important to consider the following
requirements:

- specific document types (201, 202, 206, etc);
- the emitter should be eligible by the AFIP to MiPyME transactions;
- the amount should be bigger than 100,000 ARS;
- A bank account type CBU must be related to the emisor, otherwise the
  invoice cannot be validated, having an error message such as the
  following.

![Bank account relation error.](argentina/bank-account-relation-error.png){.align-center}

To set up the `Transmission Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, go
to settings and select either `SDC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
or `ADC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Transmission Mode.](argentina/transmission-mode.png){.align-center}

To change the `Transmission Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for
a specific invoice, go to the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab and change it before confirming.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Changing the `Transmission Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} will
not change the mode selected in `Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
::::

![Transmission Mode on Invoice.](argentina/transmission-mode-on-invoice.png){.align-center}

When creating a `Credit/Debit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} note
related to a FCE document:

- use the `Credit and Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  buttons, so all the information from the invoice is transferred to the
  new `Credit and Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};
- the document letter should be the same as than the originator document
  (either A or B);
- the same currency as the source document must be used. When using a
  secondary currency there is an exchange difference if the currency
  rate is different between the emission day and the payment date. It is
  possible to create a credit/debit note to decrease/increase the amount
  to pay in ARS.

![Credit & debit notes buttons.](argentina/credit-debit-notes-button.png){.align-center}

When creating a `Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} we can
have two scenarios:

1.  the FCE is rejected so the `Credit Note`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} should have the field `FCE, is
    Cancellation?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as *True*; or;
2.  the `Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, is created to
    annulate the FCE document, in this case the field
    `FCE, is Cancellation?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be
    *empty* (false).

![FCE: Es CancelaciÃ³n?](argentina/fce-es-cancelation.png){.align-center}

#### Invoice printed report {#argentina/invoice-printed-report}

The `PDF Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} related to
electronic invoices that have been validated by the AFIP includes a
barcode at the bottom of the format which represents the CAE number. The
expiration date is also displayed as it is a legal requirement.

![Invoice printed report.](argentina/invoice-printed-report.png){.align-center}

#### Troubleshooting and auditing

For auditing and troubleshooting purposes, it is possible to obtain
detailed information of an invoice number that has been previously sent
to the AFIP. To retrieve this information, activate the
`developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, then go
to the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} menu and
click on the button `Consult Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button in AFIP.

![Consult invoice in AFIP.](argentina/consult-invoice-in-afip.png){.align-center}

![Details of invoice consulted in AFIP.](argentina/consult-invoice-in-afip-details.png){.align-center}

It is also possible to retrieve the last number used in AFIP for a
specific document type and POS Number as a reference for any possible
issues on the sequence synchronization between Odoo and AFIP.

![Consult the last invoice number.](argentina/consult-last-invoice-number.png){.align-center}

### Vendor bills

Based on the purchase journal selected for the vendor bill, the
`Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is now a required
field. This value is auto-populated based on the AFIP Responsibility
type of Issuer and Customer, but the value can be changed if necessary.

![Changing journal and document type.](argentina/changing-journal-document-type.png){.align-center}

The `Document Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field needs to
be registered manually and the format will be validated automatically.
However, in case the format is invalid, a user error will be displayed
indicating the correct format that is expected.

![Vendor bill document number.](argentina/vendor-bill-document-number.png){.align-center}

The vendor bill number is structured in the same way as the customer
invoices, excepted that the document sequence is entered by the user
using the following format: *Document Prefix - Letter -Document Number*.

#### Validate vendor bill number in AFIP

As most companies have internal controls to verify that the vendor bill
is related to an AFIP valid document, an automatic validation can be set
in `Accounting --> Settings -->
Argentinean Localization --> Validate document in the AFIP`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, considering the following levels:

- `Not available:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the verification
  is not done (this is the default value);
- `Available:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the verification is
  done. In case the number is not valid, it only displays a warning but
  still allows the vendor bill to be posted;
- `Required:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the verification is
  done, and it does not allow the user to post the vendor bill if the
  document number is not valid.

![Verify Vendor Bills validity in AFIP.](argentina/verify-vendor-bills.png){.align-center}

##### Validate vendor bills in Odoo

With the vendor validation settings enabled, a new button shows up on
the vendor bills inside of Odoo, labeled
`Verify on AFIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which is located
next to the `AFIP
Authorization code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

![Verify on AFIP.](argentina/verify-on-afip.png){.align-center}

In case the vendor bill cannot be validated in AFIP, a value of
`Rejected`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} will be displayed on the
dashboard and the details of the invalidation will be added to the
chatter.

![AFIP authorization Rejected.](argentina/afip-auth-rejected.png){.align-center}

#### Special use cases

##### Untaxed concepts

There are some transactions that include items that are not a part of
the VAT base amount, such as fuel and gasoline invoices.

The vendor bill will be registered using one item for each product that
is part of the VAT base amount, and an additional item to register the
amount of the exempt concept.

![VAT exempt.](argentina/vat-exempt.png){.align-center}

##### Perception taxes

The vendor bill will be registered using one item for each product that
is part of the VAT base amount, and the perception tax can be added in
any of the product lines. As a result, there will be one tax group for
the VAT and another for the perception. The perception default value is
always `0.10`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

To edit the VAT perception and set the correct amount, you should use
the `Pencil`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon that is the next to
the `Perception`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} amount. After the
VAT perception amount has been set, the invoice can then be validated.

![Enter the perception amount.](argentina/enter-perception-amount.png){.align-center}

### Withholding management {#l10n_ar/payment-withholdings}

The Argentinean fiscal localization module is already loaded with the
necessary withholdings records, which can be seen by navigating to
`Accounting app --> Configuration -->
Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and removing the default
`Sale or Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} filter. To verify
these records, the **Argentina Payment Withholdings**
([l10n_ar_withholding]{.title-ref}) module must be `installed
<general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:

Journal entries are *not* created when payments are posted unless
`outstanding accounts
<accounting/journals/outstanding-accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} are set up. Thus, for this feature to work properly, it is
important to verify that *all* payment methods within the bank journals
have an outstanding payment and receipt account set.

![An outstanding payment account must be set.](argentina/l10n-ar-outstanding-payments.png)

This configuration is crucial for the proper accounting of withholding
transactions with clients and vendors.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In Argentina, withholdings represent the cancellation of a specific
portion of the total debt owed to a supplier or a reduction in the total
payment to be collected from a customer. Therefore, one or multiple
withholdings can be recorded for each payment applied to an invoice.
::::

#### Configuration

While Odoo already creates most of the required withholdings inside the
`Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} menu, in several cases, it is
necessary to apply or modify certain configurations to correctly
calculate the withholding amount on vendor payments. The following
withholding types are available:

- `Earnings <l10n_ar/earnings-withholdings>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Earnings Scale <l10n_ar/earnings-scale-withholdings>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `IIBB Total Amount <l10n_ar/iib-total-amount-withholdings>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `IIBB Non-Taxable <l10n_ar/iib-nontax-withholdings>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}

##### Earnings {#l10n_ar/earnings-withholdings}

For `Earnings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} withholdings, Odoo
already has a record for each regime group, which is stated under the
name of the tax and the AFIP code.

Each of these records are ready to be used. As a good practice, the
configuration should be double checked to make sure the configuration is
updated and well-applied. The fields to validate are:

- `Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This is the percentage of
  the total payment amount which is withheld.
- `Non-Taxable Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Up to this
  amount, the withholding does not apply.
- `Minimum Withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the
  calculated withholding amount is smaller than this value, the total
  withholding amount is set to [0.0]{.title-ref}.
- `Withholding Sequence`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This field
  helps to automate the capture of a withholding number under the
  payment line. If this field is not set, a number is manually captured
  while adding a withholding to a payment.

![Earnings withholding type.](argentina/l10n-ar-earnings.png)

##### Earnings Scale {#l10n_ar/earnings-scale-withholdings}

In this particular case, a percentage does not need to be set. Instead,
this withholding is calculated based on the value of the
`Scale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

To view, modify, or create new scales, navigate to
`Accounting app --> Configuration
--> Earnings Scale`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. By default,
the Argentinian localization is preconfigured with two main scales.
However, scales should be created and updated as necessary to suit a
business\'s needs.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Earnings scales are cumulative, which means that Odoo keeps track of the
different records created for a bill and automatically calculates the
proper withholding amount.
::::

##### IIBB Total Amount {#l10n_ar/iib-total-amount-withholdings}

In this case, the necessary records related to the applicable province
need to be created. The withholding amount is calculated based on the
percentage `Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} set on the tax
configuration. Since Odoo does not automatically synchronize the
percentages applicable to each province, this information needs to be
manually updated.

The recommendation, in this case, is to always duplicate and apply the
different configurations for each record to safeguard any technical
configurations that allow the proper calculation and accounting of the
withholding.

##### IIBB Untaxed {#l10n_ar/iib-nontax-withholdings}

The configuration of non-taxable gross income withholdings is very
similar to that of a `total
amount withholding <l10n_ar/iib-total-amount-withholdings>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, so the percentage `Amount`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in each of the records needs to be maintained. However,
Odoo comes preconfigured with several records that apply to different
provinces. The difference, in this case, is that it is not necessary to
establish a non-taxable amount or minimum withholding for this record
type.

#### Partner withholding assignation

Once the proper configuration is set on each possible withholding for
partners, the applicable withholdings need to be assigned to each
contact. To do this, open the `Contacts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} app and select the desired partner. In the
`Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, find the `Purchase
Withholdings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} table.

By using the additional fields `From Date`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `To Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the
applicability of multiple withholdings can be automated across different
date ranges. The `ref`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field allows
you to apply an internal control number to each withholding line, which
is just for internal reference, so it does not affect any transactions
and is not visible on them. These fields are accessible from the
`oi-settings-adjust`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(adjust settings)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} menu.

- `From Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the start of the
  withholding date range.
- `To Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the end of the
  withholding date range.
- `ref`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: apply an internal control
  number to each withholding line that is only visible for internal
  reference and does not affect any transactions.

#### Automatic withholding calculation and application per payment

By applying new payments to vendor bills, Odoo automatically applies and
calculates the proper withholding into the payment. Based on the
record\'s configuration, it may be necessary to use a reference number
for each withholding line.

More withholdings can be added, or computed withholdings can be edited
if necessary.

![Payment with applied withholdings.](argentina/l10n-ar-payment.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The total amount of the debt to be canceled is the total amount of the
payment. However, Odoo still captures the net amount (i.e. the amount to
be reconciled with the bank), which will be represented as the payment
amount after the withholding application.

![Payment registered form.](argentina/l10n-ar-payment-registered.png)
::::

### Check management

To install the *Third Party and Deferred/Electronic Checks Management*
module, go to `Apps`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and search
for the module by its technical name [l10n_latam_check]{.title-ref} and
click the `Activate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

![l10n_latam_check module.](argentina/l10n-latam-check-module.png){.align-center}

This module enables the required configuration for journals and payments
to:

- Create, manage, and control your different types of checks
- Optimize the management of *own checks* and *third party checks*
- Have an easy and effective way to manage expiration dates from your
  own and third party checks

Once all the configurations are made for the Argentinian electronic
invoice flow, it is also needed to complete certain configurations for
the own checks and the third party checks flows.

#### Own checks

Configure the bank journal used to create your own checks by going to
`Accounting -->
Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
selecting the bank journal, and opening the `Outgoing
Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

- `Checks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} should be available as a
  `Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. If not, click
  `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and type
  [Checks]{.title-ref} under `Payment Method`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} to add them
- Enable the `Use electronic and deferred checks`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} setting.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

This last configuration **disables** the printing ability but enables
to:

- Enter check numbers manually
- Adds a field to allocate the payment date of the check
::::

![Bank journal configurations.](argentina/bank-journal-conf.png){.align-center}

##### Management of own checks

Own checks can be created directly from the vendor bill. For this
process, click on the `Register Payment`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

On the payment registration modal, select the bank journal from which
the payment is to be made and set the
`Check Cash-In Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the
`Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Payment pop-up window with own check options enabled.](argentina/payment-popup-vendorbill.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To manage current checks, the `Check Cash-In Date`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field must be left blank or filled in with the current
date. To manage deferred checks, the
`Check Cash-In Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be set in
the future.
::::

To manage your existing own checks, navigate to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Own
Checks`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. This window shows
critical information such as the dates when checks need to be paid, the
total quantity of checks, and the total amount paid in checks.

![Own checks menu location.](argentina/checks-menu-vendorbill.png){.align-center}

It is important to note that the list is pre-filtered by checks that are
still *not reconciled* with a bank statement - that were not yet debited
from the bank - which can be verified with the
`Is Matched with a Bank Statement`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field. If you want to see all of your own checks, delete the
`No Bank Matching`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} filter by clicking
on the `X`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} symbol.

![Own checks menu organization and filtering.](argentina/check-menu-list-vendorbill.png){.align-center}

##### Cancel an own check

To cancel an own check created in Odoo, navigate to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Own
Checks`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and select the check to
be cancelled, then click on the `Void Check`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button. This will break the reconciliation with the
vendor bills and the bank statements and leave the check in a
**cancelled** state.

![Empty Check button to cancel Own Checks](argentina/empty-check-button.png){.align-center}

#### Third party checks

In order to register payments using third party checks, two specific
journals need to be configured. To do so, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and create two new journals:

- [Third Party Checks]{.title-ref}
- [Rejected Third Party Checks]{.title-ref}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can manually create more journals if you have multiple points of
sale and need journals for those.
::::

To create the *Third Party Checks* journal, click the
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button and configure the
following:

- Type [Third Party Checks]{.title-ref} as the
  `Journal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- Select `Cash`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as
  `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- In the `Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, set
  `Cash Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: to [1.1.1.02.010
  Cheques de Terceros]{.title-ref}, input a
  `Short Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of your choice, and
  select a `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Automatically created cash account.](argentina/auto-cash-account.png){.align-center}

The available payment methods are listed in the *payments* tabs:

- For new incoming third party checks, go to
  `Incoming Payments tab --> Add a line`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"} and select
  `New Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This
  method is used to create *new* third party checks.
- For incoming and outgoing existing third party checks, go to
  `Incoming Payments tab
  --> Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and select
  `Existing Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  Repeat the same step for the `Outgoing Payments`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} tab. This method is used to receive and/or pay vendor
  bills using already *existing* checks, as well as for internal
  transfers.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

You can delete pre-existing payment methods appearing by default when
configuring the third party checks journals.
::::

![Payment methods automatically created.](argentina/auto-payment-methods.png){.align-center}

The *Rejected Third Party Checks* journal also needs to be created
and/or configured. This journal is used to manage rejected third party
checks and can be utilized to send checks rejected at the moment of
collection or when coming from vendors when rejected.

To create the *Rejected Third Party Checks* journal, click the
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button and configure the
following:

- Type [Rejected Third Party Checks]{.title-ref} as the
  `Journal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- Select `Cash`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as
  `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- In the `Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, set
  `Cash Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: to [1.1.1.01.002
  Rejected Third Party Checks]{.title-ref}, input a
  `Short Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of your choice, and
  select a `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

Use the same payment methods as the *Third Party Checks* journal.

##### New third party checks

To register a *new* third party check for a customer invoice, click the
`Register Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. In the
pop-up window, you must select `Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} as journal for the payment registration.

Select `New Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as
`Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and fill in the
`Check Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Payment Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Check Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Optionally, you can
manually add the `Check Issuer Vat`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
but this is automatically filled by the customer\'s VAT number related
to the invoice.

![Payment pop-up window with New Third Party Check options enabled.](argentina/third-party-payment-popup.png){.align-center}

##### Existing third party checks

To pay a vendor bill with an *existing* check, click the
`Register Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. In the
pop-up window, you must select `Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} as journal for the payment registration.

Select `Existing Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
as `Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and select a
check from the `Check`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. The
field shows all **available existing checks** to be used as payment for
vendor bills.

![Payment pop-up window with Existing Third Party Check options enabled.](argentina/existing-third-party-popup.png){.align-center}

When an **existing third party check** is used, you can review the
operations related to it. For example, you can see if a third party
check made to pay a customer invoice was later used as an existing third
party check to pay a vendor bill.

To do so, either go to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Third Party Checks`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} or
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Own Checks`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} depending on the case, and click on a check. In
the `Check Current Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field,
click on `=> Check Operations`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
bring up the check\'s history and movements.

![Check Operations menu.](argentina/check-operations-menulist.png){.align-center}

The menu also displays critical information related to these operations,
such as:

- The `Payment Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, allowing to
  classify whether it is a payment *sent* to a vendor or a payment
  *received* from a customer
- The `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in which the check is
  currently registered
- The **partner** associated with the operation (either customer or
  vendor).

### Ecommerce electronic invoicing {#argentina/ecommerce-electronic-invoicing}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
*Argentinian eCommerce* ([l10n_ar_website_sale]{.title-ref}) module to
enable the following features and configurations:

- Clients being able to create online accounts for eCommerce purposes.
- Support for required fiscal fields in the eCommerce application.
- Receive payments for sale orders online.
- Generate electronic documents from the eCommerce application.

#### Configuration

Once all of the configurations are made for the Argentinian
`electronic invoice
<argentina/configure-your-company>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} flow,
it is also necessary to complete certain configurations to integrate the
eCommerce flow.

##### Client account registration

To configure your website for client accounts, follow the instructions
in the `checkout
<../../websites/ecommerce/checkout>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
documentation.

##### Automatic invoice

Configure your website to generate electronic documents in the sales
process by navigating to
`Website --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and activating the `Automatic
Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} feature in the
`Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section to automatically
generate the required electronic documents when the online payment is
confirmed.

![Feature activated to invoice automatically.](argentina/l10nar-automatic-invoicing-ecommerce.png){.align-center}

Since an online payment needs to be confirmed for the
`Automatic Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} feature to
generate the document, a
`payment provider <../payment_providers>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
**must** be configured for the related website.

##### Products

To allow your products to be invoiced when an online payment is
confirmed, navigate to the desired product from
`Website --> eCommerce --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. In the `General
Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, set the
`Invoicing Policy`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
`Ordered quantities`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and define the
desired `Customer Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

#### Invoicing flow for eCommerce

Once the configurations mentioned above are all set, clients can
complete the following required steps in the *Argentinian eCommerce*
flow to input fiscal fields in the checkout process.

Fiscal fields are available for input in the checkout process once the
`Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is set as
[Argentina]{.title-ref}. Inputting the fiscal data enables the purchase
to conclude in the corresponding electronic document.

![Fiscal required fields for electronic invoicing.](argentina/l10nar-fiscal-fields-ar-ecommerce.png){.align-center}

When the client makes a successful purchase and payment, the necessary
invoice is generated with the corresponding layout and fiscal stamps
stated in the `Invoice printed report
<argentina/invoice-printed-report>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

::: seealso
`Client account creation <../../websites/ecommerce/checkout>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Liquidity product direct sales

Liquidity product direct sales are used for sales involving third
parties. For such sales, the seller and the proprietary company of the
goods can each register their corresponding sales and purchases.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
*Argentinian Electronic Invoicing* module ([l10n_ar_edi]{.title-ref}) to
use this feature.
::::

#### Configuration

##### Purchase journal

A purchase journal is needed to generate an electronic vendor bill with
a document type *Liquidity Product*. This journal needs to be
synchronized with the AFIP as it will be used to generate the liquidity
product electronic document.

To modify the existing purchase journal or create a new one, navigate to
`Accounting
--> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
Then, select the existing purchase journal or click the
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and fill in the
following required information:

- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select
  `Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Use Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: check this field
  to to be able select the electronic document type.
- `Is AFIP POS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: check this field to
  be able to generate electronic documents.
- `AFIP POS System`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select
  `Electronic Invoice - Web Service`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  from the drop-down menu in order to send the electronic document to
  AFIP via web service.
- `AFIP POS Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: is the number
  configured in the AFIP to identify the operations related to this AFIP
  POS.
- `AFIP POS Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: is the field
  related to the commercial address registered for the POS, which is
  usually the same address as the company. For example, if a company has
  multiple stores (fiscal locations) then the AFIP will require the
  company to have one AFIP POS per location. This location will be
  printed in the invoice report.

![l10n_ar Purchase Journal Configuration.](argentina/l10n-ar-purchase-journal.png){.align-center}

##### Sales journal

A sales journal is needed to register the invoice when a product is sold
to a third party that will then sell the same product. This journal will
not be synced with AFIP as the invoice will not be electronic.

To modify the existing sales journal or create a new one, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, selecting the sales journal or click the
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and fill in the
following required information:

- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select
  `Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Use Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: check this field
  on the journal to select the electronic document type (in this case
  the electronic invoice).

![l10n_ar Sales Journal Configuration.](argentina/l10n-ar-sales-journal.png){.align-center}

#### Invoicing flow

Once the configurations are all set, the *Liquidity Product Vendor Bill*
will be generated by the company that is selling the product on behalf
of another party. For example, a distributor of a specific product.

## Reports

As part of the localization installation, financial reporting for
Argentina is available in the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} dashboard. To access these reports, navigate to
`Accounting
--> Reporting --> Argentinean Statements`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

To access the VAT book report, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, click the `fa-book`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} (`book`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}), and select
`Argentinean VAT book (AR)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The VAT book report can be exported as a [.zip]{.title-ref} file by
selecting it in the dropdown menu in the top-left corner.
::::

### VAT summary

This pivot table is designed to check the monthly VAT totals. This
report is for internal use and is not sent to the AFIP.

### IIBB - Sales by jurisdiction

This pivot table allows you to validate the gross income in each
jurisdiction. It serves as an affidavit for the corresponding taxes due
but is not submitted to the AFIP.

![IIBB Sales by jurisdiction.](argentina/iibb-sales-jurisdiction.png)

### IIBB - Purchases by jurisdiction

This pivot table allows you to validate the gross purchases in each
jurisdiction. It serves as an affidavit for the corresponding taxes due
but is not submitted to the AFIP.

![IIBB Purchases by jurisdiction.](argentina/iibb-purchases-jurisdiction.png)

                                                                                                       `Australia`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} `fiscal localization package
                                                                                                       <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} is selected. This
                                                                                                       module also installs the `ABA Credit
                                                                                                       Transfer <australia/aba>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} module.

  `Australian Reports - Accounting`{.interpreted-text       [l10n_au_reports]{.title-ref}              Adds the
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                     `Taxable Payments Annual Report (TPAR) <australia/tpar>`{.interpreted-text

                                                                                                       It is installed automatically when the `Australia`{.interpreted-text

                                                                                                       for the Australian localization.
