  role="guilabel"}                                                                                     installed automatically when the
                                                                                                       `Payroll Entries option <payroll-accounting>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} is
                                                                                                       enabled.

  `Employment Hero Payroll`{.interpreted-text               [l10n_employment_hero]{.title-ref}         Synchronizes all pay runs from
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                     `Employment Hero <payroll/l10n_au/employment-hero>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
                                                                                                       with Odoo\'s journal entries.
  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Accounting {#australia/accounting}

### Taxes and GST

In Australia, the standard **Goods and Services Tax (GST)** rate is 10%,
but different rates and exemptions exist for specific categories of
goods and services.

![Default GST rates](australia/default-taxes.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The taxes impact the `BAS report <australia/bas>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.
::::

#### Tax mapping

Within the Australian localization, tax names encompass the tax rate as
an integral part of their naming convention. Despite the high number of
`taxes <../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} configured
in Odoo, their rates are often similar (0% or 10%).

##### GST sales taxes

The **GST sales** taxes available in Odoo are listed below.

  ------------------------------------------------------------------------
  GST name       Description                         Label on invoices
  -------------- ----------------------------------- ---------------------
  10% GST        GST Sales                           10% GST

  0% EX          GST Free on Export Sales            0% GST Free

  0% F           GST Free Sales                      0% Exempt

  0% INP         Input Taxed Sales                   0% Input Taxed Sales

  100% Adj       This is for adjustment, amounts can Tax Adjustments
                 be modified to fit your needs       (Sales)
  ------------------------------------------------------------------------

##### GST purchase taxes

The **GST purchase** taxes available in Odoo are listed below.

  ------------------------------------------------------------------------
  GST name       Description                         Label on invoices
  -------------- ----------------------------------- ---------------------
  10% GST        GST Purchases                       10% GST

  10% C          Capital Purchases                   10% Capital Purchases

  10% INP        Purchases for Input Taxed Sales     10% Purchases for
                                                     Input Taxed Sales

  10% PRIV       Purchases for private use or not    10% Purchases for
                 deductible                          Private Use

  0% F           GST Free Purchases                  0% GST Free

  0% TPS         Purchase (Taxable Imports) - Tax    0% GST Paid
                 Paid Separately                     Separately

  100% ONLY      GST Only on Imports                 GST Only on Imports

  100% Adj       Tax Adjustments (Purchases)         Tax Adjustments
                                                     (Purchases)

  100% DGST      Deferred GST Liability              100% DGST

  No ABN         Tax Withheld for Partners without   Withholding Tax for
                 ABN                                 No ABN

  PAYGW - W3     Other amounts withheld (excluding   Other Amounts
                 any amount shown at W2 or W4)       Withheld (W3)
  ------------------------------------------------------------------------

###### Variants

Businesses from certain industries need to report payments made to
subcontractors from relevant services during the financial year. Odoo
combines the use of taxes and fiscal positions to report these payments
on the `TPAR <australia/tpar>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. In order
to be compliant with the TPAR\'s obligations, two variants of the main
purchase taxes are available in Odoo, but they are inactive by default.

::: example
For the *10% GST* tax, the variants are:

+-------------+---------------------------+-------------+-------------+
| Tax name    | Description               | Reports     | Default     |
|             |                           | impacted    | status      |
+=============+===========================+=============+=============+
| 10% GST     | Default 10% GST tax       | BAS         | Active      |
+-------------+---------------------------+-------------+-------------+
| 10% GST     | TPAR variant of the tax,  | | BAS       | Inactive    |
| TPAR        | if the contractor         | | TPAR      |             |
|             | provided an ABN           |             |             |
+-------------+---------------------------+-------------+-------------+
| 10% GST     | TPAR variant of the tax,  | | BAS       | Inactive    |
| TPAR NO ABN | if the contractor did not | | TPAR      |             |
|             | provide an ABN            |             |             |
+-------------+---------------------------+-------------+-------------+
:::

#### Deferred GST

Odoo allows companies under the [Deferred Goods and Services Tax (DGST)
scheme](https://www.ato.gov.au/businesses-and-organisations/gst-excise-and-indirect-taxes/gst/in-detail/rules-for-specific-transactions/international-transactions/deferred-gst?=redirected_deferredGSTscheme)
to automate their deferred GST flows.

##### Configuration

It is recommended to:

- go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"} and set the `Tax Return
  Periodicity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
  `monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (= monthly BAS); and
- create a new journal to store all deferred GST entries by going to
  `Accounting
  --> Configuration --> Journals --> New`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}, and selecting `Miscellaneous`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} as its `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} when
  configuring it.

By default, a tax (*100% DGST*, inactive by default) and an account
(*21340 Deferred GST Liability*) are available for Australian companies.
Activate the tax by going to `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Search
for the `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} [100%
DGST]{.title-ref} (remove the default filter if necessary), and click
the `Activate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} toggle switch.

##### Flow

###### 1. Importing goods: purchase order and vendor bill

When importing goods from abroad, the GST liability can now be deferred
for companies under the DGST scheme. On the purchase order, select the
`0% TPS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tax (tax paid separately)
for the relevant order lines.

![Setting the 0% TPS tax on a purchase order](australia/dgst-po-tax.png)

###### 2. Recording the DGST balance on the BAS report

When the Australian Taxation Office (ATO) is advised electronically of
the aggregated liability for the company by the Integrated Cargo System
(ICS), the GST balance deferred during the previous month becomes
available on the ATO\'s BAS portal.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo does not yet fetch the DGST balance automatically from the ATO. A
manual entry with the liability amount needs to be created in Odoo. We
recommend using a new journal for this purpose since deferrals will be
recurring.
::::

Go to `Accounting --> Journal Entries --> New`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. On the first journal item line, add the
`Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} [21340 Deferred GST
Liability]{.title-ref} and the deferred GST balance as a
`Credit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To resume the example shown
above, we credit \$2,000 and save.

![Creating a journal entry with the DGST account](australia/dgst-balance-credit.png)

An auto-balancing line is created, along with journal items correctly
assigning the right values in the BAS `Tax Grids`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Sections *G11*, *G18*, *7A*, and *ONLY* are updated
correctly.

![The journal entry with the auto-balancing line and BAS tax grids](australia/dgst-tax-grids.png)

After posting the journal entry, the BAS report displays the correct
values for each section, along with the DGST offset.

### Reports

#### Business Activity Statement (BAS) {#australia/bas}

The **BAS report** is a critical tax reporting requirement for
businesses registered for GST in Australia. The BAS is used to report
and remit various taxes to the ATO. With the Odoo BAS feature,
businesses can report on the following:

- GST
- PAYG tax withheld
- DGST

Access the report from the Accounting dashboard by clicking
`BAS Report (AU)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} under the
`Miscellaneous Operations`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

![BAS report example](australia/bas-report.png)

The base and tax amounts are collected from the **tax grid**, which is
pre-configured in the system. The tax grid can also be manually set up
for any additional special use-case of GST (e.g., wine equalization
tax). Once the tax for each account is set up, the system automatically
slots journal items into the correct tax category. This ensures the BAS
report is accurate and reflective of the business\'s financial
activities.

![GST grids example](australia/gst-grids.png)

Besides the GST sections, the BAS report also includes the **PAYG** tax
withheld components (*W1* to *W5*, then *summary, section 4*). This
integration ensures that all payroll-related withholding taxes are
accurately captured and reflected within the report.

![PAYG tax withheld and summary of BAS report example](australia/payg.png)

The module incorporates built-in rules that facilitate the automatic
calculation of taxes for types W1 to W5. For a detailed walkthrough and
more information on the calculation process for these taxes, refer to
the `Payroll section <payroll/l10n_au/payroll>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

##### Closing

When it is time to file the tax return with the ATO, click
`Closing Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The tax return
period can be configured under
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Tax
Return Periodicity`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. The start
date of the tax return period can also be defined on the report itself
through the period button (`fa-calendar`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
*period* *year*).

::: seealso
`Year-end closing <../accounting/reporting/year_end>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo uses calendar quarters rather than the Australian FY quarters,
which means *July to September* is *Q3* in Odoo.
::::

Before closing the entry for the first time, the default **GST payable
account** and **GST receivable account** need to be set. A notification
pops up and redirects the user to the tax groups configuration.

![BAS report tax groups](australia/bas-accounts.png)

Once the GST payable and GST receivable accounts are set up, the BAS
report generates an accurate journal closing entry automatically, which
balances out the GST balance with the GST clearing account.

The balance between GST receivable and payable is set against the tax
clearing account defined on the tax group. The amount to be paid to or
received from the ATO can be reconciled against a bank statement.

![BAS report tax payment](australia/bas-taxes.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The BAS report is not directly submitted to the ATO. Odoo helps you
automatically compute the necessary values in each section, with the
possibility to audit them to better understand the history behind these
numbers. Businesses can copy these values and enter them on the [ATO
portal](https://www.ato.gov.au/businesses-and-organisations/preparing-lodging-and-paying/business-activity-statements-bas/how-to-lodge-your-bas).
::::

#### Taxable Payments Annual Report (TPAR) {#australia/tpar}

Odoo allows businesses to report payments made to contractors or
subcontractors during the financial year. This is done by generating a
**TPAR**. If you are unsure your business needs this report, refer to
the [ATO\'s TPAR web
page](https://www.ato.gov.au/businesses-and-organisations/preparing-lodging-and-paying/reports-and-returns/taxable-payments-annual-report).

Access the TPAR in Odoo by going to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Taxable Payments
Annual Reports (TPAR)`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

##### Configuration

First, it is required to assign fiscal positions to your contractors
before billing them to update the TPAR. To do so, go to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Vendors`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, select a contractor, and set a
`Fiscal Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} under the
`Sales & Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

![TPAR fiscal position on a vendor](australia/tpar-fiscal-positions.png)

Based on the chosen fiscal position, the correct tax mapping will apply
to the contractor\'s vendor bills.

![TPAR vendor bill tax mapping](australia/tpar-vendor-bill-tax.png)

The TPAR includes the following information from contractors:

- `ABN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Total GST`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (the total tax paid)
- `Gross Paid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (the amounts are
  displayed after a vendor bill has been marked as paid)
- `Tax Withheld`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (displayed if the
  contractor is registered with a fiscal position set to
  `TPAR without ABN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"})

The TPAR can be exported to multiple formats: PDF, XLSX, and TPAR.

### Remittance advice {#australia/remittance}

A remittance advice is a document used as proof of payment to a
business. In Odoo, it can be accessed by going to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Payments`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, selecting the payment(s), and clicking
`Print --> Payment Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

![Remittance advice example](australia/remittance.png)

### E-invoicing {#australia/peppol}

#### Peppol

Odoo is compliant with Australia\'s [Peppol
requirements](https://peppol.org/learn-more/country-profiles/australia/).
Set up your customers and vendors by going to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Customers`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} or `Vendors -->
Vendors`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, selecting one,
clicking the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, and
configuring the `Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section as needed.

![Electronic invoicing settings for a partner](australia/partner-einvoicing.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Validating an invoice or credit note for a partner on the Peppol network
will download a compliant XML file that can be manually uploaded to your
Peppol network. Odoo is currently in the process of becoming an access
point for the ANZ region.
::::

### ABA files for batch payments {#australia/aba}

An ABA file is a digital format developed by the [Australian Banking
Association](https://www.ausbanking.org.au/). It is designed for
business customers to facilitate bulk payment processing by uploading a
single file from their business management software.

The main advantage of using ABA files is to improve payment and matching
efficiency. This is achieved by consolidating numerous payments into one
file for batch processing, which can be submitted to all Australian
banks.

#### Configuration

##### Batch payments

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and enable `Batch
Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

##### Bank journal

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and select the `Bank`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} journal. Enter the `Account Number`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, click `Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and fill in the following fields:

- `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `BSB`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Account Holder`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

Then, toggle on the `Send Money`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
switch and click `Save & Close`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Using the `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
optional.
::::

Back on the `Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
fill in the following fields under the `ABA`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section:

- `BSB`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the BSB code from the bank
  account is used to fill in this field.

- `Financial Institution Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the
  official 3-letter abbreviation of the bank (e.g., [WBC]{.title-ref}
  for Westpac)

- `Supplying User Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: 6-digit
  number provided by the bank. Contact your bank or check its website if
  you do not know it.

- `APCA Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  6-digit number provided by the bank. Contact your bank or check its
  website if you do not know it.

- 

  `Include Self Balancing Transaction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: selecting this option adds an additional

  :   \"self-balancing\" transaction to the end of the ABA file, which
      is required by some banks.

##### Customers\' and vendors\' bank accounts

Go to `Accounting --> Customers --> Customers`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} or `Accounting -->
Vendors --> Vendors`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and select
a customer or vendor. Open the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, and, under the `Bank Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, click `Add a line`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to fill in their:

- `Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `BSB`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Account Holder`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

Then, toggle on the `Send Money`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
switch and click `Save & Close`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

#### Generating an ABA file

To generate an ABA file, create a vendor bill, confirm it, and ensure
the vendor\'s banking information is set up correctly.

Next, click `Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the vendor bill,
and select, for the following fields:

- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: `Bank`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  `ABA Credit Transfer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Recipient Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the
  vendor\'s account number

Once payments are created, go to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Payments`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, select the payments to be included in the batch,
and click `Create Batch`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Verify all
information is correct and click `Validate`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Once validated, the ABA file is available in the
**chatter** on the right.

After uploading the file to your bank\'s portal, an ABA transaction line
will appear in your bank feed at the following bank feed iteration. You
will need to reconcile it against the **batch payment** made in Odoo.

## Industry-specific features

### Starshipit shipping

Starshipit is a shipping service operator that facilitates the
integration of Australasian shipping couriers with Odoo. Refer to the
`Starshipit documentation
<../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/shipping_receiving/setup_configuration/starshipit_shipping>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} for detailed information.

::: seealso
[Starshipit Odoo webinar
recording](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TcDWnoYLXWg)
:::

### Buy Now, Pay Later solutions {#australia/buynow_paylater}

*Buy Now, Pay Later* solutions are popular payment methods for eShops in
Australia. Some of these solutions are available via
[Stripe](https://stripe.com/en-au/payments/payment-methods) and
[AsiaPay](https://www.asiapay.com.au/payment.html#option).

::: seealso
\-
`Stripe payment provider <../payment_providers/stripe>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} -
`AsiaPay payment provider <../payment_providers/asiapay>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### POS terminals

To establish a direct connection between Odoo and a POS terminal in
Australia, a **Stripe** payment terminal is required. Odoo supports the
**EFTPOS** payment solution in Australia.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

A Stripe payment terminal is not required to use Odoo as the main POS
system. However, without one, cashiers must manually enter the final
payment amount on the terminal.
::::

::: seealso
\-
`Stripe payment provider <../payment_providers/stripe>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} -
`Stripe payment terminal <../../sales/point_of_sale/payment_methods/terminals/stripe>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} - [Stripe.com terminal
documentation](https://stripe.com/docs/terminal)
:::




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/austria.md ---

# Austria

## Configuration {#localizations/austria/configuration}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Austrian localization.

  Name                                                                                   Technical name                  Description
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Austria - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                              [l10n_at]{.title-ref}           Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
  `Austria - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                      [l10n_at_reports]{.title-ref}   Adds localized versions of financial reports
  `Austrian SAF-T Export`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                             [l10n_at_saft]{.title-ref}      Adds the SAF-T export.
  `Austria - Security Regulation for Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_at_pos]{.title-ref}       Adds RKSV compliance for POS.

::: seealso
`Documentation on e-invoicingâ€™s legality and compliance in Austria
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/austria>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Financial reports {#localizations/austria/financial-reports}

The following localized reports are available:

> - Balance sheet according to [Â§ 224
>   UGB](https://www.ris.bka.gv.at/NormDokument.wxe?Abfrage=Bundesnormen&Gesetzesnummer=10001702&Artikel=&Paragraf=224&Anlage=&Uebergangsrecht=)
> - Profit and loss according to [Â§ 231
>   UGB](https://www.ris.bka.gv.at/NormDokument.wxe?Abfrage=Bundesnormen&Gesetzesnummer=10001702&Artikel=&Paragraf=231&Anlage=&Uebergangsrecht=)
>   (Gesamtkostenverfahren)

::: seealso
`Accounting reporting documentation <../accounting/reporting>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## SAF-T (Standard Audit File for Tax) {#localizations/austria/saf-t}

The Austrian tax office may request a SAF-T. The Austrian SAF-T Export
module allows exporting the report in XML format.

### Configuration {#localizations/austria/saf-t-configuration}

This section explains how to configure the database to ensure all the
information required by the SAF-T is available. If anything is missing,
a warning message listing which information is needed will be displayed
during the export.

#### Company information {#localizations/austria/saf-t-company}

Open the database `Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Under
the `Companies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, click
`Update Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and ensure the
following fields are correctly filled in:

- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, by providing at least
  the following information:
  - `Street`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Company ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} by providing your
  company\'s tax ID
- `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} by providing, if you have
  one, your `UID-Nummer
  (Umsatzsteueridentifikationsnummer)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  (including the country prefix)

##### Contact person {#localizations/austria/saf-t-contact}

At least one **contact person** must be linked to your company in the
`Contacts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} app, and:

> - Ensure the contact type is set to `Individual`{.interpreted-text
>   role="guilabel"}.
> - Select your company in the `Company name`{.interpreted-text
>   role="guilabel"} field.
> - Provide at least one phone number using the
>   `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
>   `Mobile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

#### Customer and supplier information {#localizations/austria/saf-t-customer-supplier-information}

Using the `Contacts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} app, fill in the
`Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of any partner that appears
in your invoices, vendor bills, or payments.

For partners that are companies, fill in the VAT number (including the
country prefix) in the `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field.

#### Accounting settings {#localizations/austria/saf-t-accounting}

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Under the `Austrian
localization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, fill in the
following fields:

- `Ã–NACE-Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Profit Assessment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

::: seealso
[Ã–NACE information on the Austrian Economic Chambers
website](https://www.wko.at/service/zahlen-daten-fakten/oenace.html)
:::

#### Chart of accounts mapping {#localizations/austria/saf-t-chart-of-account}

The Austrian SAF-T specifications define a chart of accounts (COA). All
relevant accounts for the SAF-T export must be annotated with a fitting
account from this COA.

The needed mapping information is supplied by adding tags to the
accounts. For example, adding the [1000]{.title-ref} tag to an account
maps it (virtually) to the SAF-T COA account with the code
[1000]{.title-ref}. Any number can be used as long as there is an
account in the SAF-T COA with that code.

The `Austria - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} module
adds a tag for each SAF-T COA account. Furthermore, it automatically
maps many accounts from the default Austrian COA.

You can try exporting the SAF-T report to check if there are unmapped
accounts (or mapped to multiple SAF-T accounts). A warning will be
displayed if there is any issue with your configuration or the mapping.
Clicking `View Problematic Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
lets you view them.

::: seealso
`Chart of accounts documentation <../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Exporting the SAF-T report {#localizations/austria/saf-t-exporting}

To export the SAF-T report, go to
`Accounting --> Reports --> General Ledger`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click the right side of the
`PDF`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button and select
`SAF-T`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![The SAF-T button to export the file in XML format](austria/austria-saft-button.png)

## Point of Sale {#localizations/austria/pos}

### RKSV (Registrierkassensicherheitsverordnung) {#localizations/austria/pos-rksv}

The `RKSV (Registrierkassensicherheitsverordnung)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} is an Austrian regulation designed to secure cash registers
and prevent tax fraud. It requires businesses to use tamper-proof
electronic cash register systems, including
`point of sale </applications/sales/point_of_sale>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} systems.

These systems must be equipped with a **Signature Creation Unit (SCU)**,
which is responsible for signing each transaction. This ensures that the
transaction data cannot be altered. Additionally, the regulation
mandates periodic transaction data exports for audit purposes. Odoo
provides a compliant solution through [fiskaly](https://fiskaly.com), a
*cloud-based solution*.

#### Configuration {#localizations/austria/pos-rksv-configuration}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
**Austria - Security Regulation for Point of Sale**
([l10n_at_pos]{.title-ref}) module.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If this module is not listed,
`update the app list <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

##### Company information {#localizations/austria/pos-rksv-company}

Open the Settings app, navigate to the `Companies`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, and click `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `Update Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to make
sure the `information
<localizations/austria/saf-t-company>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} is
up-to-date and correctly filled in.

To link your company to Fiskaly and use it in Odoo, open the
`Fiskaly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab and enable
`Managed by Odoo`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`fa-toggle-on`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}, which activates automatic
integration management.

If a Fiskaly account already exists with its own credentials, disable
the toggle and configure the existing
`Fiskaly credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} manually.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

For testing, ensure that `Test Fiskaly`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} `fa-toggle-on`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} is
enabled to run the integration without impacting the production server.
Since test mode is enabled by default, disable
`Test Fiskaly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`fa-toggle-off`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} to switch to production
mode.

![Management toggle](austria/management-toggle.png)
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Once the credentials have been authenticated, the Fiskaly management
option (by Odoo or custom) and the mode (test or production) can no
longer be modified.
::::

Click `Generate Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
create a new organization in the Fiskaly system and generate the
necessary credentials to run the service. Next, click
`Authenticate Keys`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to validate those
credentials.

##### Link a Fiskaly organization to FinanzOnline {#localizations/austria/pos-fiskaly-finanzonline}

To link the Fiskaly organization with the Austrian Ministry of Finance,
FinanzOnline credentials must be provided. To do so, fill in the
following information in your company\'s `Fiskaly`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab:

- `Participant Identifier`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `User Identifier`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `User Pin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

FinanzOnline credentials can be accessed through an existing account or
by [creating a new one](https://finanzonline.bmf.gv.at/) if it has not
yet been set up.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Random credentials can be used in **test mode**, but valid credentials
are required in **production mode**.
::::

Click `Authenticate FON`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to link your
Fiskaly organization to the Austrian Ministry of Finance and start
regular
`point of sale </applications/sales/point_of_sale>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} operations.

#### Digitally signatured receipts {#localizations/austria/pos-digitally-sign-receipts}

To ensure the integrity and authenticity of the receipts, the system
automatically signs them using the
`SCU (Signature Creation Unit)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} in a
background process. The receipt then displays an encrypted signature as
a QR code containing the receipt number and information about the SCU
used to sign it.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- If the `SCU (Signature Creation Unit)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
is unavailable, receipts may not include a QR code; in such cases:

- Make sure the receipt includes a
  `Sicherheitseinrichtung ausgefallen`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} message, indicating that the system is linked to
  Fiskaly services, but the SCU is temporarily unavailable.
- If this message is missing from the receipt, it indicates no
  connection to Fiskaly services.

\- Orders that remain unsigned due to SCU unavailability can be signed
manually. To do so, follow these steps:

1.  Go to `Point of Sale --> Orders --> Orders`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}.
2.  To identify unsigned orders, click the
    `oi-settings-adjust`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `(adjust
    settings)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon in the
    `Orders`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} list view to reveal the
    `Receipt
    Signed?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} column.
3.  Select the unsigned orders, click `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text
    role="icon"} `Actions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    select `Sign Order`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

#### DEP7 export {#localizations/austria/pos-dep7}

The exported
`DEP7 (Digitale Schnittstelle der Finanzverwaltung fÃ¼r Kassensysteme)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} file allows authorities to verify transactions and ensure
compliance with anti-fraud measures. Businesses must periodically
generate it for audit purposes and submit it to the Austrian tax
authorities upon request.

To generate it, go to
`Point of Sale --> Reporting --> DEP7 Reports`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and, in the `DEP7 Reports`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, fill in the following mandatory fields:

- `Start Datetime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Exports data with
  dates on or after the start date.
- `End Datetime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Exports data with
  dates on or before the end date.
- `Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Specify from which
  point of sale(s) data must be exported.

Then, click `Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to download the
PDF file with DEP7 data.

![DEP7 Reports](austria/dep7-reports.png)

#### Monthly / Yearly closing receipts {#localizations/austria/pos-montly-yearly-receipts}

To print monthly/yearly closing receipts,
`start a session <pos/session-start>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} from
the **POS dashboard** and click `Open Register`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} on the related point of sale. Click the
`oi-view-list`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(list view)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon in the top-right
corner and select `Montly/Yearly Receipts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

The last month is selected by default in the
`Print closing receipts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window. To
change it, select `Monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Yearly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then click the
`fa-calendar-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(calendar)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon to select the
desired month/year.




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/belgium.md ---

# Belgium

## Configuration {#belgium/configuration}

Install the `ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ª Belgium`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`fiscal localization package
<fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to get
all the default accounting features of the Belgian localization,
following the
`IFRS(International Financial Reporting Standards)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} rules.

::: seealso
`Documentation on e-invoicingâ€™s legality and compliance in Belgium
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/belgium>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Chart of accounts {#belgium/coa}

You can reach the `Chart of accounts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
by going to `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Accounting: Chart of Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

The Belgian chart of accounts includes pre-configured accounts as
described in the `PCMN(Plan
Comptable Minimum NormalisÃ©)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. To add a
new account, click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. A new line
appears. Fill it in, click `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
and then `Setup`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to configure it
further.

::: seealso
`../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Taxes {#belgium/taxes}

Default Belgian taxes are created automatically when the
`Belgium - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the
`Belgium - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
modules are installed. Each tax impacts the Belgian
`Tax Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, available by going to
`Accounting --> Reporting -->
Statements Reports: Tax Report`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

In Belgium, the standard VAT rate is **21%**, but there are lower rates
for some categories of goods and services. An intermediate rate of
**12%** is applied on social housing and food served in restaurants,
while a reduced rate of **6%** applies to most basic goods, such as
food, water supply, books, and medicine. A **0%** rate applies to some
exceptional goods and services, such as some daily and weekly
publications, as well as recycled goods.

### Non-deductible taxes {#belgium/non-deductible}

In Belgium, some taxes are not fully deductible, such as taxes on the
maintenance of cars. This means a part of these taxes is considered as
an expense.

In Odoo, you can configure non-deductible taxes by creating tax rules
for these taxes and linking them to the corresponding accounts. This
way, the system automatically calculates the taxes and allocates them to
the appropriate accounts.

To configure a new non-deductible tax, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Accounting: Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and click
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:

1.  `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select
    `Base`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
    `Based On`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} column;
2.  `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then select
    `on tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
    `Based on`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} column and enter the
    **non-deductible** percentage in the `%`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} column;
3.  On the `of tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} line, select the
    `Tax Grid(s)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} related to your
    tax;
4.  `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} with the
    **deductible** percentage in the `%`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} column;
5.  Set `of tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in
    `Based On`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};
6.  Select `411000 VAT recoverable`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    as account, and select the related tax grid.

Once you have created a non-deductible tax, you can apply it to your
transactions by selecting the appropriate tax during the encoding of
bills and credit notes. The system automatically calculates the tax
amount and allocates it to the corresponding accounts based on the tax
rules configured.

::: example
With the Belgian localization, the **21% car** tax is created by default
(50% non-deductible).

![Example of not-fully deductible tax](belgium/deductible-tax.png)
:::

::: seealso
\- `Taxes <../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`../accounting/reporting/tax_returns`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

## Reports {#belgium/reports}

Here is the list of Belgian-specific reports available:

- Balance sheet;
- Profit & loss;
- Tax report;
- Partner VAT Listing;
- EC Sales List;
- Intrastat.

You can access Belgian-specific versions of reports by clicking on the
**book** icon when on a report and selecting its Belgian version:
**(BE)**.

![Belgian version of reports](belgium/belgian-reports.png)

::: seealso
`../accounting/reporting`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Disallowed expenses report {#belgium/disallowed-expenses}

**Disallowed expenses** are expenses that can be deducted from your
accounting result but not from your fiscal result.

The **disallowed expenses report** is available by going to
`Accounting --> Reporting
--> Management: Disallowed Expenses`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. It allows financial results in real-time, and
periodic changes. This report is generated based on the **disallowed
expenses categories** that you can reach by going to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Management: Disallowed Expenses
Categories`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Some categories
already exist by default but do not have any rates. Click on
`Set Rates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to update a specific
category.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- You can add multiple rates for various dates. In that case, the rate
used to calculate the expense depends on the date at which it is
calculated, and the rate set for that date. - If you have the **Fleet**
app installed, tick the `Car Category`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} box when applicable. This makes the vehicle mandatory
while booking a vendor bill.
::::

To link a disallowed expenses category with a specific account, go to
`Accounting -->
Configuration --> Accounting: Chart of Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Find the account you want, and click on
`Setup`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Add the
`Disallowed Expense category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Disallowed
Expenses`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. From now, when an
expense is created with this account, the disallowed expense is
calculated based on the rate mentioned in the
`Disallowed Expense category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Let\'s take an example reflecting **restaurant** and **car expenses**.

#### Restaurant expenses {#belgium/restaurant-expenses}

In Belgium, 69% of **restaurant** expenses are deductible. Create a new
**disallowed expenses category** and set both
`Related Account(s)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Current Rate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

#### Car expenses: vehicle split {#belgium/vehicle-split}

In Belgium, the deductible percentage varies from car to car and,
therefore, should be indicated for each vehicle. To do so, open
`Fleet`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and select a vehicle. In
the `Tax
info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, go to the
`Deductibility Rates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section and
click on `Add a
line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Add a
`Start Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and a
`%`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The amounts go in the same
account for all car expenses.

When you create a bill for car expenses, you can link each expense to a
specific car by filling the `Vehicle`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
column, so the right percentage is applied.

![Disallowed expenses categories](belgium/car-bill.png)

The `vehicle split`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option available
in the disallowed expenses report allows you to see the rate and
disallowed amount for each car.

![Disallowed expenses categories](belgium/vehicle-split.png)

## Fee form 281.50 and form 325 {#belgium/forms}

### Fee form 281.50 {#belgium/281.50}

Annually, a **281.50 fee form** must be reported to the fiscal
authorities. To do so, the tag [281.50]{.title-ref} must be added on the
**contact form** of the entities concerned by the **281.50** fee. To add
the tag, open `Contacts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, select
the person or company you want to create a **281.50 fee form** for, and
add the [281.50]{.title-ref} tag in the `Tags`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field.

![add the tag 281.50 on a contact form](belgium/281-50.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Make sure the **street, zip code, country**, and **VAT number** are also
informed on the **Contact form**.
::::

Then, depending on the nature of the expense, add the corresponding
[281.50]{.title-ref} tag on the impact accounts. To do so, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Accounting: Chart of
Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and click on
`Setup`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to add the corresponding
[281.50]{.title-ref} tag on the impacted accounts, i.e.,
`281.50 - Commissions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, depending on
the nature of the expense.

### Form 325 {#belgium/325}

You can create a **325 form** by going to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Belgium:
Create 325 form`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. A new page
pops up: select the right options and click `Generate 325
form`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To open an already generated
**325 form**, go to `Accounting --> Reporting -->
Belgium: Open 325 forms`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

![Add the tag 281-50 on a contact form](belgium/325-form.png)

## CODA and SODA statements {#belgium/coda-soda}

### CODA {#belgium/coda}

**CODA** is an electronic XML format used to import Belgian bank
statements. You can download CODA files from your bank and import them
directly into Odoo by clicking `Import file`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} from your `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
journal on your dashboard.

![Import CODA files](belgium/coda-import.png)

::: seealso
`Import bank files <accounting/transactions/import>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

### SODA {#belgium/soda}

**SODA** is an electronic XML format used to import accounting entries
related to salaries. SODA files can be imported into the journal you use
to record salaries by going to your Accounting **dashboard** and
clicking `Upload`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the related
journal card form.

Once your **SODA** files are imported, the entries are created
automatically in your salary journal.

![Import SODA files](belgium/soda-import.png)

### CodaBox {#belgium/einvoicing}

**CodaBox** is a service that allows Belgian companies and accounting
firms to access bank information and statements. Odoo provides a way to
import such statements automatically.

#### Configuration

To configure and use Codabox, first
`install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
`CodaBox`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} module.

##### Configure the Connection {#belgium/codabox-configuration-connection}

::::::::: tabs
::::: tab
For companies

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Make sure the
`company settings </applications/general/companies>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} are correctly configured, i.e., the country is set to
`Belgium`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the
`Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Company ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is filled.
::::

1.  Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, then go to the
    `CodaBox & SODA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

2.  Click on `Manage Connection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
    open the connection wizard, which shows the
    `Company VAT/ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} number that will
    be used for the connection.

3.  If this is your **first connection**, click on
    `Create connection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The wizard
    confirms that the connection has been created on **Odoo\'s side**.
    Follow the steps to validate the connection on **CodaBox\'s side**
    too.

    If this is **not your first connection**, the
    `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} provided by Odoo
    during the first connection will be requested to create a new
    connection.

    > :::: note
    > ::: title
    > Note
    > :::
    >
    > This `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is unique to
    > Odoo and must be stored securely on your side.
    > ::::
:::::

::::: tab
For accounting firms .. note:: Accounting firms must manage their
clients on separate databases and configure them individually to avoid
mixing up their data. The connection must be made by an accounting firm
with valid CodaBox Connect credentials. In the following instructions,
we will refer to your client\'s company as *Company* and to your
accounting firm as *Accounting Firm*.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Make sure the
`company settings </applications/general/companies>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} are correctly configured, i.e., the country is set to
`Belgium`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the
`Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Company ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Accounting Firm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields are filled,
as well as the `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the
`Accounting Firm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

1.  Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, then go to the
    `CodaBox & SODA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

2.  Click on `Manage Connection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
    open the connection wizard, which shows the
    `Accounting Firm VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} number and
    the `Company VAT/ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} number that
    will be used for the connection.

3.  If this is your **first connection**, click on
    `Create connection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The wizard
    confirms that the connection has been created on **Odoo\'s side**.
    Follow the steps to validate the connection on **CodaBox\'s side**,
    too.

    If this is **not your first connection**, the
    `Accounting Firm Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    provided by Odoo during the first connection will be requested to
    create a new connection.

    > :::: note
    > ::: title
    > Note
    > :::
    >
    > This `Accounting Firm Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    > is unique to Odoo and must be stored securely on your side.
    > ::::
:::::
:::::::::

The `Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} should have now switched
to `Connected`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

##### Configure the journals

::::::: tabs
::::: tab
For CODA files

1.  `Create a new bank journal <../accounting/bank>`{.interpreted-text
    role="doc"}.
2.  Set the right IBAN in the `Account Number`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} field.
3.  Select `CodaBox synchronization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    as the `Bank Feed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Configuration of a CODA journal.](belgium/codabox_configuration_coda_journal.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

When working with bank transactions that use different currencies, it is
recommended to create multiple journals with the same bank account but
different currencies.
::::
:::::

::: tab
For SODA files

1.  Create a new miscellaneous journal.
2.  Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, then go to the `CodaBox`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} section.
3.  Select the journal you just created in the SODA journal field.

![Configuration of a SODA journal.](belgium/codabox_configuration_soda_setting.png){.align-center}
:::
:::::::

#### Synchronization

Once the connection is established, Odoo can be synchronized with
CodaBox.

::::::: tabs
::: tab
For CODA files

CODA files are automatically imported from CodaBox every 12 hours. You
do not have to do anything. However, if you wish, it can also be done
manually, by clicking on `Fetch from CodaBox`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in the Accounting Dashboard.
:::

::::: tab
For SODA files

SODA files are automatically imported from CodaBox once a day as a
draft. You do not have to do anything. However, if you wish, it can also
be done manually by clicking on `Fetch from CodaBox`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in the Accounting Dashboard.

By default, if an account in the SODA file is not mapped to an account
in Odoo, the Suspense Account (499000) is used, and a note is added to
the created journal entry.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can access the mapping between the SODA and Odoo accounts by going
to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and clicking on the
`Open SODA Mapping`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the
`CodaBox`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.
::::
:::::
:::::::

#### Potential issues

- **CodaBox is not configured. Please check your configuration.**

  Either the `Company VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or the
  `Accounting Firm VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is not set.

- **No connection exists with these accounting firms and company VAT
  numbers.** **Please check your configuration.**

  > This can happen when checking the connection status, and the
  > `Accounting Firm VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  > `Company VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} combination still
  > needs to be registered. This may happen if you have changed the
  > `Company VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} after the
  > connection was established. For security reasons, you have to
  > `recreate a connection <belgium/codabox-configuration-connection>`{.interpreted-text
  > role="ref"} for this `Company VAT`{.interpreted-text
  > role="guilabel"}.

- **It seems that your CodaBox connection is not valid anymore. Please
  connect again.**

  > This can happen if you revoke Odoo\'s access to your CodaBox account
  > or still need to complete the configuration process. In this case,
  > you must revoke the connection and create a new one.

- **The provided password is not valid for this accounting firm.** **You
  must reuse the password you received from Odoo during your first
  connection.**

  > The password you provided is different from the one you received
  > from Odoo during your first connection. You must use the password
  > you received from Odoo during your first connection to create a new
  > connection for this accounting firm. If you have lost your password,
  > you must first revoke the Odoo connection on CodaBox\'s side (i.e.,
  > on your myCodaBox portal). Then, you can revoke the connection on
  > Odoo\'s side and
  > `create a new one <belgium/codabox-configuration-connection>`{.interpreted-text
  > role="ref"}.

- **It seems that the company or accounting firm VAT number you provided
  is not valid.** **Please check your configuration.**

  > Either the `Company VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or the
  > `Accounting Firm VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is not in a
  > valid Belgian format.

- **It seems that the accounting firm VAT number you provided does not
  exist in CodaBox.** **Please check your configuration.**

  > The `Accounting Firm VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} number
  > you provided is not registered in CodaBox. You may not have a valid
  > CodaBox license linked to this VAT number.

- **It seems you have already created a connection to CodaBox with this
  accounting firm.** **To create a new connection, you must first revoke
  the old one on myCodaBox portal.**

  > You must go to your myCodaBox portal and revoke Odoo\'s access to
  > your CodaBox account. Then, you can
  > `create a new connection <belgium/codabox-configuration-connection>`{.interpreted-text
  > role="ref"} on Odoo\'s side.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To revoke the connection between Odoo and CodaBox, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, scroll down to the `CodaBox`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, click on `Manage Connection`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, then click on `Revoke`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
::::

### Codaclean {#belgium/codaclean}

**Codaclean** is a service that allows Belgian companies and accounting
firms to access bank information and statements. Odoo provides a way to
import such statements and their transactions automatically.

#### Configuration {#belgium/codaclean-configuration}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Make sure to `install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
the `Codaclean`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
([l10n_be_codaclean]{.title-ref}) module.
::::

##### Connection with Odoo {#belgium/codaclean-configuration-connection}

To connect Odoo with Codaclean, follow these steps:

1.  Open the Settings app, navigate to the
    `Companies <general/companies/company>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} section, and click `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text
    role="icon"} `Manage Companies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    to make sure the company\'s `Country`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} is set to `Belgium`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
2.  Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and scroll to the
    `Codaclean`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.
3.  Click `Manage Connection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to open
    the connection wizard, enter the Codaclean
    `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and click
    `Connect`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

The `Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is updated to
`Connected`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Once the connection is established, the
`Manage Connection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} wizard provides
two options:

- Update Codaclean credentials: Enter the new
  `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then click
  `Change Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- Remove Codaclean connection: Click `Disconnect`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}; no `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is required.
::::

##### Journal creation {#belgium/codaclean-configuration-journal}

A specific bank journal must be created for Codaclean synchronization.
To do so, `create a new
bank journal <../accounting/bank>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, make
sure to enter the correct IBAN in the `Bank
Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}Â field, and select
`Codaclean Syncronization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Bank Feeds`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

For bank transactions in different currencies, it is recommended to
create a separate journal for each currency, using the same bank
account.
::::

#### Synchronization {#belgium/codaclean-synchronization}

Once the connection is established, Odoo is synchronized with Codaclean,
and new CODA files received via Codaclean are checked every twelve
hours.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To manually check for new CODA files, go to the Accounting Dashboard and
click `Fetch
from Codaclean`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the relevant
`journal <belgium/codaclean-configuration-journal>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} .
::::

## Electronic invoicing with Peppol {#belgium/peppol}

As of 1 January 2026, all Belgian companies must be registered on the
Peppol network to send and receive electronic invoices.

To activate Peppol, refer to the
`Peppol documentation <accounting/e-invoicing/peppol>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, ensuring during
`registration <accounting/e-invoicing/peppol-registration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} that:

- The `Peppol EAS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is set to
  `0208 - Numero d'entreprise /
  ondernemingsnummer / Unternehmensnummer`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
- the `Peppol Endpoint`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is set
  to the company registry number.

In addition, when veryfing that a customer is
`registered as a Peppol participant
<accounting/e-invoicing/contact-verification>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, ensure the `Format`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field is set to `BIS Billing 3.0`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

::: seealso
`Peppol documentation <accounting/e-invoicing/peppol>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

## Cash discount {#belgium/cash-discount}

In Belgium, if an early payment discount is offered on an invoice, the
tax is calculated based on the discounted total amount, whether the
customer benefits from the discount or not.

To apply the right tax amount and report it correctly in your VAT
return, set the tax reduction as
`Always (upon invoice)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

::: seealso
`../accounting/customer_invoices/cash_discounts`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Fiscal certification: POS restaurant {#belgium/pos-restaurant-certification}

In Belgium, the owner of a cooking business such as a restaurant or food
truck is required by law to use a government-certified **Cash Register
System** for their receipts. This applies if their yearly earnings
(excluding VAT, drinks, and take-away food) exceed 25,000 euros.

This government-certified system entails the use of a
`certified POS system
<belgium/certified-pos>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, along with a
device called a `Fiscal Data Module <belgium/fdm>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} (or **black box**) and a
`VAT Signing Card <belgium/vat>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Do not forget to register as *foodservice industry manager* on the
[Federal Public Service Finance registration
form](https://www.systemedecaisseenregistreuse.be/fr/enregistrement).
::::

### Certified POS system {#belgium/certified-pos}

The Odoo POS system is certified for databases hosted on **Odoo
Online**, **Odoo.sh**, and **On-Premise**.

::: seealso
`/administration/standard_extended_support`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

A [certified POS
system](https://www.systemedecaisseenregistreuse.be/systemes-certifies)
must adhere to rigorous government regulations, which means it operates
differently from a non-certified POS.

- On a certified POS, you cannot:
  - Set up and use the **global discounts** feature (the
    [pos_discount]{.title-ref} module is blacklisted and cannot be
    activated).
  - Set up and use the **loyalty programs** feature (the
    [pos_loyalty]{.title-ref} module is blacklisted and cannot be
    activated).
  - Reprint receipts (the [pos_reprint]{.title-ref} module is
    blacklisted and cannot be activated).
  - Modify prices in order lines.
  - Modify or delete order lines in POS orders.
  - Sell products without a valid VAT number.
  - Use a POS that is not connected to an IoT box.
- The
  `cash rounding <../../sales/point_of_sale/pricing/cash_rounding>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"} feature must be activated and set to a
  `Rounding Precision`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of
  [0,05]{.title-ref} and a `Rounding Method`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} set as `Half-Up`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- Taxes must be set as included in the price. To set it up, go to
  `Point of Sale -->
  Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
  and from the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
  open the `Default Sales Tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form
  by clicking the arrow next to the default sales tax field. There,
  click `Advanced Options`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and enable
  `Included in Price`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- At the start of a POS session, users must click
  `Work in`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to clock in. Doing so
  allows the registration of POS orders. If users are not clocked in,
  they cannot make POS orders. Likewise, they must click
  `Work Out`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to clock out at the end
  of the session.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

If you configure a POS to work with a
`FDM (Fiscal Data Module)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, you cannot
use it again without it.
::::

### Fiscal Data Module (FDM) {#belgium/fdm}

An FDM, or **black box**, is a government-certified device that works
together with the Point of Sale application and saves your POS orders
information. Concretely, a **hash** (`unique code`{.interpreted-text
role="dfn"}) is generated for each POS order and added to its receipt.
This allows the government to verify that all revenue is declared.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Only the FDM from **BoÃ®tenoire.be** with the [FDM certificate number
BMC04](https://www.systemedecaisseenregistreuse.be/fr/systemes-certifies#FDM%20certifiÃ©s)
is supported by Odoo. [Contact the manufacturer (GCV
BMC)](https://www.boÃ®tenoire.be/contact) to order one.
::::

#### Configuration

Before setting up your database to work with an FDM, ensure you have the
following hardware:

- a **BoÃ®tenoire.be** (certificate number BMC04) FDM;
- an RS-232 serial null modem cable per FDM;
- an RS-232 serial-to-USB adapter per FDM;
- an `IoT Box <belgium/iotbox>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} (one IoT
  box per FDM); and
- a receipt printer.

##### Black box module {#belgium/blackbox}

As a pre-requisite, `activate <general/install>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} the [Belgian Registered Cash Register]{.title-ref} module
(technical name: [pos_blackbox_be]{.title-ref}).

![black box modules for belgian fiscal certification](belgium/be-modules.png)

Once the module is activated, add your VAT number to your company
information. To set it up, go to
`Settings --> Companies --> Update Info`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and fill in the `VAT`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field. Then, enter a national registration number for
every staff member who operates the POS system. To do so, go to the
`Employees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} app and open an employee
form. There, go to `HR
settings tab --> Attendance/Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and fill in the
`INSZ or BIS number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

![ISNZ or BIS number field on employee form](belgium/bis-number.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To input your information, click on your avatar, go to
`My Profile --> Preference
tab`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and enter your INSZ or BIS
number in the designated field.
::::

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

You must configure the `FDM (Fiscal Data Module)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} directly in the production database. Utilizing it in a
testing environment may result in incorrect data being stored within the
FDM.
::::

##### IoT Box {#belgium/iotbox}

In order to use an `FDM (Fiscal Data Module)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, you need a registered IoT Box. To register your IoT box,
you must contact us through our [support contact
form](https://www.odoo.com/help) and provide the following information:

- your VAT number;
- your company\'s name, address, and legal structure;
- the identifier of your IoT Box.

Once your IoT box is certified,
`connect <../../general/iot/connect>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} it
to your database. To verify that the IoT Box recognizes the FDM, go to
the IoT homepage and scroll down the `IOT Device`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, which should display the FDM.

![Hardware status page on a registered IoT Box](belgium/iot-devices.png)

Then, add the IoT to your POS. To do so, go to
`Point of Sale --> Configuration -->
Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, select your POS,
scroll down to the `Connected Device`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section, and enable `IoT Box`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
Lastly, add the FMD in the `Fiscal Data Module`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To be able to use an FDM, you must at least connect one
`Receipt Printer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

### VAT signing card {#belgium/vat}

When you open a POS session and make your initial transaction, you are
prompted to enter the PIN provided with your
`VSC (VAT signing card)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. The card is
delivered by the `FPS (Service
Public Federal Finances)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} upon
[registration](https://www.systemedecaisseenregistreuse.be/fr/enregistrement).

Note

The localization\'s core modules are installed automatically with the

`installed </applications/general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text

::::

## Localization overview {#localizations/brazil/loc-review}

The Brazilian localization package ensures compliance with Brazilian
fiscal and accounting regulations. It includes tools for managing taxes,
fiscal positions, reporting, and a predefined chart of accounts tailored
to Brazil's standards.

The Brazilian localization package provides the following key features
to ensure compliance with local fiscal and accounting regulations:

- `Chart of accounts <localizations/brazil/chart-of-accounts>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: a predefined structure tailored to Brazilian accounting
  standards
- `Taxes <localizations/brazil/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  pre-configured tax rates, including standard VAT, zero-rated, and
  exempt options.
- `Payroll </applications/hr/payroll>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
- `Reporting <../accounting/reporting>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}

### Chart of accounts {#localizations/brazil/chart-of-accounts}

In the
`chart of accounts <../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, the accounts are mapped automatically to their
corresponding taxes, and the default account payable and account
receivable fields.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The Brazil chart of accounts is based on the SPED CoA, which provides a
baseline of the necessary accounts.
::::

### Taxes {#localizations/brazil/taxes}

`Taxes <../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} are
automatically created and configured when installing the Brazilian
localization. Avalara uses some to compute taxes on sales orders or
invoices.

Taxes used for services must be manually added and configured, as the
rate may differ depending on the city where the service is offered.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

NFS-e can\'t be issued for service taxes created manually. To
`electronically send an NFS-e
<localizations/brazil/e-invoice-services>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, compute taxes using Avalara.
::::

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Do not delete taxes, as they are used for the AvaTax tax computation. If
deleted, Odoo creates them again when used in an
`SO (Sales order)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} or invoice, computing
taxes with AvaTax. However, the account used to register the tax must be
reconfigured in the tax\'s `Definition`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, under the
`Distribution for invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Distribution for refunds`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} sections.
::::

## Company and contacts {#localizations/brazil/company-and-contacts}

To use all the features of this fiscal localization, the following
fields are required on the
`company record </applications/general/companies>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}:

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: add
  `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `State`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `Zip Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - In the `Street`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, enter the
    street name, number, and any additional address information.
  - In the `Street 2`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, enter
    the neighborhood.
- `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  `CNPJ`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `CPF`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: associated with the
  identification type
- `IE`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: State registration
- `IM`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Municipal registration
- `SUFRAMA code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Superintendence of
  the Manaus Free Trade Zone - add if applicable
- `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

Configure the `Fiscal Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
within the `Sales and Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:

> - Add the
>   `Fiscal Position <localizations/brazil/fiscal-positions>`{.interpreted-text
>   role="ref"} for AvaTax Brazil.
> - `Tax Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Federal Tax Regime
> - `ICMS Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: indicates
>   `ICMS regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
>   `Exempt status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
>   `Non-Taxpayer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
> - `Main Activity Sector`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

Configure the following extra `Fiscal Information`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to issue NFS-e:

> - Add the
>   `Fiscal Position <localizations/brazil/fiscal-positions>`{.interpreted-text
>   role="ref"} for AvaTax Brazil.
> - `COFINS Details`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
>   `Taxable, Not Taxable, Taxable with rate 0%, Exempt,
>   Suspended`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
> - `PIS Details`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
>   `Taxable, Not Taxable, Taxable with rate 0%, Exempt,
>   Suspended`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
> - `CSLL Taxable`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if the company is
>   subject to CSLL or not

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If it is a simplified regime, the ICMS rate must be configured. To do
so, go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, scroll down to the `Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, and set the `Sales Tax`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Purchase Tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
fields in the `Default Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section.
::::

The same configuration applies to the relevant
`contact <../../essentials/contacts>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} form
when using the AvaTax integration.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Select the `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option for a
contact with a tax ID (CNPJ), or check `Individual`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} for a contact with a CPF.
::::

## AvaTax integration {#localizations/brazil/avatax-account}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Make sure to `install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} the `AvaTax Brazil`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
([l10n_br_avatax]{.title-ref}) module. - Odoo is a certified partner of
Avalara Brazil. - The
`Avalara AvaTax integration <../accounting/taxes/avatax>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} uses `In-App-Purchases
(IAPs) <../../essentials/in_app_purchase>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
to compute taxes and handle electronic documents (e.g.,
`NF-e <localizations/brazil/e-invoice-goods>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `NFS-e
<localizations/brazil/e-invoice-services>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}). Each action consumes credits from the [IAP credit
balance](https://iap.odoo.com/iap/in-app-services/819). On creation, new
databases receive 500 free credits.
::::

To compute the goods and services tax and process electronic invoices,
the following configurations are needed:

- `Company <localizations/brazil/company-and-contacts>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Contacts <localizations/brazil/company-and-contacts>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `AvaTax configuration<localizations/brazil/avatax-credentials>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.
- `A1 digital certificate <localizations/brazil/certificate-upload>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Tax mapping <localizations/brazil/fiscal-positions>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Products <localizations/brazil/products>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}

### Configuration {#localizations/brazil/avatax-configuration}

#### Credentials {#localizations/brazil/avatax-credentials}

`Activate AvaTax in Odoo <accounting/avatax/credentials>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and, in the `AvaTax Brazil`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, add the administrator\'s email address for the
AvaTax portal in the `AvaTax Portal
Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, then click
`fa-plug`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Create account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

When **testing** or **creating a production**
`AvaTax Portal Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} integration in
a sandbox or production database, use a real email address, as it is
needed to `connect to
Avalara <accounting/avatax/prerequisites>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
and set up the certificates, whether to test or use it on production.

There are two different Brazilian Avalara Portals:

- One for testing: <https://portal.sandbox.avalarabrasil.com.br/>
- One for production: <https://portal.avalarabrasil.com.br/>

When the account is created from Odoo, select the right environment.
Moreover, the email used to open the account cannot be used to open
another account. Save the `API ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and `API Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} when the account is
created from Odoo.

![Transfer API Credentials.](brazil/transfer-api-credentials.png)
::::

After the account is created from Odoo, go to the Avalara Portal to set
up the password:

1.  Access the [Avalara
    portal](https://portal.avalarabrasil.com.br/Login).
2.  Click `Meu primeiro acesso`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
3.  Add the email address used in Odoo to create the Avalara/AvaTax
    account, and click `Solicitar Senha`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
4.  An email will then be received with a token and a link to create a
    password. Click on this link and copy-paste the token to allocate
    the desired password.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If you use AvaTax in Odoo for tax computation **only**, setting a
password or accessing the Avalara portal is unnecessary. However, to use
the electronic invoice service, access to AvaTax is needed, and the
`certificate must be uploaded
<localizations/brazil/certificate-upload>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`API (Application programming interface)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
credentials can be transferred. This option should be used only when an
account has already been created in another Odoo instance and must be
reused.
::::

#### A1 certificate upload {#localizations/brazil/certificate-upload}

To issue electronic invoices, a certificate must be uploaded to the
[AvaTax portal](https://portal.avalarabrasil.com.br/Login).

The certificate will be synchronized with Odoo as long as the external
identifier number in the AvaTax portal matches, without special
characters, with the CNPJ number, and the identification number (CNPJ)
in Odoo matches the CNPJ in AvaTax.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Some cities require the certificate to be linked within the City Portal
system before issuing NFS-e from Odoo.

If an error message from the city that says
`Your certificate is not linked
to the user`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is received, this
