process needs to be done in the city portal.
::::

#### Fiscal positions {#localizations/brazil/fiscal-positions}

To set up the `Automatic Tax Mapping (Avalara Brazil)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} `fiscal position
<accounting/avatax/fiscal_positions>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
enable the `Detect Automatically`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Use AvaTax Brazil API`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} options.

::: seealso
`Fiscal positions <../accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

#### Products {#localizations/brazil/products}

To use the AvaTax integration on sales orders and invoices, enter the
following information in the `Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
tab of the product form under the `Brazil Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, based on how the product will be used.

##### E-invoices for goods (NF-e) {#localizations/brazil/e-invoice-goods}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The
`Avalara integration <localizations/brazil/avatax-account>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} works on a credit-based system, where each interaction with
Avalara consumes one credit. Below are the main credit-consuming
operations:

**Sales application**

- Tax calculation on quotations and sales orders.

**Accounting application**

- Tax calculation on invoices.
- Electronic invoice submission (NF-e or NFS-e).

**Occasional operations**: (each step is billed separately)

- `Correction letter (Carta de CorreÃ§Ã£o) <localizations/brazil/correction-letter>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Invoice cancellation <localizations/brazil/invoice-cancellation>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Sales refund via credit note <localizations/brazil/credit-notes>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Sales complementary invoice via debit note <localizations/brazil/debit-notes>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Invoice number range invalidation <localizations/brazil/invoice-number-invalidation>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- Other tax validations.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If taxes are calculated in the **Sales** app, and the invoice is later
issued in the **Accounting** app, the calculation happens twice,
consuming two credits.
::::

::: example
\| **Sales order confirmed** \| `fa-arrow-down`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} 1 credit (tax calculation) \| **Invoice created** \|
`fa-arrow-down`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} 1 credit (tax
calculation) \| **Invoice confirmed and submitted** \|
`fa-arrow-down`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} 1 credit (tax
calculation) + 1 credit (submit invoice) \| **Total: 4 credits**
:::

- `CEST Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: tax classification
  code identifying goods and products subject to tax substitution under
  ICMS regulations, and helps determine the applicable tax treatment and
  procedures for specific items. The product\'s applicability to this
  requirement can be verified at <https://www.codigocest.com.br/>.
- `Mercosul NCM Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Mercosur
  Common Nomenclature Product Code
- `Source of Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: origin of the
  product, which can be foreign or domestic, among other possible
  options, depending on the specific use case
- `SPED Fiscal Product Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: fiscal
  product type according to the SPED list table
- `Purpose of Use`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: intended purpose
  of use for this product

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo automatically creates three products to be used for transportation
costs associated with sales. These are named `Freight`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Insurance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Other Costs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and are already
configured. If more need to be created, duplicate and use the same
configuration:

- `Product Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  `Service`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Transportation Cost Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  `Insurance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Freight`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
  `Other Costs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
::::

##### E-invoices for services (NFS-e) {#localizations/brazil/e-invoice-services}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The
`Avalara integration <localizations/brazil/avatax-account>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} works on a credit-based system, where each interaction with
Avalara consumes one credit. Below are the main credit-consuming
operations:

**Sales application**

- Tax calculation on quotations and sales orders.

**Accounting application**

- Tax calculation on invoices.
- Electronic invoice submission (NF-e or NFS-e).
- Invoice status check (1 credit is consumed each time the invoice
  status is checked).

**Occasional operations**: (each step is billed separately)

- `Correction letter (Carta de CorreÃ§Ã£o) <localizations/brazil/correction-letter>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Invoice cancellation <localizations/brazil/invoice-cancellation>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Sales refund via credit note <localizations/brazil/credit-notes>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Sales complementary invoice via debit note <localizations/brazil/debit-notes>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Invoice number range invalidation <localizations/brazil/invoice-number-invalidation>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- Other tax validations.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If taxes are calculated in the **Sales** app and the invoice is later
issued in the **Accounting** app, the calculation happens twice,
consuming two credits.
::::

::: example
\| **Sales order confirmed** \| `fa-arrow-down`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} 1 credit (tax calculation) \| **Invoice created** \|
`fa-arrow-down`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} 1 credit (tax
calculation) \| **Invoice confirmed and submitted** \|
`fa-arrow-down`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} 1 credit (tax
calculation) + 1 credit (submit invoice) \| **Total: 4 credits**
:::

- `Mercosul NCM Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Mercosur
  Common Nomenclature Product Code
- `Purpose of Use`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: intended purpose
  of use for this product
- `Service Code Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: City Service
  Code where the provider is registered
- `Labor Assignment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: checkbox to
  select if the service involves labor
- `Transport Cost Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type of
  transport costs to select
- `Service Codes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: City Service Code
  where the service will be provided; if no code is added, the
  `Service Code Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} will be used.

### Tax computation {#localizations/brazil/tax-computation}

::: seealso
`Tax calculation <accounting/avatax/tax-calculation>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

#### Tax calculations on quotations and sales orders {#localizations/brazil/tax-calculations}

Trigger an `API (Application programming interface)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} call to calculate taxes on a quotation or sales order
automatically with AvaTax in any of the following ways:

- 

  **Quotation confirmation**

  :   Confirm a quotation into a sales order.

- 

  **Manual trigger**

  :   Click `Compute Taxes Using AvaTax`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}.

- 

  **Preview**

  :   Click `Preview`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- 

  **Email a quotation/sales order**

  :   Send a quotation or sales order to a customer via email.

- 

  **Online quotation access**

  :   When a customer accesses the quotation online (via the portal
      view), the
      `API (Application programming interface)`{.interpreted-text
      role="abbr"} call is triggered.

#### Tax calculations on invoices {#localizations/brazil/tax-calculations-invoices}

Trigger an `API (Application programming interface)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} call to calculate taxes on a customer invoice automatically
with AvaTax in any of the following ways:

- 

  **Manual trigger**

  :   Click `Compute Taxes Using AvaTax`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}.

- 

  **Preview**

  :   Click `Preview`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- 

  **Online invoice access**

  :   When a customer accesses the invoice online (via the portal view),
      the `API (Application programming interface)`{.interpreted-text
      role="abbr"} call is triggered.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `Fiscal Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be set to
[Automatic Tax Mapping (Avalara Brazil)]{.title-ref} for any of these
actions to compute taxes automatically.
::::

::: seealso
`Fiscal positions (tax and account mapping) <../accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Accounting {#localizations/brazil/accounting}

### Electronic documents {#localizations/brazil/electronic-documents}

#### Configuration {#localizations/brazil/journals}

A *series* number is linked to a sequence number range for electronic
invoices. To configure the series number on a sales journal, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and set it in the `Series`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field. If more than one series is needed, a new sales
journal must be created, and a new series number must be assigned for
each series.

Enable the `Use Documents?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option as
the `Series`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field will only be
displayed if the `Use Documents?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
option is selected on the journal.

When issuing electronic and non-electronic invoices, the
`Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field selects the document
type used when creating the invoice.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When creating the journal, ensure the
`Dedicated Credit Note Sequence`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field in the `Accounting Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section is unchecked, as in Brazil, sequences between invoices, credit
notes, and debit notes are shared per series number, which means per
journal.
::::

#### Customer invoices {#localizations/brazil/customer-invoices}

To process an electronic invoice for goods (NF-e) or services (NFS-e),
the invoice must be confirmed and taxes must be computed by Avalara. The
following fields must be filled out:

- `Customer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, with all customer
  information
- `Payment Method: Brazil`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Specify
  the expected payment method.
- `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  `(55) Electronic Invoice (NF-e)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `(SE)
  Electronic Service Invoice (NFS-e)`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.

`Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:

- `Fiscal Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} set as
  `Automatic Tax Mapping (Avalara Brazil)`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.

Some optional fields depend on the nature of the transaction. These
fields in the `Other
Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab are not required, so in
most cases, leaving them blank will not result in errors from the
government when the invoice is submitted:

- `Freight Model`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} determines how the
  goods are planned to be transported - domestic.
- `Transporter Brazil`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} determines who
  is doing the transportation.

Then, click `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In the
`Print & Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, click `Process
e-invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and any other options,
such as `Download`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Finally, click
`Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to process the invoice with
the government.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

All fields available on the invoice used to issue an electronic invoice
are also available on the sales order, if needed. When creating the
first invoice, the `Document Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field is displayed and allocated as the first number to be used
sequentially for subsequent invoices.
::::

#### Credit notes {#localizations/brazil/credit-notes}

If a sales return needs to be registered, a
`credit note can be created in Odoo
<accounting/credit_notes/issue-credit-note>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and sent to the government for validation.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Credit notes are only available for electronic invoices for goods
(NF-e).
::::

#### Debit notes {#localizations/brazil/debit-notes}

If additional information needs to be included or values that were not
accurately provided in the original invoice need to be corrected, a
`debit note can be issued
<accounting/credit_notes/issue-debit-note>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Debit notes are only available for electronic invoices for goods
(NF-e). - Only the products included in the original invoice can be
included in the debit note. While changes can be made to the product\'s
unit price or quantity, products **cannot** be added to the debit note.
The purpose of this document is only to declare the amount to be added
to the original invoice for the same or fewer products.
::::

#### Invoice cancellation {#localizations/brazil/invoice-cancellation}

It is possible to cancel an electronic invoice that the government
validated.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Check whether the electronic invoice is still within the cancellation
deadline, which may vary according to each state\'s legislation.
::::

##### E-invoices for goods (NF-e) {#localizations/brazil/e-invoice-goods-nf-e}

To cancel an e-invoice for goods (NF-e) in Odoo, click
`Request Cancel`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and add a
cancellation `Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the pop-up
that appears. To send this cancellation reason to the customer via
email, enable the `E-mail`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

This is an electronic cancellation, which means that Odoo will send a
request to the government to cancel the NF-e. It will then consume one
`IAP (In-app-purchase)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} credit, as an
`API (Application programming interface)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
call occurs.
::::

##### E-invoices for services (NFS-e) {#localizations/brazil/e-invoice-services-nf-e}

To cancel an e-invoice for services (NFS-e) in Odoo, click
`Request Cancel`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. There is no
electronic cancellation process in this case, as not every city has this
service available. The user needs to cancel this NFS-e on the city
portal manually. Once that step is completed, they can request the
cancellation in Odoo, which will cancel the invoice.

#### Correction letter {#localizations/brazil/correction-letter}

A correction letter can be created and linked to an electronic invoice
for goods (NF-e) that the government validated.

To do so in Odoo, click `Correction Letter`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and add a correction `Reason`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to the pop-up. To send the correction reason to a
customer via email, enable the `E-mail`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} checkbox.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Correction letters are only available for electronic invoices for goods
(NF-e).
::::

#### Invoice number range invalidation {#localizations/brazil/invoice-number-invalidation}

A range of sequences that are assigned to sales journals can be
invalidated by the government if they are not currently used **and**
will not be used in the future. To do so, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, open the journal, click the
`fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} (gear) icon, and select
`Invalidate Number Range (BR)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. On
the `Invalidate Number Range (BR)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
wizard, add the `Initial Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`End Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the range that should
be cancelled, and enter an invalidation `Reason`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Invoice number range invalidation is only available for electronic
invoices for goods (NF-e). - The journal\'s chatter records the log of
the cancelled numbers, along with the XML file.
::::

### Vendor bills {#localizations/brazil/vendor-bills}

When receiving an invoice from a supplier, encode the bill in Odoo by
adding all the commercial information and the same Brazilian-specific
information recorded on the `customer invoices
<localizations/brazil/electronic-documents>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

These Brazilian-specific fields are:

- `Payment Method: Brazil`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Specify
  the expected payment method.
- `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: used by the vendor
- `Document Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the invoice
  number from the supplier
- `Freight Model`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: **NF-e specific**
  how goods are planned to be transported - domestic
- `Transporter Brazil`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: **NF-e
  specific** who is doing the transportation.

## Point of sale NFC-e {#localizations/brazil/pos}

The NFC-e is a legal document that supports selling goods or merchandise
to the final customer. Like the
`NF-e <localizations/brazil/e-invoice-goods-nf-e>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, the electronic customer invoice is also issued in XML file
format and has an auxiliary document (DANFC-e) known as the *NFC-e
Summary*. This electronic document can be issued through **Odoo Point of
Sale**.

Its legal validity is guaranteed by the digital signature and by each
Brazilian state\'s SEFAZ (Secretaria da Fazenda).

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The
`Avalara integration <localizations/brazil/avatax-account>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} operates on a credit-based system. Each operation that
involves communication with Avalara consumes one credit. The following
operations within the **Point of Sale** (POS) application are subject to
credit consumption:

- Tax calculation at the time of sale
- Electronic invoice issuance (NFC-e)
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Each step is billed separately. For example, calculating taxes and
issuing an invoice for the same POS transaction consumes two credits.
::::

::: seealso
`Point of Sale <../../sales/point_of_sale>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Configuration {#localizations/brazil/pos-configuration}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
`Brazilian Accounting EDI for POS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
([l10nbr_edi_pos]{.title-ref}) module and make sure to activate
`AvaTax <../accounting/taxes/avatax>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.

### CSC details {#localizations/brazil/pos-csc-details}

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and scroll to the `Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section. In the `NFC-e configuration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, complete the following CSC (Taxpayer Security
Code) fields:

- `CSC ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The *CSC ID* or *CSC
  Token* is an identification of the taxpayer security code, which can
  have 1 to 6 digits and is available on the official website of your
  state's Department of Finance (SEFAZ).
- `CSC Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The *CSC Number* is a
  code of up to 36 characters that only you and the Department of
  Finance know. It is used to generate the QR Code of the NFC-e and
  ensure the authenticity of the DANFE.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The information required for these fields can be generated through the
SEFAZ website of each Brazilian State by the company\'s accountant.
::::

### Product configuration {#localizations/brazil/pos-product}

Access the relevant
`product form in POS <../../sales/point_of_sale/configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, then configure the
`product <localizations/brazil/products>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}\'s `Brazil Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
fields.

### Point of sale {#localizations/brazil/pos-shop-configuration}

Go to `Point of Sale --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and make sure that the relevant Point of Sale is
`selected at the top of the screen <../../sales/point_of_sale/configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. Then, scroll to the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section and configure the
`Brazilian EDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields:

- `Series`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Next number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the next NFC-e
  number in the sequence to be issued, for instance, if the last number
  issued in SEFAZ is [100]{.title-ref}, the *Next number* will be
  [101]{.title-ref}.

### Workflow {#localizations/brazil/pos-workflow}

#### Generating an NFC-e {#localizations/brazil/generate-nfc-e}

To generate an NFC-e, follow these steps:

1.  `Open the relevant point of sale shop and make a sale <pos/session-start>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
2.  Validate the payment to calculate taxes and issue an NFC-e. The
    valid NFC-e appears on the right side of the screen.

![NFC-e Success in a POS session.](brazil/l10n-br-nfce-succesfully-issued.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

It is also possible to issue an NFC-e that identifies the customer by
their CPF/CNPJ. To do so, click `fa-user`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Customer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, search for the customer,
or create a new one.

The following are mandatory fields to issue a CPF/CNPJ identified NFC-e:

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} where the invoice is being
  issued
- `CPF/CNPJ`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
::::

1.  Click `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The NFC-e
    appears, highlighting the customer\'s CPF on the print.
2.  Click `Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
    `Send via e-mail`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to deliver the
    invoice to the customer.

#### NFC-e ticket print {#localizations/brazil/nfc-e-print}

After
`generating and validating the NFC-e <localizations/brazil/generate-nfc-e>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, click `Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to deliver
the invoice.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The Odoo NFC-e feature is compatible with any thermal printer and does
not require an `Odoo
IoT Box <../../general/iot>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.
::::

#### Re-issuing a PoS order with an NFC-e error {#localizations/brazil/order-with-nfc-e-error}

If the NFC-e returns an error, follow these steps:

1.  Correct the error.
2.  Re-issue the NFC-e by clicking the `fa-bars`{.interpreted-text
    role="icon"} `(menu)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon and
    selecting `Orders`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
3.  Filter the list to show only `Paid`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} orders and click `Details`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}. The error is displayed.
4.  Click `Send NFC-e`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If the error has been corrected and the PoS session is closed, Odoo logs
the tax adjustment in the chatter of the related journal entry. The
journal entry for the order indicates that the taxes were incorrectly
calculated. In this case, reprocessing the NFC-e is required.
::::

![Point of sale order view form.](brazil/l10n-br-order-error-screen.png)

#### NFC-e refunds & cancellations {#localizations/brazil/nfc-e-refunds-cancellations}

`Refunds can be processed directly in Odoo <pos/refund>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, but *cancellations* must be performed through the official
government portal.

When the process is finalized, the approved return NF-e is created,
meaning the **previous NFC-e is canceled**.

![Return of Goods NF-e Approved.](brazil/l10n-br-return-succeed.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

SEFAZ only allows cancellation of an NFC-e **within 30 minutes** of its
issuance on the SEFAZ website. After this period, a manual refund must
be processed, along with the issuance of a *Return of Goods NF-e*.
::::




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/canada.md ---

# Canada

The Odoo Canada localization package provides tailored features and
configurations for Canadian businesses.

A series of videos on the subject of Accounting are available through
Odoo\'s eLearning platform. These videos cover how to start from
scratch, set up configurations, complete common workflows, and provide
in-depth looks at some specific use cases.

::: seealso
\- [Odoo Tutorials: Accounting &
Invoicing](https://www.odoo.com/slides/accounting-and-invoicing-19) -
[Odoo SmartClass:
Accounting](https://www.odoo.com/slides/smartclass-accounting-121)
:::

## Configuration

Below are the available modules in Odoo for accounting use in Canada.

### Modules installation

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Canadian localization:

+-------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Name                                            | Technical name                       | Description                                                                       |
+=================================================+======================================+===================================================================================+
| `Canada - Accounting`{.interpreted-text         | [l10n_ca]{.title-ref}                | Base accounting module for Canadian localization.                                 |
| role="guilabel"}                                |                                      |                                                                                   |
+-------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| `Canada - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text | [l10n_ca_reports]{.title-ref}        | Adds Canadian accounting reports.                                                 |
| role="guilabel"}                                |                                      |                                                                                   |
+-------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| `Canadian Checks Layout`{.interpreted-text      | [l10n_ca_check_printing]{.title-ref} | Enables the printing of payments on pre-printed check paper. Supports the three   |
| role="guilabel"}                                |                                      | most common check formats and works natively with the linked checks from          |
|                                                 |                                      | [checkdepot.net](https://checkdepot.net/collections/computer-checks/Odoo).        |
|                                                 |                                      |                                                                                   |
|                                                 |                                      | - [Check on top: Quicken / QuickBooks                                             |
|                                                 |                                      |   standard](https://checkdepot.net/collections/computer-checks/odoo+top-check)    |
|                                                 |                                      | - [Check on middle: Peachtree                                                     |
|                                                 |                                      |   standard](https://checkdepot.net/collections/computer-checks/odoo+middle-check) |
|                                                 |                                      | - [Check on bottom: ADP                                                           |
|                                                 |                                      |   standard](https://checkdepot.net/collections/computer-checks/odoo+Bottom-Check) |
+-------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

## Chart of accounts {#l10n_ca/coa}

The
`chart of accounts (COA) <../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} for the Canadian localization, in Odoo, has accounts grouped
into seven main categories, with corresponding numeric values that
prefix individual journal entries:

- **Receivable**: the balance of money (or credit) due to the business
  for goods or services delivered or used, but not yet paid for by
  customers. `AR (Accounts Receivable)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  is indicated by the journal code labeled (or beginning) with
  `1`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- **Payable**: the business\'s short-term obligations owed to its
  creditors or suppliers, which have not yet been paid.
  `AP (Accounts Payable)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is indicated by
  the journal code labeled (or beginning) with `2`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
- **Equity**: the amount of money that would be returned to a company\'s
  shareholders if all of the assets were liquidated and all of the
  company\'s debt was paid off in the case of liquidation. Equity is
  indicated by the journal code labeled (or beginning) with
  `3`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `9`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
- **Assets**: items listed on the balance sheet that contains economic
  value or have the ability to generate cash flows in the future, such
  as a piece of machinery, a financial security, or a patent. Assets are
  indicated by the journal code labeled (or beginning) with
  `1`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- **Liability**: refers to a company\'s financial debts or obligations
  that arise during the course of business operations. Liabilities are
  indicated by the journal code labeled (or beginning) with
  `2`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- **Income**: synonymous with *net income*, this is the profit a company
  retains after paying off all relevant expenses from sales revenue
  earned. Income is indicated by the journal code labeled (or beginning)
  with `4`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `6`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
- **Expenses**: the cost of operations that a company incurs to generate
  revenue. Expenses are indicated by the journal code labeled (or
  beginning) with a `6`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Predefined accounts are included in Odoo, as part of the
`CoA (Chart of Accounts)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} that\'s
installed with the Canadian localization package. The accounts listed
below are preconfigured to perform certain operations within Odoo. It is
recommended to **not** delete these accounts; however, if changes are
needed, rename the accounts instead.

+-------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
| `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} | `Account Name`{.interpreted-text                 |
|                                           | role="guilabel"}                                 |
+===========================================+==================================================+
| `Current Assets`{.interpreted-text        | | `Bank Suspense Account`{.interpreted-text      |
| role="guilabel"}                          |   role="guilabel"}                               |
|                                           | | `Outstanding Receipts`{.interpreted-text       |
|                                           |   role="guilabel"}                               |
|                                           | | `Outstanding Payments`{.interpreted-text       |
|                                           |   role="guilabel"}                               |
|                                           | | `Liquidity Transfer`{.interpreted-text         |
|                                           |   role="guilabel"}                               |
|                                           | | `Stock Valuation`{.interpreted-text            |
|                                           |   role="guilabel"}                               |
|                                           | | `Stock Interim (Received)`{.interpreted-text   |
|                                           |   role="guilabel"}                               |
|                                           | | `Stock Interim (Delivered)`{.interpreted-text  |
|                                           |   role="guilabel"}                               |
|                                           | | `Cost of Production`{.interpreted-text         |
|                                           |   role="guilabel"}                               |
+-------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
| `Income`{.interpreted-text                | | `Foreign Exchange Gain`{.interpreted-text      |
| role="guilabel"}                          |   role="guilabel"}                               |
|                                           | | `Cash Difference Gain`{.interpreted-text       |
|                                           |   role="guilabel"}                               |
|                                           | | `Cash Discount Gain`{.interpreted-text         |
|                                           |   role="guilabel"}                               |
+-------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
| `Expenses`{.interpreted-text              | | `Cash Discount Loss`{.interpreted-text         |
| role="guilabel"}                          |   role="guilabel"}                               |
|                                           | | `Foreign Exchange Loss`{.interpreted-text      |
|                                           |   role="guilabel"}                               |
|                                           | | `Cash Difference Loss`{.interpreted-text       |
|                                           |   role="guilabel"}                               |
+-------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
| `Current Year Earnings`{.interpreted-text | `Undistributed Profits/Losses`{.interpreted-text |
| role="guilabel"}                          | role="guilabel"}                                 |
+-------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
| `Receivable`{.interpreted-text            | `Account Receivable`{.interpreted-text           |
| role="guilabel"}                          | role="guilabel"}                                 |
+-------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
| `Payable`{.interpreted-text               | `Account Payable`{.interpreted-text              |
| role="guilabel"}                          | role="guilabel"}                                 |
+-------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
::::

::: seealso
\- `../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} - `../accounting/get_started/cheat_sheet`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Fiscal positions {#l10n_ca/fiscal-positions}

Canadian tax rates and taxable items vary by province and territory.
Default fiscal positions are automatically created when the Odoo
**Accounting** application is installed. To manage or configure
additional fiscal positions, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Fiscal
Positions`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

The following fiscal positions are available by default:

- `Alberta (AB)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `British Columbia (BC)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Manitoba (MB)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `New Brunswick (NB)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Newfoundland and Labrador (NL)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Nova Scotia (NS)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Northwest Territories (NT)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Nunavut (NU)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Ontario (ON)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Prince Edward Islands (PE)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Quebec (QC)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Saskatchewan (SK)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Yukon (YT)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `International (INTL)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![The default fiscal positions for the Canada localization in Odoo Accounting.](canada/l10n-ca-fiscal-positions.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When considering what taxes to be applied, it is the province where the
delivery occurs that matters. Therefore, delivery is the responsibility
of the vendor and is accounted for at the customer location.
::::

::: example
\- A delivery is made to a customer from another province. Set the
fiscal position on the customer\'s record to the province of the
customer. - A customer from another province comes to pick up products.
No fiscal position should be set on the customer\'s record. - An
international vendor doesn\'t charge any tax, but taxes are charged by
the customs broker. Set the fiscal position on the vendor\'s record to
*International*. - An international vendor charges provincial tax. Set
the fiscal position on the vendor\'s record to your position.
:::

::: seealso
`../accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

## Taxes {#l10n_ca/taxes}

In Canada, tax rates and what is considered taxable vary by province and
territory. Default *Sales* and *Purchases* taxes are created
automatically when the Odoo **Accounting** application is installed. To
manage existing or configure additional taxes, navigate to `Accounting
--> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

### AvaTax {#l10n_ca/taxes-avatax}

**Avalara AvaTax** is a cloud-based tax calculation and compliance
software that integrates with Odoo for several localizations, including
Canada. Integrating AvaTax with Odoo provides real-time and
region-specific tax calculations when items are sold, purchased, and
invoiced in the database.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

AvaTax is available for integration with databases/companies that have
locations in Canada and/or the United States. Reference the
`accounting/avatax/fiscal_country`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
documentation for more information.
::::

::: seealso
Refer to the documentation articles below to integrate and configure an
AvaTax account with an Odoo database:

- `AvaTax integration <../accounting/taxes/avatax>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}
- `Avalara management portal <../accounting/taxes/avatax/avalara_portal>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}
- `Calculate taxes with AvaTax <../accounting/taxes/avatax/avatax_use>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}
- Avalara\'s support documents: [About
  AvaTax](https://community.avalara.com/support/s/document-item?language=en_US&bundleId=dqa1657870670369_dqa1657870670369&topicId=About_AvaTax.html&_LANG=enus)
:::

## Reports {#l10n_ca/reports}

A number of
`report selections <../accounting/reporting>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} are readily available for the Canadian localization, under
the `Accounting app --> Reporting`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} drop-down menu:

- `Balance Sheet <accounting/reporting/balance-sheet>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: a \"snapshot\" of a company\'s financial position at a
  specific point in time, which contains an overview of a company\'s
  assets, liabilities, and equity.

  Be sure to select the `Balance sheet (CA)`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"} option from the `fa-book`{.interpreted-text
  role="icon"} `Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} filter.

  ![Balance sheet report selection for CA localization in Odoo.](canada/l10n-ca-balance-sheet.png)

- `Profit & Loss <accounting/reporting/balance-sheet>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: otherwise known as a *P&L statement* or *income
  statement*, provides a summary of a company\'s revenues, expenses, and
  profits/losses over a given period of time.

  Be sure to select the `Profit and loss (CA)`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"} option from the `fa-book`{.interpreted-text
  role="icon"} `Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} filter.

  ![Profit and loss report selection for CA localization in Odoo.](canada/l10n-ca-profit-loss.png)

- `Cash Flow Statement`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: shows how
  much cash and cash equivalents a company has received and spent in a
  given period.

- `Executive Summary <accounting/reporting/executive-summary>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: an overview report that covers the key performance
  indicators of a company\'s financial position, such as revenue,
  profit, and debt.

- `Tax Report <accounting/reporting/tax-report>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: an official form filed for a tax authority that reports
  income, expenses, and other pertinent tax information. Tax reports
  allow taxpayers to calculate their tax liability, schedule tax
  payments, or request refunds for the overpayment of taxes. In Odoo,
  the tax report can be made monthly, every two months, quarterly, every
  4 months, semi-annually, and annually.

::: seealso
\- `Accounting reporting <../accounting/reporting>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} - `../../essentials/search`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

## Cash discount {#l10n_ca/cash-discount}

Cash discounts can be configured from
`Accounting app --> Payment Terms`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Each payment term can be set up with a cash
discount and reduced tax.

::: seealso
`../accounting/customer_invoices/cash_discounts`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Writing checks

The Canadian localization allows users to print checks for vendor
payments. Be sure the *Canadian Checks Layout*
([l10n_ca_check_printing]{.title-ref}) module for the CA localization is
`installed
<general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

To enable check printing from Odoo, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and find the
`Vendor Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section. From here,
tick the `Checks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox to reveal
several fields for check configuration.

Select a `Check Layout`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the
drop-down menu:

- `Print Check (Top) - CA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Print Check (Middle) - CA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Print Check (Bottom) - CA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

Next, choose whether or not to enable the
`Multi-Pages Check Stub`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox.

Optionally set a `Check Top Margin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Check Left Margin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or `Check
Right Margin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if required.

Tick the `Print Date Label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox
if a date label is required.

Once all check configurations are complete, `Save`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} the settings.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Some of the check formats may require pre-printed paper from a third
party vendor. [Pre-printed checks from
checkdepot.net](https://checkdepot.net/collections/odoo-checks) are
recommended.
::::

::: seealso
`../accounting/payments/pay_checks`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/chile.md ---

# Chile

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Watch the two webinar recordings below for a general presentation of the
localization, and search the playlist for tutorials to discover
practical workflows while using Odoo in Chile.

- [Webinar: intro and demo](https://youtu.be/BHnByZiyYcM).
- [Webinar: delivery guide](https://youtu.be/X7i4PftnEdU).
- [Playlist of
  tutorials](https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PL1-aSABtP6AB6UY7VUFnVgeYOaz33fb4P).
::::

::: seealso
\- [Chilean localization app
tour](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3qYkgbmBYHw) - [Chilean
localization smart
tutorial](https://www.odoo.com/slides/smart-tutorial-localizacion-de-chile-131) -
`Documentation on e-invoicing's legality and compliance in Chile
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/chile>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Modules {#chile/configuration}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to utilize all the features of the Chilean localization.

  Name                                                                         Technical name                      Description
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Chile - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                      [l10n_cl]{.title-ref}               Adds the minimal accounting features required for a company to operate in Chile under the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} regulations and guidelines.
  `Chile - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}              [l10n_cl_reports]{.title-ref}       Adds the *Propuesta F29* and *Balance Tributario (8 columnas)* reports.
  `Chile - E-invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                     [l10n_cl_edi]{.title-ref}           Includes all technical and functional requirements to receive and generate **electronic receipts** and **invoices** online based on the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} regulations.
  `Electronic Exports of Goods for Chile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_cl_edi_exports]{.title-ref}   Includes technical and functional requirements to generate electronic invoices for exporting goods based on the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} and customs regulations.
  `Chile - E-Invoicing Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}      [l10n_cl_edi_stock]{.title-ref}     Includes all technical and functional requirements to generate delivery guides via web service based on the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} regulations.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Odoo automatically installs the appropriate package for the company
according to the country selected at the creation of the database. - The
*Chile - E-Invoicing Delivery Guide* module depends on the *Inventory*
application.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

All features are only available if the company already completed the
[SII Sistema de FacturaciÃ³n de
Mercado](https://www.sii.cl/factura_electronica/factura_mercado/proceso_certificacion.htm)
certification process.
::::

## Company information

Navigate to `Settings --> Companies: Update Info`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and ensure the following company information is
up-to-date and correctly filled in:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  - `Street`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the identification
  number for the selected `Taxpayer Type
  <chile/fiscal-info>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
- `Activity Names`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select up to four
  activity codes.
- `Company Activity Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  enter a short description of the company\'s activity.

## Accounting settings

Next, navigate to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Chilean
Localization`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and follow the
instructions to configure the:

- `Fiscal information <chile/fiscal-info>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
- `Electronic invoice data <chile/electronic-invoice>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `DTE incoming email server <chile/dte-email>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Signature certificates <chile/certificate>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}

### Fiscal information {#chile/fiscal-info}

Configure the following `Tax payer information`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}:

- `Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} by selecting the
  taxpayer type that applies:
  - `VAT Affected (1st Category)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    for invoices that charge taxes to customers
  - `Fees Receipt Issuer (2nd Category)`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}: for suppliers who issue fees receipt (Boleta)
  - `End consumer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: only issues
    receipts
  - `Foreigner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `SII Office`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select your
  company\'s `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} regional office

### Electronic invoice data {#chile/electronic-invoice}

Select your `SII Web Services`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
environment:

- `SII - Test`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: for test databases
  using test `CAFs (Folio
  Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} obtained from the
  `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
  In this mode, the direct connection flows can be tested, with the
  files being sent to the `SII (Servicio
  de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
- `SII - Production`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: for production
  databases.
- `SII - Demo Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: files are
  created and accepted automatically in demo mode but are **not** sent
  to the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}. For this reason, rejection errors or *Accepted with
  Objections* will not appear in this mode. Every internal validation
  can be tested in demo mode. Avoid selecting this option in a
  production database.

Then, enter the `Legal Electronic Invoicing Data`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}:

- `SII Resolution NÂ°`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `SII Resolution Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Required information for electronic invoice.](chile/electronic-invoice-data.png){.align-center}

## DTE incoming email server {#chile/dte-email}

The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} `Email Box Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} can be defined to receive your customers\' claim and
acceptance emails. Enabling this option from
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Chilean Localization`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} is necessary if you want to use *Email Box
Electronic Invoicing* as the `DTE (Documentos Tributarios
ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} incoming email server.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

In order to receive your SII documents, it\'s necessary to set up your
own email server. More information on how to do this can be found in
this documentation:
`../../general/email_communication`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
::::

Begin by clicking `Configure DTE Incoming Email`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, then click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
add a server and fill in the following fields:

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: give the server a name.
- `Server Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the server
  type used.
  - `IMAP Server`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `POP Server`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Local Server`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: uses a local
    script to fetch emails and create new records. The script can be
    found in the `Configuration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    section with this option selected.
  - `Gmail OAuth Authentication`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    requires your Gmail API credentials to be configured in the general
    settings. A direct link to the configuration can be found in the
    `Login
    Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.
- `DTE Server`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enable this option.
  By checking this option, this email account will be used to receive
  the electronic invoices from the suppliers, and communications from
  the `SII
  (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  regarding the electronic invoices issued. In this case, this email
  should match both emails declared on the
  `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  site in the section: *ACTUALIZACION DE DATOS DEL CONTRIBUYENTE*, *Mail
  Contacto SII* and *Mail Contacto Empresas*.

In the `Server & Login`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab (for IMAP
and POP servers):

- `Server Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the hostname
  or IP of the server.
- `Port`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the server port.
- `SSL/TLS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enable this option if
  connections are encrypted using the SSL/TLS protocol.
- `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the server login
  username.
- `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the server login
  password.

![Incoming email server configuration for Chilean DTE.](chile/dte-incoming-email.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Before going live, it is recommended to archive or remove all emails
related to vendor bills that are not required to be processed in Odoo
from your inbox.
::::

### Certificate {#chile/certificate}

A digital certificate in [.pfx]{.title-ref} format is required to
generate the electronic invoice signature. To add one, click
`Configure Signature Certificates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
under the `Signature
Certificates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section. Then, click
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to configure the certificate:

- `Certificate Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: click
  `Upload your file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select the
  [.pfx]{.title-ref} file.
- `Certificate Passkey`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  file\'s passphrase.
- `Subject Serial Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: depending
  on the certificate format, the field might not be automatically
  populated. In that case, enter the certificate\'s legal representative
  `RUT
  (Rol Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
- `Certificate Owner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select one if
  you need to restrict the certificate for a specific user. Leave the
  field empty to share it with all billing users.

![Digital certificate configuration.](chile/new-certificate.png){.align-center}

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

If the `Certificate Owner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
set to a specific user, and there are no certificates shared with users,
then the automatic sending of electronic documents and receipt
acknowledgments is **disabled**.
::::

## Multicurrency

The official currency rate is provided by [Chilean
mindicador.cl](https://mindicador.cl). Navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Currencies: Automatic Currency
Rates`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} to set an
`Interval`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for when the rate is
automatically updated, or to select another `Service`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

## Partner information {#chile/partner-information}

Configuring partner contacts is also required to send
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
electronic invoices. Open the `Contacts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} app to do so and fill in the following fields on a
new or existing contact form.

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Activity Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

In the `Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:

- `DTE Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the sender\'s
  email address for the partner.
- `Delivery Guide Price`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select
  which price the delivery guide displays, if any.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `DTE Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is the email used for
sending electronic documents and must be set in the contact that will be
part of an electronic document.
::::

![Chilean electronic invoice data for partners.](chile/dte-email-electronic-invoice.png){.align-center}

## Document types

Accounting documents are categorized by
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}-defined document types.

Document types are created automatically upon installation of the
localization module, and can be managed by navigating to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Document Types`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![Chilean fiscal document types list.](chile/chilean-document-types.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Several document types are inactive by default but can be activated by
toggling the `Active`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option.
::::

### Use on invoices

The document type on each transaction is determined by:

- The journal related to the invoice, identifying if the journal uses
  documents.
- The condition applied based on the type of issuer and recipient (e.g.,
  the buyer or vendor\'s fiscal regime).

## Journals

*Sales journals* in Odoo usually represent a business unit or location.

::: example
\- Ventas Santiago. - Ventas Valparaiso.
:::

For retail stores it is common to have one journal per
`POS (Point of Sale)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

::: example
\- Cashier 1. - Cashier 2.
:::

The *purchase* transactions can be managed with a single journal, but
sometimes companies use more than one journal in order to handle some
accounting transactions that are not related to vendor bills. This
configuration can easily be set by using the following model.

::: example
\- Tax payments to the government. - Employees payments.
:::

### Create a sales journal

To create a sales journal, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button, and fill in the following required information:

- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select
  `Sale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the drop-down menu for
  customer invoice journals.
- `Point of sale type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: if the sales
  journal will be used for electronic documents, the option
  `Online`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be selected.
  Otherwise, if the journal is used for invoices imported from a
  previous system or if you are using the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos
  Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal *FacturaciÃ³n MiPyme*,
  you can use the option `Manual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Use Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: check this field
  if the journal will use document types. This field is only applicable
  to purchase and sales journals that can be related to the different
  sets of document types available in Chile. By default, all the sales
  journals created will use documents.

Next, from the `Jounal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
define the `Default Income Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and `Dedicated Credit Note Squence`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
in the `Accounting Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section. Configuring these fields is required for one of the debit notes
`use cases <chile/use-cases>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

## CAF {#chile/caf-documentation}

A *folio authorization code* (CAF) is required for each document type
that will be issued electronically. The
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is a
file the `SII (Servicio de
Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} provides to the
issuer with the folios/sequences authorized for the electronic invoice
documents.

Your company can request multiple folios and obtain several
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Codes)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} linked
to different folio ranges. These
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} are
shared within all journals, so you only need one active
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} per
document type, and it will be applied to all journals.

Please refer to the [SII
documentation](https://palena.sii.cl/dte/mn_timbraje.html) to check the
details on how to acquire the
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} files.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The `CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
required by the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos
Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} are different from production
to test (certification mode). Make sure you have the correct
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} set
depending on your environment.
::::

### Upload CAF files

Once the `CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
files have been acquired from the `SII
(Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal,
they need to be uploaded in the database by navigating to
`Accounting --> Configuration: Chilean SII --> CAFs`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} begin the configuration. On the
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} form,
upload your `CAF
(Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} file by
clicking the `Upload your file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button and then click `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Once uploaded, the status changes to `In Use`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. At this moment, when a transaction is used for this
document type, the invoice number takes the first folio in the sequence.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The document types have to be active before uploading the
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} files.
In case some folios have been used in the previous system, the next
valid folio has to be set when the first transaction is created.
::::

## Chart of accounts

The chart of accounts is installed by default as part of the data set
included in the localization module. The accounts are mapped
automatically in:

- Taxes
- Default Account Payable
- Default Account Receivable
- Transfer Accounts
- Conversion Rate

::: seealso
`../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Taxes

As part of the localization module, taxes are created automatically with
their related financial account and configuration. These taxes can be
managed from `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

Chile has several tax types, the most common ones are:

- **VAT**: the regular VAT can have several rates.
- **ILA**: the tax for alcoholic drinks.

::: seealso
`../accounting/taxes`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

## Usage and testing

### Electronic invoice workflow

In the Chilean localization, the electronic invoice workflow includes
customer invoice issuance and vendor bill reception. The following
diagram explains how information is shared to the `SII
(Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
customers, and vendors.

![Diagram with Electronic invoice transactions.](chile/electronic-invoice-workflow.png){.align-center}

### Customer invoice emission

After the partners and journals are created and configured, the invoices
are created in the standard way. For Chile, one of the differences is
the document type that is automatically selected based on the taxpayer.
The document type can be changed manually if needed on the invoice by
navigating to `Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![Customer invoice document type selection.](chile/customer-invoice-document-type.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

`Documents type 33`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} electronic
invoice must have at least one item with tax, otherwise the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
rejects the document validation.
::::

#### Validation and DTE status {#chile/electronic-invoice-validation}

Once all invoice information is filled, either manually or automatically
when generated from a sales order, validate the invoice. After the
invoice is posted:

- The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} file is created automatically and recorded in the
  chatter.

- The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} status is set as `Pending`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} to be sent.

  ![DTE XML File displayed in chatter.](chile/xml-creation.png){.align-center}

The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} status is updated automatically by Odoo with a scheduled
action that runs every day at night, if the response from the
`SII (Servicio de
Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is needed
immediately, you can do it manually as well by following the
`DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} status workflow:

![Transition of DTE status flow.](chile/dte-status-flow.png){.align-center}

1.  The first step is to send the
    `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} to the `SII
    (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
    This can be sent manually by clicking the `Enviar
    Ahora`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. This generates a
    `SII Tack number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
    invoice, which is used to check the details sent by the
    `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} via email. Then, the `DTE status`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} is updated to `Ask for Status`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.

2.  Once the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} response is received, Odoo updates the
    `DTE status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To do it manually,
    click on the button `Verify on SII`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}. The result can either be
    `Accepted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Accepted With Objection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
    `Rejected`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

    ![Identification transaction for invoice and Status update.](chile/dte-status-steps.png){.align-center}

    :::: important
    ::: title
    Important
    :::

    There are intermediate statuses in the
    `SII (Serviciqo de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} before acceptance or rejection. It\'s recommended to
    **NOT** continuously click `Verify in
    SII`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for smooth processing.

    ![Electronic invoice data statuses.](chile/chatter-internal-statuses.png){.align-center}
    ::::

3.  The final response from the
    `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} can take on one of these values:

    - `Accepted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: indicates the
      invoice information is correct, our document is now fiscally valid
      and it\'s automatically sent to the customer.

    - `Accepted with objections`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      indicates the invoice information is correct, but a minor issue
      was identified, nevertheless the document is now fiscally valid
      and it\'s automatically sent to the customer.

    - `Rejected`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: indicates the
      invoice information is incorrect and must be corrected. Details
      are sent to emails you registered in the
      `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
      role="abbr"}. If it is properly configured in Odoo, the details
      are also retrieved in the chatter once the email server is
      processed.

      If the invoice is rejected please follow these steps:

      1.  Change the document to `Draft`{.interpreted-text
          role="guilabel"}.
      2.  Make the required corrections based on the message received
          from the `SII (Servicio
          de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} in the
          chatter.
      3.  Post the invoice again.

      ![Message when an invoice is rejected.](chile/rejected-invoice.png){.align-center}

#### Crossed references

When the invoice is created, as a result of another fiscal document, the
information related to the originator document must be registered in the
`Cross-Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. This tab is
commonly used for credit or debit notes, however, in some cases it can
be used for customer invoices, as well. In the case of the credit and
debit notes, they are set automatically by Odoo.

![Crossed referenced document(s).](chile/cross-reference-tab-registration.png){.align-center}

#### Invoice PDF report {#chile/electronic-invoice-pdf-report}

Once the invoice is accepted and validated by the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
and the PDF is printed, it includes the fiscal elements that indicate
that the document is fiscally valid.

![Fiscal elements and barcode printed in accepted invoices.](chile/accepted-invoice-fiscal-information.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

If you are hosted in Odoo SH or On-Premise, you should manually install
the [pdf417gen](https://pypi.org/project/pdf417gen/) library. Use the
following command to install it:
`pip install pdf417gen`{.interpreted-text role="command"}.
::::

#### Commercial validation

Once the invoice has been sent to the customer:

1.  `DTE Partner Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} changes to
    `Sent`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
2.  The customer must send a reception confirmation email.
3.  Subsequently, if commercial terms and invoice data are correct, an
    acceptance confirmation is sent; otherwise, a claim is sent.
4.  The field `DTE Acceptance Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    is updated automatically.

![Message with the commercial acceptance from the customer.](chile/partner-dte-status.png){.align-center}

#### Processed for claimed invoices

Once the invoice has been accepted by the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
**it can not be cancelled in Odoo**. In case you get a claim for your
customer, the correct way to proceed is with a credit note to either
cancel the invoice or correct it. Please refer to the
`chile/credit-notes`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} section for more
details.

![Invoice Commercial status updated to claimed.](chile/accepted-invoice.png){.align-center}

#### Common errors

There are multiple reasons behind a rejection from the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
but these are some of the common errors you might have and how to solve
them:

- | **Error:** [RECHAZO- DTE Sin Comuna Origen]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** make sure the company address is properly filled including
    the state and city.

- | **Error:** [en Monto - IVA debe declararse]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** the invoice lines should include one VAT tax, make sure
    you add one on each invoice line.

- | **Error:** [Rut No Autorizado a Firmar]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** the `RUT (Rol Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} entered is not allowed to invoice electronically, make
    sure the company `RUT (Rol Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} is correct and is valid in the
    `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} to invoice electronically.

- | **Error:** [Fecha/NÃºmero Resolucion Invalido RECHAZO- CAF Vencido :
    (Firma_DTE\[AAAA-MM-DD\] - CAF\[AAAA-MM-DD\]) &gt; 6
    meses]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** try to add a new CAF related to this document as the one
    you\'re using is expired.

- | **Error:** [Element \'{http://www.sii.cl/SiiDte%7DRutReceptor\':
    This element is not expected. Expected is (
    {http://www.sii.cl/SiiDte%7DRutEnvia ).]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** Make sure the field `Document Type`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} and `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are
    set in the customer and in the main company.

- | **Error:** [Usuario sin permiso de envio.]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** this error indicates that most likely, your company has
    not passed the [Certification
    process](https://www.sii.cl/factura_electronica/factura_mercado/proceso_certificacion.htm)
    in the `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} - Sistema de FacturaciÃ³n de Mercado. If this is the
    case, please contact your Account Manager or Customer Support as
    this certification is not part of the Odoo services, but we can give
    you some alternatives. If you already passed the certification
    process, this error appears when a user different from the owner of
    the certificate is trying to send
    `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} files to the
    `SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"}.

- | **Error:** [CARATULA]{.title-ref}
  | **Hint:** there are just five reasons why this error could show up
    and all of them are related to the *Caratula* section of the XML:

  > - The company\'s `RUT (Rol Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text
  >   role="abbr"} number is incorrect or missing.
  > - The certificate owner
  >   `RUT (Rol Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} number
  >   is incorrect or missing.
  > - The `SII's (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text
  >   role="abbr"} `RUT (Rol Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text
  >   role="abbr"} number (this should be correct by default) is
  >   incorrect or missing.
  > - The resolution date is incorrect or missing.
  > - The resolution number is incorrect or missing.

### Credit notes {#chile/credit-notes}

When a cancellation or correction is needed over a validated invoice, a
credit note must be generated. It is important to consider that a
`CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} file is
required for the credit note, which is identified as
`Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`61`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
Please refer to the `CAF section
<chile/caf-documentation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} for more
information on the process to load the `CAF (Folio
Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} on each document
type.

![Creation of CAF for Credit notes.](chile/credit-note-document-type.png){.align-center}

#### Use cases

##### Cancel referenced document

In case you need to cancel or invalidate an invoice, navigate to
`Accounting -->
Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and
select the desired invoice. Then, use the button `Add Credit
Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select
`Full Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, in this case the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos
Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} reference code is
automatically set to `Anula Documento de referencia`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Credit note cancelling the referenced document.](chile/credit-note-cancel-ref-doc.png){.align-center}

##### Correct referenced document

If a correction in the invoice information is required, for example the
street name on the original invoice is wrong, then use the button
`Add Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, select
`Partial Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select the
option `Only Text Correction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In
this case the `SII Reference
Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is automatically set to
`Corrects Referenced Document Text`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Credit note correcting referenced document text.](chile/credit-note-correct-text.png){.align-center}

Odoo creates a credit note with the corrected text in an invoice and
`Price`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} [0.00]{.title-ref}.

![Credit note with the corrected value on the invoice lines.](chile/text-correction-label.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Make sure to define the `Default Credit Account`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in the sales journal specifically for this use case.
::::

##### Corrects referenced document amount

When a correction on the amounts is required, use the button
`Add Credit note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select
`Partial Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In this case the
`SII Reference Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is automatically
set to `Corrige el monto del Documento de Referencia`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Credit note for partial refund to correct amounts, using the SII reference code 3.](chile/credit-note-correct-amount.png){.align-center}

### Debit notes

In Chilean localization, debit notes, in addition to credit notes, can
be created using the `Add Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button, with two main use cases.

#### Use cases {#chile/use-cases}

##### Add debt on invoices

The primary use case for debit notes is to increase the value of an
existing invoice. To do so, select option
`3. Corrige el monto del Documento de Referencia`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} for the `Reference Code SII`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field.

![Debit note correcting referenced document amount.](chile/debit-note-correct-amount.png){.align-center}

In this case Odoo automatically includes the
`Source Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the `Cross
Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

![Automatic reference to invoice in a debit note.](chile/auto-ref-debit-note.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

You can only add debit notes to an invoice already accepted by the SII.
::::

##### Cancel credit notes

In Chile, debits notes are used to cancel a valid credit note. To do
this, click the `Add
Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button and select the
`1: Anula Documentos de referencia`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
