option for the `Reference Code SII`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field.

![Debit note to cancel the referenced document (credit note).](chile/debit-note-cancel-ref-doc.png){.align-center}

### Vendor bills

As part of the Chilean localization, you can configure your incoming
email server to match the one you have registered in the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} in
order to:

- Automatically receive the vendor bills
  `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} and create the vendor bill based on this information.
- Automatically send the reception acknowledgement to your vendor.
- Accept or claim the document and send this status to your vendor.

#### Reception

As soon as the vendor email with the attached
`DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} is received:

1.  The vendor bill maps all the information included in the XML.
2.  An email is sent to the vendor with the reception acknowledgement.
3.  The `DTE Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set as
    `Acuse de Recibido Enviado`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

#### Acceptation

If all the commercial information is correct on your vendor bill, then
you can accept the document using the
`Aceptar Documento`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. Once this
is done, the `DTE Acceptation
Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} changes to
`Accepted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and an email of acceptance
is sent to the vendor.

![Button for accepting vendor bills.](chile/accept-vendor-bill-btn.png){.align-center}

#### Claim

In case there is a commercial issue or the information is not correct on
your vendor bill, you can claim the document before validating it, using
the `Claim`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. Once this is
done, the `DTE Acceptation Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
changes to `Claim`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and a rejection
email is sent to the vendor.

![Claim button in vendor bills to inform the vendor all the document is commercially
rejected.
:align: center](chile/claim-vendor-bill-btn.png)

If you claim a vendor bill, the status changes from
`Draft`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to `Cancel`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} automatically. Considering this as best practice, all
the claimed documents should be cancelled as they won\'t be valid for
your accounting records.

### Electronic purchase invoice

The *electronic purchase invoice* is a feature included in the
[l10n_cl_edi]{.title-ref} module.

Once all configurations have been made for
`electronic invoices <chile/electronic-invoice>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} (e.g., uploading a valid company certificate, setting up
master data, etc.), the electronic purchase invoices need their own
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. Please
refer to the
`CAF documentation <chile/caf-documentation>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} to check the details on how to acquire the
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} for
electronic purchase invoices.

Electronic purchase invoices are useful when vendors are not obligated
to expedite an electronic vendor bill for your purchase. Still, your
obligations require a document to be sent to the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} as
proof of purchase.

#### Configuration

To generate an electronic purchase invoice from a vendor bill, the bill
must be created in a purchase journal with the *Use Documents* feature
enabled. It is possible to modify an existing purchase journal or create
a new one in the following process.

To modify the existing purchase journal, or create a new purchase
journal, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button, and fill in the following required information:

- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select
  `Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the drop-down menu
  for vendor bill journals.
- `Use Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: check this field
  so the journal can generate electronic documents (in this case the
  electronic purchase invoice).

#### Generate an electronic purchase invoice

To generate this type of document, it is necessary to create a vendor
bill in Odoo. To do so, navigate to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Bills`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

When all of the electronic purchase invoice information is filled,
select the option `(46)
Electronic Purchase Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field:

After the vendor bill is posted:

- The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} file (Electronic Tax Document) is automatically created
  and added to the chatter.
- The `DTE SII Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set as
  `Pending to be sent`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Odoo automatically updates the *DTE Status* every night using a
scheduled action. To get a response from the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
immediately, click the `Send now to
SII`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

### Delivery guide

To install the `Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
module, go to `Apps`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and search
for [Chile (l10n_cl)]{.title-ref}. Then click
`Install`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the module
`Chile - E-Invoicing Delivery
Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`Chile - E-Invoicing Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
has a dependency with `Chile -
FacturaciÃ³n ElectrÃ³nica`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Odoo will
install the dependency automatically when the
`Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} module is installed.
::::

The *Delivery Guide* module includes the ability to send the
`DTE (Documentos Tributarios
ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} to
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
and the stamp in PDF reports for deliveries.

Once all configurations have been made for
`electronic invoices <chile/electronic-invoice>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} (e.g., uploading a valid company certificate, setting up
master data, etc.), delivery guides need their own
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. Please
refer to the `CAF documentation
<chile/caf-documentation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to check the
details on how to acquire the `CAF (Folio
Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} for electronic
Delivery Guides.

Verify the following important information in the
`Price for the Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
configuration:

- `From Sales Order`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: delivery guide
  takes the product price from the sales order and shows it on the
  document.
- `From Product Template`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Odoo takes
  the price configured in the product template and shows it on the
  document.
- `No show price`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: no price is shown
  in the delivery guide.

Electronic delivery guides are used to move stock from one place to
another and they can represent sales, sampling, consignment, internal
transfers, and basically any product move.

#### Delivery guide from a sales process

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

A delivery guide should **not** be longer than one page or contain more
than 60 product lines.
::::

When a sales order is created and confirmed, a delivery order is
generated. After validating the delivery order, the option to create a
delivery guide is activated.

![Create Delivery Guide button on a sales process.](chile/delivery-guide-creation-btn.png){.align-center}

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

When clicking on `Create Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} for the first time, a warning message pops up, stating
the following:

[No se encontrÃ³ una secuencia para la guÃ­a de despacho. Por favor,
establezca el primer nÃºmero dentro del campo nÃºmero para la guÃ­a de
despacho]{.title-ref}

![First Delivery Guide number warning message.](chile/delivery-guide-number-warning.png){.align-center}
::::

This warning message means the user needs to indicate the next sequence
number Odoo has to take to generate the delivery guide (e.g. next
available `CAF (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} number), and only happens the first time a delivery guide
is created in Odoo. After the first document has been correctly
generated, Odoo takes the next available number in the
`CAF (Folio Authorization
Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} file to generate the following
delivery guide.

After the delivery guide is created:

- The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} file (Electronic Tax Document) is automatically created
  and added to the `chatter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- The `DTE SII Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set as
  `Pending to be sent`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Chatter notes of Delivery Guide creation.](chile/chatter-delivery-guide.png){.align-center}

The `DTE Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is automatically
updated by Odoo with a scheduled action that runs every night. To get a
response from the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
immediately, press the `Send now to SII`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

Once the delivery guide is sent, it may then be printed by clicking on
the `Print Delivery
Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

![Printing Delivery Guide PDF.](chile/print-delivery-guide-btn.png){.align-center}

Delivery guide will have fiscal elements that indicate that the document
is fiscally valid when printed (if hosted in *Odoo SH* or on
*On-premise* remember to manually add the `pdf417gen`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} library mentioned in the `Invoice PDF report section
<chile/electronic-invoice-pdf-report>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}).

### Electronic receipt

To install the `Electronic Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
module, go to `Apps`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and search
for [Chile (l10n_cl)]{.title-ref}. Then click
`Install`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the module
`Chile - Electronic
Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`Chile - Electronic Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} has a
dependency with `Chile - FacturaciÃ³n
ElectrÃ³nica`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Odoo will install the
dependency automatically when the `E-invoicing
Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} module is installed.
::::

Once all configurations have been made for
`electronic invoices <chile/electronic-invoice>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} (e.g., uploading a valid company certificate, setting up
master data, etc.), electronic receipts need their own
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. Please
refer to the `CAF documentation
<chile/caf-documentation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to check the
details on how to acquire the `CAFs (Folio
Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} for electronic
receipts.

Electronic receipts are useful when clients do not need an electronic
invoice. By default, there is a partner in the database called
`Anonymous Final Consumer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} with a
generic `RUT (Rol
Ãšnico Tributario)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
[66666666-6]{.title-ref} and taxpayer type of
`Final Consumer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This partner can be
used for electronic receipts or a new record may be created for the same
purpose.

![Electronic Receipt module.](chile/electronic-receipt-customer.png){.align-center}

Although electronic receipts should be used for final consumers with a
generic `RUT (Rol Ãšnico
Tributario)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, it can also be used for
specific partners. After the partners and journals are created and
configured, the electronic receipts are created in the standard way as
electronic invoice, but the type of document
`(39) Electronic Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} should be
selected in the invoice form:

![Document type 39 for Electronic Receipts.](chile/document-type-39.png){.align-center}

#### Validation and DTE status

When all of the electronic receipt information is filled, manually (or
automatically) proceed to validate the receipt from the sales order. By
default, `Electronic Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
selected as the `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
however in order to validate the receipt correctly, make sure to edit
the `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and change to
`Electronic Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

After the receipt is posted:

- The `DTE (Documentos Tributarios ElectrÃ³nicos)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} file (Electronic Tax Document) is created automatically
  and added to the `chatter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- The `DTE SII Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set as
  `Pending to be sent`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Electronic Receipts STE creation status.](chile/electronic-receipt-ste-status.png){.align-center}

The `DTE Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is automatically
updated by Odoo with a scheduled action that runs every day at night. To
get a response from the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
immediately, press the `Send now to SII`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

Please refer to the
`DTE Workflow <chile/electronic-invoice-validation>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for electronic invoices as the workflow for electronic
receipt follows the same process.

### Electronic export of goods

To install the `Electronic Exports of Goods`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} module, go to `Apps`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and search for [Chile (l10n_cl)]{.title-ref}. Then
click `Install`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the module
`Electronic
Exports of Goods for Chile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`Chile - Electronic Exports of Goods for Chile`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} has a dependency with `Chile
- FacturaciÃ³n ElectrÃ³nica`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

Once all configurations have been made for
`electronic invoices <chile/electronic-invoice>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} (e.g., uploading a valid company certificate, setting up
master data, etc.), electronic exports of goods need their own
`CAFs (Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. Please
refer to the `CAF
documentation <chile/caf-documentation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
to check the details on how to acquire the `CAFs
(Folio Authorization Code)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} for
electronic receipts.

Electronic invoices for the export of goods are tax documents that are
used not only for the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
but are also used with customs and contain the information required by
it.

#### Contact configurations

![Taxpayer Type needed for the Electronic Exports of Goods module.](chile/taxpayer-type-export-goods.png){.align-center}

#### Chilean customs

When creating an electronic exports of goods invoice, these new fields
in the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab are required
to comply with Chilean regulations.

![Chilean customs fields.](chile/chilean-custom-fields.png){.align-center}

#### PDF report

Once the invoice is accepted and validated by the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
and the PDF is printed, it includes the fiscal elements that indicate
that the document is fiscally valid and a new section needed for
customs.

![PDF report section for the Electronic Exports of Goods PDF Report.](chile/pdf-report-section.png){.align-center}

### eCommerce electronic invoicing

To install the `Chilean eCommerce`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
module, go to `` Apps, search for the
module by its technical name `l10n_cl_edi_website_sale ``{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and click the `Activate`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

![l10n_cl eCommerce module.](chile/ecommerce-module-chile.png){.align-center}

This module enables the features and configurations to:

- Generate electronic documents from the *eCommerce* application
- Support for required fiscal fields in the *eCommerce* application
- Effectively let the final client decide the electronic document to be
  generated for their purchase

Once all of the configurations are made for the Chilean
`electronic invoice
<chile/electronic-invoice>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} flow, the
following configurations are required for the eCommerce flow to be
integrated.

To configure your website to generate electronic documents during the
sale process, go to
`Website --> Configuration --> Settings --> Invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and activate the
`Automatic Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} feature.
Activating this feature allows electronic documents to be automatically
generated when an online payment is confirmed.

![Invoice Policy and Automatic Invoice configurations.](chile/website-configurations-ecommerce-chile.png){.align-center}

Since an online payment needs to be confirmed for the *automatic
invoice* feature to generate the document, a payment provider must be
configured for the related website.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Review the `../payment_providers`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
documentation for information on which payment providers are supported
in Odoo, and how to configure them.
::::

It is also recommended to configure your products so they are able to be
invoiced when an online payment is confirmed. To do so, go to
`Website --> eCommerce --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and select the product template of the desired
product. Then, set the `Invoicing Policy`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to `Ordered quantities`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Invoice Policy configuration in Products.](chile/ordered-quantities-product.png){.align-center}

#### Invoicing flows

Clients from Chile will be able to select if they need an **invoice** or
a **ballot** for their purchase with an extra step added during the
checkout process.

![Option for EDI Documents for clients.](chile/select-edi-docs-ecommerce.png){.align-center}

If the customer selects the `Electronic Invoice`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} option, fiscal fields are required to be filled out,
including the `Activity Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
the `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and their
`DTE Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Fiscal fields required for an Invoice to be requested.](chile/fiscal-fields-invoice-ecommerce.png){.align-center}

If the client selects the `Electronic Receipts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} option, they will be directed to the next step, and the
electronic document will be generated for the *Consumidor Final AnÃ³nimo*
contact.

Clients from countries other than Chile, will have their electronic
receipts automatically generated for them by Odoo.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If a purchase through eCommerce requires an export, the customer will
need to contact your company to generate an electronic export invoice
(*document type 110*), which can be done from the *Accounting* app.
::::

### Point of Sale electronic invoicing

To install the `Chilean Module for Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, go to the `Apps`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} application on the main Odoo dashboard, search for
the module by its technical name [l10n_cl_edi_pos]{.title-ref}, and
click the `Activate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

![l10n_cl POS EDI module.](chile/pos-edi-module-chile.png){.align-center}

This module enables the following features and configurations to:

- Generate electronic documents from the *Point of Sale* application
- Support the required fiscal fields for contacts created in the *Point
  of Sale* application
- Effectively lets the final client decide the type of electronic
  document to be generated for their purchase
- Print QR or 5-digit codes in tickets to access to electronic invoices

To configure contacts with the required fiscal information, review the
`partner information
<chile/partner-information>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} section, or
directly modify a contact. Navigate to
`Point of Sale --> Session --> Customers --> Details`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and edit any of the following fields:

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Identification Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Tax Payer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Type Giro`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `DTE Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `RUT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Contact with fiscal information created from POS.](chile/fiscal-required-pos-session.png){.align-center}

To configure the products, navigate to
`Point of Sale --> Products --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and select a product record. In the
`Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of the product form, it
is necessary to mark the product as
`Available for POS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, this makes the
product available for sale in the *Point of Sale* app.

![Product with fiscal information created from POS.](chile/available-in-pos-product.png){.align-center}

Optionally, the following features are available for configuration in
the `Point of
Sale --> Configuration --> Settings --> Bills & Receipts section`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}:

- `Use QR code on ticket`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this
  feature enables a QR code to be printed on the user\'s receipt so they
  can easily request an invoice after their purchase
- `Generate a code on ticket`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this
  feature enables a 5-digit code to be generated on the receipt,
  allowing the user to request an invoice through the customer portal

![Configuration to generate QR or 5 digit codes on tickets.](chile/qr-code-ticket.png){.align-center}

#### Invoicing flows

The following sections cover the invoicing flows for the *Point of Sale*
application.

##### Electronic receipts: anonymous end user

When making a purchase as an anonymous user that does not request an
electronic invoice, Odoo automatically selects
`Consumidor Final AnÃ³nimo`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the
contact for the order and generates the electronic receipt.

![Automatic contact selection of an anonymous end consumer.](chile/invoice-receipt-selection.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If the client requests a credit note due to a return of their purchase,
the credit note should be made using the *Accounting* app. See the
`credit notes and refunds
<../accounting/customer_invoices/credit_notes>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} documentation for detailed instructions.
::::

##### Electronic receipts: specific customer

When specific user makes a purchase that does not request an electronic
invoice, Odoo automatically selects the contact for the order as the
`Consumidor Final AnÃ³nimo`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
allows you to select or create the required customer contact with their
fiscal information for the receipt.

![Selection of contact for the receipt.](chile/contact-for-electronic-invoice.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If the client requests a credit note because of a return of this type of
purchase, the credit note and return process can be managed directly
from the `POS (Point of Sale)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} session.
::::

##### Electronic invoices

When clients request an electronic invoice, it is possible to select or
create the required contact with their fiscal information. When the
payment is being made, select the option `Invoice`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to generate the document.

![Selection of invoice option at payment.](chile/invoice-option-at-payment.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

For both the electronic receipts and invoices, if the product is not
affected by taxes, Odoo detects this and generates the correct type of
document for tax-exempt sales.
::::

##### Returns

For electronic receipts (not generated for the *Consumidor Final
AnÃ³nimo*) and electronic invoices, it is possible to manage the process
to return products sold in a `POS (Point of Sale)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} order by selecting the `Refund`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

![Refund option in the POS application.](chile/refund-order.png){.align-center}

Orders can be searched by the order status or by contact, and be
selected for the refund to be based on the client\'s original order.

![Selection of order for the refund process.](chile/select-order-refund.png){.align-center}

When the return payment is validated, Odoo generates the necessary
credit note, referencing the original receipt or invoice, partially or
fully cancelling the document.

::: seealso
[Smart tutorial - Electronic invoicing for point of
sale](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B2XuWmtlmno&t=360s).
:::

## Financial reports

### Balance tributario de 8 columnas

This report presents the accounts in detail (with their respective
balances), classifying them according to their origin and determining
the level of profit or loss that the business had within the evaluated
period of time.

You can find this report in
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Balance Sheet`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and selecting in the `Report`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field the option `Chilean Fiscal Balance (8 Columns)
(CL)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Location of the Reporte Balance Tributario de 8 Columnas.](chile/locate-fiscal-balance-report.png){.align-center}

![Chilean Fiscal Balance (8 Columns).](chile/8-col-fiscal-balance-report.png){.align-center}

### Propuesta F29

The form *F29* is a new system that the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
enabled to taxpayers, and that replaces the *Purchase and Sales Books*.
This report is integrated by Purchase Register (CR) and the Sales
Register (RV). Its purpose is to support the transactions related to
VAT, improving its control and declaration.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The *Propuesta F29 (CL)* report in Odoo covers the basic legal
requirements as a first proposal for your final tax declaration.
::::

This record is supplied by the electronic tax documents (DTE\'s) that
have been received by the
`SII (Servicio de Impuestos Internos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

You can find this report in
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Reports`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and selecting the `Report`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} option `Propuesta F29 (CL)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Location of the Propuesta F29 (CL) Report.](chile/locate-propuesta-f29-report.png){.align-center}

It is possible to set the
`PPM (Provisional Monthly Payments rate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
and the `Proportional Factor for the fiscal year`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} from the `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

![Default PPM and Proportional Factor for the Propuesta F29 Report.](chile/f29-report.png){.align-center}

Or manually in the reports by clicking on the
`âœï¸ (pencil)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon.

![Manual PPM for the Propuesta F29 Report.](chile/manual-ppm-f29-report.png){.align-center}

# Colombia

Odoo\'s Colombian localization package provides accounting, fiscal, and
legal features for databases in Colombia - such as chart of accounts,
taxes, and electronic invoicing. The localization has the following
[prerequisites](https://micrositios.dian.gov.co/sistema-de-facturacion-electronica/que-requieres-para-factura-electronicamente/)
when using the [DIAN Own
Software](https://micrositios.dian.gov.co/sistema-de-facturacion-electronica/como-puedes-facturar-electronicamente/)
solution with Odoo:

- Be registered in the
  [RUT](https://www.dian.gov.co/tramitesservicios/tramites-y-servicios/tributarios/Paginas/RUT.aspx)
  (Registro Ãšnico Tributario) with a valid
  `NIT (El NÃºmero de IdentificaciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}.
- Have a valid digital signature certificate [approved by the
  ONAC](https://onac.org.co/directorio-de-acreditados/).
- [Register and get
  enabled](https://micrositios.dian.gov.co/sistema-de-facturacion-electronica/proceso-de-registro-y-habilitacion-como-facturador-electronico/)
  by completing the certification process required by the
  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}.

::: seealso
\- For more information on how to complete the certification process for
the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} module, review the following
[webinar](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l0G6iDc7NQA) - [Smart
Tutorial - Colombian
Localization](https://www.odoo.com/slides/smart-tutorial-localizacion-de-colombia-132) -
`Documentation on e-invoicing's legality and compliance in Colombia
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/colombia>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Configuration {#localization/colombia/configuration}

### Modules installation {#localization/colombia/modules}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Colombian localization:

  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name                                                                  Technical name                  Description
  --------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Colombia - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}            [l10n_co]{.title-ref}           Default
                                                                                                        `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text
                                                                                                        role="ref"}. This module adds the base accounting features for the Colombian
                                                                                                        localization: chart of accounts, taxes, withholdings, and identification document
                                                                                                        type.

  `Electronic invoicing for Colombia with DIAN`{.interpreted-text       [l10n_co_dian]{.title-ref}      This module includes the features required for integration with the
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                      `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
                                                                                                        role="abbr"} as its own software, and adds the ability to generate electronic
                                                                                                        invoices and support documents based on
                                                                                                        `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
                                                                                                        role="abbr"} regulations.

  `Colombian - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_co_reports]{.title-ref}   This module includes accounting reports for sending certifications to suppliers
                                                                                                        for withholdings applied.

  `Electronic invoicing for Colombia with Carvajal`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_co_edi]{.title-ref}       This module includes the features required for integration with Carvajal. Adds
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                      the ability to generate the electronic invoices and support documents, based on
                                                                                                        `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
                                                                                                        role="abbr"} regulations.

  `Colombian - Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}        [l10n_co_pos]{.title-ref}       This module includes **Point of Sale** receipts for Colombian localization.
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Company information {#localization/colombia/configuration/company}

To configure your company information:

1.  Access your company\'s contact form:
    - Go to the `Contacts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} app and
      search for your company or;
    - Go to the `Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} app,
      activate the `developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"}, and in the `Companies`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"} section, click `Update Info`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}. Then, in the `Contact`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"} field, click on the company name.
2.  Configure the following information:
    - `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    - `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Including
      `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
      `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
      `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code.
    - `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
      the `Identification Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
      (`NIT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
      `CÃ©dula de CiudadanÃ­a`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
      `Registro Civil`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, etc.). When
      the `Identification Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
      `NIT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the
      `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
      **must** have the *verification digit* at the end of the ID
      prefixed by a hyphen ([-]{.title-ref}).
3.  Go to the `Sales & Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab
    and configure the `Fiscal Information`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}:
    - `Obligaciones y Responsabilidades`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}: Select the fiscal responsibility for the
      company. (`O-13`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} Gran
      Contribuyente, `O-15`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
      Autorretenedor, `O-23`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} Agente
      de retenciÃ³n IVA, `O-47`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
      Regimen de tributaciÃ³n simple, `R-99-PN`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"} No Aplica).
    - `Gran Contribuyente`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the
      company is *Gran Contribuyente*, enable this option.
    - `Fiscal Regimen`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
      Tribute Name for the company (`IVA`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}, `INC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
      `IVA e INC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
      `No Aplica`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"})
    - `Commercial Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the
      company uses a specific commercial name and it needs to be
      displayed in the invoice.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The data configured in the `Fiscal Information`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section is printed in the valid fiscal PDF reports.
::::

### Electronic invoicing credentials and `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} environment {#localization/colombia/einvoice-configuration}

To configure the user credentials to be used to connect with the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}\'s web service and the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} environment, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and scroll to the
`Colombian Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section. Then, follow these steps:

1.  Select `DIAN: Free Service`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as
    the `Electronic Invoicing Provider`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
2.  Configure the `Operation Modes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    for the respective types of documents (*electronic invoices* or
    *support documents*) to be generated from Odoo. Click
    `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then fill in the
    fields:
    - `Software Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the type of
      document to be generated with the operation mode.
    - `Software ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the ID generated
      by
      `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
      role="abbr"} for the specific operation mode.
    - `Software PIN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the PIN
      selected in the operation mode configuration in the
      `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
      role="abbr"} portal.
    - `Testing ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the testing ID
      generated by
      `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
      role="abbr"} and obtained after testing the operation mode.
3.  Configure the available `Certificates`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} to sign the electronic documents. Click
    `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then fill in the
    fields:
    - `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the name of the
      certificate.

    - `Certificate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: upload the
      certificate file in PEM format. In the `Private
      Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field that appears on the
      screen, select an existing private key or create a new one. To do
      so, enter a key name and select
      `Create and edit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, in the
      `Create
      Private Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} wizard, upload a
      valid `Key file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and click
      `Save & Close`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

      ![Colombian electronic invoicing credentials configured.](colombia/dian-credentials-configuration.png)
4.  Configure the
    `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} environment; the
    `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} electronic invoicing module offers four different
    `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} environments to connect with:
    - **DIAN demo mode**: This environment allows to test electronic
      invoicing workflows using a demo digital certificate. Files are
      created and accepted automatically and are not sent to any
      `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
      role="abbr"} environment. Every internal validation can be tested.
      To activate it, tick the `DIAN Demo Mode`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"} checkbox.

      :::: note
      ::: title
      Note
      :::

      The `DIAN Demo Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox
      is hidden from view when the `Test
      environment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox is
      enabled.
      ::::

    - **Certification environment**: This environment is useful to pass
      the
      `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
      role="abbr"} certification process and obtain the *Enabled* status
      to invoice from Odoo. To activate it, enable both the
      `Test environment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the
      `Activate the certification process`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"} checkboxes.

    - **Testing environment**: This environment allows reproducing
      electronic invoicing flows and validations in the
      `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
      role="abbr"} testing portal. To activate it, enable only the `Test
      Environment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox.

    - **Production environment**: This environment allows generating
      valid electronic documents. To activate it, disable both the
      `Test environment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the
      `Activate the
      certification process`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
      checkboxes.

      :::: important
      ::: title
      Important
      :::

      Do not activate `DIAN Demo Mode`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"} on a production database. This mode is intended
      for use in test environments only.
      ::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In a multi-company database, each company can have its own certificate.
::::

::: seealso
For electronic invoicing configurations using the Carvajal solution,
review the following video: [ConfiguraciÃ³n de FacturaciÃ³n ElectrÃ³nica -
LocalizaciÃ³n de
Colombia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bzweMwTEbfY&list=PL1-aSABtP6ABxZshems3snMjx7bj_7ZsZ&index=3).
:::

### Master data {#localization/colombia/master-data}

#### Contacts {#localization/colombia/contacts}

Configure the following fields on the
`contact form <../../essentials/contacts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}:

- `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (VAT):
  Select the identification number type and enter the identification
  number. If the identification number type is `NIT`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, the identification number must include the
  verification digit at the end, prefixed by a hyphen ([-]{.title-ref}).
- `Fiscal Information fields <localization/colombia/configuration/company>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} in the `Sales & Purchase`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} tab.

#### Products {#localization/colombia/products}

Access the product\'s form via
`Accounting --> Customers --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and ensure that either the
`UNSPSC Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field (found in the
`Accounting tab`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) or the
`Internal Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field (in the
`General Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab) is
configured.

#### Taxes {#localization/colombia/taxes}

To create or modify taxes, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select the related tax.

If sales transactions include products with taxes, configure the
`Value Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field in the
`Advanced Options`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Retention tax
types (`ICA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `IVA`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Fuente`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) are also
included. This configuration is used to display taxes correctly on the
invoice.

![Specific tax configurations per DIAN regulations.](colombia/dian-taxes-configuration.png)

#### Sales journals {#localization/colombia/co-journals}

Once the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} has assigned the official sequence and prefix for the
electronic invoice resolution, the sales journals related to the
invoices **must** be updated in Odoo. To do so, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and select an existing sales journal or create a
new one with the `Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

On the sales journal form, enter the `Journal Name`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then set
a unique `Short Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Journals Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Then,
configure the following data in the
`Advanced Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:

- `Electronic invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enable UBL
  2.1 (Colombia).
- `Invoicing Resolution`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: resolution
  number issued by
  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} to the company via their test set.
- `Resolution Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: initial
  effective date of the resolution.
- `Resolution End Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: end date of
  the resolution\'s validity.
- `Range of Numbering (minimum)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  first authorized invoice number.
- `Range of Numbering (maximum)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  last authorized invoice number.
- `Technical Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: control key
  received from the
  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} portal test set or from their web service in case of the
  production environment.

When the database is configured for the `production environment
<localization/colombia/einvoice-configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, instead of configuring these fields manually, click the
`Reload DIAN configuration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to
obtain the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} resolution information from the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} web service.

![Reload DIAN configuration button in sale journals.](colombia/reload-dian-configuration-button.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

\- The short code and resolution of the journal **must** match the ones
received in the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} portal test set or from the MUISCA portal. - The
`invoice sequence and prefix <localization/colombia/invoice-creation>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} **must** be correctly configured when the first invoice is
created. Odoo automatically assigns a prefix and sequence to the
following invoices.
::::

#### Purchase journals {#localization/colombia/purchase-journals}

Once the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} has assigned the official sequence and prefix for the
*support document* related to vendor bills, the purchase journals
related to their supporting documents need to be updated in Odoo. The
process is similar to the configuration of the `sales journals
<localization/colombia/co-journals>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

::: seealso
For more information on support document journals using the Carvajal
solution, review the [Documento Soporte - LocalizaciÃ³n de Colombia
video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UmYsFcD7xzE&list=PL1-aSABtP6ABxZshems3snMjx7bj_7ZsZ&index=8).
:::

#### Chart of accounts {#localization/colombia/chart-of-accounts}

The
`chart of accounts </applications/finance/accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is installed by default as part of the localization module.
The accounts are mapped automatically in taxes, default account payable,
and default account receivable. The chart of accounts for Colombia is
based on the PUC (Plan Unico de Cuentas).

### Multicurrency {#localization/colombia/workflows}

The official exchange rate for Colombia is provided by the [Banco de la
RepÃºblica](https://suameca.banrep.gov.co/estadisticas-economicas/).

To enable automatic exchange rate updates, follow these steps:

1.  Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}.
2.  Navigate to the `Currencies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    section and enable `Automatic Currency Rates`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
3.  Ensure that `[CO] Bank of the Republic`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} is selected as the `Service`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
4.  Select an `Interval`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for how
    frequently the currency rate should be automatically updated.

## Main workflows

### Electronic invoices {#localization/colombia/electronic-invoices}

The following is a breakdown of the main workflow for electronic
invoices with the Colombian localization:

1.  The user creates an invoice.
2.  Odoo generates the legal XML file.
3.  Odoo generates the CUFE (Invoice Electronic Code) with the
    electronic signature.
4.  Odoo sends a notification to DIAN.
5.  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} validates the invoice.
6.  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} accepts or rejects the invoice.
7.  Odoo generates the PDF invoice with a QR code.
8.  Odoo compresses the attached document (containing the sent XML file
    and the DIAN validation response) and the fiscal valid PDF into a
    `.zip`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file.
9.  The user sends the invoice (`.zip`{.interpreted-text role="file"}
    file) via Odoo to the acquirer.

#### Invoice creation {#localization/colombia/invoice-creation}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The functional workflow taking place before an invoice validation does
**not** alter the main changes introduced with the electronic invoice.
::::

Electronic invoices are generated and sent to both the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} and the customer. These documents can be created from the
sales order or manually generated. To create a new invoice, go to
`Accounting --> Costumers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select `Create`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. On the invoice form, configure the following fields:

- `Customer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: customer\'s
  information.
- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: journal used for
  electronic invoices.
- `Electronic Invoice Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  the type of document. By default, `Factura
  de Venta`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected.
- `Invoice Lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Specify the
  products with the correct taxes.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

When creating the first invoice related to an electronic invoicing
journal, it is required to manually change the *sequence* of the invoice
to the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} format: [Prefix + Sequence]{.title-ref}.

For example, format the sequence from [SETP/2024/00001]{.title-ref} to
[SETP1]{.title-ref}.
::::

When done, click `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

#### Electronic invoice sending {#localization/colombia/send-electronic-invoice}

After the
`invoice confirmation <localization/colombia/invoice-creation>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, click `Print & Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In
the wizard that appears, make sure to enable the
`DIAN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and `Email`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} checkboxes to send an XML to the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} web service and the validated invoice to the client fiscal
email and click `Print & Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then:

- The XML document is created.
- The CUFE is generated.
- The XML is processed synchronously by the
  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}.
- If accepted, the file is displayed in the chatter and the email to the
  client with the corresponding `.zip`{.interpreted-text role="file"}
  file.

![EDI documents available in the chatter.](colombia/zip-xml-chatter-colombia.png)

The `DIAN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab then displays the
following:

- `Signed Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: timestamp recorded
  of the XML creation.
- `Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Status result obtained in
  the
  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} response. If the invoice was rejected, the error messages
  can be seen here.
- `Testing Environment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: To know if
  the document sent was delivered to the
  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} testing environment.
- `Certification Process`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: To know if
  the document was sent as part of the certification process with the
  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}.
- `Download`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: To download the sent
  XML file, even if the
  `DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} result was rejected.
- `Fetch Attached Document`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: To
  download the generated attached document file included in the
  delivered `.zip`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file to the client.

![EDI document record available in DIAN tab.](colombia/dian-tab-electronic-document.png)

### Credit notes {#localization/colombia/credit-notes}

The process for credit notes is the same as for invoices. To create a
credit note with reference to an invoice, go to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. On the invoice, click
`Add Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and complete the
following information:

- `Credit Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the type of
  credit method.
  - `Partial Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Use this option
    when it is a partial amount.
  - `Full Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Use this option if
    the credit note is for the full amount.
  - `Full refund and new draft invoice`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}: Use this option if the credit note is
    auto-validated and reconciled with the invoice. The original invoice
    is duplicated as a new draft.
- `Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the reason for the
  credit note.
- `Reversal Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select if you want
  a specific date for the credit note or if it is the journal entry
  date.
- `Use Specific Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  journal for your credit note or leave it empty if you want to use the
  same journal as the original invoice.
- `Refund Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If you chose a
  specific date, select the date for the refund.

Once reviewed, click the `Reverse`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button.

### Debit notes {#localization/colombia/debit-notes}

The process for debit notes is similar to credit notes. To create a
debit note with reference to an invoice, go to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. On the invoice, click the
`Add Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and enter
the following information:

- `Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Type the reason for the
  debit note.
- `Debit note date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  specific options.
- `Copy lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select this option if
  you need to register a debit note with the same lines of invoice.
- `Use Specific Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  printer point for your debit note, or leave it empty if you want to
  use the same journal as the original invoice.

When done, click `Create Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

### Support document for vendor bills {#localization/colombia/support-document}

With master data, credentials, and the purchase journal configured for
support documents related to vendor bills, you can start using *support
documents*.

Support documents for vendor bills can be created from your purchase
order or manually. Go to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Bills`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and fill in the following data:

- `Vendor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the vendor\'s
  information.
- `Bill Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the date of the
  bill.
- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the journal for
  support documents related to the vendor bills.
- `Invoiced Lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Specify the
  products with the correct taxes.

Once reviewed, click the `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button. Upon confirmation, an XML file is created and automatically sent
to Carvajal.

### Common errors {#localization/colombia/common-errors}

During the XML validation, the most common errors are related to missing
`master data
<localization/colombia/master-data>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. In
such cases, a validation error message is displayed and sending is
blocked.

If the invoice was sent and set as *Rejected* by the
`DIAN (DirecciÃ³n de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, the error messages are visible by clicking the
`fa-info-circle`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(info circle)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon next to the
`Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field in the
`DIAN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Using the reported error
codes, it is possible to review solutions to apply before re-sending.

![Example of error messages on rejected invoices.](colombia/rejected-invoice-error-message.png)

After the master data or other issues are corrected, it is possible to
reprocess the XML again. Do so by following the
`electronic invoice sending <localization/colombia/send-electronic-invoice>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} flow.

## Financial reports {#localization/colombia/reports}

This report is a certification to vendors for withholdings made for the

![Certificado de RetenciÃ³n en IVA report in Odoo Accounting.](colombia/retencion-iva-dian.png)

### Certificado de RetenciÃ³n en la Fuente {#localization/colombia/certificado-fuente}

Click the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(gear)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon to display options to
`Download Excel`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and

![Certificado de RetenciÃ³n en Fuente report in Odoo Accounting.](colombia/retencion-fuente-dian.png)

# Denmark

## Compliance with Danish bookkeeping requirements: data retention and integrity

This page outlines how Odoo complies with the Danish Bookkeeping Act,
specifically regarding the storage and integrity of financial
transactions and receipts. Odoo recognizes the importance of adhering to
Danish regulations and has implemented robust measures to ensure
clients\' data is secure and compliant.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo's registration as a digital bookkeeping system has been confirmed
by the Danish Business Authority under registration numbers
[fob585505]{.title-ref} and [fob441967]{.title-ref}. Customers must meet
certain conditions to benefit from it, as outlined below.
::::

### Key requirements of the Danish Bookkeeping Act

The Danish Bookkeeping Act (DBA) outlines the [requirements for digital
bookkeping
systems](https://danishbusinessauthority.dk/requirements-digital-bookkeeping-systems):

- **Retain transactional data and receipts:** Store all recorded
  transactions and receipts covered by Â§ 3 for a minimum of five years
  from the end of the financial year to which they pertain.
- **Ensure data integrity:** Prevent the customer from changing,
  backdating, or deleting recorded transactions.
- **Maintain data accessibility:** Store all recorded transactions in a
  structured and machine-readable format for the required five-year
  period, regardless of customer relationship status, bankruptcy, or
  dissolution.
- **Provide decryption capabilities:** Ensure that encrypted bookkeeping
  data and receipts can be decrypted into a structured and readable
  format.

### Odoo Compliance

Odoo\'s registration as digital standard bookkeeping systems with the
Danish Business Authority confirms that Odoo meets the applicable
criteria for digital bookkeeping systems in Denmark, in accordance with
the requirements of the `DBA (Danish Bookkeeping Act)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

However, to benefit from all the required guarantees for digital
bookkeeping systems in Denmark, customers must meet a few conditions.

#### Conditions for full DBA compliance

- The customer uses Odoo Accounting on the Odoo SaaS platform (Odoo
  Online);
- The customer has an active Odoo subscription (e.g., Standard or Custom
  Plan), or their database is managed by an officially registered [Odoo
  Accounting Firm](https://www.odoo.com/accounting-firms);
- The customer refrains from customizations or actions intended to
  undermine the system's immutability, traceability, or security
  controls.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Customers using Odoo products outside these conditions are responsible
for ensuring their own compliance with the DBA.
::::

When the above conditions are met, the requirements of the DBA are
fulfilled through features and processes described in the following
sections.

### Immutable transaction records

- Once transactions are recorded, they cannot be deleted through the
  user interface.
- All modifications are logged, providing a complete audit trail.
- While historically dated entries can be made, Odoo records the
  creation date and time of the entry.

### Secure document storage

- Receipts and digital vouchers are stored as attachments and integrated
  into the database, ensuring they are included in backups.
- Posted documents cannot be deleted.
- We fully support the storage of mandatory digital vouchers as defined
  by Danish regulations.

### Continuous data availability

- Clients with active subscriptions can access all transactions and
  digital vouchers through Odoo.
- Regardless of customer relations, bankruptcy, or dissolution, Odoo can
  provide access to transaction and digital voucher details to former
  clients for six years (see
  `localizations/denmark/data-lifecycle`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}).

### Automated data export and secure storage

- Odoo Accounting implements no automatic deletion or archival of
  recorded transactions, so if a customer has been recording
  transactions for six years, the six years of history are preserved in
  the Odoo Accounting database.
- As described in the [Odoo Cloud Hosting
  SLA](https://www.odoo.com/cloud-sla) and [Odoo Privacy
  Policy](https://www.odoo.com/privacy), the Odoo Cloud relies on
  immutable daily snapshot backups, which cannot be individually altered
  or deleted, even at the customer\'s request, ensuring their integrity.
- All documents and receipts stored in a database backup are available
  as a standard ZIP archive accompanying the SQL dump.

### Data lifecycle management {#localizations/denmark/data-lifecycle}

- Odoo database backups are available in standard SQL dump formats at
  all times and include all recorded transactions.
- The [Odoo Cloud Hosting SLA](https://www.odoo.com/cloud-sla)
  guarantees three months of backup history to all active customers. As
  a special guarantee for Danish customers subject to the DBA and
  meeting the conditions highlighted above the last Odoo Cloud backup
  retention gets increased to six years as soon as they decide to
  terminate their Odoo Cloud subscription, in order to comply with the
  requirements of Annex 1, 4 of Executive Order 97.

### Decryption

Odoo Accounting customer data on the Odoo Cloud is always stored in
encrypted form (encryption at rest at storage level). When backups are
retrieved, they are automatically decrypted and provided in decrypted
form in standard formats for the user: SQL dumps + ZIP archive of all
attached documents (file store).

# Ecuador

With the Ecuadorian localization, electronic documents can be generated
using XML, fiscal folio, electronic signature, and direct connection to
tax authority SRI.

The supported documents are invoices, credit notes, debit notes,
purchase liquidations, and withholdings.

The localization also includes automation to easily predict the
withholding tax to be applied to each purchase invoice.

::: seealso
\- [App Tour - LocalizaciÃ³n de
Ecuador](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BQOXVSDeeK8) - [Smart
Tutorial - LocalizaciÃ³n de
Ecuador](https://www.odoo.com/slides/smart-tutorial-localizacion-de-ecuador-170) -
`Documentation on e-invoicing's legality and compliance in Ecuador
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/ecuador>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- **SRI**: *Servicio de Rentas Internas*, the government organization
that enforces the payment of taxes in Ecuador. - **SRI certificate**:
Document or digital credential issued by the *SRI* that is crucial for
compliance with Ecuadorian tax laws. - **EDI**: *Electronic Data
Interchange*, which refers to the electronic transmission of
documents. - **RIMPE**: *Regimen Simplificado para Emprendedores y
Negocios*, the type of taxpayer qualified for SRI.
::::
