## Localization overview {#localizations/ecuador/specifics}

The Ecuadorian localization package ensures compliance with Ecuadorian
fiscal and accounting regulations. It includes tools for managing taxes,
fiscal positions, reporting, and a predefined chart of accounts tailored
to Ecuador\'s standards.

The Ecuadorian localization package provides the following key features
to ensure compliance with local fiscal and accounting regulations:

- `../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}: a predefined structure aligned with the latest standards
  of Ecuador's *Superintendency of Companies*, organized into multiple
  categories and fully compatible with NIIF accounting
- `Products <localizations/ecuador/products>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Taxes <localizations/ecuador/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  pre-configured tax rates, including standard VAT, zero-rated, and
  exempt options
- `../accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}:
  automated tax adjustments based on customer or supplier registration
  status
- `Document types <localizations/ecuador/document types>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: classification of transactions like *customer invoices*
  and *vendor bills* using government-defined document types set by the
  SRI (Ecuador's tax authority)
- `Company and contacts <localizations/ecuador/company-contact>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Electronic documents <localizations/ecuador/electronic-documents>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `VAT withholding <localizations/ecuador/vat-withholding>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Printer points <localizations/ecuador/printer-points>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Withholding <localizations/ecuador/withholding>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Reporting <localizations/ecuador/reporting>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}

### Products {#localizations/ecuador/products}

If products have any
`withholding taxes <../accounting/taxes/retention>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, they must be configured on the product form. To do so, go
to `Accounting --> Vendors -->
Products`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. On the
`General Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, specify
both `Purchase Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Profit Withhold`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

### Taxes {#localizations/ecuador/taxes}

To manage taxes, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Depending on the tax type, the following options
may be required for additional configuration:

- `Tax Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Follows a specific
  format depending on the tax type:
  - | **For IVA (Value-Added Tax)**:
    | [IVA \[percent\] (104, \[form code\] \[tax support code\] \[tax
      support short name\])]{.title-ref}
    | Example: [IVA 12% (104, RUC \[tax support code\] IVA)]{.title-ref}

  - | **For Income Tax Withholding codes**:
    | [Code ATS \[percent of withhold\] \[withhold name\]]{.title-ref}
    | Example: [Code ATS 10% RetenciÃ³n a la Fuente]{.title-ref}
- `Tax Support`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Configure only for
  the IVA tax. This option is used to register purchase withholdings.
- `Code ATS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Configure only for
  income tax withholding codes, as it is necessary to register a
  withholding.

In the `Definition`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:

- `Tax Grids`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Configure the code of
  a 104 form if it is an IVA tax, and the code of a 103 form if it is an
  income tax withholding code.

::: seealso
`Configuring taxes <../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Document types {#localizations/ecuador/document types}

To access or configure document types, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Document Types`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Each document
type can have a unique sequence per journal where it is assigned. As
part of the localization, the document type includes the country where
the document is applicable; also, the data is created automatically when
the localization module is installed. The information required for the
document types is included by default and doesn\'t need to be changed.

### Company and contact {#localizations/ecuador/company-contact}

::: seealso
`Configure a company or individual contact <../../essentials/contacts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

The following fields should be completed for localization purposes on
the contact form:

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the company or
  individual\'s name.
- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The
  `Street`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} sub-field is required to
  confirm electronic invoices.
- `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: For a
  company, enter the `Ruc`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. For
  individuals, enter the `CÃ©dula`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `Passport`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} number.
- `SRI Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  contact\'s SRI taxpayer type.
- `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the company or
  individual\'s phone number.
- `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the company or
  individual\'s email. This email is used to send electronic documents,
  such as invoices.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `SRI Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} indicated on
the contact form determines which `VAT and
profit withholding <localizations/ecuador/vat-withholding>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} taxes apply when using this contact on a vendor bill.
::::

### Electronic documents {#localizations/ecuador/electronic-documents}

To upload information for electronic documents, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration
--> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and scroll to the
`Ecuadorian Localization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

Configure the following information, starting with the
`Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:

- `Company legal name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select whether the
  company is in the `Regular Regime (without
  additional messages in the RIDE)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  or is qualified as in the `RIMPE Regime`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
- `Special Taxpayer Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the
  company is qualified as a special taxpayer, complete this field with
  the company\'s corresponding tax contributor number.
- `Forced to Keep Accounting Books`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  Enable this option if needed.

`Withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:

- `Consumables`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the code of
  the default withholding tax used when purchasing goods.
- `Services`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the code of the
  default withholding tax used when purchasing services.
- `Credit Card`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the code of
  the default withholding tax used when purchasing with credit cards.
- `Withhold Agent Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  company\'s withholding agent resolution number, if applicable.

`SRI Connection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:

- `Certificate file for SRI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  the company\'s `SRI certificate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  Click `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `SRI Certificates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to upload one,
  if necessary.
- `Use production servers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enable
  this option if electronic documents are used in the production
  environment; leave it disabled if the testing environment is used
  instead.

`Withholding accounts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:

- `Sales Tax Base Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  company\'s sales tax base account.
- `Purchase Tax Base Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter
  the company\'s sales tax purchase account.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

When using the testing environment, EDI data is sent to test servers.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- The values entered in the `Consumables`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Services`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
withholding fields are used as default values for domestic **only when**
no withholdings are set up on the *SRI Taxpayer Type*. - The entered
`Credit Card`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} withholding value is
always applied when a credit or debit card SRI payment method is used.
::::

### VAT withholding {#localizations/ecuador/vat-withholding}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

This configuration applies only if the SRI recognizes the company as a
withholding agent. If not, skip this step.
::::

To configure a VAT withholding, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxpayer Type
SRI`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Then, configure the
`Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the taxpayer type, the
`Goods VAT
Withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the
`Services VAT Withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If the `Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
`Rimpe`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, configure the
`Profit Withhold`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} percentage.
::::

### Printer points {#localizations/ecuador/printer-points}

*Printer points* need to be configured for each type of electronic
document used, such as customer invoices, credit notes, and debit notes.

To configure printer points, navigate to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Journals`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. For each electronic
document, click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and enter the
following information on the journal form:

- `Journal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter in this
  format: [\[Emission Entity\]-\[Emission Point\] \[Document
  Type\]]{.title-ref}, e.g., [001-001 Sales Documents]{.title-ref}.
- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Refers to the journal type;
  select `Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Once the `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected, complete
the following fields:

- `Use Documents?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enable this
  option if legal invoicing (invoices, debit/credit notes) is used, as
  this is the standard configuration. If not, select the option to
  record accounting entries unrelated to legal invoicing documents, such
  as receipts, tax payments, or journal entries.
- `Emission Entity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  facility number.
- `Emission Point`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the printer
  point.
- `Emission address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  address of the facility.

In the `Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, under
the `Accounting information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
fill in the following fields:

- `Default Income Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  default income account.
- `Dedicated Credit Note Sequence`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  Enable this option if *credit notes* should be generated from this
  printer point (i.e., the journal).
- `Dedicated Debit Note Sequence`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  Enable this option if *debit notes* should be generated from this
  printer point (i.e., the journal).
- `Short Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a unique
  5-digit code for the accounting entry sequence (e.g., VT001).

Customer invoices, credit notes, and debit notes must use the same
journal as the `Emission Point`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
whereas the `Entity Point`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} should be
unique per journal.

Finally, in the `Advanced Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
tab, check the `Electronic invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
checkbox to enable sending XML/EDI invoices.

::: seealso
`../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Withholding {#localizations/ecuador/withholding}

To define a *withholding journal*, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. For each withholding journal, click
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and enter the following
information:

- `Journal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter this format:
  [\[Emission Entity\]-\[Emission Point\] \[Document
  Type\]]{.title-ref}, e.g.,\`001-001 Withholding\`.
- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Refers to the journal type.
  Select `Miscellaneous`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Withhold Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  `Purchase Withhold`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Once the `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Withhold Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are selected,
complete the following fields:

- `Emission Entity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  facility number.
- `Emission Point`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the printer
  point.
- `Emission address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  address of the facility.

In the `Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, under
the `Accounting information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
fill in the following fields:

- `Default Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Configure the
  default income account.
- `Short Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a unique
  5-digit code for the accounting entry sequence (e.g.,
  [WT001]{.title-ref}).

Finally, in the `Advanced Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
tab, check the `Electronic invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
checkbox to enable sending XML/EDI invoices.

### Reporting {#localizations/ecuador/reporting}

Ecuadorian companies submit fiscal reports to the SRI, with Odoo
supporting two main ones: **reports 103** and **104**.

To get these reports, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Return`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click the `fa-book`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `Report:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon and
select [103 (EC)]{.title-ref} or [104 (EC)]{.title-ref}.

#### Report 103 {#localizations/ecuador/report-103}

This report details income tax withholdings in a given period and can be
reported monthly or semi-annually. It includes information about base,
tax amounts, and tax codes and can be used for SRI reporting.

#### Report 104 {#localizations/ecuador/report-104}

This report details VAT tax and VAT withholding for a given period and
can be generated monthly or semi-annually. It includes information about
base, tax amounts, and tax codes and can be used for SRI reporting.

#### ATS report {#localizations/ecuador/ats}

To enable downloading the ATS
`ATS (Anexo Transaccional Simplificado)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
report in XML format,
`install </applications/general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} the *ATS Report* ([l10n_ec_reports_ats]{.title-ref}) module.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The Ecuadorian *ATS Report* module depends on the previous installation
of the *Accounting* app and the *Ecuadorian EDI module*.
::::

##### Configuration {#localizations/ecuador/ats-configuration}

To issue electronic documents, ensure the company is configured as
explained in the
`electronic invoice <localizations/ecuador/company-contact>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} section. In the `ATS (Anexo
Transaccional Simplificado)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, every
document generated in Odoo, such as `invoices
<localizations/ecuador/customer-invoice>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
`vendor bills <localizations/ecuador/vendor-bill>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"},
`sales <localizations/ecuador/customer-withholdings>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and `purchases withholdings
<localizations/ecuador/purchase-withholding>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `credit notes
<localizations/ecuador/credit-notes>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, and
`debit notes <localizations/ecuador/debit-notes>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, is included.

###### Vendor bills {#localizations/ecuador/ats-vendor-bills}

When generating a
`vendor bill <localizations/ecuador/vendor-bill>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, register the authorization number from the vendor\'s
invoice. To do so, go to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Bills`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and select the bill. Then, enter the number from
the vendor\'s invoice in the `Authorization Number`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field.

###### Credit and debit notes {#localizations/ecuador/ats-credit-debit-notes}

When creating a
`credit <localizations/ecuador/credit-notes>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} or `debit
<localizations/ecuador/debit-notes>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} note
manually or through an import, link it to the sales invoice it modifies.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Some information is required to the documents before downloading the
`ATS (Anexo
Transaccional Simplificado)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} file. For
example, add the *Authorization Number* and the *SRI Payment Method* to
documents when needed.
::::

##### XML generation {#localizations/ecuador/ats-xml-generation}

To generate the
`ATS (Anexo Transaccional Simplificado)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
report, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Return`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Choose a period for the desired `ATS
(Anexo Transaccional Simplificado)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
report, then click `ATS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then,
upload the downloaded XML file to *DIMM Formularios*.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When downloading the
`ATS (Anexo Transaccional Simplificado)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
report, Odoo generates a warning pop-up alerting the user if a
document(s) has missing or incorrect data. Nevertheless, the XML file
can still be downloaded.
::::

## Accounting {#localizations/ecuador/accounting}

### Sales documents {#localizations/ecuador/sales-documents}

#### Customer invoice {#localizations/ecuador/customer-invoice}

Customer invoices, electronic documents
`created from sales orders or manually
<../accounting/customer_invoices/overview>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, must contain the following data and, once validated, are
sent to the SRI:

- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the option
  matching the customer invoice\'s printer point.
- `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Type the document
  type in this format: [(01) Invoice]{.title-ref}.
- `Payment Method (SRI)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select how
  the invoice will be paid.

#### Customer credit note {#localizations/ecuador/credit-notes}

`Customer credit notes <../accounting/customer_invoices/credit_notes>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} are electronic documents sent to the SRI once validated.
`Credit notes
<accounting/credit_notes/issue-credit-note>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} can only be registered from a validated (posted) invoice.

Keep the `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on
`(04) Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Credit note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window.

Filling out a credit note follows the same process as completing an
`invoice
<accounting/invoice/creation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When creating the first credit note, select `Reverse`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and assign the first credit note number or, by default,
Odoo assigns [NotCr 001-001-000000001]{.title-ref} as the first credit
note number.
::::

#### Customer debit note {#localizations/ecuador/debit-notes}

`Customer debit notes <accounting/credit_notes/issue-debit-note>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} are electronic documents sent to the SRI once validated.
They can only be registered from a validated (posted) invoice.

In the `Use Specific Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the
`Create Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, select
the printer point for the credit note or leave it empty to use the same
journal as the original invoice.

#### Customer withholding {#localizations/ecuador/customer-withholdings}

`Customer withholdings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are
non-electronic documents issued by the client to apply a withholding to
a sale. They can only be registered from a validated (posted) invoice.

On the invoice, click `Add Withhold`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and complete the following information in the
`Customer withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window:

- `Document Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  withholding number.
- `Withhold Lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the taxes
  that the customer is withholding.

Before validating the withholding, review that the amounts for each tax
are the same as the original document.

### Purchase documents {#localizations/ecuador/purchase-documents}

#### Vendor bill {#localizations/ecuador/vendor-bill}

`Vendor bills <../accounting/vendor_bills>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, non-electronic documents created from purchase orders or
manually, require a specific `vendor bill journal
<localizations/ecuador/vendor-bills-journal>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

##### Vendor bills journal {#localizations/ecuador/vendor-bills-journal}

Use the following configuration to set up the vendor bills journal:

- Select `Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the
  `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- **Do not** tick the `Purchase Liquidations`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} checkbox.
- Add a `Default Expense Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

To configure a vendor bill, make sure also to complete the following
Ecuador-specific fields:

- `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter this
  document type: [(01) Invoice]{.title-ref}.
- `Document number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  document number.
- `Payment Method (SRI)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select how
  to pay the vendor bill.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

When creating the purchase withholding, verify that the bases (base
amounts) are correct. If the amount of the tax in the
`Vendor bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} needs to be edited,
click `Edit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Or, from the
`Journal Items`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, click
`Edit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and set the adjustment as
desired.
::::

#### Purchase liquidation {#localizations/ecuador/purchase-liquidation}

*Purchase liquidations* are electronic documents sent to the SRI once
they\'re validated. Companies issue them when they make a purchase, but
the vendor does not provide an invoice due to one or more of the
following reasons:

- Non-residents of Ecuador provided services.
- Foreign companies provided services without residency or facility in
  Ecuador.
- Purchase of goods or services from natural persons not registered with
  a RUC, who cannot issue sales receipts or customer invoices.
- Reimbursement for purchasing goods or services must be given to
  employees in a dependency relationship (full-time employee).
- Members of collegiate bodies have provided services in the exercise of
  their function.

In these cases, a `purchase liquidation journal
<localizations/ecuador/purchase-liquidation-journal>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} must be created.

##### Create a purchase liquidation journal {#localizations/ecuador/purchase-liquidation-journal}

To create a *purchase liquidations* journal, enter the following
information:

- `Journal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter this format:
  [\[Emission Entity\]-\[Emission Point\] \[Document
  Type\]]{.title-ref}, e.g., [001-001 Purchase
  Liquidations]{.title-ref}.
- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Refers to the journal type.
  Select `Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Once the `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected, complete
the following fields:

- `Purchase Liquidations`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Tick this
  checkbox to enable purchase liquidations.
- `Use Documents?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enable this
  option if legal invoicing (invoices, debit/credit notes) is used, as
  this is the standard configuration. If not, select the option to
  record accounting entries unrelated to legal invoicing documents, such
  as receipts, tax payments, or journal entries.
- `Emission Entity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  facility number.
- `Emission Point`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the printer
  point.
- `Emission address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  address of the facility.
- `Short Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a unique
  5-digit code for the accounting entry sequence (e.g.,
  [PT001]{.title-ref}).

Finally, in the `Advanced Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
tab, check the `Electronic invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
checkbox to enable sending XML/EDI invoices.

##### Create a purchase liquidation {#localizations/ecuador/purchase-liquidation-creation}

Purchase liquidations, created from *purchase orders* or manually from
*vendor bills*, must contain the following data:

- `Vendor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the vendor\'s
  information.
- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  `Purchase Liquidation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} journal with
  the correct printer point.
- `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter this
  document type: [(03) Purchase Liquidation]{.title-ref}.
- `Document number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  document number (sequence). This must only be entered once, and the
  sequence will automatically be assigned to the subsequent documents.
- `Payment Method (SRI)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select how
  to pay the invoice.
- `Products`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Specify the product
  with the correct taxes.

Then, validate the `Purchase Liquidation`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

#### Purchase withholding {#localizations/ecuador/purchase-withholding}

*Purchase withholdings* are electronic documents sent to the SRI once
they\'re validated. They can only be registered from a validated
(posted) invoice.

On the invoice, click `Add Withhold`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and complete the following fields in the `Withhold`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} window:

- `Document number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  document number (sequence). This must only be entered once, and the
  sequence will automatically be assigned for the next documents.
- `Withhold lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The taxes appear
  automatically according to the configuration of products and vendors.
  Review if the taxes and tax support are correct. If not, edit and
  select the correct taxes and tax support.

Then, validate the `Withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Tax support types must be configured on the
`Vendor Bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To do so, go to the
tax applied on the `Vendor Bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
change the `Tax Support`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} there.
::::

A withholding tax can be divided into two or more lines, depending on
whether two or more withholding percentages apply.

::: example
Odoo suggests a VAT withholding of 30% with tax support 01. VAT
withholding of 70% can be added to a new line with the same tax support.
Odoo allows it if the base total matches the
`Vendor Bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}\'s total.
:::

### Expense reimbursement {#localizations/ecuador/expense reimbursement}

Expense reimbursements apply to the following cases:

- `Individual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: reimbursement to an
  employee for miscellaneous expenses (e.g., purchase liquidations)
- `Legal Entity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: reimbursement for
  incurred expenses, such as representation expenses (e.g., hiring a
  lawyer)

To enable expense reimbursement, make sure a
`purchase liquidation journal
<localizations/ecuador/purchase-liquidation>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} has been created for an individual or a `vendor
bills journal <localizations/ecuador/vendor-bill>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for a legal entity.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In the vendor bills journal, be sure the following necessary
configurations are set for a legal entity:

- Select `Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the
  `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- **Do not** tick the `Purchase Liquidations`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} checkbox.
- Add a `Default Expense Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

Next, to create a reimbursement,
`create a vendor bill <localizations/ecuador/vendor-bill>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} using the *purchase liquidation* or *vendor bills* journal.
On the vendor bill, configure the following fields:

- `Vendor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This field should be an
  employee.
- `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Verify that this
  field is accurately populated from the journal.
- `Payment Method (SRI)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select a
  payment method.
- `Reimbursement Lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab: Click
  `Auto Fill Invoice Lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
  automatically populate the invoice lines or add the expenses line by
  line, and provide the following details for each expense:
  - `Partner or authorization number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Document Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Tax Base`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

Then, click `Confirm Vendor Bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Process Now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The XML and
authorization number for the purchase liquidation are recorded, and the
purchase withholding created from this vendor bill includes the
reimbursement information.

![Expense Reimbursement.](ecuador/l10n-ec-individual-flow.png)

### Electronic delivery guide {#localizations/ecuador/electronic-delivery-guide}

An *Electronic Delivery Guide* in Ecuador is a legal document that
supports the transportation of goods or merchandise from one place to
another within the national territory. It is issued by the sender of the
goods and aims to record and justify the movement of products to avoid
legal or tax issues. It is a fiscal requirement mandated by the
*Internal Revenue Service (SRI)*.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Make sure to
`install </applications/general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} the `Ecuadorian
Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
([l10n_ec_edi_stock]{.title-ref}) module.
::::

#### Transporter {#localizations/ecuador/transporter}

To create a new carrier (transporter), first
`create a new contact <../../essentials/contacts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} and fill out the contact information as a
`Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Make sure the following
fields are complete:

- `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  `RUC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and type the carrier\'s RUC
  number.
- `SRI Taxpayer Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  `Companies - Legal Entities`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the
  partner position in the tax pyramid to automate the computation of VAT
  withholdings.

![Configuration of a carrier contact.](ecuador/l10n-ec-carrier-contact.png)

#### Certificate file for SRI {#localizations/ecuador/certificate-file}

To upload the certificate file for SRI, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, scroll to the
`Ecuadorian Localization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
and click `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`SRI Certificates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`SRI Connection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section. Then, to
create a new certificate, click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and fill out the following fields:

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The title of the
  certificate.
- `Certificate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Use the
  `Upload your file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to upload
  the SRI certificate.
- `Certificate Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Include the
  password to decrypt the PKS file if required.

Once the certificate is created, click `Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to go back to the settings and ensure the certificate
is selected in the `Certificate file for SRI`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field and the `Use
production servers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox is
ticked.

#### Warehouse configuration {#localizations/ecuador/warehouse configuration}

To configure a warehouse, first `create a new warehouse
<../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/warehouses_storage/inventory_management/warehouses>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. Enter the following data for each warehouse that generates
an electronic delivery guide:

- `Entity Point`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the emission entity
  number given by the SRI
- `Emission Point`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the emission
  point number given by the SRI
- `Next Delivery Guide Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the
  forwarding tracking number (editable after first saving the
  warehouse).

#### Generate an electronic delivery guide {#localizations/ecuador/generate-electronic-delivery}

Once the
`delivery <../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/shipping_receiving/setup_configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} from inventory is created during the sales workflow, make
sure the following fields are complete in the
`Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section on the
`Additional info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:

- `Transporter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  `contact <localizations/ecuador/transporter>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} created.
- `Plate Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the vehicle
  plate number.
- `Transfer Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: By default,
  `Goods dispatch`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set; modify as
  needed.
- `Start date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Automatically set to
  the creation date (editable).
- `End date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Automatically set to 15
  days after the start date (editable).

![Delivery Guide Settings.](ecuador/l10n-ec-delivery-guide-settings.png)

Click `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then
`Generate Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
Subsequently, the following information will be available in the
`Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:

- `Authorization date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: date on which
  the government authorizes the document.
- `Authorization number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: EDI
  authorization number (same as access key).
- `Delivery Guide Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: status of
  the delivery guide.

![Authorization number.](ecuador/l10n-ec-authorization-number.png)

To receive the XML and PDF, an email can be sent to the contact used in
the `Delivery
Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field - this is an optional
and manual step; the `Send Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button needs to be clicked.

![Delivery Guide PDF.](ecuador/l10n-ec-delivery-guide-pdf.png)

## eCommerce {#localizations/ecuador/ecommerce}

The `ATS Report module <localizations/ecuador/ats>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} enables the following:

- Choose the *SRI Payment Method* for each payment method\'s
  configuration.
- Customers can manually input their identification type and number
  during eCommerce checkout.
- Automatically generate a valid electronic invoice for Ecuador at the
  end of the checkout process.

::: seealso
`eCommerce documentation <../../websites/ecommerce>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Online payments {#localizations/ecuador/online-payments}

To enable online payments, add the relevant
`payment provider(s) <../payment_providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} and configure the necessary
`payment methods <payment_providers/payment_methods>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. It is mandatory to set the
`SRI Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for each method.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Adding the `SRI Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
necessary to correctly generate the electronic invoice from an eCommerce
sale. Select a **payment method** to access its configuration menu and
field.
::::

### Automatic invoice {#localizations/ecuador/automatic-invoice}

`Invoices <ecommerce/handling/invoices>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
can be generated after the checkout process.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The invoice\'s email template can be modified from the
`Invoice Email Template`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field under
the `Automatic Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The sales journal used for invoicing is the first in the priority
sequence in the `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} menu.
::::

### Identification type and number {#localizations/ecuador/ecommerce-workflow}

During the checkout process, the client making a purchase will have the
option to indicate their identification type and number. This
information is required to generate the electronic invoice after the
checkout is completed correctly.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Verification is done to ensure the
`Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
completed and has the correct number of digits. For RUC identification,
13 digits are required, and for CÃ©dula, 9 digits are required.
::::

After finishing the checkout process, a confirmed invoice is generated,
ready to be sent manually or asynchronously to the SRI.

## Point of sale electronic invoicing {#localizations/ecuador/point-of-sale}

Make sure the *Ecuadorian module for Point of Sale*
([l10n_ec_edi_pos]{.title-ref}) is `installed
<localizations/ecuador/module-installation>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} to enable the following features and configurations:

- Choose the SRI payment method in each payment method configuration.
- Manually input the customer\'s identification type and number when
  creating a new contact on *POS*.
- Automatically generate a valid electronic invoice for Ecuador at the
  end of the checkout process.

### Payment method configuration {#localizations/ecuador/payment-method-configuration}

To
`create a payment method for a point of sale <../../sales/point_of_sale/payment_methods>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, go to
`Point of Sale --> Configuration --> Payment Methods`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, set the
`SRI Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the payment
method form.

### Invoicing flows {#localizations/ecuador/invoicing-flow}

#### Identification type and number {#localizations/ecuador/identification-type-number}

The P0S cashier can
`create a new contact for a customer <pos/customers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} who requests an invoice from an open POS session.

The *Ecuadorian Module for Point of Sale* adds two new fields to the
contact creation form: `Identification Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

As the identification number length differs depending on the
identification type, Odoo automatically checks the
`Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field when saving the
contact form. To manually ensure the length is correct, know that the
`RUC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Citizenship`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} types require 13 and 10
digits, respectively.
::::

#### Electronic invoice: anonymous end consumer {#localizations/ecuador/anonymous-end-consumer}

When clients do not request an electronic invoice for their purchase,
Odoo automatically sets the customer as
`Consumidor Final`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and generates an
electronic invoice anyway.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If the client requests a credit note due to a return of this type of
purchase, the credit note should be made using the client\'s real
contact information. Credit notes cannot be created for *Consumidor
Final* and can be managed
`directly from the POS session <pos/refund>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.
::::

#### Electronic invoice: specific customer {#localizations/ecuador/specific-customer}

If a customer requests an invoice for their purchase, it is possible to
select or create a contact with their fiscal information. This ensures
the invoice is generated with accurate customer details.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If the client requests a credit note due to a return of this type of
purchase, the credit note and return process can be managed
`directly from the POS session <pos/refund>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.
::::

# Egypt

## Installation {#egypt/installation}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Egyptian localization:

  Name                                                                  Technical name      Description
  --------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Egypt - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}               `l10n_eg`           Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Egyptian E-invoice Integration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   `l10n_eg_edi_eta`   `Egyptian Tax Authority (ETA) e-invoicing integration <egypt/e-invoicing>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}

## Egyptian e-invoicing {#egypt/e-invoicing}

Odoo is compliant with the **Egyptian Tax Authority (ETA) e-invoicing**
requirements.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Egyptian e-invoicing is available from Odoo 15.0. If needed, `upgrade
</administration/upgrade>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} your database.
::::

::: seealso
\- [Video: Egypt
E-invoicing](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NXuBPLR4pVw) -
`/administration/upgrade`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Register Odoo on your ETA portal {#egypt/e-invoicing-eta-portal}

You must register your Odoo ERP system on your ETA portal to get your
API credentials. You need these codes to
`configure your Odoo Accounting app <egypt/e-invoicing-configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Access your company profile on the ETA portal by clicking on
`View Taxpayer Profile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Clicking on \"View Taxpayer Profile\" on an ETA invoicing portal](egypt/taxpayer-profile.png){.align-center}

Next, go to the `Representatives`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section and then click on `Register ERP`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Fill out the `ERP Name`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} (e.g., `Odoo`) and leave the other fields empty.

![Filling out of the form to register an ERP system on the ETA portal.](egypt/add-erp-system.png){.align-center}

Once successfully registered, the website displays your API credentials:

- Client ID
- Client Secret 1
- Client Secret 2

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- ETA should give you a username and a password to access their online
portal. - Ask ETA to provide you with preproduction portal access as
well. - These codes are confidential and should be stored safely.
::::

### Configuration on Odoo {#egypt/e-invoicing-configuration}

To connect your Odoo database to your ETA portal account, go to
`Accounting -->
Configuration --> Settings --> ETA E-Invoicing Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and set the `ETA Client ID`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `ETA Secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
that you retrieved when you `registered Odoo on your ETA portal
<egypt/e-invoicing-eta-portal>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. Set an
invoicing threshold if needed.

![Configuration of the ETA E-Invoicing credentials in Odoo Accounting](egypt/eta-api-integration.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

\- **Test on your preproduction portal** before starting to issue real
invoices on the production ETA portal. - **Credentials** for
preproduction and production environments are different. Make sure to
update them on Odoo when you move from one environment to another. - If
not done yet, fill out your company details with your company\'s full
address, country, and Tax ID.
::::

#### ETA codes {#egypt/e-invoicing-eta-codes}

E-invoicing works with a set of codes provided by the ETA. You can use
the [ETA documentation](https://sdk.preprod.invoicing.eta.gov.eg/codes/)
to code your business attributes.

Most of these codes are handled automatically by Odoo, provided that
your `branches
<egypt/e-invoicing-branches>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
`customers <egypt/e-invoicing-customers>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
and `products
<egypt/e-invoicing-products>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} are
correctly configured.

- Company Information:
  - Company Tax ID

  - | Branch ID
    | If you have only one branch, use `0` as the branch code.

  - Activity type Code
- Other Information:
  - | Product Codes
    | Your company\'s products should be coded and matched with their
      **GS1** or **EGS** codes.

  - | Tax Codes
    | Most of the taxes codes are already configured on Odoo in the
      `ETA Code (Egypt)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. We
      advise you to make sure these codes match your company\'s taxes.

::: seealso
\- [Egyptian eInvoicing & eReceipt SDK - Code
Tables](https://sdk.preprod.invoicing.eta.gov.eg/codes/) -
`../accounting/taxes`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

#### Branches {#egypt/e-invoicing-branches}

Create a contact and a journal for each branch of your company and
configure its ETA settings.

To do so, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, then click on `Create`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

Name the journal according to your company\'s branch and set the
`Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as `Sales`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Next, open the `Advanced Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} tab and fill out the
`Egyptian ETA settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:

- In the `Branch`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, select the
  branch\'s contact or create it.
- Set the `ETA Activity Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- Set the `ETA Branch ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (use `0` if
  you have one branch only).

![Sales journal configuration of an Egyptian company\'s branch](egypt/branch-journal.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The contact selected in the `Branch`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field must be set as a `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
(**not** as an `Individual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}), and the
`Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields must be filled out.
::::

#### Customers {#egypt/e-invoicing-customers}

Make sure your customers\' contact forms are correctly filled out so
your e-invoices are valid:

- contact type: `Individual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: or
  `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
- `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
- `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Tax ID or Company
  registry for companies. National ID for individuals.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can edit your customers\' contact forms by going to
`Accounting --> Customers
--> Customers`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
::::

#### Products {#egypt/e-invoicing-products}

Make sure your products are correctly configured so your e-invoices are
valid:

- `Product Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: storable products,
  consumables, or services.
- `Unit of Measure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: if you also use
  Odoo Inventory and have enabled `Units of
  Measure <../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/product_management/configure/uom>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}.
- `Barcode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: **GS1** or **EGS**
  barcode
- `ETA Item code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (under the
  `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} tab): if the
  barcode doesn\'t match your ETA item code.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can edit your products by going to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.
::::

### USB authentication {#egypt/e-invoicing-usb-authentication}

Each person who needs to electronically sign invoices needs a specific
USB key to authenticate and send invoices to the ETA portal through an
ERP.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can contact the `ETA (Egyptian Tax Authority)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} or [Egypt Trust](https://www.egypttrust.com/) to get these
USB keys.
::::

#### Install Odoo as a local proxy on your computer {#egypt/e-invoicing-local-proxy}

An Odoo local server works as a bridge between your computer and your
Odoo database hosted online.

Download the Odoo Community installer from the page
<https://www.odoo.com/page/download> and start the installation on your
computer.

Select `Odoo IoT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the type of
install.

![Selection of \"Odoo IoT\" during the installation of Odoo Community.](egypt/install-odoo-local-proxy.png){.align-center}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

This installation of Odoo only works as a server and does not install
any Odoo apps on your computer.
::::

Once the installation is complete, the installer displays your **access
token** for the Odoo Local Proxy. Copy the token and save it in a safe
place for later use.

::: seealso
\- [Odoo: Download Odoo](https://www.odoo.com/page/download) -
`../../../administration/on_premise`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

#### Configure the USB key {#egypt/e-invoicing-usb-configuration}

Once the local proxy server is installed on your computer, you can link
it with your Odoo database.

1.  Go to
    `Accounting --> Configurations --> Thumb Drive`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and click on `Create`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
2.  Input a `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} name, the
    `ETA USB Pin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} given to you by
    your USB key provider, and the `Access Token`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} provided at the end of the `local proxy
    installation <egypt/e-invoicing-local-proxy>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}, then click on `Save`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
3.  Click on `Get certificate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Creating a new thumb drive for the e-invoicing of an egyptian company.](egypt/thumb-drive.png){.align-center}

## Localization overview {#localizations/france/loc-overview}

The French localization package ensures compliance with French fiscal
and accounting regulations. It includes tools for managing taxes, fiscal
positions, reporting, and a predefined chart of accounts tailored to
France's standards.

The French localization package provides the following key features to
ensure compliance with local fiscal and accounting regulations:

- `../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}: a predefined structure tailored to French accounting
  standards
- `../accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}:
  automated tax adjustments based on customer or supplier registration
  status
- `Taxes <../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}:
  pre-configured tax rates, including standard VAT, zero-rated, and
  exempt options
- `Payroll </applications/hr/payroll>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
- `Reporting <localizations/france/reporting>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}

### Reporting {#localizations/france/reporting}

`Installing </applications/general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} the `France - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
([l10n_fr_account]{.title-ref}) module gives access to some accounting
reports specific to France, such as:

- `Bilan comptable (FR)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  (`Balance Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"})
- `Compte de rÃ©sultats (FR)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  (`Profit and Loss`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"})
- `Rapport de taxes (FR)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  (`Tax Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"})

## Accounting {#localizations/france/accounting}

### E-Invoicing {#localizations/france/e-invoicing}

The [Chorus Pro](https://portail.chorus-pro.gouv.fr/aife_csm) portal,
managed by the AIFE (Agence pour l\'Informatique financiÃ¨re de l\'Ã‰tat),
is the official platform for submitting electronic invoices to French
public entities. It allows businesses to send and manage invoices, track
their processing status, and access payment updates. Since January 2020,
electronic invoicing has been mandatory for all business-to-government
(B2G) transactions in France. Odoo supports integration with Chorus Pro
to submit invoices generated in Odoo.

#### Configuration {#localizations/france/e-invoicing-configuration}

To send invoices to Chorus Pro, the following configuration is required:

1.  `Install </applications/general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text
    role="doc"} the `France - Factur-X integration
    with Chorus Pro`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    ([l10n_fr_facturx_chorus_pro]{.title-ref}) module.
2.  `Register <accounting/e-invoicing/peppol-registration>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} with Peppol, as invoices are sent from Odoo to Chorus
    Pro via the
    `Peppol <accounting/e-invoicing/peppol>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} network.
3.  If you don't already have a Chorus Pro account, go to the [Chorus
    Pro](https://portail.chorus-pro.gouv.fr/aife_csm) page, click
    `CrÃ©er un compte`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and create
    one.
4.  `Configure the relevant customers' contact form
    <localizations/france/e-invoicing-contacts>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.

::: seealso
[Chorus Pro
documentation](https://portail.chorus-pro.gouv.fr/aife_documentation)
:::

##### Customers {#localizations/france/e-invoicing-contacts}

To submit invoices to Chorus Pro, configure the relevant customers\'
contact form as follows:

1.  Verify the `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields are filled out.
2.  In the `Sales & Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
    ensure the `SIRET`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
    completed.
3.  In the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, fill in
    the following fields in the `Customer
    Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:
    - `eInvoice format`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
      `BIS Billing 3.0`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    - Make sure `France SIRET`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
      selected in the next field, then type
      [11000201100044]{.title-ref}, the reference used by Chorus Pro.

#### Sending invoices to Chorus Pro {#localizations/france/e-invoicing-invoices}

To send invoices to Chorus Pro, follow these steps:

1.  Go to `Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and open or create the invoice.
2.  In the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, make
    sure the following fields are filled in the
    `Chorus Pro`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:
    - `Buyer Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      `Service ExÃ©cutant`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in Chorus
      Pro
    - `Contract Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      `NumÃ©ro de MarchÃ©`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in Chorus
      Pro
    - `Purchase Order Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      `Engagement Juridique`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in
      Chorus Pro
3.  Confirm the invoice.
4.  Click `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and, in the
    `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, enable
    `By Peppol`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
5.  Click `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Once the invoice is sent, the Peppol status of the invoice is updated to
`Done`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

::: seealso
`Peppol <accounting/e-invoicing/peppol>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
:::

### FEC - Fichier des Ã‰critures Comptables {#localizations/france/fec}

An FEC `Fichier des Ã‰critures Comptables`{.interpreted-text role="dfn"}
audit file contains all the accounting data and entries recorded in all
the accounting journals for a financial year. The entries in the file
must be arranged in chronological order. Since January 2014, every
French company is required to produce and transmit this file upon
request by the tax authorities for audit purposes.

#### FEC Import {#localizations/france/fec-import}

`Install </applications/general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} the `France - FEC Import`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
([l10n_fr_fec_import]{.title-ref}) module to import FEC files from other
software.

To enable this feature, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. In the `Accounting Import`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, click `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `Import`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Import FEC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, in the
`FEC Import`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, upload the FEC
file and click `Import`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Importing FEC files from different years requires no particular actions
or computations. However, if multiple files contain RAN
`Reports Ã  Nouveaux`{.interpreted-text role="dfn"} with the starting
balance for the year, these entries are automatically marked as
unnecessary in Odoo and may need to be deleted.
::::

##### File formats {#localizations/france/fec-file-formats}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- FEC files must be in CSV format, as XML format is not supported. -
The FEC CSV file is a plain text file structured as a data table. The
first line serves as the header, defining the list of fields for each
entry, and each following line represents a single accounting entry
without any specific order.
::::

FEC files must comply with the following technical specifications:

- **Encoding**: UTF-8, UTF-8-SIG and iso8859_15.
- **Separator**: any of these: [;]{.title-ref} or [\|]{.title-ref} or
  [,]{.title-ref} or [TAB]{.title-ref}.
- **Line terminators**: both CR+LF ([rn]{.title-ref}) and LF
  ([n]{.title-ref}) character groups are supported.
- **Date format**: [%Y%m%d]{.title-ref}

##### Implementation details {#localizations/france/fec-implementation}

The following accounting entities are imported from the FEC files:
**Accounts, Journals, Partners**, and **Moves**. The module
automatically determines the encoding, line terminator, and separator
used in the file. Next, a check is performed to ensure that each line
has the correct number of fields matching the header. If the check is
successful, the entire file is read, stored in memory, and scanned.
Accounting entities are then imported one type at a time in the
following order.

###### Accounts {#localizations/france/fec-accounts}

Each accounting entry is associated with an account identified by the
`CompteNum`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

###### Code matching {#localizations/france/fec-code-matching}

If an account with the same code already exists, the existing one is
used rather than creating a new one. In Odoo, account numbers follow the
default digit length of the fiscal localization. Since the FEC module is
tied to the French localization, the default account length is 6 digits.
This means that trailing zeros in account codes are removed, and the
comparison between the account codes in the FEC file and those already
in Odoo is made based only on the first six digits of the codes.

::: example
The account code [65800000]{.title-ref} in the file is matched with an
existing [658000]{.title-ref} account in Odoo, and the existing account
is used instead of creating a new one.
:::

###### Reconcilable flag {#localizations/france/fec-reconcilable-flag}

An account is technically flagged as *reconcilable* if the first line in
which it appears has the `EcritureLet`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field filled out, indicating that the accounting entry
will be reconciled with another one.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The field can be left empty on the line, but the entry must still be
reconciled with an unrecorded payment. The account is flagged as
reconcilable once the import of the move lines requires it.
::::

###### Account type and templates matching {#localizations/france/fec-account-type}

Since the account **type** is not specified in the FEC format, **new**
accounts are created with the default type
`Current Assets`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. After the import
process, they are matched against the installed Chart of Account
templates. The *reconcile* flag is also determined this way.

The matching is performed by comparing the left-most digits, starting
with all digits, followed by 3 digits, and then 2 digits.

::: example
  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name         Code                     Full comparison          3-digits comparison 2-digits
                                                                                     comparison
  ------------ ------------------------ ------------------------ ------------------- ------------------
  Template     [400000]{.title-ref}     [400000]{.title-ref}     [400]{.title-ref}   [40]{.title-ref}

  CompteNum    [40100000]{.title-ref}   [40100000]{.title-ref}   [401]{.title-ref}   [40]{.title-ref}

  **Result**                                                                         Match **found**
  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
:::

The account type is then flagged as `payable`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `reconcilable`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
based on the account template.

###### Journals {#localizations/france/fec-journals}

Journals are checked against the existing ones in Odoo to avoid
duplicates, even when importing multiple FEC files.

If a journal with the same code already exists, the existing journal is
used instead of creating a new one.

New journals have the prefix `FEC-`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
added to their name. For example, `ACHATS`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} becomes `FEC-ACHATS`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Journals are *not* archived, allowing the user to manage them as
desired.
::::

###### Journal type determination {#localizations/france/fec-journal-type}

The journal type is not specified in the format (similar to the
accounts) and is initially created with the default type
`general`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

At the end of the import process, the journal type is determined based
on the following rules regarding related moves and accounts:

- | `bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Moves in these journals
    always include a line (debit or credit) impacting a liquidity
    account.
  | `cash`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} / `bank`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} can be interchanged, so `bank`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} is assigned when this condition is met.

- | `sale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Moves in these journals
    mostly have debit lines on receivable accounts and credit lines on
    tax income accounts.
  | Sale refund journal items are debit/credit inverted.

- | `purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Moves in these
    journals mostly have credit lines on payable accounts and debit
    lines on expense accounts.
  | Purchase refund journal items are debit/credit inverted.

- | `general`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Used for everything
    else.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- A minimum of three moves is required to identify the journal type. -
A threshold of 70% of the moves must meet the criteria for a journal
type to be determined.
::::

::: example
Suppose we are analyzing the moves that share a certain
`journal_id`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

  -------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Moves                                                Count   Percentage
  ---------------------------------------------------- ------- ------------
  that have a sale account line and no purchase        0       0
  account line                                                 

  that have a purchase account line and no sale        1       25%
  account line                                                 

  that have a liquidity account line                   3       **75%**

  **Total**                                            4       100%
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------

The journal `type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} would be
`bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, because the bank\'s move
percentage (75%) exceeds the threshold (70%).
:::

###### Contacts {#localizations/france/fec-partners}

Each contact keeps its `Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
from the `CompAuxNum`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

These fields are searchable based on previous FEC imports for
fiscal/audit purposes.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Similar and potential duplicate contacts can be merged using the Data
Cleaning App.
::::

###### Moves {#localizations/france/fec-moves}

Entries are posted and reconciled immediately upon submission, with the
`EcritureLet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field used to match the
entries.

The `EcritureNum`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field represents
the name of the moves, but it may sometimes be left empty. In such
cases, the `PieceRef`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is used
instead.

###### Rounding issues {#localizations/france/fec-rounding-issue}

A rounding tolerance is applied based on currency precision for debit
and credit amounts (i.e., 0.01 for EUR). If the difference falls under
this tolerance, a new line is added to the move, called
`Import rounding difference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
targeting the following accounts:

- [658000]{.title-ref} Charges diverses de gestion courante, for added
  debits
- [758000]{.title-ref} Produits divers de gestion courante, for added
  credits

###### Missing move name {#localizations/france/fec-missing-move-name}

If the the `EcritureNum`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is not
filled out and `PieceRef`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
not suited to determine the move name (it may be used as an accounting
move line reference), it becomes impossible to identify which lines
should be grouped into a single move, and effectively preventing the
creation of balanced moves.

In such cases, a final attempt is made to group all lines by the same
journal and date (`JournalLib`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`EcritureDate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}). If this grouping
generates balanced moves (sum(credit) - sum(debit) = 0), then each
different combination of journal and date creates a new move.

::: example
[ACH]{.title-ref} + [2021/05/01]{.title-ref} \--\> new move on journal
[ACH]{.title-ref} with name [20210501]{.title-ref}.
:::

If this attempt fails, an error message is displayed, listing all the
move lines that are considered unbalanced.

###### Contact information {#localizations/france/fec-partner-information}

If a line includes contact information, it is copied to the accounting
move itself, provided the targeted journal is of type
`payable`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`receivable`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

#### FEC Export {#localizations/france/fec-export}

To download the FEC, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> General Ledger`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(gear)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon and select
`FEC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In the
`FEC File Generation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, fill in
the following fields:

- `Start Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `End Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Test File`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enable this option to
  test the FEC file generation.
- `Exclude lines at 0`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enable this
  option if needed.
- `Excluded Journals`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  journal(s) to exclude.

Then, click `Generate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

::: seealso
\- [Official Technical Specification
(fr)](https://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/codes/article_lc/LEGIARTI000027804775) -
[Test-Compta-Demat (Official FEC Testing
tool)](https://github.com/DGFiP/Test-Compta-Demat)
:::

### Liasse fiscale {#localization/france/liasse-fiscale}

The *liasse fiscale* (tax returns) is a collection of standardized
financial documents that businesses must submit annually to the tax
authorities. It comprehensively summarizes the company's financial
activities and determines corporate taxes.

[Teledec](https://www.teledec.fr) is a platform used to prepare and
submit tax returns using data from accounting records. To synchronize
your accounting data stored in Odoo with Teledec and electronically send
your company\'s *liasse fiscale* to the DGFiP (Direction GÃ©nÃ©rale des
Finances Publiques), follow these steps:

1.  `localization/france/teledec-account`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
2.  `localization/france/teledec-registration`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}
3.  `localization/france/teledec-synchronization`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}

#### Teledec account creation {#localization/france/teledec-account}

To create a Teledec account, access the [Teledec account creation
page](https://www.teledec.fr/s-enregistrer) and fill in the
`Adresse e-mail`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field with an email
address. Choose a secure password, accept the general terms and
conditions by checking the box, and click
`S'enregistrer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to save. Then, enter
the `SIREN (SystÃ¨me d'identification du rÃ©pertoire des entreprises,
Business Directory Identification System)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} number of the company.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If the account has already been created, click
`DÃ©jÃ  enregistrÃ©?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Already
registered).
::::

#### Company registration and fiscal year information {#localization/france/teledec-registration}

(Company\'s details) and `ReprÃ©sentant lÃ©gal`{.interpreted-text

  Closing date.

  role="guilabel"}: Select the Tax scheme and tax return option.

- `Agissant en qualitÃ© de`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Legal

- `NumÃ©ro de tÃ©lÃ©phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Phone

Click `Sauvegarder`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Save) to display
the next step
`Informations gÃ©nÃ©rales sur l'exercice dÃ©clarÃ©`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} (General information about the declared fiscal year).
Then, fill in information on the financial year, such as the fiscal year

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- The `Etat`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Status) column shows
the progress of the document filing. - Click
`ComplÃ©ter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to fill out a document,
then `Sauvegarder`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to save. - To

`Imprimer la dÃ©claration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select

#### Odoo synchronization {#localization/france/teledec-synchronization}

In the `Synchroniser cette liasse avec Odoo`{.interpreted-text

## Point of sale {#localizations/france/pos}

### VAT anti-fraud certification {#localizations/france/vat-anti-fraud-certification}

Since January 2018, new anti-fraud legislation has been in effect in
France and its overseas territories (DOM-TOM). This legislation
establishes specific requirements for the integrity, security, storage,
and archiving of sales data. Odoo complies with these legal requirements
by providing a module and a downloadable certificate of conformity.

Anti-fraud cash register software, such as Odoo (CGI art. 286, I. 3Â°
bis), is required for companies taxable in France or DOM-TOM, where some
customers are private individuals (B2C). This rule applies to all
company sizes, but auto-entrepreneurs exempt from VAT are unaffected.

::: seealso
\- [Frequently Asked
Questions](https://www.economie.gouv.fr/files/files/directions_services/dgfip/controle_fiscal/actualites_reponses/logiciels_de_caisse.pdf) -
[Official
Statement](http://bofip.impots.gouv.fr/bofip/10691-PGP.html?identifiant=BOI-TVA-DECLA-30-10-30-20160803) -
[Item 88 of Finance Law
2016](https://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/affichTexteArticle.do?idArticle=JORFARTI000031732968&categorieLien=id&cidTexte=JORFTEXT000031732865)
:::

#### Odoo certification {#localizations/france/pos-odoo-certification}

The tax administration requires all companies to provide a certificate
of conformity confirming that their software complies with anti-fraud
legislation. In case of non-compliance, a â‚¬7,500 fine may be imposed.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

This
[certificate](https://www.odoo.com/my/contract/french-certification/) is
granted by Odoo SA to Odoo Enterprise users.
::::

To get the certification, follow these steps:

1.  `Install </applications/general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text
    role="doc"} the `France - VAT Anti-Fraud
    Certification for Point of Sale (CGI 286 I-3 bis)`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} ([l10n_fr_pos_cert]{.title-ref}) module.
2.  Set the `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field on the
    `company record </applications/general/companies>`{.interpreted-text
    role="doc"} to encrypt entries for the inalterability check.
3.  Download the mandatory [certificate of
    conformity](https://www.odoo.com/my/contract/french-certification/)
    delivered by Odoo SA.

#### Anti-fraud features {#localizations/france/pos-anti-fraud-features}

The anti-fraud module introduces the following features:

- `Inalterability <localizations/france/pos-inalterability>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Security <localizations/france/pos-security>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Storage <localizations/france/pos-storage>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}

##### Inalterability {#localizations/france/pos-inalterability}

All methods to cancel or modify key data in POS orders, invoices, and
journal entries are deactivated for companies located in France or any
DOM-TOM.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In a multi-company environment, only the documents of such companies are
impacted.
::::

##### Security {#localizations/france/pos-security}

To ensure inalterability, every order or journal entry is encrypted upon
validation. This number (or hash) is calculated from the document\'s key
data and the hash of the precedent documents. The module introduces an
interface to test the data\'s inalterability. The test will fail if any
information is modified on a document after its validation. The
algorithm recomputes all the hashes and compares them against the
initial ones. In case of failure, the system points out the first
corrupted document recorded in the system.

Only users with
`administrator </applications/general/users/access_rights>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} access rights can initiate the inalterability check:

- For POS orders, go to
  `Point of Sales --> Reporting --> POS Inalterability Check`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"};
- For journal entries, go to
  `Invoicing/Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}. In the `Reporting`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} section, click
  `Download the Data Inalterability Check
  Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

##### Storage {#localizations/france/pos-storage}

The system also processes automatic sales closings daily, monthly, and
annually. Such closings compute the sales total for the period and the
cumulative grand totals from the very first sales entry recorded in the
system.

To access closings, either go to
`Point of Sales --> Reporting --> Sales Closings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} or
`Invoicing/Accounting --> Reporting --> Sales Closings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Closings compute the totals for journal entries of sales journals
(Journal Type = Sales). - For multi-companies environments, such
closings are performed by company. - POS orders are posted as journal
entries at the closing of the POS session. Closing a POS session can be
done anytime. To prompt users to do it daily, the module prevents them
from resuming a session that was opened more than 24 hours ago. Such a
session must be closed before selling again. - A period's total is
computed from all the journal entries posted after the previous closing
of the same type, regardless of their posting date. Recording a new
sales transaction for a period already closed will be counted in the
very next closing.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

For test & audit purposes, closings can be manually generated in
`developer mode
<developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. To do so, go to
`Settings --> Technical --> Scheduled Actions`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. In the scheduled actions list view, open the
desired `Sale Closing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} action and
click `Run manually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

#### Responsibilities {#localizations/france/pos-responsibilities}

Uninstalling this module will reset the security hashes. This means the
system will no longer guarantee the integrity of the past data.

Users are responsible for their Odoo system and must operate it
carefully. Modifying source code responsible for ensuring data integrity
is not allowed.

Odoo is not responsible for any issues with this module\'s functionality
if caused by uncertified third-party applications.
