# Germany

## Accounting

### Chart of accounts

Both SKR03 and SKR04 charts of accounts are supported in Odoo. When you
create a new Odoo Online database, SKR03 is installed by default.

Verify which is installed by going to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and checking the `Package`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field under the `Fiscal Localization`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Selecting another package is only possible if you have not created an
accounting entry. If one was posted, a new company or database must be
set up to select another package. In addition, all journal entries will
need to be created again.
::::

### Reports

The following German-specific reports available on Odoo Enterprise:

- Balance Sheet
- Profit & Loss
- Tax Report (Umsatzsteuervoranmeldung)
- EC Sales List
- Intrastat

### Exporting entries from Odoo to DATEV

Provided that one of the German `fiscal localization packages
<fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} is
installed, you can export your accounting entries from Odoo to DATEV
from the general ledger.

Two types of exports are needed: first the DATEV ATCH export, then the
DATEV DATA export.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Both are needed at different stages to transfer the data correctly to
DATEV, as DATEV works with two interfaces, one for clients (DUO - DATEV
Unternehmen Online) and one for tax advisors (DATEV Rechnungswesen).
::::

#### 1. DATEV ATCH

Go to `Accounting --> Reporting --> General Ledger`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, click the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
(`Actions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) button, and select
`Datev ATCH (zip)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![General ledger\'s actions menu with DATEV exports](germany/datev-export.png)

Upload the downloaded ZIP file via the [DATEV Belegtransfer
software](https://www.datev.de/web/de/service-und-support/software-bereitstellung/download-bereich/betriebliches-rechnungswesen/belegtransfer).

If you do not have the DATEV Belegtransfer software installed on your
computer, ask your tax advisor to help you with this.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

The DATEV ATCH ZIP file includes the files (reports) linked to an Odoo
invoice or bill. For customer invoices, the file must have been
generated by using the `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.
For vendor bills, the file must have been received via an email alias or
uploaded by using the `Upload`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button.
::::

::: admonition
DATEV ATCH ZIP file

The ZIP file contains two types of files:

- the individual invoice/bill files (PDF, JPEG, etc.) for the selected
  period on the general ledger, and
- a `document.xml`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file used to generate
  a unique ID (GUID) for each file.

These unique IDs are essential as they allow DATEV to automatically link
the files to the individual journal items, which will be imported with
the DATEV DATA file in the next step.
:::

#### 2. DATEV DATA

Go to `Accounting --> Reporting --> General Ledger`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, click the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
(`Actions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) button, and select
`Datev DATA (zip)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Transfer the downloaded ZIP file to your tax advisor. They should import
the ZIP file into DATEV Rechnungswesen.

Check with your tax advisor how often they need these files.

::: admonition
DATEV ATCH ZIP file

The ZIP file contains three CSV files:

- the `EXTF_customer_accounts.csv`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file
  containing all information related to your customers,
- the `EXTF_vendor_accounts.csv`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file
  containing all information related to your vendors, and
- the `EXTF_accounting_entries.csv`{.interpreted-text role="file"}
  containing all journal items for the period defined on the general
  ledger, as well as the unique IDs (GUID) so that the journal items can
  be linked to the files inside the DATEV ATCH ZIP file.
:::

### GoBD compliance {#germany/gobd}

**GoBD** stands for *GrundsÃ¤tze zur ordnungsmÃ¤ÃŸigen FÃ¼hrung und
Aufbewahrung von BÃ¼chern, Aufzeichnungen und Unterlagen in
elektronischer Form sowie zum Datenzugriff*. In short, it is a guideline
for the proper management and storage of books, records, and documents
in electronic form, as well as for data access, that is relevant for the
German tax authority, tax declaration, and balance sheet.

These principles have been written and published by the Federal Ministry
of Finance (BMF) in November 2014. Since January 2015, **they have
become the norm** and have replaced previously accepted practices linked
to computer-based accounting. Several changes have been made by the BMF
in 2019 and January 2020 to specify some of the content due to the
development of digital solutions (cloud hosting, paperless companies,
etc.).

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo is certified **GoBD-compliant**.
::::

#### Understanding GoBD in relation to accounting software

The **GoBD is binding for companies that have to present accounts**,
which includes SMEs, freelancers, and entrepreneurs, to the financial
authorities. As such, **the taxpayer himself is the sole responsible**
for the complete and exhaustive keeping of fiscal-relevant data
(above-mentioned financial and related data).

Apart from software requirements, the user is required to ensure
internal control systems (*in accordance with sec. 146 of the Fiscal
Code*):

- access rights control;
- segregation of duties, functional separating;
- entry controls (error notifications, plausibility checks);
- reconciliation checks at data entry;
- processing controls; and
- measures to prevent intentional or unintentional manipulation of
  software, data, or documents.

The user must distribute tasks within their organization to the relevant
positions (*control*) and verify that the tasks are properly and
completely performed (*supervision*). The result of these controls must
be recorded (*documentation*), and should errors be found during these
controls, appropriate measures to correct the situation should be put
into place (*prevention*).

#### Data security

The taxpayer must **secure the system against any data loss** due to
deletion, removal, or theft of any data. If the entries are not
sufficiently secured, the bookkeeping will be regarded as not in
accordance with the GoBD guidelines.

Once bookings have been finally posted, they can no longer be changed or
deleted via the application.

- If Odoo is used in the cloud, regular backups are part of the Odoo
  Online service. In addition, regular backups can be downloaded and
  backed up on external systems.

  ::: seealso
  [Odoo Cloud Hosting - Service Level
  Agreement](https://www.odooo.com/cloud-sla)
  :::

- If the server is operated locally, the user is responsible for
  creating the necessary backup infrastructure.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

In some cases, data has to be kept for ten years or more, so always have
backups saved. It is even more important if you decide to change
software provider.
::::

#### Responsibility of the software editor

Considering GoBD applies only to the taxpayer, **the software editor can
by no means be held responsible for the accurate and compliant
documentation of their users\' financial transactional data**. It can
merely provide the necessary tools for the user to respect the
software-related guidelines described in the GoBD.

#### Ensuring compliance through Odoo

The keywords, when it comes to GoBD are: **traceable, verifiable, true,
clear, and continuous**. In short, you need to have audit-proof
archiving in place, and Odoo provides you with the means to achieve all
of these objectives:

1.  | **Traceability and verifiability**
    | Each record in Odoo is stamped with the creator of the document,
      the creation date, the modification date, and who modified it. In
      addition, relevant fields are tracked. Thus, it can be seen which
      value was changed by whom in the chatter of the relevant object.

2.  | **Completeness**
    | All financial data must be recorded in the system, and there can
      be no gaps. Odoo ensures that there is no gap in the numbering of
      the financial transactions. It is the responsibility of the user
      to encode all financial data in the system. As most financial data
      in Odoo is generated automatically, it remains the responsibility
      of the user to encode all vendor bills and miscellaneous
      operations completely.

3.  | **Accuracy**
    | Odoo ensures that, with the correct configuration, the correct
      accounts are used. In addition, the control mechanisms between
      purchase orders and sales orders and their respective invoices
      reflect the reality of the business. It is the responsibility of
      the user to scan and attach the paper-based vendor bill to the
      respective record in Odoo. *Odoo Documents helps you automate this
      task*.

4.  | **Timely booking and record-keeping**
    | As most financial data in Odoo is generated by the transactional
      objects (for example, the invoice is booked at confirmation), Odoo
      ensures out-of-the-box timely record-keeping. It is the
      responsibility of the user to encode all incoming vendor bills in
      a timely manner, as well as the miscellaneous operations.

5.  | **Order**
    | Financial data stored in Odoo is, per definition, ordered and can
      be reordered according to most fields present in the model. A
      specific ordering is not enforced by the GoBD, but the system must
      ensure that a given financial transaction can be quickly found by
      a third-party expert. Odoo ensures this out-of-the-box.

6.  | **Inalterability**
    | With the German Odoo localization, Odoo is in standard configured
      in such a way that the inalterability clause can be adhered to
      without any further customization.

#### GoBD export

In the case of fiscal control, the fiscal authority can request three
levels of access to the accounting system (Z1, Z2, Z3). These levels
vary from direct access to the interface to the handover of the
financial data on a storage device.

In the case of a handover of financial data to a storage device, the
GoBD does **not** enforce the format. It can be, for example, in XLS,
CSV, XML, Lotus 123, SAP-format, AS/400-format, or else. Odoo supports
the CSV and XLS export of financial data out of the box. The GoBD
**recommends** the export in a specific XML-based GoBD format (see
\"ErgÃ¤nzende Informationen zur DatentrÃ¤gerÃ¼berlassung\" Â§3), but it is
not binding.

#### Non-compliance

In the event of an infringement, you can expect a fine and a court order
demanding the implementation of specific measures.

## Point of Sale {#germany/pos}

### Technical security system

The **Kassensicherungsverordnung** (The Act on Protection against
Manipulation of Digital Records) requires that electronic record-keeping
systems - including the `point of sale
</applications/sales/point_of_sale>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
systems - must be equipped with a **technical security system** (also
called **TSS** or **TSE**).

Odoo offers a service that is compliant with the help of
[fiskaly](https://fiskaly.com), a *cloud-based solution*.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Since this solution is cloud-based, a working internet connection is
required.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The only VAT rates allowed are given by fiskaly. You can check these
rates by consulting [fiskaly DSFinV-K API: VAT
Definition](https://developer.fiskaly.com/api/dsfinvk/v0/#tag/VAT-Definition).
::::

#### Configuration

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
**Germany - Certification for Point of Sale**
([l10n_de_pos_cert]{.title-ref}) and **Germany - Certification for Point
of Sale of type restaurant** ([l10n_de_pos_res_cert]{.title-ref})
modules.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If these modules are not listed,
`update the app list <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

##### Company registration at the financial authority

To register your company, open the `Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} app, click `Update Info`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} under the `Companies`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, and fill in the following fields:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `St.-Nr.`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Steuernummer) this
  number is assigned by the tax office to every taxable natural or legal
  person (e.g., [2893081508152]{.title-ref}).
- `W-IdNr.`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  (Wirtschafts-Identifikationsnummer) this number is used as a permanent
  identification number for economically active persons.

You can then **register your company through fiskaly** by opening the
`Fiskaly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab and clicking the
`Fiskaly Registration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If you do not see the `Fiskaly Registration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button, make sure that you *saved* your company details
and are not in *editing mode* anymore.
::::

Once the registration has been finalized, new fields appear:

- `Fiskaly Organization ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} refers to
  the ID of your company on fiskaly\'s side.
- `Fiskaly API Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `Fiskaly API Secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are the
  credentials the system uses to access the services offered by fiskaly.

![Fiskaly registration tab](germany/fiskaly-registration.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

It is possible to request new credentials if there is any issue with the
current ones by clicking the `New keys`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.
::::

##### Create a technical security system and link it to a POS

To use a point of sale in Germany, first create a
`TSS (Technical Security System)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} by
going to
`Point of Sale --> Configuration --> Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, selecting the `Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to edit, then checking the
`Create TSS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} box under the
`Fiskaly API`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

Once the creation of the TSS is successful, you can find the:

- `TSS ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which refers to the ID of
  your TSS on fiskaly\'s side, and
- `Fiskaly Client ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which refers
  to your POS on fiskaly\'s side.

![Fiskaly API section](germany/fiskaly-tss.png)

#### DSFinV-K export

Whenever you close a PoS session, the details of the orders are sent to
the `DSFinV-K
(Digitale Schnittstelle der Finanzverwaltung fÃ¼r Kassensysteme)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} service of fiskaly.

In case of an audit, you can export the data sent to DSFinV-K by going
to `Point of
Sale --> Orders --> DSFinV-K Exports --> New`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![Menu to export DSFinV-K](germany/pos-orders-menu.png)

These fields are mandatory:

- `Start Datetime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: export data with
  dates larger than or equal to the given start date
- `End Datetime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: export data with
  dates smaller than or equal to the given end date

Leave the `Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field blank
to export the data of all your points of sale; specify one if you want
to export data for this specific POS only.

![Exporting DSFinV-K](germany/dsfinv-k-export.png)

When an export is successfully triggered and is being processed, the
`State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field should mention
`Pending`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Click
`Refresh State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to check if it is
ready.

# Guatemala

## Introduction {#guatemala/intro}

With the Guatemalan localization, you can connect to the tax authority
Superintendencia de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria (SAT) to generate
electronic documents with its XML, fiscal folio, and electronic
signature.

The supported documents are:

- `FACT-Factura`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
- `FCAM-Factura Cambiaria`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
- `FPEQ-Factura de PequeÃ±o Contribuyente`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"},
- `NCRE-Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
- `NDEB-Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
- `NABN-Nota de Abono`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
- `FCAP-Factura Cambiaria PequeÃ±o Contribuyente`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"},
- `FACT-Factura with Export Complement`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.

The localization requires an [Infile](https://infile.com.gt/) account,
which enables users to generate electronic documents within Odoo. To
request an Infile account, fill out the [Infile Registration
Form](https://share.hsforms.com/1HksZ6i1VRRWHRhXPvYZORQrwu2r).

::: seealso
`Documentation on e-invoicing's legality and compliance in Guatemala
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/guatemala>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Glossary

The following terms are used throughout the Guatemalan localization:

- **SAT**: *Superintendencia de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria* is the
  government entity responsible for enforcing tax payments in Guatemala.
- **FEL**: *Factura ElectrÃ³nica en LÃ­nea* is the electronic invoicing
  system mandated by the SAT in Guatemala, which requires businesses to
  issue and manage electronic documents in compliance with local
  regulations.
- **EDI**: *Electronic Data Interchange* refers to the sending of
  electronic documents.
- **Infile**: is the third-party organization that facilitates the
  interchange of electronic documents between companies and the
  Guatemalan government.
- **UUID**: *Universally Unique Identifier* is a unique alphanumeric
  code assigned by the SAT to each certified electronic document in the
  FEL system, used for traceability and official validation.
- **Phrases**: Type of Phrases with specific Scenario Codes are used in
  the Guatemalan localization to comply with the requirements of the
  SAT. They should be added depending on the issuer regime, receiver,
  and operation type. These phrases are used in the XML and PDF
  documents.
- **Establishment Code**: A unique identifier assigned by the SAT to
  each business establishment, which is required for electronic
  invoicing.
- **Quetzal**: The official currency of Guatemala, represented by the
  symbol GTQ. This is the base currency for all financial transactions
  in the Guatemalan localization.

## Configuration

### Modules installation

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Guatemalan localization:

  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name                                           Technical name              Description
  ---------------------------------------------- --------------------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Guatemala - Accounting`{.interpreted-text     [l10n_gt]{.title-ref}       The default `fiscal localization package <../fiscal_localizations>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.
  role="guilabel"}                                                           It adds accounting characteristics for the Guatemalan localization, which represent the minimum
                                                                             configuration required for a company to operate in Guatemala according to the guidelines set by
                                                                             the `SAT (Superintendencia de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. The
                                                                             module\'s installation automatically loads the chart of accounts and taxes.

  `Guatemala Accounting EDI`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_gt_edi]{.title-ref}   Includes all the technical and functional requirements to generate and validate
  role="guilabel"}                                                           `Electronics Documents <../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing>`{.interpreted-text
                                                                             role="doc"}, based on the technical documentation published by the
                                                                             `SAT (Superintendencia de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. The
                                                                             authorized documents are `listed
                                                                             above <guatemala/intro>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo automatically installs the base module **Guatemala - Accounting**
when a database is installed with [Guatemala]{.title-ref} selected as
the country. However, to enable electronic invoicing, the **Guatemala
Accounting EDI** ([l10n_gt_edi]{.title-ref}) module needs to be manually
`installed
<general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

### Company

To configure your company information, open the **Settings** app, scroll
down to the `Companies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
click `Update Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and configure
the following:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, including the
  `Street`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `City`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

- `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the identification
  number for the selected taxpayer type.

- `VAT Affiliation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the VAT
  affiliation for the company, which is the type of Regime the company
  belongs to.

- `Legal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The legal name of the
  company, which is used in the XML and PDF documents.

- `Establishment Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: A necessary
  part of the XML when creating an electronic document. If this field is
  not set, all electronic documents will be rejected.

  To locate the `Establishment Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  in your [SAT account](https://portal.sat.gob.gt/), go to
  `FEL --> AdministraciÃ³n de Establecimientos`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}. The list of registered establishments is
  displayed along with their corresponding codes.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

After configuring the company in the database settings, navigate to the
company\'s contact form and verify that the
`Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set to
`NIT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

### Electronic invoicing credentials

In Guatemala, electronic invoicing is mandatory for most businesses.
Odoo connects with the authorized provider, Infile, to generate and
submit electronic documents to the
`SAT (Superintendencia de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} for validation.

Before issuing electronic documents, you must configure and connect Odoo
to Infile to ensure they are properly validated and assigned an official
`UUID (Universally Unique Identifier)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

#### Infile

Sign a service agreement directly with [Infile](https://infile.com.gt/).
Infile will then provide the necessary credentials to input in Odoo.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To create an Infile account and benefit from the **8% discount**
available for Odoo customers, fill out the: [Infile Registration
Form](https://share.hsforms.com/1HksZ6i1VRRWHRhXPvYZORQrwu2r). An Infile
agent will contact you to help you complete the onboarding process and
sign the service agreement.
::::

#### Odoo

In Odoo, once you have completed the Infile process, navigate to
`Accounting -->
Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
scroll down to the `Guatemalan Localization`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, then follow these steps:

1.  Select the `Infile Web Services`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    environment, either `Test`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
    `Production`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
2.  Enter the `Infile Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    - `Infile WS Username or Prefix`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Infile Token`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Infile Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
3.  Click on `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `Infile Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are provided
by Infile and are required for both test and production environments. If
they are not available, contact Infile support.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The demo environment is for testing only and does not generate legal
documents, `UUID (Universally Unique Identifier)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} keys, or fiscal folios. No Infile account or credentials
are needed to use the demo environment.
::::

#### Multi-currency

The official currency exchange rate in Guatemala is provided by the Bank
of Guatemala. Odoo can connect directly to its services and get the
currency rate either automatically or manually.

::: seealso
`Multi-currencies <../accounting/get_started/multi_currency>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Master data

#### Chart of accounts

The
`chart of accounts <../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is installed by default as part of the set of data included
in the localization module, the accounts are mapped automatically in
taxes, default accounts payable, and default accounts receivable.

Accounts can be added or deleted according to the company\'s needs.

#### Contacts

The following fields must be completed on contact forms:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, including the
  `Street`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `City`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  - `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select an identification
    type.
  - `Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Required to confirm an
    electronic invoice.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To automatically include a specific phrase in the XML and PDF of every
electronic invoice for a contact, select it in
`Phrases`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field in the
`Sales & purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of the contact
form.
::::

#### Taxes

As part of the Guatemala localization module, taxes are automatically
created with their configuration and related financial accounts.

## Electronic invoices

Once the database has been configured successfully, electronic documents
can be created and sent.

Once
`customer invoices <../accounting/customer_invoices>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} are validated, they can be sent electronically to
`SAT (Superintendencia de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} via Infile, provided the following fields are completed:

- `Customer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Type the customer\'s
  information.
- `GT Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the type
  of document you want to create, i.e.,
  `FACT - Factura ElectrÃ³nica`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `FCAM - Factura Cambiara`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. By
  default, the document type is set to `FACT`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
- `Due date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: To compute if the
  invoice is due now or later.
- `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the sales
  journal.
- `Products`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Specify the product(s)
  with the correct taxes.

When done, click `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If you need to add a specific phrase based on the transaction, go to the
`Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab and add the
corresponding phrase in `GT Phrases`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
These phrases are used in the XML and PDF documents.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If you need to add an addendum to the invoice, you can do so in the
`Terms and
Conditions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. The addendum will
be included in the XML document and can be used to provide additional
information or notes related to the invoice.
::::

After the invoice confirmation, click `Send`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. In the wizard that appears, make sure to enable the
`Send to SAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`by Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkboxes to send the XML
to the
`SAT (Superintendencia de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} through Infile\'s web service and the validated invoice to
the client\'s email, and click `Send`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Then, the following occurs:

- The XML document is created.
- The `UUID (Universally Unique Identifier)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} is generated.
- The XML is processed synchronously by Infile.
  - If accepted, the file is displayed in the chatter, and the email to
    the client with the corresponding `pdf`{.interpreted-text
    role="file"} and `xml`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file is sent.
  - If the file contains errors, a warning message displays the
    reason(s) and the email is not sent.

![EDI documents available in the chatter.](guatemala/pdf-xml-chatter-guatemala.png)

The `SAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab then displays the
following:

- `Datetime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Timestamp recorded of
  the XML creation.
- `GT Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Status result obtained
  in the
  `SAT (Superintendencia de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} response. If the file contains errors, a warning message
  displays the reason(s) and the email is not sent.
- `UUID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The unique identifier
  assigned by the
  `SAT (Superintendencia de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} to the electronic document.
- `Download Certificate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: To download
  the sent XML file, even if the
  `SAT (Superintendencia de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} result was rejected.

![EDI document record available in SAT tab.](guatemala/sat-tab-electronic-document.png)

### Debit and credit notes {#localization/guatemala/credit-notes}

To send a debit or credit note to Infile, first create the `debit
<accounting/credit_notes/issue-debit-note>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} or `credit note
<accounting/credit_notes/issue-credit-note>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Then, in the `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, click
`Send to SAT (Guatemalan EDI)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
submit it for real-time validation. Upon successful validation, the QR
code from Infile is embedded in the debit or credit note PDF.

### Export invoices

Exportation invoices must meet the following conditions:

- The customer\'s `Identification type`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} must be `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Passport`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
  `Foreign ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- The following fields must be defined in the customer invoice\'s
  `Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, under the
  `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:

  > - `Incoterm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  > - `GT Phrases`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  >   `Type 4 Code 1`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  > - `Consignatory Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

- All invoice lines must include taxes set to 0%.

![Exportation invoices main data.](guatemala/l10n-gt-factura-de-cliente.png)

# Hong Kong

## Configuration

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get the latest features of the Hong Kong localization:

  Name                                                                       Technical name                               Description
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Hong Kong - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                [l10n_hk]{.title-ref}                        The base module to manage chart of accounting and localization for Hong Kong.
  `Hong Kong - Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                   [l10n_hk_hr_payroll]{.title-ref}             Enables `payroll <payroll/l10n_hk/payroll>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} specific localization features for Odoo *Payroll* app. This module also installs `Hong Kong - Payroll with Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and `Documents - Hong Kong Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  `Hong Kong - Payroll with Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_hk_hr_payroll_account]{.title-ref}     Installs the link between Hong Kong payroll and accounting.
  `Documents - Hong Kong Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}         [documents_l10n_hk_hr_payroll]{.title-ref}   Integrates employee ir56 forms in the Odoo *Documents* app.

## FPS QR codes on invoices

`FPS (Faster Payment System)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is a
payment service platform that allows customers to make instant domestic
payments to individuals and merchants in Hong Kong dollars or Renminbi
via online and mobile banking.

### Activate QR codes

Go to `Accounting app --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Under the `Customer
Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, tick the checkbox
beside the `QR Codes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} feature. Then,
click `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

### FPS bank account configuration

Go to
`Contacts app --> Configuration --> Bank Accounts section --> Bank Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then select the bank account for FPS activation.
Proceed to set the `Proxy Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
fill in the `Proxy Value`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field,
depending on the type chosen.

Remember to include the invoice number in the QR code, by ticking the
`Include Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox.

![FPS bank account configuration.](hong_kong/hk-fps-bank-setting.png){.align-center}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

\- The account holder\'s country must be set to [Hong Kong]{.title-ref}
on its contact form. - The account holder\'s city is mandatory. - You
could also include the invoice number in the QR code by checking the
`Include
Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox.
::::

::: seealso
`../accounting/bank`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Bank journal configuration

Go to `Accounting app --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and open the bank journal. Then, fill out the
`Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields, located in the
`Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

![Bank Account\'s journal configuration.](hong_kong/hk-bank-account-journal-setting.png){.align-center}

### Issue invoices with FPS QR codes

When creating a new invoice, open the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab and set the `Payment
QR-code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option to
`EMV Merchant-Presented QR-code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Select EMV Merchant-Presented QR-code option.](hong_kong/hk-qr-code-invoice-setting.png){.align-center}

Ensure that the `Recipient Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
configured, as Odoo uses this field to generate the FPS QR code.

# India

## Installation {#india/installation}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Indian localization:

  Name                                                               Technical name                         Description
  ------------------------------------------------------------------ -------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Indian - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}           [l10n_in]{.title-ref}                  Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Indian E-invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}            [l10n_in_edi]{.title-ref}              `Indian e-invoicing integration <india/e-invoicing>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Indian E-waybill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}              [l10n_in_ewaybill]{.title-ref}         `Indian E-way bill integration <india/e-waybill>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Indian E-waybill Stock`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}        [l10n_in_ewaybill_stock]{.title-ref}   `E-waybill creation from the Inventory app <india/e-waybill-stock>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Indian - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_in_reports]{.title-ref}          Adds the `Indian GST Return filing <india/gstr>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and the `Indian
                                                                                                            Tax reports <india/gstr_reports>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

### Company {#india/company}

To configure your company information, open the **Settings** app, scroll
down to the `Companies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
click `Update Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and configure
the following:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, including the
  `Street`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `City`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `PAN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: essential for determining
  the type of taxpayer.
- `GSTIN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: necessary for generating
  e-Invoices, E-waybills and filing GST returns.

## Indian Configuration {#india/indian-configuration}

The **Indian Integration** section provides essential taxation and
compliance features to simplify financial operations. To enable these
features, navigate to `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and
scroll down to the `Indian Integration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section.

![Indian Integration Section](india/indian-integration.png)

- `TDS/TCS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Activate this to enable
  `TDS/TCS <india/tds-tcs-threshold>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  functionality along with account-based TDS/TCS section suggestions.
- `Registered Under GST`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select this
  if your business is registered under GST to access GST-related
  features, including e-invoice, e-waybill, GST e-filing, fetch vendor
  e-invoiced document and check GST number status.
- `E-Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Connects to the
  `e-invoice <india/e-invoicing>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} `NIC
  (National Informatics Center)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal
  to submit invoices.
- `E-Way bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Connects to the
  `e-waybill <india/e-waybill>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} `NIC
  (National Informatics Center)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal
  to generate e-waybills.
- `GST E-Filing & Matching`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enable
  the feature to facilitate `GST return filing
  <india/gstr>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and connect with the GST
  portal to submit GSTR-1 and retrieve GSTR-2B.
- `Check GST Number Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enable
  to verify `GSTIN Status <india/gstin_status>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.
- `Fetch Vendor E-Invoiced Document`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  Helps in creating draft vendor bills using e-invoice data submitted by
  vendors on GST portal.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Check the `Production Environment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
checkbox to start using Indian services in the production environment.
If you want to use the testing environment then keep the checkbox
unchecked.
::::

## e-Invoice system {#india/e-invoicing}

Odoo is compliant with the **Indian Goods and Services Tax (GST)
e-Invoice system** requirements.

### Setup

#### NIC e-Invoice registration {#india/e-invoicing-api}

You must register on the
`NIC (National Informatics Centre)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
e-Invoice portal to get your **API credentials**. You need these
credentials to `configure your Odoo Accounting app
<india/e-invoicing-configuration>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

1.  Log in to the [NIC e-Invoice portal](https://einvoice1.gst.gov.in/)
    by clicking `Login`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and entering
    your `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    If you are already registered on the NIC portal, you can use the
    same login credentials.
    ::::

    ![Register Odoo ERP system on e-invoice web portal](india/e-invoice-system-login.png)

2.  From the dashboard, go to
    `API Registration --> User Credentials --> Create API
    User`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"};

3.  After that, you should receive an
    `OTP (one-time password)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} code on
    your registered mobile number. Enter the OTP code and click
    `Verify OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

4.  Select `Through GSP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the API
    interface, set `Tera Software Limited`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} as GSP, and type in a `Username`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} and `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    for your API. Once it is done, click `Submit`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.

    ![Submit API specific Username and Password](india/submit-api-registration-details.png)

#### Configuration in Odoo {#india/e-invoicing-configuration}

To enable the e-Invoice service in Odoo,
`activate <india/indian-configuration>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
the `E-Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} feature and enter
the `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} previously set for the
API.

### Workflow {#india/e-invoicing-workflow}

#### Generate e-Invoice {#india/generate-e-invoice}

Once an invoice is confirmed, click the `Send`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button to open the wizard. Select
`E-Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then click the
`Generate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. Odoo will upload
the JSON-signed file of the invoice to the NIC e-Invoice portal.

![Generate e-Invoice](india/generate-e-invoice.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- You can find the JSON-signed file and check the e-Invoicing status in
the chatter.
::::

#### Invoice PDF report {#india/invoice-pdf-report}

Once an invoice is validated and submitted, the invoice PDF report can
be printed. The report includes the
`IRN (Invoice Reference Number)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
`Acknowledgement`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (number and date)
and QR code. These certify that the invoice is a valid fiscal document.

![IRN and QR code](india/invoice-report.png)

#### e-Invoice cancellation {#india/edi-cancellation}

To cancel an e-Invoice, click the `Request Cancel`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button on the related invoice. In the
`Cancel E-Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, fill out
the `Cancel Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and `Cancel
Remarks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- You can find the e-Invoicing status in the chatter.
::::

#### Management of negative lines in e-Invoices {#india/e-invoice-negative-lines}

Negative lines are typically used to represent discounts or adjustments
associated with specific products or global discounts. The government
portal prohibits the submission of data with negative lines, which means
they need to be converted based on the HSN code and GST rate. This is
done automatically by Odoo.

::: example
Consider the following example:

+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| > **Product Details**                                                                |
+===============+=============+=============+==============+=============+=============+
| **Product     | **HSN       | **Tax       | **Quantity** | **GST       | **Total**   |
| Name**        | Code**      | Excluded**  |              | Rate**      |             |
+---------------+-------------+-------------+--------------+-------------+-------------+
| Product A     | > 123456    | > 1,000     | > 1          | > 18%       | > 1,180     |
+---------------+-------------+-------------+--------------+-------------+-------------+
| Product B     | > 239345    | > 1,500     | > 2          | > 5%        | > 3,150     |
+---------------+-------------+-------------+--------------+-------------+-------------+
| Discount on   | > 123456    | > -100      | > 1          | > 18%       | > -118      |
| Product A     |             |             |              |             |             |
+---------------+-------------+-------------+--------------+-------------+-------------+

Here\'s the transformed representation:

+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| > **Product Details**                                                                             |
+=============+=============+=============+==============+==============+=============+=============+
| **Product   | **HSN       | **Tax       | **Quantity** | **Discount** | **GST       | **Total**   |
| Name**      | Code**      | Excluded**  |              |              | Rate**      |             |
+-------------+-------------+-------------+--------------+--------------+-------------+-------------+
| Product A   | > 123456    | > 1,000     | > 1          | > 100        | > 18%       | > 1,062     |
+-------------+-------------+-------------+--------------+--------------+-------------+-------------+
| Product B   | > 239345    | > 1,500     | > 2          | > 0          | > 5%        | > 3,150     |
+-------------+-------------+-------------+--------------+--------------+-------------+-------------+

In this conversion, negative lines have been transformed into positive
discounts, maintaining accurate calculations based on the HSN Code and
GST rate. This ensures a more straightforward and standardized
representation in the E-invoice records.
:::

#### GST e-Invoice verification {#india/verify-e-invoice}

After submitting an e-Invoice, you can verify if the invoice is signed
from the GST e-Invoice system website itself.

1.  Download the JSON file from the attached files. It can be found in
    the chatter of the related invoice;

2.  Open the [NIC e-Invoice portal](https://einvoice1.gst.gov.in/) and
    go to `Search --> Verify Signed Invoice`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"};

3.  Select the JSON file and submit it;

    ![select the JSON file for verify invoice](india/verify-invoice.png)

    If the file is signed, a confirmation message is displayed.

    ![verified e-invoice](india/signed-invoice.png)

## E-Way bill {#india/e-waybill}

### Setup {#india/e-waybill-setup}

Odoo is compliant with the **Indian Goods and Services Tax (GST)
E-waybill system** requirements.

#### API registration on NIC E-Way bill {#india/e-waybill-api}

You must register on the
`NIC (National Informatics Centre)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} E-Way
bill portal to create your **API credentials**. You need these
credentials to `configure your Odoo Accounting app
<india/e-waybill-configuration>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

1.  Log in to the [NIC E-Way bill portal](https://ewaybillgst.gov.in/)
    by clicking `Login`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and entering
    your `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

2.  From your dashboard, go to
    `Registration --> For GSP`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"};

3.  Click `Send OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Once you have
    received the code on your registered mobile number, enter it and
    click `Verify OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};

4.  Check if `Tera Software Limited`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    is already on the registered GSP/ERP list. If so, use the username
    and password used to log in to the NIC portal. Otherwise, follow the
    next steps;

    ![E-Way bill list of registered GSP/ERP](india/e-waybill-gsp-list.png)

5.  Select `Add/New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, select
    `Tera Software Limited`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as your
    GSP Name, create a `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    a `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for your API, and
    click `Add`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

    ![Submit GSP API registration details](india/e-waybill-registration-details.png)

#### Configuration in Odoo {#india/e-waybill-configuration}

To enable the E-Way bill service in Odoo,
`activate <india/indian-configuration>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
the `E-Way bill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} feature and enter
the `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

### Workflow {#india/e-waybill-workflow}

#### Generate E-Way bill {#india/generate-e-waybill}

To generate an E-Way bill, confirm the customer invoice/vendor bill and
click `Create
e-Waybill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Enter the necessary
details and click `Generate e-Waybill`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to proceed.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- You can find the JSON-signed file in the attached files in the
chatter.
::::

#### Invoice PDF report

You can print the invoice PDF report once you have submitted the E-Way
bill. The report includes the **E-Way bill number** and the **E-Way bill
validity date**.

![E-way bill acknowledgment number and date](india/e-waybill-invoice-report.png)

#### E-Way bill cancellation {#india/e-waybill-cancellation}

To cancel an E-Way bill, click `e-Waybill`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} on the related invoice/bill, then
`Cancel e-Waybill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In the
`Cancel Ewaybill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, fill out
the `Cancel Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Cancel Remarks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note

Note

::: title
Note

Make sure the **E-Way bill Stock** module is

## Indian GST Return filing {#india/gstr}

### Enable API access {#india/gstr_api}

To file GST Returns in Odoo, you must first enable API access on the GST
portal.

1.  Log into the [GST
    portal](https://services.gst.gov.in/services/login) by entering your
    `Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and go to
    `My Profile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on your **profile
    menu**;

    ![Click On the My Profile from profile](india/gst-portal-my-profile.png)

2.  Select `Manage API Access`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    click `Yes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to enable API access;

    ![Click Yes](india/gst-portal-api-yes.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

It is recommended to set the `Duration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to `30 days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
avoid the need for frequent token reauthentication.
::::

1.  Doing so enables a `Duration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    drop-down menu. Select the `Duration`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} of your preference, and click
    `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

### Indian GST Service In Odoo {#india/gstr_configuration}

Once you have enabled the
`API access <india/gstr_api>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} on the GST
portal, `activate
<india/indian-configuration>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
`GST E-Filing & Matching Feature`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
start using GST Service. Then, in the
`Registered Under GST`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, fill
in the required `GST
Username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

> ![Please enter your GST portal Username as Username](india/gst-setup.png)

### File-in GST Return {#india/gstr_workflow}

To file a GST return, make sure the `GST E-Filing & Matching Feature
<india/indian-configuration>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} is enabled.
Then, go to the Accounting dashboard and click
`Tax Returns`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the
`Tax Returns`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} journal. In the
`Accounting Periods`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, fill in
the following fields.

- `Opening Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Starting date from
  which tax return periods are created.
- `Fiscal Year End`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: End date of the
  fiscal year (e.g., `31 March`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}).
- `GSTIN Periodicity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Frequency of
  return filing (e.g., `Monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}).

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Alternatively, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, click `fa-book`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Report:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select
`GSTR-1 (IN)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, click
`Returns`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to file the return.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To reconcile vendor bills with GST portal data, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, click `fa-book`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Report:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select
`GSTR-2B`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and click
`Reconcile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

#### Filing GSTR-1 tax return {#india/gstr-1}

To file a GSTR-1 tax return, follow these steps:

1.  Click the suitable `GSTR-1`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    report for the desired period to open the filing view.

    ![GSTR-1 filing view](india/gst-gstr-1-file.png)

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    It is recommended to file the return **five days before the filing
    date** to avoid any penalties.
    ::::

2.  Odoo automatically performs validation checks before submission to
    ensure compliance with GST portal requirements that must be
    addressed before filing.

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    The following types of validation issues can be raised:

    - `Apply Appropriate Tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      `IGST`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is not applicable for
      intra-state transactions.
    - `Wrong CGST/SGST on Inter-State Transactions`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}: `CGST/SGST`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
      cannot be applied on inter-state transactions.
    - `Fiscal Year Reversed Move`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      Credit Notes for invoices issued in a given financial year should
      not be included in GSTR-1 after **November 30th**; remove tax from
      these lines.
    - `Invalid HSN Codes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      - For products (non-services), HSN codes must not begin with
        [99]{.title-ref}.
      - For services, HSN codes must begin with [99]{.title-ref}.
    - `Missing HSN Codes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Some
      product lines do not have HSN codes for journal items.
    - `Invalid UQC Codes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The Unit
      Quantity Code (UQC) must comply with Indian GST standards.
    - `Missing Document Summary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      Document summary lines are mandatory for GSTR-1. This check is
      always marked as `Anomaly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
      initially. After reviewing the summary by clicking the relevant
      check, it changes to `Reviewed`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}.
    - `Missing E-Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Some
      invoices are not linked to an e-invoice.
    - `Unlinked Unregistered Credit Notes`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}: Credit Notes have been issued without
      referencing an invoice.
    ::::

    Validation checks have four stages:

    - `To Review`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Check requires
      review.
    - `Reviewed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Check has been
      reviewed.
    - `Supervised`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Check is
      supervised, and a supervisor is assigned.
    - `Anomaly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Check has failed.

    Click on any individual check to view and resolve the corresponding
    issue.

    :::: tip
    ::: title
    Tip
    :::

    A tax return can only be validated when all checks are in the
    `Reviewed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
    `Supervised`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} stage.
    ::::

    After reviewing the checks, click `Validate`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}. The `Review`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    stage appears in green then.

3.  Click `GSTR-1 (IN)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to review the
    report.

4.  Click `Submit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and click
    `Push Data`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
    `Submission Instructions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window
    to send the report to the GST portal.

    During this step, GST portal credentials must be verified. As the
    data is being sent, the `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    stage in the progress bar appears orange. Once the GST portal
    confirms receipt, the stage turns green. If an error occurs, the
    `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} stage changes to red.

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    Click the `fa-ellipsis-v`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    `(ellipsis)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon on the relevant
    `GSTR-1`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} line to display
    additional options:

    - `Generate XLSX`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Download the
      GSTR-1 report as an XLSX file.
    - `Reset`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Clear the current
      state and revert the return to the initial stage.
    ::::

5.  Click `Check Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to retrieve
    the current status from the GST portal. Once the confirmation is
    received, the `Review`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} stage in
    the progress bar turns green. Then, click
    `Mark as Filed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to finalize and
    submit the return as filed.

    :::: important
    ::: title
    Important
    :::

    Once a return is marked as **Filed**, it cannot be reset or filed
    again.
    ::::

#### Receive GSTR-2B tax reconciliation {#india/gstr-2b}

1.  Select the relevant `GSTR-2B`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    report for the desired period that needs to be reconciled.

2.  In the validation checks view, click
    `Fetch E-Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to retrieve
    vendor e-invoice data for the reconciliation period. The check is
    initially marked as `Anomaly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    changes to `Reviewed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} after
    fetching. Then, click `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    to confirm and mark the `Review`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    stage as green.

    :::: important
    ::: title
    Important
    :::

    The `Fetch E-Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} check only
    turns green if the e-invoice data is fetched **two days after the
    end of the last month\'s reconciliation period**.
    ::::

3.  Click `Fetch GSTR-2B`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to retrieve
    all invoices from the GST portal. Once the data is fetched, the
    `Fetch`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} stage in the progress bar
    turns green. To view the raw report data, click
    `GSTR-2B (IN)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

4.  The fetched invoices are automatically matched with the E-invoices.
    Click `View Bills`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to see
    detailed matching results.

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    The `Match`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} stage indicates the
    reconciliation status:

    - Orange: Partially matched (some bills require correction).
    - Green: Fully matched (all bills reconciled).

    In case of mismatches, correct the affected bills, then click the
    `fa-ellipsis-v`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    `(ellipsis)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon to access
    additional options:

    - `Re-Match`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Re-run the matching
      process after making corrections.
    - `Reset`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Reset the
      reconciliation to the `Match`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
      stage.
    ::::

5.  After all bills are fully matched, click the
    `fa-ellipsis-v`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    `(ellipsis)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon and select
    `Mark as Complete`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The
    `Complete`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} stage in the progress
    bar turns green, finalizing the bill reconciliation.

## Tax reports {#india/gstr_reports}

### GSTR-1 report {#india/gstr-1_report}

The `GSTR-1`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} report is divided into
sections. It displays the `Base`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
amount, `CGST (Central Goods and Services Tax)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, `SGST (State Goods and Service Tax)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"},
`IGST (Integrated Goods and Services Tax)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, and `CESS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for each
section.

> ![GSTR-1 Report](india/gst-gstr-1-report.png)

### GSTR-2B report {#india/gstr-2b_report}

The `GSTR-2`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} report is divided into
sections. It displays the `Base`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
amount, `CGST (Central Goods and Services Tax)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, `SGST (State Goods and Service Tax)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"},
`IGST (Integrated Goods and Services Tax)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, and `CESS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for each
section.

> ![GSTR-2B Report](india/gst-gstr-2b-report.png)

### GSTR-3B report {#india/gstr-3b_report}

The `GSTR-3B`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} report contains
different sections:

- Details of inward and outward supply subject to a **reverse charge**;

- Eligible `ITC (Income Tax Credit)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"};

- Values of **exempt**, **Nil-rated**, and **non-GST** inward supply;

- Details of inter-state supplies made to **unregistered** persons.

  > ![GSTR-3B Report](india/gst-gstr-3b-report.png)

### Profit and Loss (IN) report

This is a `Profit and Loss`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} report
that displays the balances for **Opening Stock** and **Closing Stock**.
It helps users using Continental accounting to accurately determine the
cost of goods (i.e `Opening Stock`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} +
purchases during the period - `Closing Stock`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}).

> ![Profit and Loss report](india/profit-and-loss-report.png)

## TDS/TCS threshold alert {#india/tds-tcs-threshold}

`TDS (tax deducted at source)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} and
`TCS (tax collected at source)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} are tax
provisions under Indian law, triggered when transaction amounts exceed
specified thresholds. This alert notifies users when the value of
invoices or bills surpasses these limits, prompting the application of
the appropriate TDS/TCS.

To configure Odoo to advise you on when to apply TDS/TCS, set the
`TDS/TCS section`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field on the
corresponding account in the chart of accounts. Odoo will display a
banner suggesting the TDS/TCS section under which tax might be
applicable when recording an invoice or bill.

### Configuration

1.  Navigate to
    `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}
2.  In the `Indian Integration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    section, enable the `TDS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
    `TCS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} feature as required.
3.  Navigate to
    `Accounting --> Configuration --> Chart of Accounts`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}.
4.  Click `View`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the desired
    account, and set the `TDS/TCS Section`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} field.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The TDS/TCS sections are pre-configured with threshold limits. If you
need to modify these limits, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. In the `Advanced
Options`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, click on the
`fa-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(internal link)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon of the
`Section`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

![TDS/TCS section modify](india/tds-tcs-section-modify.png)
::::

### Applying TCS/TDS on invoices and bills

Based on the account used on the customer invoice or vendor bill, Odoo
checks the TCS/TDS threshold limit. If the limit specified in the
`TCS/TDS Section`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the account is
exceeded, Odoo displays an alert that suggests applying the appropriate
TCS/TDS. The alert will disappear once the TCS/TDS is applied.

![TCS advice](india/tcs-warning.png)

**TCS** is directly applicable in the tax on the invoice lines. To apply
**TDS**, click the `TDS Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart
button on the vendor bill/payment. The popup window allows specifying
the TDS details. Confirm the entry to apply the TDS.

![TDS application](india/tds-apply.png)

In Odoo, the aggregate total is calculated for partners sharing the same
PAN number, across all company branches.

::: example
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  **Branch**   **Customer**       **Invoice**   **Transaction      **PAN Number**
                                                Amount (â‚¹)**       
  ------------ ------------------ ------------- ------------------ --------------
  IN - MH      XYZ Enterprise -   Invoice 1     â‚¹50,000            ABCPX1234E
               GJ                                                  

  IN - MH      XYZ Enterprise -   Invoice 2     â‚¹30,000            ABCPX1234E
               GJ                                                  

  IN - MH      XYZ Enterprise -   Invoice 3     â‚¹40,000            ABCPX1234E
               MH                                                  

  IN - DL      XYZ Enterprise -   Invoice 4     â‚¹20,000            ABCPX1234E
               GJ                                                  

  IN - GJ      XYZ Enterprise -   Invoice 5     â‚¹60,000            ABCPX1234E
               MH                                                  
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

- **Aggregate total** = 50,000 + 30,000 + 40,000 + 20,000 + 60,000 =
  â‚¹200,000
- The aggregate total for all customers (XYZ Enterprise - GJ, MH, DL)
  sharing the PAN number ABCPX1234E across all branches is â‚¹200,000.
:::
