# Indonesia

## Modules {#localizations/indonesia/modules}

The following modules related to the Indonesian localization are
available:

  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name                                               Technical name                          Description
  -------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------- -----------------------------------
  `Indonesian - Accounting`{.interpreted-text        [l10n_id]{.title-ref}                   This module includes the default
  role="guilabel"}                                                                           fiscal localization package.

  `Indonesia E-faktur`{.interpreted-text             [l10n_id_efaktur]{.title-ref}           This module includes the features
  role="guilabel"}                                                                           required to export invoices as
                                                                                             e-Faktur.

  `Indonesia E-faktur (Coretax)`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_id_efaktur_coretax]{.title-ref}   This module facilitates the
  role="guilabel"}                                                                           generation of XML files for the
                                                                                             Coretax system.
  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Configuration {#localizations/indonesia/configuration}

### Company {#localizations/indonesia/configuration-company}

Open the `Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} app, go to the
`Companies <../../general/companies>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
section, and click
`Update Info <general/companies/company>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
Ensure the `NPWP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field contains the
**Tax Identification Number**, as an e-Faktur cannot be generated from
an invoice otherwise.

### Contacts {#localizations/indonesia/configuration-contacts}

To configure a partner for e-Faktur, go to their
`contact <../../essentials/contacts>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} form
and fill in the following Indonesian-specific fields:

- `Is PKP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Check this box to allow
  e-Faktur generation for the partner.
- `NPWP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the partner\'s Tax
  Identification Number.
- `NIK`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the partner does not have
  an `NPWP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, enter the
  `NIK`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
  `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab under
  `Indonesian taxes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

### Products {#localizations/indonesia/configuration-products}

To set a product\'s E-Faktur product code, go to
`Accounting --> Customers -->
Products`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and access the desired
product form. In the `Indonesian Localization`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, select a code in the
`E-Faktur Product code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. By
default, the code is set to `000000 - Barang`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Product with the E-Faktur Product Code.](indonesia/efaktur_product.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`E-Faktur product codes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are
pre-generated by Odoo and cannot be edited. Select a code from the
available options.
::::

#### E-Faktur UoM Code {#localizations/indonesia/configuration-uom-code}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Go to `Inventory --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to make sure the
`Units of Measure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option has been
enabled.
::::

To configure the `E-Faktur UoM code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
go to `Inventory --> Configuration
--> UoM Categories`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Open a
category and select the appropriate
`E-Faktur UoM Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the options.

![E-Faktur UoM.](indonesia/efaktur_uom.png)

## Accounting {#localizations/indonesia/accounting}

### E-invoicing {#localizations/indonesia/e-invoicing}

#### Generate an E-Faktur XML {#localizations/indonesia/e-faktur-xml}

An e-Faktur can be created for an invoice if the customer\'s country is
Indonesia and the `Is PKP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox
is enabled on their `contact
<localizations/indonesia/configuration-contacts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} form.

To generate an e-Faktur XML:

1.  Go to `Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and `create an invoice
    <accounting/invoice/creation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

2.  In the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, under
    the `Electronic Tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
    select a `Kode Transaksi`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code.

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    The `Kode Transaksi`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} codes are
    pre-generated by Odoo and cannot be edited.
    ::::

3.  After confirming the invoice, click the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text
    role="icon"} `(Actions)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon and
    select `Download e-faktur`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

The downloaded XML file can then be uploaded to the Coretax system.
After the file is generated, the
`e-Faktur Document (Coretax)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field
in the invoice\'s `Electronic Tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section is populated automatically.

> ![Invoice with E-Faktur Document.](indonesia/faktur_invoice_confirmed.png)
>
> :::: note
> ::: title
> Note
> :::
>
> To create a batch XML file for several invoices, select them in the
> invoice list view and choose `Download e-faktur`{.interpreted-text
> role="guilabel"} from the `Actions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
> menu.
> ::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

\- The tax invoice number is generated by the Coretax system, not by
Odoo. - Once an e-Faktur XML file has been downloaded, it cannot be
changed. Any subsequent download will retrieve the original file.
::::

## QRIS QR code on invoices {#localizations/indonesia/qris}

[QRIS](https://qris.online/homepage/) is a digital payment system that
allows customers to make payments by scanning the QR code from their
preferred e-wallet.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

According to the [QRIS API
documentation](https://qris.online/api-doc/create-invoice.php), QRIS
expires after 30 minutes. Due to this restriction, the QR code is not
included in reports sent to customers and is only available on the
customer portal.
::::

### Activate QR codes {#localizations/indonesia/qris-activate-qr-code}

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Under the `Customer
Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, activate the
`QR Codes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} feature.

### QRIS bank account configuration {#localizations/indonesia/qris-bank-account-config}

Go to `Contacts --> Configuration --> Bank Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and select the bank account for which you want to
activate QRIS. Set the `QRIS API Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and `QRIS Merchant ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} based on the
information provided by QRIS.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The account holder\'s country must be set to [Indonesia]{.title-ref} on
its contact form.
::::

![QRIS bank account configuration](indonesia/qris-setup.png)

::: seealso
`../accounting/bank`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Bank journal configuration {#localizations/indonesia/qris-bank-journal-configuration}

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, open the bank journal, then fill out the
`Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} under the
`Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

![Bank journal configuration](indonesia/journal-bank-config.png)

### Issue invoices with QRIS QR codes {#localizations/indonesia/qris-invoices}

When creating a new invoice, open the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab and set the `Payment
QR-code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option to
`QRIS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Select QRIS QR-code option](indonesia/invoice-qris.png)

Ensure that the `Recipient Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
the one you configured, as Odoo uses this field to generate the QRIS QR
code.




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/italy.md ---

# Italy

## Configuration {#italy/modules}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Italian localization:

  Name                                Technical name                          Description
  ----------------------------------- --------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Italy - Accounting                  [l10n_it]{.title-ref}                   Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  Italy - E-invoicing                 [l10n_it_edi]{.title-ref}               E-invoice implementation
  Italy - E-invoicing (Withholding)   [l10n_it_edi_withholding]{.title-ref}   E-invoice withholding
  Italy - Accounting Reports          [l10n_it_reports]{.title-ref}           Country-specific reports
  Italy - Stock DDT                   [l10n_it_stock_ddt]{.title-ref}         Transport documents - Documento di Trasporto (DDT)

::: seealso
`Documentation on e-invoicingâ€™s legality and compliance in Italy
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/italy>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Company information

Configuring the company\'s information ensures your Accounting database
is properly set up. To add information, go to
`Settings --> General Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
and in the `Companies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, click
`Update info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. From here, fill out
the fields:

- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the address of the
  company;
- `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: VAT of the company;
- `Codice Fiscale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the fiscal code
  of the company;
- `Tax System`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the tax system under
  which the company falls;

![Company information to be provided](italy/company.png)

### Taxes configuration

Many of the e-invoicing features are implemented using Odoo\'s tax
system. As such, taxes must be properly configured to generate invoices
correctly and handle other billing use cases.

The **Italian** localization contains predefined **examples** of taxes
for various purposes.

#### Tax exemption {#italy/tax-exemption}

The use of sale taxes that amount to **zero percent** (0%) is required
by Italian authorities to keep track of the exact
`Tax Exemption Kind (Natura)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Law Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} that justify the
exemption operated on an invoice line.

::: example
The export tax in the EU can be used as reference ([0% EU]{.title-ref},
invoice label [00eu]{.title-ref}). It can be found under
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Exports are exempt from VAT, and therefore, they
require `Exoneration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} kind and
`Law Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} filled in.
:::

![Tax Exemption Settings](italy/tax-exemption.png)

::: seealso
There are many `Tax Exemption Kind (Natura)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Law Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
codes. Make sure you check the latest version available to get the
latest information on:

- [Italian authorities
  documentation](https://www.agenziaentrate.gov.it/portale/web/guest/aree-tematiche/fatturazione-elettronica)
- [Official guide on Tax
  exemption](https://www.agenziaentrate.gov.it/portale/documents/20143/451259/Guida_compilazione-FE-Esterometro-V_1.9_2024-03-05.pdf/67fe4c2d-1174-e8de-f1ee-cea77b7f5203)
:::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If you need to use a different kind of exoneration, go to
`Accounting -->
Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, select
a similar tax, then click on the cog icon and select
`Duplicate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In the
`Advanced Options`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, add the
`Exoneration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Law Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To confirm click on
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

**Rename** your taxes in the `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field according to their `Exoneration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to differentiate them easily.
::::

## Reverse charge {#italy/reverse-charge}

The **reverse charge** mechanism is a VAT rule that shifts the liability
to pay VAT from the supplier to the customer. The customers pay the VAT
*themselves* to the `AdE (Agenzia delle
Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} instead. There are different
types:

- | `Internal Reverse Charge`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (for
    domestic sales)
  | The VAT responsibility is shifted to the buyer for certain
    categories of products and services.

- | `External Reverse Charge`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (for
    intra-EU sales)
  | VAT is due in the country of the delivery or in the country where
    the service is performed. When the buyer is itself an Italian
    business, then the EU offers a mechanism that allows the seller to
    transfer his responsibility to the buyer.

### Invoices

**Reverse-charged** customer invoices show no VAT amount, but the
`AdE (Agenzia delle
Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} requires the seller to specify
the `Tax Exemption`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} reason and the
`Law
Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} that enable the
reverse-charge mechanism. Odoo provides a set of special 0% taxes that
can be assigned to each reverse-charged invoice lines, representing the
most commonly used configurations.

### Vendor bills

Italian companies subjected to Reverse Charge must send the information
in the bill received to the
`AdE (Agenzia delle Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Self-reported VAT XML files must be issued and sent to the
`AdE (Agenzia Delle Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} for reverse
charged bills.
::::

When creating a vendor bill, **reverse charge** taxes are available to
be added in the `Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. You
can check which taxes are available by going to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, you can see that the 10% Goods and 22% Services
taxes are activated, among others. Due to the automated configuration of
the Italian fiscal position, these are automatically activated in the
tax list.

### Tax grids {#italy/grids}

The Italian localization has a specific
`tax grid <accounting/tax-returns/tax-grids>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} section for **reverse charge** taxes. These tax grids are
identifiable by the `VJ <italy/grids>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
tag, and can be found by going to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Audit Reports: Tax
Report`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

![Reverse charge tax grid from the VJ section of the Tax Declaration](italy/grids.png)

## E-invoicing {#italy/e-invoicing}

The `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is
the `electronic invoicing
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} system used in Italy. It enables the sending and receiving
of electronic invoices to and from customers. The documents must be in
an XML `EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} format called **FatturaPA** and formally validated by the
system before being delivered.

To be able to receive invoices and notifications, the
`SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} service
must be notified that the user\'s files need to be sent to Odoo and
processed on their behalf. To do so, you must set up Odoo\'s
`Destination Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the
`AdE (Agenzia Delle
Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal.

1.  Go to [Italian authorities
    portal](https://ivaservizi.agenziaentrate.gov.it/portale) and
    authenticate;
2.  Go to section `Fatture e Corrispettivi`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"};
3.  Set the user as Legal Party for the VAT number you wish to configure
    the electronic address;
4.  In
    `Servizi Disponibili --> Fatturazione Elettronica --> Registrazione
    dellâ€™indirizzo telematico dove ricevere tutte le fatture elettroniche`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, insert Odoo\'s
    `Destination Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    [K95IV18]{.title-ref}, and confirm.

### EDI Mode and authorization

Since the files are transmitted through Odoo\'s server before being sent
to the `SdI (Sistema
di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} or received by your
database, you need to authorize Odoo to process your files from your
database. To do so, go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings -->
Electronic Document Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

There are three modes available:

- | `Demo`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  | This mode simulates an environment in which invoices are sent to the
    government. In this mode, invoices need to be *manually* downloaded
    as XML files and uploaded to the
    `AdE  (Agenzia delle Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}\'s
    website.

- | `Test (experimental)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  | This mode sends invoices to a non-production (i.e., test) service
    made available by the
    `AdE (Agenzia delle Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. Saving
    this change directs all companies on the database to use this
    configuration.

- | `Official`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  | This is a production mode that sends your invoices directly to the
    `AdE (Agenzia delle  Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

Once a mode is selected, you need to accept the **terms and conditions**
by ticking `Allow
Odoo to process invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and then
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. You can now record your
transactions in Odoo Accounting.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Selecting either `Test (experimental)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} or `Official`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
**irreversible**. For example, once in `Official`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} mode, it is not possible to select `Test
(experimental)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Demo`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. We recommend creating a
**separate database** for testing purposes only.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When in `Test (Experimental)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} mode,
all invoices sent *must* have a partner using one of the following fake
`Destination Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} given by the
`AdE (Agenzia Delle
Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}: [0803HR0]{.title-ref} -
[N8MIMM9]{.title-ref} - [X9XX79Z]{.title-ref}. Any real production
`Codice Destinario`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of your customers
will not be recognized as valid by the test service.
::::

![Electronic document invoicing settings](italy/edi.png)

### Process {#italy/e-invoicing-process}

The submission of invoices to the
`SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} for Italy
is an electronic process used for the mandatory transmission of tax
documents in XML format between companies and the
`AdE (Agenzia delle Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} to reduce
errors and verify the correctness of operations.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

You can check the current status of an invoice by the
`SdI State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. The XML file is
attached to the invoice.
::::

![EDI system architecture](italy/edi-process.png)

#### XML Documents creation

Odoo generates the required XML files as attachments to invoices in the
[FatturaPA]{.title-ref} format required by the
`AdE (Agenzia delle Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. Once the
invoices needed are selected, go to `Action`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and click on `Send and Print`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Send and Print menu](italy/edi-menu.png)

When the pop-up window opens there is a selection of actions that can be
taken. `Generate
XML File`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} generates the attachments.

![Send and Print dialog](italy/edi-send-and-print.png)

The XML file as well as the PDF once can be found attached to the
invoice.

![EDI Attachments](italy/edi-attachments.png)

#### Submission to SDI

The `Send to Tax Agency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option in
the `Send and Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dialog sends the
attachment to the `Proxy Server`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
which gathers all requests and then forwards them via a WebServices
channel to the `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. Check the sending status of the invoice through the
`Check Sending`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button at the top of
the invoice\'s view.

#### Processing by SDI

The `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
receives the document and verifies for any errors. At this stage, the
invoice is in the `SdI Processing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
state, as shown on the invoice. The invoice also gets assigned a
`FatturaPA Transaction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} number that
is shown in the `Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab. The checks may take variable time, ranging from a
few seconds up to a day, depending on the queue of invoices sent
throughout Italy.

![Check Sending button and Sdi Processing state](italy/edi-processing.png)

#### Acceptance

If the document is valid, it is recorded and considered fiscally valid
by the `AdE (Agenzia
delle Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, which will proceed with
archiving in `Substitute Storage (Conservazione
Sostitutiva)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if explicitly requested
on the Agency\'s portal.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Odoo does not offer the [Conservazione
Sostitutiva](https://www.agid.gov.it/index.php/it/piattaforme/conservazione)
requirements. Other providers and
`AdE (Agenzia delle Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} supply free
and certified storage to meet the specifications requested by law.
::::

The `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
`Destination Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} attempts to
forward the invoice to the customer at the provided address, whether it
is a [PEC]{.title-ref} email address or a
`SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
`Destination Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for their ERP\'s
WebServices channels. A maximum of 6 attempts are made every 12 hours,
so even if unsuccessful, this process can take up to three days. The
invoice status is
`Accepted by SDI, Forwarding to Partner`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

#### Possible Rejection

The `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} may
find inaccuracies in the compilation, possibly even formal ones. In this
case, the invoice is in the `SDI Rejected`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} state. The `SdI
(Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}\'s
observations are inserted at the top of the Invoice tab. To resolve the
issue, it is sufficient to delete the attachments of the invoice, return
the invoice to `Draft`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and fix the
errors. Once the invoice is ready, it can be resent.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To regenerate the XML, both the XML attachment and the PDF report must
be deleted, so that they are then regenerated together. This ensures
that both always contain the same data.
::::

![EDI Rejected State](italy/edi-rejected.png)

#### Forwarding Completed

The invoice has been delivered to the customer; however, you can still
send a copy to the customer in PDF via email or post. Its status is
`Accepted by SDI, Delivered to Partner`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

If the `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
cannot contact your customer, they may not be registered on the
`AdE (Agenzia delle Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal. In
this case, just make sure to send the invoice in PDF via email or by
mail. The invoice is then in the `Accepted by SDI,
Partner Delivery Failed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} state.

### Tax Integration

When you receive a vendor bill, either from
`SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, from
paper or from an imported XML file, the Tax Agency might request that
you send some tax information integration back to the
`SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. It
happens when a transaction that was tax exempt becomes taxable for any
reason.

::: example
Here is a non-exhaustive list:

- | `italy/reverse-charge`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  | As a buyer, you have to pay taxes on what you buy and integrate tax
    information. `Reverse Charge`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    taxes.

- | `italy/split-payment`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  | As a `PA (Public Administration)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
    business buyer, you have to pay taxes and integrate tax information.
    Be sure that you replace the `0% Sale Taxes`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} on the vendor bill you received with the correct
    `Split Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} taxes.

- | `Self Consumption`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  | When, as a business owner, you use an asset that you bought for
    business for personal reasons instead, you have to pay those taxes
    you originally deducted as a business cost for it.
:::

Odoo may detect that your vendor bill can be interpreted as a document
of a type that needs tax integration, as detailed in the
`italy/document-types`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} section.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Be sure that you replace the `0% Sale Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} on the vendor bill you received with the ones you\'re
supposed to pay to the `AdE (Agenzia delle Entrate)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. A button then appears on the top of the single vendor bill
form to send them.

When clicking on the `Send Tax Integration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button, an XML file of the appropriate
`Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is generated,
attached to the bill, and sent as for invoices.

![EDI Send Tax Integration button](italy/edi-tax-integration-button.png)
::::

### Document Types {#italy/document-types}

The `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
requires businesses to send customer invoices and other documents
through the `EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

The following `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} codes
all technically identify different business use cases.

#### TD01 - Invoices

This represents the standard **domestic** scenario for all invoices
exchanged through the `SdI
(Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. Any invoice
that doesn\'t fall into one of the specific special cases is categorized
as a regular invoice, identified by the
`Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} [TD01]{.title-ref}.

#### TD02 - Down payments

**Down payment** invoices are imported/exported with a different
`Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code
[TDO2]{.title-ref} than regular invoices. Upon import of the invoice, a
regular vendor bill is created.

Odoo exports transactions as [TD02]{.title-ref} if the following
conditions are met:

1.  It is an invoice;
2.  All invoice lines are related to down payment sales order lines.

#### TD04 - Credit notes

It is the standard scenario for all **credit notes** issued to
**domestic** clients, when we need to formally acknowledge that the
seller is reducing or cancelling a previously issued invoice, for
example, in case of overbilling, incorrect items, or overpayment. Just
like invoices, they must be sent to the
`SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, their
`Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} [TD04]{.title-ref}

#### TD07, TD08, TD09 - Simplified Invoicing

Simplified invoices ([TD07]{.title-ref}), credit notes
([TD08]{.title-ref}), and debit notes ([TD09]{.title-ref}) can be used
to certify domestic transactions under 400 EUR (VAT included). Its
status is the same as that of a regular invoice, but with fewer
information requirements.

For a simplified invoice to be established, it must include:

1.  `Customer Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} reference:
    **unique** numbering sequence with **no gaps**;
2.  `Invoice Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: issue **date** of
    the invoice;
3.  `Company Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the **seller**\'s
    full credentials (VAT/TIN number, name, full address) under
    `General Settings --> Companies (section)`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"};
4.  `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the **buyer**\'s VAT/TIN
    number (on the partner form);
5.  `Total`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the total **amount**
    (VAT included) of the invoice.

In the `EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, Odoo exports invoices as simplified if:

1.  It is a domestic transaction (i.e., the partner is from Italy);
2.  Your company\'s **required fields** (`VAT Number`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} or `Codice Fiscale`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, `Fiscal Regime`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, and full **address**) are provided;
3.  The partner\'s address is not fully specified (i.e., it misses the
    City or the ZipCode);
4.  The total amount of VAT included is **less** than **400 EUR**.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The 400 EUR threshold was defined in [the decree of the 10th of May 2019
in the Gazzetta
Ufficiale](https://www.gazzettaufficiale.it/eli/id/2019/05/24/19A03271/sg).
We advise you to check the current official value.
::::

#### TD16 - Internal Reverse Charge

Internal reverse charge transactions (see
`italy/tax-exemption`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and
`italy/reverse-charge`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}) are exported as
[TD16]{.title-ref} if the following conditions are met:

- It is a vendor bill;
- It has at least **one tax** on the invoice lines that targets one of
  these `tax grids
  <italy/grids>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}: [VJ6]{.title-ref},
  [VJ7]{.title-ref}, [VJ8]{.title-ref}, [VJ12]{.title-ref},
  [VJ13]{.title-ref}, [VJ14]{.title-ref}, [VJ15]{.title-ref},
  [VJ16]{.title-ref}, [VJ17]{.title-ref}

#### TD17 - Buying services from abroad

When buying **services** from **EU** and **non-EU** countries, the
foreign *seller* invoices a service with a **VAT-excluded** price, as it
is not taxable in Italy. The VAT is paid by the *buyer* in Italy.

- Within the EU: the *buyer* integrates the invoice received with the
  **VAT information** due in Italy (i.e., **vendor bill tax
  integration**);
- Non-EU: the *buyer* sends themselves an invoice (i.e.,
  **self-billing**).

Odoo exports a transaction as [TD17]{.title-ref} if the following
conditions are met:

- It is a vendor bill;
- It has at least **one tax** on the invoice lines that targets the tax
  grid `VJ3
  <italy/grids>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"};
- All invoice lines either have `Services`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} as **products**, or a tax with the
  `Services`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as **tax scope**.

#### TD18 - Buying goods from EU

Invoices issued within the EU follow a **standard format**, therefore
only an integration of the existing invoice is required.

Odoo exports a transaction as [TD18]{.title-ref} if the following
conditions are met:

- It is a vendor bill;
- The **partner** is from an **EU** country;
- It has at least one tax on the invoice lines that targets the tax grid
  `VJ9 <italy/grids>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"};
- All invoice lines either have `Consumable`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} as **products**, or a tax with
  `Goods`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as **tax scope**.

#### TD19 - Buying goods from VAT deposit

Buying **goods** from a **foreign** vendor, but the **goods** are
already in **Italy** in a **VAT deposit**.

- From the EU: the *buyer* integrates the invoice received with the
  **VAT information** due in Italy (i.e., **vendor bill tax
  integration**);
- Non-EU: the *buyer* sends an invoice to *themselves* (i.e.,
  **self-billing**).

Odoo exports a transaction as a [TD19]{.title-ref} if the following
conditions are met:

- It is a vendor bill;
- It has at least one tax on the invoice lines that targets the tax grid
  `VJ3 <italy/grids>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"};
- All invoice lines either have `Consumables`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} as products, or a tax with `Goods`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} as **tax scope**.

#### TD24 - Deferred invoices

The **deferred invoice** is an invoice that is **issued at a later
time** than the sale of goods or the provision of services. A **deferred
invoice** has to be issued at the latest within the **15th day** of the
month following the delivery covered by the document.

It usually is a **summary invoice** containing a list of multiple sales
of goods or services carried out in the month. The business is allowed
to **group** the sales into **one invoice**, generally issued at the
**end of the month** for accounting purposes. Deferred invoices are
default for **wholesalers** having recurrent clients.

If the goods are transported by a **carrier**, every delivery has an
associated **Documento di Transporto (DDT)**, or **Transport Document**.
The deferred invoice **must** indicate the details of all the **DDTs**
information for better tracing.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

E-invoicing of deferred invoices requires the
[l10n_it_stock_ddt]{.title-ref}
`module <italy/modules>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. In this case, a
dedicated `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
[TD24]{.title-ref} is used in the e-invoice.
::::

Odoo exports transactions as [TD24]{.title-ref} if the following
conditions are met:

1.  It is an invoice;
2.  It is associated with deliveries whose **DDTs** have a **different**
    date than the issue date of the invoice.

#### TD28 - San Marino

##### Invoices

San Marino and Italy have special agreements on e-invoicing operations.
As such, **invoices** follow the regular **reverse charge** rules. You
can use the proper `Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
depending on the invoice type: [TD01]{.title-ref}, [TD04]{.title-ref},
[TD05]{.title-ref}, [TD24]{.title-ref}, [TD25]{.title-ref}. Additional
requirements are not enforced by Odoo. However, the user is requested by
the **State** to:

- Select a tax with the `Tax Exemption Kind`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} set to [N3.3]{.title-ref};
- Use the generic `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} `Destination Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  [2R4GTO8]{.title-ref}.

The invoice is then routed by a dedicated office in San Marino to the
correct business.

##### Vendor Bills

When a **paper bill** is received from San Marino, any Italian company
**must** submit that invoice to the
`AdE (Agenzia delle Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} by
indicating the e-invoice\'s `Document Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field with the special value [TD28]{.title-ref}.

Odoo exports a transaction as [TD28]{.title-ref} if the following
conditions are met:

1.  It is a vendor bill;
2.  It has at least one tax on the invoice lines that targets the tax
    grids `VJ <italy/grids>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"};
3.  The **country** of the partner is **San Marino**.

## Public Administration Businesses (B2G)

`PA (Public Administration)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} businesses
are subjected to more control than private businesses as they handle
public money coming from taxpayers. The
`EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
process adds some steps to the
`regular one <italy/e-invoicing-process>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
as `PA (Public
Administration)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} businesses can
**accept** or **refuse** invoices.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`PA (Public Administration)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} businesses
have a 6-digit long `Destination Code`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, also called
`CUU (Codice Univoco Ufficio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, that is
**mandatory**, **PEC** address cannot be used in this case.
::::

::: seealso
[Complete list of businesses that belong to the Public Administration
along with their Destination
Code](https://www.agenziaentrate.gov.it/portale/web/guest/aree-tematiche/fatturazione-elettronica)
:::

### CIG, CUP, DatiOrdineAcquisto

To ensure the effective traceability of payments by public
administrations, electronic invoices issued to public administrations
must contain:

- The `CIG (Codice Identificativo Gara)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
  except in cases of exclusion from traceability obligations provided by
  law n. 136 of August 13, 2010;
- The `CUP (Codice Unico di Progetto)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
  in case of invoices related to public works.

If the XML file requires it, the
`AdE (Agenzia Delle Entrate)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} can *only*
proceed payments of electronic invoices when the XML file contains a
`CIG (Codice Identificativo Gara)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} and
`CUP (Codice Unico di Progetto)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `CUP (Codice Unico di Progetto)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} and
the `CIG (Codice Identificativo Gara)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
must be included in one of the [DatiOrdineAcquisto]{.title-ref},
[DatiContratto]{.title-ref}, [DatiConvenzione]{.title-ref},
[DateRicezione]{.title-ref}, or [DatiFattureCollegate]{.title-ref} XML
tags.

These correspond to the elements named `CodiceCUP`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `CodiceCIG`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of
the electronic invoice XML file, whose table can be found on the
government [website](http://www.fatturapa.gov.it/).
::::

### Split Payment {#italy/split-payment}

The `Split Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} mechanism behaves
much like `italy/reverse-charge`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

::: example
When an Italian company bills a
`PA (Public Administration)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} business -
for example, cleaning services for a public building - the
`PA (Public Administration)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} business
self-reports the VAT to the Tax Agency themselves, and the vendor just
has to select the appropriate tax with the right
`Tax Exemption`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for their invoice
lines.
:::

The specific `Scissione dei Pagamenti`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} fiscal position is available to deal with partners
belonging to the `PA (Public Administration)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

### Process

#### Qualified electronic signature {#italy/digital-signature}

Invoices and bills intended for the
`PA (Public Administration)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} must include
a **qualified electronic signature** when submitted through the
`SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. This
signature is automatically applied in the
`XAdES (XML Advanced Electronic Signature)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} format when the invoice\'s partner has a 6-digit long
`Destination Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (which indicates a
`PA (Public Administration)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} business).

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When such an invoice is transmitted to the Tax Agency, the generated
[.xml]{.title-ref} file is signed on the Odoo servers, returned to the
database, and attached to the invoice automatically.
::::

#### Acceptance or Refusal

After receiving the invoice through the
`SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, the
`PA (Public
Administration)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} business has 15 days to
accept the invoice. If it does, then the process ends here. If the
`PA (Public Administration)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} business
refuses the invoice, it is still considered valid once it is accepted by
the `SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. You
then have to issue a credit note to compensate and send it to the
`SdI (Sistema di Interscambio)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

#### Expired Terms

If the `PA (Public Administration)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
business doesn\'t reply within 15 days, you need to contact the
`PA (Public Administration)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} business
directly, sending them both the invoice and the received deadline
notification by email. You can make an arrangement with them and
manually set the correct `SdI State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
on your invoice.

## Point of Sale fiscal printers

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Fiscal printers are distinct from `ePOS printers
</applications/sales/point_of_sale/configuration/epos_printers>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. The IP address for a fiscal printer should not be entered
in the ePOS IP address settings.
::::

Fiscal regulations mandate using certified RT devices, such as RT
printers or RT servers, to ensure compliant sales receipts and secure
communication with the Tax Authority. These devices automatically
transmit fiscal data daily. RT printers, designed for individual POS
terminals, handle transactions, print receipts, and report to the
authorities, ensuring data integrity and compliance.

### Simulation mode

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Since the simulation mode sends data to the authorities, it should only
be enabled at the very start of the printer\'s configuration process.
Once the printer is switched to the production mode, it cannot be
reverted to the simulation mode.
::::

To test the fiscal printer setup with Odoo, configure the fiscal printer
in the simulation mode as follows:

1.  Make sure the fiscal printer is set to its default state: printer
    on, start-up cycle complete, and no transaction in progress.
2.  Type [3333]{.title-ref}.
3.  Press `Chiave`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The screen
    displays `Scelta Funzione`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
4.  Type [14]{.title-ref}. The screen displays
    `Apprendimento`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
5.  Type [62]{.title-ref}. The screen displays
    `Simulazione`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
6.  To turn the `no`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} into a
    `si`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, press `X`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
7.  To confirm, press `Contante`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
8.  Press `Chiave`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

To configure the printer for production, repeat the steps above.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To test the printer configuration, the physical device must first be
obtained and registered with the relevant authorities.
::::

### Setting up the printer to work with Odoo

Fiscal printers are meant to work only in the local network. This means
the printer and the device running
`Odoo Point of Sale </applications/sales/point_of_sale>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} must be connected to the same network.

Fiscal printers are typically configured to use HTTP by default. To
ensure compatibility with Odoo, the settings must be updated to enable
HTTPS support on the printer. This can be done using either the
EpsonFPWizard configuration software or the keyboard connected to the
printer.

To set up the fiscal printer using the keyboard, follow these steps:

1.  Make sure the fiscal printer is set to its default state: printer
    on, start-up cycle complete, and no transaction in progress.
2.  Type [3333]{.title-ref}.
3.  Press `Chiave`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The screen
    displays `Scelta Funzione`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
4.  Type [34]{.title-ref}. The screen displays
    `Web Server`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
5.  Press `Contante`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} 3 times until
    the screen displays `Web Server: SSL`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
6.  To turn the value [0]{.title-ref} into a [1]{.title-ref}, press
    `X`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
7.  To confirm, press `Contante`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} 3
    times.
8.  Press `Chiave`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Then, log in to the printer with the device that runs
`Odoo Point of Sale
</applications/sales/point_of_sale>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} so it
recognizes the printer\'s certificate.

To approve and install the printer\'s certificate, follow these steps:

1.  Access the printer by opening a web browser and entering
    [https://\<ip-of-your-printer\>]{.title-ref} in the address bar. A
    `Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} security message appears.
2.  Click `Advanced`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to show the
    certificate approval options.
3.  Click `Proceed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to validate the
    certificate.

Then, to ensure
`Odoo Point of Sale </applications/sales/point_of_sale>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is configured with the fiscal printer, go to
`Point of Sale --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. In the `Connected Devices`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, add the IP address in the
`Italian Fiscal Printer
IP address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and enable
`Use HTTPS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

## Ri.Ba. (Ricevuta Bancaria)

`Ri.Ba. (Ricevuta Bancaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is a payment
method widely used in Italy where vendors request payments through their
bank, which forwards the request to the customer\'s own bank and takes
responsibility for the collection. This enables payment automation and
reduces risks for the vendor.

The vendor generally uploads a fixed-format text file with the list of
payments to the bank\'s web portal.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Ri.Ba. are exclusively for **domestic payments** in Italy. For
recurring international payments, please use [SEPA Direct Debt
(SDD)](../accounting/payments/batch_sdd)
::::

### Configuration

1.  Check that the [l10n_it_riba]{.title-ref} module is
    `installed <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

2.  Go to
    `Settings --> Users & Companies --> Companies`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and select the company that will use Ri.Ba.

3.  Fill out the required `SIA Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

    ![The company\'s SIA code](italy/sia-code.png)

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    The `SIA Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} identifies
    businesses within the Italian banking network and is used to receive
    money through specific payment methods. It consists of one letter
    and four digits (e.g., T1234) and can usually be found on the
    bank\'s portal or obtained by contacting the bank.
    ::::

4.  Ensure the Company\'s bank account has an Italian IBAN.

    ::: seealso
    How to configure
    `Bank Accounts <../accounting/bank>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
    :::

### Accept Ri.Ba. for your invoices

Payments of type `Ri.Ba. (Ricevuta Bancaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} can be registered from the `Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}
(`Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}).

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Make sure that your invoice involves a Partner that has a bank account
with an Italian IBAN.
::::

Then, all Payments must be grouped in a **Batch Payment**.

::: seealso
\- `Batch Payments <../accounting/payments>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} -
`Create a Batch Payment <../accounting/payments/batch>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

Once you press the `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
for the Batch Payment, the `Ri.Ba. (Ricevuta
Bancaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} file is generated and attached
to the Batch Payment, so you can download it and upload it through your
bank\'s web portal.

![The Ri.Ba. file attached](italy/riba-attachment.png)
