# Jordan

## Modules {#localizations_jordan/configuration/modules}

The following modules are installed automatically with the Jordanian
localization:

  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name                                      Technical name              Description
  ----------------------------------------- --------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Jordan - Accounting`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_jo]{.title-ref}       Jordanian
  role="guilabel"}                                                      `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text
                                                                        role="ref"}, complete with the Jordanian chart of accounts, taxes, tax report,
                                                                        and fiscal positions

  `Jordan E-Invoicing`{.interpreted-text    [l10n_jo_edi]{.title-ref}   Integration module for JoFotara to support Jordanian e-invoicing requirements
  role="guilabel"}                                                      
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In some cases, such as when upgrading to a version with additional
modules, it is possible that modules may not be installed automatically.
Any missing modules can be manually `installed
<general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

::: seealso
`Jordan Payroll localization documentation <../../hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/jordan>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Localization overview {#localizations/jordan/specifics}

The Jordanian localization package ensures compliance with Jordanian
fiscal and accounting regulations. It includes tools for managing taxes,
fiscal positions, reporting, and a predefined chart of accounts tailored
to Jordan\'s standards.

The Jordanian localization package provides the following key features
to ensure compliance with local fiscal and accounting regulations:

- `../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}: a predefined structure tailored to Jordanian accounting
  standards
- `localizations/jordan/taxes`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  pre-configured tax rates, including standard VAT, zero-rated, and
  exempt options
- `../accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}:
  automated tax adjustments based on customer or supplier registration
  status
- `localizations/jordan/tax-reporting`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  detailed overview of your net tax liability
- `E-invoicing (JoFotara)<localizations/jordan/jofotara>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: integration for electronic invoicing in line with
  Jordanian government requirements

### Taxes {#localizations/jordan/taxes}

The following `taxes <../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} are available by default with the Jordanian localization
package:

- standard sales tax (16%): applied to most goods and services within
  Jordan.
- exempt transactions: for sales and services not subject to VAT, such
  as financial services or healthcare.
- export tax (0%): zero-rated tax applied to goods and services exported
  outside Jordan.

### Tax reporting {#localizations/jordan/tax-reporting}

The
`VAT summary <../accounting/reporting/tax_returns>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} provides a detailed breakdown of taxable, zero-rated, and
exempt transactions. Like other `financial reports
<../accounting/reporting>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, the VAT
summary can be filtered by period, compared against other periods, and
exported in Excel and PDF formats, ensuring compliance with Jordanian
tax laws.

## E-invoicing with JoFotara {#localizations/jordan/jofotara}

E-invoicing with JoFotara is integrated with Odoo, ensuring compliance
with Jordanian government\'s technical and legal requirements for
electronic invoicing. The JoFotara integration in Odoo directly connects
with the Jordanian e-invoicing platform, allowing companies to:

- generate compliant electronic invoices
- submit invoices in real time for validation
- track invoice statuses directly within Odoo

The integration requires first creating an account with JoFotara, then
generating API credentials, and finally entering those credentials in
your Odoo database to link the two.

[Government
manuals](https://istd.gov.jo/EN/List/Electronic_billing_User_Manual)
provide instructions for creating an account and generating the API
credentials.

### Configuration {#localizations/jordan/jofotara-configuration}

#### Link Odoo to JoFotara {#localizations/jordan/linking-jofotara}

1.  If you don\'t already have an account, create one by going to the
    [government
    manuals](https://istd.gov.jo/EN/List/Electronic_billing_User_Manual)
    page and following the steps in the **Procedure Manual for Joining
    the Jordanian National Electronic Invoicing System**.
2.  Generate API credentials (Activity Number, Secret Key, and Client
    ID) by going to the [government
    manuals](https://istd.gov.jo/EN/List/Electronic_billing_User_Manual)
    page and following the steps in **Procedure Manual for Linking to
    the Jordanian National Electronic Invoicing System**.
3.  In your Odoo database, go to
    `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}. In the
    `Electronic Invoicing (Jordan)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    section, enter the API credentials generated previously:
    - `Activity Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (income
      source sequence)
    - `JoFotara Secret Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `JoFotara Client ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
4.  Enter the `Taxpayer type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    - `Unregistered in the sales tax`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}: for businesses not registered for sales tax. No
      tax on the invoice line is required.
    - `Registered in the sales tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      for businesses registered under the standard sales tax system. One
      tax computed as a percentage is required per invoice line.
    - `Registered in the special sales tax`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}: for businesses subject to special sales tax
      regulations. One tax computed as a percentage and one fixed tax
      per invoice line are required per invoice.
5.  Click `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If the `Electronic Invoicing (Jordan)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section is missing from the
`Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, make sure the
`Jordan E-Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} module is
`installed
<general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

#### Company and customers {#localizations/jordan/company-and-contacts}

The JoFotara invoicing workflow requires address information related to
the company that sends the invoices and the customers who receive them:

1.  Go to
    `Settings --> Users & Companies --> Companies`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and select the company that will use JoFotara.

2.  Fill in the `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (TIN), and
    `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. If desired, fill in
    additional optional fields such as `Street`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

    :::: important
    ::: title
    Important
    :::

    - The `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be set to
      `Jordan`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

    \- The `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must match
    the name that is registered with the Income and Sales Tax Department
    (ISTD).
    - The company\'s `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must
      be set to `JOD`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    ::::

3.  Go to `Accounting --> Customers --> Customers`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}.

4.  For each customer whose invoices will be sent to JoFotara, click on
    the customer to open the form view, and complete the
    `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. If desired, fill in
    additional optional fields such as `Street`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

### Sending invoices to JoFotara via Odoo {#localizations/jordan/sending-invoices}

Once the company has been
`linked with JoFotara <localizations/jordan/linking-jofotara>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and the `company and customers have been properly configured
<localizations/jordan/company-and-contacts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, invoices can be sent to JoFotara via Odoo:

1.  Go to `Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and open a confirmed (posted) invoice.
2.  Click `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
3.  In the `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, select
    `JoFotara (Jordan EDI)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and click
    `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

When an invoice is sent to JoFotara, Odoo does the following:

- generates the invoice in the required format (UBL 1.2)
- submits the invoice to JoFotara for validation
- receives the QR code from JoFotara on the invoice\'s PDF

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- Multiple invoices can be
`sent at once <accounting/invoice/sending>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} to JoFotara. - From the `Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} list view, filter the invoices by their
`localizations/jordan/jofotara-state`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to
see the invoices that have either been sent or not been sent to
JoFotara. - In the `oi-settings-adjust`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
(`adjust settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) menu, add the
`JoFotara State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`JoFotara Error`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields to see the
sending state and any errors in the list view, respectively.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

There is an inherent difference in how values are approximated in Odoo
and ISTD due to the differing system architectures. JOD values in Odoo
are stored and approximated to three decimals, whereas ISTD expects
values to have nine decimals. As a result, an insignificant difference
is inevitable and arises between the values stores in Odoo and the
values reported to ISTD, which can have an error margin of \<0.001.
::::

#### JoFotara State {#localizations/jordan/jofotara-state}

The `JoFotara State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field in the
`Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of confirmed
invoices reflects the current state of the document in JoFotara. It can
be changed manually to reflect the actual state of the invoices in cases
where a technical error or timeout prevents Odoo from updating it
automatically.

#### Validating QR codes (Sanad app) {#localizations/jordan/qr-codes}

To validate the QR code received from JoFotara on the invoice, follow
these steps:

1.  Install the [Sanad app](https://www.sanad.gov.jo/Default/en).
2.  Navigate to `More`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
3.  Click on `Validate document`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    scan the QR code.
4.  Review results.

#### Debit and credit notes {#localizations/jordan/debit-credit}

To send a debit or credit note to JoFotara, first create the `debit
<accounting/credit_notes/issue-debit-note>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} or `credit note
<accounting/credit_notes/issue-credit-note>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. In the `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window,
click `JoFotara (Jordan EDI)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
submit it for real-time validation. Upon successful validation, the QR
code from JoFotara is embedded in the debit or credit note PDF.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Ensure that the `Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for
generating a debit/credit note aligns with ISTD regulations.
::::

#### Discounts {#localizations/jordan/discounts}

JoFotara does not support negative quantities or negative prices on
invoice lines. As a result, global discount and fixed amount discount
functionality are not supported.

Discounts must be applied **per invoice line as a percentage** instead
of as a global discount or fixed amount.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Attempting to submit invoices to JoFotara with negative invoice lines
will result in validation errors.
::::

::: seealso
`Discount types <sales/discounts/discount-button>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/kenya.md ---

# Kenya

## Configuration {#localization/kenya/configuration}

Install the ðŸ‡°ðŸ‡ª **Kenyan**
`fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} to get all the features of the Kenyan localization.

## eTIMS

The [Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA)](https://www.kra.go.ke/) has
implemented the [electronic Tax Invoice Management System
(eTIMS)](https://www.kra.go.ke/online-services/etims) for tax
collection.

To submit documents through eTIMS, you must use an
`OSCU (Online Sales Control Unit)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} that
integrates with the existing **Trader Invoicing System (TIS)**, such as
the one provided by Odoo. The OSCU is used to validate, encrypt, sign,
transmit, and store tax invoices.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Make sure to `install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
the **Kenya eTIMS EDI** modules to use the OSCU device fully.
::::

### OSCU device initialization {#kenya/initialization}

The OSCU must be initialized before use. To do so, navigate to
`Settings --> General
Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, click
`Update Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Companies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, and enter your
`Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

To initialize the OSCU:

1.  Go to `Settings --> General Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and scroll down to the `Kenya
    eTIMS Integration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.
2.  Set the `eTIMS Server Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
    `Test`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the initialization.
3.  Enter the `Serial Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the
    device and tick the two check boxes.
4.  Click `Initialize OSCU`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Three server modes are available:

- `Demo`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Designed for demo purposes;
  it uses mock data and does not require an initialized OSCU;
- `Test`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Used to test the connection
  to eTIMS;
- `Production`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Used for live
  databases that are ready to send data.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

If your device has **already been initialized** (through another ERP,
for example), enable the
`../../general/developer_mode`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}. Then, in
the `Kenya eTIMS Integration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section, enter the ID of the unit in the `Unit ID`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field and the key obtained through a previous
initialization in the `CMC Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field. Click `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} when done.
::::

Once the **OSCU module** has been
`initialized <kenya/initialization>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, an
OSCU serial number is generated for each company on that database with
its **country** set to `Kenya`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The
serial number is generated based on the VAT number of the company
(regardless of its validity). It is a unique and sequential serial
number starting with the prefix [ODOO]{.title-ref} followed by the
company\'s **VAT number** and a sequence of numbers.

### Registering on eTIMS

Taxpayers *must* sign up and create an account on the [KRA
portal](https://etims.kra.go.ke/basic/login/indexLogin). If you do not
have an account yet:

1.  Sign up, enter your **PIN**, and verify that all information is
    correct, including your phone number, email address, and postal
    address. Correct any errors on the [iTax
    page](https://itax.kra.go.ke/KRA-Portal/).
2.  An `OTP (One-time Password)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is sent
    to the phone number provided. Unblock promotional messages if you do
    not receive it.
3.  Upload the **business owner ID** *or* **director\'s ID** (as listed
    on iTax), along with the filled-out and signed **commitment form** .
4.  On the **eTIMS dashboard**, click
    `Service request`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} at the top of
    the page. Select `OSCU`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the
    **eTIMS type**, enter [Odoo KE LTD]{.title-ref} as the third-party
    integrator, and enter your company\'s OSCU serial number retrieved
    earlier.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Service request approvals are usually quick. If there\'s a delay,
contact the eTIMS operation or KRA office.
::::

::: admonition
Commitment form

- Part 1: Fill in the taxpayer\'s information.
- Part 2: Fill in the business owner\'s *or* director\'s information.
- Part 3: Fill in your unique serial number found in Odoo.
- Part 4: Tick **OSCU**, enter Odoo KE LTD PIN
  [PO52112956W]{.title-ref}, and enter the Odoo version you\'re using
  (17.0 or onwards).
- Part 5: Check the mandatory boxes, enter a date, and sign.
:::

### eTIMS codes

Common standard codes are **automatically** fetched from the KRA eTIMS
API servers every two days. To fetch them manually, proceed as follows:

1.  Enable the `../../general/developer_mode`{.interpreted-text
    role="doc"}.
2.  Go to
    `Settings --> Technical --> Automation: Scheduled Actions`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and search for
    `KE eTIMS: Fetch KRA standard codes`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
3.  Click the action in the list, then click
    `Run Manually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to fetch the
    codes.

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> KE OSCU Codes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to view the complete list of fetched OSCU codes.

![List of fetched OSCU codes.](kenya/oscu-codes.png)

### UNSPSC codes {#etims/unspsc}

The KRA needs UNSPSC codes for a product to be **registered**. UNSPSC
codes are **automatically** fetched from the KRA eTIMS API servers every
day. To fetch them manually, proceed as follows:

1.  Enable the `../../general/developer_mode`{.interpreted-text
    role="doc"}.
2.  Go to
    `Settings --> Technical --> Automation: Scheduled Actions`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and search for
    `KE eTIMS: Fetch UNSPSC codes from eTIMS`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
3.  Click the action in the list, then click
    `Run Manually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to fetch the
    codes.

Go to the **product form**, and in the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, click the `UNSPSC
Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to view the complete
list of fetched UNSPSC codes.

### Notices

Notices are **automatically** fetched from the KRA eTIMS API servers
every day. To fetch them **manually**, proceed as follows:

1.  Enable the `../../general/developer_mode`{.interpreted-text
    role="doc"}.
2.  Go to
    `Settings --> Technical --> Automation: Scheduled Actions`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and search for
    `KE eTIMS: Fetch KRA notices from eTIMS`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
3.  Click the action in the list, then click
    `Run Manually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to fetch the
    notices.

Go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> KE OSCU Notices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to view the complete list of fetched notices.

### Multi-company

:::: {#kenya/branch}
::: seealso
`../../general/companies`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::
::::

If you have
`multiple companies <accounting/multi-company>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, you can centralize and manage them all on a single Odoo
database. The KRA identifies and differentiates the **parent** company
from its **subsidiaries** by using IDs. Furthermore, subsidiaries are
classified as `branches
<general/companies/branches>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} of the
parent company.

To configure the company\'s ID, open the **Settings** app, click
`Update Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Companies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, and search for
the `eTIMS Branch Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. The
**parent company** has a branch ID equal to [00]{.title-ref} in a
multi-company environment. Companies that are *not* the parent company
have a branch ID other than [00]{.title-ref} and are assigned an ID by
the KRA.

To fetch the **branch ID** from the KRA for your non-parent companies,
ensure the parent company has a Kenyan `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and the OSCU device has been
`initialized <kenya/initialization>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
Then, go to the `Branches`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab and
click `Populate from KRA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- The KRA considers each **place of supply** as a separate branch
(ID). - The **OSCU** device must be
`initialized independently <kenya/initialization>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for each branch.
::::

### Contact branch ID

To attribute a branch ID to a contact, access the contact form, go to
the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, and enter the
branch code in the `eTIMS Branch Code`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

By default, contacts\' branch IDs are set to [OO]{.title-ref}.
::::

### KRA sequences

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo invoice sequences and KRA sequences are **different**.
::::

In Odoo, invoice sequences depend on the **parent company**. Parent
companies can see the invoices of branches, but branches **cannot** see
the parent company\'s invoices or those of other branches.

The KRA needs **independent** sequences per branch. Therefore, Odoo
manages sequences individually per branch.

::: example
If you have a parent company with two branches, the invoice sequence
would be the following:

- Creating an invoice on **branch 1**: INV/2024/00001;
- Creating an invoice on **branch 2**: INV/2024/00002;
- Creating an invoice on the **parent company**: INV/2024/00003.

This is how Odoo manages sequences to be compliant with the KRA
regulations:

- Creating an invoice on **branch 1**: INV/2024/00001;
- Creating an invoice on **branch 2**: INV/2024/00001;
- Creating an invoice on the **parent company**: INV/2024/00001.
:::

## Insurance

For **health service providers**, you can send insurance information
about the parent and branch companies and update it in eTIMS. To do so,
go to `Accounting --> Configuration -->
Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, scroll to the
`Kenya eTIMS Integration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
and fill in the `Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and `Rate`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} fields. Click `Send Insurance
Details`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} when done.

## Product registration {#kenya/product-registration}

The KRA requires **products to be registered** first before conducting
business operations (such as stock movements,
`BOM (Bill of Materials)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, customer
invoices, etc.). For a product to be registered, the following fields
must be defined on the product form:

- In the `General Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:
  `Cost`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- In the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:
  - `Packaging Unit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};
  - `Packaging Quantity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};
  - `Origin Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};
  - `eTIMS Product Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};
  - `Insurance Applicable`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};
  - `UNSPSC Category <etims/unspsc>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

If the elements above are defined, the product is automatically
registered while sending the operation to the KRA. If not, you will be
alerted by a yellow banner at the top of the screen inviting you to
check the missing elements.

![Product registration template.](kenya/product-registration.png)

## Stock movements

All **stock movements** must be sent to the KRA. They do not require an
invoice if they are internal operations or stock adjustments; therefore,
Odoo automatically sends them if at least one of the following
conditions are met:

1.  No contact is set for the move;
2.  The contact is your parent company or a branch of the parent
    company.

If the stock moves are **external operations** (e.g., to contacts that
are not part of the parent company or its branches), the stock moves are
automatically sent *after* the invoice is sent to eTIMS.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- The stock move must be confirmed before sending the invoice to
eTIMS. - The product(s) must be
`registered <kenya/product-registration>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
for the stock move to be sent to eTIMS. If the product has not been
registered yet, a yellow banner will prompt the products\' registration.
::::

## Purchases

Odoo automatically fetches new vendor bills from eTIMS every day. You
need to confirm the fetched vendor bills and send the confirmation to
the KRA. To confirm a vendor bill, it must be linked to one or several
confirmed purchase order line(s).

::: {#kenya/purchases}
In the case of purchases (not customs imports), the steps to link
purchase order lines with bills are the following:
:::

1.  Go to `Accounting --> Vendors --> Bills`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}. The vendor bill is fetched from the KRA
    servers. The JSON file is available in the chatter of the vendor
    bill if needed.

2.  Odoo looks at the `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (PIN)
    of the vendor (partner);

    - If it is unknown, a new contact (partner) is created.
    - If it is known and the branch ID is the same, Odoo uses the known
      contact.

3.  In the fetched bill from the KRA, select the
    `Product`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Each vendor bill
    *must* contain a product to be confirmed and sent to eTIMS later on.

4.  Odoo checks existing purchase order lines matching the product(s)
    entered at the previous step and the partner (if any). Click the
    `Purchase Order Line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, and
    select the correct related purchase order line(s) matching the
    product(s). The quantities on the bill *must* be the same as the
    received quantities indicated on the purchase order.

    If no existing purchase order line matches the lines of the fetched
    bill, click `Create Purchase Order`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} and create a purchase order based on the unmatched
    line(s). `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the resulting
    stock move and `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the
    bill.

5.  Set a method in the `eTIMS Payment Method`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} field..

6.  Once all steps are completed, click
    `Send to eTIMS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to send the
    vendor bill. When the vendor bill has been confirmed on eTIMS, the
    **KRA invoice number** can be found in the
    `eTIMS Details`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

![Bill registration steps.](kenya/purchase-order-lines.png)

## Invoicing

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The KRA does *not* accept sales if the product is not in stock.
::::

This is the **advised sales flow** in Odoo when selling:

1.  Create a **sales order**.
2.  `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the delivery.
3.  `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the invoice.
4.  Click `Send and print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and then
    enable `Send to eTIMS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
5.  Click `Send & print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to send the
    invoice.

Once the invoice has been sent and signed by the KRA, the following
information can be found on it:

- **KRA invoice number**;
- Mandatory KRA invoice fields, such as **SCU information**, **date**,
  **SCU ID**, **receipt number**, **item count**, **internal date**, and
  **receipt signature**;
- The **KRA tax table**;
- A unique **KRA QR code** for the signed invoice.

## Imports

Customs import codes are **automatically** fetched from the KRA eTIMS
API servers every day. To fetch them manually, proceed as follows:

1.  Enable the `../../general/developer_mode`{.interpreted-text
    role="doc"}.
2.  Go to
    `Settings --> Technical --> Automation: Scheduled Actions`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and search for
    `KE eTIMS: Receive Customs Imports from the OSCU`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
3.  Click the action in the list, then click
    `Run Manually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to fetch the
    codes.

Go to `Accounting --> Vendors --> Customs Imports`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to view the imported codes.

The following steps are required to send and have **customs imports**
signed by the KRA:

1.  Go to `Accounting --> Vendors --> Customs Imports`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}; The customs import is fetched automatically
    from the KRA.

2.  Match the imported item with an existing registered product in the
    `Product`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field (or create a
    product if no related product exists).

3.  Set a vendor in the `Partner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    field.

4.  Based on the partner, match the imported item with its related
    purchase order (see
    `purchase steps <kenya/purchases>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}).
    The stock must be correctly adjusted when the customs import is
    approved.

    If no related purchase order exists, create one and
    `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} it. Then, confirm the
    delivery by clicking `Receive Products`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, then `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    on the purchase order.

5.  Click `Match and Approve`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
    `Match and Reject`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, depending on
    the situation of the goods.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The JSON file received from the KRA is attached to the chatter of the
customs import.
::::

## BOM

The KRA requires all BOMs to be sent to them. To send BOMs to eTIMS, the
product and its components *must* be
`registered <kenya/product-registration>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
To access a product\'s BOM, click on the product and then click the
`Bill of Materials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button.

Make sure the
`KRA's required fields <kenya/product-registration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} are filled in the `KRA eTIMS details`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section of the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab in the product form, and click
`Send to eTIMS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The successful
sending of the BOM is confirmed in the chatter, where you can also find
the sent information in an attached JSON file.

## Credit notes

The KRA does not accept credit notes with quantities or prices higher
than the initial invoice. When creating a credit note, a KRA reason must
be indicated: In the credit note form, go to the
`eTIMS Details`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, select the
`eTIMS Credit Note Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and then
select the invoice number in the `Reversal of`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field.




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/luxembourg.md ---

# Luxembourg

## Modules {#localizations/luxembourg/modules}

The following modules are installed automatically with the Luxembourgish
localization:

  Name                                                                   Technical name                  Description
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Luxembourg - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}           [l10n_lu]{.title-ref}           Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Luxembourg - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_lu_reports]{.title-ref}   Country-specific reports

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In some cases, such as when upgrading to a version with additional
modules, it is possible that modules may not be installed automatically.
Any missing modules can be manually `installed
<general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

::: seealso
`Documentation on e-invoicingâ€™s legality and compliance in Luxembourg
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/luxembourg>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Localization overview {#localizations/luxembourg/overview}

The Luxembourgish localization includes the following features:

- `../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}: a predefined set of accounts that follows the current
  official accounting standards (PCN 2020)
- `localizations/luxembourg/taxes`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  pre-configured tax rates, including standard (17%), reduced (14%, 8%,
  and 3%) and zero-rated VAT, intra-community, and zero-rated export
  taxes
- `../accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}:
  automated account and tax adjustments based on customer or supplier
- `localizations/luxembourg/e-invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  E-invoicing with Peppol
- `localizations/luxembourg/tax-reporting`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: detailed overview of your VAT liability, and generation
  of monthly and annual VAT declarations in XML format to upload to the
  `eCDF
  platform (plateforme Ã©lectronique de Collecte des DonnÃ©es FinanciÃ¨res)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}
- `localizations/luxembourg/faia`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  generation of audit files in the `FAIA (Fichier
  dâ€™Audit InformatisÃ© AED)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  (Luxembourgish SAF-T) format

### Taxes {#localizations/luxembourg/taxes}

The following `taxes <../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} are available by default with the Luxembourgish localization
package:

- standard VAT (17%): applied to most goods and services within
  Luxembourg
- reduced VAT (14%, 8%, and 3%): applied to some goods and services
  within Luxembourg
- zero-rated VAT: applied to goods and services not subject to VAT
- intra-community VAT: applied to goods and services sold to or
  purchased from VAT-registered persons located in other EU countries
- export tax (0%): zero-rated tax applied to goods and services exported
  outside Luxembourg

### E-invoicing {#localizations/luxembourg/e-invoicing}

Odoo users in Luxembourg can register on the
`accounting/e-invoicing/peppol`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} network,
which allows exchanging e-invoices and credit notes with other
participants on the network.

The e-invoice format in Luxembourg is **BIS Billing 3.0**.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

E-invoicing via Peppol is mandatory for all B2G transactions in
Luxembourg.
::::

## Tax reporting {#localizations/luxembourg/tax-reporting}

In Luxembourg, companies must submit a VAT declaration on a monthly,
quarterly, or annual basis to the tax office, depending on their
turnover. Companies that submit a monthly or quarterly declaration are
also required to submit the annual declaration.

Both monthly/quarterly and annual VAT declarations can be exported as
XML files to upload on the
`eCDF platform (plateforme Ã©lectronique de Collecte des DonnÃ©es FinanciÃ¨res)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

### Monthly / quarterly declaration

Go to `Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

In the `fa-book`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} selector, select
`Tax Report (LU)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

In the `fa-calendar`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
(`Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) selector, choose the month
or quarter for which to generate the declaration.

Check the amounts generated for all four sections of the report.

If you sold to customers under a VAT exemption for SMEs during the
period, you need to manually enter the value of such sales in the
editable fields at section I, items 481 and 482. To find the amounts for
these items, you can use the `Partner Ledger`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} report:

- Go to `Accounting --> Reporting --> Partner Ledger`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}.
- In the `fa-calendar`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  (`Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) selector, choose the
  appropriate month or quarter.
- In the `fa-user`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  (`Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) selector, choose
  `Receivable`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- In the `fa-folder-open`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  (`Partners`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) selector, choose the
  partners that fall under the exemption.
- Copy the total `Balance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for those
  partners for the given period.

Once the declaration is correct, click the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} (`action menu`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) icon,
then click `XML`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to export and
download it in XML format. You can then submit the XML file on the eCDF
platform.

### Annual declaration

#### Account tag configuration {#luxembourg/account-tag-configuration}

The following configuration allows values to be generated automatically
for sections I and III, and Appendix A of the report, based on journal
entries that impact accounts associated with each report line.

This requires using a different
`account <../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} for each type of operation subject to VAT, output and input
VAT, and expense listed in those sections.

Assign the following account
`tags <chart-of-account/tags>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to accounts
you use for each type of operation subject to VAT listed in the
declaration, if applicable:

- [001 - Supply of inhouse manufactured goods]{.title-ref}
- [002 - Supply of goods not manufactured inhouse]{.title-ref}
- [003 - Net profit margin]{.title-ref}
- [004 - Supply of services]{.title-ref}
- [005 - Disposal of tangible and intangible capital assets]{.title-ref}
- [008 - Application of goods for private use or for that of the
  staff]{.title-ref}
- [009 - Application for the purpose of business of goods]{.title-ref}
- [010 - Use of goods considered business assets]{.title-ref}
- [011 - Supply of services carried out free of charge]{.title-ref}
- [013 - IC supply of goods]{.title-ref}
- [202 - IC supply of new means of transport]{.title-ref}
- [203 - Supply of goods carried out abroad]{.title-ref}

Assign the following account tags to the accounts you use for each type
of output and input VAT, if applicable:

- [077 - VAT on stock entries invoiced by other taxable
  persons]{.title-ref}
- [081 - VAT on capital expenditures invoiced by other taxable
  persons]{.title-ref}
- [085 - VAT on operational expenditures invoiced by other taxable
  persons]{.title-ref}
- [078 - VAT on stock entries due in respect of IC
  acquisitions]{.title-ref}
- [082 - VAT on capital expenditures due in respect of IC
  acquisitions]{.title-ref}
- [086 - VAT on operational expenditures due in respect of IC
  acquisitions]{.title-ref}
- [079 - VAT on stock entries of importations of goods]{.title-ref}
- [083 - VAT on capital expenditures of importations of
  goods]{.title-ref}
- [087 - VAT on operational expenditures of importations of
  goods]{.title-ref}
- [404 - VAT on stock entries due under the reverse charge]{.title-ref}
- [405 - VAT on capital expenditures due under the reverse
  charge]{.title-ref}
- [406 - VAT on operational expenditures due under the reverse
  charge]{.title-ref}

Assign the following account tags to the expense accounts you use for
each type of expense, if applicable:

- [188 - Appendix A - Expenses for other work carried out by third
  parties]{.title-ref}
- [190 - Appendix A - Car expenses]{.title-ref}
- [239 - Appendix A - Gross salaries]{.title-ref}
- [244 - Appendix A - Gross wages]{.title-ref}
- [247 - Appendix A - Occasional salaries]{.title-ref}
- [250 - Appendix A - Compulsory social security contributions
  (employer\'s share)]{.title-ref}
- [253 - Appendix A - Accident insurance]{.title-ref}
- [260 - Appendix A - Staff travel and representation
  expenses]{.title-ref}
- [269 - Appendix A - Accounting and bookkeeping fees]{.title-ref}
- [283 - Appendix A - Employer\'s travel and representation
  expenses]{.title-ref}
- [285 - Appendix A - Electricity]{.title-ref}
- [289 - Appendix A - Gas]{.title-ref}
- [293 - Appendix A - Employer\'s travel and representation
  expenses]{.title-ref}
- [301 - Appendix A - Telecommunications]{.title-ref}
- [305 - Appendix A - Renting/leasing of immovable property with
  application of VAT]{.title-ref}
- [307 - Appendix A - Renting/leasing of immovable property with no
  application of VAT]{.title-ref}
- [310 - Appendix A - Renting/leasing of permanently installed equipment
  and machinery]{.title-ref}
- [316 - Appendix A - Property tax]{.title-ref}
- [324 - Appendix A - Business tax]{.title-ref}
- [326 - Appendix A - Interest paid for long-term debts]{.title-ref}
- [327 - Appendix A - Interest paid for short-term debts]{.title-ref}
- [328 - Appendix A - Other financial costs]{.title-ref}
- [330 - Appendix A - Stock and business equipment
  insurance]{.title-ref}
- [331 - Appendix A - Public and professional third party liability
  insurance]{.title-ref}
- [332 - Appendix A - Office expenses]{.title-ref}
- [336 - Appendix A - Fees and subscriptions paid to professional
  associations and learned societies]{.title-ref}
- [337 - Appendix A - Papers and periodicals for business
  purposes]{.title-ref}
- [343 - Appendix A - Shipping and transport expenses]{.title-ref}
- [345 - Appendix A - Work clothes]{.title-ref}
- [347 - Appendix A - Advertising and publicity]{.title-ref}
- [349 - Appendix A - Packaging]{.title-ref}
- [351 - Appendix A - Repair and maintenance of equipment and
  machinery]{.title-ref}
- [353 - Appendix A - Other repairs]{.title-ref}
- [355 - Appendix A - New acquisitions (tools and equipment) if their
  cost can be fully allocated to the year of acquisition or
  creation]{.title-ref}
- [358 - Appendix A - Custom (value)]{.title-ref}
- [361 - Appendix A - Total \'Appendix to Operational
  expenditures\']{.title-ref}

#### Opening the declaration

Go to `Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

In the `fa-book`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} selector, select
`Annual VAT Declaration (LU)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

In the `fa-calendar`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
(`Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) selector, choose the
fiscal year dates for which to generate the declaration.

#### Completing the declaration

The annual declaration contains five sections labelled I to V, seven
appendices labelled A to G, and an additional Appendix to Operational
Expenditures.

Sections I, III, and Appendix A can be pre-populated automatically based
on the `account tag
configuration <luxembourg/account-tag-configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. After configuring the account tags,
`set the tax lock date <accounting/tax-returns/lock-date>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} to the end of the fiscal year. This will trigger the
pre-computation of those values.

![Odoo Accounting populates a Luxembourgish annual VAT declaration based on account tags.](luxembourg/annual-tax-report.png)

Alternatively, the year\'s total VAT debit and credit can be manually
distributed among the various report lines in sections I and III. You
can use the `fa-pencil`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
(`Edit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) icon to manually enter the
value for each report line.

Sections II and IV are automatically computed.

You then need to manually complete appendices B through G, as well as
the Appendix to Operational Expenditures, with any additional
information to be reported.

#### Exporting the declaration

Once the declaration is complete and correct, click the
`fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} (`action menu`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}) icon, then click `XML`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to export and download it in XML format. You can then
submit the XML file on the eCDF platform.

::: seealso
\- `../accounting/reporting/tax_returns`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
[Tax office website - VAT
declaration](https://guichet.public.lu/en/entreprises/fiscalite/impots-benefices/tva/declarations/declaration-tva.html) -
[Platform for electronic gathering of financial data
(eCDF)](http://www.ecdf.lu)
:::

## FAIA audit file export {#localizations/luxembourg/faia}

`FAIA (Fichier dâ€™Audit InformatisÃ© AED)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
is the Luxembourgish version of the SAF-T format for accounting data
interchange. It allows exporting complete accounting data for a period
from a taxpayer\'s accounting system to the tax office.

Odoo can generate an XML file in the FAIA format that contains the
entire accounting data for a period.

To generate and download the FAIA file, open
`Accounting --> Reporting --> General
Ledger`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, choose the desired
period, click the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
(`action menu`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) icon, and click
`Export FAIA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/malaysia.md ---

# Malaysia

## Configuration {#malaysia/configuration}

### Modules installation {#malaysia/configuration/modules}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Malaysian localization:

  Name                                                                 Technical name                   Description
  -------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Malaysia - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}           [l10n_my]{.title-ref}            This module includes the default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
  `Malaysia - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_my_reports]{.title-ref}    This module includes the accounting reports for Malaysia.
  `Malaysia - UBL PINT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}             [l10n_my_ubl_pint]{.title-ref}   This module includes the features required to export invoices in PINT format.
  `Malaysia - E-invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}          [l10n_my_edi]{.title-ref}        This module includes the features required for integration with MyInvois under IRBM.

### Company information {#malaysia/configuration/company}

To configure your company information, go to the
`Contacts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} app, search for your
company, and select it. Then configure the following fields:

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, including the
  `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `State`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `Zip Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

  > - In the `Street`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, enter
  >   the street name, number, and any additional address information.
  > - In the `Street 2`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, enter
  >   the neighborhood.

- `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Tax identification number

- `SST`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Malaysian Sales and Service
  Tax Number, if applicable

- `TTx`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Malaysian Tourism Tax
  Number, if applicable

- `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

## E-invoicing integration with MyInvois

The MyInvois Portal is a platform provided by the
`IRBM (Inland Revenue Board of Malaysia)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
that facilitates the implementation of e-invoices for Malaysian
taxpayers. Odoo supports integration with MyInvois to submit the
invoices generated in Odoo.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `Malaysia - E-invoicing module`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
must be installed to submit invoices to MyInvois.
::::

### Set-up {#malaysia/myinvois/setup}

#### MyInvois registration {#malaysia/myinvois/setup/registration}

To send electronic invoices to MyInvois, you first need to register and
log in to the MyInvois portal to grant Odoo the **right to invoice** as
an intermediary for your company.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If this is the first time you log into the MyInvois portal, click
`User Manual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on
[MyTax](https://mytax.hasil.gov.my) to learn more about the registration
process. Both the **pre-production** (`testing
environment to try the functions before using the actual (production) environment`{.interpreted-text
role="dfn"}) and **production**
(`actual environment to submit e-invoices with accurate information`{.interpreted-text
role="dfn"}) environments are supported.
::::

1.  Log into [MyTax](https://mytax.hasil.gov.my). Choose the
    `ID Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the corresponding
    `identification number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} used to
    register for the digital certificate.

2.  From the dashboard, click the `fa-angle-down`{.interpreted-text
    role="icon"} `(angle-down)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon
    in the top-right corner and select
    `View Taxpayer Profile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

3.  In the `Representatives`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
    click `Add Intermediary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
    top-right corner.

    ![MyInvois add intermediary](malaysia/myinvois-add-intermediary.png)

4.  Add [ODOO S.A.]{.title-ref} as an intermediary using the following
    information:

    - `TIN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      [C57800417080]{.title-ref}
    - `BRN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      [BE0477472701]{.title-ref}
    - `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      - `Production`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: [ODOO
        S.A.]{.title-ref}
      - `Pre-production`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
        [OXXX_XXXXA.]{.title-ref}

5.  Grant the following permissions by clicking the
    `fa-toggle-on`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    `(toggle-on)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon:

    - `Representation From`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Document - Submit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Document - Cancel`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Document - Request Rejection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    - Access can be revoked in the future if needed.

    \- Odoo, as an intermediary, does not store invoices sent on behalf
    of the client on the proxy server.
    ::::

6.  Click `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The status for
    [ODOO S.A.]{.title-ref} is then `Active`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.

    ![MyInvois status active](malaysia/myinvois-intermediary-active.png)

#### Configuration in Odoo {#malaysia/myinvois/setup/odoo}

##### Company {#malaysia/myinvois/setup/odoo/einvoicing}

Open the Settings app, navigate to the `Companies`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, and click `Update Info`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Make sure the `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is entered and complete the following fields in the
`E-invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:

> - `Identification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
>   `ID Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and enter the
>   associated `Identification number`{.interpreted-text
>   role="guilabel"} used to register for the digital certificate.
> - `Ind. Classification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Input the
>   5-digit numeric code that represents the nature and activity of the
>   business.

##### Electronic invoicing

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. In the
`Malaysian Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section, select the relevant `MyInvois mode`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} based on the environment used for the company\'s
MyInvois registration.

Make sure to allow Odoo to process e-invoices by checking the box, then
click `Register`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To change the `TIN (tax identification number)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} reference, click `Unregister`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, change the company\'s information and make sure the
number registered on MyInvois matches, then `Register`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} again.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

For taxpayers with a `TIN (tax identification number)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} starting with \"IG\" and a
`ROB (registration of business)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} number,
combine the TIN and ROB in the **TIN:ROB** format for the
`Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

To register, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and in the
`Malaysian Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section, click `Register`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Once the
registration is complete, the **:ROB** can be removed from the
`Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Additionally, remember to log into [MyTax
account](https://mytax.hasil.gov.my/) and set the
`Type of Role`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as
`Business Owner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

##### Contacts {#malaysia/myinvois/setup/odoo/company}

Access the contact\'s form and fill in the following fields:

> - `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
> - `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
> - `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
> - `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
> - `Identification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the
>   `ID Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the corresponding
>   `Identification number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the
>   contact registered on MyTax.

##### Products {#malaysia/myinvois/setup/odoo/product}

All products to be included in e-invoices require a Malaysian
classification code. To add it, access the `Product`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} form and in the `General Information`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, fill in the
`Malaysian classification code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field.

##### Malaysian tax type

To configure a tax\'s `Malaysian Tax Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field, go to `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Accounting --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and open the relevant tax in the
`Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} list view.

When an invoice or bill includes a tax with the
`Malaysian Tax Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} set to **Tax
Exempt**, a `Tax Exemption Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
must be specified in the `MyInvois`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
tab before the document is sent.

![MyInvois tax exemption reason](malaysia/myinvois-tax-exemption-reason.png)

### Workflow {#malaysia/myinvois/workflow}

#### Send invoices to MyInvois {#malaysia/myinvois/workflow/sending}

Invoices can be sent to MyInvois once they have been confirmed. To do
so, click `Send to MyInvois`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

#### Send bills to MyInvois

Sending a bill to MyInvois is necessary when issuing an e-Invoice on
behalf of a supplier. Once a bill is confirmed, click
`Send To MyInvois`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- In [MyInvois](https://preprod.myinvois.hasil.gov.my/content), these
vendor bills are categorized as `Self-billed Invoice`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

- If a `Bill Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
  empty, Odoo\'s vendor bill number is used as the MyInvois number. If a
  reference is entered in the `Bill Reference`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} field, that reference is used instead.
::::

##### MyInvois status {#malaysia/myinvois/workflow/sending/status}

The current MyInvois status of an invoice or bill is shown in the
`MyInvois State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field within the
`MyInvois`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

> - `Validation in Progress`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the
>   validation is being processed by MyInvois. A blue
>   `Processing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} banner is also
>   displayed.
> - `Valid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: it is validated by
>   MyInvois. The `Submission UID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
>   `MyInvois`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
>   `Validation Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are
>   automatically updated with information from MyInvois.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo
`automatically checks and updates <../../sales/subscriptions/scheduled_actions>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} the status every hour. To update it manually at any time,
click `Update MyInvois Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

#### Invoice cancellation {#malaysia/myinvois/workflow/cancellation}

Sent invoices can be canceled within 72 hours from
`Validation time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In this case, open
the invoice and click `Request Cancel`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. In the `Cancel document`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} window, include the cancellation
`Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then click
`Update Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The
`MyInvois State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is updated to
`cancelled`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

#### Send credit notes to MyInvois

Before sending a credit note, the original invoice must be successfully
submitted to MyInvois. Otherwise, the credit note\'s
`MyInvois State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is updated to
`Invalid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

While Odoo uses a single `credit note`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} document, MyInvois categorizes these into two types:
`credit note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`refund note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, depending on how they
are reconciled.

- `MyInvois Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This is
  created when an Odoo credit note is reconciled with the original
  invoice.
- `MyInvois Refund Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This is
  created when an Odoo credit note is reconciled with a full payment
  instead of the original invoice.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If a credit note is reconciled with only a partial payment before being
sent, it is still categorized as a `credit note`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in MyInvois.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To issue both a credit note and a refund note for the same original
invoice: - Create two separate credit notes in Odoo from the original
invoice. - For a MyInvois `Refund Note`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}: Register a payment before sending it. - For a MyInvois
`Credit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Do not register a
payment before sending it.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The same logic applies to credit notes created from bills: if reconciled
with a full payment, the credit note becomes a
`Self-billed Refund Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}; otherwise,
it becomes a `Self-billed Credit Note`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
::::

#### Send debit notes to MyInvois

`Issue a debit note from an existing bill or invoice <accounting/credit_notes/issue-debit-note>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and click `Send To MyInvois`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. In MyInvois, it appears then as a
`Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if issued from an
invoice or a `Self-billed Debit Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
from a vendor bill.

### Access invoices via QR code

When a document is successfully submitted to MyInvois, a QR code is
added to its PDF version. Scanning this code links directly to the
validated document in MyInvois.

To download the PDF from an invoice or bill:

1.  Click the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    `(gear)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon
2.  Select `Download`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
3.  Choose either `PDF`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
    `PDF without Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![MyInvois QR code](malaysia/myinvois-qr-code.png)

## Employment Hero payroll {#malaysia/employment-hero}

If your business is already up and running with `Employment Hero
<../../hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/employment_hero>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, you can use our connector as an alternative payroll
solution.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

To
`configure the Employment Hero API <employment_hero/configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for **Malaysia**, use the following value as
`Payroll URL`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
[https://apimy.yourpayroll.io/]{.title-ref}.
::::

                                                                                                  the chart of accounts --- based on [the SAT account grouping
                                                                                                  code](https://www.gob.mx/cms/uploads/attachment/file/151586/codigo_agrupador.pdf).

  `EDI for Mexico`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}     [l10n_mx_edi]{.title-ref}               Includes all the technical and functional requirements to generate and validate

                                                                                                  `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. This allows you to
                                                                                                  send invoices (with or without addendums) and payment complements to the government.

  `Odoo Mexican Localization Reports`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_mx_reports]{.title-ref}           Adapts reports for Mexico\'s electronic accounting: chart of accounts, trial balance, and
  role="guilabel"}                                                                                `DIOT (DeclaraciÃ³n Informativa de Operaciones con Terceros)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

  `Mexico - Month 13 Trial Balance`{.interpreted-text     [l10n_mx_reports_closing]{.title-ref}   Necessary to create the closing entry (also known as the *month 13 move*).

  `Mexico - Electronic Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text           [l10n_mx_edi_stock]{.title-ref}          Lets you create a *Carta Porte*: A bill of lading that proves

Payroll module information is available `here

## Video tutorials {#l10n/mx/video-tutorials}

Videos on the Mexican localization are also available. Basic workflows
and most topics covered on this page are also available in video format,
please check out the following:

- [Odoo Smart Tutorial - Mexican
  localization](https://www.odoo.com/es/slides/smart-tutorial-localizacion-de-mexico-173)
- [Basic configurations and YouTube
  playlist](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TjWddMtQRfc&list=PL1-aSABtP6ACcwRzy_cdx-avDoNfSvooD&index=22)

## Localization overview {#l10n/mx/overview}

The Odoo Mexican localization modules allow for the signing of
electronic invoices, according to the specifications of the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} for [version 4.0 of the
CFDI](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/documentos/Anexo_20_Guia_de_llenado_CFDI.pdf),
a legal requirement, as of January 1, 2022. These modules also add
relevant accounting reports including the
`DIOT (DeclaraciÃ³n Informativa de Operaciones con Terceros)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, enable foreign trade, and enable the creation of delivery
guides.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In order to electronically sign any documents in Odoo, the Sign
application must be installed.
::::

::: seealso
- `Documentation on e-invoicing's legality and compliance in Mexico
  <../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/mexico>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}
- `Mexican Payroll signing and configurations
  <../../hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/mexico>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}
:::

### Requirements {#l10n/mx/requirements}

It is necessary to meet the following requirements before configuring
the Mexican localization modules in Odoo:

1.  Be registered in the
    `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} with a valid
    `RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"}.
2.  Have a [Certificado de Sello Digital / Digital Seal
    Certificate](https://www.gob.mx/sat/acciones-y-programas/ certificado-de-sello-digital)
    (CSD).
3.  Choose a
    `PAC (Proveedor Autorizado de CertificaciÃ³n / Authorized Certification
    Provider)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. Currently, Odoo works
    with the following
    `PAC (Proveedor Autorizado de CertificaciÃ³n / Authorized Certification
    Provider)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}s: [SoluciÃ³n
    Factible](https://solucionfactible.com/contenido/productos/timbrado/general#dos),
    [Quadrum](https://cfdiquadrum.com.mx/odoo/), and [SW Sapien -
    Smarter Web](https://info.sw.com.mx/sw-smarter-odoo).

### Company {#l10n/mx/company}

After installing the correct modules, the next step is to verify that
the company is configured with the correct data. To do so, go to
`Settings --> Users & Companies --> Companies`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select the company to configure.

Enter the full `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
resulting form, including: `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
code, `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} (`Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} number).

According to the requirements of the
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} 4.0, the name of the main company contact **must** match
the business name registered in the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, without the legal entity abbreviation. This is the same
for the `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

From a legal point of view, Mexican companies **must** use the local
currency (MXN). To use another currency, let MXN be the default currency
and use a `pricelist
<../../sales/sales/products_prices/prices/pricing>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} instead.
::::

Next, go to `Accounting --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and scroll to the `MX Electronic
invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section. Under
`Service Tax Administration (SAT)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
select the `Fiscal
Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} that applies to the company
from the drop-down list, and click `Save`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

In order to test the Mexican localization, configure the company with a
real address within Mexico (including all fields). Add
[EKU9003173C9]{.title-ref} as the `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and [ESCUELA KEMPER URGATE]{.title-ref} as the
`Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. For the
`Fiscal Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, use
`General de Ley Personas Morales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

### Branches

When using branches, all the invoicing information will be taken from
the main company except for the zip. Unless the
`RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} is set on the branch, then the information will be taken
directly from the branch.

Branches enable users to establish multiple brands within the same
parent company. Additionally, when different fiscal regimes are required
for invoicing purposes, it is necessary to create a branch for each
regime. By default, the regime is inherited from the parent company.
However, if the regime is explicitly set on the branch, Odoo will adopt
the regime applicable to that branch.

### Contacts {#l10n/mx/contacts}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
**Contacts** application to access contact records.
::::

To create a contact that can be invoiced, go to the
`Contacts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} app and click
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, enter the contact name,
full `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} including the
`ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code, `State`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} (`Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}).

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

As with the company itself, all contacts must have their correct
business name registered in the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. The `Fiscal Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
must also be added in the `Sales & Purchase`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab.
::::

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Having a `RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} (`Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) set but no
`Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} configured may result in
incorrect invoices.
::::

### Taxes {#l10n/mx/taxes}

In order to properly sign invoices, set the
`Factor Type <l10n/mx/factor-type>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and
`Tax
Object <l10n/mx/tax-object>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} fields on
sales taxes.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

RESICO ISR withholdings and some
`IEPS (Impuesto Especial sobre ProducciÃ³n y Servicios)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} taxes are created automatically, but the feature is not
active by default. To enable it, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.
::::

#### Factor type {#l10n/mx/factor-type}

Both the **Factor Type** and **SAT Tax Type** fields are pre-loaded in
the default taxes.

For new taxes, set these fields in
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and click `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Set the `Tax Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
to `Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In the `Advanced
Options`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, fill
`SAT Tax Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Factor Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields.

Odoo supports four groups of `SAT Tax Types`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}: `IVA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`ISR`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `IEPS`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and `Local Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

If the factor type is `Quota`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
standard calculation methods cannot be used. Instead, set the tax
calculation computation to `Custom Formula`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

::: example
.. math:: result = quantity \* 6.455

- *quantity* = the number of items in the transaction
- *6.455* = the quota value (a fixed amount per unit)
- Only per-unit quotas are supported, not quotas based on other factors
:::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Mexico manages two different kinds of 0% VAT to accommodate two
scenarios:

- For *0% VAT*, set the `Factor Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  to `Tasa`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- For *VAT Exempt*, set the `Factor Type`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} to `Exento`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Local taxes are generated in a separate node in the XML file, these do
not get validated by the
`PAC (Proveedor Autorizado de CertificaciÃ³n / Authorized Certification
Provider)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
::::

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Quotas and custom formulas require the
`Define Taxes as Python Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} module.
See `Taxes <../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.
::::

#### Tax object {#l10n/mx/tax-object}

One requirement of the CFDI 4.0 is that the resulting XML file handles
the breakdown of taxes of the operation in accordance with the
regulation. There are eight different possible values that are added in
the XML file:

- \`01\`: No tax Object: This value is added automatically if the
  invoice line doesn\'t contain any taxes.
- \`02\`: Tax Object: This is the default configuration of any invoice
  line that contains taxes.
- \`03\`: Tax Object and doesn\'t require breakdown: This can only be
  added manually.
- \`04\`: Tax Object and doesn\'t have tax: This can only be added
  manually.
- \`05\`: Tax Object, VAT for PODEBI: This can only be added manually.
- \`06\`: VAT Object, No VAT forwarded: This object will be selected
  when there is an ISR withholding and no VAT tax.
- \`07\`: No VAT forwarded,
  `IEPS (Impuesto Especial sobre ProducciÃ³n y Servicios)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} breakdown: This object will be selected when there is an
  ISR withholding,
  `IEPS (Impuesto Especial sobre ProducciÃ³n y Servicios)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} tax and no VAT tax.
- \`08\`: No VAT forwarded,
  `IEPS (Impuesto Especial sobre ProducciÃ³n y Servicios)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} breakdown: This object can only be added manually.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Using either 01, 03, 04, or 05 will remove the tax node from the XML
file.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The `IEPS breakdown`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} status affects
the behavior of the tax objects due to the missing
`IEPS (Impuesto Especial sobre ProducciÃ³n y Servicios)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} when the breakdown does not happen.
::::

#### Local taxes {#l10n/mx/local-taxes}

Local taxes (e.g., *ISH*, *Cedullar*) require a separate XML node and
may not follow standard tax logic.

When configuring a local tax, its name appears in the local tax
complement. The rate is treated as a withholding if negative, or carried
forward if positive.

#### IEPS breakdown {#l10n/mx/ieps-breakdown}

By default Odoo hides the
`IEPS (Impuesto Especial sobre ProducciÃ³n y Servicios)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} in the invoices so that the subtotal on which the VAT is
calculated includes the amount of
`IEPS (Impuesto Especial sobre ProducciÃ³n y Servicios)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, this is to ensure that Fiscal Regimes that do not require
it, do not receive it.

It is possible to make the
`IEPS (Impuesto Especial sobre ProducciÃ³n y Servicios)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} visible in the XML by selecting the
`IEPS Breakdown`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox inside each
contact on the `Sales & Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
tab.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

When using either
`eCommerce invoicing <l10n/mx/ecommerce>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
or the `Self invoicing
portal <l10n/mx/pos/portal>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, the customer
will have the option to decide whether or not to have the
`IEPS (Impuesto Especial sobre ProducciÃ³n y Servicios)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} breakdown.
::::

#### Other tax configurations {#l10n/mx/tax-config}

The Mexican Localization uses
`cash basis taxes <../../finance/accounting/taxes/cash_basis>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. When registering a payment, Odoo carries out the movement
of taxes from the *Cash Basis Transition Account* to the account set in
the `Definition`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of the tax
record set on the invoice or bill line. For such movement, a tax base
account is used: (`899.01.99 Base Imponible de
Impuestos en Base a Flujo de Efectivo`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}) in the journal entry when reclassifying taxes. **Do
not delete this account**.

### Withholdings {#l10n/mx/products}

By default, Odoo includes withholdings with special distributions to
allocate VAT.

When registering an invoice, add the withholding and its corresponding
VAT. Both must be included on the vendor bill to ensure correct
accounting. Using `fiscal positions
<../accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} is
recommended so the cash-basis entry properly splits the distribution.

::: example
For a lease vendor bill of [10000 MXN]{.title-ref}, the
[10.67%]{.title-ref} lease withholding corresponds to a [16% VAT 2/3
H]{.title-ref}. Both taxes must be applied together to reflect the
correct accounting.
:::

![Cash Basis entry with VAT split between paid and due.](mexico/mx-withholdings-cash-basis.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Withholdings
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} is not currently supported. Consult with an accountant the
proper distribution.
::::

### Products

To configure products, go to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Open an existing product or click
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In the
`Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, set the
`UNSPSC Product Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Products
and categories can be set manually, or through `a
bulk import <../../essentials/export_import_data>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

All products need to have a
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} code associated with them in order to prevent validation
errors.
::::

### Electronic invoicing {#l10n/mx/e-invoicing-overview}

#### PAC credentials {#l10n/mx/pac}

After processing your [Private Key
(CSD)](https://www.sat.gob.mx/aplicacion/16660/genera-y-descarga-tus-archivos-a-traves-de-la-aplicacion-certifica)
with the `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, you **must** register directly with the `PAC
<l10n/mx/requirements>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} of your choice
before you start creating invoices from Odoo.

Once you\'ve created your account with any of these providers, go to
