`Accounting -->
Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and
navigate to the `MX Electronic invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section. Under the
`Authorized Certification Provider (PAC)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, enter the name of your
`PAC (Proveedor Autorizado de CertificaciÃ³n / Authorized Certification
Provider)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} with your credentials
(`PAC username`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`PAC password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}).

![Configuring PAC credentials from the Accounting settings.](mexico/mx-pac-account.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To test the electronic invoicing without credentials, activate the
`MX PAC test
environment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox, and select
`Solucion Factible`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the
`PAC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. It is not required to add a
username or password for a test environment.
::::

#### .cer and .key certificates {#l10n/mx/certifications}

The [digital certificates of the
company](https://www.gob.mx/tramites/ficha/certificado-de-sello-digital/SAT139)
must be uploaded within the `Certificates`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section. To do so, navigate to `Settings --> General
Settings --> Certificates and Keys`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

Under `Manage your certificates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
click the `fa-right-arrow`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Keys`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} link to access the
`Keys`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} list view. Click
`Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, upload the digital
`Key file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (`.key`{.interpreted-text
role="file"} file), add a `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
the key, and enter the `Private key password`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

From
`Settings --> General Settings --> Certificates and Keys`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, select `Certificates`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to access the `Certificate`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} list view. Click `Create`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, upload the digital `Certificate`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} (`.cer`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file), add a
`Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to the certificate, and select
the `Private Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} created on the
previous step from the drop-down menu.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `Certificate Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Public Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields on
`Certificate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} records are optional.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

In order to test the electronic invoicing, the following
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} test certificates are provided:

- `Certificate <mexico/certificate.cer>`{.interpreted-text
  role="download"}
- `Certificate Key <mexico/certificate.key>`{.interpreted-text
  role="download"}
- **Password**: `12345678a`
::::

## Accounting

### Electronic invoicing {#l10n/mx/e-invoicing}

The invoicing process in Odoo is based on [Annex
20](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/anexo_20.htm)
version 4.0 of electronic invoicing of the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

#### Customer invoices {#l10n/mx/invoices}

To start invoicing from Odoo, a customer invoice must be created using
the `standard invoicing
flow <../accounting/customer_invoices>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.

While the document is in draft mode, changes can be made to it, some
fields take values previously set on the sale order or the contact.

The fields that need to be reviewed are:

- CFDI to public.
- Usage
- Payment Policy
- Payment Method (If Payment Policy is not set as
  `PPD (Pago en Parcialidades o Diferido/Payment in Installments or
  Deferred)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"})

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

`Usage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Payment Policy`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} can be previously
set on a sale order and/or can be set on the contact for every invoice.
::::

The payment policy is a selectable field on the invoice and can be
manually set to the required policy, however if no policy is selected,
Odoo will compute an automatic policy based on the following general
rules:

The value will be set to
`PUE (Pago en una Sola ExhibiciÃ³n/Payment in a Single Exhibition)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} if the due date in which the payment is expected is within
the current month, in case the date is outside the current month, the
policy will be set to
`PPD (Pago en Parcialidades o Diferido/Payment in Installments or
Deferred)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} instead.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

If the payment policy is not selected and
`PPD (Pago en Parcialidades o Diferido/Payment in Installments or
Deferred)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} policy is expected, either
select an invoice `Due Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on a
different month than the current one, or choose `Payment
terms`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} that imply changing the due
month (i.e., `30 Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
`15 Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, as long as they fall on
the next month).
::::

After clicking on `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
customer invoice, click on the `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button to process the invoice with the government. Make sure that the
`CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox is marked.

![CFDI Checkbox](mexico/mx-send-cfdi.png)

After receiving the signed document back from the government, the
`Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field appears on the
document, and the XML file appears both in the
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} tab and attached in the chatter.

If an email address is configured on the customer contact record,
marking the `by Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkboxes sends both the XML
and PDF files together.

To download the PDF file locally, click the `Print`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

When clicking `Update SAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the
`SAT status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field on the invoice
will confirm if the XML file is **Validated** in the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

On a testing environment, the message `Not Found`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} will always come up.
::::

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

If the partner does not contain the `Country`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} or `Zip`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the
invoicing is assumed as a
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} to public and the invoicing will be addressed to the
generic customer. If however, these fields are left empty and the user
unticks the `CFDI to public`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
checkbox, a pop-up will appear blocking the operation.
::::

#### Credit notes {#l10n/mx/credit-notes}

While an invoice is a document type \"I\" (Ingreso), a credit note is a
document type \"E\" (Egreso).

An addition to the `standard flow for credit notes
<../accounting/customer_invoices/credit_notes>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is that, as a requirement of the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, there has to be a relation between a credit note and an
invoice through the fiscal folio.

Because of this requirement, the field `CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} adds this relation with a [01\|]{.title-ref}, followed
by the fiscal folio of the original
`UUID (universally unique identifier)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

For the `CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to be
automatically added, use the `Add Credit
Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button from the invoice,
instead of creating it manually.
::::

Generally credit notes reverse the main sales account defined in the
journal, but it is also possible to globally assign an account to all
credit notes. To do so, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and set the `Credit notes`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} account under the `Default Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

On the default configuration, the credit notes account is set as
`402.01.01 Returns,
discounts or bonuses over sales and/or services at the general rate`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
::::

#### Vendor bills {#l10n/mx/vendor-bills}

Vendor bills have to have a fiscal folio for reports and payments to
work correctly, if the vendor bill was created by the purchase app or
added manually, just add the XML file of the invoice on the chatter **As
a log note** and the fiscal folio will be updated accordingly, keep in
mind that the bill **Must be in draft state** for the update to happen.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

When clicking `Update SAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the
`SAT status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field on the invoice
will confirm if the XML file is **Validated** by the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, this is also true for vendor bills.
::::

::: seealso
`../accounting/vendor_bills`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

#### Journals {#l10n/mx/journals}

The module `EDI for Mexico (Advanced Features)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} ([l10n_mx_edi_extended]{.title-ref}) must be installed
on the database to complete the `Address Issued`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field on the sales journal. This ensures that all
invoices from that sales journal, as well as
`global invoices <l10n/mx/global-invoice>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, use the correct zipcode when generating the CFDI.

To invoice within a company under different time zones with the same
user, a system parameter must be created to ensure the correct time zone
is applied when invoicing, as the user\'s time zone is used by default.

To do so, enable
`developer mode <../../general/developer_mode>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} and go to
`Settings --> Technical --> System Parameters`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
create a new parameter with the key [l10n_mx_edi_tz_XX]{.title-ref}
where [XX]{.title-ref} is the ID of the journal, and set the desired
time zone as the value, for example, "America/Tijuana".

#### Payments {#l10n/mx/payments}

##### Payment policy {#l10n/mx/payment-policy}

One addition of the Mexican localization is the
`Payment Policy`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. [According to
the SAT
documentation](https://www.sat.gob.mx/consultas/92764/comprobante-de-recepcion-de-pagos),
there are two types of payments:

- `PUE`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Pago en una Sola
  ExhibiciÃ³n/Payment in a Single Exhibition)
- `PPD`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Pago en Parcialidades o
  Diferido/Payment in Installements or Deferred)

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Payment Complements are only generated if the policy of the invoice is
set to `PPD (Pago en Parcialidades o Diferido/Payment in Installments or
Deferred)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, please note that it is a
requirement to set the `Payment Method`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to something different than **99 -Por definir**.
::::

![Example of an invoice with the PUE requirements.](mexico/mx-pue-payment.png)

If the invoice has a due date outside the current month, it will default
to `PPD (Pago en Parcialidades o Diferido/Payment in Installments or
Deferred)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

![Example of an invoice with the PPD requirements.](mexico/mx-ppd-payment.png)

##### Payment flow {#l10n/mx/payment-flow}

In both cases, the payment process in Odoo
`is the same <../accounting/payments>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"},
the main difference being payments related to
`PPD (Pago en Parcialidades o Diferido/Payment in Installments or
Deferred)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} invoices, by law, need to be
sent to the government as a document type \"P\" (Pago).

If a payment is related to a
`PUE (Pago en una Sola ExhibiciÃ³n/Payment in a Single Exhibition)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} invoice, it can be registered through the payment popup,
and be associated with the corresponding invoice. To do so, navigate to
`Accounting -->
Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and
select an invoice. Then, click the `Pay`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button to open the payment popup, set the
`Payment Way`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and any other fields,
and click `Create
Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

::: seealso
\- `../accounting/payments`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`../accounting/bank/reconciliation`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

While this process is the same for PPD invoices, the addition of
creating an `electronic
document <../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} means some additional requirements are needed to correctly
send the document to the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

From a legal perspective, PPD invoices **must** include the specific
`Payment Way`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} that the payment was
received. Because of this, the `Payment Way`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field **cannot** be set as
`To Define`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, thus the field will
become invisible when selecting it.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- If a bank account number is required, add it in the
`Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of a customer\'s
contact record. - The exact configurations are in the [Anexo 20 of the
SAT](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/anexo_20.htm).
Usually, the `Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} needs to
be 10 or 18 digits for transfers, 16 for credit or debit cards.
::::

If a fully-reconciled payment is related to an invoice with a
`Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the
`Update Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} appears. Click the
`Update Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to send the
**payment complement** XML file to the government automatically and
display it in the
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} tab in both the invoice and the payment.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

While it is a bad fiscal practice, the
`PUE (Pago en una Sola ExhibiciÃ³n/Payment in a Single Exhibition)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} payments can also be sent to the government, however it is
required to click `Force CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab for this.
::::

Similar to an invoice or credit note, the PDF and XML can be sent to the
final customer. To do so, click the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(gear)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon to open
the actions drop-down menu and select
`Send receipt by email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the
payment view.

Regardless of whether the payment was created with or without
reconciliation, it is possible to download the payment PDF from the
`CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab on the invoice by clicking
the `print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

![Example of the print button on the CFDI tab.](mexico/mx-print-payment.png)

#### Invoice cancellations {#l10n/mx/invoice-cancellations}

It is possible to cancel the EDI documents sent to the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. According to the [Reforma Fiscal
2022](https://www.sat.gob.mx/consultas/91447/nuevo-esquema-de-cancelacion),
since January 1st, 2022, there are two requirements for this:

- All cancellation requests require a *cancellation reason*.
- After 24 hours from the invoice creation, the client must be asked to
  approve the cancellation. If there is no response within 72 hours, the
  cancellation is processed automatically.

Invoice cancellations are updated automatically on Odoo but can take
some time, to check the status of the cancellation just press the
`Update SAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

Invoice cancellations can be made for one of the following reasons:

- 01 - Invoice issued with errors (with related document)
- 02 - Invoice issued with errors (no replacement)
- 03 - The operation was not carried out
- 04 - Nominative operation related to the global invoice

To initiate a cancellation, go to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, select the posted invoice to cancel, and click
`Request Cancel`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, refer to the
`l10n/mx/01-invoice-cancellation`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} or
`l10n/mx/02-03-04-invoice-cancellation`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
sections, depending on the cancellation reason.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Alternatively, request a cancellation from the `CFDI`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab by clicking `Cancel`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} on the line item.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- If a cancellation is requested on a locked period, the CFDI will be
cancelled but not the accounting entry. - If the client rejects the
cancellation, the invoice cancellation line item is removed from the
`CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.
::::

##### Cancellation reason 01 {#l10n/mx/01-invoice-cancellation}

1.  In the `Request CFDI Cancellation`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} pop-up window, select `01 - Invoice issued
    with errors (with related document)`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} from the `Reason`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} field and click
    `Create Replacement Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
    create a new draft invoice. This new draft invoice replaces the
    previous invoice, along with the related
    `CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"}.
2.  `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the draft and
    `Send & Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the invoice.
3.  Return to the initial invoice (i.e., the invoice from which you
    first requested the cancellation). Notice the
    `Substituted By`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field appears
    with a reference to the new replacement invoice.
4.  Click `Request Cancel`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In the
    `Request CFDI Cancellation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    pop-up window, the
    `01 - Invoice issued with errors (with related document)`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} option is automatically selected in the
    `Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
5.  Click `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

The invoice cancellation is then generated with a reason line item in
the `CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

![Canceled invoice line item in the CFDI tab.](mexico/mx-invoice-cancellation-reason-01.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When using the
`01 - Invoice issued with errors (with related document)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} cancellation reason, the [04\|]{.title-ref} prefix
appears in the `Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
This is an internal prefix used by Odoo to complete the cancellation and
**does not** mean that the cancellation reason was
`04 - Nominative operation related to the global invoice`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
::::

##### Cancellation reasons 02, 03, and 04 {#l10n/mx/02-03-04-invoice-cancellation}

In the `Request CFDI Cancellation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
pop-up window, select the desired cancellation
`Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the cancellation.

Upon doing so, the invoice cancellation is generated with a reason line
item in the `CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If the `SAT Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} goes back to
**Validated** it could be due to one of these three reasons:

- The invoice is labeled as *No Cancelable* in the [SAT
  Website](https://www.sat.gob.mx/home). due to the fact that it has a
  valid related document: Either another invoice linked with the
  `CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field or a Payment
  Complement. If so, you need to cancel any other related document
  first.
- The cancellation request is still being processed by the
  `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}. If so, wait a few minutes and try again.
- The final customer needs to reject or accept the cancellation request
  in their [BuzÃ³n
  Tributario](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/BuzonTributario/Paginas/servicios_disponibles.html).
  This can take up to 72 hours and, in case that the cancellation
  requests gets rejected, you will need to repeat the process again.
::::

::: seealso
[Tool to validate Mexican Electronic Documents (CFDI)
status](https://verificacfdi.facturaelectronica.sat.gob.mx/)
:::

For the cancellation reasons **02**, **03** and **04**, the
`Create Replacement Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
is replaced by a `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
that requests the cancellation immediately.

Both the current `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Cancellation Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} can be found in
the `CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

![Old invoice with CFDI Origin.](mexico/mx-invoice-cancellation-reason-tab.png)

##### Payment cancellations {#l10n/mx/payment-cancellations}

To cancel `payment complements <l10n/mx/payment-flow>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, go to the `CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of
the related invoice and click `Cancel`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} on the line of the payment complement.

Like with invoices, go to the payment and click
`Update SAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in order to change the
`SAT Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
`Cancelled`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Just like invoices, when creating a new payment complement, it is
possible to add the relation of the original document, by adding a
[04\|]{.title-ref} plus the fiscal folio in the
`CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

This action cancels the invoice and marks the `Reason`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} as `01 - Invoice
issued with errors (with related document)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
::::

#### Invoicing special use cases {#l10n/mx/special-use-cases}

##### CFDI relations {#l10n/mx/cfdi-origin}

Sometimes it is needed to relate the current document to previously
signed CFDIs, to do so just fill the `CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field on the invoice indicating a relation, there are 7
possible values:

- 01: Nota de crÃ©dito
- 02: Nota de dÃ©bito de los documentos relacionados
- 03: DevoluciÃ³n de mercancÃ­a sobre facturas o traslados previos
- 04: SustituciÃ³n de los CFDI previos
- 05: Traslados de mercancias facturados previamente
- 06: Factura generada por los traslados previos
- 07: CFDI por aplicaciÃ³n de anticipo

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The format is: Origin Type\|UUID1, UUID2, \...., UUIDn where more than
one Origin Type can be added.
::::

::: example
Here is an example with two relations:

``` none
04|042FE739-7B45-4D64-B26D-360000876D83,
07|A164BAF8-8016-428C-A422-D9BD2F68F6A0,CEAD9433-3B77-4270-85BF-AC2519587514
```

- The first section has relation type **04** with **1 UUID**
- The second section has relation type **07** with **2 UUIDs**
:::

Additionally any combination is also visible on the signed PDF.

![Example of the PDF with 3 relations.](mexico/mx-CFDI_3relations.png)

##### Multicurrency {#l10n/mx/multicurrency}

The `Main Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in Mexico is MXN.
While this is mandatory for all Mexican companies, it is possible to
send and receive invoices (and payments) in different currencies. To
enable the use of
`multicurrency <../accounting/get_started/multi_currency>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, navigate to the
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Currencies`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and set `[MX] Bank of
Mexico`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the
`Service`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Automatic Currency Rates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.
Then, set the `Interval`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to the
frequency you wish to update the exchange rates.

This way, the XML file of the document will have the correct exchange
rate, and the total amount, in both the foreign currency and in MXN.

It is highly recommended to use separate
`bank accounts for each currency
<../accounting/bank/foreign_currency>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The only currencies that automatically update their exchange rate daily
are: USD, EUR, GBP, JPY and CNY.
::::

##### Discounts {#l10n/mx/discounts}

By law, electronic documents sent to the government cannot have negative
lines, as this can trigger errors. Therefore, when using `Gift Cards
<../../sales/sales/products_prices/ewallets_giftcards>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} or `Loyalty Programs
<../../sales/sales/products_prices/loyalty_discount>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, the subsequent negative lines will be translated in the XML
as if they were regular `Discounts
<../../sales/sales/products_prices/prices/pricing/>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.

In order to set this up, navigate to
`Sales --> Products --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and create a product [Discounts]{.title-ref}, make
sure that it has a valid `Tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
(usually `IVA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} at [16%]{.title-ref}).

After this, create and sign the invoice via
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, and add the [Discounts]{.title-ref} product at the bottom.
In the XML, Odoo will distribute the discount between the lines evenly,
while any math differences will be added in a rounding product.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

A [Discount]{.title-ref} and [UNSPSC Product Category]{.title-ref} for
each product variant related to `Gift
Cards`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Loyalty Programs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} have to be
created.
::::

##### Down payments {#l10n/mx/down-payments}

A common practice in Mexico is the usage of `down payments
<../../sales/sales/invoicing/down_payment>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. It\'s usage primarily consists of cases where you receive a
payment for a good or service where either the product or the price (or
both) has not been fully determined.

The `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} allows two different ways to handle this process: both of
them involve linking all invoices to each other with the
`CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

For this process, the `Sales <../../sales>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} app must be installed.
::::

::: seealso
[The official documentation for registration of down payments in
Mexico](http://http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/documentos/GuiaAnexo311221.pdf).
:::

###### Configuration

First, navigate to `Sales --> Products --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to create a product [Anticipo]{.title-ref} and
configure it. The `Product Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must
be `Service`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and use the
`UNSPSC Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`84111506 Servicios de facturaciÃ³n`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Then, go to
`Sales --> Settings --> Invoicing --> Down Payments`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and add the *Anticipo* product as the default.

###### Method A {#l10n-mx/down-payment-method-a}

This method consists of creating a down payment invoice, creating a
invoice for the total amount, and finally, creating a credit note for
the total of the down payment.

First, create a sales order with the total amount, and create a down
payment from it (either using a percentage or fixed amount). Then, sign
the document via CFDI, and register the payment.

When the time comes for the customer to get the final invoice, create it
again from the same sales order. In the
`Create Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} popup, select
`Regular Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Make sure to
delete the line that contains the product *Anticipo*.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

When using down payments with the Mexican localization, make sure that
the `Invoicing
Policy`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the products are
`Ordered quantities`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Otherwise a
customer credit note will be created.
::::

Then, copy the `Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from
the down payment invoice, and paste it into the
`CDFI Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the final invoice,
adding the prefix [07\|]{.title-ref} before the value and sign the
document via
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

Finally, create a credit note for the first invoice. Copy the
`Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the final
invoice, and paste it in the `CFDI Origin`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} of the credit note, adding the prefix
[07\|]{.title-ref}. Then, sign the document via
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

With this, all electronic documents are linked to each other. The final
step is to fully pay the new invoice. At the bottom of the new invoice,
you can find the credit note in the
`Outstanding credits`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} - add it as
payment. Finally, register the remaining amount with the
`Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} popup.

In the sales order, all three documents should appear as \"In Payment\".

###### Method B

Another, simpler way to fulfill
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} requirements involves creating only the down payment
invoice, and a second invoice for the remnant. This method involves the
fact that negative lines are treated as discounts.

For this, follow the same process as
`Method A <l10n-mx/down-payment-method-a>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, up until the creation of the final invoice. Do not delete
the line that contains the *Anticipo* and instead rename the other
products `Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to include the
text [CFDI por remanente de un anticipo]{.title-ref}. Don\'t forget to
add the `Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the down
payment invoice in the `CDFI Origin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
of the final invoice, adding the prefix [07\|]{.title-ref}.

Finally, sign the final invoice via
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

##### Addendas and complements {#l10n/mx/addendas-and-complements}

Addendas and complements can be included in the XML. To add one, go to
`Accounting
--> Configuration --> Addendas & Complementos (MX)`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
enter the code to be injected. Additional fields beyond standard Odoo
may be required.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

This section might require technical knowledge and may risk adding
technical debt; it is recommended to ask your account manager for the
best technical advice.
::::

Once the desired nodes are created, they can be selected on each contact
to make them appear on every invoice addressed to that contact. By
default, all the selected nodes will be added automatically on every
invoice.

It is also possible to just select the nodes as needed on every invoice
by selecting the `Other info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab and
then selecting the desired nodes from `Addendas &
Complementos`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

It is possible to add more than one per contact or per invoice.
::::

##### XML reader {#l10n/mx/xml-reader}

In certain occasions, such as when you are creating invoices in another
software or in the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} directly, you would want to upload the invoices in Odoo.
The XML Reader allows you to retrieve the data from an XML file. To do
this, navigate to `Accounting --> Customers -->
Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and, in the list view,
click the `Upload`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to select
any number of XML files, and draft invoices will be automatically
created. This can work also by dragging the files from your computer and
dropping them in the view.

The draft invoices will retrieve the
`Customer information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (if it
doesn\'t exist, new ones will be created), the
`Product Lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (only if products
with the same name already exist) and will calculate all taxes and
additional fields exclusive to the Mexican Localization. The import
information will appear in the chatter.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Depending on where the invoice was created, XML files could have
different values from the total calculated in Odoo. **Always**
double-check any document uploaded this way.
::::

`Customer Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} created this way
will be able to create **payment complements** and to be canceled at any
time. If you use the `Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button,
the PDF document will have all the corresponding information.

This can be done for `Vendor Bills`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
too.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To retrieve the `Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, drag
and drop XML files as a log note in the chatter for previously created
draft invoices.
::::

##### CFDI to public {#l10n/mx/cfdi}

The Mexican government requires that any goods or services that are sold
must be backed up by an invoice. If the customer does not require an
invoice or has no
`RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, a *CFDI to Public* has to be created also known as a
\"nominative\" invoice.

A contact must be created and it must have a particular name.

If the `CFDI to Public`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox in
either a sales order or an invoice is checked, the final XML will
override the data in the invoice contact and will add the following
characteristics:

- `RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}: **XAXX010101000** if it is a national customer or
  **XEXX010101000** if it is a foreign customer
- `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code: The same code of the
  company
- `Usage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: S01 - Without Fiscal
  Effects

![CFDI to Public Checkbox](mexico/mx-cfdi-to-public.png)

If the final customer doesn\'t share any details, create a generic
`Customer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The name cannot be
[PUBLICO EN GENERAL]{.title-ref} or an error will be triggered (it can
be, for example, [CLIENTE FINAL]{.title-ref}).

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

By default sending the invoice is not allowed if the partner does not
have either the *Country* or *Zip code* set, however this is not
required if the `CFDI to public`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
checkbox is active.
::::

::: seealso
[Regla 2.7.1.21 ExpediciÃ³n de comprobantes en operaciones con el pÃºblico
en general](https://www.sat.gob.mx/articulo/90959/regla-2.7.1.21).
:::

##### Global invoice {#l10n/mx/global-invoice}

If by the end of a certain period of time (that can vary from daily to
bimonthly, depending of your company\'s legal needs and preferences) and
the customer still has sales that weren\'t marked as regular invoices or
individual *CFDI to Public* invoices, the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} allows for the creation of a single invoice that can
contain all operations, known as a *global invoice*.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

For this process, the `Sales <../../sales/sales>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} app must be installed.
::::

::: seealso
[GuÃ­a de llenado del CFDI
global](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/documentos/GuiallenadoCFDIglobal311221.pdf)
:::

###### Setup

The `Global Invoice Serie`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
specific to each branch or company and is used to define the sequence of
global invoices. To configure it, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and navigate to the
`MX Electronic invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.
The `Global
Invoice Serie`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field can be found
within the `Service Tax Administration (SAT)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section.

![Accounting setting with an MX company.](mexico/mx-accounting-settings.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The default sequence for every company/branch is [GINV/]{.title-ref}
::::

###### Sales flow

First, create a dedicated journal in
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to maintain a separate sequence that is used for
global invoices, which function as orders when they are created.

Then, make sure that all the sales orders that need to be signed have
the following configurations:

- `CFDI to Public`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox enabled
- `Invoice Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} marked as
  `To Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

After this, go to
`Sales --> To Invoice --> Orders to Invoice`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, select all relevant sales orders and press
`Create Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Make sure to
disable the `Consolidated
Billing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox and click
`Create Draft Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Odoo will redirect to a list of invoices. Select all of them and in the
`fa-gear`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Actions`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} drop-down menu select `Post entries`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Select all posted invoices again and go back to the
`fa-gear`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Actions`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} drop-down menu to select `Create
Global Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

In the wizard, select the `Periodicity`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} indicated by a professional accountant and press
`Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. All invoices should be
signed under the same XML file, with the same
`Fiscal Folio`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- Click `Show`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab to display a list with all
related invoices. - Click `Cancel`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in
the `CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab to cancel the global
invoice in both the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} and Odoo.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Global invoices created this way won\'t have a **PDF** in them as their
information is already within Odoo and is not to be seen by a customer.
::::

### Electronic accounting (reporting) {#l10n/mx/reporting}

For Mexico, [Electronic
Accounting](https://www.sat.gob.mx/aplicacion/42150/envia-tu-contabilidad-electronica)
refers to the obligation to keep accounting records and entries through
electronic means, and to enter accounting information on a monthly
basis, through the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} website.

It consists of three main XML files:

1.  The updated list of the chart of accounts that is currently in use
2.  A monthly trial balance, plus a closing entry report, also known as:
    *Trial Balance Month 13*
3.  An export of the journal entries in the general ledger (optional
    except in the case of a compulsory audit)

The resulting XML files follow the requirements of the [Anexo TÃ©cnico de
Contabilidad ElectrÃ³nica
1.3](https://www.gob.mx/cms/uploads/attachment/file/151135/Anexo24_05012015.pdf).

In addition to this, it is possible to generate the
[DIOT](https://www.sat.gob.mx/declaracion/74295/presenta-tu-declaracion-informativa-de-operaciones-con-terceros-(diot)-):
a report of vendors\' journal entries that involve IVA taxes that can be
exported in a TXT file.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In order to use these reports, the following modules must be installed:

- `Odoo Mexican Localization Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  [l10n_mx_reports]{.title-ref}
- `Mexico - Month 13 Trial Balance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  [l10n_mx_reports_closing]{.title-ref}
- `Odoo Mexican XML Polizas Export`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  [l10n_mx_xml_polizas]{.title-ref}
::::

The *chart of accounts* and the *Trial Balance Month 13* reports can be
found in `Accounting --> Reporting --> Trial Balance`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. The *DIOT* report can be found in
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The specific characteristics and obligations of the reports that you
send might change according to your fiscal regime. Always contact your
accountant before sending any documents to the government.
::::

#### Chart of accounts {#l10n_mx/chart-of-accounts}

The
`chart of accounts <../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} in Mexico follows a specific pattern based on
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}\'s\' [CÃ³digo agrupador de
cuentas](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/fichas_tematicas/buzon_tributario/Documents/codigo_agrupador.pdf).

It is possible to create any account, as long as it respects
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}\'s encoding group: the pattern is [NNN.YY.ZZ]{.title-ref}
or [NNN.YY.ZZZ]{.title-ref}.

::: example
Some examples are [102.01.99]{.title-ref} or [401.01.001]{.title-ref}.
:::

When a new account is created in
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Chart of
Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, with the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} encoding group pattern, the correct grouping code appears
in `Tags`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the account appears in
the *COA* report.

Once all accounts are created, make sure the correct
`Tags`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are added as these mark the
nature of the account.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

It is not advised use any pattern that ends a section with a 0 (such as
[100.01.01]{.title-ref}, [301.00.003]{.title-ref} or
[604.77.00]{.title-ref}). This triggers errors in the report. By default
Odoo will mark the accounts as yellow if the numbering will cause issue
later on, this is to prevent reports from providing inaccurate data.
::::

Once everything is set up, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Trial Balance`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and click the `COA SAT (XML)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button to generate an XML file containing all of the
accounts. This XML file is ready to upload to the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} website.

#### Trial balance {#l10n/mx/trial-balance}

The trial balance reports the initial balance, credit, and total balance
of your accounts, provided that you added their correct
`encoding group <l10n_mx/chart-of-accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

To generate an XML file of the trial balance, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting -->
Trial Balance`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, select the date,
and click the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(action menu)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then select
`SAT (XML)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Trial balance report.](mexico/mx-reports-trial-balance.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo does not generate the *Balanza de ComprobaciÃ³n Complementaria*.
::::

##### Month 13 {#l10n/mx/month-13}

An additional report is the *Month 13*: a closing balance sheet that
shows any adjustments or movements made in the accounting to close the
year.

To generate this XML document, navigate to
`Accounting --> Accounting --> Journal
Entries`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and create a new
document. Here, add all amounts to modify, and balance the debit and/or
credit of each one.

After this is done, go to the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab and check the `Month 13 Closing`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field. If needed, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Trial Balance`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and select the date `Month 13`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, where it is possible to see the the total amount of
the year, plus all the additions of the journal entry. To generate the
XML file, click the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(action menu)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then select
`SAT (XML)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

#### General ledger {#l10n/mx/general-ledger}

By law, all transactions in Mexico must be recorded digitally. Since
Odoo automatically creates all the underlying journal entries of all
invoices and payments, simply exporting the general ledger complies with
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}\'s audits and/or tax refunds.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The report can be filtered by period or by journal, depending on the
need.
::::

To create the XML, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> General Ledger`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, click `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(action menu)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then click
`XML (Polizas)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, select among
four `Export`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} types:

- `Tax audit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Audit certification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Return of goods`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Compensation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

For `Tax audit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Audit certification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, add the
`Order Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} provided by the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. For `Return of goods`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
or `Compensation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, add the
`Process Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, also provided by
the `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To see this report without sending it, use [ABC6987654/99]{.title-ref}
for the `Order Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
[AB123451234512]{.title-ref} for the `Process Number`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
::::

#### DIOT report {#l10n/mx/diot}

The DIOT (DeclaraciÃ³n Informativa de Operaciones con Terceros /
*Informative Declaration of Operations with Third Parties*) is an
additional obligation with the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, where the current status of creditable and non-creditable
payments, withholdings, import taxes, and refunds of VAT from your
vendor bills are provided to the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Since July 2025 the new 2025 version of the report is available.
::::

Unlike other reports, the
`DIOT (DeclaraciÃ³n Informativa de Operaciones con Terceros)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} is uploaded to a website provided by the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} that contains the A-29 form. In Odoo, you can download the
records of your transactions as a TXT file that can be uploaded to the
form, avoiding direct capture of this data.

The transactions file contains the total amount of the payments
registered in vendor bills, broken down into the corresponding types of
IVA. The `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Type of operation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields are
mandatory for all vendors.

To download the
`DIOT (DeclaraciÃ³n Informativa de Operaciones con Terceros)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} report as a TXT file, go to `Accounting --> Reports --> Tax
Return`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Select the desired
month, click `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(action menu)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and select
`DIOT (TXT)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

In case new taxes are created on the database, there are two types of
tags, the tags containing **tax** must go into the tax distribution and
the ones with the base name go on the base of the tax. All lines of a
VAT tax **must** containing at least one tax grid.

![DIOT (TXT) download button.](mexico/mx-reports-diot.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

It is required to fill in the `Type of Operation`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field in the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab of each vendor to prevent validation errors. Make
sure that foreign customers have their `Country`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} set.

![DIOT information on a vendor contact.](mexico/mx-reports-diot-contact.png)

Selecting `87 - Global Operations`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
will cause the final TXT file to merge all vendors that are part of the
global operations under one generic VAT: *XAXX010101000*.
::::

### External trade {#l10n/mx/external-trade}

The external trade is a complement to a regular invoice that adds
certain values in both the XML and PDF, to invoices with a foreign
customer according to [SAT
regulations](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/complemento_comercio_exterior.htm),
such as:

- The specific address of the receiver and the sender
- The addition of a `Tariff Fraction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  that identifies the type of product
- The correct
  `../accounting/customer_invoices/incoterms`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"} (International Commercial Terms)
- And more, such as the *certificate of origin* and *special units of
  measure*

This allows the correct identification of exporters and importers, in
addition to expanding the description of the merchandise sold.

Since January 1, 2018, external trade is a requirement for taxpayers who
carry export operations of type A1. While the current CFDI is 4.0, the
external trade is currently on version 2.0.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In order to use this feature, the
`EDI for Mexico (Advanced Features)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
[l10n_mx_edi_extended]{.title-ref} module must be installed.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Before installing, make sure your business needs to use this feature.
Consult your accountant first, if needed, before installing any modules.

The `CFDI to public`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox must be
ticked when creating foreign invoices.
::::

#### Configuration

##### Contacts

To configure your company contact for external trade, navigate to
`Accounting -->
Customers --> Customers`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, remove
the default `Customer Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
filter, and select your `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
name. While the CFDI 4.0 requirements require adding a valid
`ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code in the company contact
record, the external trade complement adds the requirement that the
`City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the
`State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must also be valid. All three
fields must coincide with the [Official SAT Catalog for Carta
Porte](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/catalogos_emision_cfdi_complemento_ce.htm),
or it will produce an error.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Add the `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the company\'s *contact
record*, not in the company record itself.
::::

On the contact record, the optional fields `Locality`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Colony Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
can also be filled. These two fields also have to coincide with the data
in the `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}.

To configure the contact data for a foreign receiving client, navigate
to `Accounting
--> Customers --> Customers`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
and select the foreign client\'s contact. The contact must have the
following fields completed to avoid errors:

1.  The entire company `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    including a valid `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code and
    the foreign `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
2.  The foreign `RFC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (tax
    identification number), in the correct format (for example: Colombia
    [123456789-1]{.title-ref})
3.  In the `Sales & Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, to
    activate the `Needs external trade?`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} checkbox.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In the resulting XML and PDF files, the `VAT`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is automatically replaced by the generic VAT for abroad
transactions: [XEXX010101000]{.title-ref}.
::::

##### Products

All products involved with external trade have four additional fields
that are required, two of which are exclusive to external trade.

1.  The `Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the product
    must be set in the `General Information`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} tab.
2.  The `Weight`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the product in
    the `Inventory`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab must be more
    than [0]{.title-ref}.
3.  The
    [correct](https://www.ventanillaunica.gob.mx/vucem/Clasificador.html)
    `Tariff
    Fraction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the product must be
    set in the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab for
    external trade.
4.  The `UMT Aduana`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
    `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab must be set and
    correspond to the `Tariff Fraction`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} for external trade.

![Required external trade product fields.](mexico/mx-external-trade-product.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- If the UoM code of the `Tariff Fraction`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is [01]{.title-ref}, the correct
`UMT Aduana`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is [kg]{.title-ref}. -
If the UoM code of the `Tariff Fraction`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is [06]{.title-ref}, the correct
`UMT Aduana`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is [Units]{.title-ref}.
::::

#### Invoicing flow

Before creating an invoice, it is important to take into account that
external trade invoices require converting product prices into a foreign
currency such as USD. Therefore,
`multicurrency <../accounting/get_started/multi_currency>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} **must** be enabled with the foreign currency activated in
the `Currencies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section. The correct
`Service`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to run is
`[MX] Bank of Mexico`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To convert
product prices, create a `pricelist
<../../sales/sales/products_prices/prices/pricing>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} in the foreign currency.

Then, with the correct exchange rate set up in
`Accounting --> Settings -->
Currency`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, set the
`Incoterm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the optional
`Certificate Source`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields in the
invoice\'s `Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

While not mandatory, the information will be more complete if
`CFDI to public`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is also active.
::::

Finally, confirm the invoice with the same process as a regular invoice,
and click the `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to sign
it via CFDI.

## Point of sale {#l10n/mx/pos}

The `Point of sale <../../sales/point_of_sale>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} adaptation of the Mexican Localization enables the creation
of invoices that comply with the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} requirements directly in the **POS session**, with the
added benefit of creating receipt tickets that allow *self-invoicing* in
a special portal and creating global invoices.

### Point of sale flow {#l10n/mx/pos/flow}

On top of the standard
`Point of Sale configuration <../../sales/point_of_sale/configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, the Mexican localization requires each payment method to be
configured with a correct `Payment Way`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} as well as a `Re-invoicing account`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to handle the accounting for invoices with the
invoicing portal.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

By default, Odoo creates pre-configured payment methods for cash, credit
card, and debit card and assigns the
`402.04.01 Re-invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} account as
default for re-invoicing.
::::

While selling on the **Point of Sale**, click the
`Customer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to either create or
select a customer. Here it is possible to review customer invoicing
information (such as the
`RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} or `Fiscal Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) and
even modify it directly inside the session.

After selecting a customer, tick the `fa-file-text-o`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox. This
opens a menu to select the `Usage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and to define if it is an invoice to the public. Click confirm, select
the payment method, and then click validate to complete the order. The
PDF is then downloaded and it is possible to send the invoice via mail
to the final customer alongside the receipt.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To create invoices from orders, go to the `Orders`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} menu, select the order, click
`Load Order`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and tick the
`fa-file-text-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox. This opens the
same menu for the `Usage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`CFDI to Public`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

![Invoice Configuration for Point of Sale.](mexico/mx-pos.png)

To sign a credit note automatically, tick the
`fa-file-text-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox when processing a
`refund <pos/refund>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Credit notes for returned products will contain the relation type
`03 - DevoluciÃ³n de
mercancÃ­a sobre facturas o traslados previos`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

\- In the Mexican localization, positive and negative lines in a **POS**
session cannot be mixed.

- If a `SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} validation error occurs customer will get a
  `Pro-Forma invoice
  <../../sales/sales/invoicing/proforma>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
  instead.
::::

### Self-invoicing portal {#l10n/mx/pos/portal}

If the final customer is not sure if they want to have their invoice
generated at the exact moment of the sale, it is possible to give them
the option of creating a receipt with either a QR code or a URL. To do
so, follow these steps:

1.  Go to `Point of Sale --> Configuration`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}.
2.  Select the `Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
3.  Scroll to the `Bills & Receipts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    section.
4.  Enable `Self-service invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
5.  Set the `Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
    `QR code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `URL`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or `QR code +
    URL`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Customers who scan this QR code or follow the URL will access to a menu
where they can add their fiscal information, including the *Usage* and
*Fiscal Regime* once they enter the five digit code that is also
provided on the receipt.

On the journal entries of the session, the previously selected
**Re-invoicing account** will be used to handle reversals of the sales
entries when invoices are requested as well as be used as a sales
account for the new invoices.

::: seealso
`../../sales/point_of_sale/receipts_invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Global invoice {#l10n/mx/pos/global-invoice}

As with regular sales orders, global invoices can also be created from a
POS session.

For this, make sure not to select a customer or the invoice option in
the payment menu and go to
`Point of Sale --> Orders --> Orders`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. There, select all the orders to invoice, click
`fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Actions`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and select `Create Global Invoice`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

Like with sales orders, choose the correct
`Periodicity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and press
`Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

This attaches an XML file to each of the selected orders. The XML files
can be downloaded by going to the `CFDI`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab. If needed, it is possible to cancel the invoice
from the same tab.

If eventually any of the orders that are part of the global invoice need
to be addressed to a customer, it is still possible to send an invoice
by entering a new POS session, clicking the `fa-bars`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(drop-down menu)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then
click `Orders`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Change the
`All active orders`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} filter to
`Paid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, select the order, and click
the `fa-file-text-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Global invoices, just as regular invoices, can only be grouped by
physical address. That is determined by the address set on the POS
invoice journal, so when attempting to invoice two addresses a warning
will come up to warn the user of the error.
::::

## eCommerce {#l10n/mx/ecommerce}

The eCommerce adaptation of the Mexican Localization provides and extra
step to create invoices that comply with the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} requirements on
`eCommerce  <../../websites/ecommerce>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} by
retrieving the customer data after the **Checkout** and even allowing
for the signature of **automatic invoices** after the payment is
processed, as well as sending customers the files via email and granting
them access to retrieve their PDF file from their own customer portal.

### eCommerce flow {#l10n/mx/ecommerce/flow}

During the regular checkout process, a new
`Invoicing Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} step appears, where
it is possible to request an invoice or not. If `No`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is selected, a **CFDI to Public** is created,. If
`Yes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected, the
`RFC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Fiscal Regime`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Usage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are required in order to get
all information in the sales order, where its status will change to
`To Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Additionally the customer can decide whether or not to request
`IEPS Breakdown
<l10n/mx/ieps-breakdown>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Make sure to add a `UNSPSC code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
the `shipping product
<ecommerce/checkout/delivery>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

If the `Automatic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
enabled in `Settings --> Website -->
Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, the electronic
document will be signed automatically.

## Sales {#l10n/mx/sales}

The **Sales** app contains fields that make invoicing easier, while the
fields themselves do not change the sales behavior, they are directly
copied when creating an invoice.

The copied fields are:

- Payment Way
- Payment Policy
- CFDI to public
- Usage

Additionally, it is possible to get a preview of the invoice for
validation purposes with the customer by installing the
`pro-forma module <../../sales/sales/invoicing/proforma>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. This module adds the mentioned fields to the sale order as
well as:

- Product code
- Unit code
- Fiscal regime

## Subscriptions {#l10n/mx/subscriptions}

While handling subscriptions, all the sales fields are used to create
the recurrent invoices. These are automatically signed and sent via
email with the PDF and XML attached with no additional manual actions
required.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

All invoices generated by the subscription app will always be
automatically signed with no exceptions.
::::

## Inventory {#l10n/mx/inventory}

### Customs numbers {#l10n/mx/inventory/customs}

A *customs declaration* (Pedimento Aduanero) is a fiscal document that
certifies that all contributions to the fiscal entity (the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}) have been paid for, including the import/export of goods.

According to the [Annex
20](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/anexo_20.htm) of
CFDI 4.0, in documents where the invoiced goods come from a first-hand
import operation, the `Customs Number`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field needs to be added to all lines of products
involved with the operation, as does the date of the document.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To do so, the
`Odoo Mexico Localization for Stock/Landing`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} [l10n_mx_edi_landing]{.title-ref} module must be
installed, in addition to the
`Inventory <../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"},
`Purchase <../../inventory_and_mrp/purchase>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, and `Sales <../../sales/sales>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} apps.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Do not confuse this feature with external trade. The customs numbers are
directly related to importing goods, while the external trade complement
is related to exporting. Consult your accountant first if this feature
is needed before doing any modifications.
::::

#### Configuration

In order to track the correct customs number for a specific invoice,
Odoo uses `landed costs
<../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/inventory_valuation/landed_costs>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. Go to
`Inventory --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and in the `Valuation`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, make sure that
`Landed Costs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is activated.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

It is recommended to add a `Default Journal`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to automatically fill the mandatory
`Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field on landed costs even
though landed costs that only add customs numbers without adding
`Additional Costs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} do not create
journal entries.
::::

Configure the **goods-type** products that hold the customs numbers. To
do so, create the products and complete these three requirements:

- `Tracking`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} **must** be set to
  either `By Lots`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `By Unique Serial
  Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} but **not**
  `By Quantity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Invoicing Policy`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} **must** be set
  to `Delivered quantities`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Valuation by lots/serial numbers
  <../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/inventory_valuation/valuation_by_lots>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"} **must** be enabled.

This will make the field `Customs invoicing`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} available on the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab. Enable the field to use customs numbers with this
product.

It is important to make sure the product has a
`Product Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and has the
following configuration:

- `Costing Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Either
  `FIFO`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `AVCO`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `Inventory Valuation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Either
  `Periodic`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `Perpetual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The feature works regardless of whether the `inventory valuation
<../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/inventory_valuation/cheat_sheet>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is set to either `Periodic (at closing)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} or `Perpetual (at invoicing)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
::::

![Storable products general configuration.](mexico/mx-landing-configuration.png)

![Storable product category configuration.](mexico/mx-landing-configuration-category.png)

#### Purchase and sales flow

After configuring the product, follow the standard `purchase flow
<../../inventory_and_mrp/purchase>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.

Create a purchase order from
`Purchase --> Orders --> Purchase Order`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, confirm the order to display a
`Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button. Click on the
`Receipt`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button, add the lots
or serial numbers and `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Go to `Inventory --> Operations --> Landed Costs`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and create a new record. In the
`Transfer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, add the receipt that was
just validated, and add the `Customs
number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

While it is possible to add costs related to the customs number at this
stage of the process, it is highly recommended to create a landed cost
from a vendor bill from your customs agent. Learn more about
`Landed Costs here
<../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/inventory_valuation/landed_costs>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.
::::

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

The `Customs number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is not
editable once it is set, and cannot be repeated, however it is possible
to fix the number on the lot or serial number later by selecting a
different landed cost.
::::

![Customs number on a landed costs Inventory record.](mexico/mx-landing-inventory.png)

The customs number assigned to a specific lot or serial number can be
found on the its registry on
`Inventory --> Products --> Lots/Serial Numbers`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. The `L10N Mx Edi Landed
Cost`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field can be edited at any time
to fix any mistakes that could have occurred when registering the landed
cost. Editing the `L10N Mx Edi Landed Cost`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field automatically updates the
`Customs number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the name of the
lot or serial number.

Next, create a sales order and confirm it. Click on the
`Delivery`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button that appears,
and carefully review the assigned lots/serial numbers to make sure they
are the desired values, after that `Validate`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} the delivery order.

Finally,
`create an invoice from the sales order <accounting/inv-process/so>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, and confirm it. The invoice lines are created according to
the distribution of the delivery order, in cases where more than one
customs number were selected, Odoo will split the invoice lines by
quantity and customs numbers.

![Customs number on confirmed sales order product.](mexico/mx-landing-invoice.png)

### Delivery guide {#l10n/mx/inventory/delivery-guide}

A [Carta
Porte](https://www.sat.gob.mx/portal/public/tramites/complemento-carta-porte)
is a bill of lading: a document that states the type, quantity, and
destination of goods being carried.

On July 17th, 2024, version 3.1 of this
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} was implemented for all transportation providers,
intermediaries, and owners of goods. Odoo is able to generate a document
type \"T\" (Traslado), which, unlike other documents, is created in a
delivery order instead of an invoice or payment.

Odoo can create XML and PDF files with (or without) ground transport,
and can process materials that are treated as *Dangerous Hazards*.

In order to print the PDF, the delivery order must be signed by the
government and then it can be printed using the
`Print Carta Porte`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button on the
delivery order.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The PDF file contains a QR code to verify the CCP code for the
authorities.
::::

In order to transport goods between warehouses, the logistic route must
contain a **Delivery** type of operation.

::: seealso
`Inter-warehouse replenishment
<../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/warehouses_storage/replenishment/resupply_warehouses>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In order to use this feature, the
`Mexico - Electronic Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
[l10n_mx_edi_stock]{.title-ref} module must be installed.

Additionally, it is necessary to have the
`Inventory <../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} and `Sales <../../sales/sales>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} apps installed.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo does not support Carta Porte type document type \"I\" (Ingreso),
air, train or marine transport.

Consult your accountant first if this feature is needed before doing any
modifications.
::::

#### Configuration

Odoo manages two different types of CFDI type \"T\". Both can be created
from either `incoming
shipments or delivery orders
<../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/shipping_receiving/daily_operations>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.

- `No Federal Highways`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is used when
  the `Distance to Destination`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
  [less than 30
  km](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/cartaporte/Paginas/documentos/PreguntasFrecuentes_Autotransporte.pdf).
- `Federal Transport`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is used when
  the `Distance to Destination`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  exceeds 30 km.

For No Federal Highways, no other configuration is required beyond the
standard requirements of regular invoicing (the
`RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} of the customer, the UNSPSC code, etc.).

For *Federal Transport*, several configurations have to be added to
contacts, vehicle setups, and products. Those configurations are then
included in the XML and PDF files.

##### Contacts and vehicles

Like the external trade feature, the `Address`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in both the company and the final customer must be
complete. The `ZIP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} code,
`City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and `State`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} must coincide with the [Official SAT Catalog for Carta
Porte](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/catalogos_emision_cfdi_complemento_ce.htm).

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The `Locality`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is optional for
both addresses.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The origin address used for the delivery guide is set in `Inventory -->
Configuration --> Warehouses`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
While this is set as the company address by default, you can change it
to your correct warehouse address.
::::

This feature requires the use of
`Fleet <../../hr/fleet/new_vehicle>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} to
manage vehicles. The vehicle setup is managed directly on the vehicle,
and all the required fields are only visible after checking the
`L10N Mx Is Freight Vehicle`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

Checking the `L10N Mx Is Freight Vehicle`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field displays the `MX Parameters`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab where the mandatory fields are required to create a
correct delivery guide. Additionally the vehicle **must** contain a
`License Plate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a
`Model Year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and a
`Driver`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The `Vehicle Plate Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Number Plate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields must contain
between 5 and 7 characters.
::::

The main driver of the vehicle is set directly on the
`Driver`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, and it is possible to
add more vehicle operators in the `Intermediaries`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section. The only mandatory fields for driver contacts
are the `VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Operator License`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Delivery guide vehicle configuration.](mexico/mx-delivery-guide-vehicle.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If the vehicle is rented or more intermediaries are required, it is
possible to add them in the `Intermediaries`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field.
::::

##### Products

Similar to regular invoicing, all products must have a
`UNSPSC category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In addition to
this, there are two extra configurations for products involved in
delivery guides:

- The `Product Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be set as
  `Storable Product`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for stock
  movements to be created.
- In the `Inventory`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, the
  `Weight`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field must be more than
  [0]{.title-ref}.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Creating a delivery guide of a product with the
`Weight`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} set to [0]{.title-ref} will
trigger an error. As the `Weight`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
immediately stored in the delivery order, it is then necessary to return
the products and recreate the delivery order (and delivery guide) with
