the correct values.
::::

#### Sales and inventory flow

To create a delivery guide, first create and confirm a sales order from
`Sales -->
Sales Order`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Click the
`Delivery`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button that is
generated, and `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the
transfer.

After the status is set to `Done`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
you can edit the transfer, and select the
`Transport Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Additional Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

If using the `No Federal Highways`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`Transport Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, save the transfer,
and then click `Generate Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. The resulting XML can be found in the chatter.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Other than the `UNSPSC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on all
products, delivery guides that use `No Federal
Highways`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} do not require any special
configuration to be sent to the government, as they are a type \"T\"
CFDI with no delivery guide complement.
::::

If using the `Federal Transport`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`Transport Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the
`Vehicle Setup`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is displayed to be
selected. The `Gross vehicle weight`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
is taken from the `Vehicle setup`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
configuration where it is possible to add additional
`Extra weight`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to account for the
drivers and luggage.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo will calculate the `Gross vehicle weight`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} with the following formula:

$$Gross vehicle weight = Vehicle weight + (Weight + Extra Weight) / 1000$$
::::

Every delivery requires a value in
`Distance to Destination (KM)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
greater than [0]{.title-ref}. Finally, enter the
`Delivery Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and click
`Generate Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

By default the `Scheduled Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
filled and represents the time at which the shipment leaves the
warehouse and the `Delivery Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
the time that the shipment is expected to arrive at its destination.
These values are declared in both the XML and PDF.
::::

##### Dangerous hazards

Certain values in the `UNSPSC Category`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} are considered in the [official SAT
catalog](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/tramitesyservicios/Paginas/complemento_carta_porte.htm)
as *dangerous hazards*. These categories need additional considerations
when creating a delivery guide with
`Federal Transport`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

First, select the product from
`Inventory --> Products --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Then, in the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, fill the
`Hazardous Material Designation Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and `Hazardous Packaging`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields with
the correct code from the
`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} catalog.

![Delivery guide hazardous material product required fields.](mexico/mx-delivery-guide-hazards-designation.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

There exists the possibility that a `UNSPSC Category`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} may or may not be a dangerous hazard (for example
*01010101*). If it is not dangerous, enter [0]{.title-ref} in the
`Hazardous
Material Designation Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
::::

In `MX Parameters`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, complete the
`Environment
Insurer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Environment Insurance Policy`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as
well. After this, continue with the regular process to create a delivery
guide.

##### Imports and Exports

If your Carta Porte is for international operations (for exports), some
additional fields need to be taken into account.

First, make sure that all relevant `Products`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} have the following configuration:

- `UNSPSC Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} cannot be
  `01010101 Does not exist in the catalog`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
- `Tariff Fraction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `UMT Aduana`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be set, similar
  to the `external
  trade <l10n/mx/external-trade>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} flow.
- `Material Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be set.

Then, when creating a `Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} from a delivery or receipt, fill the following fields:

- `Customs Regimes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Customs Document Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Customs Document Identification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

Then, when creating a `Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} for a receipt where the `Customs Document
Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
`Customs number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, two new fields
appear: `Customs Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Importer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The field `Customs Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} should
follow the pattern [xx xx xxxx xxxxxxx]{.title-ref}. For example, [15 48
3009 0001235]{.title-ref} with **Two** spaces between text.
::::




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/netherlands.md ---

# Netherlands

::: seealso
`Documentation on e-invoicingâ€™s legality and compliance in the Netherlands
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/netherlands>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## XAF Export

With the Dutch accounting localization installed, you will be able to
export all your accounting entries in XAF format. For this, you have to
go in `Accounting --> Reporting --> General Ledger`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, you define the entries you want to export using
the filters (period, journals, \...) and then you click on the button
**EXPORT (XAF)**.

## Dutch Accounting Reports

If you install the Dutch accounting localization, you will have access
to some reports that are specific to the Netherlands such as :

- Profit & Loss
- Tax Report (Aangifte omzetbelasting)
- Intrastat Report (ICP)




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/new_zealand.md ---

# New Zealand

## Modules {#localizations/new_zealand/modules}

The following modules related to the New Zealand localization are
available:

  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name                                             Technical name                       Description
  ------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------------ -----------------------------------
  `New Zealand - Accounting`{.interpreted-text     [l10n_nz]{.title-ref}                Installed by default when the
  role="guilabel"}                                                                      accounting fiscal localization
                                                                                        package is set to New Zealand. This
                                                                                        module also installs the remittance
                                                                                        advice report module.

  `Employment Hero NZ Payroll`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_employment_hero]{.title-ref}   This module synchronizes all pay
  role="guilabel"}                                                                      runs from Employment Hero with
                                                                                        Odoo\'s journal entries.

  `EFT Batch Payment`{.interpreted-text            [l10n_nz_eft]{.title-ref}            This module allows businesses to
  role="guilabel"}                                                                      streamline bulk payments like
                                                                                        payroll and vendor payments. Each
                                                                                        bank has its specific format for
                                                                                        these transactions.
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The localization's core modules are installed automatically with the
localization. The rest can be manually
`installed </applications/general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.
::::

## Localization overview {#localizations/new_zealand/loc-specifics}

- `../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}: a predefined structure tailored to New Zealand accounting
  standards
- `../accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}:
  automated tax adjustments based on customer or supplier registration
  status
- `localizations/new_zealand/taxes-gst`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
- `localizations/new_zealand/reporting`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}

### Taxes and GST {#localizations/new_zealand/taxes-gst}

The default taxes impact the
`GST report<../../../applications/finance/accounting/reporting/tax_returns>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, which can be accessed through
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Return`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}

The standard **Goods and Service Tax** (GST) rate is 15%, but different
rates and exemptions exist for specific categories of goods and
services.

::: seealso
`GST report<../../../applications/finance/accounting/reporting/tax_returns>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

#### Tax mapping {#localizations/new_zealand/tax-mapping}

Within the New Zealand localization package, tax names encompass the tax
rate as an integral part of their naming convention.

::: seealso
`Taxes documentation <../../../applications/finance/accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

These are the taxes in Odoo.

  -----------------------------------------------------------------------
  GST name          Description       Label on invoices GST Type
  ----------------- ----------------- ----------------- -----------------
  15%               Sale (15%)        GST Sales (15%)   Sales

  15%               Purch (15%)       GST Purchases     Purchases
                                      (15%)             

  0% EX             Zero/Export (0%)  Zero Rated        Sales
                    Sale              (Export) Sales    

  0% F              Zero/Import (0%)  GST Free          Purchases
                    Purch             Purchases         

  0% TPS            Purch (Imports    Purchase (Taxable Purchases
                    Taxable)          Imports) - Tax    
                                      Paid Separately   

  100% ONLY         GST Only -        GST Only on       Purchases
                    Imports           Imports           
  -----------------------------------------------------------------------

### Reporting {#localizations/new_zealand/reporting}

#### GST report {#localizations/new_zealand/gst-report}

The **Goods and Services Tax (GST) report** is a critical tax reporting
requirement for businesses registered for GST. The GST return is used to
report and remit GST to the **Inland Revenue Department (IRD)**.

![GST Report.](new_zealand/GST_report.png)

The base and tax amounts are collected from the **GST**, which is
pre-configured in Odoo to align with GST Return requirements (Boxes
1-15). The **GST** can also be manually configured for special use
cases, such as specific GST treatments (e.g., zero-rating for exported
agricultural goods). Once the **GST** setup for each account is
complete, Odoo automatically categorizes journal items into the
appropriate boxes. This ensures the **GST** return is accurate and fully
reflects the business\'s financial activities.

::: seealso
`Taxes documentation <../../../applications/finance/accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

##### Closing the GST report {#localizations/new_zealand/gst-closing}

The
`tax return periodicity <accounting/tax-returns/periodicity>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} must be set up before submitting the
`tax return <accounting/tax-returns/report>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} (**GST report**) to the **IRD**.

::: seealso
`Year-end closing documentation
<../../../applications/finance/accounting/reporting/year_end>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

Before closing the entry for the first time, enable the `developer mode
<../../../applications/general/developer_mode>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} and go to `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Tax Groups`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} to
set the default **GST payable account** and **GST receivable account**.

Once the **GST payable** and **GST receivable** accounts are set up, the
**Tax Return** report generates an accurate journal closing entry
automatically, balancing the GST balance with the GST clearing account.

The balance between **GST receivable** and **payable** is set against
the tax clearing account defined on the tax group. The amount to be paid
to or received from **IRD** can then be reconciled with a bank
transaction.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The **GST** report is not submitted directly to the **IRD**. Instead,
Odoo automatically calculates the required values for each section,
providing options to audit and review the data for a clearer
understanding of its history. Businesses can then submit these values to
the [IRD portal](https://myir.ird.govt.nz/_/).
::::

#### Remittance advice {#localizations/new_zealand/remittance-advice}

A remittance advice is a document used as proof of payment to a
business. To access it, go to
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Payments`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and select the payment(s). Then click
`fa-print`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Print`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and select `Payment Receipt`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![Remittance Advice.](new_zealand/remitance_advice_new.png)

## Accounting {#localizations/new_zealand/accounting}

### E-invoicing {#localizations/new_zealand/e-invoicing}

Odoo allows
`electronic invoicing <accounting/e-invoicing/configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} settings to be configured per contact.

![Peppol Contact.](new_zealand/peppol_contact_new.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Validating an invoice or credit note for a contact on the PEPPOL network
will download a compliant XML file that can be manually uploaded to the
PEPPOL network. Odoo is currently in the process of becoming an access
point for the ANZ region.
::::

::: seealso
[PEPPOL
requirements](https://peppol.org/learn-more/country-profiles/new-zealand/)
:::

### EFT batch payments {#localizations/new_zealand/eft-batch-payments}

An `EFT (electronic funds transfer)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
batch file is a digital format used to facilitate bulk payment
processing for businesses. It allows companies to consolidate multiple
inbound and outbound payments into a single electronic file. This
process is commonly used by businesses handling multiple payments at
once, such as payroll or payments to multiple suppliers.

#### Configuration {#localizations/new_zealand/eft-configuration}

::: {#localizations/new_zealand/eft-settings}
> 1.  `Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
>     `EFT Batch Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} module
>     ([l10n_nz_eft]{.title-ref}).
> 2.  Go to
>     `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
>     role="menuselection"}. In the
>     `Customer Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
>     enable `Batch Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
:::

::: seealso
`../../../applications/finance/accounting/payments/batch`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

##### Bank journal {#localizations/new_zealand/eft-bank-journal}

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to configure the bank **journal**. In the
`Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, enter the
`Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and click
`Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In the
`Create Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, fill
in the `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and enable
`Send Money`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to set the bank account
as trusted. The `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
optional.

##### Contacts\' bank accounts {#localizations/new_zealand/eft-contacts}

To add banking information for a contact, navigate to
`Accounting --> Customers --> Customers`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"},
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Vendors`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, or access the contact directly through the
**Contacts** app. Select the relevant contact, then open the
`Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Under the
`Bank Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, click
`Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to enter the required
details.

- `Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Account Holder`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (it will
  automatically be selected for that contact)
- `Send Money`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be **enabled**.

#### Generate an EFT file {#localizations/new_zealand/eft-generate}

Go to `Accounting --> Customers --> Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} or
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Bills`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Select the invoices/bills to be paid from the
list and click `Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In the
`Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, select
`New Zealand EFT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and click
`Create Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `Group Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox is
optional. This option appears only if there are multiple invoices or
bills from the same contact.
::::

In the payments window, the required EFT information for each payment,
such as `Particulars`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Analysis Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, can be entered as
needed.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The same payment information can be found under
`Accounting --> Customers -->
Payments`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} or
`Accounting --> Vendors --> Payments`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.
::::

Then, return to the **payments** list view, select the payments needing
to be batched, and click `Create Batch`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

In the **batch payment** window, fill in the following fields:

- `EFT file format`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Payment Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Payment Particulars`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Batch Payement.](new_zealand/batch_payment_view.png)

Then, click `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Odoo will
generate the EFT file in the chatter. Click on the file to preview or
download it.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Each bank has its specific format requirements for EFT batch payments.
Make sure to choose the correct EFT file format. Some banks may also
require the completion of additional fields, such as
`Direct Debit Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Dishonour Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

::: seealso
`Batch paments by bank deposit documentation
<../../../applications/finance/accounting/payments/batch>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Industry-specific features {#localizations/new_zealand/XXXXXX}

### Starshipit shipping {#localizations/new_zealand/starshipit}

[Starshipit](https://starshipit.com/) is a shipping service operator
that facilitates the integration of Australasian shipping couriers with
Odoo.

::: seealso
\- [Starshipit webinar
recording](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TcDWnoYLXWg) -
`Starshipit shipping <../../../applications/inventory_and_mrp/inventory/shipping_receiving/setup_configuration/starshipit_shipping>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Buy Now, Pay Later solutions {#localizations/new_zealand/buynow-paylater}

**Buy Now, Pay Later** solutions are popular payment methods for
e-shops. Some of these solutions are available via the
[Stripe](https://stripe.com/au/payments/payment-methods) and [AsiaPay
payment](https://www.asiapay.com.au/payment.html#option) providers.

::: seealso
\-
`AsiaPay Payment Provider documentation <../../../applications/finance/payment_providers/asiapay>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} -
`Stripe Payment Provider documentation <../../../applications/finance/payment_providers/stripe>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

### Point of Sale terminals {#localizations/new_zealand/pos-terminals}

To have a direct connection between Odoo and a PoS terminal, a
`Stripe terminal
<../../../applications/sales/point_of_sale/payment_methods/terminals/stripe>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is needed. Odoo supports the **EFTPOS** payment solution.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

A Stripe payment terminal is not needed to use Odoo as the main POS
system. The only drawback of not using Stripe is that cashiers must
manually enter the final payment amount on the terminal.
::::

::: seealso
\-
`Stripe Payment Provider documentation <../../../applications/finance/payment_providers/stripe>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} - [Stripe.com
Dashboard](https://dashboard.stripe.com/login?redirect=%2Fdashboard) -
[Stripe.com Docs: Terminal](https://docs.stripe.com/terminal)
:::

## Payroll {#new-zealand/payroll}

### Employment Hero integration {#new-zealand/employment-hero}

If your business is already up and running with [Employment
Hero](https://employmenthero.com/), the connector can be used as an
alternative payroll solution.

The Employment Hero module automatically synchronises payslip accounting
entries (e.g., expenses, social charges, liabilities, taxes) from
**Employment Hero** to Odoo. Payroll administration is still done in
**Employment Hero**; only the **journal entries** are recorded in Odoo.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

To
`configure the Employment Hero API <employment_hero/configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for **New Zealand**, use the following value as
`Payroll URL`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
[https://api.nzpayroll.co.nz/]{.title-ref}.
::::




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/oman.md ---

# Oman

## Modules {#localizations/oman/modules}

The following modules related to the Omani localization are available:

  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Name                                            Technical name                  Description
  ----------------------------------------------- ------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Oman - Accounting`{.interpreted-text           [l10n_om]{.title-ref}           Omani
  role="guilabel"}                                                                `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text
                                                                                  role="ref"}, complete with the local chart of accounts, taxes, tax report, and
                                                                                  fiscal positions.

  `Oman - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text   [l10n_om_reports]{.title-ref}   Accounting reports for Oman.
  role="guilabel"}                                                                
  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The module automatically installs core configurations. A manual `update
</applications/general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} may
be required for missing elements or updates.
::::

## Localization overview {#localizations/oman/loc-review}

The Omani localization package provides the necessary accounting setup
for companies operating in Oman, including a pre-configured chart of
accounts, taxes, fiscal positions, and a standard tax report format. It
ensures alignment with Oman VAT regulations and Royal Decree
requirements.

The Omani localization package provides the following key features to
ensure compliance with local fiscal and accounting regulations:

- `Chart of Accounts <localizations/oman/chart-of-accounts>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: based on Omani standards, with mapped account groups and
  default account mappings.
- `Taxes <localizations/oman/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  standard 5% VAT, zero-rated domestic as well as exports, exempt,
  imports, and reverse charge taxes.
- `Fiscal Positions <../accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}: automated tax adjustments based on customer or supplier
  registration status.
- `Tax Report <localizations/oman/tax-report>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: structured according to the Oman VAT return format, as
  issued by the Tax Authority.

### Chart of accounts {#localizations/oman/chart-of-accounts}

The Omani
`chart of accounts <../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is based on the local rules and regulations. This includes
pre-configured account groups and mapped default accounts. Use the
`predefined structure <chart-of-account/create>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} or create new accounts, as needed.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Accounts are grouped under relevant categories such as assets,
liabilities, income, and expenses in line with local standards.
::::

### Taxes {#localizations/oman/taxes}

The following `Taxes <../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, included in the Omani VAT system, are available by default
with the Omani localization package:

- Standard Rate 5%: Applies to the sale of most goods and services
  within Oman.
- Zero-Rated Supplies (0%): Applies to essential supplies where the
  seller can still reclaim input VAT.
- Exports (0%): Applies to the supply of goods and services that are
  exported outside Oman.
- Exempt Supplies: Applies to supplies that are not subject to VAT, and
  for which the supplier cannot reclaim input VAT on related purchases.
- Reverse Charge Mechanism (RCM): Applies to taxable businesses in Oman
  receiving services or goods from non-resident suppliers not registered
  for VAT in Oman.
- Import VAT (5%): Applies to the importation of most goods into Oman,
  charged at the customs point of entry.

### Tax report {#localizations/oman/tax-report}

The `VAT return <accounting/tax-returns/report>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} provides a consolidated overview of the taxable sales and
purchases, VAT collected and paid, and the total amount owed or
refundable for the reporting period.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

\- The tax return aligns with official declarations required by [Oman\'s
Tax Authority](https://tms.taxoman.gov.om/portal/web/taxportal/home). -
[VAT Taxpayer
Guide](https://tms.taxoman.gov.om/portal/documents/20126/1414820/VAT+Taxpayer+Guide+-+VAT+Return+Filing.pdf/fae31d0c-e7e7-0014-9f28-a4c506b36614?t=1733169613409).
::::




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/peru.md ---

# Peru

## Modules

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to utilize all the current features of the Peruvian
localization.

+----------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------+

## Configuration

### Install the Peruvian localization modules

Go to *Apps* and search for Peru, then click Install in the module Peru
EDI. This module has a dependency with *Peru - Accounting*. In case this
last one is not installed, Odoo installs it automatically within EDI.

![The \"Module\" filter is set on \"Peru\"](peru/peru-modules.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

When you install a database from scratch selecting Peru as country, Odoo
automatically installs the base module: Peru - Accounting.
::::

#### Configure your company

In addition to the basic information in the Company, we need to set Peru
as the Country, this is essential for the Electronic Invoice to work
properly. The field **Address Type Code** represents the establishment
code assigned by the SUNAT when companies register their RUC (Unique
Contributor Registration):

![Company data for Peru including RUC and Address type code.](peru/peru-company.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

In case the Address type code is unknown, you can set it as the default
value: 0000. Be aware that if an incorrect value is entered, the
Electronic invoice validation might have errors.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The NIF should be set following the RUC format.
::::

#### Chart of Account

The chart of accounts is installed by default as part of the set of data
included in the localization module, the accounts are mapped
automatically in:

- Taxes
- Default Account Payable.
- Default Account Receivable

The chart of accounts for Peru is based on the most updated version of
the `PCGE (Plan
Contable General Empresarial)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, which is
grouped in several categories and is compatible with NIIF accounting.

### Accounting Settings {#peru-accounting-settings}

Once the modules are installed and the basic information of your company
is set, you need to configure the elements required for Electronic
Invoice. For this, go to `Accounting
--> Settings --> Peruvian Localization`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

#### Basic Concepts

Here are some terms that are essential on the Peruvian localization:

- **EDI**: Electronic Data Interchange, which in this refers to the
  Electronic Invoice.
- **SUNAT**: is the organization that enforces customs and taxation in
  Peru.
- **OSE**: Electronic Service Operator, [OSE SUNAT\'s
  definition](https://cpe.sunat.gob.pe/aliados/ose#:~:text=El%20Operador%20de%20Servicios%20Electr%C3%B3nicos%20(OSE)%20es%20qui%C3%A9n%20se%20encarga,otro%20documento%20que%20se%20emita).
- **CDR**: Receipt certificate (Constancia de RecepciÃ³n).
- **SOL Credentials**: Sunat Operaciones en LÃ­nea. User and password are
  provided by the SUNAT and grant access to Online Operations systems.

#### Signature Provider

As part of the requirements for Electronic Invoice in Peru, your company
needs to select a Signature Provider that will take care of the document
signing process and manage the SUNAT validation response. Odoo offers
three options:

1.  IAP (Odoo In-App Purchase)
2.  Digiflow
3.  SUNAT

Please refer to the sections below to check the details and
considerations for each option.

##### IAP (Odoo In-App Purchase)

This is the default and the suggested option, considering the digital
ceritificate is included as part of the service.

![IAP option as signature providers.](peru/peru-IAP.png)

###### What is the IAP?

This is a signature service offered directly by Odoo, the service takes
care of the next process:

1.  Provides the Electronic invoice Certificate, so you do not need to
    acquire one by yourself.
2.  Send the document to the OSE, in this case, Digiflow.
3.  Receive the OSE validation and CDR.

###### How does it work?

The service requires Credits in order to process your electronic
documents. Odoo provides 1000 credits for free in new databases. After
these credits are consumed, you need to buy a Credit Package.

  ---------------
  Credits   EUR
  --------- -----
  1000      22

  5000      110

  10,000    220

  20,000    440
  ---------------

The credits are consumed per each document that is sent to the OSE.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

If you have a validation error and the document needs to be sent one
more time, one additional credit will be charged. Therefore, it is
paramount that you verify all information is correct before sending your
document to the OSE.
::::

###### What do you need to do?

- In Odoo, once your enterprise contract is activated and you start
  working in Production, you need to buy credits once the first 1000 are
  consumed.
- As Digiflow is the OSE used in the IAP, you need to affiliate it as
  the official OSE for your company on the SUNAT website. This is a
  simple process. For more information, please check [OSE Affiliation
  guide](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BkrMTZIiJyi5XI0lGMi3rbMzHddOL1pa/view?usp=sharing).
- Register Digiflow as the authorized PSE, please check [PSE Affiliation
  guide](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QZoqWvtQERpS0pqp6LcKmw7EBlm9EroU/view?usp=sharing).

##### Digiflow

This option can be used as an alternative, instead of using the IAP
services you can send your document validation directly to Digiflow. In
this case you need to consider:

- Buy your own digital Certificate: For more detail regarding the
  official vendor list, and the process to acquire it, please refer to
  [SUNAT Digital
  Ceritifcates](https://cpe.sunat.gob.pe/informacion_general/certificados_digitales/).
- Sign a service agreement directly with
  [Digiflow](https://www.digiflow.pe/).
- Provide your SOL credentials.

![Digiflow.](peru/peru-Digiflow.png)

##### SUNAT

In case your company wants to sign directly with the SUNAT, it is
possible to select this option in your configuration. In this case you
need to consider: - Get the SUNAT Certification process accepted.

- Buy your own digital Certificate: For more detail regarding the
  official vendor list, and the process to acquire it, please refer to
  [SUNAT Digital
  Ceritifcates](https://cpe.sunat.gob.pe/informacion_general/certificados_digitales/).
- Provide you SOL credentials.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

When using direct connection with the SUNAT, the SOL User must be set
with the Company RUT + User Id. Example: `20121888549JOHNSMITH`
::::

#### Testing environment

Odoo provides a testing environment that can be activated before your
company goes into production.

When using the testing environment and the IAP signature, you don't need
to buy testing credits for your transactions as all of them are
validated by default.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

By default the databases are set to work on production, make sure to
enable the testing mode if needed.
::::

#### Certificate

In case you don't use Odoo IAP, in order to generate the electronic
invoice signature, a digital certificate with the extension `.pfx` is
required. Proceed to this section and load your file and password.

![EDI Certificate wizard.](peru/peru-Certificate.png)

#### Multicurrency

The official currency exchange rate in Peru is provided by the SUNAT.
Odoo can connect directly to its services and get the currency rate
either automatically or manually.

![SUNAT displayed in Multicurrency Service option.](peru/l10n-pe-banksync-sunat.png)

Please refer to the next section in our documentation for more
information about
`multicurrencies <../accounting/get_started/multi_currency>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.

### Configure Master data {#peru-master_data}

#### Taxes

As part of the localization module the taxes are created automatically
with their related financial account and electronic invoice
configuration.

![List of default taxes.](peru/peru-taxes.png)

##### EDI Configuration

As part of the taxes configuration, there are three new fields required
for electronic invoice, the taxes created by default have this data
included, but in case you create new taxes make sure you fill in the
fields:

![Taxes EDI data for Peru.](peru/peru-taxes-edi.png)

#### Fiscal Positions

There are two main fiscal positions included by default when you install
the Peruvian localization.

**Extranjero - ExportaciÃ³n**: Set this fiscal position on customers for
Exportation transactions.

**Local Peru**: Set this fiscal position on local customers.

#### Document Types

In some Latin American countries, including Peru, some accounting
transactions like invoices and vendor bills are classified by document
types, defined by the government fiscal authorities, in this case by the
SUNAT.

Each document type can have a unique sequence per journal where it is
assigned. As part of the localization, the Document Type includes the
country on which the document is applicable;the data is created
automatically when the localization module is installed.

The information required for the document types is included by default
so the user does not need to fill anything on this view:

![Document Type list.](peru/peru-document-type.png)

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Currently the documents supported on customer invoices are: Invoice,
Boleta, Debit Note and Credit Note.
::::

#### Journals

When creating Sales Journals, the following information must be filled,
in addition to the standard fields on the Journals:

##### Use Documents

This field is used to define if the journal uses Document Types. It is
only applicable to Purchase and Sales journals, which are the ones that
can be related to the different set of document types available in Peru.
By default, all the sales journals created use documents.

##### Electronic Data Interchange

This section indicates which EDI workflow is used in the invoice, for
Peru we must select "Peru UBL 2.1".

![Journal EDI field.](peru/peru-journal-edi.png)

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

By default, the value Factur-X (FR) is always displayed, make sure you
can uncheck it manually.
::::

#### Partner

##### Identification Type and VAT

As part of the Peruvian localization, the identification types defined
by the SUNAT are now available on the Partner form, this information is
essential for most transactions either on the sender company and in the
customer, make sure you fill in this information in your records.

![Partner identification type.](peru/peru-id-type.png)

#### Product

Additional to the basic information in your products, for the Peruvian
localization, the UNSPC Code on the product is a required value to be
configured.

![UNSPC Code on products.](peru/peru-unspc-code.png)

## Usage and testing

### Customer invoice

#### EDI Elements

Once you have configured your master data, the invoices can be created
from your sales order or manually. Additional to the basic invoice
information described on `our page about the
invoicing process <../accounting/customer_invoices/overview>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, there are a couple of fields required as part of the Peru
EDI:

- **Document type**: The default value is "Factura Electronica" but you
  can manually change the document type if needed and select Boleta for
  example.

  ![Invoice document type field on invoices.](peru/peru-invoice-document-type.png)

- **Operation type**: This value is required for Electronic Invoice and
  indicates the transaction type, the default value is "Internal Sale"
  but another value can be selected manually when needed, for example
  Export of Goods.

  ![Invoice operation type field on invoices.](peru/peru-operation-type.png)

- **EDI Affectation Reason**: In the invoice lines, additional to the
  Tax there is a field "EDI Affectation Reason" that determines the tax
  scope based on the SUNAT list that is displayed. All the taxes loaded
  by default are associated with a default EDI affection reason, if
  needed you can manually select another one when creating the invoice.

  ![Tax affectation reason in invoice line.](peru/peru-tax-affectation-reason.png)

#### Invoice validation

Once you check all the information in your invoice is correct, you can
proceed to validate it. This action registers the account move and
triggers the Electronic invoice workflow to send it to the OSE and the
SUNAT. The following message is displayed at the top of the invoice:

![Sending of EDI Invoice in blue.](peru/peru-posted-invoice.png)

Asynchronous means that the document is not sent automatically after the
invoice has been posted.

##### Electronic Invoice Status {#peru-electronic-invoice-status}

**To be Sent**: Indicates the document is ready to be sent to the OSE,
this can be done either automatically by Odoo with a *cron* that runs
every hour, or the user can send it immediately by clicking on the
button "Sent now".

![Send EDI manually.](peru/peru-sent-manual.png)

**Sent**: Indicates the document was sent to the OSE and was
successfully validated. As part of the validation a ZIP file is
downloaded and a message is logged in the chatter indicating the correct
Government validation.

![Message on chatter when the invoice is valid.](peru/peru-invoice-sent.png)

In case there is a validation error the Electronic Invoice status
remains in "To be sent" so the corrections can be made and the invoice
can be sent again.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

One credit is consumed each time that you send a document for
validation, in this sense if an error is detected on an invoice and you
send it one more time, two credits are consumed in total.
::::

#### Common Errors

There are multiple reasons behind a rejection from the OSE or the SUNAT,
when this happens Odoo sends a message at the top of the invoice
indicating the error details and in the most common cases a hint to fix
the issue.

If a validation error is received, you have two options:

- In case the error is related to master data on the partner, customer
  or taxes, you can simply apply the change on the record (example
  customer identification type) and once it is done click on the Retry
  button.

- If the error is related to some data recorded on the invoice directly
  (Operation type, missing data on the invoice lines), the correct
  solution is to reset the invoice to Draft, apply the changes, and then
  send the invoice again to the SUNAT for another validation.

  ![List of common errors on invoices.](peru/peru-errors.png)

For more detail please refert to [Common errors in
SUNAT](https://www.nubefact.com/codigos-error-sunat/).

#### Invoice PDF Report

After the invoice is accepted and validated by the SUNAT, the invoice
PDF report can be printed. The report includes a QR code, indicating the
invoice is a valid fiscal document.

![Invoice PDF report.](peru/peru-PDF.png)

#### IAP Credits

Odoo's Electronic IAP offers 1000 credits for free, after these credits
are consumed in your production database, your company must buy new
credits in order to process your transactions.

Once you run out of credits a red label is displayed at the top of the
invoice indicating that additional credits are required, you can easily
buy them by accessing the link provided in the message.

![Buying credits in the IAP.](peru/peru-credits-IAP.png)

In the IAP service includes packages with different pricing based on the
number of credits. The price list in the IAP is always displayed in EUR.

#### Special Use cases

##### Cancellation process

Some scenarios require an invoice cancellation, for example, when an
invoice was created by mistake. If the invoice was already sent and
validated by the SUNAT, the correct way to proceed is by clicking on the
button Request Cancellation:

![Request invoice cancellation button.](peru/peru-cancellation.png)

In order to cancel an invoice, please provide a cancellation Reason.

###### Electronic Invoice Status

**To Cancel**: Indicates the cancellation request is ready to be sent to
the OSE, this can be done either automatically by Odoo with a *cron*
that runs every hour, or the user can send it immediately by clicking on
the button "Send now". Once it is sent, a cancellation ticket is
created, as a result the next message and CDR File are logged in the
chatter:

![Cancellation CDR sent by the SUNAT.](peru/peru-cancellation-cdr.png)

**Cancelled**: Indicates the cancellation request was sent to the OSE
and was successfully validated. As part of the validation a ZIP file is
downloaded and a message is logged in the chatter indicating the correct
Government validation.

![Invoice after cancellation.](peru/peru-cancelled.png)

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

One credit is consumed on each cancellation request.
::::

##### Export invoices

When creating exportation invoices, take into account the next
considerations:

- The Identification type on your customer must be Foreign ID.
- Operation type in your invoice must be an Exportation one.
- The taxes included in the invoice lines should be EXP taxes.

![Exportation invoices main data.](peru/peru-exp-invoice.png)

##### Advance Payments

1.  Create the advance payment Invoice and apply its related payment.
2.  Create the final invoice without considering the advance payment.
3.  Create a credit note for the Final invoice with the advance payment
    amount.
4.  Reconcile the Credit note with the final invoice.
5.  The remaining balance on the final invoice should be paid with a
    regular payment transaction.

##### Detraction Invoices

When creating invoices that is subject to Detractions, take into account
the next considerations:

1.  All the products included in the invoice must have these fields
    configured:

    ![Detraction fields on products.](peru/peru-detraction.png)

2.  Operation type in your invoice must be `1001`

    ![Detraction code on invoices.](peru/peru-detraction-invoice.png)

### Credit Notes

When a correction or refund is needed over a validated invoice, a credit
note must be generated, for this just click on the button "Add Credit
Note", a part of the Peruvian localization you need to prove a Credit
Reason selecting one of the options in the list.

![Add Credit Note from invoice.](peru/peru-credit-note.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

When creating your first credit Note, select the Credit Method: Partial
Refund, this allows you to define the credit note sequence.
::::

By default the Credit Note is set in the document type:

![Credit Note document type.](peru/peru-credit-note-document.png)

To finish the workflow please follow the instructions on
`our page about Credit Notes
<../accounting/customer_invoices/credit_notes>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The EDI workflow for the Credit notes works in the same way as the
invoices.
::::

### Debit Notes

As part of the Peruvian localization, besides creating credit notes from
an existing document you can also create debit Notes. For this just use
the button "Add Debit Note".

By default the Debit Note is set in the document type.

### Electronic delivery guide 2.0 {#peru-edg}

The *GuÃ­a de RemisiÃ³n ElectrÃ³nica* (GRE) is an electronic document
generated by the shipper to support the transportation or transfer of
goods from one place to another, such as a warehouse or establishment.
In Odoo, there are several configuration steps needed before you can
successfully use this feature.

The use of the *guÃ­a de remisiÃ³n electrÃ³nica* electronic document is
mandatory and required by
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} for taxpayers who need to
transfer their products, except those under the *Single Simplified
Regime* (rÃ©gimen Ãºnico simplificado or RUS).

#### Delivery guide types

##### Sender

The *Sender* delivery guide type is issued when a sale is made, a
service is rendered (including processing), goods are assigned for use,
or goods are transferred between premises of the same company and
others.

This delivery guide is issued by the owner of the goods (i.e., the
sender) at the beginning of the shipment. The sender delivery guide is
supported in Odoo.

::: seealso
[SUNAT guÃ­a de remisiÃ³n](https://www.gob.pe/7899-guia-de-remision)
:::

##### Carrier

The *Carrier* delivery guide type justifies the transportation service
the driver (or carrier) performs.

This delivery guide is issued by the carrier and must be issued to each
shipper when the shipment goes through public transport.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The carrier delivery guide is **not** supported in Odoo.
::::

::: seealso
[SUNAT guÃ­a de remisiÃ³n
transportista](https://tefacturo.pe/blog/sunat/guia-de-remision-electronica/guia-de-remision-transportista/)
:::

#### Transportation types

##### Private

The *Private* transportation type option is used when the owner
transfers goods using their own vehicles. In this case, a sender\'s
delivery guide must be issued.

##### Public

The *Public* transportation type option is used when an external carrier
moves the goods. In this case, two delivery guides must be issued: the
sender\'s delivery guide and the carrier\'s delivery guide.

#### Direct submission to SUNAT

The creation of the
`GRE (GuÃ­a de RemisiÃ³n ElectrÃ³nica)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
delivery guide in Odoo **must** be sent directly to the
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, regardless of the
electronic document provider: IAP, Digiflow, or
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

#### Required information

Version 2.0 of the electronic delivery guide requires additional
information on the general configuration, vehicles, contacts, and
products. In the general configuration, it is necessary to add new
credentials that you can retrieve from the
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal.

#### Cancellations

**Both** the sender and the carrier can cancel the electronic waybill as
long as the following conditions are met:

- The shipment has not been initiated.
- If the shipment has been initiated, the receiver **must** be changed
  before reaching the final destination.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The `SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} no longer uses the term
\"Anula\", but now uses the term \"Dar de baja\" for cancellations.
::::

#### Testing

The `SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} does not support a test
environment. This means that any delivery guides that were generated by
mistake **will** be sent to the
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

If, by mistake, the waybill was created in this environment, it is
necessary to delete it from the
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal.

#### Configuration

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

\- Electronic sender\'s
`GRE (GuÃ­a de RemisiÃ³n ElectrÃ³nica)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is
currently the only supported type of waybill in Odoo. - The delivery
guide is dependent on the Odoo *Inventory* app, the
`l10n_pe_edi`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`l10n_pe`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} modules. - A second user
**must** be added for the creation of electronic documents.
::::

After following the steps to configure the
`electronic invoicing <peru-accounting-settings>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and the `master data <peru-master_data>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
the `Peruvian - Electronic Delivery Note 2.0`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} module ([l10n_pe_edi_stock_20]{.title-ref}).

Next, you need to retrieve the *client ID* and *client secret* from
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. To do so, follow the
[manual de servicios web plataforma nueva
GRE](https://cpe.sunat.gob.pe/sites/default/files/inline-files/Manual_Servicios_GRE%20%281%29.pdf).

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

In the `SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal, it is important to
have the correct access rights enabled, as they may differ from the user
set for electronic invoicing.
::::

These credentials should be used to configure the delivery guide general
settings from
`Inventory --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and scroll down to the `Peru
Delivery Guide`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

Configure the following `Sunat Delivery Guide API`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} fields:

- `Guide Client ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the unique API
  *client ID* generated in the
  `SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
  Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal
- `Guide Client Secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the unique
  API *client secret* generated in the
  `SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
  Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal
- `Guide SOL User`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the RUC Number +
  SOL username
- `Guide SOL Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the SOL user
  password

![Example for the SUNAT Delivery Guide API section configuration.](peru/gre-fields-example.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

It is required to follow the format [RUC + UsuarioSol]{.title-ref}
(e.g., [20557912879SOLUSER]{.title-ref}) for the
`Guide SOL User`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, depending on
the user selected when generating the
`GRE (GuÃ­a de RemisiÃ³n ElectrÃ³nica)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} API
credentials in the
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} portal.
::::

##### Operator

The *operator* is the vehicle\'s driver in cases where the delivery
guide is through *private* transport.

To create a new operator, navigate to
`Contacts --> Create`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and fill
out the contact information.

First, select `Individual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the
`Company Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, add the
`Operator License`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of the contact form.

For the customer address, make sure the following fields are complete:

- `District`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (`DNI`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}/`RUC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"})
- `Tax ID Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Individual type operator configurations in the Contact form.](peru/operator-configuration.png)

##### Carrier

The *carrier* is used when the delivery guide is through *public*
transport.

To create a new carrier, navigate to
`Contacts --> Create`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and fill
out the contact information.

First, select `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the
`Company Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, add the `MTC
Registration Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Authorization Issuing Entity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
the `Authorization
Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

For the company address, make sure the following fields are complete:

- `District`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (`DNI`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}/`RUC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"})
- `Tax ID Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Company type operator configurations in the Contact form.](peru/company-operator-configuration.png)

##### Vehicles

To configure the available vehicles, navigate to
`Inventory --> Configuration -->
Vehicles`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and fill in the
vehicle form with the information needed for the vehicle:

- `Vehicle Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `License Plate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Is M1 or L?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Special Authorization Issuing Entity`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `Authorization Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Default Operator`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

It is important to check the `Is M1 or L?`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} checkbox if the vehicle has fewer than four wheels or
fewer than eight seats.
::::

![Vehicle not selected as an M1 or L type with extra fields shown.](peru/vehicle-not-m1-or-l-pe.png)

##### Products

To configure the available products, navigate to
`Inventory --> Products`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and
open the product to be configured.

Make sure that the applicable information in the product form is fully
configured. The `Partida Arancelaria`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
(Tariff Item) field needs to be completed.

#### Generating a GRE

Once the delivery from inventory is created during the sales workflow,
make sure you complete the
`GRE (GuÃ­a de RemisiÃ³n ElectrÃ³nica)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
fields on the top-right section of the transfer form for the fields:

- `Transport Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Reason for Transfer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Departure start date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

It is also required to complete the `Vehicle`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and `Operator`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
fields under the `Guia de Remision PE`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab.

The delivery transfer has to be marked as *Done* for the
`Generar Guia de Remision`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to
appear on the left menu of the transfer form.

![Generar Guia de Remision button on a transfer form in the Done stage.](peru/generate-gre-transferview.png)

Once the transfer form is correctly validated by
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, the generated XML file
becomes available in the chatter. You can now print the delivery slip
that shows the transfer details and the QR code validated by
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

![Transfer details and QR code on generated delivery slip.](peru/gre-delivery-slip.png)

#### Common errors

- [Diferente prefijo para productos (T001 en algunos, T002 en
  otros)]{.title-ref}

  At the moment, Odoo does not support the automation of prefixes for
  products. This can be done manually for each product output. This can
  also be done for non-storable products. However, keep in mind that
  there will be no traceability.

- [2325 - GrossWeightMeasure - El dato no cumple con el formato
  establecido \"Hace falta el campo\" \"Peso\"\" en el
  producto]{.title-ref}

  This error occurs when the weight on the product is set as
  [0.00]{.title-ref}. To fix this, you need to cancel the waybill and
  recreate it. Make sure that you fix the weight on the product before
  creating the new waybill, or it will result in the same error.

- [JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0) when
  creating a Delivery Guide]{.title-ref}

  This error is typically generated due to SOL user issues. Verify the
  user\'s connection with the
  `SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
  Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}; the SOL user must be
  established with the company RUT + user ID. For example
  [2012188549JOHNSMITH]{.title-ref}.

- [El nÃºmero de documento relacionado al traslado de mercancÃ­a no cumple
  con el formato establecido: error: documento relacionado]{.title-ref}

  The *Related Document Type* and *Related Document Number* fields only
  apply to invoices and receipts.

- [400 Client error: Bad Request for URL]{.title-ref}

  This error is not solvable from Odoo; it is advised you reach out to
  the `SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
  Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} and verify the user. It
  may be necessary to create a new user.

- [Invalid content was found starting with element
  \'cac:BuyerCustomerParty\']{.title-ref}

  This error occurs when the transfer reason is set as *other*. Please
  select another option. Following to the official documentation of the
  `SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
  Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}\'s waybill guide, the
  transfer reasons *03 (sale with shipment to third party)* or *12
  (others)* does not work in Odoo, since you should not have an empty or
  blank customer.

- [Duda cliente: consumo de crÃ©ditos IAP al usar GRE 2.0]{.title-ref}

  For live clients using IAP, no credit is consumed (in theory) because
  it does not go through the OSE, i.e., these documents are directly
  sent to the
  `SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
  Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

- [Errores con formato credenciales GRE 2.0 (traceback
  error)]{.title-ref}

  Odoo currently throws an error with a traceback instead of a message
  that the credentials are not correctly configured in the database. If
  this occurs on your database, please verify your credentials.

### eCommerce electronic invoicing

First, `install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
**Peruvian eCommerce** ([l10n_pe_website_sale]{.title-ref}) module.

The **Peruvian eCommerce** module enables the features and
configurations to:

- allow clients to create online accounts for **eCommerce** purposes;
- support required fiscal fields in the **eCommerce** application;
- receive payments for sales orders online;
- generate electronic documents from the **eCommerce** application.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The **Peruvian eCommerce** module is dependent on the previous
installation of the **Invoicing** or **Accounting** app, as well as the
**Website** app.
::::

#### Configuration {#peru-ecommerce-configuration}

After configuring the Peruvian
`electronic invoicing <peru-accounting-settings>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} flow, complete the following configurations for the
**eCommerce** flow:

- `Client account registration <ecommerce/customer_accounts/checkout-access>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"};
- `Automatic invoice <ecommerce/handling/invoices>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"};
- `../../websites/ecommerce/products`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}: Set
  the `Invoicing Policy`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
  `Ordered quantities`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and define the
  desired `Customer taxes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `../payment_providers`{.interpreted-text role="doc"};
- `../../websites/ecommerce/shipping`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}: For
  each shipping method, set the `Provider`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} field to `Fixed Price`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}. Then, set a `Fixed Price`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} amount greater than [0.00]{.title-ref} (not zero), as
  the shipping method price is added to the invoice line.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- [Mercado Pago](https://www.mercadopago.com/) is an online payment
provider supported in Odoo that covers several countries, currencies,
and payment methods in Latin America. - Make sure to define a
`Sales Price`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the
`Delivery Product`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the shipping
method to prevent errors when validating the invoice with
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. - To offer free delivery,
manually remove the `Delivery Product`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, or at least use [\$0.01]{.title-ref} (one cent) for
the invoice to be validated with SUNAT.
::::

::: seealso
`Set up the Mercado Pago payment provider. <../payment_providers/mercado_pago>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

#### Invoicing flow for eCommerce

Once the
`configurations <peru-ecommerce-configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} are all set, fiscal input fields will be available during
the checkout process for signed-in customers.

When customers enter their fiscal data at checkout and complete a
successful purchase, the invoice is generated with the corresponding
`EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
elements. The document type (Boleta/Factura) is selected based on their
tax ID (RUC/DNI). The invoice must then
`be sent to the OSE and the SUNAT
<peru-electronic-invoice-status>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. By
default, all published invoices are sent once a day through a scheduled
action, but you can also send each invoice manually if needed.

Once the invoice is validated with
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, customers can download the
.zip file with the CDR, XML, and PDF files directly from the customer
portal by clicking the `Download`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button.

## Reports

### Permanent inventory reports: `PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} 12.1 and `PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} 13.1 {#peru/reports-ple}

Odoo can produce two permanent inventory reports as [.txt]{.title-ref}
files for Peruvian accounting:
`PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
12.1 and `PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} 13.1. All inventory transactions made need to be reported.

- `PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  12.1 **only tracks inventory in physical units**, focusing on the
  inflow and outflow of goods for effective management and planning.
- `PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  13.1 tracks **both physical quantities and monetary values of
  inventory**, providing a comprehensive view for tax and management
  purposes.

Both reports must be maintained semi-annually (January-June and
July-December), with monthly transaction details reported within these
periods. The submission deadlines are October 1st for the first semester
and April 1st for the second semester, in accordance with the
*ResoluciÃ³n de Superintendencia NÂ° 169-2015*.

#### Configuration

Before generating the
`PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
12.1 or `PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} 13.1 reports, make sure the `Peru - Stock
Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
([l10n_pe_reports_stock]{.title-ref}) module is installed, then update
the fields for:

- `Products <peru/reports-ple-products>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
- `Warehouses <peru/reports-ple-warehouses>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Inventory transfers <peru/reports-ple-transfers>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}

##### Products {#peru/reports-ple-products}

Several configurations related to the product or product category are
necessary for `PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} reporting:

- **Type of existence**: For all products needing
  `PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  reporting, go to the product record\'s `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} tab and select the
  `Type of Existence`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} according to
  `SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
  Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}\'s table 5 for inventory
  reporting.
- **Automatic inventory valuation**: For storable goods
  (`products with tracked inventory`{.interpreted-text role="dfn"}), use
  `automatic inventory valuation
  <../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/inventory_valuation/cheat_sheet>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}. Once automatic inventory valuation is enabled, this
  valuation method can be enabled for a product\'s product category.
- **Costing method:** Storable goods must use a `costing method
  <../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/inventory_valuation/cheat_sheet>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"} **other** than `Standard Price`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, as the journal entries generated from stock moves
  are used to populate the
  `PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  reports.

##### Warehouses {#peru/reports-ple-warehouses}

When `setting up a warehouse
<../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/warehouses_storage/inventory_management/warehouses>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, the `Annex Establishment Code`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field must be filled. This code acts as a unique ID for
each warehouse and should only be a numeric combination, containing
between 4 to 7 digits.

##### Inventory transfers {#peru/reports-ple-transfers}

Transferring inventory is a key process captured in the
`PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
12.1 and `PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} 13.1 reports.
`Inventory transfers <../../inventory_and_mrp/inventory/shipping_receiving/daily_operations>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} include both incoming and outgoing shipments.

When validating an inventory transfer (either on a warehouse receipt or
delivery order), select the `Type of Operation (PE)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} performed according to
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}\'s table 12 for permanent
inventory reporting.

#### Generate a .txt file for permanent inventory Kardex reports

`PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
12.1 and 13.1 come as two separate books. The books need to be
downloaded in [.txt]{.title-ref} file format from Odoo, and then they
should be submitted to the
`SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
`PLE (Programa de Libros ElectrÃ³nico)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
software.

On the
`Inventory Valuation Report <inventory/product_management/valuation-report>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, click the `PLE Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button. Then, select the `Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
choose a report to export: either the `PLE 12.1`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} or `PLE 13.1`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Odoo
generates a [.txt]{.title-ref} file for the chosen report.

![Export Buttons selection](peru/l10n-ple-export-button.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Only a download of the report in [.txt]{.title-ref} format is available.
There is no preview or visualization available within Odoo.
::::
