# Philippines

## Configuration

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
`ðŸ‡µðŸ‡­ Philippines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`fiscal localization package
<fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to get
all the default accounting features of the Philippine localization, such
as a chart of accounts, taxes, and reports. These provide a base
template to get started with using Philippine accounting.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- When creating a new database and selecting the
[Philippines]{.title-ref} as a country, the fiscal localization module
**Philippines - Accounting** is automatically installed. - If the module
is installed in an existing company, the **chart of accounts** and
**taxes** will *not* be replaced if there are already posted journal
entries.
::::

### Chart of accounts and taxes

A minimum configuration default chart of accounts is installed, and the
following types of taxes are installed and linked to the relevant
account:

- Sales and Purchase VAT 12%
- Sales and Purchase VAT Exempt
- Sales and Purchase VAT Zero-Rated
- Sales and Purchase Withholding

For the withholding taxes
(`Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}), there is an additional
`Philippines ATC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field under the
`Philippines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

![Philippines ATC code field set on taxes.](philippines/philippines-atc-code.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Taxes\' ATC codes are used for the
`BIR 2307 <localizations/philippines/report-BIR1207>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"},
`SAWT and QAP reports <localizations/philippines/report-QAP-SAWT>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. If a tax is created manually, its ATC code must be added.
::::

### Contacts

When a company or an individual (not belonging to a company) contact is
located in the Philippines, fill in the `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field with their [Taxpayer Identification Number
(TIN)]{.title-ref}.

For individuals not belonging to a company, identify them by using the
following additional fields:

- `First Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Middle Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Last Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

For both `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Individual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the TIN should follow
the [NNN-NNN-NNN-NNNNN]{.title-ref} format. The branch code should
follow the last digits of the TIN, or else it can be left as
[00000]{.title-ref}.
::::

## Reports

### BIR 2307 report {#localizations/philippines/report-BIR1207}

**BIR 2307** reports, also known as [Certificate of Creditable Tax
Withheld at
Source](https://www.bir.gov.ph/bir-forms?tab=Certificates&idTag=BIR2307&datasetCode=3381&label=2307&type=TAB%20LINK),
can be generated for purchase orders and vendor payments with the
applicable withholding taxes.

To generate a BIR 2307 report, select one or multiple vendor bills from
the list view, and click
`Action --> Download BIR 2307 XLS`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![Multiple vendor bills selected with action to \"Download BIR 2307 XLS\".](philippines/philippines-multi-bill.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The same action can be performed on a vendor bill from the form view.
::::

In the pop-up that opens, review the selection and click
`Generate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Pop up menu to generate BIR 2307 XLS file.](philippines/philippines-generate.png)

This generates the [Form_2307.xls]{.title-ref} file that lists all the
vendor bill lines with the applicable withholding tax.

The process above can also be used for a *single* vendor
`payment <../accounting/payments>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} if it
is linked to one or more
`vendor bills <../accounting/payments>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
with applied withholding taxes.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- If no withholding tax is applied, then the XLS file will not generate
records for those vendor bill lines. - When grouping payments for
multiple bills, Odoo splits the payments based on the contact. From a
payment, clicking `Action --> Download BIR 2307 XLS`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} generates a report that only includes vendor bills
related to that contact.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo cannot generate the BIR 2307 PDF report or DAT files directly. The
generated `Form_2307.xls`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file can be
exported to an *external* tool to convert it to BIR DAT or PDF format.
::::

### SLSP report

To access the
`SLSP (Summary List of Sales and Purchases)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} report, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Summary List of Sales and Purchases`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

Click the buttons at the top to display the desired report:

- | `Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
    `SLS (Summary List of Sales)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} report.
  | All customer invoices with the associated sales taxes applied are
    shown in this report.

- | `Purchases`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
    `SLP (Summary List of Purchases)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
    report.
  | All vendor bills with the associated purchase taxes applied are
    shown in this report.

![SLSP Report](philippines/slsp.png)

By default, both reports exclude journal entries containing partners
without a TIN number set and those with importation taxes set. To view
or hide them, click `Options:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
select the required filter:

- `Including Partners Without TIN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Including Importations`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

To export the
`SLSP (Summary List of Sales and Purchases)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} report, click `Export
SLSP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo cannot generate the DAT files directly. The
`Export SLSP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`XLSX`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} buttons are used to export an
XLSX file, which can be processed using an *external* tool to convert it
to the DAT format.
::::

### 2550Q tax report

The tax report report is accessible by navigating to
`Accounting --> Reporting -->
Statement Reports --> Tax Report --> 2550Q(PH)`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. The form is based on the latest *2550Q (Quarterly
Value-Added Tax Return)* Jan. 2023 version.

![2550Q Tax Report](philippines/2550Q.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Most lines in the tax report are automatically computed based on the
taxes. For more accurate reporting and filing of the tax report, manual
journal entries can also be mapped to the tax report through
preconfigured **Tax Grids** for each tax report line.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo cannot generate the 2550Q BIR formatted PDF report directly. It
should be used as a reference when externally filing the form manually
or online.
::::

### QAP & SAWT reports {#localizations/philippines/report-QAP-SAWT}

To access the `QAP (Quarterly Alphalist of Payees)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} and `SAWT (Summary Alphalist of
Withholding Tax)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} reports, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Return`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, click the `fa-book`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `Report:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and
select `SAWT & QAP (PH)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Click the buttons at the top to display the desired report:

- | `SAWT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
    `SAWT (Summary Alphalist of Withholding Tax)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} report.
  | All customer invoices with the associated sales witholding taxes
    applied are shown in this report.

- | `QAP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
    `QAP (Quarterly Alphalist of Payees)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
    report.
  | All vendor bills with the associated purchase witholding taxes
    applied are shown in this report.

![SAWT & QAP Report](philippines/philippines-sawt.png)

To export the
`SAWT (Summary Alphalist of Withholding Tax)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} and `QAP (Quarterly
Alphalist of Payees)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} reports in XLSX
format, click `Export SAWT & QAP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo cannot generate the DAT files directly. The
`Export SAWT & QAP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`XLSX`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} buttons are used to export an
XLSX file, which can be processed using an *external* tool to convert it
to the DAT format.
::::

## Check printing

The Philippine check print layout follows the latest
`PCHC (Philippine Clearing House
Corporation)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} standardized format. To
enable check printing, go to `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
enable `Checks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and set the
`Check Layout`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to [Print Check -
PH]{.title-ref}.

Checks are printed using the
`standard workflow <../accounting/payments/pay_checks>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/romania.md ---

# Romania

## Configuration

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Romanian localization.

  Name                                                         Technical name               Description
  ------------------------------------------------------------ ---------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Romania - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}    [l10n_ro]{.title-ref}        Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
  `Romanian SAF-T Export`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_ro_saft]{.title-ref}   Module to generate the **D.406 declaration** in the SAF-T format.

![Modules for the Romanian localization](romania/romania-modules.png)

::: seealso
`Documentation on e-invoicingâ€™s legality and compliance in Romania
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/romania>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## D.406 declaration

Starting January 1, 2023, companies registered for tax purposes in
Romania must report their accounting data to the Romanian Tax Agency
monthly or quarterly in the D.406 declaration.

Odoo provides all you need to export the data of this declaration in the
SAF-T XML format, which you can validate and sign using the software
provided by the Romanian Tax Agency.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Currently, Odoo only supports the generation of the monthly/quarterly
D.406 declaration (containing journal entries, invoices, vendor bills,
and payments). The yearly declaration (including assets) and the
on-demand declaration (including inventory) are not yet supported.
::::

### Configuration

#### Company

- Under `Settings --> General Settings`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, in the **Companies** section, click
  `Update Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and fill in the
  company\'s `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Telephone Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- Provide your company\'s
  `CUI (Codul Unic de Inregistrare)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  number or `CIF (*Codul de
  identificare fiscalÄƒ*)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} number (for
  foreign companies) in the `Company ID`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} field, without the [RO]{.title-ref} prefix (e.g.,
  [18547290]{.title-ref}).
- If your company is **registered** for VAT in Romania, fill in the
  `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field number, including
  the [RO]{.title-ref} prefix (e.g., [RO18547290]{.title-ref}). If the
  company is **not** registered for VAT in Romania, you **must not**
  fill in the `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
- Open the **Contacts** app and search for your company. Open your
  company\'s profile, and in the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} tab, click `Add a line`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} and add your **bank account number** if not informed
  already. Make sure the profile is set as `Company`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} above the **name**.
  - You must have at least one **contact person** linked to your company
    in the **Contacts** app. If no **contact person** is linked, create
    a new one by clicking `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, set
    it as `Individual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and select
    your company in the `Company name`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} field.

#### Chart of accounts

To generate a file receivable by the Romanian Tax Agency, the chart of
accounts must not deviate from an official chart of accounts, such as:

- the chart of accounts for commercial companies
  (*PlanConturiBalSocCom*), which is installed by default when creating
  a company with the Romanian localization or;
- the chart of accounts for companies following
  [IFRS](https://www.ifrs.org/) (*PlanConturiIFRS*).

Under `Settings --> Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, in
the **Romanian localization** section, set the
`Tax Accounting Basis`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to reflect the
accounting regulations and Chart of Accounts used by the company.

::: seealso
`../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

#### Customer and supplier

Fill in the `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Zip Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of each partner that
appears in your invoices, vendor bills, or payments through the
**Contacts** app.

For partners that are companies, you must fill in the VAT number
(including the country prefix) in the `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field. If the partner is a company based in Romania,
you may instead fill in the CUI number (without the \'RO\' prefix) in
the `Company ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

#### Tax

You must indicate the `Romanian SAF-T Tax Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} (3-digit number) and `Romanian
SAF-T Tax Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (6-digit number) on
each of the taxes you use. This is already done for the taxes that exist
by default in Odoo. To do so, go to `Accounting --> Configuration -->
Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, select the tax you wish
to modify, click the `Advanced Options`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, and fill in the **tax type** and **tax code**
fields.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The **tax type** and **tax code** are codes defined by the Romanian Tax
Agency for the **D.406 declaration**. These can be found in the Excel
spreadsheet published as guidance for completing the declaration, which
you can find on the [website of the Romanian Tax
Agency](https://www.anaf.ro/anaf/internet/ANAF/despre_anaf/strategii_anaf/proiecte_digitalizare/saf_t/).
::::

::: seealso
`../accounting/taxes`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

#### Product

For some types of goods transactions, the
`Intrastat Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Cod NC) must be
configured on the product, as it is required by Romanian law:

- import / export transactions;
- acquisitions / supplies of food products subjected to reduced VAT
  rate;
- intra-community movements subjected to intrastat reporting;
- acquisitions / supplies subjected to local reversed VAT charge
  (depending on Cod NC); and
- transactions with excisable products for which excise duties are
  determined based on the Cod NC.

If the Intrastat Code is not specified on a non-service product, the
default code \'0\' will be used.

To configure the `Intrastat Codes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
go to `Accounting --> Customers --> Products`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, select a product, and in the
`Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, set a
`Commodity Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

::: seealso
`../accounting/reporting/intrastat`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

#### Vendor bill

You must check the `Is self-invoice (RO)?`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} checkbox in the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab for any vendor bill that is a self-invoice (i.e. a
vendor bill that you issued yourself in the absence of an invoice
document received from a supplier).

### Generating the declaration

#### Exporting your data

To export the XML for the D.406 declaration, go to
`Accounting --> Reports -->
General Ledger`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and click on
`SAF-T`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Click on the \'SAF-T\' button to export the D.406 XML declaration.](romania/romania-saft-button.png){.align-center}

You can then validate and sign the XML file using the Romanian Tax
Agency\'s validation software, *DUKIntegrator*.

#### Signing the report

Download and install the *DUKIntegrator* validation software found on
the [website of the Romanian Tax
Agency](https://www.anaf.ro/anaf/internet/ANAF/despre_anaf/strategii_anaf/proiecte_digitalizare/saf_t/).

Once you have generated the XML, open \'DUKIntegrator\' and select the
file you have just generated.

Click on `Validare + creare PDF`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
create an **unsigned** PDF containing your report, or
`Validare + creare PDF semnat`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
create a **signed** PDF containing your report.

![The DUKIntegrator validation software.](romania/romania-dukintegrator.png){.align-center}

If the *DUKIntegrator* validator detects errors or inconsistencies in
your data, it generates a file that explains the errors. In this case,
you need to correct those inconsistencies in your data before you can
submit the report to the Romanian Tax Agency.




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/saudi_arabia.md ---

# Saudi Arabia

## Modules {#localizations/saudi-arabia/modules}

The following modules related to the Saudi Arabian localization are
available:

  Name                                      Technical name                          Description
  ----------------------------------------- --------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Saudi Arabia - Accounting                 [l10n_sa]{.title-ref}                   Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} for Saudi Arabia with Phase 1 QR code support.
  Saudi Arabia - Accounting Reports         [l10n_sa_reports]{.title-ref}           Accounting reports for Saudi Arabia
  Saudi Arabia - E-invoicing                [l10n_sa_edi]{.title-ref}               Enables ZATCA Phase 2 API integration for e-invoicing compliance.
  Saudi Arabia - E-invoicing (Simplified)   [l10n_sa_edi_pos]{.title-ref}           Enables e-invoicing through PoS.
  Saudi Arabia - Point of Sale              [l10n_sa_pos]{.title-ref}               Adds compliance fields and behavior for PoS invoices.
  Saudi Arabia - Withholding Tax            [l10n_sa_withholding_tax]{.title-ref}   Forces the installation of the Withholding Tax on Payment module.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The localization\'s core modules are installed automatically with the
localization. The rest can be manually
`installed </applications/general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.
::::

::: seealso
`Saudi Arabia Payroll localization documentation <../../hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/saudi_arabia>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Localization overview {#localizations/saudi-arabia/loc-review}

The Saudi Arabian localization package ensures compliance with Saudi
Arabian fiscal and accounting regulations. It includes tools for
managing taxes, fiscal positions, reporting, and a predefined chart of
accounts tailored to Saudi Arabia\'s standards.

The Saudi Arabian localization package provides the following key
features to ensure compliance with local fiscal and accounting
regulations:

- `../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}: a predefined structure aligned with Saudi Arabian
  regulations
- `localizations/saudi-arabia/taxes`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  preconfigured tax rates, including standard 15% VAT, zero-rated, and
  exempt options
- `../accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}:
  automated tax adjustments based on customer or supplier registration
  status
- `Withholding taxes <localizations/saudi-arabia/withholding-taxes>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: predefined withholding tax rules for applicable service
  categories
- `localizations/saudi-arabia/tax-reporting`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: automated tax reports
- `E-invoicing (ZATCA) <localizations/saudi-arabia/zatca>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: integration for electronic invoicing in line with Saudi
  Arabian government requirements

### Taxes {#localizations/saudi-arabia/taxes}

The Saudi Arabian localization includes preconfigured sales, purchase,
and withholding `taxes
<../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}:

- | Standard VAT (15%): The prevailing rate applied to the majority of
    goods and services supplied within the Kingdom.
  | The supplier charges 15% VAT on the sale (Output VAT) and is
    generally entitled to deduct the VAT paid on its business purchases
    (Input VAT).

  ::: example
  Most commercial sales, retail goods, telecommunication services,
  non-exempt private education, and non-exempt private healthcare.
  :::

- | Zero-rated VAT (0%): These are taxable supplies where the rate of
    tax applied is 0%.
  | The supplier charges no VAT on the sale, but, critically, is fully
    entitled to recover the input VAT paid on costs related to making
    those supplies.

  ::: example
  \- Exports: Supplies of goods and services to a
  non-`GCC (Gulf Cooperation Council)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  resident or for consumption outside the Kingdom.
  \- International transport: Services for the international transport
  of passengers and goods, and related services.
  \- Specific goods: Supplies of qualifying medicines and qualifying
  medical equipment, as specified by ZATCA/Ministry of Health.
  \- Residential property: First supply of a new residential
  building/property to a Saudi citizen, up to a value of SAR 1,000,000
  (subject to specific conditions).
  \- Investment metals: Qualifying gold, silver, and platinum of 99%
  purity or higher (supplied for investment).
  :::

- | Exempt transactions: These transactions fall outside the scope of
    VAT, meaning they are not subject to the tax.
  | The supplier does not charge any VAT on the sale and is not entitled
    to recover the input VAT paid on costs related to making these
    supplies (resulting in an unrecoverable cost).

  ::: example
  \- Financial services: interest on loans, provision of credit,
  operations of current/deposit/savings accounts, issuance or transfer
  of money or securities, and life insurance.
  - Real estate: bare rental (leasing) of residential property.
  :::

- | Import VAT: VAT is levied on goods brought into the Kingdom from a
    non-`GCC (Gulf  Cooperation Council)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
    country.
  | VAT is typically calculated at the standard rate (15%) and is paid
    to the Customs Authority at the point of importation.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

When assigning
`discounts <../../sales/sales/products_prices/prices/discounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} to invoices, assign a 15% tax on the line containing a
global discount to comply with ZATCA rules.
::::

#### Reverse charge mechanism (RCM)

- Description: Mechanism that shifts the responsibility for accounting
  for VAT from the non-resident supplier to the resident recipient of
  the goods or services.
- Mechanism: The VAT-registered recipient must calculate and account for
  the VAT (as both output VAT and input VAT) in their
  `VAT return <accounting/tax-returns/vat-report>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}. This typically results in a net zero effect on the VAT
  return, provided the input tax is fully deductible.
- Application: Primarily used for B2B supplies of services from a
  non-resident supplier to a VAT-registered business in Saudi Arabia.

### Withholding taxes {#localizations/saudi-arabia/withholding-taxes}

There are two available methods for calculating withholding tax: gross
and deducted.

- Gross withholding: This is the primary configuration, where the
  withholding amount is calculated in addition to the bill total. For
  example, if the total bill is entered as 115 SAR, the system
  calculates the base plus Withholding Tax (WHT) without reducing the
  payment amount.
- Deducted withholding: It reduces the payable amount by the withholding
  amount directly, meaning the total payment reflects the deduction
  upfront. This affects how the accounting entries and payable lines are
  booked.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Deducted withholding taxes are not enabled by default. To activate it,
go to Accounting \--\> Configuration \--\> Taxes and enable the relevant
withholding tax.
::::

The following Withholding Tax (WHT) configurations are preloaded and
available for use:

- 5% Withholding Tax: Applied on payments for rent, dividends, technical
  and consulting services, air and maritime freight, as well as
  interest, insurance, and reinsurance premiums.
- 15% Withholding Tax: Applies to royalties and other general service
  payments made to non-residents.
- 20% Withholding Tax: Reserved for management fees and specific
  high-value service payments.

### Tax reporting {#localizations/saudi-arabia/tax-reporting}

The
`VAT and Withholding Return <accounting/tax-returns/vat-report>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} provide a detailed breakdown of taxable, zero-rated, exempt,
and withholding transactions. Like other financial reports, the
`VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Withholding Return`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} can be filtered
by period, compared against other periods, and exported in Excel and PDF
formats, ensuring compliance with Saudi Arabia tax laws.

## Company and contacts {#localizations/saudi-arabia/company-contacts}

To ensure proper integration with
`ZATCA <localizations/saudi-arabia/zatca>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, the following fields are required on the
`company record <general/companies/company>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (must match exactly
  VAT certificate)
- All relevant `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields,
  including the `District`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Building
  Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Plot Identification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Identification Scheme`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Tax Identification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Commercial Registration Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Momra License`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `MLSD License`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `700 Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Sagia License`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `VAT Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be set to
  `SAR`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

All fields must be completed accurately to avoid rejection during
`ZATCA onboarding
<localizations/saudi-arabia/zatca>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The same configuration applies to all relevant
`contact <../../essentials/contacts>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
forms.
::::

### Branches configuration {#localizations/saudi-arabia/branches}

Set up your company `branches <general/branches>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} in compliance with `ZATCA rules
<localizations/saudi-arabia/company-contacts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

On the branch contact form, enter the same
`VAT Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the parent company
and enter the branch
`Commercial Registration Number (CRN)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in the `Identification
Scheme`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Either use the parent company's sales journal to follow a centralized
billing system model, or onboard a new branch-specific journal to set up
a multi-threaded system with parallel invoice processing.
::::

## Invoicing language {#localizations/saudi-arabia/invoicing-language}

Invoices can be issued in different languages to meet regional or
customer-specific requirements at two levels:

- Customer level: To assign a preferred language to a customer, go to
  `Accounting -->
  Customers --> Customers`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} or
  `Point of Sale --> Orders --> Customers`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}, and open the relevant customer form. In the
  `Language`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, update the
  language. All documents are then automatically generated in the
  selected language for that customer.

  :::: important
  ::: title
  Important
  :::

  Saudi Arabia\'s VAT regulations require
  `Tax Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and `Simplified Tax
  Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (along with corresponding
  credit notes or debit notes) to be in Arabic, mandatorily. Invoices
  can be bilingual, including English.
  ::::

- Company level: To add Arabic as a secondary language to meet Saudi
  Arabia VAT regulations:

  - For `Tax Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Go to
    `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, in the `Customer Invoices`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} section.
  - For Point of Sale receipts: Go to
    `Point of Sale --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, and navigate to the
    `Bills & Receipts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

  Then, enable the `Gulf Cooperation Council Format`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} option, and `Save`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.

## Electronic invoicing with ZATCA {#localizations/saudi-arabia/zatca}

The ZATCA e-invoicing system is designed to streamline and digitize the
invoicing process for businesses operating in Saudi Arabia.

ZATCA Phase 2 employs a clearance e-invoicing model for
Business-to-Business (B2B) transactions. Conversely, for
Business-to-Consumer (B2C) transactions, Odoo generates a QR code and
subsequently reports these transactions to the Fatoora reporting
endpoint.

In a B2B scenario, a `Tax Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
issued, whereas in a B2C scenario, a
`Simplified Tax Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
generated.

::: seealso
[ZATCA e-invoicing
page](https://zatca.gov.sa/en/E-Invoicing/Pages/default.aspx)
:::

### Step-by-step process {#localizations/saudi-arabia/step-by-step}

When onboarding to ZATCA (Phase 2), there are three modes:

- `Sandbox <localizations/saudi-arabia/sandbox>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: Common pre-configured testing environment; use it to
  simulate integration functionality out of the box.
- `Simulation (Pre-Production) <localizations/saudi-arabia/simulation>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: User-specific testing environment; use it to simulate
  your unique integration.
- `Production <localizations/saudi-arabia/production>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: Live environment

#### Sandbox {#localizations/saudi-arabia/sandbox}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Use VAT Number 399999999900003 on your company setup for sandbox
testing.
::::

1.  | Set the database
    | Go to
      `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
      role="menuselection"} and, in the
      `Saudi  Arabia Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"} section, ensure the
      `ZATCA API mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set to
      `Sandbox`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

2.  | Company information verification
    | Make sure all
      `company <localizations/saudi-arabia/company-contacts>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"} information is complete.

3.  Onboard sales journals
    - Go to
      `Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
      role="menuselection"}.
    - Open the `Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} journal.
    - Under the ZATCA tab, click `fa-refresh`{.interpreted-text
      role="icon"} `Onboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    - In the `Enter the OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window,
      the 6-digit `OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
      pre-populated. Click `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

4.  Invoice testing
    - `Create <accounting/invoice/creation>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"} and `confirm
      <accounting/invoice/confirmation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
      customer invoices.
    - Once the invoice is confirmed, a blue banner appears; click
      `Process now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    - Ensure the
      `response from the API <localizations/saudi-arabia/invoice-submission>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"} is `Action Successful`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}. If not, review the API response displayed in the
      chatter and take the appropriate actions.

#### Simulation (Pre-Production) {#localizations/saudi-arabia/simulation}

1.  Set the database
    - Duplicate your Live/Production database.
    - Go to
      `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
      role="menuselection"} and, in the `Saudi
      Arabia Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
      section, ensure the `ZATCA API mode`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"} is set to
      `Simulation (Pre-Production)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

2.  | Company information verification
    | Make sure all
      `company <localizations/saudi-arabia/company-contacts>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"} information is complete.

3.  Onboard sales journals
    - Go to
      `Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
      role="menuselection"}.
    - Open the `Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} journal.
    - Under the ZATCA tab, click `fa-refresh`{.interpreted-text
      role="icon"} `Onboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    - In the `Enter the OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window,
      enter the 6-digit `OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
      retrieved from the Fatoora Simulation Portal under the Testing
      Environment. Then click `Confirm`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}.

4.  Invoice testing
    - `Create <accounting/invoice/creation>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"} and `confirm
      <accounting/invoice/confirmation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
      customer invoices.
    - Once the invoice is confirmed, a blue banner appears; click
      `Process now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    - Ensure the
      `response from the API <localizations/saudi-arabia/invoice-submission>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"} is `Action Successful`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}. If not, review the API response displayed in the
      chatter and take the appropriate actions.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

`Simulation (Pre-Production)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} mode
invoices are not legally valid.
::::

#### Production {#localizations/saudi-arabia/production}

1.  | In your Live/Production database
    | Go to
      `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
      role="menuselection"} and, in the
      `Saudi  Arabia Electronic Invoicing`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"} section, ensure the
      `ZATCA API mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set to
      `Production`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

2.  | Company information verification
    | Make sure all
      `company <localizations/saudi-arabia/company-contacts>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"} information is complete.

3.  Onboard sales journals
    - Go to
      `Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
      role="menuselection"}.
    - Open the `Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} journal.
    - Under the ZATCA tab, click `fa-refresh`{.interpreted-text
      role="icon"} `Onboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    - In the `Enter the OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window,
      enter the 6-digit `OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
      retrieved from the Fatoora Portal under the Production
      Environment. Then click `Confirm`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}.

4.  Invoice synchronization
    - `Create <accounting/invoice/creation>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"} and `confirm
      <accounting/invoice/confirmation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
      customer invoices.
    - Once the invoice is confirmed, a blue banner appears; click
      `Process now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    - Ensure the
      `response from the API <localizations/saudi-arabia/invoice-submission>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"} is `Action Successful`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}. If not, review the API response displayed in the
      chatter and take the appropriate actions.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Each `Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} journal must be
onboarded separately.
::::

If a sales journal is no longer needed as a ZATCA solution unit, make
sure to revoke it in your Fatoora portal. To do so, click
`View List of Solutions And Devices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
select the relevant solution and device under
`Revoke CSID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then click
`Revoke`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

\- Once the API mode is switched to `Production`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and an invoice is submitted to ZATCA, it cannot be
changed back to `Sandbox`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Simulation (Pre-Production)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. -
OTP's generated from either the Fatoora Simulation or Production portal
expire after 60 minutes and need to be regenerated.
::::

### Invoice submission to ZATCA {#localizations/saudi-arabia/invoice-submission}

After submitting the invoice to ZATCA, a structured response message is
returned by the API in the chatter.

::: example
\[202\] BR-KSA-F-13 : \[BR-KSA-F-13\] - Please recheck Other
Seller/Buyer ID (BT-29 or BT-46) as it contains an invalid value.
:::

Common codes that can be received:

+------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| Code                                                                   | Action                           |
+========================================================================+==================================+
| `200 â€“ Action Successful`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}           | No action required.              |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| `202 â€“ Action Successful (with Warnings)`{.interpreted-text            | - Share the warnings with the    |
| role="guilabel"}                                                       |   solution provider to correct   |
|                                                                        |   them as soon as possible.      |
|                                                                        | - Warnings are temporarily       |
|                                                                        |   accepted but may become        |
|                                                                        |   rejections in the future.      |
|                                                                        | - Frequent warnings may trigger  |
|                                                                        |   investigation, education, or   |
|                                                                        |   auditing by ZATCA.             |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| `303 â€“ Clearance Switched Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}      | Submit the invoice through the   |
|                                                                        | reporting flow instead of        |
|                                                                        | clearance.                       |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| `400 â€“ Action Failed (Rejected)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}    | Review the detailed error        |
|                                                                        | message, correct the issue, and  |
|                                                                        | resubmit.                        |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| `401 â€“ Unauthorized`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                | - Check the authentication       |
|                                                                        |   certificate and secret key.    |
|                                                                        | - Correct the credentials and    |
|                                                                        |   resubmit.                      |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| `413 â€“ Payload Too Large (Invoice Not Received)`{.interpreted-text     | Reduce the invoice payload size  |
| role="guilabel"}                                                       | and resend.                      |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| `429 â€“ Too Many Requests (Invoice Not Received)`{.interpreted-text     | Resend the invoice.              |
| role="guilabel"}                                                       |                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| `500 â€“ Internal Server Error (Invoice Not Received)`{.interpreted-text | Resend the invoice.              |
| role="guilabel"}                                                       |                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| `503 â€“ Service Unavailable (Invoice Not Received)`{.interpreted-text   | Resend the invoice.              |
| role="guilabel"}                                                       |                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| `504 â€“ Request Timed Out (Invoice Not Received)`{.interpreted-text     | Resend the invoice.              |
| role="guilabel"}                                                       |                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------+

The color of the message displayed in the chatter after an invoice is
confirmed and submitted indicates the following information:

- Green: invoice successfully accepted - The invoice is fully compliant
  and has been successfully validated by ZATCA.
- Yellow: invoice accepted with warnings - The invoice is legally valid
  but was accepted with a warning. The issue should be reviewed and
  corrected for future submissions.
- Red: invoice was rejected - The invoice was not accepted by ZATCA and
  is not legally valid. It must be corrected and resubmitted.

If the invoice is rejected, an error message is displayed in the
invoice's chatter. Correct the underlying issue described in the message
description in the invoice or company settings. Then, to resubmit the
invoice, click `Retry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

\- Invoices rejected by ZATCA remain in a `Rejected`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} state and are not considered legally valid. - In case
of any incidents, technical errors, or emergency matters that prevent
the generation of e-invoices/e-receipts, notify
[ZATCA](https://zatca.gov.sa/en/E-Invoicing/FailureNotifications/Pages/VerifyTaxpayer.aspx).
Once the issue has been resolved, contact ZATCA again using the same
communication channel. For specific failure scenarios, refer to the
steps outlined in [ZATCA\'s guidelines (page
45)](https://zatca.gov.sa/en/E-Invoicing/Introduction/Guidelines/Documents/E-Invoicing_Detailed__Guideline.pdf).
::::

### QR code verification {#localizations/saudi-arabia/qr-code-verification}

To verify the QR Code on the invoice, scan it using the official [ZATCA
app](https://zatca.gov.sa/en/AboutUs/ZATCAApps/Pages/default.aspx).

Once in the app, click `Services`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In
the `E-Invoice Validation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
click `Start Service`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, begin
scanning the invoices\' QR codes.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- The QR verification output does not display a currency symbol. The
invoice amount is always shown as a plain numeric value, irrespective of
the currency used. - An invoice with a related contact (e.g., Invoicing
Address) is sent to the clearance API (B2B).
::::

### Debit and credit notes {#localizations/saudi-arabia/debit-and-credit-notes}

To create a
`credit <accounting/credit_notes/issue-credit-note>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} or `debit
<accounting/credit_notes/issue-debit-note>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} note, include a ZATCA-approved reason from the
`ZATCA Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field in the
`Credit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}/`Debit`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} window, as required by ZATCA regulations:

- Cancellation or suspension of the supplies after their occurrence,
  either wholly or partially.
- Essential change or amendment in the supply that results in a change
  to the VAT due.
- Amendment of the supply value that was pre-agreed between the supplier
  and the consumer.
- Goods or services refund.
- Change in the seller's or buyer's information.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The `ZATCA Reason`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is also
available in the credit/debit note `Other
Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Whenever the credit/debit note is unrelated/independent, fill in the
sequential number of the original invoice(s) that the credit/debit note
is related to in the `Customer
Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
::::

### Down payments (advance payments) {#localizations/saudi-arabia/advance-payments}

Handle
`down payments (advance payments) <../../sales/sales/invoicing/invoicing_policy>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} in compliance with [ZATCA's
guidelines](https://zatca.gov.sa/en/E-Invoicing/Introduction/Guidelines/Documents/E-Invoicing_Detailed__Guideline.pdf).

### Retention {#localizations/saudi-arabia/retention}

Retention is an amount temporarily held by the customer, defined by the
commercial contract, to ensure the quality and completion of the work.
It is usually a percentage of the invoice value (e.g., 5-10%) and serves
as security against future defects; it is ultimately paid back to the
contractor once the warranty period expires.

For ZATCA, the commonly applied rule is that VAT is calculated based on
the full invoice amount, even if the customer withholds a portion as
retention. ZATCA advises taxpayers to first determine the tax position,
specifically whether the retention amount reduces the taxable amount or
not. Tax position depends on contractual terms.

The Odoo retention workflow ensures, through tax position, that the
retention amount does not reduce the taxable amount.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Any negative tax (e.g., -20%) configured with the
`Is Retention`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox enabled has
no impact on the UBL 2.1. It only applies when this retention tax is
used in conjunction with a generic tax (e.g., 15%) on the invoice line
and represents a percentage of that invoice line. For example, if a
taxpayer wants to retain 20% of the invoiced goods, both the 15% tax and
the -20% retention tax would be applied to the invoice line.
::::

Within this same tax position, retention can also be applied at the
invoice level as an separate negative invoice line using a 0% (Not
Subject to VAT) tax rate.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

\- Adding either a negative tax with `Is Retention`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} enabled and a generic tax on the invoice line, or a
separate negative invoice line with a 0%
(`Not Subject to VAT`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) tax rate at
the invoice level, usually indicates that VAT has been paid on the full
taxable amount. Therefore, the final invoice for releasing the retention
amount does not qualify as a `Tax Invoice`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and should not be submitted to ZATCA. - The 0% (Not
Subject to VAT) tax is already preconfigured according to ZATCA rules;
do not modify it.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

\- When creating a new retention tax, create a
`Retention`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tax group and assign it
to this newly created retention tax to comply with ZATCA rules. - To add
the `Retention Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as a note on
the invoice line, click `Add a
note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to comply with ZATCA rules. For
example - Retention Amount: [\[retention amount\] SAR]{.title-ref}
::::

### Generated documents {#localizations/saudi-arabia/generated-documents}

Once an invoice is submitted, a UBL 2.1 XML file is generated and sent
to ZATCA API endpoints. For auditability, this XML file is stored in the
chatter. To display it, click the `fa-paperclip`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(attachments)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon.

Additionally, the invoice PDF generated when using
`Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is displayed in the chatter.
Both the XML and PDF files are permanently attached to the invoice and
cannot be deleted to ensure compliance with ZATCA regulations.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Successfully ZATCA-submitted invoices can only be reset to draft in
`Sandbox
<localizations/saudi-arabia/sandbox>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} or
`Simulation (Pre-Production)
<localizations/saudi-arabia/simulation>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
modes.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To automatically generate a PDF/A-3 with the embedded UBL 2.1, click
`Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

## Point of sale {#localizations/saudi-arabia/pos}

### ZATCA integration configuration {#localizations/saudi-arabia/pos-zatca-configuration}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Make sure the
`Saudi Arabia - E-invoicing (Simplified) (l10n_sa_edi_pos)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} module is
`installed <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

PoS orders must be properly reported in compliance with ZATCA Phase 2.
To do so, follow these steps:

- Onboard the `Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} default
  journal in the `PoS settings
  <configuration/settings>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  - Go to
    `Point of Sale --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}. In the yellow banner, select the relevant
    `Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then navigate to
    the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.
  - In the `Default Journals`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    section, find the `Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    field and click the `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    `(right arrow)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to open the
    default `Sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} journal.
  - Under the ZATCA tab, click `fa-refresh`{.interpreted-text
    role="icon"} `Onboard`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  - In the `Enter the OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window,
    enter the 6-digit `OTP`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} retrieved
    from the Fatoora Portal under the Production Environment. Then click
    `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Assign a customer <pos/customers>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to
  the order before finalizing the transaction.

These steps ensure that each receipt is processed as a compliant
e-invoice and reported to the ZATCA portal in real time. Once the
receipt is generated, the Phase 2 QR code automatically appears on both
the printed receipt and the PDF.

# Singapore

## Add PayNow QR codes to invoices

PayNow is a payment service platform that allows customers to make
instant domestic payments to individuals and merchants in Singapore
dollars via online and mobile banking.

### Activate QR codes

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Under the `Customer
Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, activate the
`QR Codes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} feature.

### PayNow bank account configuration

Go to `Contacts --> Configuration --> Bank Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and select the bank account to activate PayNow.
Set the `Proxy Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and fill in the
`Proxy Value`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field depending on the
chosen type.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

\- The account holder\'s country must be set to [Singapore]{.title-ref}
on its contact form. - The account holder\'s city is mandatory. - You
could also include the invoice number in the QR code by checking the
`Include
Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox.
::::

![PayNow bank account configuration](singapore/sg-paynow-bank-setting.png)

::: seealso
`../accounting/bank`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Bank journal configuration

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, open the bank journal, then fill out the
`Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} under the
`Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

![Bank Account\'s journal configuration](singapore/sg-bank-account-journal-setting.png)

### Issue invoices with PayNow QR codes

When creating a new invoice, open the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab and set the `Payment
QR-code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option to *EMV
Merchant-Presented QR-code*.

![Select EMV Merchant-Presented QR-code option](singapore/sg-qr-code-invoice-setting.png)

Ensure that the `Recipient Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
the one you configured, as Odoo uses this field to generate the PayNow
QR code.

## Employment Hero payroll {#singapore/employment-hero}

If your business is already up and running with `Employment Hero
<../../hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/employment_hero>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, you can use our connector as an alternative payroll
solution.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

To
`configure the Employment Hero API <employment_hero/configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for **Singapore**, use the following value as
`Payroll URL`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
[HTTPS://apisg.yourpayroll.io/]{.title-ref}.
::::

# Spain

## Configuration

Install the ðŸ‡ªðŸ‡¸ **Spanish**
`fiscal localization package <../fiscal_localizations>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} to get all the default accounting features of the Spanish
localization.

Three **Spanish** localizations exist, each with its own pre-configured
**PGCE** charts of accounts:

- Spain - SMEs (2008);
- Spain - Complete (2008);
- Spain - Non-profit entities (2008).

To select the one to use, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and select a package in the
`Fiscal Localization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

You can only change the accounting package as long as you have not
created any accounting entry.
::::

::: seealso
\- `Documentation on e-invoicingâ€™s legality and compliance in Spain
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/spain>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} -
`Documentation on e-invoicingâ€™s legality and compliance in the Basque Country
<../accounting/customer_invoices/electronic_invoicing/basque_country>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Chart of accounts

You can reach the **Chart of Accounts** by going to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Accounting: Chart of Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

When you create a new Odoo Online database, **Spain - SMEs (2008)** is
installed by default.
::::

## Taxes

Default Spain-specific taxes are created automatically when the
`Spanish - Accounting (PGCE 2008) (l10n_es)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} module is installed, and tax reports are available when
installing the module
`Spain - Accounting (PGCE 2008) (l10n_es_reports)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Each tax impacts the Spain-specific **tax reports
(Modelo)**, available by going to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Statements Reports: Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

## Reports

Here is the list of Spanish-specific statement reports available:

- Balance Sheet;
- Profit & Loss;
- EC Sales List;
- Tax Report (Modelo 111);
- Tax Report (Modelo 115);
- Tax Report (Modelo 130);
- Tax Report (Modelo 303);
- Tax Report (Modelo 347);
- Tax Report (Modelo 349);
- Tax Report (Modelo 390).

You can access Spain-specific tax reports by clicking on the **book**
icon when on a report and selecting its Spain-specific version:
`(ES)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Spain-specific tax reports.](spain/modelo-reports.png)

### Modelo 130

#### Change the percentage

If you wish to change the percentage computation of the box
`[04]`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} under the
`I`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section and/or of the box
`[09]`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} under the
`II`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:

1.  Activate the `developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}, go to `Accounting -->
    Reporting --> Tax Report`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
    and select the report `Tax report (Modelo 130)`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
2.  Click the `fa-cogs`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    (`cogs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) icon to the right of
    `Report: Tax Report
    (Mod 130) (ES)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
3.  Click the box you wish to change, and in the pop-up window, click on
    the `percentage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} line. In the new
    pop-up window, change the value in the `Formula`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} field to the percentage you wish to apply. Repeat
    this action if you wish to modify the other box as well.

#### Report agriculture activity

If you wish to have any amount input in the `II`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section (from boxes `[08]`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to `[11]`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}), you must
change the **industry** of the corresponding contact to
`Agriculture`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:

1.  Go to the contact form
    (`Accounting --> Customers --> Customers`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} or
    `Accounting --> Vendors --> Vendors`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, for example), and select a contact.
2.  In the `Sales & Purchase`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
    set the `Industry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
    `Agriculture`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Repeat this operation for all contacts related to the **agriculture**
industry.

## Veri\*Factu {#localizations/spain/veri-factu}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Producers of Veri\*Factu billing systems must self-certify their
compliance with the regulations.
`Download Odoo's "declaraciÃ³n responsable"<spain/declaracion_responsable.pdf>`{.interpreted-text
role="download"}
::::

**Veri\*Factu** is an e-Invoicing system used by the Spanish Tax Agency.
It is mandatory for most taxpayers in Spain, except for those who use
the SII system or are under a regional tax regime (i.e., TicketBai).

Odoo allows
`invoices <localizations/spain/veri-factu-invoices>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and Point of Sale `orders
<localizations/spain/veri-factu-orders>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
to be automatically sent to the tax authorities.

### Configuration {#localizations/spain/veri-factu-configuration}

To enable **Veri\*Factu**, follow these steps:

1.  Open the Settings app to make sure your company\'s
    `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are correctly set in the
    `Companies <general/companies/company>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} section.
2.  `Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
    `Spain - Veri*Factu (l10n_es_edi_verifactu)`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} module.
3.  Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, scroll to the `Veri\*Factu`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} section, check the
    `Enable Veri*Factu`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option, and
    click `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    `Manage certificates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to add a
    certificate.
4.  In the `Certificates for Veri\*Factu`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} list view, click `New`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
5.  Click `Upload your file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then
    select a certificate file and enter the `Password`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} needed to open the certificate (if there is one).

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- At least one certificate has to be uploaded. - By default Veri\*Factu
is in testing mode. The data is sent to test servers and is not
considered official. When official data can be sent to the production
servers, go to the `Veri\*Factu`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
section in the `Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and disable
`Test
Environment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

### Invoices {#localizations/spain/veri-factu-invoices}

Once an
`invoice <../../finance/accounting/customer_invoices>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is confirmed, it can be
`sent <accounting/invoice/sending>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. In
the `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window, the Veri\*Factu
option is available if Veri\*Factu has been enabled.

Click `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to generate a JSON file
containing the invoice details. This file is stored as a Veri\*Factu
document. In the `Veri*Factu`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
all corresponding documents are listed by their creation date and
current status.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To download a JSON file, click on its document in the
`Veri*Factu`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Then, in the
`Open: Veri*Factu Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window,
click the link in the `JSON`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- The document should be sent to the
`AEAT (Agencia Estatal de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} immediately. However, it may be delayed due to mandatory
waiting periods between submissions required by the
`AEAT (Agencia Estatal de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. In such cases, the document is automatically sent the next
time a scheduled action runs. - A Veri\*Factu **QR code** appears on the
invoice PDF. Scan this code to verify that the invoice has been received
and recognized by the `AEAT (Agencia Estatal de AdministraciÃ³n
Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
::::

### Point of sale orders {#localizations/spain/veri-factu-orders}

Once an order has been `paid <pos/sell>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
a JSON file containing the order details is generated. This file is
stored as a Veri\*Factu document.

Go to `Point of Sale --> Orders --> Orders`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. In the `Orders`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} list view, select the relevant order. In the
`Veri*Factu`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, all the
corresponding documents are listed by their creation date and current
status.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To download a JSON file, click on its document in the
`Veri*Factu`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Then, in the
`Open: Veri*Factu Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} window,
click the link in the `JSON`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- The document should be sent to the
`AEAT (Agencia Estatal de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} immediately. However, it may be delayed due to mandatory
waiting periods between submissions required by the
`AEAT (Agencia Estatal de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. In such cases, the document is automatically sent the next
time a scheduled action runs.
::::

If an invoice is generated for an order during the payment process, the
Veri\*Factu document is
`created and sent for the invoice <localizations/spain/veri-factu-invoices>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} instead.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

A Veri\*Factu **QR code** appears on the order receipt, even if an
invoice is created for the order. Scan this code to verify that the
invoice has been received and recognized by the
`AEAT (Agencia Estatal de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}
::::

## TicketBAI

[Ticket BAI](https://www.gipuzkoa.eus/es/web/ogasuna/ticketbai) or
**TBAI** is an e-Invoicing system used by the Basque government and its
three provincial councils (Ãlava, Biscay, and Gipuzkoa).

Odoo supports the **TicketBAI (TBAI)** electronic invoicing format for
all three regions of the **Basque Country**. To enable **TicketBAI**,
set your company\'s `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} under
`Settings --> General Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}
in the `Companies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

Then, `install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
module `Spain -TicketBAI (l10n_es_edi_TBAI)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select a **region** in the
`Spain Localization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section\'s
`Tax Agency for TBAI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

Once a region is selected, click
`Manage certificates (SII/TicketBAI)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, then click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
upload the certificate, and enter the password provided by the tax
agency.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

If you are testing certificates, enable `Test Mode`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in the `Spain Localization`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section, which can be found under
`Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the **Settings** app.
::::

### Use case

Once an invoice has been
`created <../../finance/accounting/customer_invoices>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} and confirmed, a TicketBAI **banner** appears at the top.

![TicketBAI banner at the top of the invoice once sent.](spain/ticketbai-invoice.png)

Odoo sends invoices through TicketBAI automatically every **24 hours**.
However, you can click `Process now`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
to send the invoice immediately.

When the invoice is **sent**, the status of the field
`Electronic Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} changes to
`Sent`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the XML file can be found
in the **chatter**. Under the `EDI Documents`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, you can see the traceability of other generated
documents related to the invoice (e.g., if the invoice should also be
sent through the **SII**, it will appear here).

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The TBAI **QR code** is displayed on the invoice PDF.

![QR code of the TicketBAI on the invoice.](spain/qr-code.png)
::::

## FACe

[FACe](https://face.gob.es/en) is the e-Invoicing platform used by the
public administrations in Spain to send electronic invoices.

Before configuring the
`FACe (General Entrance for Electronic Invoices)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} system, `install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} the
`Spain - Facturae EDI (l10n_es_edi_facturae)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} module and other **Facturae EDI**-related modules.

To configure FACe, follow these steps:

1.  Go to
    `Accounting --> Configuration --> Certificates`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}.
2.  Click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to create a new
    certificate.
3.  Complete the fields, including uploading the file of the
    `Certificate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} provided by the tax
    agency and the provided `Certificate Password`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If using the Invoicing app instead of Accounting, go to `Invoicing -->
Configuration --> Certificates`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
::::

### Use case

Once you have
`created <../../finance/accounting/customer_invoices>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} an invoice and confirmed it, click
`Send & Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Make sure
`Generate Facturae edi file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
enabled, and click `Send & Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
again. Once the invoice is sent, the generated XML file is available in
the **chatter**.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

The file is **NOT** automatically sent. You have to send it yourself
manually.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

You can send **FACe** XML files in batch through [the governmental
portal](https://www.facturae.gob.es/formato/Paginas/descarga-aplicacion-escritorio.aspx).
::::

### Administrative centers

In order for **FACe** to work with **administrative centers**, the
invoice *must* include specific data about the centers.

To add **administrative centers**, create a new **contact** to add to
the **partner** company. Select `FACe Center`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} as the **type**, assign one or more **role(s)** to that
contact, and `Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The **three**
roles usually required are:

- Ã“rgano gestor: `Receptor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  (Receiver);
- Unidad tramitadora: `Pagador`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  (Payer);
- Oficina contable: `Fiscal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  (Fiscal).

![Administrative center contact form for public entities.](spain/administrative-center.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- If administrative centers need different `Codes`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} per role, you *must* create different centers for each
role. - When an electronic invoice is created using a partner with
**administrative centers**, *all* administrative centers are included in
the invoice. - You can add one contact with multiple roles or multiple
contacts with a different role each.
::::

# Switzerland

## ISR (In-payment Slip with Reference number)

The ISRs are payment slips used in Switzerland. You can print them
directly from Odoo. On the customer invoices, there is a new button
called *Print ISR*.

![image](switzerland/switzerland00.png){.align-center}

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The button *Print ISR* only appears there is well a bank account defined
on the invoice. You can use CH6309000000250097798 as bank account number
and 010391391 as CHF ISR reference.
::::

![image](switzerland/switzerland01.png){.align-center}

Then you open a pdf with the ISR.

![image](switzerland/switzerland02.png){.align-center}

There exists two layouts for ISR: one with, and one without the bank
coordinates. To choose which one to use, there is an option to print the
bank information on the ISR. To activate it, go in
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Customer Invoices`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and enable **Print bank on ISR**:

![image](switzerland/switzerland03.png){.align-center}

### ISR reference on invoices

To ease the reconciliation process, you can add your ISR reference as
**Payment Reference** on your invoices.

To do so, you need to configure the Journal you usually use to issue
invoices. Go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, open the Journal you want to modify (By default,
the Journal is named *Customer Invoices*), click en *Edit*, and open the
*Advanced Settings* tab. In the **Communication Standard** field, select
*Switzerland*, and click on *Save*.

![Configure your Journal to display your ISR as payment reference on your invoices in Odoo](switzerland/switzerland-isr-reference.png){.align-center}

## Currency Rate Live Update

You can update automatically your currencies rates based on the Federal
Tax Administration from Switzerland. For this, go in
`Accounting --> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
activate the multi-currencies setting and choose the service you want.

![image](switzerland/switzerland04.png){.align-center}

## Updated VAT for January 2018

Starting from the 1st January 2018, new reduced VAT rates will be
applied in Switzerland. The normal 8.0% rate will switch to 7.7% and the
specific rate for the hotel sector will switch from 3.8% to 3.7%.

### How to update your taxes in Odoo Enterprise (Odoo Online or On-premise)?

If you have the V11.1 version, all the work is already been done, you
don\'t have to do anything.

If you have started on an earlier version, you first have to update the
module \"Switzerland - Accounting Reports\". For this, you go in
`Apps --> remove the filter "Apps" --> search for "Switzerland - Accounting Reports" --> open the module --> click on "upgrade"`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![image](switzerland/switzerland05.png){.align-center}

Once it has been done, you can work on creating new taxes for the
updated rates.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

**Do not suppress or modify the existing taxes** (8.0% and 3.8%). You
want to keep them since you may have to use both rates for a short
period of time. Instead, remember to archive them once you have encoded
all your 2017 transactions.
::::

The creation of such taxes should be done in the following manner:

- **Purchase taxes**: copy the origin tax, change its name, label on
  invoice, rate and tax group (effective from v10 only)
- **Sale taxes**: copy the origin tax, change its name, label on
  invoice, rate and tax group (effective from v10 only). Since the vat
  report now shows the details for old and new rates, you should also
  set the tags accordingly to
  - For 7.7% taxes: Switzerland VAT Form: grid 302 base, Switzerland VAT
    Form: grid 302 tax
  - For 3.7% taxes: Switzerland VAT Form: grid 342 base, Switzerland VAT
    Form: grid 342 tax

You\'ll find below, as examples, the correct configuration for all taxes
included in Odoo by default

  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  **Tax Name**    **Rate**   **Label on  **Tax Group  **Tax       **Tag**
                             Invoice**   (effective   Scope**     
                                         from V10)**

  achat B&S (TN)                                                  grid 400

  achat B&S                  Incl.                                grid 400

  invest. et                 invest.                              grid 405

  (Incl. TN)                                                      

  TVA 3.7% sur    3.7%       3.7% achat  TVA 3.7%     Purchases   Switzerland VAT Form:
  achat B&S (TS)                                                  grid 400

If you have questions or remarks, please contact our support using
odoo.com/help.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Don\'t forget to update your fiscal positions. If you have a version
11.1 (or higher), there is nothing to do. Otherwise, you will also have
