--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/thailand.md ---

# Thailand

## Configuration

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
`ðŸ‡¹ðŸ‡­ Thailand`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} localization package to
get all the features of the Thai localization:

  Name                                                                 Technical name                  Description
  -------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Thailand - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}           [l10n_th]{.title-ref}           Default `fiscal localization package <fiscal_localizations/packages>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  `Thailand - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_th_reports]{.title-ref}   Country-specific accounting reports

![Thailand localization modules](thailand/modules.png)

## Chart of accounts and taxes

Odoo\'s fiscal localization package for Thailand includes the following
taxes:

- VAT 7%
- VAT-exempted
- Withholding tax
- Withholding income tax

## Tax report

Odoo allows users to generate Excel files to submit their VAT to the
**Revenue Department** of Thailand.

### Sales and purchase tax report

To generate a sales and purchase tax report, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax
Report`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Select a specific time
or time range on the tax report, and click
`VAT-202-01 (xlsx)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for purchase tax
and `VAT-202-02 (xlsx)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for sales
tax.

![Thai purchase and sales taxes reports](thailand/tax-report.png)

### Withholding PND tax report

PND report data displays the summarized amounts of the applicable
**withholding corporate income tax returns (domestic)** from vendor
bills under the `PND53 (TH)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`PND3 (TH)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tax reports. It is
installed by default with the Thai localization.

![PND tax reports](thailand/pnd-report.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Withholding corporate income tax returns (domestic) is the tax used in
case the company has withheld the tax from "**Personal (PND3)**" or
"**Corporate (PND53)**" services provided such as rental, hiring,
transportation, insurance, management fee, consulting, etc.
::::

The PND tax report allows users to generate a CSV file for bills to
upload on the [RDprep for Thailand e-Filling
application](https://efiling.rd.go.th/rd-cms/).

To generate a PND CSV file, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, select a specific time or time range on the tax
report, and click `PND3`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`PND53`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

This generates the `Tax Report PND3.csv`{.interpreted-text role="file"}
and `Tax Report PND53.csv`{.interpreted-text role="file"} files that
lists all the vendor bill lines with the applicable withholding tax.

![PND3 and PND53 CSV files](thailand/pnd3-pnd53.png)

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Odoo cannot generate the PND or PDF report or **withholding tax
certificate** directly. The generated
`Tax Report PND3.csv`{.interpreted-text role="file"} and
`Tax Report PND53.csv`{.interpreted-text role="file"} files must be
exported to an external tool to convert them into a **withholding PND**
report or a **PDF** file.
::::

## Tax invoice

The **tax invoice PDF** report can be generated from Odoo through the
**Invoicing** module. Users have the option to print PDF reports for
normal invoices and tax invoices. To print out **tax invoices**, users
can click on `Print Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in
Odoo. Regular invoices can be printed as **commercial invoices** by
clicking on `Cog button (âš™ï¸) --> Print -->
Commercial Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

![Commercial invoice printing](thailand/tax-invoice.png)

### Headquarter/Branch number settings

You can inform a company\'s **Headquarters** and **Branch number** in
the **Contacts** app. Once in the app, open the **contact form** of the
company and under the `Sales & Purchase`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab:

- If the contact is identified as a branch, input the **Branch number**
  in the `Company ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
- If the contact is a **Headquarters**, leave the
  `Company ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field **blank**.

![Company Headquarter/Branch number](thailand/contact.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

This information is used in the **tax invoice** PDF report and PND **tax
report** export.
::::

## PromptPay QR code on invoices

The **PromptPay QR code** is a QR code that can be added to invoices to
allow customers to pay their bills using the PromptPay-supported bank
mobile application. The QR code is generated based on the **invoice
amount** and one of the following **merchant information**:

- Ewallet ID
- Merchant Tax ID
- Mobile Number

### Activate QR codes

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Under the `Customer
Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, activate the
`QR Codes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} feature.

### PromptPay QR bank account configuration

Go to `Contacts --> Configuration --> Bank Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and select the bank account for which you want to
activate PromptPay QR. Set the `Proxy Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and fill in the `Proxy Value`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field depending on the chosen type.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

\- The account holder\'s city is mandatory. - The
`Include Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox doesn\'t
work for PromptPay QR codes.
::::

![PromptPay bank account configuration](thailand/qr-promptpay-bank.png)

::: seealso
`../accounting/bank`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Bank journal configuration

Go to `Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, open the bank journal, then fill in the
`Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} under the
`Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

![Bank Account\'s journal configuration](thailand/qr-bank-journal.png)

### Issue invoices with PromptPay QR code

When creating a new invoice, open the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab and set the `Payment
QR-code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option to
`EMV Merchant-Presented QR-code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Select EMV Merchant-Presented QR-code option](thailand/qr-code-invoice-emv.png)

Ensure that the `Recipient Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
the one you configured, as Odoo uses this field to generate the
PromptPay QR code.




--- SOURCE: finance/fiscal_localizations/united_arab_emirates.md ---

# United Arab Emirates

## Modules {#localizations/uae/modules}

The following modules related to the United Arab Emirates localization
are available:

  Name                                                                             Technical name                  Description
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `United Arab Emirates - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}           [l10n_ae]{.title-ref}           Default `fiscal localization package </applications/finance/fiscal_localizations>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} for the UAE.
  `United Arab Emirates - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_ae_reports]{.title-ref}   Adds VAT and corporate tax reporting capabilities.
  `United Arab Emirates - Point of Sale`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}        [l10n_ae_pos]{.title-ref}       Adds local compliance behavior for PoS receipts.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The localization\'s core modules are installed automatically with the
localization. The rest can be manually
`installed </applications/general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.
::::

::: seealso
`United Arab Emirates Payroll localization documentation <../../hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/united_arab_emirates>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Localization overview {#localizations/uae/loc-review}

The UAE fiscal localisation provides a fully configured accounting setup
aligned with national VAT and corporate tax regulations. It includes a
localised chart of accounts, VAT-compliant tax groups, standard
journals, fiscal year configurations, and reporting features that ensure
accuracy and compliance with the Federal Tax Authority (FTA).

The UAE localization package provides the following key features to
ensure compliance with local fiscal and accounting regulations:

- `Chart of accounts <localizations/uae/coa>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: a predefined structure aligned with UEA accounting
  standards
- `Taxes <localizations/uae/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  preconfigured tax groups and templates based on UAE VAT rules
- `../accounting/taxes/fiscal_positions`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}:
  automated tax adjustments to handle local and cross-border
  transactions
- `VAT return <localizations/uae/tax-return>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: structured according to the UAE VAT return format, as
  issued by the `FTA (Federal Tax Authority)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}
- `Corporate Tax Report <localizations/uae/corporate-tax-report>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: structured according to the UAE Corporate Tax Report, as
  issued by the `FTA (Federal Tax Authority)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}

### Chart of accounts {#localizations/uae/coa}

The UAE
`chart of accounts <../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} is aligned with
`IFRS (International Financial Reporting Standards)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} and `FTA (Federal Tax Authority)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} tax requirements. This includes classified accounts for
assets, liabilities, equity, income, and expenses, as well as separate
accounts for VAT payable and VAT receivable.

This structure ensures compatibility with UAE reporting obligations,
VAT, and corporate income tax filings.

### Taxes {#localizations/uae/taxes}

The UAE localization includes preconfigured VAT rates and
`taxes <../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} as defined
by the `FTA (Federal Tax Authority)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}:

- | Standard VAT (5%): The prevailing VAT rate applied to most taxable
    goods and services supplied within the UAE.
  | The supplier charges 5% VAT on the sale (Output VAT). VAT-registered
    businesses may generally recover the VAT paid on eligible business
    purchases (Input VAT).

  ::: example
  Most commercial sales, retail goods, telecommunication services,
  non-exempt private education, and non-exempt private healthcare.
  :::

- | Zero-Rated VAT (0%): Taxable supplies on which VAT is applied at a
    rate of 0%.
  | No VAT is collected on the sale, but the supplier remains fully
    entitled to recover input VAT related to making these supplies.

  ::: example
  - Exports of goods and services (subject to qualifying conditions)
  - International transport and related services
  - Designated sectors such as specific healthcare and education
    services
  - First supply of residential property (subject to conditions)
  :::

- | Exempt VAT: Supplies that fall outside the taxable category and are
    not subject to VAT.
  | The supplier does not charge VAT and cannot recover input VAT on
    costs related to exempt activities.

  ::: example
  \- Financial services: Interest on loans, bank account operations, and
  life insurance (when no explicit fee is charged).
  - Local passenger transport: Taxis, buses, metro services, and
    domestic flights within the UAE.
  :::

- | Import VAT: VAT that is applied to goods imported into the UAE.
  | Import VAT is recorded at the applicable rate (generally 5%). In UAE
    VAT reporting, only the VAT amount is declared; the import base
    amount is not required in the tax report.
  | Applied when recording customs-import transactions or imports
    recognized through the VAT return.

- | Out of Scope: Transactions that fall outside the scope of UAE VAT
    legislation.

  ::: example
  - Transactions entirely outside the UAE
  - Internal accounting adjustments
  - Certain government-mandated transfers
  :::

  :::: note
  ::: title
  Note
  :::

  These taxes can be applied directly to products or managed dynamically
  through fiscal positions.
  ::::

#### Reverse charge mechanism (RCM) {#localizations/uae/reverse-charge-mechanism}

- Description: Mechanism that transfers the obligation to account for
  VAT from the non-resident supplier to the UAE VAT-registered
  recipient.
- Mechanism: The recipient declares VAT as both output VAT and input VAT
  in the VAT return. This typically results in a net-zero impact when
  fully recoverable.
- Application: Commonly used for imported services and cross-border B2B
  transactions where the supplier has no UAE VAT registration.

### VAT return (VAT201) {#localizations/uae/tax-return}

The UAE
`VAT Return report <accounting/tax-returns/vat-report>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} includes:

- Output VAT
- Input VAT
- Reverse charge VAT
- Zero-rated and exempt sales

> :::: note
> ::: title
> Note
> :::
>
> The report structure follows the official
> `FTA (Federal Tax Authority)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} format
> and can be exported in both Excel and PDF formats for manual
> submission.
> ::::

### Corporate tax report {#localizations/uae/corporate-tax-report}

The UAE Corporate Tax Report helps companies prepare for compliance with
local corporate tax regulations. The report is found under
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Corporate Tax
Report`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and includes:

- Net profit
- Exempt income
- Allowable deductions
- Adjustments for non-deductible (disallowed) expenses
- Corporate tax amount

As part of this report, users can set `exempt income
<localizations/uae/exempt-income-accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `allowable deductions
<localizations/uae/allowable-deductions-accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, and `disallowed expenses accounts
<localizations/uae/disallowed-expenses>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

No default fiscal categories, disallowed expenses, allowable deduction
accounts, or exempt income accounts are configured. Users must classify
them manually according to their tax situation.
::::

#### Exempt income accounts {#localizations/uae/exempt-income-accounts}

Exempt income generally refers to revenue that is not subject to
corporate tax under UAE rules. Examples may include:

- Dividends received from qualifying shareholdings
- Capital gains on the sale of qualifying shares

To classify exempt income, navigate to the `chart of accounts
<../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, open the relevant account, and assign the tag
`Corporate Tax Report â€“ Exempted Income Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Tagging these accounts ensures that exempt income is
reported accurately without being included in the taxable base.

#### Allowable deductions accounts {#localizations/uae/allowable-deductions-accounts}

Allowable deductions are expenses that are incurred solely for business
purposes. Examples include:

- Employee salaries and benefits
- Office rent, utilities, and professional services

To classify allowable deductions, navigate to the `chart of accounts
<../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, open the relevant expense account, and assign the tag
`Corporate Tax Report â€“ Allowable Deductions Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Tagging these accounts ensures that they effectively
reduce taxable profits.

#### Disallowed expenses {#localizations/uae/disallowed-expenses}

Some expenses are not deductible for corporate tax purposes. Examples
include:

- Fines and penalties (e.g., traffic or administrative violations)
- Non-business or personal expenses
- Excessive entertainment costs beyond permitted limits
- Certain related-party costs that do not meet transfer-pricing
  requirements

To configure these expenses, navigate to the `chart of accounts
<../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, open the relevant account, and assign a fiscal category.
Then, in the `Fiscal Rates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
configure the start date and the fiscal rate.

### Automatic currency rates {#localizations/uae/automatic-currency-rates}

The UAE localization includes automatic synchronization of foreign
`currency rates
<multi-currency/config-rates>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} through a
built-in connection with the Central Bank of the UAE. Exchange rates are
retrieved
`automatically <multi-currency/automatic-update>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and applied across transactions when the
`Automatic Currency Rates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option is
enabled.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Rates are updated automatically, but can also be `manually updated
<multi-currency/manual-update>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} when
necessary.
::::

## Invoicing language {#localizations/uae/invoicing-language}

Invoices can be issued in different languages to meet regional or
customer-specific requirements at two levels:

- Customer level: To assign a preferred language to a customer, go to
  `Accounting -->
  Customers --> Customers`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} or
  `Point of Sale --> Orders --> Customers`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}, and open the relevant customer form. In the
  `Language`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, update the
  language preference. All documents for that customer are then
  automatically generated in the selected language.

- Company level: To add Arabic as a secondary language to meet business
  needs:

  - For `Tax Invoices`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Go to
    `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, in the `Customer Invoices`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} section.
  - For Point of Sale receipts: Go to
    `Point of Sale --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, and navigate to the
    `Bills & Receipts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.

  Then, enable the `Gulf Cooperation Council Format`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} option, and `Save`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.

## Invoice types {#localizations/uae/invoice-types}

The type of invoice to be issued depends on the following criteria:

- `Tax Invoices (B2B)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: A
  `Tax Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, used for
  business-to-business transactions, contains all the details required
  for VAT recovery, including the supplier and customer legal names,
  addresses, `TRN (Tax Registration Number)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} numbers (where applicable), itemized VAT amounts, and
  total amounts. This is the standard document required when a customer
  intends to reclaim VAT.
- `Simplified Tax Invoices (B2C)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: A
  `Simplified Tax Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
  primarily used for business-to-consumer (B2C) transactions, where the
  customer is not expected to reclaim VAT. It contains reduced customer
  information (customer
  `TRN (Tax Registration Number)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is not
  required), focusing instead on supplier details, VAT charged, and the
  total amount payable.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

A `Simplified Tax Invoice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is still a
legally valid tax invoice under VAT law.
::::

# United Kingdom

## Configuration {#localization/united-kingdom/modules}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
`UK - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the
`UK - Accounting
Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} modules to get all the
features of the UK localization.

+-------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------+
| Name                                                  | Technical name                    | Description                                                |
+=======================================================+===================================+============================================================+
| `UK - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}  | [l10n_uk]{.title-ref}             | - CT600-ready chart of accounts                            |
|                                                       |                                   | - VAT100-ready tax structure                               |
|                                                       |                                   | - Infologic UK counties listing                            |
+-------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------+
| `UK - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text           | [l10n_uk_reports]{.title-ref}     | - Accounting reports for the UK                            |
| role="guilabel"}                                      |                                   | - Allows sending the tax report via the MTD-VAT API to     |
|                                                       |                                   |   HMRC.                                                    |
+-------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------+
| `UK BACS Payment Files`{.interpreted-text             | [l10n_uk_bacs]{.title-ref}        | Allows generating                                          |
| role="guilabel"}                                      |                                   | `localization/united-kingdom/BACS-files`{.interpreted-text |
|                                                       |                                   | role="ref"} for bill and invoice payments                  |
+-------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------+
| `UK - Construction Industry Scheme`{.interpreted-text | [l10n_uk_reports_cis]{.title-ref} | - Allows sending the Monthly return to                     |
| role="guilabel"}                                      |                                   |   `HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text        |
|                                                       |                                   |   role="abbr"}                                             |
|                                                       |                                   | - CIS Deduction (GB) report for UK construction industry   |
+-------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------+
| `UK - HMRC API`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}    | [l10n_uk_hmrc]{.title-ref}        | Includes the                                               |
|                                                       |                                   | `HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text          |
|                                                       |                                   | role="abbr"} basics.                                       |
+-------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------+

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Only UK-based companies can submit reports to HMRC. - Installing the
module `UK - Accounting Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
installs all two modules at once. - The
`UK - Construction Industry Scheme`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
module automatically includes the `UK - HMRC API`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} module during installation.
::::

::: seealso
\- [HM Revenue &
Customs](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-revenue-customs/) -
[Overview of Making Tax
Digital](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/making-tax-digital/overview-of-making-tax-digital/)
:::

## Chart of accounts {#localization/united-kingdom/chart-of-account}

The UK chart of accounts is included in the
`UK - Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} module. Go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Accounting: Chart of Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to access it.

Setup your `CoA (chart of accounts)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} by
going to `Accounting --> Configuration
--> Settings --> Accounting Import section`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and choose to `Review Manually`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} or `Import (recommended)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} your initial balances.

## Taxes {#localization/united-kingdom/taxes}

As part of the localization module, UK taxes are created automatically
with their related financial accounts and configuration.

Go to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to update the `Default Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, the `Tax Return Periodicity`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} or to `Configure your
tax accounts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

To edit existing taxes or to `Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
a new tax, go to `Accounting -->
Configuration --> Accounting: Taxes`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

::: seealso
\- `taxes <../accounting/taxes>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
Tutorial: [Tax report and
return](https://www.odoo.com/slides/slide/tax-report-and-return-1719?fullscreen=1).
:::

### Making Tax Digital (MTD) {#localization/united-kingdom/digital-tax}

In the UK, all VAT-registered businesses have to follow the MTD rules by
using software to submit their VAT returns.

The **UK - Accounting Reports** module enables you to comply with the
[HM Revenue &
Customs](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-revenue-customs/)
requirements regarding [Making Tax
Digital](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/making-tax-digital/overview-of-making-tax-digital/).

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

If your periodic submission is more than three months late, it is no
longer possible to submit it through Odoo, as Odoo only retrieves open
bonds from the last three months. Your submission has to be done
manually by contacting HMRC.
::::

#### Register your company to HMRC before the first submission {#localization/united-kingdom/hmrc-registration}

Go to `Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and click on `Connect to HMRC`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Enter your company information on the HMRC platform.
You only need to do it once.

#### Periodic submission to HMRC {#localization/united-kingdom/periodic-hmrc-submission}

Import your obligations HMRC, filter on the period you want to submit,
and send your tax report by clicking `Send to HMRC`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

You can use dummy credentials to demo the HMRC flow. To do so, activate
the `developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and
go to `General Settings -->
Technical --> System Parameters`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. From here, search for
[l10n_uk_reports.hmrc_mode]{.title-ref} and change the value line to
[demo]{.title-ref}. You can get such credentials from the [HMRC
Developer Hub](https://developer.service.hmrc.gov.uk/api-test-user).
::::

#### Periodic submission to HMRC for multi-company {#localization/united-kingdom/periodic-hmrc-submission-multi}

Only one company and one user can connect to HMRC simultaneously. If
several UK-based companies are on the same database, the user who
submits the HMRC report must follow these instructions before each
submission:

1.  Log into the company for which the submission has to be done.
2.  Go to `General Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and in
    the `Users`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, click
    `Manage Users`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Select the user
    who is connected to HMRC.
3.  Go to the `UK HMRC Integration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    tab and click `Reset Authentication
    Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
    `Remove Authentication Credentials`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} button.
4.  `Register your company to HMRC <localization/united-kingdom/hmrc-registration>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} and submit the company\'s tax report.
5.  Repeat the steps for other companies\' HMRC submissions.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

During this process, the `Connect to HMRC`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button no longer appears for other UK-based companies.
::::

## Bacs files {#localization/united-kingdom/BACS-files}

`Bacs (Bankers' Automated Clearing Services)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} files are electronic files used in the UK to process
payments and transfers between bank accounts.

To enable the use of Bacs files, make sure the
`UK BACS Payment Files <localization/united-kingdom/modules>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} module is installed, then:

1.  Configure your Bacs Service User Number:
    1.  Go to
        `Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
        role="menuselection"} and scroll down to the
        `Customer Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.
    2.  Enter your `Service User Number`{.interpreted-text
        role="guilabel"} under `BACS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
        and manually save.
2.  Configure your **bank** journal:
    1.  Go to
        `Accounting --> Configuration --> Journals`{.interpreted-text
        role="menuselection"} and select your **bank** journal.
    2.  In the `Journal Entries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
        configure the `Account Number`{.interpreted-text
        role="guilabel"} and `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
        fields.
    3.  In the `Incoming Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
        and `Outgoing Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tabs,
        make sure the `BACS Direct Debit`{.interpreted-text
        role="guilabel"} payment method is enabled.
3.  Configure the contacts for whom you wish to use Bacs files: Access
    the contact form and, in the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} tab, click `Add a line`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} and fill in the `Account Number`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} and `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    fields.

### Bill payments {#localization/united-kingdom/bill-payments}

To generate Bacs files for bill payments, set the
`Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
`BACS Direct Debit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} when
`registering vendor payments <../accounting/payments>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.

Then, create a vendor batch payment:

1.  Go to `Accounting --> Vendors --> Batch Payments`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, and click `New`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
2.  Select the bank journal in the `Bank`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} field, set the `Payment Method`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} to `BACS Direct Credit`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, and select a
    `BACS Processing Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
3.  Optionally, you can also:
    - select a `BACS Expiry Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};
    - enable `BACS Multi Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
      process the payments on their individual date.
4.  Click `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, select the
    payments you want to include, click `Select`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, then `Validate`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.

Once validated, the Bacs file is available in the chatter. You can also
`Re-generate
Export File`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if you need a new Bacs
file for that batch payment.

![Vendor Batch Payment view with generated BACS file.](united_kingdom/bacs-files.png)

::: seealso
`../accounting/payments/batch`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Invoice payments {#localization/united-kingdom/invoice-payments}

Before generating Bacs files for invoice payments, you must first create
a **BACS Direct Debit Instruction**: Go to
`Accounting --> Customers --> BACS Direct Debit Instructions`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and click `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Select a `Customer`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, their `IBAN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
the `Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} you wish to use.

To generate Bacs files for invoice payments, set the
`Payment Method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
`BACS Direct Debit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} when
`registering invoice payments <../accounting/payments>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If you register the payment for an invoice linked to a subscription or
via `Accounting --> Customers --> Payments`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, you can select the `BACS
Payment Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:

- `Direct debit-first collection of a series`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"};
- `Direct debit single collection`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};
- `Direct debit repeating collection in a series`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"};
- `Direct debit-final collection of a series`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
::::

Then, create a customer batch payment:

1.  Go to
    `Accounting --> Customers --> Batch Payments`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, and click `New`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
2.  Select the bank journal in the `Bank`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} field, set the `Payment Method`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} to `BACS Direct Credit`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, and select a
    `BACS Processing Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
3.  Optionally, you can also:
    - select a `BACS Expiry Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"};
    - enable `BACS Multi Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
      process the payments on their individual date.
4.  Click `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, select the
    payments you want to include, click `Select`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, then `Validate`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.

Once validated, the Bacs file is available in the chatter. You can also
`Re-generate
Export File`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if you need a new Bacs
file for that batch payment.

## Employment Hero payroll {#localization/united-kingdom/employment-hero}

If your business is already up and running with `Employment Hero
<../../hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/employment_hero>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, you can use our connector as an alternative payroll
solution.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

To
`configure the Employment Hero API <employment_hero/configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for **United Kingdom**, use the following value as
`Payroll URL`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
[https://api.yourpayroll.co.uk/]{.title-ref}.
::::

::: {#localization/united-kingdom/cis-deduction}
:::

## CIS deduction

The Construction Industry Scheme deduction (CIS deduction) is a tax
deduction system used in the UK designed specifically for the
construction industry. It requires contractors to deduct a percentage of
payments made to subcontractors and forward these deductions to HM
Revenue and Customs (HMRC). These deductions apply only to the labor
portion of the payments and serve as advance payments towards the
subcontractor\'s tax and National Insurance contributions. Contractors
are required to register for the scheme, but subcontractors are not.
However, subcontractors who are not registered face higher payment
deductions. Under the
`CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
contractors must deduct 20% from payments to registered subcontractors,
while the deduction increases to 30% for unregistered ones.

::: seealso
- [Construction Industry Scheme
  (CIS)](https://www.gov.uk/what-is-the-construction-industry-scheme)
- [Guidelines for CIS
  contractors](https://www.gov.uk/what-you-must-do-as-a-cis-contractor)
- [Guidelines for CIS
  subcontractors](https://www.gov.uk/what-you-must-do-as-a-cis-subcontractor)
:::

As a contractor, you are required to register with the
`CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
before hiring subcontractors and to check whether each subcontractor is
registered with the
`CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. You
must also maintain records of all payments and deductions and submit
monthly returns to HMRC, including the following details:

- information about the subcontractors
- records of payments made and any deductions applied
- a declaration confirming that the employment status of all
  subcontractors has been reviewed
- a declaration confirming that all subcontractors requiring
  verification have been verified

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If no payments were made to subcontractors in the previous tax month,
contractors must notify
`HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} by the
19th of the month to avoid a penalty.
::::

To submit Monthly Returns to
`HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
`install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
`UK - Construction Industry Scheme <localization/united-kingdom/modules>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} module.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To enable the `Test`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} mode and use
test credentials, open the Settings app, activate the
`developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and go
to `Settings --> Technical -->
System Parameters`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Search for
[l10n_uk_hmrc.api_mode]{.title-ref}, select it, and change the
`Value`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from [production]{.title-ref}
to [test]{.title-ref}.
::::

### Monthly returns {#localization/united-kingdom/cis-monthly-returns}

Monthly returns only work for vendor bills and vendor refunds. To submit
a complete return to `HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, several steps must be followed to report all payments made
to subcontractors under the scheme during the previous tax month:

- `localization/united-kingdom/cis-contractor-setup`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `localization/united-kingdom/cis-subcontractor-setup`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `localization/united-kingdom/cis-vendorbills`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `localization/united-kingdom/cis-monthly-return-sending`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}

#### Contractor (company) setup {#localization/united-kingdom/cis-contractor-setup}

To configure your company\'s
`HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
information, go to the Settings app and, in the
`Companies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, click
`Update Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Open the
`HMRC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab and configure the
information in the `HMRC Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and the `Contractor details`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
sections. All fields are mandatory.

#### Subcontractor setup {#localization/united-kingdom/cis-subcontractor-setup}

Access the subcontractor\'s contact form and select the
`Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. In the
`HMRC Details`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, enable the
`Construction Industry Scheme`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
option; the `CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}-related fields are displayed.

By default, the `Deduction rate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
set to 30%. To modify it, first enter the
`Verification Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} provided by
`HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} when
verifying the subcontractor\'s status, then update the
`Deduction Rate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} accordingly.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `Forename`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Surname`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields are mandatory if the
contact type is set to `Individual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

#### Vendor bills {#localization/united-kingdom/cis-vendorbills}

The appropriate `CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} tax must be applied to **labor items** on vendor bills
based on the subcontractor\'s `Deduction Rate`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}: `0% CIS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`20% CIS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`30% CIS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To apply the rate, go to
the `Invoice Lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section of the
vendor bill and select the appropriate
`CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} tax
rate in the `Taxes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} column of the
**labor** items.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- The `CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} tax rate is not necessary for material items on vendor
bills. - A yellow banner appears at the top of the page if:

- The `Construction Industry Scheme`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  option hasn\'t been enabled in the
  `subcontractor <localization/united-kingdom/cis-subcontractor-setup>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}\'s `Contact`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form when
  creating a vendor bill.
- The `CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} tax used in the vendor bill does not match the expected
  `CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  deduction rate for a
  `subcontractor <localization/united-kingdom/cis-subcontractor-setup>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.
::::

#### Monthly returns sending {#localization/united-kingdom/cis-monthly-return-sending}

On the 6th of each month, Odoo sends a reminder email to submit a
monthly return to `HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. The recipient email address is the one entered in the
company `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. To send
monthly returns to `HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, go to
`Accounting --> Reporting --> Tax Return`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and follow these steps:

1.  Click `fa-book`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    `Report:`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and select
    `CIS Deduction (GB)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
2.  In the `fa-calendar`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    `(calendar)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} date selector, the
    `Tax Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is automatically
    adjusted to match the
    `CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
    deduction period.
3.  Click on `Send to HMRC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
    top-left corner.
4.  In the `CIS monthly return`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    window, select the required options in the
    `Declaration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:
    - `Employment Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: To declare
      that the employment status of all subcontractors has been
      reviewed.
    - `Subcontractor Verification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      To declare that all submitted subcontractors requiring
      verification have been verified.
    - `Inactivity Indicator`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: To
      declare temporary inactivity.
5.  In the `Information correct declaration`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} section, confirm the information is true and
    complete by checking the box. Then, enter the
    `Password`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} used in the
    `HMRC Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section during
    `contractor setup <localization/united-kingdom/cis-contractor-setup>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
6.  Click `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to prompt Odoo to
    request `HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text
    role="abbr"} to initiate the transaction.

When `HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
replies to a transaction, Odoo automatically notifies the user who
submitted it by email. The email informs them that the response is
available in the company\'s chatter with an attached XML document for
download. Both the electronic and paper versions of the
`HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} receipt
should be retained. If an error is detected, a new submission is
required to comply with
`HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
requirements.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Transactions are updated daily. To manually update the
`HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} request,
click the `fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(gear)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon and select
`Refresh HMRC request`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. -
`CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
invoices are included in the `CIS Deduction (GB)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} report but are not sent to
`HMRC (HM Revenue and Customs)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
::::

# United States

The Odoo fiscal localization package for the United States follows the
Generally Acceptable Accounting Principles (GAAP) accounting standards
and rules used to prepare financial statements, as outlined by the
Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) and adopted by the
Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).

::: seealso
\- [Financial Accounting Standards Board
(FASB)](https://asc.fasb.org/Home) - [Securities and Exchange Commission
(SEC)](https://www.sec.gov/)
:::

In addition, a series of videos on the subject of Accounting are
available through Odoo\'s eLearning platform. These videos cover how to
start from scratch, set up configurations, complete common workflows,
and provide in-depth looks at some specific use cases, as well.

::: seealso
\- [Odoo Tutorials: Accounting &
Invoicing](https://www.odoo.com/slides/accounting-and-invoicing-19) -
[Odoo SmartClass:
Accounting](https://www.odoo.com/slides/smartclass-accounting-121)
:::

## Configuration

Below are the available modules in Odoo for accounting use in the United
States.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The modules listed below are either for reference only or are optional,
as the core requirements to operate under the US fiscal localization in
Odoo are already included under the default package that came installed
during database initialization.

Verify the default package is in use by navigating to
`Accounting App -->
Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} and under the
`Fiscal Localization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section at the
top, look for the [Generic Chart Template]{.title-ref} selection to be
listed next to the `Package`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field
label. This chart template includes the necessary settings for the US
localization for the Odoo **Accounting** app.

![The Generic Chart Template comes preconfigured for the US localization.](united_states/us-l10n-generic-chart-template.png)
::::

## Chart of accounts {#l10n_us/coa}

The
`chart of accounts (COA) <../accounting/get_started/chart_of_accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} for the United States localization, in Odoo, follows the
standard
`GAAP (Generally Acceptable Accounting Practices)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} structure, with accounts grouped into seven main
categories, with corresponding numeric values that prefix individual
journal entries:

- **Receivable**: the balance of money (or credit) due to the business
  for goods or services delivered or used, but not yet paid for by
  customers. `AR (Accounts Receivable)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  is indicated by the journal code labeled (or beginning) with
  `1`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- **Payable**: the business\'s short-term obligations owed to its
  creditors or suppliers, which have not yet been paid.
  `AP (Accounts Payable)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is indicated by
  the journal code labeled (or beginning) with `2`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
- **Equity**: the amount of money that is returned to a company\'s
  shareholders if all of the assets were liquidated and all of the
  company\'s debt was paid off in the case of liquidation. Equity is
  indicated by the journal code labeled (or beginning) with
  `3`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `9`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
- **Assets**: items listed on the balance sheet that contains economic
  value or have the ability to generate cash flows in the future, such
  as a piece of machinery, a financial security, or a patent. Assets are
  indicated by the journal code labeled (or beginning) with
  `1`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- **Liability**: refers to a company\'s financial debts or obligations
  that arise during the course of business operations. Liabilities are
  indicated by the journal code labeled (or beginning) with
  `2`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- **Income**: synonymous with *net income*, this is the profit a company
  retains after paying off all relevant expenses from sales revenue
  earned. Income is indicated by the journal code labeled (or beginning)
  with `4`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `6`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
- **Expenses**: the cost of operations that a company incurs to generate
  revenue. Expenses are indicated by the journal code labeled (or
  beginning) with a `6`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

installed with the US localization package. The accounts listed below
are preconfigured to perform certain operations within Odoo. It is
recommended to **not** delete these accounts; however, if changes are
needed, rename the accounts instead.
