# Nuvei

[Nuvei](https://www.nuvei.com) is a Canadian-based payment solution
provider that covers several Latin American countries, the US, and
Canada. It allows businesses to accept credit cards and several local
payment methods.

## Configuration on the Nuvei Dashboard {#payment_providers/nuvei/dashboard}

1.  Create a Nuvei account, if necessary, via our [referral
    page](https://pages.nuvei.com/odoo-referral-0).
2.  Nuvei uses two separate portals for Sandbox and Production
    environments. Utilize the [Sandbox
    Dashboard](https://sandbox.nuvei.com/login) to test the integration
    without charging your customers. Once you are ready to accept
    payments, switch to the [Production
    Dashboard](https://cpanel.nuvei.com/login).
3.  Go to `Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the left
    sidebar, select `My Integration Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, then select your payment page in the
    `Website`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dropdown menu.
4.  Copy the `Merchant ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Site ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} values and save them
    for `later
    <payment_providers/nuvei/odoo>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
5.  Click `Reveal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then copy the
    `Secret Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and save it for
    `later
    <payment_providers/nuvei/odoo>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Nuvei supports additional functionality relating to error handling from
the same page as above. For example, the following options are available
for handling failed transactions: Enable `User Trap`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to redirect users back to the payment page and allow
them to attempt another deposit or `Decline Recovery`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to display a popup suggesting alternative or similar
payment methods.
::::

## Configuration on Odoo {#payment_providers/nuvei/odoo}

1.  `Navigate to the payment provider Nuvei <payment_providers/add_new>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} and fill in the `Merchant Identifier`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, `Site Identifier`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, and `Secret Key`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} fields with the information saved at the step
    `payment_providers/nuvei/dashboard`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
2.  To activate the provider, change its state to
    `Enabled`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
    `Test Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
3.  Configure the rest of the options to your liking.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

You can also test Nuvei using the
`test mode <payment_providers/test-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
and your Sandbox Dashboard values.
::::

## Payment methods {#payment_providers/nuvei/services}

Most Nuvei payment methods are **region specific**. The supported
payment methods and brands for each country are listed below:

+---------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| **Argentina**                   | **Ecuador**                      |
|                                 |                                  |
| - Boleto                        | - Card (AMEX, Mastercard, Visa)  |
| - Card (AMEX, Mastercard, Visa) | - AstroPay TEF (Banco Guayaquil, |
|                                 |   Banco Pichincha, Facilito)     |
+---------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| **Brazil**                      | **Mexico**                       |
|                                 |                                  |
| - Boleto                        | - Card (AMEX, Mastercard, Visa)  |
| - Card (AMEX, Mastercard, Visa) | - SPEI                           |
| - Pix                           | - Oxxo Pay                       |
+---------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| **Canada**                      | **Peru**                         |
|                                 |                                  |
| - Card (AMEX, Mastercard, Visa) | - Card (AMEX, Mastercard, Visa)  |
|                                 | - Boleto                         |
+---------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| **Chile**                       | **United States**                |
|                                 |                                  |
| - Card (AMEX, Mastercard, Visa) | - Card (AMEX, Mastercard, Visa)  |
| - WebPay                        |                                  |
+---------------------------------+----------------------------------+
| **Colombia**                    | **Uruguay**                      |
|                                 |                                  |
| - Card (AMEX, Mastercard, Visa) | - Card (AMEX, Mastercard, Visa)  |
| - PSE                           | - Local Payments (Abitab,        |
|                                 |   RedPagos)                      |
+---------------------------------+----------------------------------+

::: seealso
`../payment_providers`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::




--- SOURCE: finance/payment_providers/paymob.md ---

# Paymob

[Paymob](https://paymob.com/) is an Egypt-based payment service provider
operating in Egypt, Oman, Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, and the United Arab
Emirates. It allows businesses to accept online payments through credit
and debit cards, as well as several local payment methods.

## Configuration on the Paymob dashboard {#payment_providers/paymob/configure_dashboard}

1.  Create a Paymob account if necessary and log into the Paymob
    dashboard:
    - [Paymob dashboard for
      Egypt](https://accept.paymob.com/portal2/en/login)
    - [Paymob dashboard for
      Oman](https://oman.paymob.com/portal2/en/login)
    - [Paymob dashboard for
      Pakistan](https://pakistan.paymob.com/portal2/en/login)
    - [Paymob dashboard for Saudi
      Arabia](https://ksa.paymob.com/portal2/en/login)
    - [Paymob dashboard for the United Arab
      Emirates](https://uae.paymob.com/portal2/en/login)
2.  Check the account mode in the top left corner of the page. Use the
    `Test`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} mode to try the
    integration without charging customers. Switch to
    `Live`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} mode once you are ready to
    accept payments.
3.  Navigate to `Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} in
    the left menu.
4.  In the `Account Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
    copy the value of the `HMAC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    field and save it for
    `later <payment_providers/paymob/configure_odoo>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
5.  Click `View`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} next to the
    `API Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Secret Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    `Public Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields to reveal
    each value. Copy each key and save it for
    `later <payment_providers/paymob/configure_odoo>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
6.  Navigate to `Developers --> Payment Integrations`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} in the left menu.
7.  Ensure that all required payment methods are listed in the payment
    integrations. If any payment method is missing, contact Paymob
    support.

## Configuration on Odoo {#payment_providers/paymob/configure_odoo}

1.  `Navigate to the payment provider Paymob <payment_providers/add_new>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} and change its state to `Enabled`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} (or `Test Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    if you are trying Paymob as a `test
    <payment_providers/test-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}).

2.  In the `Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, set the
    `Account Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to your
    company\'s country.

3.  Fill in the `HMAC Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `API key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Secret Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    `Public Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields with the
    information saved at the step
    `payment_providers/paymob/configure_dashboard`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.

4.  In the `Configuration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, click
    `Enable Payment Methods`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then
    `activate the payment methods <payment_providers/payment_methods>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} you want to offer.

5.  Return to the provider\'s form and click
    `Synchronize with Paymob`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

    :::: important
    ::: title
    Important
    :::

    \- For a payment method to be available to customers, it must be
    activated in Odoo **and** added to the
    `list of payment integrations on the Paymob dashboard
    <payment_providers/paymob/configure_dashboard>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
    \- If a payment method is added to the Paymob dashboard **after**
    synchronization, click `Synchronize with Paymob`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} again to make it available in Odoo.
    ::::

6.  Configure the remaining options as needed.

::: seealso
`../payment_providers`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::




--- SOURCE: finance/payment_providers/paypal.md ---

# PayPal

[Paypal](https://www.paypal.com/) is an American online payment provider
available worldwide and one of the few that does not charge a
subscription fee.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

While PayPal is available in [over 200
countries/regions](https://www.paypal.com/webapps/mpp/country-worldwide),
only [a selection of currencies are
supported](https://developer.paypal.com/docs/reports/reference/paypal-supported-currencies).
::::

## Configuration in PayPal {#payment_providers/paypal/configuration-paypal}

1.  [Log into your PayPal Developer
    Dashboard](https://developer.paypal.com/dashboard/).
2.  Click `Apps & Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    click `Create App`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
3.  Enter an `App Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and click
    `Create App`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
4.  Copy the `Client ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and save them for
    `later <payment_providers/paypal/configuration-odoo>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

If you use customer names or addresses that include accented or
non-Latin characters, you **must** configure the encoding format of the
payment request sent by Odoo to PayPal to avoid transaction failures
without notice. To do so, access the [PayPal button language encoding
setting](https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/websrc?cmd=_profile-language-encoding),
click `More Options`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and set the
`Encoding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
`UTF-8`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

If you are trying PayPal as a test, access your `PayPal Sandbox account
<payment_providers/paypal/testing>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and
[configure the encoding format for your sandbox
account](https://sandbox.paypal.com/cgi-bin/customerprofileweb?cmd=_profile-language-encoding).
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

For encrypted website payments & EWP_SETTINGS errors, please check the
[PayPal documentation](https://developer.paypal.com/docs/online/).
::::

## Configuration in Odoo {#payment_providers/paypal/configuration-odoo}

1.  `Navigate to the payment provider PayPal <payment_providers/add_new>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
2.  In the `Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, enter
    the `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} linked to your PayPal
    account, then fill in the `Client ID`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} and `Client Secret`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} fields with the values you saved at the step
    `payment_providers/paypal/configuration-paypal`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
3.  Click `Generate your webhook`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
    create the `Webhook ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
4.  Set the `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
    `Enabled`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and make sure the
    PayPal payment provider is `Published`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
5.  Configure the remaining options as desired.

## Testing {#payment_providers/paypal/testing}

PayPal provides two sandbox accounts that you can use to simulate live
transactions:

- A business account (to use as the merchant account, e.g.,
  [ab-1abc12345678@business.example.com]{.title-ref});
- A default personal account (to use as the shopper account, e.g.,
  [ba-9cba87654321@personal.example.com]{.title-ref}).

To test the PayPal payment workflow in Odoo:

1.  Log into the [Paypal Developer Site](https://developer.paypal.com/)
    using your PayPal credentials and go to
    `Testing Tools --> Sandbox Accounts`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}.
2.  Click the `fa-ellipsis-v`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
    (`ellipsis`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) icon next to the
    sandbox business account and select
    `View/Edit account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
3.  Copy the `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Client ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    `Secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and save them for the
    next step.
4.  In Odoo,
    `configure the PayPal payment provider <payment_providers/paypal/configuration-odoo>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} with the values saved at the previous step and set the
    `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
    `Test Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

You can then run a test transaction from Odoo using the sandbox personal
account.

::: seealso
\- `payment_providers/test-mode`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} -
`../payment_providers`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::




--- SOURCE: finance/payment_providers/razorpay.md ---

# Razorpay

[Razorpay](https://razorpay.com/) is an online payments provider
established in India that supports more than 100 payment methods.

## Create a Razorpay account with Odoo (Indian companies only) {#payment_providers/razorpay/oauth-connection}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- This method is only available for Indian companies. - This flow does
not support the
`test mode <payment_providers/test-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

1.  `Navigate to the Razorpay payment provider <payment_providers/supported_providers>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} and click `Connect`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

2.  Go through the account creation process and enter the verification
    codes when prompted.

    :::: tip
    ::: title
    Tip
    :::

    If you already have a Razorpay account, enter your Razorpay
    credentials, select the account you want to link to your Odoo
    database (if applicable), then click `Continue`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
    ::::

3.  At the end of the process, click `Authorize`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}. If all required information has been submitted,
    you are then redirected to Odoo, and the payment provider is
    `Enabled`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

## Manual credentials and webhook input {#payment_providers/razorpay/manual-connection}

### Razorpay configuration {#payment_providers/razorpay/configure_dashboard}

1.  [Create a Razorpay account](https://accounts.razorpay.com/) if
    necessary and log into the [Razorpay
    Dashboard](https://dashboard.razorpay.com/).

2.  Go to the `Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab at the
    top of the page.

3.  Toggle the `Test Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} switch in
    the left menu to try the integration without charging customers.
    Toggle it off once you are ready to accept real payments.

4.  Click `Account & Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
    left menu, then, under `Website and app
    settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, select [API
    Keys](https://dashboard.razorpay.com/app/website-app-settings/api-keys).

5.  Copy the values of the `Key Id`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    and `Secret Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields and save
    them for later.

6.  Click `Account & Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
    left menu, then, under `Website and app
    settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, select
    [Webhooks](https://dashboard.razorpay.com/app/website-app-settings/webhooks).

7.  | Click `Add New Webhook`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then
      enter your Odoo database URL followed by
      [/payment/razorpay/webhook]{.title-ref} in the
      `Webhook URL`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
    | For example:
      [https://example.odoo.com/payment/razorpay/webhook]{.title-ref}.

8.  Fill the `Secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field with a
    password of your choice and save it for later.

9.  Enable the following events: `payment.authorized`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, `payment.captured`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, `payment.failed`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, `refund.failed`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, and `refund.processed`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.

10. Click `Create Webhook`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
    finalize the configuration.

::::: {#payment_providers/razorpay/recurring_payments}
:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The [Recurring
payments](https://razorpay.com/docs/payments/recurring-payments/)
feature must be activated to accept recurring payments. To enable this
feature, submit a request to the [Razorpay Support
team](https://razorpay.com/support/#request).
::::
:::::

### Odoo configuration {#payment_providers/razorpay/configure_odoo}

1.  Activate `developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
2.  `Navigate to the Razorpay payment provider <payment_providers/add_new>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
3.  In the `Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, fill
    the `Key Id`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Key Secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    `Webhook Secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} with the values
    you saved during
    `payment_providers/razorpay/configure_dashboard`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
4.  Configure the remaining options as needed.
5.  Set the `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
    `Enabled`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (or
    `Test Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if you are trying
    Razorpay as a `test <payment_providers/test-mode>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}).

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

If you configure Odoo to
`capture amounts manually <payment_providers/manual_capture>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}:

- **Manual voiding** of a transaction is not supported by Razorpay.
- Transactions that remain uncaptured for more than **five days** are
  automatically **voided**.
::::

::: seealso
`../payment_providers`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::




--- SOURCE: finance/payment_providers/redsys.md ---

# Redsys

[Redsys](https://redsys.es) is a Spain-based payment service provider
that processes online and in-store payments for businesses across
Europe. It allows merchants to accept major credit and debit cards, as
well as other local payment methods supported by Spanish banks.

## Redsys account configuration {#payment_providers/redsys/configure_redsys}

1.  Contact your bank to request activation of an online payment
    terminal (TPV) with Redsys.
2.  [Log into your Redsys
    account](https://sis-t.redsys.es:25443/admincanales-web/index.jsp#/login)
    using the credentials provided by your bank.
3.  In the left-hand menu, navigate to
    `Merchant Configuration`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
4.  In the `Merchant Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    section, fill in the `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Merchant URL`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    `Merchant Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields.
5.  Set the fields in the `Configuration data`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} section as follows:
    - `Online notification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      `With online notification: HTTP`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"}
    - `Synchronization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      `Synchronous`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    - `Parameters in the URLs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
      `Yes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
6.  Copy the merchant code and merchant terminal number displayed in the
    `Merchant
    management`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section and save them
    for
    `later <payment_providers/redsys/configure_odoo>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
7.  Click `See key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, enter your user
    identifier and password to display the key, and save it for
    `later <payment_providers/redsys/configure_odoo>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.

## Configuration in Odoo {#payment_providers/redsys/configure_odoo}

1.  `Navigate to the payment provider Redsys <payment_providers/add_new>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
2.  Fill in the `Merchant Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Merchant Terminal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    `Secret Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields with the
    information saved at the step
    `payment_providers/redsys/configure_redsys`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
3.  Configure the rest of the options to your liking.
4.  Set the `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
    `Enabled`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (or
    `Test Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if you want to
    `test the integration without affecting live transactions <payment_providers/test-mode>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}).

::: seealso
`../payment_providers`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::




--- SOURCE: finance/payment_providers/stripe.md ---

# Stripe

[Stripe](https://stripe.com/) is a United States-based online payment
solution provider allowing businesses to accept **credit cards** and
other payment methods.

::: seealso
\- [List of countries supported by Stripe](https://stripe.com/global) -
[List of payment methods supported by
Stripe](https://stripe.com/payments/payment-methods) -
`../payment_providers`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`Use Stripe as a payment terminal in Point of Sale
<../../sales/point_of_sale/payment_methods/terminals/stripe>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Create your Stripe account with Odoo {#payment_providers/stripe/create_account}

To create a new Stripe account and link it to your Odoo database, make
sure the company\'s `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
configured in the
`company's settings <general/companies/company>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, then follow the steps below according to your hosting type:

:::: tabs
.. group-tab:: Odoo Online

1.  `Navigate to the payment provider Stripe <payment_providers/supported_providers>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} and click `Connect Stripe`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
2.  Go through the setup process and confirm your email address when
    Stripe sends you a confirmation email.
3.  At the end of the process, click
    `Agree and submit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. If all
    requested information has been submitted, you are then redirected to
    Odoo, and your payment provider is enabled.

::: group-tab
Odoo.sh or On-premise
:::

1.  `Navigate to the payment provider Stripe <payment_providers/supported_providers>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} and click `Connect Stripe`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
2.  Go through the setup process and confirm your email address when
    Stripe sends you a confirmation email.
3.  At the end of the process, click
    `Agree and submit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}; you are then
    redirected to the payment provider **Stripe** in Odoo.
4.  `Fill in your credentials <payment_providers/stripe/manual_input>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
5.  Set the `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
    `Enabled`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If you have created an account instead of `linking an existing one
<payment_providers/stripe/manual_input>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
`enable the developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, then click `Reset your Stripe Account`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} on the Stripe payment provider form, then
`fill in your Stripe account's credentials <payment_providers/stripe/manual_input>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.
::::

## Manual credential input {#payment_providers/stripe/manual_input}

Manual credential input is needed, for example, when linking an existing
Stripe account to your Odoo database, when using an account
`created on Odoo.sh or On-premise
<payment_providers/stripe/create_account>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, or when `testing Stripe without affecting live
transactions <payment_providers/test-mode>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

### Stripe configuration {#payment_providers/stripe/stripe-configuration}

1.  Go to [the API keys page on
    Stripe](https://dashboard.stripe.com/account/apikeys), or log into
    your Stripe dashboard and go to
    `Developers --> API Keys`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
2.  In the `Standard keys`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
    copy the `Publishable key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    the `Secret key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and save them
    for the
    `payment_providers/stripe/odoo-configuration`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} step.

### Odoo configuration {#payment_providers/stripe/odoo-configuration}

1.  `Enable the developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
2.  `Navigate to the Stripe payment provider <payment_providers/supported_providers>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
3.  In the `Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, fill in
    the `Publishable Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Secret Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields with the
    values you `previously saved
    <payment_providers/stripe/stripe-configuration>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
4.  Click `Generate your webhook`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
5.  Configure the remaining options as needed.
6.  Set the `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
    `Enabled`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- You can also test Stripe without affecting live transactions using
the `test mode
<payment_providers/test-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and the
`API keys
<payment_providers/stripe/stripe-configuration>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} of your [Stripe account\'s Test Mode or a sandbox
environment](https://docs.stripe.com/testing-use-cases). - To link the
same Stripe account to `multiple companies
</applications/general/companies/multi_company>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} in a database, `create an account
<payment_providers/stripe/create_account>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
and `fill in the credentials
<payment_providers/stripe/manual_input>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
for one company, then reuse the same credentials and webhook for the
others. To view the webhook, go to the [Webhooks page on
Stripe](https://dashboard.stripe.com/webhooks), or log into your Stripe
dashboard and go to `Developers --> Webhooks`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click the destination in the list, then click the
`fa-eye`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
(`Reveal secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) icon next to the
`Signing secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field and copy the
value.
::::

## Enable Apple Pay

To allow customers to use the Apple Pay button to pay for their
eCommerce orders, `navigate to
the Stripe payment provider <payment_providers/supported_providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, then go to the `Configuration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, enable `Allow Express Checkout`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and click `Enable Apple Pay`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

::: seealso
`Express checkout and Google Pay <payment_providers/express_checkout>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Stripe allows to
`manually capture <payment_providers/manual_capture>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and `refund
<payment_providers/refunds>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} payments
either from Odoo or directly from the Stripe dashboard.
::::




--- SOURCE: finance/payment_providers/worldline.md ---

# Worldline

[Worldline](https://worldline.com/) is a France-based company and the
world\'s fourth largest payment provider.

## Settings in Worldline

### Create an API user {#worldline/API-user}

It is recommended to set up an **API user** to create transactions from
Odoo to ensure that your Worldline configuration remains safe even if
credentials are compromised. Additionally, API users do not require
frequent password updates like regular accounts.

To create an **API user**, proceed as follows:

1.  Log into your [Worldline Merchant
    Portal](https://merchant-portal.worldline-solutions.com/), click the
    `fa-th`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} (`menu`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}) icon, and select `Back Office`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
2.  Go to `Configuration --> Users`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and click on `New User`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
3.  Configure the following fields:
    1.  Specify a `UserID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
        `User's name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
        `E-mail address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
        `Timezone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of your choice.
    2.  Set the `Profile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
        `Admin`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    3.  Enable `Special user for API`{.interpreted-text
        role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- If you have already set up a user, make sure it is activated without
any error. - To test the payment flow with Worldline, use their [test
environment](https://merchant-portal.preprod.worldline-solutions.com/)
together with the `test mode
<payment_providers/test-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

### Set up Worldline for Odoo {#worldline/set-up}

Worldline must now be configured to accept payments from Odoo.

1.  From your merchant portal, go to
    `Developer --> Payment API`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}
    and click on `Generate API key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    Copy the `API key ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the
    `Secret API key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and save them
    for `later <wordline/odoo-configuration>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.

2.  Go to `Developer --> Webhooks`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} and click on
    `Generate webhook keys`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Copy the
    `Webhook ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the associated
    `Secret webhook key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and save
    them for `later <wordline/odoo-configuration>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.

3.  | Click `Add webhook endpoint`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
      enter your Odoo database\'s URL followed by
      [/payment/worldline/webhook]{.title-ref} in the
      `Endpoint url`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, and
      `Confirm`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
    | For example:
      [https://example.odoo.com/payment/worldline/webhook]{.title-ref}.

## Settings in Odoo {#wordline/odoo-configuration}

To set up Worldline in Odoo:

1.  `Navigate to the payment provider Worldline <payment_providers/add_new>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} and change its state to `Enabled`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
2.  In the `Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, enter
    the `PSPID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of your Worldline
    account and fill in the `API Key`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, `API Secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Webhook Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    `Webhook Secret`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} with the values
    you saved at the step `Set up Worldline for
    Odoo <worldline/set-up>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
3.  Configure the rest of the options to your liking.

::: seealso
`../payment_providers`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

# Xendit

[Xendit](https://www.xendit.co) is an Indonesian-based payment solution
provider that covers several Southeast Asian countries. It allows
businesses to accept credit cards as well as several local payment
methods.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\* Credit card payments are processed through Odoo, while all other
payment methods are handled via Xendit\'s website. \* Xendit supports
card payment tokenization, provided the customer has requested Merchant
Initiated Transaction (MIT) from [Xendit
Support](https://www.xendit.co/en/contact/).
::::

## Configuration on the Xendit Dashboard {#payment_providers/xendit/configure_dashboard}

1.  [Create a Xendit
    account](https://dashboard.xendit.co/register/1?referral_code=odooid&countr_code=ID)
    if necessary and log in to the [Xendit
    Dashboard](https://dashboard.xendit.co).
2.  Check your account mode in the top left corner of the page. Use the
    `Test Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to try the
    integration without charging your customers. Switch to
    `Live Mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} once you are ready to
    accept payments.
3.  Navigate to `Configuration: Settings`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"} in the left part of the application page. In
    the `Developers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, click
    [API
    Keys](https://dashboard.xendit.co/settings/developers#api-keys).
4.  Click `Generate Secret Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. In
    the popup box, enter any `API key name`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, select `Write`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    for the `Money-in Products`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    permission and `None`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for all
    other permissions then click `Generate key`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
5.  Confirm your password to display your API key. Copy or download the
    key and **save this information securely for later**. This is the
    only time the API key can be viewed or downloaded.
6.  Once completed, scroll down the page to the
    [Webhooks](https://dashboard.xendit.co/settings/developers#webhooks)
    section to generate the webhook token.
7.  Under `Webhook verification token`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, click
    `View Webhook Verification Token`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, then confirm your password to display the token.
    Save it for later.
8.  In the `Webhook URL`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section,
    enter your Odoo database\'s URL, followed by
    [/payment/xendit/webhook]{.title-ref} (e.g.,
    [https://example.odoo.com/payment/xendit/webhook]{.title-ref}) in
    the field `Invoices paid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    click the `Test and save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
    next to it.
9.  To allow recurring payments for credit cards, go to
    `Configuration: Payment
    Channels`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} in the left part
    of the application page. Then, hover your mouse over the
    `Visa, Mastercard, JCB, Amex`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    channel, click `View Details`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    and enable `Recurring Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    by toggling the related switch.

## Configuration on Odoo

1.  `Navigate to the payment provider Xendit <payment_providers/add_new>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} and change its state to `Enabled`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}.
2.  Fill in the `Secret Key`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
    `Webhook Token`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields with the
    information saved at the step
    `payment_providers/xendit/configure_dashboard`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
3.  Configure the rest of the options to your liking.

::: seealso
`../payment_providers`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

# Online payments

::: {.toctree titlesonly=""}
payment_providers/adyen payment_providers/amazon_payment_services
payment_providers/asiapay payment_providers/authorize
payment_providers/buckaroo payment_providers/demo payment_providers/dpo
payment_providers/flutterwave payment_providers/iyzico
payment_providers/mercado_pago payment_providers/mollie
payment_providers/nuvei payment_providers/paymob
payment_providers/paypal payment_providers/razorpay
payment_providers/redsys payment_providers/stripe
payment_providers/worldline payment_providers/xendit
payment_providers/bank_payments payment_providers/inperson_payments
:::

Odoo embeds several **payment providers** that allow your customers to
pay online, on their *customer portals*, or on your *eCommerce website*.
They can pay sales orders, invoices, or subscriptions with recurring
payments using their favorite payment methods, such as **credit cards**.

Each payment provider is linked to a list of supported `payment methods
<payment_providers/payment_methods>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} that
can be (de)activated based on your needs.

![Online payment form](payment_providers/online-payment.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo apps delegate the handling of sensitive information to the
certified payment provider so that you don\'t ever have to worry about
PCI compliance. No sensitive information (such as credit card numbers)
is stored on Odoo servers or Odoo databases hosted elsewhere. Instead,
Odoo apps use a unique reference number for the data stored safely in
the payment providers\' systems.
::::

## Supported payment providers {#payment_providers/supported_providers}

To access the supported payment providers, go to
`Accounting --> Configuration -->
Payment Providers`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
`Website --> Configuration --> Payment Providers`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, or
`Sales --> Configuration --> Payment Providers`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click the relevant payment provider card to
access and configure the related provider.

### Online payment providers {#payment_providers/online_providers}

                                                                                                        Payment flow from                 `Tokenization <payment_providers/tokenization>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}   `Manual capture <payment_providers/manual_capture>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}   `Refunds <payment_providers/refunds>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}   `Express checkout <payment_providers/express_checkout>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Adyen <payment_providers/adyen>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                       Odoo                              âœ”                                                                               Full and partial                                                                    Full and partial                                                      
  `Amazon Payment Services <payment_providers/amazon_payment_services>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}   The provider\'s website                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
  `AsiaPay <payment_providers/asiapay>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                   The provider\'s website                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
  `Authorize.Net <payment_providers/authorize>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                           Odoo                              âœ”                                                                               Full only                                                                           Full only                                                             
  `Buckaroo <payment_providers/buckaroo>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                 The provider\'s website                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
  `DPO Pay <payment_providers/dpo>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                       The provider\'s website                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
  `Flutterwave <payment_providers/flutterwave>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                           The provider\'s website           âœ”                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
  `Iyzico <payment_providers/iyzico>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                     The provider\'s website                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
  `Mercado Pago <payment_providers/mercado_pago>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                         The provider\'s website                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
  `Mollie <payment_providers/mollie>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                     The provider\'s website                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
  `Nuvei <payment_providers/nuvei>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                       The provider\'s website                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
  `Paymob <payment_providers/paymob>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                     The provider\'s website                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
  `PayPal <payment_providers/paypal>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                     Odoo                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
  `Razorpay <payment_providers/razorpay>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                 Odoo                              âœ”                                                                               Full only                                                                           Full and partial                                                      
  `Redsys <payment_providers/redsys>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                     The provider\'s website                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
  `Stripe <payment_providers/stripe>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                     Odoo                              âœ”                                                                               Full only                                                                           Full and partial                                                      âœ”
  `Worldline <payment_providers/worldline>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                               The provider\'s website           âœ”                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
  `Xendit <payment_providers/xendit>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}                                     Odoo or the provider\'s website   âœ” \*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Each provider has its own specific configuration flow, depending on
which feature is available. - Some of these online payment providers can
also be added as `bank accounts
<../finance/accounting/bank>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, but this is
**not** the same process as adding them as payment providers. Payment
providers allow customers to pay online, and bank accounts are added and
configured in the Accounting app to do a `bank reconciliation
<accounting/bank/reconciliation>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

In addition to the regular payment providers that integrate with an API,
such as Stripe, PayPal, or Adyen, Odoo bundles the
`Demo payment provider <payment_providers/demo>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}. This payment provider allows you to test business flows
involving online payments. No credentials are required as the demo
payments are dummy payments.
::::

### Bank payments {#payment_providers/bank_payments}

- | `Wire Transfer <payment_providers/bank_payments/wire_transfer>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}
  | Odoo displays your payment information with a payment reference. You
    have to approve the payment manually once it has been received in
    your bank account.

- | `SEPA Direct Debit <payment_providers/bank_payments/sdd>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}
  | Customers can make a bank transfer to register a SEPA Direct Debit
    mandate and allow their account to be charged directly for future
    payments.

### In-person payments

- | `Pay on Site <payment_providers/inperson_payments/pay_on_site>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}
  | Customers can reserve products online and pay when collecting their
    orders in store.

- | `Cash on Delivery <payment_providers/inperson_payments/cash_on_delivery>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}
  | Customers can pay for their orders upon delivery.

## Enabling a payment provider {#payment_providers/add_new}

To add a new payment provider and make its related payment methods
available to your customers, proceed as follows:

1.  Go to the payment provider\'s website, create an account, and make
    sure you have the API credentials requested for third-party use.
    These are necessary for Odoo to communicate with the payment
    provider.
2.  In Odoo, navigate to the `Payment providers`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} by going to `Accounting -->
    Configuration --> Payment Providers`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}, `Website --> Configuration --> Payment
    Providers`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, or
    `Sales --> Configuration --> Payment Providers`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}.
3.  Select the provider and configure the
    `Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.
4.  Set the `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to
    `Enabled`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- The fields available in the `Credentials`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab depend on the payment provider. Refer to the
`related documentation <payment_providers/supported_providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for more information. - Once you have enabled the payment
provider, it is automatically published on your website. If you wish to
unpublish it, click the `Published`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button. Customers cannot make payments through an unpublished provider,
but they can still manage
`(delete and assign to a subscription)`{.interpreted-text role="dfn"}
their existing tokens linked to such a provider.
::::

### Test mode {#payment_providers/test-mode}

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

We recommend using the test mode on a **duplicate** or a **test**
database to avoid potential issues with invoice numbering.
::::

To try a payment provider without affecting live transactions, set the
`State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field in the payment provider
form to `Test mode`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, enter the
**provider\'s dedicated test or sandbox credentials** in the
`Credentials`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Each payment
provider has its own separate test account or environment for this
purpose.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

By default, the payment provider remains **unpublished** in test mode so
that it\'s not visible to visitors.
::::

## Payment methods {#payment_providers/payment_methods}

Each payment provider is related to a list of supported payment methods;
the methods listed in the `Payment methods`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field in the `Configuration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab of the payment provider form are the ones that have
been activated. To activate or deactivate a payment method for a
provider, click `Enable Payment Methods`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, then click the toggle button of the related method.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

\- To view the complete list of supported payment methods, go to
`Accounting -->
Configuration --> Payment Methods`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, `Website --> Configuration -->
Payment Methods`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, or
`Sales --> Configuration --> Payment Methods`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. - Payment methods are displayed on the ecommerce
website based on their sequence order. To reorder them, drag and drop
the payment methods into the desired order in the
`Payment Methods`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} list.
::::

### Icons and brands

The icons displayed next to the payment method on your website are
either the icons of the brands activated for the payment method or, if
there aren\'t any, the icons of the payment methods themselves. To
modify them, `access the list of payment methods
<payment_providers/payment_methods>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, then
click the relevant one.

To modify a payment method\'s icon, hover your mouse over the image in
the upper-right corner of the payment method\'s form and click the
`fa-pencil`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} (`pencil`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}) icon.

Select the `Brands`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab to view the
brands that have been activated for the payment method. The brands and
their related icons are displayed based on their sequence order; to
reorder them, drag and drop them into the desired order. To modify a
brand\'s icon, select the brand, then, in the popup window that opens,
hover the mouse over the image in the upper-right corner and click the
`fa-pencil`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} (`pencil`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}) icon.

### Advanced configuration

To further configure payment methods, follow these steps:

1.  Activate the `developer mode <developer-mode>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"}.
2.  `Access the list of payment methods <payment_providers/payment_methods>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} and click the relevant one.
3.  Go to the `Configuration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab and
    adjust the features as needed.

:::: danger
::: title
Danger
:::

\- Each payment method is preconfigured in a way that aligns with the
payment providers\' behavior and their integration with Odoo. Any change
to this configuration may result in errors and should be tested on a
duplicate or test database first. - Modifications to the payment
method\'s configuration only work to the extent of the method\'s and
provider\'s capabilities. For example, adding `countries
<payment_providers/currencies_countries>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
for a payment method only supported in one country or enabling
`tokenization <payment_providers/tokenization>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for a method linked to a provider that does not support it
will not produce the intended results.
::::

## Tokenization {#payment_providers/tokenization}

`If the payment provider supports this feature <payment_providers/online_providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, customers can save their payment method details for later.
To enable this feature, go to the `Configuration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab of the selected payment provider and enable
`Allow Saving
Payment Methods`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

In this case, a **payment token** is created in Odoo to be used as a
payment method for subsequent payments without the customer having to
enter their payment method details again. This is particularly useful
for the eCommerce conversion rate and subscriptions that use recurring
payments.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To add or delete their saved payment method details, customers can click
`Manage
payment methods`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`customer portal <users-portal-payment-methods>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.
::::

::: admonition
PCI DSS and Attestation of Compliance

Odoo is not [PCI](https://www.pcisecuritystandards.org) DSS-certified
because it does not store cardholder data or process payments. Instead,
it outsources tokenization and payment to
`external payment providers <payment_providers/online_providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, which means that as an Odoo customer, you only need to
complete the minimal Self-Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ) with the
provider to obtain the Attestation of Compliance (AoC) and achieve PCI
compliance. Odoo should not be mentioned as a payment processor or a
third-party service provider in the
`SAQ (Self-Assessment Questionnaire)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
:::

## Manual capture {#payment_providers/manual_capture}

`If the payment provider supports this feature <payment_providers/online_providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, you can authorize and capture payments in two steps instead
of one. To enable this feature, go to the
`Configuration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of the selected
payment provider and enable `Capture Amount
Manually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

When you authorize a payment, the funds are reserved on the customer\'s
payment method but not immediately charged. They are charged when you
manually capture the payment later on. You can also void the
authorization to cancel it and release the reserved funds. Capturing
payments manually is helpful in many situations:

- Receive the payment confirmation and wait until the order is shipped
  to capture the payment.
- Review and verify that orders are legitimate before the payment is
  completed and the fulfillment process starts.
- Avoid potentially high refund fees for refunded payments: payment
  providers will not charge you for voiding an authorization.
- Hold a security deposit to return later, minus any deductions (e.g.,
  in case of damages).

To capture the payment after it was authorized, go to the related sales
order or invoice and click the `Capture Transaction`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button. To release the funds, click the `Void
Transaction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Some payment providers support capturing only part of the authorized
amount. The remaining amount can then be either captured or voided.
These providers have the value **Full and partial** in the
`table above <payment_providers/online_providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. The providers that only support capturing or voiding the
total amount have the value **Full only**. - The funds are likely not
reserved forever. After a certain time, they may be automatically
released back to the customer\'s payment method. Refer to your payment
provider\'s documentation for the exact reservation duration. -
`payment_providers/adyen`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} and
`payment_providers/stripe`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} allow to
capture payments manually directly from their website interface.
::::

## Refunds {#payment_providers/refunds}

If your payment provider supports this feature, you can refund payments
directly from Odoo. It does not need to be enabled first. To refund a
customer payment, navigate to it and click the
`Refund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- Some payment providers support refunding only part of the amount. The
remaining amount can then optionally be refunded, too. These providers
have the value **Full and partial** in the
`table above <payment_providers/online_providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. The providers that only support refunding the total amount
have the value **Full only**. -
`payment_providers/adyen`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} and
`payment_providers/stripe`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} allow to refund
payments directly from their website interface.
::::

## Express checkout {#payment_providers/express_checkout}

`If the payment provider supports this feature <payment_providers/online_providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, you can allow customers to use the
`Google Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Apple Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} buttons and pay their
eCommerce orders in one click. When they use one of these buttons,
customers go straight from the cart to the confirmation page without
filling out the contact form. They just have to validate the payment on
Google\'s or Apple\'s payment form.

To enable this feature, go to the `Configuration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab of the selected payment provider and enable
`Allow Express Checkout`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

All prices shown on the express checkout payment form always include
taxes.
::::

## Availability {#payment_providers/availability}

You can adapt the payment provider\'s availability by specifying the
`Maximum amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} allowed and
modifying the `Currencies`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Countries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Configuration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To display an availability report for payment providers and payment
methods, and to help diagnose potential availability issues on the
payment form, enable the `developer-mode`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
then click the `fa-bug`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
(`bug`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) icon next to the
`Choose a payment method`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} heading on
the payment form. The report includes a list of enabled payment
providers and payment methods, reasons for any payment providers or
methods not being available, if applicable, and a list of supported
providers for each payment method.
::::

### Currencies and countries {#payment_providers/currencies_countries}

All payment providers have a different list of available currencies and
countries. They serve as a first filter during payment operations, i.e.,
the payment methods linked to the payment provider are not available for
selection if the customer\'s currency or country is not in the supported
list. As there might be errors, updates, and unknowns in the lists of
available currencies and countries, adding or removing a payment
provider\'s supported currencies or countries is possible.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

- `Payment methods <payment_providers/payment_methods>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} also have their own list of available currencies and
  countries that serves as another filter during payment operations.
- If the list of supported currencies or countries is empty, it means
  the list is too long to be displayed, or Odoo does not have
  information on that payment provider. The payment provider remains
  available, even though it is possible the payment will be refused at a
  later stage should the country or currency not be supported.
::::

### Maximum amount {#payment_providers/maximum_amount}

You can restrict the `Maximum Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
that can be paid with the selected provider. Leave the field to
[0.00]{.title-ref} to make the payment provider available regardless of
the payment amount.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

This feature is not intended to work on pages that allow the customer to
update the payment amount, e.g., the **Donation** snippet and the
**Checkout** page when paid `shipping methods
<../websites/ecommerce/shipping>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} are
enabled.
::::

## Payment journal {#payment_providers/journal}

A `payment journal <accounting/bank>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} must
be defined for the payment provider to record the payments on an
**outstanding account**. By default, the `Bank`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} journal is added as the payment journal for all payment
providers. To modify it, go to the `Configuration`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab of the selected payment provider and select another
`Payment journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

\- The payment journal must be a `Bank`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} journal. - The same journal can be used for several
payment providers. - Payment journals must only be configured if the
`Invoicing or Accounting app <accounting>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
is installed.
::::

### Accounting perspective

From an accounting perspective, there are two types of online payment
workflows: the payments that are directly deposited into your bank
account and follow the usual `reconciliation
<accounting/bank/reconciliation>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
workflow, and those coming from third-party `online payment
providers <payment_providers/online_providers>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and require you to follow another accounting workflow. For
these payments, you need to consider how you want to record your
payments\' journal entries. We recommend you ask your accountant for
advice.

By default, the `Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
defined for the `payment journal
<payment_providers/journal>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} is used, but
you can also specify an `outstanding account
<accounting/journals/outstanding-accounts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for each payment provider to separate the provider\'s
payments from other payments.

![Define an outstanding account for a payment provider.](payment_providers/bank_journal.png)

::: seealso
\- `payment_providers/adyen`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/authorize`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/asiapay`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/buckaroo`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/demo`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/dpo`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/mercado_pago`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/mollie`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/nuvei`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/paymob`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/paypal`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/razorpay`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/redsys`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/stripe`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/worldline`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/xendit`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/bank_payments`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`payment_providers/inperson_payments`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`accounting/bank`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::




--- SOURCE: hr/appraisals/360.md ---

# 360 Feedback

Odoo\'s **Appraisals** app lets managers gather feedback on their direct
reports from anyone in the company. Input from colleagues gives managers
a fuller view of each employee\'s strengths, growth areas, and
collaboration skills.

## 360 feedback dashboard {#appraisals/360-dashboard}

The `360 Feedback`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section displays
information for all the surveys configured for the **Appraisals** app.
To view the surveys and their statistics, navigate to `Appraisals
app --> Configuration --> 360 Feedback`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![A list view of all available surveys in the Appraisals application.](360/survey-list.png)

Each appraisal, or survey, is presented on its own line on the
`360 Feedback`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dashboard, along with
various information related to that particular appraisal.

Each appraisal includes the following information:

- `Survey Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the name of the
  specific survey.
- `Responsible`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the employee
  responsible for the survey, including the month and year they were
  given that designation.
- `Questions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the number of
  questions in that particular survey.
- `Average Duration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the average
  time a user spends completing the survey.
- `Registered`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the number of people
  who have been sent the survey.
- `Completed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the number of people
  who have completed the survey.
- `Certified`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: if the survey is for a
  certification, the percentage of users who have passed the
  certification.

Each appraisal row offers two actions:

- `Test`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Opens the appraisal in a
  new tab to preview the questions without submitting answers. Close the
  tab to return to the list, or click `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text
  role="icon"} `Go to
  Survey`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}/`Go to Appraisal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  for the full form.
- `See Results`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  `View response analytics <appraisals/360-view-results>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.

## Request feedback {#appraisals/360-request-feedback}

To request feedback from a colleague, navigate to the **Appraisals**
app, and click on the appraisal card to open it.

Click the `Ask Feedback`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and
an `Ask Feedback`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} email pop-up window
appears, using the `Appraisal: Ask Feedback`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} email template.

First, using the drop-down menu, select the employees being asked to
provide feedback in the `Recipients`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field. Multiple employees may be selected. Next, make any desired
changes to the default message, and attach any relevant documents.

The `Answer Deadline`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} date is
automatically set to the day after the `Appraisal
Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the appraisal form. Using
the calendar selector, modify the date, if desired.

Click `Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the feedback
requests are sent to the specified employees.

![The email pop-up when requesting feedback from other employees.](360/ask-feedback.png)

## View results {#appraisals/360-view-results}

To view the results from everyone who has completed a survey, click the
`See Results`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button at the end of
the corresponding survey line in the `360 Feedback dashboard
<appraisals/360-dashboard>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. This presents
all the answers for the survey in a new tab. Each question provides
information on how many people responded to a question, and how many
people skipped it. All answers for each question are visible.

To save a PDF version of the survey results, click the
`fa-print`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `(Print)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon at the top of the page. To exit, close the tab.

In addition to viewing the responses from past appraisals and surveys,
new surveys can also be created from the
`360 Feedback`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} page. Click the
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the top-left of the
page to create a new survey.

For more information on how to create a survey, refer to the
`../../marketing/surveys/create`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} document.




--- SOURCE: hr/appraisals/appraisal_analysis.md ---

# Appraisal analysis

The **Appraisals** app has the ability to report on all the appraisals
in the system, including past, present, and future appraisals, and their
respective statuses. This report helps managers track scheduled
appraisals, and identify any overdue or unconfirmed ones.

To access the *Appraisal Analysis* report, navigate to
`Appraisals app --> Reporting
--> Appraisal Analysis`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

On the `Appraisal Analysis`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} page, a
report loads, displaying all the appraisals in the database, in a
default graph chart. Appraisals are grouped by `Month`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, then `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

## View by status

Another way to view the *Appraisal Analysis* report is in the Gantt
view, which provides visual information on the appraisal\'s status.

Navigate to
`Appraisals app --> Reporting --> Appraisal Analysis`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and click the `fa-tasks`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(Gantt)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon in the
upper-right corner. The report displays the current year, grouped by
department, with the current month highlighted.

Each entry is highlighted in a different color to represent their
status:

  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Color     Status                               Meaning
  --------- ------------------------------------ --------------------------------------
  Yellow    `Done`{.interpreted-text             The appraisal was completed.
            role="guilabel"}                     

  Orange    `Appraisal Sent`{.interpreted-text   The appraisal was confirmed, but not
            role="guilabel"}                     completed.

  Red       `Cancelled`{.interpreted-text        The appraisal was cancelled.
            role="guilabel"}                     

  Gray      `To Start`{.interpreted-text         The appraisal was scheduled, but not
            role="guilabel"}                     confirmed.
  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Appraisals are scheduled automatically (appear in gray), according to
their respective `appraisals/appraisal-plan`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.
::::

To change the period of time that is presented, adjust the date settings
in the top-left corner of the report by clicking the
`fa-calendar`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`From: (date) to (date)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to reveal a
drop-down menu of options. The options to display are
`Today`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`This week`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`This month`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`This quarter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`This year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Additionally, a range of dates can be entered in the
`From`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and `To`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} fields at the bottom of the list, then click
`Apply`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

At any point, click the `fa-crosshairs`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(Focus Today)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to have the
report include today\'s date in the view.

To view the details of any appraisal, click on any appraisal. A pop-over
window appears, displaying the due date for the appraisal. To view more
details, click the `View`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and
further details appear in an `Open`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
pop-up window.

The report can have other `filters <search/filters>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and `groupings <search/group>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
set in the search bar at the top.

![A report showing all the appraisals for the Appraisal Analysis report.](appraisal_analysis/analysis.png)

## Group by status {#appraisals/group-status}

When a company has a large number of employees, the default
`Appraisal Analysis`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} report may
display too much information to view at one time. In this scenario,
viewing the data by status can be beneficial.

First, clear any filters or groups from the search bar. Next, click the
`fa-caret-down`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(Toggle Search Panel)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon in the
far-right of the search bar. Click `Status`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in the `oi-group`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Group By`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} column. Click away from
the drop-down menu to close it.

All the appraisals are now organized by status, in the following order:
`Cancelled`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Done`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `To Start`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Appraisal Sent`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

This view shows which appraisals need to be completed, and when, as well
as which appraisals still need to be confirmed.

![A report showing all the appraisals, grouped by status.](appraisal_analysis/by-status.png)

## Use case: view only the user\'s appraisals

When viewing the `Appraisal Analysis`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
report, it can save time to only view the appraisals the signed-in user
is responsible for, and hide the rest.

To only view this data, click the `fa-caret-down`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(Toggle Search Panel)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
icon in the far-right of the search bar, revealing a drop-down menu.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

It is not necessary to remove the default `oi-group`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} grouping.
If it remains active, the results are grouped by department. If it is
removed, the results appear in a list, alphabetically.
::::

Click `Add Custom Filter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} at the
bottom of the `fa-filter`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Filters`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} column, and a
`Add Custom Filter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up window
appears.

Click into the first field, and a pop-over appears with a variety of
options. Click the `fa-chevron-right`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(right arrow)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon after the word
`Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then scroll down and
click on `Manager`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Next, set the
middle field to `=`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`(equal)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Last, click the third
field and select the desired user from the list. When all the fields are
set, click `Add`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![A customized filter to show only the user\'s employees.](appraisal_analysis/custom.png)

Now, the only appraisals that appear are the appraisals that the
selected user is responsible for, instead of viewing *all* the
appraisals.

This report can also be
`grouped by status <appraisals/group-status>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

![A report showing only the appraisals the user is responsible for, by status.](appraisal_analysis/users-appraisals.png)

::: seealso
\-
`Odoo essentials reporting <../../essentials/reporting>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} - `../../essentials/search`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

# Appraisal templates

The **Appraisals** app uses a preconfigured default template, which is
general enough to be applicable to all employees. If desired, the
default template `can be modified
<appraisals/modify-template>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, or, if
different templates are needed, such as department-specific appraisal
templates, new templates
`can be created <appraisals/create-template>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

## Modify appraisal templates {#appraisals/modify-template}

If needed, changes can be made to the default template. To view the
default template, navigate to
`Appraisals app --> Configuration --> Appraisal Templates`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

The default template appears in a list view, named
`Default Template`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Click on the
template to view the template details. Make any desired changes to the
