The possible options are:

- `Kiosk`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the employee physically
  checked in or out using a `kiosk <kiosks>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"} device. The employee was present at the kiosk to check-in.
- `Systray`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the employee checked in
  or out `directly from the database
  <check_in_check_out>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}. Depending on the
  `IP Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} displayed on the
  detailed attendance record, the employee\'s location at the time of
  check-in can be determined.
- `Manual`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the record was created
  manually in the **Attendances** app. This is typically done by
  management, to add a missing record.
::::

## Create attendance records {#attendances/create-records}

When necessary, users with the required
`access rights <employees/work-info-tab>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
are able to create attendance records manually in the **Attendances**
app. Some situations requiring this is when employees forget to check in
and out for shifts, as employees cannot retroactively create attendance
records.

To add a missing attendance record, navigate to
`Attendances app --> Overview`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
Click the `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the
upper-left corner. In the `Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
pop-up window, enter the following information on the form:

- `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the employee the
  record is being created for. The signed-in user populates this field,
  by default.
- `Check In`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the calendar
  modal, select the check in date and time, then click
  `fa-check`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Apply`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}. By default, the current date is selected, and the
  time is set to [00:00:00]{.title-ref}.
- `Check Out`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the calendar
  modal, select the check out date and time, then click
  `fa-check`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Apply`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}. By default, the following date is selected, and the
  time is set to [00:00:00]{.title-ref}.
- `Worked Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this field is
  automatically populated with the difference from the selected
  `Check In`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `Check Out`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} times. This field
  **cannot** be modified.
- `Extra Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the number of
  overtime hours, if any, to be approved.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Once `Extra Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are added, they
are automatically approved by the system. However, it is possible to
manually refuse them, as explained in the `Approvals and Refusals
<attendances/approve-refuse>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} section.
::::

![An Attendances app record form, filled out for Doris Cole for April 23, 2025.](management/new-record.png)




--- SOURCE: hr/attendances.md ---

show-content

:   

# Attendances

Odoo\'s **Attendances** application functions as a time clock. Employees
are able to check in and out of work using a
`dedicated device in kiosk mode <attendances/kiosk-mode-entry>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, while users are also able to check in and out of work
`directly from the database <attendances/check-in>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. Managers can see who is available at any given time, create
reports to see everyone\'s hours, and gain insights on which employees
are working overtime or checking out of work earlier than expected.

## Access rights {#attendances/access-rights}

Understanding access rights is essential to navigating the
**Attendances** application.

Every user in the database is able to check in and out directly from the
database, without needing access to the **Attendances** app.
Additionally, all users can access their own attendance records from
their employee form in the **Employees** app.

Access to both the **Attendances** application and the various features
within the application is determined by access rights.

To see what access rights a user has, navigate to the
`Settings app --> Users &
Companies --> Users`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, and click
on an individual user. The `Access Rights`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab is visible by default. Scroll down to the *Human
Resources* section to view the settings. For the
`Attendances`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, the following
options appear:

- `No`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The user does **not** have
  access to the **Attendances** application, and is **not** able to open
  the app, even though it appears on the main database dashboard. An
  *Access Error* pop-up message appears when the application is clicked.
  The user can only check in and out of the database either through an
  `attendance kiosk <attendances/kiosk-mode-entry>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} or the
  `attendance icon <attendances/check_in_check_out>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"} in the top-right corner of the Odoo database, which is
  visible at all times, in every application).
- `Officer: Manage all attendances`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  The user has full access to all employee attendance records, including
  the ability to modify and create records, but does **not** have access
  to the configuration menu and settings.
- `Administrator`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The user has full
  access to the entire **Attendances** application, with no
  restrictions. They can view all employee attendance records, enter
  `kiosk mode
  <attendances/enable-kiosk-mode>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} from
  the application, access all `reporting
  <attendances/attendance_reporting>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
  metrics, and make modifications to the settings.

### Approvers {#attendances/approvers}

An approver is a user assigned to review and manage an employee\'s
attendance records. An approver is typically a manager, though that is
not required. Approvers without administrative rights can access and
modify attendance records **only** for the employees they are assigned
to. This is the only exception where non-admin users can view records in
the **Attendances** app.

To view the attendance approver for an employee, navigate to the
`Employees`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} application and
click on the specific employee. Click on the
`Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, scroll to the
*Approvers* section, and check the `Attendance`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field. The person selected is able to view that
employee\'s attendance records, both on the **Attendances** application
dashboard as well as in the attendance reports, and make modifications
to their records.

## Configuration

Few configurations are needed in the **Attendances** app. Determining
how employees check in and out, defining how the kiosks function, and
determining how extra hours are computed are all configured in the
settings menu. Navigate to the `Attendances app --> Configuration
--> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} to access the
settings menu.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Any configuration item with a `fa-building-o`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(building)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon is a
company-specific configuration. Items without a
`fa-building-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(building)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon apply to all
companies within the database.
::::

### Modes {#attendances/modes}

This section specifies how employees log in and out, and how absences
are handled.

- `Attendances from Backend`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  `fa-building-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}: Activate this feature
  to allow users to check in and out directly from the Odoo database. If
  this is not activated, users must use a kiosk to check in and out of
  work.

- `Automatic Check-Out`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  `fa-building-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}: Activate this feature
  to automatically check out employees according to their working
  schedule, after a buffer of time has passed. When enabled, a
  `Tolerance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field appears below
  this option. Enter the amount of time, in hours, that must elapse
  after an employee\'s working hours have ended, before they are
  automatically checked out.

  ::: example
  With the `Automatic Check-Out`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  option enabled, and the `Tolerance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  set to [2.00]{.title-ref} hours, an employee checks in to work at 9:00
  AM and forgets to check out at 5:00 PM. At 7:00 PM, they are
  automatically checked out.
  :::

- `Absence Management`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  `fa-building-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}: Activate this feature
  to log any absences that are not associated with a time off request,
  such as vacation time or sick time, on the
  `attendance report <attendances/attendance_reporting>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}. This does **not** apply for employees with a flexible
  working schedule.

### Extra Hours

This section specifies how extra time (sometimes referred to as
*overtime*) is calculated, including when extra time is counted and what
time is not logged.

- `Tolerance Time In Favor Of Company`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}: Enter the amount of time, in minutes, that is
  **not** counted towards an employee\'s overtime. When an employee
  checks out, and the extra time logged is below the specified minutes,
  the extra time is **not** counted as overtime for the employee. When
  an employee checks out, and the extra time logged is more than the
  specified minutes, the extra time **is** counted as overtime for the
  employee.

  ::: example
  A company sets the
  `Tolerance Time In Favor Of Company`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} to [15]{.title-ref} minutes, and the working hours
  for the entire company are set from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

  An employee checks in at 9:00 AM. If the employee checks out at 5:14
  PM, the extra 14 minutes are **not** counted towards their overtime.
  If the employee checks out at 5:17 PM, they earn 17 minutes of
  overtime.
  :::

- `Tolerance Time In Favor Of Employee`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}: Enter the amount of time, in minutes, that an
  employee is given, which does **not** adversely affect their
  attendance if they log less time than their working hours. When an
  employee checks out, and the total time logged for the day is less
  than their specified working hours and less than this specified grace
  period, they are **not** penalized for their reduced hours. When an
  employee checks out, and the total time logged for the day is less
  than their specified working hours and more than this specified grace
  period, they **are** penalized for their reduced hours.

  ::: example
  A company sets the
  `Tolerance Time In Favor Of Employee`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} fields to [15]{.title-ref} minutes, and the working
  hours for the entire company are set from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

  An employee checks in at 9:05 AM. If the employee checks out at 4:55
  PM, even though they logged a total of 10 minutes less than their full
  working hours, they are **not** penalized for this discrepancy, and
  they are logged as working a full eight-hour day. If the employee
  checks out at 4:40 PM, they **are** penalized, and they are logged as
  only working 7 hours and 35 minutes.
  :::

- `Extra Hours Validation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  `fa-building-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}: Click on either the
  radio button next to `Automatically Approved`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} to have all extra time automatically approved, or
  `Approved by Manager`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if all extra
  time should be reviewed and approved by a manager.

- `Display Extra Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Activate
  this box to display the extra hours logged by an employee when they
  check out with a kiosk, or when a user checks out in the database.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Approved extra hours can be `deducted from an approved time off request
<time_off/deduct-extra-hours>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

::: seealso
\- `attendances/check_in_check_out`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`attendances/kiosks`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`attendances/management`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`attendances/attendance_logs`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`attendances/hardware`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`attendances/attendance_reporting`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

::: {.toctree titlesonly=""}
attendances/check_in_check_out attendances/kiosks attendances/management
attendances/attendance_logs attendances/hardware
attendances/attendance_reporting
:::




--- SOURCE: hr/employees/badges.md ---

# Badges

In Odoo, employees can earn badges, either automatically through
`challenges created in the CRM
app <../../sales/crm/optimize/gamification>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, through **eLearning** courses, or manually, as managers
decide to award them.

Badges are a way to gamify the work day, can be created for any reason,
and can be granted to any user.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Badges can **only** be awarded to
`users of the database <../../general/users>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, *and* if the **eLearning** app is installed.
::::

## View available badges

To view the available badges that are configured by default, navigate to
`Employees
app --> Configuration --> Badges`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

All badges appear in a default Kanban view, with the badge\'s
`Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and image displayed.
Additionally, the number of users awarded the badge for both the current
month, and in total, appears, along with the badge description, and the
avatar for each user who received the badge.

Each badge has a `Grant`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to
`award the badge <employees/grant_badge>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
from the `Badges`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dashboard.

![All the available badges, on the Badges dashboard.](badges/badges.png)

## Create badges

Badges can be created in the database when the default badges are not
sufficient. This can be done from the `Badges`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} dashboard in the **Employees** app, or from the **CRM**
app.

To add a badge in the **Employees** app, first navigate to
`Employees app -->
Configuration --> Badges`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, then
click the `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the
upper-left corner.

Fill out the badge form as outlined in the
`CRM documentation <crm/create-rewards>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

::: seealso
`CRM Gamification <crm/create-rewards>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
:::

## View employee badges

To view badges awarded to an employee, open the **Employees** app, and
click on an employee record. Click on the
`Received Badges`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab to view any
awarded badges.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If this tab is not visible, it means there is no
`Related User`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Once a user is
populated in the `Related User`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field, the `Badges`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab appears.
::::

## Grant badges {#employees/grant_badge}

To grant a badge to an employee, open the employee record, and click
into the `Received
Badges`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Click the
`Grant a Badge`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to load a
`Reward Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up window.

Using the drop-down menu, select the badge being awarded in the
`What are you thankful
for?`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. The default options are
`Good Job`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Problem Solver`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Brilliant`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Additional options appear (e.g., `Get Started`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Power user`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`community Hero`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) which are
associated with challenges. These are automatically granted through
completed challenges. While these can be awarded at any time, it is
advised to grant badges manually that are *not* associated with a
challenge.
::::

Next, enter a brief summary of why the badge is being granted in the
field displaying
`Describe what they did and why it matters (will be public)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field. Last, click the
`Reward Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and the
badge is awarded, and is visible in the `Badges`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Users cannot grant themselves badges. An error message appears if
attempted.
::::

![The \'Reward Employee\' field populated.](badges/badge.png)




--- SOURCE: hr/employees/certifications.md ---

# Certifications

When jobs require specific knowledge, it is necessary to track employee
certifications to ensure the necessary knowledge and certifications are
in place.

When jobs require specific knowledge, track employee certifications
(e.g., classes, tests, seminars) to verify required skills. Odoo accepts
any certification type without restriction.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

To add certifications to an employee profile, and to access the
*Employee Certifications* report, the **Surveys** app **must** be
installed.
::::

## View certifications

To view a full list of all employee certifications, navigate to
`Employees app -->
Reporting --> Certifications`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

All certifications appear in a list view, grouped by employee. Each
certification entry displays the following:

- `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the employee\'s name,
  along with their avatar image.
- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the title of the
  certification.
- `Validity Start`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: when the employee
  received the certification.
- `Validity End`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: when the
  certification expires.
- `Certification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the corresponding
  course in the **Surveys** app that was completed by the employee, if
  applicable.

The entries are also color-coded. Current certifications that are still
valid appear in black, expired certifications appear in red, and
certifications that are going to expire within the next 90 days appear
in orange.

![The list of employee certifications.](certifications/certifications.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

**Only** certification records with the *Display Type* set to
*Certification* on their
`certification form <employees/certifications-form>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} appear on the `Employee
Certifications`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} report. All other
certifications appear in the resume section of the
`employee form <employees/resume>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

### View certifications by expiration status

When managing a large number of employees with a variety of
certifications, it can be difficult to determine which employees need to
keep necessary certifications current in the default list view. In this
scenario, it is beneficial to view the certifications by expiration
status.

To do so, navigate to
`Employees app --> Reporting --> Certifications`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Next, click the `fa-caret-down`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(Toggle Search Panel)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
icon in the search bar, then click `Add Custom Group`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} `fa-caret-down`{.interpreted-text role="icon"},
revealing a drop-down menu. Click `Expiration Status`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, then click away from the drop-down menu to close it.

After doing so, all the certifications are organized by status, starting
with `Expired`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} certifications, then
certifications that are `Expiring`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
soon (within the next 90 days), and lastly, certifications that are
still `Valid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Filter certifications by expiration status to identify certifications
expiring soon, and identify employees who must renew.

![The list of employee certifications, grouped by status.](certifications/status.png)

## Log a certification {#employees/certifications-form}

To log a certification for an employee, navigate to
`Employees app --> Learning -->
Certifications`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Click
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and a blank certification form
loads. Enter the following information on the form:

- `Title`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a short description
  for the certification in this field.

- `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down
  menu, select the employee who received the certification.

- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down menu,
  select the type of certification received. This field determines where
  on the employee\'s resume the certification appears. To create a new
  `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, enter the type in the
  field, then click `Create [type]`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

  The default options are:

  - `Experience`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select this option
    to have the certification appear in the *Experience* section of the
    *Resume* tab on the `employee form <new_employee>`{.interpreted-text
    role="doc"}. Experience entries are typically previous jobs or
    internships.
  - `Education`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select this option
    to have the certification appear in the *Education* section of the
    *Resume* tab on the `employee form <new_employee>`{.interpreted-text
    role="doc"}.
  - `Social Media`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select this
    option to have the certification appear in the *Social Media*
    section of the *Resume* tab on the
    `employee form <new_employee>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}. Social
    Media entries typically relate to certifications relating to digital
    marketing, social media management, and specific trainings from
    social media platforms.
  - `Internal Certification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
    this option to have the certification appear in the *Internal
    Certification* section of the *Resume* tab on the
    `employee form <new_employee>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.
    Internal certifications entries are tied to courses, training, or
    programs created by the company, that once completed, have a
    certification associated with it.
  - `Completed Internal Training`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    Select this option to have the certification appear in the
    *Completed Internal Training* section of the *Resume* tab on the
    `employee form
    <new_employee>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}. Completed internal
    training entries are typically associated with trainings created by
    the company, for company-specific processes. These do not result in
    any certifications, but are logged on the employee profile to
    indicate completed training.

- `Display Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  visibility of the certification in this field. The default options
  are:

  - `Classic`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select this option to
    have the certification appear in the *Resume* section of the
    employee form, and **not** appear on the *Employee Certifications*
    report.
  - `Certification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select this
    option to have the certification appear in the *Resume* section of
    the employee form, **and** appear on the *Employee Certifications*
    report. Once this is selected, a `Certification`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} field appears beneath the
    `Display Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. Using the
    drop-down menu, select the corresponding **Surveys** app
    certification the employee took. This field **only** appears if the
    **Surveys** app is installed.
  - `Course`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select this option to
    have the certification appear in the *Resume* section of the
    employee form, and **not** appear on the *Employee Certifications*
    report. Once this option is selected, a `Course`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} field appears beneath the
    `Display Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. Using the
    drop-down menu, select the corresponding **eLearning** course the
    employee took. This field **only** appears if the **eLearning** app
    is installed.

- `Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a description
  for the certification in this field.

- `Duration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Click into the first
  field, and a calendar pop-over window appears. Click on the start and
  end dates for the certification validity period. When the correct
  dates are selected, click `fa-check`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `Apply`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and both fields are
  populated.

![A certification form filled out for an OSHA certificate for construction.](certifications/cybersecurity.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Once a certification is logged for an employee, a new certification of
the *same type* (i.e. `Education`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Internal Certification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) can be
added directly from the employee form, instead of the
`Employee Certifications`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dashboard.

In the main **Employees** app dashboard, click on an employee profile to
open their employee form. In the `RESUME`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, click the `ADD`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button at the end of the corresponding certification line.

This `ADD`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button **only** appears on
employee profiles that already have a certification.
::::




--- SOURCE: hr/employees/departments.md ---

# Departments

All employees in the **Employees** app fall under specific departments
within a company.

## Create new departments {#employee/create-departments}

To make a new department, navigate to
`Employees app --> Departments`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"},
then click the `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the
top-left corner to reveal a blank department form. Fill out the
following information on the department form:

- `Department Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter a name for
  the department.
- `Manager`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down
  menu, select the department manager.
- `Parent Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: if the new
  department is housed within another department (has a parent
  department), select the parent department using the drop-down menu.
- `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down
  menu, select the company the department is part of. This field only
  appears in a multi-company database.
- `Color`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select a color for the
  department. Click the colored box to display all the color options.
  Click on a color to select it.
- `Appraisal Templates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the
  drop-down menu, select the appraisal form to be used for all employee
  appraisals within this department. If a new appraisal is desired,
  enter the name for the appraisal, then click
  `Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to modify the
  new appraisal form. This field **only** appears if the **Appraisals**
  app is installed.
- `Appraisal Survey`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the
  drop-down menu, select the default survey to use for the department
  when requesting feedback from employees within the department. The
  default options are `Employee Opinion Form`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `360 Feedback`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  and `Employee Appraisal Form`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This
  field **only** appears if the **Appraisals** app is installed, *and*
  the *360 Feedback* option is enabled in the settings.

After the form is completed, click the
`fa-cloud-upload`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(cloud upload)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon to manually
save the changes. When saved, a
`DEPARTMENT ORGANIZATION`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} chart
appears in the top-right of the department card, illustrating where the
department lies in the organization.

![The department for with all fields filled out.](departments/department-form.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The form auto-saves while data is entered, however the
`Department Organization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} chart does
**not** appear until the form is manually saved. If the form is not
saved, the `Department Organization`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
chart is visible upon opening the department card from the
`Departments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dashboard.
::::

::: seealso
`../appraisals`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

## Departments dashboard

To view the currently configured departments, navigate to
`Employees app -->
Departments`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. All departments
appear in a Kanban view, and are listed in alphabetical order.

The default view for the `Departments`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} dashboard is a `Kanban view
<employees/department-kanban>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. It is
possible to view the departments in two other forms: a
`list view <employees/department-list>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
and a `hierarchy view
<employees/department-hierarchy>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

![The departments dashboard view with all the department cards in a Kanban view.](departments/departments.png)

### Kanban view {#employees/department-kanban}

Each department has its own Kanban card on the main
`Departments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dashboard. Each
department card displays the following information, if available:

- `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the name of the department.
- `Manager`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the name and image of
  the department manager.
- `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the company the
  department is part of, including the location icon.
- `Employees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the number of
  employees within the department.
- `Appraisals`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the number of
  appraisals scheduled for employees in the department.
- `Time Off Requests`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the number of
  unapproved time off requests for employees in the department
  `awaiting approval <time_off/manage-time-off>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} . This **only** appears if there are requests to approve.
- `Allocation Requests`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the number
  of unapproved allocation requests for employees in the department
  `awaiting approval <time_off/manage-allocations>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}. This **only** appears if there are requests to approve.
- `New Applicants`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the number of
  `new applicants <recruitment/new>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} for a
  position within the department. This **only** appears if there are new
  applicants.
- `Expense Reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the number of
  employees in the department with `open expense
  reports to approve <../../finance/expenses/approve_expenses>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}. This **only** appears if there are any expense reports
  waiting for approval.
- `Absence`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the number of employees
  with approved time off for the current day.
- Color bar: the selected color for the department appears as a vertical
  bar on the left side of the department card.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Click on an alert in a department card, such as
`Time Off Requests`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, to reveal a list
view of the requests to approve for that department
::::

### List view {#employees/department-list}

To view the departments in a list view, click the
`fa-align-justify`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(list)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon in the top-right
corner. The departments appear in a list view, which displays the
`Department Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Manager`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Employees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Parent Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Color`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for each department.

The departments are sorted alphabetically by
`Department Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, by default.

![The departments presented in a list view.](departments/list.png)

### Hierarchy view {#employees/department-hierarchy}

To view the departments in a hierarchy view, click the
`fa-share-alt fa-rotate-90`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(Hierarchy)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon in the top-right
corner. The departments appear in an organizational chart format, with
the highest-level department at the top (typically [Executive
Management]{.title-ref}), and all other departments beneath it. All
child departments of the first-level child departments are folded.

Each department card displays the `Department Name`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, the `Manager`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (and
their profile image), the `Number of Employees`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in the department, and the number of any child
departments.

Click the `Unfold`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button on a
department card to expand it. Once expanded, the
`Unfold`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button changes to a
`Fold`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. To collapse the
department, click the `Fold`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.
Only **one** department *per row* can be unfolded at a time.

Click anywhere on a department card to open the department form. Click
the `(#) Employees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button to
view a list of all the employees in that department.

![The departments presented in a hierarchy view.](departments/hierarchy.png)




--- SOURCE: hr/employees/equipment.md ---

# Equipment

Many employees are given various items to use while they work, such as
laptops, phones, and printers. Most companies track their equipment, to
see who is using what, as well as having a record of important
information regarding the equipment, such as serial numbers, warranty
information, and maintenance history.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To track employee equipment, the **Maintenance** app *must* be
installed.
::::

## Individual employee equipment {#employees/equipment}

Employee equipment is tracked on the employee record. To view all
equipment currently assigned to an employee, navigate to the
`Employees`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} app, and click on
the desired employee record.

At the top of the record, an `fa-cubes`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Equipment Count`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button
appears, with a number indicating how many, if any, items are currently
assigned to that employee.

Click the `fa-cubes`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Equipment Count`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button, and
all equipment currently assigned to the employee appears in individual
Kanban cards.

Each Kanban card displays the equipment\'s name and model on the first
line, followed by the serial number (if available), and lastly, the
employee\'s name. Any current maintenance requests appear at the bottom
of the card in a red box.

![A Kanban view of all equipment for an employee.](equipment/equipment.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

A serial number is **not** required when logging equipment.
::::

## All employee equipment

To view all equipment for all employees, start on the
`equipment record of an individual
employee <employees/equipment>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

It does not matter what employee is selected, or whether they have any
equipment assigned to them. This step is only used to get to the
`Equipment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} list.
::::

In the Kanban view of the employee\'s equipment, clear the default
`Assigned Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} filter in the
search bar. This presents *all* equipment in the database, including
those assigned to individual employees and whole departments.

Click into the search bar, and select `Employee`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in the `oi-group`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Group
By`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} column. The equipment is now
organized in a Kanban view, by employee.

In the Kanban view displaying all employee equipment records, equipment
can be reassigned by clicking and dragging an equipment card to the
desired employee. This changes ownership of the equipment.

![A Kanban view of all equipment for all employees.](equipment/all-equipment.png)

## Add equipment to an employee record

To add equipment to an employee\'s record, open the
`Employees`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} app, click on the
desired employee record, then click the `fa-cubes`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `Equipment Count`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart
button at the top.

All equipment currently assigned to the employee appears in individual
Kanban cards. To add a new equipment record, click the
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the upper-left
corner, and a blank `Equipment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form
loads.

`Fill out the equipment form <../../inventory_and_mrp/maintenance/add_new_equipment>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} for the employee\'s equipment.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Instead of filling out a new `Equipment`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} form for the same item, a form can be duplicated, then
updated.

On the `Equipment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form, click the
`fa-gear`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `(Actions)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon in the upper-left corner, then select
`fa-clone`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Duplicate`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

An identical form appears, with *all* the information filled out, except
for the `Serial Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Enter the `Serial Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the
form, and make any other necessary changes, such as the assigned
`Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![A duplicate equipment form with all the information filled out except the serial number.](equipment/equipment-form.png)
::::




--- SOURCE: hr/employees/new_employee.md ---

# New employees

When a new employee is hired, the first step is to create a new employee
record. This record is a centralized place where all important
information about the employee is stored, including
`general information <employees/general-info>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `job history and skills
<employees/resume>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
`various work information <employees/work-info-tab>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, `personal
details <employees/private-info>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
`payroll-related information <employees/payroll>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, and various
`settings <employees/hr-settings>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} that
affect integrations with other apps in the database.

To begin, open the `Employees`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}
app, then click the `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in
the upper-left corner. Doing so reveals a blank employee form.

Proceed to fill out the required information, along with any additional
details.

![Create a new employee form with all fields filled out.](new_employee/new-employee-form.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The current company phone number and name are populated in the
`Work Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields. If the
**Appraisals** application is installed, the `Next
Appraisal Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is populated
with a date six months from the current date.
::::

## General information {#employees/general-info}

Fill out the following employee details.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

The employee form automatically saves as data is entered. However, the
form can be saved manually at any time by clicking the
`fa-cloud-upload`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(Save manually)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon.
::::

- `Employee's Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  employee\'s name. This field is required.

- `Job Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this field appears
  below the employee name and can be filled in manually. Alternatively,
  select a position from the drop-down menu in the
  `Job Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field beneath the
  `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to auto-populate
  the top field. The two fields do not need to match.

  ::: example
  While it is recommended to have the job positions match, the typed-in
  description in this top field can contain more specific information
  than the selected drop-down `Job
  Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, if desired.

  For instance, if someone is hired for a sales representative position
  configured as `Sales Representative`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} in the **Recruitment** app, that can be selected in
  the drop-down `Job Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

  In the typed-in `Job Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  field beneath the `Employee's Name`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, the position can be more specific, such as [Sales
  Representative - Subscriptions]{.title-ref} if the employee is focused
  solely on subscription sales.

  ![Both job position fields entered but with different information.](new_employee/job-description-fields.png)
  :::

- `Photo`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: in the top-right image box
  of the employee form, click on the `fa-pencil`{.interpreted-text
  role="icon"} `(Edit)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon, then
  select a photo to upload.

- *Work Contact Information*: enter the employee\'s
  `Work Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Work Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Work Mobile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, information, if not
  already auto-populated.

- `Tags`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select a tag from the
  drop-down menu to add relevant tags to the employee. Any tag can be
  created in this field by typing it in. Once created, the new tag is
  available for all employee records. There is no limit to the amount of
  tags that can be added on an employee form.

- `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: from the drop-down menu
  in this field, select the company the new employee was hired by, or
  create a new company by typing the name in the field, and clicking
  `Create`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the mini
  drop-down menu that appears. This field is required.

- `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the
  employee\'s department from the drop-down menu.

- `Job Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the
  employee\'s job position from the drop-down menu. If using the
  **Recruitment** app, this list reflects configured job positions. Once
  a selection is made, the `Job Position`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} field beneath the `Employee's Name`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} field automatically updates to reflect the currently
  selected job position, but is still editable.

- `Manager`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the employee\'s
  manager from the drop-down menu.

- `Coach`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the employee\'s
  coach from the drop-down menu.

- `Next Appraisal Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this field
  is **only** visible if the **Appraisals** application is installed.
  The date automatically populates with a date that is computed
  according to the settings configured in the **Appraisals**
  application. This date can be modified using the calendar selector.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

After a `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected, the
department\'s configured manager and coach automatically populates the
respective `Manager`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Coach`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields.
::::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

To make edits to the selected `Department`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Manager`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Coach`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
`Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, click the
`oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(Internal link)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} arrow next to the
respective selection. The `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(Internal link)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} arrow
opens the selected form, allowing for modifications. Click
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} after any edits are made.
::::

## ResumÃ© tab {#employees/resume}

### ResumÃ©

Enter the employee\'s work history in the `ResumÃ©`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab. Each resumÃ© line must be entered individually.
When creating an entry for the first time, click
`Create a new entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the
`Create ResumÃ© lines`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form appears.
After an entry is added, the `Create a
new entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button is replaced with an
`ADD`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. Enter the following
information for each entry.

- `Title`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type in the title of the
  previous work experience.
- `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the employee
  from the drop-down menu.
- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: from the drop-down menu,
  select either `Experience`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Education`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Social Media`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
  `Internal Certification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To create
  a new `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, enter the name of the
  type, then click `Create "(Type)"`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Display Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: from the drop-down
  menu, choose `Classic`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for typical
  work experience, or `Certification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  for experience gained through a certification.
- `Duration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the start and end
  dates for the work experience. To select a date, click the first empty
  field to reveal a calendar pop-up window. Proceed to use the
  `oi-chevron-left`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `(left arrow)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `oi-chevron-right`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `(right
  arrow)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icons to scroll to the
  desired month, then click on the day to select it. Repeat this process
  to locate and select the end date. When the desired dates have been
  selected, click `fa-check`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `Apply`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter any relevant
  details in this field.

Once all the information is entered, click the
`Save & Close`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button if there is
only one entry to add, or click the `Save & New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button to save the current entry and create another
resumÃ© line.

![A resumÃ© entry form with all the information populated.](new_employee/resume-lines.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

After the new employee form is saved, the current position and company
is automatically added to the `ResumÃ©`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, with the end date listed as [current]{.title-ref}.
::::

### Skills {#employees/skills}

An employee\'s skills can be entered in the `ResumÃ©`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab in the same manner that a resumÃ© line is created.

In order to add a skill to an employee record, the skill types must
first be configured. By default, Odoo comes with two
`Skill Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} preconfigured:
*Languages* and *Soft Skills*.
`Configure the rest of the skill types <employees/skill-types>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} before adding any skills to the employee record.

When adding the first skill to an employee record, a
`Pick a skill from the list`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
appears in the `Skills`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section of
the `ResumÃ©`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Click the `Pick a
skill from the list`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and
select the following information for each skill.

- `Skill Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select a
  `skill type <employees/skill-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} by
  clicking the radio button next to the skill type.

- `Skill`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: after selecting a
  `Skill Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the corresponding
  skills associated with that selected `Skill Type`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} appear in a drop-down menu. For example, selecting
  `Language`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as the
  `Skill Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} presents a variety of
  languages to select from under the `Skills`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} field. Select the appropriate preconfigured skill
  from the list.

  :::: important
  ::: title
  Important
  :::

  If the desired skill does not appear in the list, it is **not**
  possible to add the new skill from this window. New skills must be
  added from the `Skill Types <employees/skill-types>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} dashboard.
  ::::

- `Skill Level`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: pre-defined skill
  levels associated with the selected `Skill
  Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} appear in a drop-down menu.
  First, select a `Skill Level`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then
  the progress bar automatically displays the pre-defined progress for
  that specific skill level. Skill levels can be created and modified
  from the `Skill Types <employees/skill-types>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} dashboard.

Click the `Save & Close`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button if
there is only one skill to add, or click the
`Save & New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to save the
current entry and immediately add another skill.

At any point, a new line can be added by clicking the
`ADD`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button next to the
corresponding section.

![A skill form with the information filled out.](new_employee/select-skills.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Only users with `Officer: Manage all employees`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} or `Administrator`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
rights for the **Employees** app can add or edit skills.
::::

#### Skill types {#employees/skill-types}

In order to add a skill to an employee\'s form, the
`Skill Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} must be configured. Go
to `Employees app --> Configuration --> Skill Types`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to view the currently configured skill types and
create new skill types.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The default skill of `Languages`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
preconfigured with twenty-one skills, and the default
`Soft Skills`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is preconfigured with
fifteen skills.
::::

Click the `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the
upper-left corner, and a new `Skill Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} form appears. Fill out the following details for the
new skill type. Repeat this for all the needed skill types.

- `Skill Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the name of the
  skill type. This acts as the parent category for more specific skills
  and should be generic.

- `SKILLS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: click
  `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and enter the
  `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the new skill, then
  repeat for all other needed skills.

- `LEVELS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: click
  `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and enter a
  `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `Progress`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} percentage
  ([0]{.title-ref}-[100]{.title-ref}) for each level.

  Set a `Default Level`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} by clicking
  the toggle on the desired line (only one level can be selected). The
  toggle turns green to indicate the default level. Typically, the
  lowest level is chosen, but any level can be selected.

- `DISPLAY`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: click the colored box
  next to the `Color`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to reveal
  a list of available colors for the skill type. Click on a color to
  select it.

  ::: example
  To add a math skill set in yellow, enter [Math]{.title-ref} in the
  `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. Then, in the
  `Skills`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, enter
  [Algebra]{.title-ref}, [Calculus]{.title-ref}, and
  [Trigonometry]{.title-ref}. Next, in the `Levels`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} field enter [Beginner]{.title-ref},
  [Intermediate]{.title-ref}, and [Expert]{.title-ref}, with the
  `Progress`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} listed as
  [25]{.title-ref}, [50]{.title-ref}, and [100]{.title-ref},
  respectively. Click `Set
  Default`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} on the
  [Beginner]{.title-ref} line to set this as the default skill level.
  Last, click the colored box next to `Color`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, and select yellow.

  ![A skill form for a Math skill type, with all the information entered.](new_employee/math-skills.png)
  :::

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Once the form is completely filled out, click the
`fa-cloud-upload`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `(Save
manually)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon at the top of the
screen, and the `Levels`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} rearrange in
descending order, with the highest level at the top, and the lowest at
the bottom, regardless of the default level and the order they were
entered.
::::

## Work information tab {#employees/work-info-tab}

The `Work Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab contains
job-related details such as the employee\'s schedule, roles, approvers
(for time off, timesheets, and expenses), remote work setup, and work
location.

Click on the `Work Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab
to access this section, and enter the following information for the new
employee, for the various sections listed below.

### LOCATION

This section is visible for all employees, and does not require any
other apps to be installed for this section to be visible.

- `Work Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the
  `Work Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the drop-down
  menu. The current company populates this field, by default. To modify
  the address, hover over the first line (if there are multiple lines)
  of the address to reveal an `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text
  role="icon"} `(Internal
  Link)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} arrow. Click the
  `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `(Internal Link)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} arrow to open up
  the company form, and make any edits.

  Use the breadcrumb links to navigate back to the new employee form
  when done.

  If a new work address is needed, add the address by typing it in the
  field, then click `Create (new address)`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} to add the address, or
  `Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to add the new
  address and edit the address form.

- `Work Location`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the
  drop-down menu, select where the `Work Address`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} is located. The default options are
  `Home`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Office`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, or `Other`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

  To add a new location, type in the location name, then click
  `Create (new location)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to add the
  location, or `Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  to add the location, assign a `Work
  Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and a
  `Cover Image`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

### APPROVERS {#employees/approvers}

To see this section, the user must have either
`Administrator`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or `Officer:
Manage all employees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} rights set for
the **Employees** application. For the category to appear, the
respective app **must** be installed. For example, if the **Time Off**
app is not installed, the `Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
approver field does not appear. Only one selection can be made for each
field.

> :::: important
> ::: title
> Important
> :::
>
> The users that appear in the drop-down menu for the
> `Approvers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section **must** have
> *Administrator* rights set for the corresponding human resources role.
>
> To check who has these rights, go to `Settings app`{.interpreted-text
> role="menuselection"} and click `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text
> role="icon"} `Manage Users`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
> `Users`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section. Then, click on an
> employee, then click into the `Access Rights`{.interpreted-text
> role="guilabel"} tab. Scroll to the
> `HUMAN RESOURCES`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and check the
> various settings.
>
> - In order for the user to appear as an approver for
>   `Expenses`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, they **must** have
>   either `Team Approver`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
>   `All Approver`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
>   `Administrator`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} set for the
>   `Expenses`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} role.
> - In order for the user to appear as an approver for
>   `Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, they **must** have
>   either `Officer:Manage all Requests`{.interpreted-text
>   role="guilabel"} or `Administrator`{.interpreted-text
>   role="guilabel"} set for the `Time Off`{.interpreted-text
>   role="guilabel"} role.
> - In order for the user to appear as an approver for
>   `Timesheets`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, they **must** have
>   either `Officer:Manage all contracts`{.interpreted-text
>   role="guilabel"} or `Administrator`{.interpreted-text
>   role="guilabel"} set for the `Payroll`{.interpreted-text
>   role="guilabel"} role.
> - In order for the user to appear as an approver for
>   `Attendances`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, they **must** have
>   `Administrator`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} set for the
>   `Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} role.
> ::::

- `Expense`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down
  menus, select the user responsible for approving all expenses for the
  employee.
- `Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down
  menus, select the user responsible for approving all time off requests
  from this employee.
- `Timesheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down
  menus, select the user responsible for approving all the employee\'s
  timesheet entries.
- `Attendance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down
  menus, select the user responsible for approving all attendance
  entries for the employee.

### REMOTE WORK

This section **only** appears if the *Remote Work* setting is enabled in
the configuration menu.

Use the drop-down menu to select the default location the employee
works, for each day of the week. The default options are
`Home`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Office`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, or `Other`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

A new location can be typed into the field, then click either
`Create (new location)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to add the
location, or `Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
add the new location and edit the form.

After edits are done, click `Save & Close`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and the new location is added, and populates the
field.

Leave the field blank (`Unspecified`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"})
for non-working days, such as Saturday and Sunday.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

It is also possible to add or modify work locations by navigating to
`Employees
app --> Configuration --> Work Locations`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. To modify a location, click on an existing
location, then make any changes on the form.

Click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to create a new location,
then enter the following information on the form. All fields are
**required**.

- `Work Location`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the name for
  the location. This can be as general or as specific, as needed, such
  as [Home]{.title-ref} or [Building 1, Second Floor]{.title-ref},
  respectfully.
- `Work Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down
  menu, select the address for the location.
- `Cover Image`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: click on the icon to
  select it for the `Cover Image`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  Options are a `fa-home`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `(home)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon, an
  `fa-building-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `(building)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon, and a
  `fa-map-marker`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `(map marker)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon.
- `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down
  menu, select the company the location applies to. The current company
  populates this field, by default. This field **only** appears in a
  multi-company database.

![A new work location form with all fields filled out.](new_employee/location.png)
::::

### SCHEDULE {#employees/schedule}

This section defines when the employee is expected to work.

- `Working Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the
  drop-down menu, select the hours the employee is expected to work. By
  default, a `Standard 40 hour/week`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  working schedule is available. If the **Timesheets** app is installed,
  an `Appointment Resource Default Calendar`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} option is also available.

  To view and modify the specific daily working hours, click the
  `oi-arrow-right`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
  `(Internal link)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} arrow at the end
  of the `Working Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} line.
  Working hours can be modified or deleted here.

  > :::: note
  > ::: title
  > Note
  > :::
  >
  > `Working Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are related to a
  > company\'s working schedules, and an Employee **cannot** have
  > working hours that are outside of a company\'s working schedule.
  >
  > Each individual working schedule is company-specific. For
  > multi-company databases, each company **must** have its own working
  > hours set.
  >
  > If an employee\'s working hours are not configured as a working
  > schedule for the company, new working schedules can be added, or
  > existing working schedules can be modified.
  >
  > Working hours can be modified in the **Payroll** application, where
  > they are referred to as `Working Schedules`{.interpreted-text
  > role="guilabel"}.
  >
  > For more information on how to create or modify
  > `Working Schedules`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
  > **Payroll** application, refer to the
  > `../../hr/payroll`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} documentation.
  >
  > After the new working time is created, or an existing one is
  > modified, the `Working
  > Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} can be selected on the
  > employee form.
  > ::::

- `Timezone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down
  menu, select the timezone for the employee.

### PLANNING

This section is **only** visible if the **Planning** app is installed,
as this section affects what the employee can be assigned in the
**Planning** app.

- `Roles`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down menu,
  select all the roles the employee can perform. There are no
  preconfigured roles available, so all roles must be
  `configured in the Planning app
  <planning/roles>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. There is no limit to
  the number of roles assigned to an employee.
- `Default Role`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down
  menu, select the default role the employee will typically perform. If
  the `Default Role`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected
  before the `Roles`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
  configured, the selected role is automatically added to the list of
  `Roles`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

## Private information tab {#employees/private-info}

No information in the `Private Information`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab is required to create an employee, however, some
information in this section may be necessary for the company\'s payroll
department.

In order to properly process payslips and ensure all deductions are
accounted for, it is recommended to check with the accounting department
and payroll department to ensure all required fields are populated.

Enter the various information in the following sections and fields of
the `Private
Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Fields are entered
either using a drop-down menu, ticking a checkbox, or typing in the
information.

> :::: note
> ::: title
> Note
> :::
>
> Depending on the localization setting, other fields may be present.
> For example, for the United States, a `SSN No`{.interpreted-text
> role="guilabel"} (Social Security Number) field is present.
> ::::

### PRIVATE CONTACT {#employees/private-contact}

- `Private Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  employee\'s private home address.

- `Private Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  employee\'s personal email address.

- `Private Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  employee\'s personal phone number.

- `Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the bank
  account number for the employee, and click
  `Create and edit..`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. A
  `Create Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form loads
  with the bank account number populating the
  `Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. Next,
  select the `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} using the
  drop-down menu.

  If the bank is not already configured, click
  `Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and a blank
  `Create Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form loads, with the
  bank name populating the `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  field. Next, enter the `Bank Identifier Code`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, also referred to as a BIC or SWIFT code. Then enter
  the `Bank Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Once the form is complete,
  click `Save & Close`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the new
  bank populates the `Bank`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

  Next, enter the `ABA/Routing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  number for the bank account, then select the
  `Account Holder`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which is
  typically the employee.

  Finally, click the `Send Money`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  toggle. This changes the toggle color to green, and the status changes
  from `Untrusted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in black text, to
  `Trusted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in green text.

  ![The Create Bank Account form with all the information filled out.](new_employee/bank.png)

  :::: important
  ::: title
  Important
  :::

  **All** bank accounts must be marked as `Trusted`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, if not payments cannot be processed and sent to the
  bank account. Having an `Untrusted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  bank account for an employee will cause an error in the **Payroll**
  application.
  ::::

- `Home-Work Distance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  number, in miles or kilometers, the employee commutes to work, in one
  direction. The unit of measure can be changed from kilometers
  (`km`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) to miles
  (`mi`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) using the drop-down menu.
  This field is only necessary if the employee is receiving any type of
  commuter benefits or tax deductions based on commute distances.

- `Private Car Plate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  license plate for the employee\'s personal car.

### EMERGENCY

This section details the person to contact in the event of an emergency.

- `Contact Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the emergency
  contact\'s name.
- `Contact Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  emergency contact\'s phone number. It is recommended to enter a phone
  number that the person has the most access to, typically a mobile
  phone.

### FAMILY STATUS

This section is used for tax purposes, and affects the **Payroll** app.
Enter the following information in the fields.

- `Marital Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the
  marital status for the employee using the drop-down menu. The default
  options are `Single`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Married`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Legal Cohabitant`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Widower`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Divorced`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

  If `Married`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `Legal Cohabitant`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected, two
  additional fields appear: `Spouse Complete Name`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} and `Spouse Birthdate`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}. Enter these fields with the respective information.

- `Number of Dependent Children`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  enter the number of dependent children. This number is the same number
  used for calculating tax deductions, and should follow all tax
  regulations regarding applicable dependents.

### CITIZENSHIP

This section outlines all the information relating to the employee\'s
citizenship. This section is primarily for employees who are working in
a different country than their citizenship. For employees working
outside of their home country, for example on a work visa, this
information may be required. Information for all fields may not be
available.

- `Nationality (Country)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the
  drop-down menu, select the country the employee is from.
- `Identification No`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  employee\'s identification number in this field.
- `SSN No`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the employee\'s
  social security number.
- `Passport No`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  employee\'s passport number.
- `Gender`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the employee\'s
  gender from the drop-down menu. The default options are
  `Male`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Female`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, and `Other`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Date of Birth`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the calendar
  selector, select the birthday of the employee.
- `Place of Birth`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the city or
  town the employee was born.
- `Country of Birth`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the
  drop-down menu, select the country the employee was born.
- `Non-resident`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: tick this checkbox
  if the employee lives in a foreign country.

### EDUCATION

This section allows for only one entry, and should be populated with the
highest degree the employee has earned.

- `Certificate Level`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the
  drop-down menu, select the highest degree the employee has earned. The
  default options are `Graduate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Bachelor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Master`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Doctor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Other`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Field of Study`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type in the
  subject the employee studied, such as [Business]{.title-ref} or
  [Computer Science]{.title-ref}.
- `School`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: type in the name of the
  school the employee earned the degree from.

### WORK PERMIT

This section should be filled in if the employee is working on some type
of work permit. This section may be left blank if they do not require
any work permits for employment.

- `Visa No`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the employee\'s
  visa number.
- `Work Permit No`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  employee\'s work permit number.
- `Visa Expiration Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the
  calendar selector, select the date the employee\'s visa expires.
- `Work Permit Expiration Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  using the calendar selector, select the date the employee\'s work
  permit expires.
- `Work Permit`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: click
  `Upload your file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then navigate
  to the work permit file in the file explorer, and click
  `Select`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to add the permit.

## Payroll tab {#employees/payroll}

Depending on the installed
`localization <../payroll/payroll_localizations>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, the sections and fields in this tab may vary considerably.
Due to the specific nature of localizations and the variety of
information that may be requested in this tab, it is recommended to
check with the accounting department to fill out this section correctly.

The following fields are universal for all localizations:

- `Legal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the legal name
  for the employee. This is the name that typically is used for filing
  taxes.
- `Payslip Language`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  desired language to be used when printing payslips for this employee.
- `Registration Number of the Employee`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}: enter the employees registration number.

::: seealso
`Payroll localizations <../payroll/payroll_localizations>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Settings tab {#employees/hr-settings}

This tab provides various fields for different applications within the
database. Depending on what applications are installed, different fields
may appear in this tab.

### STATUS

- `Employee Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the
  drop-down menu, select the *type* of employee. The default options are
  `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Worker`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Student`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Trainee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Contractor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Freelancer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- `Related User`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the drop-down
  menu, select a user in the database to link to this employee.

  :::: important
  ::: title
  Important
  :::

  Employees do **not** need to be users of the database.

  *Employees* do **not** count towards the Odoo subscription billing,
  while *Users* **do** count towards billing. If the new employee should
  also be a user, the user **must** be created.

  After the employee is created, click `Create User`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} at the end of the `Related User`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} line. A `Create User`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} form appears.

  The employee name populates the `Name`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} field by default. If the `Email
  Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Phone`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `Mobile`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `photo`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are populated on the
  employee form, the corresponding fields are auto-populated on the
  `Create User`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form.

  Once the form is completed, click the `Save`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} button. The user is created, and populates the
  `Related User`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

  Users can also be created manually. For more information on how to
  manually add a user, refer to the
  `../../general/users/`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} document.
  ::::

### APPLICATION SETTINGS

This section affects the **Fleet** and **Manufacturing** apps. Enter the
following information in this section.

- `Hourly Cost`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the hourly
  cost for the employee, in a XX.XX format. This cost is factored in
  when the employee is working at a `work center
  <../../inventory_and_mrp/manufacturing/advanced_configuration/using_work_centers>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}.

  :::: note
  ::: title
  Note
  :::

  Manufacturing costs are added to the costs for producing a product, if
  the value of the manufactured product is **not** a fixed amount. This
  cost does **not** affect the **Payroll** application.
  ::::

- `Fleet Mobility Card`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: if
  applicable, enter the `Fleet Mobility Card`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} number

### ATTENDANCE/POINT OF SALE

This section determines how employees sign in to either the
**Attendances** or **Point Of Sale** apps, and only appear if either of
these apps is installed.

- `PIN Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the employee\'s
  pin number in this field. This code is used to sign in and out of
  **Attendances** app kiosks, and a
  `POS (Point Of Sale)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} system.
- `Badge ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: click
  `Generate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} at the end of the
  `Badge ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} line to create a badge
  number. Once generated, the badge number populates the
  `Badge ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, and
  `Generate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} changes to
  `Print Badge`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Click
  `Print Badge`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to create a PDF file
