- Money is automatically deducted from the user\'s paychecks, then the
  **Lunch** app manager updates the account when paychecks are issued.
  This requires `adding a salary attachment
  <payroll/worked-days-inputs>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} for the
  user\'s payslip in the *Payroll* app.
- Companies can sell \"lunch tickets\" at a set price (for example, one
  ticket costs \$5.00). Users can purchase tickets from a **Lunch** app
  manager, who then updates the user\'s account.
:::

## Cash Moves {#lunch/cash-moves}

To add funds to user accounts, each cash move must be individually
logged. To view all cash move records, or create a new cash move,
navigate to `Lunch app --> Manager --> Cash
Moves`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Doing so reveals the
`Cash Moves`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dashboard.

On the `Cash Moves`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dashboard, all
cash moves are presented in a default list view, displaying each
record\'s `Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`User`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The total of all the cash
moves is displayed at the bottom of the `Amount`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} column.

![The list view of all cash moves.](user-accounts/cash.png)

### Add funds

To add funds to a lunch account, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button, located in the top-left corner of the
`Cash Moves`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dashboard.

A blank `Cash Moves`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form loads.
Enter the following information on the form:

- `User`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the user depositing
  cash into their account from the drop-down menu. If the user is not in
  the database, they can be created by typing their name in the
  `User`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, and clicking either
  `Create "user"`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to create the
  user and edit the `Create User`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  form.
- `Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: using the calendar popover,
  select the date the transaction occurred.
- `Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the amount being
  added to the lunch account.
- `Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter a brief
  description of the transaction.

![The cash move form filled out for a transaction of \$40.00.](user-accounts/cash-move-form.png)

## Control Accounts

An overview of every transaction in the **Lunch** app, including all
cash deposits and purchases, can be viewed on the main *Control
Accounts* dashboard. To access this dashboard, navigate to
`Lunch app --> Manager --> Control Accounts.`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}

All transactions are grouped `By Employee`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and listed alphabetically by the user\'s first name.
At the end of the user\'s name, a number appears. This indicates the
number of individual records logged for that user.

The default view is to have all individual transactions hidden. To view
all transactions for a user, click the
`fa-caret-right`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(triangle)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon to the left of the
desired name to expand that specific group.

Each record includes the `Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`User`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![The Control Accounts dashboard with two employee\'s transactions expanded.](user-accounts/control-accounts.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

This list only displays the various transactions within the **Lunch**
app, and does **not** allow modifications to be made to any records
listed.

Cash moves can be modified, but **only** from the
`Cash Moves <lunch/cash-moves>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} dashboard,
not from the `Control Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
dashboard.

It is **not** possible to modify any product-related records.
::::




--- SOURCE: hr/lunch/vendors.md ---

# Vendors

Before `products can be added <products>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
to the **Lunch** app, the restaurants that provide the food needs to be
configured.

To add a new vendor, first navigate to
`Lunch app --> Configuration --> Vendors`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Here, all currently configured vendors for the
**Lunch** app appear in a default Kanban view. To change to a list view,
click the `oi-view-list`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(List)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon in the top-right
corner.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

No vendors are preconfigured in the **Lunch** app, so all vendors
**must** be added to the database.
::::

A placeholder `Lunch Supplier`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} card
appears on the `Vendors`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dashboard,
by default. Click on this card, and configure the following fields on
the vendor form:

- `Vendor information <lunch/vendor-info>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
- `Availability <lunch/availability>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
- `Orders <lunch/orders>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
- `Extras <lunch/extras>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}

After the first vendor is configured, add more vendors by clicking the
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the top-left corner,
and configure the new lunch supplier form. Repeat for all needed
vendors.

## Vendor information {#lunch/vendor-info}

- `Vendor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a name for the
  vendor in this field.

- `Vendor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (beneath the line for
  vendor name): Using the drop-down menu, select the corresponding
  vendor in the **Contacts** app. If the vendor has not already been
  created, type in the vendor name, and click
  `Create "new vendor name"`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to add
  them. Alternatively, click `Create and edit...`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} to create the vendor and edit the vendor contact
  form. The vendor contact form allows for more details to be entered,
  such as contact information.

  :::: note
  ::: title
  Note
  :::

  If a selection is made to the drop-down `Vendor`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} field, the `Vendor`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} text field (above, for the vendor\'s name) updates
  with the name of the vendor chosen from the drop-down menu.

  The list of vendors that is presented in the drop-down menu is pulled
  from the **Contacts** application.
  ::::

- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the vendor\'s
  address in the various fields.

- `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the vendor\'s email
  in this field.

- `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the vendor\'s phone
  number in this field.

- `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If this vendor is only
  available to a specific company, select the company from the drop-down
  menu. If this field is left blank, the vendor\'s items are available
  to **all** companies. This field **only** appears in a multi-company
  database.

![The top portion of the vendor form filled out.](vendors/vendor-info.png)

## Availability {#lunch/availability}

The `AVAILABILITY`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section presents a
table with two rows. The days of the week populate the top row, and the
bottom row has checkboxes. Tick the corresponding checkbox for each day
of the week the vendor is available.

By default, Monday through Friday are ticked.

![The default view of the availability section, with Mon-Fri enabled.](vendors/availability.png)

## Orders {#lunch/orders}

The `ORDERS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section of the vendor
form details which locations the vendor is available for, in addition to
how and when orders are placed and received.

- `Delivery`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down
  menu, select `Delivery`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if the
  vendor delivers to the office, or select
  `No Delivery`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if orders must be
  picked up.

- `Location`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select which locations
  are able to order from this vendor. Multiple locations can be
  selected. If this field is left blank, **all** locations can order
  from the vendor.

  :::: note
  ::: title
  Note
  :::

  An [HQ Office]{.title-ref} location is created by default when
  creating a database, and is available to select from the list.
  ::::

- `Send Order By`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Click the radio
  button to select how orders are sent to the vendor. The available
  options are `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- `Order Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This field **only**
  appears if `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected in
  the `Send Order By`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. Enter
  the time that an order must be emailed for it to be accepted. Enter
  the time in the following format: [HH:MM]{.title-ref}. Then select
  either `AM`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `PM`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the drop-down menu, next
  to the time field.

![The orders section of a vendor form, with all fields filled out.](vendors/orders.png)

## Extras {#lunch/extras}

When ordering an item in the **Lunch** app, optional extra items,
sometimes referred to as *add-ons*, can be shown. These can be
configured in any manner that suits the products being offered.

By default, Odoo allows for three types of extra items, which can be
thought of as *categories*. By default, the first type (or *category*)
of add-ons is labeled [Extras]{.title-ref}, the second is labeled
[Beverages]{.title-ref}, and the third is labeled [Extra Label
3]{.title-ref}.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

When configuring the extras, it is important to keep in mind that all
the extras configured appear for **every item** offered by the vendor.
That means that only items which apply to **all** products from the
vendor should be added.
::::

### Configure extras {#lunch/configure-extras}

Enter the following information for each of the three available extra
sections:

- `Extra (#) Label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a name for
  the type of extra, such as [Toppings]{.title-ref}. This can be thought
  of as a *category*.
- `Extra (#) Quantity`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select how
  the extras are selected. The options are:
  - `None or More`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select this
    option if the user is not required to make a selection.
  - `One or More`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select this option
    to **require** the user to make **at least one** selection.
  - `Only One`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select this option to
    **require** the user to make **only one** selection.

### Add extras

After the labels and quantities have been configured for an extra
category, the individual extra items must be added for each category.

Click `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} at the bottom of
the list that appears on the right-hand side of the extra category.
Enter the `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Price`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for each item being added.
The price can remain at [\$0.00]{.title-ref} if there is no cost. This
is common for items like disposable silverware or condiments.

::: example
For a pizzeria that only offers personal pizzas, see their extras
configured as follows:

The first extra is configured for the various toppings they offer. The
`Extra 1 Label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set to
[Toppings]{.title-ref}, and the `Extra 1 Quantity`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is set to `None or More`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. The various toppings are then added, with their
corresponding costs.

![The first of the extras configured for pizza toppings.](vendors/extras.png)

The pizzeria also offers a free beverage with any purchase. To set this
up, the `Extra
2 Label`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set to
[Beverages]{.title-ref}, and the `Extra 2 Quantity`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is set to `Only
One`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The various beverage choices
are added, and the cost for each remains zero.

![The second of the extras configured for a free beverage with purchase.](vendors/beverages.png)
:::




--- SOURCE: hr/lunch.md ---

show-content

:   

# Lunch

The **Lunch** application in Odoo allows users to conveniently order
food and pay for their meal directly from the database.

Before employees can use the **Lunch** application, there are a number
of configurations that need to be made:
`settings <lunch/settings>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
`vendors <lunch/vendors>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, `locations
<lunch/locations>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
`products <lunch/products>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, and
`product categories
<lunch/product-categories>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. Once these
are created and configured, employees can view offerings and order food.

## Settings {#lunch/settings}

In the `Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} menu, only two
items need to be configured: overdraft settings and notifications. To
access the settings, navigate to `Lunch app --> Configuration -->
Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

Configure the following:

- `Lunch Overdraft`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter the
  maximum overdraft amount for employees. The currency format is
  determined by the localization setting of the company.
- `Reception notification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: set the
  message users receive via the **Discuss** app when their food has been
  delivered. The default message [Your lunch has been delivered. Enjoy
  your meal!]{.title-ref} populates this field, but can be modified, if
  desired.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

If a database has multiple languages installed, many forms in the
**Lunch** application have the option of entering translations for
various fields.

If translations are available to be configured, a language code appears
next to a translatable field on a form. To add translations for that
field, click the two letter language code (for example,
`EN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for English) and a translation
pop-up window appears.

The following is an example for the
`Reception notification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field in the
settings menu:

Navigate to `Lunch app --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click the `EN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
In the top-right of the text box beneath the
`Reception notification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section. A
`Translate: company_lunch_notify_message`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} pop-up window loads with the option to enter a
translation for the other languages used by the database.

The first column lists the different languages in alphabetical order,
with the currently selected language in bold. The second column has the
currently configured message in each column. The last column in the
far-right provides a text box to type in a translation for each
language.

Enter the text that should appear for each language, then click
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![The translation text box, with the current language highlighted, and the Arabic
translation field highlighted.](lunch/translation.png)
::::

## Locations {#lunch/locations}

By default, Odoo creates an [HQ Office]{.title-ref} location when the
**Lunch** application is installed. If a company has more than one
location, they must be configured.

To add a location, navigate to
`Lunch app --> Configuration --> Locations`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. The currently configured locations appear in a
list view. Click the `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in
the top-left corner and a blank line appears beneath the last location
in the list.

Enter the name of the location in the field. Next, click into the
`Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field to the right of the
name, and enter the location\'s address. It is possible to enter
multiple lines in the address field.

Repeat this for all locations that need to be added.

![A list view of the locations with the new button highlighted.](lunch/locations.png)

## Alerts

It is possible to set up alerts that can either be displayed in the
**Lunch** app, or be sent to specific employees via the **Discuss** app.

No alerts are preconfigured by default. To set up an alert, navigate to
`Lunch app
--> Configuration --> Alerts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
Click the `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the
top-left corner and a blank lunch alert form loads. Enter the following
information on the form:

- `Alert Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: enter a name for the
  alert. This should be short and descriptive, such as [New Lunch
  Vendor]{.title-ref} or [Order by 11:00 AM]{.title-ref}. This field is
  **required**.

- `Display`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select whether the alert
  is visible in the **Lunch** app (`Alert in
  app)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or sent to employees via the
  **Discuss** app in a chat window (`Chat
  notification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}).

  - `Recipients`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this field only
    appears if `Chat notification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
    selected for the `Display`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    option. Select who receives the chat alert. The options are:
    `Everyone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Employee who ordered last week`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Employee who
    ordered last month`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
    `Employee who ordered last year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- `Location`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the locations
  the alert should appear for from the drop-down menu. Multiple
  locations can be selected. This field is **required**, therefore, if
  the alert applies to all locations, select all the locations from the
  drop-down menu.

- `Show Until`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: if the alert should
  expire on a specific date, select the date from the calendar picker.

- `Active`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this option is on
  (appears green) by default. To turn off the alert, click the toggle so
  that it no longer appears green.

- `Message`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the alert message
  in this field. This field is **required**.

- `Notification Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select the
  days of the week the alert should be sent. By default, all seven days
  are active. Click on a checkbox to change the setting from active to
  inactive.

  If `Chat notification`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} was selected
  for the `Display`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option, a
  `Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field also appears. Enter
  the time the chat message should be sent. Next, select if the time is
  either `AM`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `PM`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} using the drop-down menu to
  the right of the `Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

![An alert form with all of the information filled out for a chat alert sent at 10:30 AM,
asking employees to submit orders by 11:30 AM.](lunch/alert.png)

::: seealso
\- `lunch/vendors`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`lunch/products`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`lunch/orders`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`lunch/user-accounts`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`lunch/management`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

::: {.toctree titlesonly=""}
lunch/vendors lunch/products lunch/orders lunch/user-accounts
lunch/management
:::




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/commissions.md ---

# Commissions

Commissions are payments made to employees that are earned as part of
their salary. The payments are awarded after a sale has been made, and
the amount depends on how much the sale was. Typically the amount is
either a percentage of the sale, or a set commission based on a
structure created by the company.

To pay an employee a commission they earned, a separate commission
paycheck must be issued to the employee. In Odoo, a commission payslip
is referred to as a *warrant payslip*.

## Create warrant payslips

Warrant payslips are generated directly from the
`Payslips Batches`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dashboard, which
is accessed by navigating to
`Payroll app --> Payslips --> Batches`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

First, click the `Generate Warrant Payslips`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button in the top-left corner. Doing so reveals a
`Generate Warrant Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up
window, in which the necessary information **must** be filled out.

Set the time frame the commission was earned, in the two fields next to
`Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Click into each field, and
a calendar pop-up window loads. Navigate to the desired date and click
on it to select it.

Using the drop-down menu, select the `Department`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in the corresponding field. When a department is
selected, the employees listed for that department appear in the
`Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, below.

If a file is needed for the record, upload a file to the
`Import File`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, such as a sales
invoice, using the `Upload your file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button. Any file type is accepted.

Under the `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, enter
the individual `Commission Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
for each employee in the far-right column. To remove an employee, click
the `fa-trash-o`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`(trash)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon to remove the line.

Add a new commission by clicking `Add a Line`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and entering the `Employee`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} and the appropriate
`Commission Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Once all the commissions are properly entered, click the
`Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button to create
the warrant payslips in a group, which is reffered to as a *pay run* in
Odoo, or click `Export`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to export a
CSV file of the commissions.

`Process the pay run <payroll/pay-run-process>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} in the same way as a typical batch to complete the payment
process.

![Enter the commission details.](commissions/commission-details.png)

::: seealso
`Commissions <../../sales/sales/commissions>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/contracts.md ---

# Contracts

Every employee in Odoo is required to have a running contract in order
to be paid. A contract outlines the terms of an employee\'s position,
compensation, working hours, and any other relevant terms.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Contract documents (PDFs) are uploaded and organized using the
**Documents** application, and are signed using the **Sign**
application. Ensure these applications are installed to send and sign
contracts. Please refer to the
`../../productivity/documents`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} and
`../../productivity/sign`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} documentation
for more information.
::::

## Contracts dashboard {#payroll/contract-dashboard}

Both the **Payroll** and **Employees** apps display *identical employee
contract information*.

To access the contracts dashboard from the **Employees** app, navigate
to `Employees
app --> Employees --> Contracts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. To access the contracts dashboard from the
**Payroll** app, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Contracts --> Contracts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

The `Contracts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dashboard displays
all employee contracts in a default list view, grouped by
`Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The available status
groupings are `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Running`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Expired`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Cancelled`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Each grouping displays
the number of contracts within the grouping.

![Contracts dashboard view showing running contracts and contracts with issues.](contracts/contracts-overview.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Any changes made to contracts in the **Employees** app is reflected in
the **Payroll** app, and vice versa. Contract information remains
identical, regardless of where the contract information is accessed.
::::

## Create a contract {#payroll/new-contract}

To create a new contract, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button on the `Contracts dashboard
<payroll/contract-dashboard>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, and a blank
contract form appears.

### General information section {#payroll/gen-info}

Enter the following information in the top-half of the blank contract
form:

- `Contact Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Type in the
  name or title for the contract, such as [John Smith
  Contract]{.title-ref}. This field is **required**.

- `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down
  menu, select the employee the contract is for.

- `Contract Start Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  date the contract goes into effect. Contracts can be created
  retroactively, or be created to begin at a future date. The current
  date populates this required field by default, but can be modified.

- `Contract End Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If the
  contract has a firm end date, enter the date in this field. Leave this
  field blank if the contract runs indefinitely, or until a new contract
  is made (when the employee has a change to their job title, salary, or
  benefits).

- `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select one of
  the available working schedules the employee is expected to work, from
  the drop-down menu. The selected working schedule determines how `work
  entries <work_entries>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} are generated,
  which determines the employees schedule and compensation. If this
  field is left blank, this allows the employee to work as many or as
  few hours as desired every week, with no restrictions.

  :::: tip
  ::: title
  Tip
  :::

  The `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} drop-down
  menu displays all the working schedules for the selected company. To
  modify or add to this list, go to `Payroll app -->
  Configuration --> Working Schedules`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}. Click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  and create a new working schedule, or click on an existing working
  schedule and make edits.
  ::::

::: {#payroll/work-entry-source}
- `Work Entry Source`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the
  drop-down menu, select how the `work entries
  <work_entries>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} are generated. This
  field is **required**. Click the radio button next to the desired
  selection. The options are:

  - `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Work entries
    are generated based on the selected
    `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  - `Attendances`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Work entries are
    generated based on the employee\'s check-in records in the
    **Attendances** app. (This requires the **Attendances** app to be
    installed).
  - `Planning`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Work entries are
    generated based on the planned schedule for the employee from the
    **Planning** app. (This requires the **Planning** app to be
    installed).

- `Salary Structure Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select one
  of the salary structure types from the drop-down menu. The default
  salary structure types are `Employee`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} or `Worker`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. A
  `new salary structure type <payroll/new-structure-type>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} can be created, if needed.

- `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the department
  the employee is working within, using the drop-down menu.

- `Job Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  employee\'s specific job position using the drop-down menu.

  :::: note
  ::: title
  Note
  :::

  If the selected `Job Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} has
  a contract template linked to it with a specific
  `Salary Structure Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the
  `Salary Structure Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} changes to
  the one associated with that `Job Position`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
  ::::

- `Contract Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the
  drop-down menu, select the type of contract being created. The default
  options are `Permanent`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Temporary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Seasonal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Full-Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Intern`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Student`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Apprenticeship`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Thesis`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Statutory`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- `Wage on Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  employee\'s monthly wage in this field.

  :::: tip
  ::: title
  Tip
  :::

  The `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} drop-down
  menu displays all the working times for the selected
  `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. To modify or add to this
  list, go to `Payroll app -->
  Configuration --> Working Times`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}, and either `Create`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} a new working time, or click on an existing working
  time, then edit it by clicking `Edit`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.
  ::::

- `HR Responsible`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the person
  who is responsible for validating the contract using the drop-down
  menu. This field is required.

  :::: note
  ::: title
  Note
  :::

  The `HR Responsible`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field only
  appears if the **Salary Configurator**
  ([hr_contract_salary]{.title-ref}) module and the **Sign** app are
  both installed.
  ::::
:::

![](contracts/required-fields.png){alt="New contract form to be filled in when creating a new contract."}

### Salary information tab

The `Salary Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab is where
the specific details of how much and how often the employee is paid.
Fill in the following fields in this tab:

- `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down
  menu, select what kind of pay the employee receives. The two default
  options are `Fixed Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Select
  `Fixed Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for salaried
  employees, and select `Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  for employees who are paid based on their logged worked hours.
- `Schedule Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down
  menu, select how often the employee is paid. The default options are
  `Annually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Semi-annually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Quarterly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Bi-monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Semi-monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Bi-weekly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Weekly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
  `Daily`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the amount the
  employee receives each pay period. The first field allows for a wage
  to be entered, the second field displays how often the pay is issued
  to the employee. The second field *cannot* be modified, and is updated
  when the `Schedule Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field
  changes.
- `Yearly Cost (Real)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This field
  automatically updates after the `Schedule
  Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and `Wage`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} fields are entered. This amount is the total yearly
  cost for the employer. This field can be modified. However, if this is
  modified, the `Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field updates,
  accordingly. Ensure both the `Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  and `Yearly Cost (Real)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are
  correct if this field is modified.
- `Monthly Cost (Real)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This field
  automatically updates after the `Schedule
  Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and `Wage`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} fields are entered. This amount is the total monthly
  cost for the employer. This field **cannot** be modified, and is
  calculated based on the `Yearly Cost
  (Real)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![](contracts/salary-info.png){alt="The Salary Information tab filled out."}

### Details tab

The `Details`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of the contract
houses the contract template information, accounting information (refer
to the
`country-specific localization document <payroll_localizations>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} for more information), any part time work information, and
notes. Fill out the following fields in this tab:

- `Contract Template`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the
  drop-down menu, select a `contract template
  <payroll/contract-template>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to use when
  making an offer to an applicant.

- `Originated Offer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This field
  automatically populates with the original offer sent to the employee.
  This field is **not** modifiable, and is only populated if applicable.

- `Part Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Tick the checkbox if
  the contract is for part time work. Once enabled, a percentage field
  appears next to the checkbox. The percentage **cannot** be modified,
  and automatically updates based on the selected
  `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the top-half
  of the contract, compared to the typical working schedule for the
  company (typically 40 hours/week).

  - `Standard Calendar`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This field
    is automatically populated with the default working schedule for the
    company. In most cases, this is
    `Standard 40 hours/week`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  - `Part Time Work Entry Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    Using the drop-down menu, select the work entry type that generates
    the balance of a full-time working schedule.

  ::: example
  An employee contract is being created for a part-time employee who
  works 20 hours a week.

  To configure this, the employee\'s
  `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set to `20
  Hours/Part time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
  `general information section <payroll/gen-info>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}. In the `Details`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
  the `Part Time`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox is ticked,
  and the percentage is set to [50]{.title-ref}. The
  `Standard Calendar`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set to
  `Standard 40 hours/week`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the
  `Part Time Work Entry Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set
  to `Unpaid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

  When a typical work week is processed in the **Payroll** app, the
  employee generates twenty
  (20) hours of regular work entries under the work entry type
       [Attendance]{.title-ref}, and another twenty

  \(20\) hours of work entries under the work entry type
  [Unpaid]{.title-ref}, for a total of forty (40) hours worth of work
  entries.
  :::

- `Notes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter any relevant notes
  for the contract in this field.

![](contracts/details-tab.png){alt="The Details tab filled out."}

### Signatories tab

The `Signatories`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab is where the
default contract templates are selected, for both new and updated
contracts.

Using the drop-down menu, select the default contract template to use
when creating a new or updated contract, in the respective fields.

Once a PDF template is selected, any mapped signature fields in the file
appear in a list, below the selection, identifying who must sign the
document. These fields **cannot** be updated.

Any changes to the template and signatories but be done in the **Sign**
app, where contract templates are uploaded, modified, and stored.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The `PDF Template`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields are only
visible if the **Sign** app is installed, along with the
`hr_contract_salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`hr_contract_salary_payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} `modules
<../../general/apps_modules>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.
::::

![](contracts/signatories.png){alt="The Signatories tab with the roles specified for signing."}

### Personal documents tab

Occasionally, additional paperwork may be required when creating a
contract, such as legal documents declaring the employee is able to work
in the country. When this situation occurs, Odoo allows for one image
file of the necessary document to be attached to a contract in the
`Personal
Documents`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

Click the `Upload your file`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button,
navigate to the desired document, and click `Select`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to attach the file to the contract. The file name
appears on the `Image`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} line.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

This tab **only** appears after an `Employee`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is selected. Additionally, only image files can be
attached in this field at this time.
::::

### Salary attachments

After an employee is selected for the contract, a
`fa-book`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Salary Attachments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button
appears at the top of the page.

For new employees who do not currently have a contract, the smart button
displays `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. If the contract is
being updated for a current employee who already has salary attachments
configured, the smart button displays the number of salary attachments
currently running.

`Create or update any necessary salary attachments <salary_attachments>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} for the contract, before sending.

## Send a contract

After a contract has been created and configured, the next step is to
send it to the employee or applicant. Click the
`Generate Offer`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and the
`Offer for (Employee)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form loads.

The `Offer for (Employee)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form
displays all the basic information from the contract, as well as a link
the employee can use to sign the contract. The last field on the form is
a `Validity Days Count`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. This
indicates how long the offer is valid. Enter the desired number of days
in the field. The default is [30]{.title-ref} days.

Click `Send By Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and a pop-up
email window loads, using a preconfigured default email template. Click
`Send`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to send the offer.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

In order to send a contract using the `Generate Offer`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button, there **must** be an employee signature field
on the contract PDF being sent.
::::

![Send the contract to the employee via one of the buttons.](contracts/send-contract.png)

## Contract status

When creating and sending out a contract, the default status of the
contract is `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Once there is a minimum of one completed signature on the document, the
status changes to `Partially Signed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
Internal users, such as HR and recruitment employees, are alerted in the
database when there is a signature requested of them.

After all required parties have signed the contract, the status changes
to `Fully Signed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

All status changes happen automatically as the document is signed.

## Contract templates {#payroll/contract-template}

Contract *templates* eliminate the need to configure new contracts every
time an employee is hired.

Having multiple contract templates allows for faster contract creation
for different types of employment positions that are commonly filled,
such as full time, part time, seasonal, etc.

Contract templates are created through the **Payroll** app configuration
menu, and stored in the **Documents** app.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

To access contract templates, the **Salary Configurator**
([hr_contract_salary]{.title-ref}) module **must** be
`installed <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
::::

To view all contract templates, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration -->
Templates`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

The `Contract Templates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} page lists
all existing templates. Click a template line to open and edit it.

To create a new contract template, click the `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button. Then, enter the following information on the
blank contract template form that appears:

- `Contract Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a brief
  description for the template. This should be clear and easily
  understood, as this name appears in the **Recruitment** application,
  as well.
- `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  desired working schedule the contract applies to from the drop-down
  menu. If a new working schedule is needed, create a
  `new working schedule
  <payroll/new-working-schedule>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
- `Work Entry Source`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  `how the work entries are generated
  <payroll/work-entry-source>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.
- `Salary Structure Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  `salary structure type
  <payroll/structure-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} from the
  drop-down menu.
- `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the department
  the contract template applies to from the drop-down menu. If blank,
  the template applies to all departments.
- `Job Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  `job position <../recruitment/new_job>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
  the contract template applies to from the drop-down menu. If blank,
  the template applies to all job positions.
- `Contract Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the type of
  contract from the drop-down menu. This list is the same as the
  *employment type*.
- `Wage on Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  monthly wage in the field.
- `HR Responsible`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the
  employee responsible for validating contracts, using this template,
  from the drop-down menu.

![A new contract template form, with the fields filled in.](contracts/contract-template.png)

### Salary information tab

- `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select either
  `Fixed Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the drop-down
  menu.
- `Schedule Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down
  menu, select how often the employee is paid. Options include
  `Annually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Semi-annually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Quarterly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Bi-monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Semi-monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Bi-weekly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Weekly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
  `Daily`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the gross wage. The
  time period presented in this field is based on what is selected for
  the `Scheduled Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. It is
  recommended to populate the `Yearly Cost (Real)`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} field *first*, since that entry updates this field
  automatically.
- `Yearly Cost (Real)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  total yearly cost the employee costs the employer. When this value is
  entered, the `Monthly Cost (Real)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  is automatically updated.
- `Monthly Cost (Real)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This field
  is **not** editable. The value is automatically populated after the
  `Yearly Cost (Real)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is entered.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The `Schedule Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Yearly Cost (Real)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields are all
linked. If any of these fields are updated, the other two fields
automatically update to reflect the change. It is best practice to check
these three fields if any modifications have been made, to ensure they
are accurate.
::::

![The salary information tab, with the fields filled in.](contracts/salary-information.png)

#### Benefits and deductions

Depending on the
`payroll localization <payroll_localizations>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} for the company, the entries presented in this section
either vary, or may not appear at all. For example, some entries may
pertain to retirement accounts, health insurance benefits, and commuter
benefits.

Enter the monetary amounts or percentages to specify how much of the
employee\'s salary goes to the various benefits and deductions.

### Signatories tab

This tab outlines which documents the employee must sign to either
accept a new offer or an updated contract.

- `New Contract PDF Template`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  the default document that a new employee has to sign to accept an
  offer.
- `Contract Update PDF Template`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  Select the default document that a current employee has to sign to
  update their contract.

::: seealso
\- `../../productivity/documents`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} -
`../../productivity/sign`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/headcount.md ---

# Headcount report

The *Headcount report* in the **Payroll** app shows the number of
employees on payroll and allows headcount comparisons between different
periods of time.

## Create a headcount report

Create a headcount report to see the number of employees at a specific
time or compare headcounts across periods.

To create a headcount report, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Reporting --> Headcount`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and click `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

- Report name: generated automatically as [Headcount for (Company Name)
  on the (YYYY-MM-DD)]{.title-ref} and **cannot** be modified.
- `Company`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: populated automatically
  (works in both single and multi-company databases)
- `From`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}/`To`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} dates: defaults to current date (from) and blank
  (to). Adjust these to define the period to analyze.

![A headcount report form filled out for the third quarter of 2025.](headcount/new-headcount.png)

Next, click `Populate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to generate
the report.

At the top of the form, a `fa-people`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Employees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button appears.
Clicking the button displays the total number of employees for the
selected period.

## View all headcount reports

See how the company headcount has changed over time by viewing all
headcount reports in a list view.

To view all headcount reports, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Reporting --> Headcount`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

### View employees in a headcount

TO get an overall view of employees and their salary impact on the
company, view all employee records of a specific headcount report.

To view the employees of a specific headcount report, click the
`fa-people`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Employees`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} smart button at the top of a headcount report.

All employees from the headcount appear in a list view, grouped by
`Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the employee\'s full
  name
- `Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the department their
  job position is in
- `Job Title`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: their role
- `Employer Cost`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: how much the
  company pays the employee each pay-period
- `Wage on Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the dollar
  amount on payroll reports




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/pay_runs.md ---

# Pay runs

*Pay runs* are used to generate multiple
`payslips <payslips>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} at once and process
them in a group, rather than create and process individual payslips.
This method not only helps the payroll department pay employees in less
time, but it also helps keep payslips organized.

Typically, a company\'s payroll department
`creates a new pay run <payroll/new-pay-run>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for each salary structure, for every pay period (usually
weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly). If desired, pay runs can be further
organized by department, job position, etc.

Once a pay run is made,
`payslips are added to the pay run <payroll/add-payslips>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, then the pay run is processed, and employees are paid.

## View pay runs

To view all the pay runs in the database, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Payslips -->
Pay Runs`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} to display all payslip
pay runs that have been created. These payslip pay runs are displayed in
a list view, grouped by `oi-group`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (either
`Ready`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Done`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, or `Paid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}), by
default.

Each pay run displays the name, the dates it includes, the number of
payslips, and the total `employer cost`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `gross`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`net`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} amounts for all payslips.

![View displaying all pay runs created.](pay_runs/pay-runs.png)

## Create a new pay run {#payroll/new-pay-run}

New pay runs can be created from the
`Work Entry <payroll/work-entry-pay-run>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
`Employee
Payslips <payroll/payslips-pay-run>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, or
`Pay Runs <payroll/pay-runs-pay-run>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
dashboards.

### Work entry dashboard {#payroll/work-entry-pay-run}

To create a pay run from the work entry dashboard, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Work
Entries --> Work Entries`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. The
current time period is displayed, with the current day highlighted in
yellow.

All employees appear in a default Gantt view, with all work entries
displayed. If necessary, navigate to the desired time period.

Once all
`missing work entries are added <payroll/new-work-entry>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} and all `conflicts are
resolved <payroll/conflicts>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, click the
`Generate Pay Run`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. The pay
run is created for all employees, with a status of
`Ready`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![The work entries dashboard with the GeneratePay Runs button visible.](pay_runs/work-entries-pay-run.png)

### Employee payslips dashboard {#payroll/payslips-pay-run}

To create a pay run from the payslips dashboard, navigate to
`Payroll app -->
Payslips --> Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. All
payslips for all employees are displayed in a default list view, in
chronological order.

::: {#payroll/new-pay-run-pop-up}
Click the `Pay Run`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button and a
`New Pay Run`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up window loads.
Select the `Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} using
the drop-down menu. If no `Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is selected, the pay run applies to *all* salary
structures. Next, select the `Pay Schedule`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, which is *how often* employees are paid. The default
options are `year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`half-year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`quarter`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`2 months`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `month`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `half-month`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`2 weeks`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `week`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, or `day`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
:::

Last, using the calendar selector, set the first day the pay run covers
in the first blank `Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.
The second field is automatically populated based on the selection in
the `Pay Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

::: example
A company pays its employees every month. To configure the pay run for
November, the `Pay Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set
to `month`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the first
`Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is set to [Nov
1]{.title-ref}. Once entered, the second field is automatically
populated with [Nov 30]{.title-ref}.

![A monthly pay run configured for November.](pay_runs/new-pay-run.png)
:::

When the `New Pay Run`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up window
is configured, click `Continue`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
the pop-up window changes to a `Select Employees`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} window. All employees who match the parameters set in
the `New Pay Run`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up window
appear in the list. Select the desired employees to add to the pay run,
or click the box next to `Employees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
to select *all* employees in the list.

![The pay run employee selection pop-up window.](pay_runs/select-employees.png)

Once all desired employees are selected, click
`Select`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. The pop-up window closes,
and the pay run appears on the screen.

### Pay runs dashboard {#payroll/pay-runs-pay-run}

To create a pay run from the pay runs dashboard, navigate to
`Payroll app -->
Payslips --> Pay Runs`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Click
the `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button and a
`New Pay Run`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up window loads.

> Follow the same directions as if creating a
> `pay run form the payslips dashboard
> <payroll/new-pay-run-pop-up>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

## Add a payslips to a pay run {#payroll/add-payslips}

Once a
`pay run has been created <payroll/new-pay-run>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, payslips are added as part of the pay run creation. If
needed, additional payslips can be created individually, and added to a
pay run after it has been created.

To add a new payslip, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Payslips --> Payslips`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click the `New Off-Cycle`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button and a blank
`Employee Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form loads.
`Configure the payslip form <payroll/new-payslip>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, and ensure the `Pay Run`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field is populated.

Once the form is configured, click `Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to calculate the payslip and add it to the selected pay
run.

## Process a pay run {#payroll/pay-run-process}

After a
`pay run has been created <payroll/new-pay-run>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, and `all required payslips have
been added <payroll/add-payslips>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, the
pay run must then be processed, and employees paid.

Open the desired pay run by navigating to
`Payroll app --> Payslips --> Pay Runs`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and clicking on the desired pay run.

For a pay run to be processed, it must have a status of
`Ready`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. That means the pay run has
been created and payslips have been added, but the payslips have *not*
been processed.

Click the `Create Draft Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button, then click `OK`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Confirmation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up window to
confirm and create a draft of all the individual payslips in the pay
run. After this occurs, the pay run status changes to
`Done`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and moves to the
corresponding grouping on the `Pay Runs`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} dashboard.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

At any time, the pay run needs to be reverted back to a status of
`Ready`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, click the
`Revert`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. This action does
**not** remove any payslips that have already been added to the pay run,
instead, the status changes back to `Ready`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

After any desired changes have been made, click
`Create Draft Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and the pay run
status changes to `Done`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

It is important to note, that if any payslips in the pay run have a
status of `Paid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, the pay run
**cannot** revert to a status of `Ready`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.
::::

Once the status has changed to `Done`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, the payments must be logged in the database. Click the
`Payment Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and a pop-up
window loads, where the payment report details are entered.

Using the drop-down menu, select the `Export Format`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} for the payment report. The universal option is
`CSV`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, while all other available
options depend on the installed `payroll
localization <payroll_localizations>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.

Next, select the `Payment Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} using
the calendar selector. This is the date the paychecks are issued.

Some `payroll localizations <payroll_localizations>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} cause a `Bank Journal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
field to also appear. If visible, select the journal the payslips are
logged on, using the drop-down menu.

Once the pop-up window is configured, click the
`Generate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. The `Payment
Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button changes to a
`fa-download`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Download (filetype)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button. To save
a copy of the payment report, click the `fa-download`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `Download (filetype)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
button, select the location for the file, then click
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If the screen is enlarged beyond a certain amount, the
`fa-download`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Download
(filetype)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button is hidden from
view. In this scenario, click the `fa-ellipsis-v`{.interpreted-text
role="icon"} `(vertical ellipsis)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
icon to view and select the `fa-download`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Download (filetype)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option.
::::

After the report is created, click the `Mark as paid`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button to mark the payslips as paid in the database.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Odoo automatically creates the name of the pay run according to the
various selections made when creating the pay run (salary structure, pay
schedule, etc). In some situations, a company may want to rename the pay
runs, for better organization and a clearer understanding of what pay
slips are part of each pay run.

For example, a company pays its employees monthly, for both hourly and
salaried employees.

The names for their four August 2025 pay runs are:

- [Aug 1-14 2025 - Hourly]{.title-ref}
- [Aug 1-14 2025 - Salary]{.title-ref}
- [Aug 15-31 2025 - Hourly]{.title-ref}
- [Aug 15-31 2025 - Salary]{.title-ref}
::::




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/payroll_analysis.md ---

# Payroll analysis

The *Payroll Analysis* report displays the total net wage for the
company, for the last 365 days. This report allows companies to view
their payroll costs and identify any trends.

To view the *Payroll Analysis* report, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Reporting -->
Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

`Net Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is the default metric
displayed in the report, but other measures can be displayed if desired,
such as *gross wage* or *days of paid time off*. Click the
`Measures`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`fa-caret-down`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} button to view a
drop-down menu of other metrics to display. Click on the desired measure
to display the results.

![Payroll overview report showing payroll for the last 365 days.](payroll_analysis/payroll-report.png)

## View multiple metrics {#payroll_analysis/multiple}

It is possible to view multiple metrics at one time by viewing the
report in the *pivot table* view. This can aid management to determine
other trends, such as which departments do not take time off, or which
departments have the highest payroll costs.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

**Only one** measure is able to be displayed in the default
`fa-area-chart`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Graph`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} view. Multiple measures are **only** possible in the
`oi-view-pivot`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Pivot`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} view.
::::

To display the data in a pivot table, click on the
`oi-view-pivot`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Pivot`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button.

The default information displayed includes the number of payslips
(`# Payslip`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}), the number of
`Days of Paid Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Days of Unpaid Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, along with
the `Net Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Gross Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. All the information is
organized by department.

To display more information on the report, click the
`Measures`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`fa-caret-down`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} button to reveal a
drop-down menu. Click on any metric to display it on the pivot table.

![Pivot table view with the various metrics on display.](payroll_analysis/pivot.png)

## Use case: comparing payroll costs

Managers can compare payroll costs, and determine which departments have
raised their payroll costs, either by hiring more employees, or by
raising salaries.

To compare previous periods of time, first view the *Payroll Analysis*
report in a `pivot table
<payroll_analysis/multiple>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. Then, click
the `fa-caret-down`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `(Toggle Search
Panel)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} icon in the search bar, and
click `Start Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
`fa-caret-down`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} to reveal a list of time
periods (months, quarters, and years). Click on a desired time period,
and a `fa-adjust`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Comparison`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section appears in the
search bar. Click on one of the two available options, either
`Start Date: Previous Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
`Start Date:
Previous Year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

The report now displays three columns of information for every displayed
measure: a column for the current time period, a column for the previous
time period, and a `Variation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
column, which displays the difference between the two time periods in a
color-coded percentage (green for increases, red for decreases.)

::: example
In this example, the data shows an overall increase in the number of
payslips. Since the company pays all employees every two weeks, an
increase in the number of payslips (`#
Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) means that more employees
were hired, in this example, a 500% increase.

Additionally, both the `Net Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Gross Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} increased. The
department `RD US`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} showed the largest
growth, with both metrics increasing by approximately 350%.

![Pivot table view comparing two years of data.](payroll_analysis/comparison.png)
:::

::: seealso
`../../essentials/reporting`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/australia.md ---

# Australia

::::: {#payroll/l10n_au/payroll}
:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo is currently in the process of becoming compliant with STP Phase 2
and SuperStream. An announcement will be made as soon as companies can
use Odoo for payroll as a one-stop platform.
::::
:::::

## Setting up employees

### Employee settings

Create an employee by going to `Employees --> New`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Go to the `Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab, and configure the
`Australian Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, for
example checking if they are `Non-resident`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, if they benefit from the
`Tax-free Threshold`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, their
`TFN Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Employee Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, etc.

![Employee settings tab for the Australian payroll localization.](australia/payroll-employee-settings.png)

### Employee private information

In addition, some personal employee information is required for payroll
compliance with Single Touch Payroll, and to process superannuation
payments. Open the employee\'s `Private Information`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} tab and fill in the following fields:

- `Private Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Private Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Private Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Date of Birth`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Employee private information tab for the Australian payroll localization.](australia/payroll-employee-private.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo will remind you to complete the required data at different stages
of the process.
::::

### Super accounts and funds

You can add the superannuation details of new employees under the
employee\'s `Super
Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Click
`Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and make sure to include
the `Member Since`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} date,
`Member Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Super Fund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Use the `Proportion`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field if an
employee\'s contributions should sent to multiple funds at a time.
::::

![Configuring a super fund and super account for the Australian payroll localization.](australia/payroll-super-account.png)

To create a new `Super Fund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, start
typing its name and click `Create and
edit...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Fill in its:

- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `ABN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (APRA / SMSF)
- unique identifier (`USI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for APRA,
  `ESA`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for SMSF)
- (for SMFS only) `Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Configuring a super fund for the Australian payroll localization.](australia/payroll-super-fund.png)

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Manage all super accounts and funds by going to
`Payroll --> Configuration -->
Super Funds`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} or
`Super Accounts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo is currently in the process of becoming SuperStream-compliant.
::::

### Contracts

Once the employee has been created, create their employment contract by
clicking the `fa-book`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Contracts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button, or by going
to `Employees --> Employees -->
Contracts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Only one contract can be active per employee at a time. However, an
employee can be assigned consecutive contracts during their employment.
::::

#### Employment contract creation: recommended steps

![Recommended steps to create an employment contract.](australia/payroll-contract-flow.png)

#### 1. Basic contractual information

- Select the `Contract Start Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  and `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (set, or
  flexible for casual workers).
- Keep the `Salary Structure Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  set to `Australian Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This
  structure covers all of the ATO\'s tax schedules.

::: {#payroll/l10n_au/work-entry-source}
- (if using the Attendances or Planning app) Select the
  `Work Entry Source`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to define how
  working hours and days are accounted for on the employee\'s payslip.

  - `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: work entries
    are automatically generated based on the employee\'s working
    schedule, starting from the contract\'s start date.

    ::: example
    An employee works 38 hours a week, their contract begins on 01/01,
    today\'s date is 16/01, and the user generates a pay run from 14/01
    to 20/01. The working hours on the payslip will be automatically
    calculated to be 38 hours (5 \* 7.36 hours) if no unpaid leave is
    taken.
    :::

  - `Attendances`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the working
    schedule is ignored, and work entries are only generated after
    clocking in and out of the Attendances app. Note that attendances
    can be imported.

  - `Planning`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the working schedule
    is ignored, and work entries are generated from planning shifts in
    the Planning app.

  :::: important
  ::: title
  Important
  :::

  Timesheets do not impact work entries in Odoo. If you need to import
  your timesheets in Odoo, import them by going to
  `Payroll --> Work Entries --> Work Entries`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"} instead.
  ::::
:::

#### 2. Salary Information tab

- `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select
  `Fixed Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for full-time and
  part-time employees, and `Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} for casual workers. The latter allows you to add a
  `Casual
  Loading`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} percentage.

  :::: note
  ::: title
  Note
  :::

  For hourly workers, the `Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} field should exclude casual loading.
  ::::

- `Schedule Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: in Australia, only
  the following pay run frequencies are accepted:
  `Daily`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Weekly`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `Bi-weekly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (or
  fortnightly), `Monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Quarterly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- `Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} /\*period\*: assign a wage
  to the contract according to their pay frequency. On payslips, the
  corresponding annual and hourly rates will be computed automatically.

#### 3. Australia tab

![Australia tab of a contract.](australia/payroll-contract-australia.png)

- `General`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - Add the `Regular Pay Day`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if
    relevant.
  - Enable `Report in BAS - W3`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} if
    you choose to add PAYG withholding amounts in BAS section W3 instead
    of W2 (refer to the [ATO\'s web page on PAYG
    withholding](https://www.ato.gov.au/businesses-and-organisations/preparing-lodging-and-paying/business-activity-statements-bas/in-detail/instructions/payg-withholding-how-to-complete-your-activity-statement-labels#W3Otheramountswithheldexcludinganyamount)
    for more information).
- `Leave loading / workplace giving`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - Define whether your employees are
    `Eligible for Leave Loading`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  - Set the `Workplace Giving Employee`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} amount in exchange for deductions.
  - Set the `Salary Sacrificed Workplace Giving`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} amount (e.g., receiving a benefit instead of a
    deduction).
- `Super contributions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - Add the `Extra Negotiated Super %`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} on top of the *super guarantee*.
  - Add the `Extra Compulsory Super %`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} as per industrial agreements or awards obligations.
- `Salary sacrifice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Salary Sacrifice Superannuation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    allows employees to sacrifice part of their salary in favor of
    reportable employer superannuation contributions (RESC).

  - `Salary Sacrifice Other Benefits`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    allows them to sacrifice part of their salary towards some other
    form of benefit (refer to the [ATO\'s web page on Salary sacrificing
    for
    employees](https://www.ato.gov.au/individuals-and-families/jobs-and-employment-types/working-as-an-employee/salary-sacrificing-for-employees)
    for more information).

    :::: note
    ::: title
    Note
    :::

    As of Odoo 18, salary sacrificing for other benefits currently does
    not impact fringe benefits tax (FBT) reporting.
    ::::

#### 4. Salary attachments {#payroll/l10n_au/salary-attachments}

If the employee is to receive additional recurring payments every pay
run, whether indefinitely or for a set number of periods, click the
`fa-book`{.interpreted-text role="icon"}
`Salary Attachments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button on
the contract. Choose a `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and a
`Description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Around 32 recurring salary attachment types exist for Australia. These
are mostly related to allowances and child support. [Contact
us](https://www.odoo.com/help) for more information as to whether
allowances from your industry can be covered.
::::

#### 5. Run the contract

![Example of a running contract.](australia/payroll-contract-run.png)

Once all the information has been completed, change the contract stage
from `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
`Running`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

## Prepare pay runs

### Regular

Pay runs are created by going to
`Payroll --> Payslips --> Batches`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. After clicking `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, enter a `Batch Name`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, select a `Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
and click `Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Steps to generate payslips.](australia/payroll-payslips-generation.png)

Employees on a pay run can be filtered down by
`Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Job Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. There is no limit to
the amount of payslips that can be created in one batch. After clicking
`Generate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, one payslip is created
per employee in the `Waiting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} stage,
in which they can be reviewed and amended before validation.

![Generated payslips in the waiting stage.](australia/payroll-waiting-payslips.png)

On the payslip form view, there are two types of inputs:

- `Worked days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are computed based on
  the `work entry source set on the employee's
  contract <payroll/l10n_au/work-entry-source>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}. `Work entries can be configured
  <payroll/l10n_au/work-entry-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  according to different types: attendance, overtime, Saturday rate,
  Sunday rate, public holiday rate, etc.
- `Other inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} are individual
  payments or amounts of `different types
  <payroll/l10n_au/other-input-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
  (allowances, lump sums, deductions, termination payments, leaves,
  etc.) that have little to do with the hours worked during the current
  pay period. The
  `previously configured salary attachments <payroll/l10n_au/salary-attachments>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"} are simply recurring other inputs attached to a contract.

![Worked days and other inputs of a payslip.](australia/payroll-payslips-inputs.png)

Under the `Salary Computation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab,
Odoo automatically computes payslip rules based on employees, contracts,
worked hours, other input types, and salary attachments.

The salary structure *Australian Employee* has 35 payslip rules that
automatically compute and dynamically display according to the payslip
inputs.

::: example
![Salary computation tab of a payslip](australia/payroll-payslip-salary.png)

The following rules apply for that pay period in the above example:

- `Basic Salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: pre-sacrifice gross
  salary
- `Ordinary Time Earnings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: amount to
  which the super guarantee percentage needs to be applied
- `Salary Sacrifice Total`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: includes
  the \$150 sacrificed to superannuation
- `Taxable Allowance Payments`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  includes the \$10 allowance (*cents per KM* in this case)
- `Taxable Salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: gross salary
  amount minus non-taxable amounts
- `Salary Withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
  `Total Withholding`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: amounts to be
  withheld from the taxable salary
- `Net Salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the employee\'s net
  wage
- `Concessional Super Contribution`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  in this scenario, the amount sacrificed to superannuation, payable to
  the employee\'s super fund in addition to the super guarantee
