--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/egypt.md ---

# Egypt

The Egypt **Payroll** localization package enables payroll processing
that fully complies with Egyptian labor laws. It calculates progressive
income tax, employee- and employer-paid social security, and core salary
components, including housing and transportation allowances.

## Configuration

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Egypt **Payroll** localization:

  Name                                                                   Technical name                             Description
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------ ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `Egypt - Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                   [l10n_eg_hr_payroll]{.title-ref}           Payroll module includes all salary rules, leave logic, and compensation rules compliant with Egyptian Labor Law.
  `Egypt - Payroll with Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   [l10n_eg_hr_payroll_account]{.title-ref}   Adds account mappings related to payroll calculations.

::: seealso
`Egypt fiscal localization documentation <../../../finance/fiscal_localizations/egypt>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Egyptian employee contracts

Once an employee has been
`created in the database <../../employees/new_employee>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}, a
`contract must be created <payroll/new-contract>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

To check if the user already has a contract, navigate to the
**Employees** app, then click on the employee\'s Kanban card. The
`fa-book`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `Contracts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} smart button displays a red zero when no contract
exists. Otherwise, it displays
`In contract since (contract start date)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in green.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Contracts can also be found by navigating to
`Employees app --> Employees -->
Contracts`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. All contracts appear
in a list view, grouped by status.
::::

Populate the following contractual information in the
`Salary Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of the
contract:

- `Social Insurance Reference Amount`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}: Used as the base amount for calculating the
  `social insurance employee and employer portions
  <payroll/payroll_localizations/social-insurance>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.
- `Number of Leave Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Used for
  calculating the `provision amount for the annual
  leave for the employee <payroll/payroll_localizations/provisions>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.
- `Provision Number of Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  Corresponds with the number of days used in the calculation of the
  `provision value of the end of service for the employee
  <payroll/payroll_localizations/provisions>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.
- `Total Number of Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Refers to
  the number of days used to calculate the
  `end-of-service benefit paid to the employee when their employment with the company ends
  <payroll/payroll_localizations/end-of-service>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}.

## Social insurance {#payroll/payroll_localizations/social-insurance}

Social insurance rules calculate the contribution amounts that are to be
paid by the employer and employee to the
`NOSI (National Organization for Social Insurance)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}. This is only available for Egyptian employees.

The employer contributes 18.75% of the social insurance reference amount
for the employee. On the other hand, the employee contributes 11% of
their insurance reference amount, and that amount gets deducted from the
payslip amount.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The social insurance reference amount is set per employee in their
contracts.
::::

## Leaves

The following leave types are available to employees working in Egypt:
`Annual leave
<payroll/payroll_localizations/annual>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"},
`Sick leave <payroll/payroll_localizations/sick>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"},
`Unpaid leave <payroll/payroll_localizations/unpaid>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, and `Other leave types
<payroll/payroll_localizations/other>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

### Annual leave {#payroll/payroll_localizations/annual}

Employees are eligible for 21 days of annual leave, and if the employee
requires more days, they have to be
`requested from HR managers <time_off/request-allocation>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} accordingly.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Since the annual leave is fully paid, it is not connected to a salary
rule, but it will appear on the worked days on the payslip form and on
the PDF printout.
::::

### Sick leave {#payroll/payroll_localizations/sick}

Three cases exist for sick leaves in terms of the amount to be deducted
from the employee:

- `Fully paid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: first 30 calendar
  days each year (affects only working entries; no payroll deduction).

  **Payroll computation** =(Daily Wage)

- `75% paid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: next 60 days; payroll
  rule deducts 25% of an employee\'s salary.

  **Payroll computation** =(Daily Wage \* 0.25)

- `0% paid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: after 90 days; payroll
  rule deducts 100% of an employee\'s salary.

  **Payroll computation** =(Daily Wage \* 0.00)

### Unpaid leave {#payroll/payroll_localizations/unpaid}

Deductions are applied on the employee\'s salary based on the number of
unpaid leave days taken, and it is calculated by dividing the monthly
salary for the employee by 30 to get the daily salary and then
multiplying it by the number of unpaid leave days taken.

### Other leave types {#payroll/payroll_localizations/other}

These are leave types considered fully paid and do not affect the end
payslip, but are tracked in the working entries:

- Maternity leave
- Hajj leave
- Death leave

## Income tax

In Egypt, employees are subject to a progressive income tax system,
where tax rates increase with higher annual income brackets.

### Tax brackets

Depending on the annual income of the employee, the following rates
apply:

+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+
| Taxable | \<600k  | 600k -  | 700k -  | 800k -  | 900k -  | \>1.2M  |
| Amount  |         | 699k    | 799k    | 899k    | 1.2M    |         |
+=========+=========+=========+=========+=========+=========+=========+
| 0%      | 1-40k   | -       | -       | -       | -       | -       |
+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+
| 10%     | More    | 1 - 55k | -       | -       | -       | -       |
|         | than    |         |         |         |         |         |
|         | 40k to  |         |         |         |         |         |
|         | 55k     |         |         |         |         |         |
+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+
| 15%     | More    | More    | 1 - 70k | -       | -       | -       |
|         | than    | than    |         |         |         |         |
|         | 55k to  | 55k to  |         |         |         |         |
|         | 70k     | 70k     |         |         |         |         |
+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+
| 20%     | More    | More    | More    | 1 -     | -       | -       |
|         | than    | than    | than    | 200k    |         |         |
|         | 70k to  | 70k to  | 70k to  |         |         |         |
|         | 200k    | 200k    | 200k    |         |         |         |
+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+
| 22.5%   | More    | More    | More    | More    | 1 -     | -       |
|         | than    | than    | than    | than    | 400k    |         |
|         | 200k to | 200k to | 200k to | 200k to |         |         |
|         | 400k    | 400k    | 400k    | 400k    |         |         |
+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+
| 25%     | More    | More    | More    | More    | More    | 1 -     |
|         | than    | than    | than    | than    | than    | 1.2M    |
|         | 400k    | 400k    | 400k    | 400k    | 400k    |         |
+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+
| 27.5%   | -       | -       | -       | -       | -       | More    |
|         |         |         |         |         |         | than    |
|         |         |         |         |         |         | 1.2M    |
+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+

### Exemptions

Employees are eligible to an EGP 20,000 personal exception on their
gross income.

## Overtime

Depending on the time of day and the time at which the overtime is
recorded in, the additional amount to be paid to the employee can be as
follows:

- During daytime hours on working days, the amount is 1.35x times the
  employee\'s hourly wage.
- During nighttime hours on working days, the amount is 1.70x times the
  employee\'s hourly wage.
- On rest days and public holidays: The amount is 2.0x times the
  employee\'s hourly wage.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Overtime hours are registered as other inputs directly on payslips.
::::

## Provisions {#payroll/payroll_localizations/provisions}

Provisions are the amounts computed by the employer to account for the
payments made to the employee for
`EOS (end-of-service)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} benefits or annual
leave. And it is computed on a monthly basis.

### End of service benefit provision

It is computed by dividing the end of service Provision Number of Days
by 12 and multiplying the result by the daily salary for the employee.

[$$\text{Payroll computation} = \frac{\text{Provision Number of Days}}{12} \times \frac{\text{Wage} + \text{Allowances}}{30}$$]{.overflow-scroll}

### Annual leave provision

It is computed by dividing the number of leave days by 12 and
multiplying the result by the daily salary for the employee.

[$$\text{Payroll computation} = \frac{\text{Number of Leave Days}}{12} \times \frac{\text{Wage} + \text{Allowances}}{30}$$]{.overflow-scroll}

## End of service {#payroll/payroll_localizations/end-of-service}

At the end of the service slip that is generated for the employee, there
are the following points that are unique only to the payslip:

### Unused leaves compensation

The number of available annual leaves is shown on the employee\'s
record. It is based on the annual leave type defined in the Payroll
settings. It is calculated as the total remaining allocations for that
specific leave type assigned to the employee.

That number is then multiplied by the daily rate for the employee and
added as an allowance on their payslip.

### End of service benefit

It is calculated by multiplying the daily wage of the employee by the
number of days for the end of service that is set in the employee\'s
contract.

[$$\text{Payroll computation} = \frac{\text{Wage + Allowances}}{30} \times \text{End of Service Number of Days}$$]{.overflow-scroll}

## Out of contract

Out-of-contract days are the days that fall within the payslip period
but are not included in the employee\'s contract period. The
corresponding amount is added as a deduction on the payslip and is
calculated by multiplying the number of out-of-contract days by the
employee\'s daily wage.

[$$\text{Payroll computation} = \frac{\text Wage + Allowances}{\text{Days in the Month}} \times \text{Out of Contract Days}$$]{.overflow-scroll}




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/employment_hero.md ---

# Employment Hero Payroll

The [Employment Hero](https://employmenthero.com/) module synchronises
payslip accounting entries (e.g., expenses, social charges, liabilities,
taxes) automatically from Employment Hero to Odoo. Payroll
administration is still done in Employment Hero, but the **journal
entries** are done in Odoo.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

KeyPay was rebranded as **Employment Hero** in March 2023.
::::

## Configuration {#employment_hero/configuration}

1.  `Activate <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the
    `Employment Hero Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} module
    ([l10n_employment_hero]{.title-ref}).

2.  Configure the **Employment Hero API** by going to
    `Accounting --> Configuration
    --> Settings`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. More fields
    become visible after clicking on `Enable Employment Hero
    Integration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

    ![Enabling Employment Hero Integration in Odoo Accounting displays new fields in the
    settings](employment_hero/employment-hero-integration.png)

    - The API Key can be found in the `My Account`{.interpreted-text
      role="guilabel"} section of the Employment Hero platform.

      ![\"Account Details\" section on the Employment Hero dashboard](employment_hero/employment-hero-myaccount.png)

    - The **Payroll URL** is left empty by default to avoid any
      confusion. Please fill it according to the documentation specific
      to the localization.

      :::: note
      ::: title
      Note
      :::

      Employment hero is available for
      `Australia <payroll/l10n_au/employment-hero>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"},
      `Malaysia <malaysia/employment-hero>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"},
      `New Zealand <new-zealand/employment-hero>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"},
      `Singapore <singapore/employment-hero>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"}, and the
      `United Kingdom <localization/united-kingdom/employment-hero>`{.interpreted-text
      role="ref"}.
      ::::

    - The **Business ID** can be found in the Employment Hero URL.
      (i.e., [189241]{.title-ref})

      ![The Employment Hero Business ID number is in the URL](employment_hero/employment-hero-business-id.png)

    - Choose any Odoo journal to post the payslip entries.

3.  Configure the tax by going to
    `Accounting --> Configuration --> Taxes`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}. Create the necessary taxes for the Employment
    Hero payslip entries. Fill in the tax code from **Employment Hero**
    in the `Matching Employment Hero Tax`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} field.

## How does the API work?

The API syncs the journal entries from Employment Hero to Odoo and
leaves them in draft mode. The reference includes the Employment Hero
payslip entry ID in brackets for the user to easily retrieve the same
record in Employment Hero and Odoo.

![Example of a Employment Hero Journal Entry in Odoo Accounting (Australia)](employment_hero/employment-hero-journal-entry.png)

By default, the synchronisation happens once per week. The records can
be fetched manually by going to
`Accounting --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and, in the `Enable
Employment Hero Integration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option,
click on `Fetch Payruns Manually`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Employment Hero payslip entries also work based on double-entry
bookkeeping.

The accounts used by Employment Hero are defined in the section
`Payroll settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Chart of Accounts menu in Employment Hero](employment_hero/employment-hero-chart-of-accounts.png)

For the API to work, create the same accounts as the default accounts of
the Employment Hero business (**same name and same code**) in Odoo. The
correct account types must be chosen in Odoo to generate accurate
financial reports.




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/hong_kong.md ---

# Hong Kong

::::: {#payroll/l10n_hk/payroll}
:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Ensure the `Hong Kong - Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
([l10n_hk_hr_payroll]{.title-ref}) module is installed before
proceeding.
::::
:::::

## Create employees {#payroll/l10n_hk/create_employees}

Go to the `Employees`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"} app and
click `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Then, configure the
following fields:

- Under the `Work Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab

  - `Working Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    `HK Standard 40 hours/week`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    option **must** be selected.

- Under the `Private Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab

  - `Surname, Given Name, Name in Chinese`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}: name of the employee.
  - `Private Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: address of the
    employee.
  - `Bank Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    employee\'s bank account number.
  - `Current Rental`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: employee\'s
    rental records (if rental allowance is applicable).
  - `Autopay Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    `BBAN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `SVID`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}, `EMAL`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, etc.
  - `Autopay Reference`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: autopay
    reference number.
  - `Identification No`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: HKID of the
    employee.
  - `Gender`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: gender of the employee.

  :::: important
  ::: title
  Important
  :::

  For the `Bank Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, this
  account should be set as `Trusted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  before further processing.

  To achieve this, click on the right-arrow button next to
  `Bank Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. Set
  the `Send Money`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
  `Trusted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} by clicking on the
  toggle.
  ::::

  :::: note
  ::: title
  Note
  :::

  To populate the `Current Rental`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  click on the `History`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.
  Then, click on `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Fill in the
  relevant details and save the rental record. Upon saving the record,
  the rental contract `state`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} will be
  visible (at the top-right corner) and can be set to
  `Running`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  ::::

- Under the `HR Settings`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab:

  - `Volunteer Contribution Option`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    select either `Only Mandatory
    Contribution`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `With Fixed %VC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
    `Cap 5% VC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  - `MPF Manulife Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: account
    number, if applicable.

## Manage contracts {#payroll/l10n_hk/manage_contracts}

Once the new employee has been created, click the
`Contracts`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button on the
employee record, or navigate to
`Employees app --> Employees --> Contracts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Only **one** contract can be active simultaneously per employee, but an
employee can be assigned consecutive contracts during their employment.
::::

The following are critical for setting up a contract:

- `Salary Structure Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: set as
  `CAP57: Hong Kong Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Contract Start Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: start date
  of employment.
- `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: set as
  `HK Standard 40 hours/week`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (from
  employee record).
- `Work Entry Source`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select either
  `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Attendances`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
  `Planning`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This field determines
  how the work entries are accounted for in the payslip.
  - `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the work
    entries are generated automatically based on the employee\'s working
    schedule.
  - `Attendances`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the work entries
    are generated based on the check-in/out period logged in the
    *Attendances*.
  - `Planning`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the work entries are
    generated from planning shifts only.
- Under the `Salary Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab
  - `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: select
    `Fixed Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for Full-time or
    Part-time employees, or `Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} for employees who are paid hourly.
  - `Schedule Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the frequency of
    payslip issuance.
  - `Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    `Monthly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
    `Hourly`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} depending on the `Wage
    Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  - `Internet Subscription`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: this is
    an **optional** field to provide additional internet allowance on
    top of the current salary package.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Timesheets do **not** impact work entries in Odoo.
::::

Once all information has been setup, set the contract status to
`Running`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} by clicking the
`Running`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button in the top-right of
the page.

![Hong Kong employment contract.](hong_kong/hk-contract.png)

## Generate payslips {#payroll/l10n_hk/running_payslips}

Once the employees, and their contracts, are configured, payslips can be
generated in the *Payroll* app.

Odoo provides **four** different salary structures under CAP57
regulation:

1.  `CAP57: Employees Monthly Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    to process the monthly employee salary.
2.  `CAP57: Payment in Lieu of Notice`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}: to process final payment upon contract termination
    using `ADW (Average Daily Wage)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.
3.  `CAP57: Long Service Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    applicable to employees with more than five years of service upon
    contract termination.
4.  `CAP57: Severance Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
    applicable to employees with more than two years of service upon
    contract termination.

Before running the payslips, the accounts used in the salary rule can be
adjusted by navigating to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Rules`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

![Hong Kong Salary Rules.](hong_kong/hk-salary-rules.png)

Odoo can create pay runs in two ways: via
`batch <payroll/l10n_hk/batch_payslips>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
or `individual <payroll/l10n_hk/individual_payslips>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} payslips.

### Batch payslips {#payroll/l10n_hk/batch_payslips}

This method of payslip generation is used for recurring payments, since
multiple employee payslips can be managed at once. Go to
`Payroll app --> Payslips --> Batches`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

1.  Click on `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
2.  Enter a `Batch Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (e.g.
    [2024 - Jan]{.title-ref}) and `Period`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"} (e.g. [01/01/2024]{.title-ref}
    -[01/31/2024]{.title-ref}).
3.  Click on `Generate Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
4.  Choose which `Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    to use for this batch. The department filter allows the batch to
    only apply to a specific group of employees.
5.  Click on `Generate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
6.  A `Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button is
    created automatically.

Next, click `Create Draft Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
generate a draft journal entry found in the
`Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab of each payslip. A
`Confirmation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} pop-up window appears
asking `Are you sure you want to proceed?`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. Click `Ok`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
create the journal entries.

### Individual payslips {#payroll/l10n_hk/individual_payslips}

Go to `Payroll app --> Payslips --> All Payslips`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

This method of payslip generation is commonly used to handle
non-recurring payments (e.g.
`CAP57: Payment in Lieu of Notice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`CAP57: Long Service Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`CAP57: Severance Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}).

1.  Click on `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
2.  Select an `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. When
    selected, the `Contract`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
    filled out automatically.
3.  Add a pay `Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
4.  Select a salary `Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (e.g.
    `CAP57: Employees Monthly Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}).
5.  The `Worked Days & Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab
    automatically compute the worked days/hours and time off leaves that
    are applicable.
6.  Additional payslip items can be added at this time (e.g.
    `Commissions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Deductions`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}) under the
    `Other Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section.
7.  Click on `Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button
    to generate the payslip lines. This button updates the
    `Salary Computation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

If the work entry for an employee was amended, click the
`fa-cog`{.interpreted-text role="icon"} `(gear)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} icon, then click
`Recompute Whole Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to refresh
the payslip\'s `Worked Days &
Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.
::::

The `Salary Computation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab shows
the detailed breakdown of the computation, based on the salary rules
configured for each structure type.

1.  `Rent Allowance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: amount derived
    from the employee\'s active rental record.
2.  `Basic Salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: amount of base
    salary provided (after rent allowance deduction).
3.  `713 Gross`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: net payable amount
    considering *Commission*, *Internet Allowance*, *Reimbursements*,
    *Back-pay*, *Deduction*, etc.
4.  `MPF Gross`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: net payable amount
    from 713 gross after consideration of additional allowances,
    deductions, and end-of-year payment.
5.  `Employee Mandatory Contribution`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}: employee MPF Contribution.
6.  `Employer Mandatory Contribution`{.interpreted-text
    role="guilabel"}: employer MPF Contribution.
7.  `Gross`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: net payable amount from
    MPF gross after consideration of MPF deductions.
8.  `Net Salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: final payable
    amount to be paid to the employee.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

There are no MPF contributions for the first month. Both employee and
employer contribution starts on second month.
::::

![Hong Kong Salary computation.](hong_kong/hk-salary-computation.png)

Under the `Other Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section in
`Worked Days & Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, there are
additional manual input types:

- `Back Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: additional salary
  payout can be included under this category.
- `Commission`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the commission earned
  during the period can be manually entered here.
- `Global Deduction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: a lump-sum
  deduction from the entire payslip.
- `Global Reimbursement`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: a lump-sum
  reimbursement to the entire payslip.
- `Referral Fee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: the additional
  bonus offered for any form of business-related referral.
- `Moving Daily Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: to override
  the `ADW (Average Daily Wage)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} value
  used for leaves computation.
- `Skip Rent Allowance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: if set, the
  rental allowance is excluded from the current payslip.
- `Custom Average Monthly Salary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: to
  override the average monthly salary used for end-of-year payment (rule
  is only applicable to payslips generated in December).
- `Lieu of Notice Period (Months)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  only applicable to `CAP57: Payment in Lieu
  of Notice`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} salary structure. By
  default, the final payout is set as 1-month. Use the
  `Count`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field under the
  `Other Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section to set a
  different notice period duration.

Once the payslips are ready, click on `Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, followed by `Create Draft
entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to generate a draft journal
entry found in the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab
of the payslip.

## Pay employees

Once the draft journal entries have been posted, the company can now pay
the employees. The user can choose between **two** different *payment
methods*:

- From the employee\'s payslip
  (`Payroll app --> Payslips --> All Payslips`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}), once the payslip\'s journal entry has been
  posted, click `Register Payment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  The process is the same as
  `paying vendor bills <../../../finance/accounting/payments>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"}. Select the desired bank journal and payment method, then
  later reconcile the payment with the corresponding bank statement.
- For batch payments
  (`Payroll app --> Payslips --> Batches`{.interpreted-text
  role="menuselection"}), once all draft journal entries from the batch
  are confirmed, click `Mark as Paid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  to post the payment journal entry. Then
  `create a payment <../../../finance/accounting/payments>`{.interpreted-text
  role="doc"} in the *Accounting* app, and reconcile accordingly.

## Attendances and hourly wage

To configure the contract for an employee paid hourly using the
*Attendances* app for hours tracking, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Contracts --> Contracts`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Create a new
`contract <payroll/l10n_hk/manage_contracts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. It is important to remember to set the
`Work Entry Source`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as
`Attendances`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} as
`Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

To record the hours logged by the employee using *Attendances* app:

1.  Go to `Attendances app`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.
2.  The employee can check-in/out, via the kiosk mode and the time will
    be logged automatically.
3.  In the `Payroll app`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, review
    the attendance work entries generated from
    `Payroll app --> Work Entries --> Work Entries`{.interpreted-text
    role="menuselection"}.
4.  Next, generate the
    `payslips <payroll/l10n_hk/running_payslips>`{.interpreted-text
    role="ref"} and process the payment.

![Hong Kong Attendance Work Entry.](hong_kong/hk-attendance-work-entry.png)

![Hong Kong Attendance Payslip.](hong_kong/hk-attendance-payslip.png)

## Time Off with Payroll

The work entry types and time off types are fully integrated between the
*Time Off* and *Payroll* apps. There are several default time off types
and work entry types specific to Hong Kong which are installed
automatically along with the *Hong Kong - Payroll* module.

Go to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Work Entry Types`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and click `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

There are two checkboxes to be considered when setting up the work entry
type:

- `Use 713`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Include this leave type
  as part of 713 computation.
- `Non-full pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: 80% of the
  `ADW (Average Daily Wage)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

![Hong Kong Work Entry Type.](hong_kong/hk-work-entry-type.png)

::: seealso
`Creating and configuring work entry types <payroll/work-entry-types>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}
:::

## Understanding 713 Ordinance

The *Hong Kong - Payroll* module is compliant with 713 Ordinance which
relates to the `ADW (Average Daily Wage)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
computation to ensure fair compensation for employees.

The ADW computation is as follows:

![`ADW (Average Daily Wage)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} equals the
total wage in a 12-month period, minus the wages of non-full pay,
divided by the total days in a 12-month period minus the days of
non-full pay.](hong_kong/hk-adw.png){alt="Hong Kong ADW Formula."}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

For 418 compliance, there is no automated allocation of the *Statutory
Holiday* entitlement to the employees. As soon as 418 requirements are
met, manually allocate the leaves, via the *Time Off* app.
::::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Before generating payslips, ensure the statuses are
`Done`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to validate the outcome.
::::

  Period                         Days   Wage         Commission   Total        ADW                        Leave Value
  ------------------------------ ------ ------------ ------------ ------------ -------------------------- --------------------------
  Jan                            31     \$20200      \$0          \$20200      \$651.61 (\$20200/31)      N/A
  Feb                            28     \$20200      \$5000       \$25200      \$769.49 (\$45400/59)      N/A
  Mar (One Day Annual Leave)     31     \$20324.33   \$0          \$20324.33   \$730.27 (\$65724.33/90)   \$769.49
  Apr (One Day 80% Sick Leave)   30     \$20117.56   \$0                                                  \$584.22 (\$730.27\*0.8)

::: example
Here is an example demonstrating the 713 logic:

- **Jan**: Generate a payslip with a monthly wage of \$20200. The
  `ADW (Average Daily Wage)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is always
  computed on a cumulative basis of the trailing 12-months.

- **Feb**: Generate a similar payslip, but add an
  `Other Input Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
  `Commission`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- **Mar**: Apply for **one** full-paid annual leave in March. The salary
  compensation for the leave taken is based on
  `ADW (Average Daily Wage)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} thus far.

  ![Hong Kong March 713.](hong_kong/hk-march-713.png)

- **Apr**: Apply for a 1-day non-full pay leave in April. Since this is
  a non-full pay leave, the `ADW (Average Daily Wage)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} is computed accordingly.

  ![Hong Kong April 713.](hong_kong/hk-apr-713.png)
:::

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The value of `ADW (Average Daily Wage)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
is computed in the backend, and not be visible to the user.
::::

::: seealso
\- [HK 713
Ordinance](https://www.labour.gov.hk/eng/public/wcp/ConciseGuide/Appendix1.pdf) -
[HK 418 Ordinance](https://www.workstem.com/hk/en/blog/418-regulations/)
:::

## Generate reports

Before generating the below reports, setup the following in
`Settings app -->
Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}.

Configure the following in the `Accounting`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section:

- Tick the `Payroll HSBC Autopay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  checkbox.
  - `Autopay Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Set as
    `H2H Submission`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
  - Select the `Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to use.

Configure the following in the `HK Localization`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section:

- `Employer's Name shows on reports`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Employer's File Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `Manulife MPF Scheme`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

![Hong Kong Payroll Settings.](hong_kong/hk-report-setup.png)

### IRD report

There are a total of **four** IRD reports available:

- `IR56B`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: employer\'s Return of
  Remuneration and Pensions.
- `IR56E`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: notification of
  Commencement of Employment.
- `IR56F`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: notification of Ceasation
  of Employment (remaining in HK).
- `IR56G`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: notification of Ceasation
  of Employment (departing from HK permanently).

Go to `Payroll app --> Reporting`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and select one of the `IR56B/E/F/G
Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} options:

1.  Click on `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
2.  Fill in the relevant information for the IRD report.
3.  Click on `Populate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and the
    `Eligible Employees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} smart button
    appears.
4.  The `Employee Declarations`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
    status is `Draft`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and changed to
    `Generated PDF`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} status once the
    schedule runs.
5.  Once the PDF is generated, the IRD form may be downloaded.

![Hong Kong IR56B report.](hong_kong/hk-ir56b.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The scheduled action called *Payroll: Generate pdfs* can be manually
triggered. It is set by default to run the PDF generation monthly.
::::

### Manulife MPF sheet

Go to
`Payroll app --> Reporting --> Manulife MPF Sheet`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}.

1.  Click on `New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
2.  Select the relevant `Year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
    `Month`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
    `Sequence No.`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
3.  Click on `Create XLSX`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
4.  The *Manulife MPF XLSX* file is then generated, and available for
    download.

![Hong Kong Manulife Sheet.](hong_kong/hk-manulife-sheet.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Odoo will not be developing further reports for other MPF trustee as
there will soon be an eMPF platform setup by the local government.
::::

::: seealso
[eMPF](https://www.mpfa.org.hk/en/empf/overview)
:::

### HSBC autopay report

If *HSBC Autopay* is selected as the batch payment method, click on
`Create HSBC Autopay
Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and fill in the mandatory
fields:

![Hong Kong HSBC Autopay wizard.](hong_kong/hk-generate-autopay.png)

This creates an `.apc`{.interpreted-text role="file"} file format which
can be uploaded to the HSCB portal for processing.




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/india.md ---

# India

**Indian Payroll Localization** provides the complete Indian salary
structure, including allowances, deductions, statutory compliance, and
employee benefits. It automatically calculates and deducts contributions
for both employees and employers, ensuring full compliance with Indian
labor and taxation laws.

Before configuring the Indian localization, refer to the general
`payroll <../../payroll>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} documentation,
which includes the basic information for all localizations, as well as
all universal settings and fields.

## Apps & Modules {#payroll/indian_apps}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Indian payroll localization:

  Name                                                                   Technical name                 Description
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------ -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  `India - Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                   `l10n_in_hr_payroll`           Provides the statutory salary structure, allowances, deductions, and compliance rules for Indian payroll.
  `India - Payroll with Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}   `l10n_in_hr_payroll_account`   Adds accounting entries and mappings for payslips generated with the Indian localization.
  `India - Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}                  `l10n_in_hr_holidays`          Adds India-specific leave policies, including sandwich leave and optional holidays.

::: seealso
`Configure the Indian fiscal localization <../../../finance/fiscal_localizations/india>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## General Configurations

First, the company must be configured. Navigate to
`Settings app --> Users & Companies --> Companies`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. From the list, select the desired company, and
configure the following fields:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the business
  name in this field.
- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Complete the full
  address, including the City, State, Zip Code, and Country.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The state selected in the company\'s address is associated as the work
address by default for the employee, and the one used to calculate
payroll taxes.
::::

- `GSTIN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a 15-digit tax
  identification number required for GST-registered businesses in India.
- `PAN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a 10-character
  alphanumeric ID issued by the Income Tax Department for tax reporting.
- `Company ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the business\'s
  state ID number.
- `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: By default, INR is
  selected. If not, select INR from the drop-down menu.
- `UPI Id`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter a virtual payment
  address used for receiving digital payments through India\'s UPI
  system.
- `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the company phone
  number.
- `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the email used for
  general contact information.

Next, configure the payroll settings for the Indian payroll
localization. Navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and enable the following options that apply to
the company:

- `Employee Provident Fund <payroll/epf>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  Enter your `EPF (Employee Provident Fund)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} Employer ID (alphanumeric code issued by the
  `EPFO (Employees' Provident Fund Organisation)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}) to enable automatic
  `PF (Provident Fund)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} deductions and
  contributions. Enabling this will activate the **Provident Fund (PF)
  contribution** section in employee payroll setting and contract
  template.
- `Professional Tax <payroll/pt>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}: Enter
  your state-issued `PT (Professional Tax)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} registration number (usually numeric/alphanumeric) to
  allow salary-based professional tax deduction. Enabling this will
  activate the **Professional Tax slab** field under the **Tax
  Deductions** section in employee payroll setting and contract
  template.
- `Employee State Insurance <payroll/esic>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}: Enter your
  `ESIC (Employee State Insurance)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  Employer Code/IP Number (10-digit numeric ID provided by ESIC) to
  process mandatory medical insurance contributions. Enabling this will
  activate the **ESIC (Employee State Insurance)** section in employee
  payroll setting and contract template.
- `Labour Welfare Fund <payroll/lwf>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}:
  Enter your `LWF (Labour Welfare Fund)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  Establishment/Identification Number (state-issued numeric/alphanumeric
  ID) to deduct and remit statutory welfare fund contributions. Enabling
  this will activate the **Labour Welfare Fund (LWF)** section in
  employee payroll setting and contract template.

![Indian Localization Settings](india/in-payroll-configuration.png)

## Employees

Create the `employee <../../employees/new_employee>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"} record before configuring the salary package in the
`contract <../contracts>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}.

Employee contracts serve as the foundation for payroll calculations,
with the salary structure covering allowances, deductions, and statutory
compliances configured directly within the contract.

### Personal Tab

Configure the following information in the employee\'s
`Personal Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:

- `UAN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: A 12-digit unique identifier
  issued by the
  `EPFO (Employees' Provident Fund Organisation)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} for each employee; it links all
  `PF (Provident Fund)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} accounts across
  different employers and is used for tracking PF contributions,
  withdrawals, and transfers.
- `ESIC Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: A 17-digit unique
  Insurance Number assigned to an employee under the Employee State
  Insurance Corporation; used to provide access to medical benefits,
  insurance coverage, and compliance under the
  `ESI (Employee State Insurance)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  scheme.
- `PAN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: A 10-character alphanumeric
  identifier issued by the Income Tax Department; used for income-tax
  reporting, verifying employee identity, and ensuring correct
  `TDS (Tax Deducted at Source)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  processing.
- `LWF Account Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: A
  state-specific employee Labour Welfare Fund ID; used to record
  employee-level contributions toward the Labour Welfare Fund, enabling
  welfare-related statutory compliance.

### Payroll Tab

#### Statutory compliance

##### Provident Fund (PF) Contribution {#payroll/epf}

The **EPF** is a retirement benefit scheme for employees, where both the
employer and employee contribute a fixed percentage of the employee\'s
salary each month.

The Provident Fund (PF) configuration option in Indian Payroll allows you to choose whether to:

:   - Cap Basic at â‚¹15,000 (as per EPF statutory rule), or
    - Calculate PF on the actual Basic (prorated wage) without cap.

![Provident Fund Section](india/in-pf-section.png)

::: seealso
More information about [Employees\' Provident Fund Organisation
(EPFO)](https://www.epfindia.gov.in/site_en/index.php)
:::

##### Tax Deductions {#payroll/pt}

Tax Deductions allow companies to define statutory and employer-specific
tax deductions, such as Professional Tax and TDS, which are
automatically applied during payslip computation.

- Tax deductions are statutory or company-defined amounts subtracted
  from an employee\'s salary to comply with income tax and state tax
  regulations.
- The **Professional Tax** is a state-level tax levied on employees\'
  income.
- The system reads the employee\'s income and state from the contract
  and automatically applies the correct PT slab rate when generating
  payslips.

::: seealso
More information about [Professional
Tax](https://cleartax.in/s/professional-tax)
:::

![Tax deduction Section](india/in-tax-deduction-section.png)

##### Employee State Insurance (ESIC) {#payroll/esic}

The **ESIC** is a social security scheme that provides medical and cash
benefits to employees and their families.

Both employer and employee contributions are automatically calculated as
a percentage of the wage.

::: seealso
More information about [Employees\' State Insurance Corporation
(ESIC)](https://esic.gov.in/)
:::

![ESIC Section](india/in-esic-section.png)

##### Labour Welfare Fund (LWF) {#payroll/lwf}

The **Labour Welfare Fund (LWF)** is a statutory compliance aimed at the
welfare of workers, managed by state-specific Labour Welfare Boards.

Fixed contributions for both employer and employee can be defined.

::: seealso
More information about [Labour Welfare Fund
(LWF)](https://cleartax.in/s/labour-welfare-fund)
:::

![Labour Welfare Fund Section](india/in-lwf-section.png)

#### Salary benefits

Salary benefits such as phone and internet subscriptions, meal vouchers,
company transport, and medical insurance can be configured in employee
contracts as allowances or benefits, and they will be automatically
reflected in the employee\'s payslip.

Configure the **Benefits** and **Insurance Benefits** sections on the
contract, then set the monthly contribution amounts for each benefit.
Typical examples include:

- **Benefits**: Phone subscription, internet subscription, meal
  vouchers, company transport, and similar allowances.
- **Insurance Benefits**: Medical insurance, insured spouse, insured
  first child, insured second child, etc.

![Indian Benefits](india/in-benefits.png)

#### Other Deductions

Other Deductions include statutory items such as Gratuity.

Gratuity is a statutory employer contribution calculated as a percentage
of the employee\'s wage, accrued monthly as part of end-of-service
benefits.

![Other deduction section](india/in-other-deduction-section.png)

## Configure salary from contract template

Configure the Employee Salary page to automatically load and display
details based on the default contract template.

When creating a new employee, load the default contract template in the
`Employee Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab to configure a
predefined salary package automatically.

![Load Indian Contract Template](india/in-contract-template-load.png)

The contract template defines the salary structure and includes all
applicable salary components, statutory compliances, and benefits.

To configure the contract template go to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Contract Templates`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, create or open an existing contract template,
then In the contract template, configure the salary package for the
applicant/employee, including the **Salary components**, **Statutory
compliances**, **Benefits** and **Insurance Benefits** described above.

> ![Indian Contract Template](india/in-contract-template.png)

## Time off Configuration

The Indian Localization for Time Off includes specific leave management
features designed for Indian organizations, such as
`Sandwich Leave <payroll/in_sandwich>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and
`Optional Holidays <payroll/in_optional>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

Install the `India - Time Off`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
application to enable these policies.

::: seealso
`About Time Off <../../time_off>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

### Sandwich leave {#payroll/in_sandwich}

A *sandwich Leave* is a time off policy where weekends and public
holidays falling between two applied leave days are also counted as time
off. To enable this on a
`time off types <time_off/time-off-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
navigate to
`Time Off app --> Configuration --> Time Off Types`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and click the desired time off type to enable
this feature on. Tick the checkbox next to
`Sandwich Leave`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Configuration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section of the
`Time Off Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form.

::: example
An employee applies for leave on Friday November 28th and Monday
December 1st. Both Saturday November 29th and Sunday November 30th (the
weekend) are also counted as time off, making the total time off
requested **four** days *not* **two** days.
:::

### Optional holidays {#payroll/in_optional}

Optional Holidays, also called *Flexible Holidays* are special holidays
assigned to specific calendar dates, such as regional or religious
holidays. Employees may apply for leave only on these defined dates.

If an employee attempts to request leave on any other date, a validation
error will be raised.

To enable this on a
`time off types <time_off/time-off-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
navigate to
`Time Off app --> Configuration --> Time Off Types`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and create a new time off type or open an
existing one, Tick the checkbox next to
`Limited to Optional Holiday`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Configuration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section of the
`Time Off Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form. Then, go to
`Time Off app --> Configuration --> Optional Holidays`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Create new optional holidays by assigning them to
specific calendar dates The optional holiday can be seen on the
dashboard

Employees can request these leave types, but only on the configured
optional (flexible) holiday dates.

## Payroll configuration

When the **l10n_in_hr_payroll** module is
`installed <payroll/indian_apps>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, a new
salary structure for India is added:
`India: Regular Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} under the
`India: Employee Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} structure type.

The salary structure contains all salary rules needed to calculate
wages, statutory salary structure, allowances, deductions, and
compliance rules.

### Salary rules

The salary rules control how each allowance, deduction, benefit, and
statutory compliances is calculated.

To view the salary rules, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Structures`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click on `India: Employee Pay`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to expand it, and then click
`India: Regular Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![Indian Regular Pay](india/in-regular-pay-structure.png)

### Rule parameters

Certain payroll calculations require specific rates or wage caps, and
Rule Parameters provide values either as percentages or fixed amounts
that can be referenced in salary rules.

Rule parameters can be accessed via
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Rule Parameters`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. All the Rule parameters will be listed here with
the associated salary rules.

Rule parameters are used by salary rules for statutory calculations,
ensuring that payslips stay compliant with national and state-level
regulations.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo updates rule parameters as needed. It is recommended **not to
modify** rule parameters unless there is an official change in national
or state regulations.
::::

## Run India Payroll

Before running payroll, the payroll officer must validate employee
`work entries
<../work_entries>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} to confirm pay accuracy
and catch any errors. This includes ensuring that all time off is
approved, any overtime is appropriate.

Work entries are synchronized based on the employee\'s
`contract <../contracts>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} configuration.
Odoo pulls from the assigned working schedule, attendance records,
planning schedule, and approved time off.

Any `discrepancies or conflicts <payroll/conflicts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} must be resolved, then the work entries can be
`regenerated <payroll/regenerate-work-entries>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Once everything is correct, draft payslips can be `created individually
<payroll/process>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} or in
`groups <../pay_runs>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, referred to in the
Payroll app as Pay Runs.

![The work entries for a pay run, with some time off entered in the work entries.](india/in-work-entries.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To cut down on the payroll officer\'s time, it is typical to process
payslips in batches, either by wage type (fixed salary vs hourly), pay
schedule (weekly, bi-weekly, monthly, etc.), department (direct cost vs.
administration), or any other grouping that best suits the company.
::::

The process of running payroll includes different actions that need to
be executed to ensure that the amount withheld from payroll taxes is
correct, the amount that the employee receives as their net salary is
correct, and the computation of hours worked reflects the employee\'s
actual hours worked, among others.

When running a payroll batch, check that the period, company, and
employees included are correct *before* starting to analyze or validate
the data.

Once the payslips are drafted, review them for accuracy. Check the
`Worked Days & Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, and
ensure the listed worked time is correct, as well as any other inputs.
Add any missing inputs, such as commissions, tips, reimbursements, that
are missing.

Next, check the various totals (gross pay, employee taxes, benefits,
employer taxes, net salaries), then click
`Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to update the salary
calculations, if there were edits. If everything is correct, click
`Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![The worked days tab of a payslip.](india/in-check-payslips.png)

### Accounting check

The accounting process when running payroll has two components:
`creating journal entries
<payroll/in-journal>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, and
`registering payments <payroll/in-register>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

#### Journal entry creation {#payroll/in-journal}

After payslips are confirmed and validated, journal entries are posted
either individually, or in a batch. The journal entry is created first
as a draft.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

It must be decided if journal entries are done individually or in
batches *before* running payroll.
::::

![All payslips in a draft state.](india/in-draft-payslip.png)

Six accounts from the India `CoA (Chart of Accounts)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} are included with the India payroll localization:

- \`210100 Salary Expense\`: Records the gross salary expense for
  employees, including the basic pay and any earnings not allocated to
  specific allowance accounts. This account captures the main salary
  cost for financial reporting.
- \`300001 House Rent Allowance Expense\`: Records the portion of salary
  paid as House Rent Allowance. Used to track HRA separately for
  statutory reporting and tax computation purposes.
- \`300002 Standard Allowance Expense\`: Records recurring allowances
  that are part of the salary package but do not fall under special
  categories like HRA or performance bonus. Examples include transport
  or utility allowances.
- \`300005 Performance Bonus\`: Records discretionary or
  performance-linked bonuses paid to employees. This account helps
  separate one-time or variable incentive costs from regular salary
  expenses.
- \`300011 Leave Travel Allowance Expense\`: Tracks Leave Travel
  Allowance paid to employees. LTA is often partially tax-exempt under
  Indian Income Tax rules, so tracking it separately is important for
  compliance.
- \`300004 Fixed Allowance Expense\`: Records fixed, recurring
  allowances paid to employees such as meal allowances, special duty
  allowances, or any other structured component of the salary.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `CoA (Chart of Accounts)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
configuration is set up by default when a company is located in India.
The account codes and names can be customized to match the company\'s
salary structure and reporting requirements. If a salary rule (used in a
salary structure) does not have an associated
`CoA (Chart of Accounts)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} account, Odoo
will use the default account [Salary Expense]{.title-ref} to create the
journal entry, regardless of the type of move.
::::

Once the journal entry draft appears correct, post the journal entries.

![Journal entries posted.](india/in-done-payslip.png)

### Register Payments {#payroll/in-register}

After the `journal entries <payroll/in-journal>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} are validated, Odoo can generate payments.

Payments can be `Grouped by Partner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
if there is a partner associated with a salary rule.

![Payslips with a status of paid.](india/in-paid-payslip.png)

### Close Payroll

If there are no errors, payroll is completed for the pay period.

## Understanding the Indian Payslip

This payslip provides detailed information on allowances, deductions,
compliance requirements, and benefits. It helps employees understand how
their salary is calculated, the statutory and organizational deductions
applied, and the benefits they are entitled to, ensuring transparency
and trust in the payroll process.

::: seealso
`Create a Payslip <../payslips>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}
:::

![Indian Salary Payslip](india/in-payslip.png)

## Payroll reports

The Indian payroll localization includes payslip-related reports and
statutory compliance reports, including:

- `Salary Register <payroll/in_salary_register>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `EPF Report <payroll/in_epf_report>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
- `ESI Report <payroll/in_esi_report>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
- `Labour Wlefare Fund Report <payroll/in_lwf_report>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Salary Statement Report <payroll/in_salary_statement_report>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}
- `Yearly Salary by Employee <payroll/in_yearly_salary_report>`{.interpreted-text
  role="ref"}

### Salary Register {#payroll/in_salary_register}

The Register report provides a detailed month-wise record of salaries
paid to employees. This includes allowances, tax compliance, deductions,
and benefits for each employee. Employers can use this report to track
payroll expenditures and employee earnings.

To generate the report, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Reporting --> Salary Register`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. A `Salary Register`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} pop-up window will appear. Set the
`Start Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`End Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, select a specific
`Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to filter them by
the Salary Structure (otherwise all employees are included), and choose
the desired `Payslip Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
(`Paid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Done`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, or both) to filter the payslips. Once the filters are
set, click `Export XLSX`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to download
the salary register report.

![Salary Register Report](india/in-salary-register-report.png)

### EPF Report {#payroll/in_epf_report}

The `EPF (Employee Provident Fund)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
report lists the contributions made by both employer and employee toward
the Provident Fund. It includes the employee\'s EPF number, contribution
amounts, and employer matching contributions, ensuring compliance with
the Employees\' Provident Funds and Miscellaneous Provisions Act, 1952.

To generate the report, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Reporting --> EPF Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click on `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, set desired `Year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and `Month`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and click on
`Export XLSX File`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![EPF Report](india/in-epf-report.png)

### ESI Report {#payroll/in_esi_report}

The `ESI (Employee State Insurance)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
report details the contributions made toward the ESI scheme. It provides
both employer and employee contribution amounts, along with the
employee\'s ESI number, which is required for statutory filing with the
Employee State Insurance Corporation.

To generate the report, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Reporting --> ESI Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click on `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, set desired `Year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and `Month`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, Select the Report type
as per the need and click on `Export XLSX File`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

![ESI Report](india/in-esi-report.png)

### Labour Welfare Fund (LWF) Report {#payroll/in_lwf_report}

This report covers the contributions made toward the Labour Welfare Fund
(LWF) by both employer and employee. It tracks the deduction amounts and
helps ensure compliance with state-level welfare fund requirements.

To generate the report, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Reporting --> Labour Welfare Fund Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. A `Labour Welfare Fund Report`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} pop-up window will appear. Set the
`Start Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`End Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, select a specific
`Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to filter them by
Department (otherwise all employees are included), click
`Export XLSX`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to download the Labour
Welfare Fund Report report.

![Labour Welfare Fund Report](india/in-labour-welfare-fund-report.png)

### Salary Statement Report {#payroll/in_salary_statement_report}

The salary statement report is used to provide employees with their
current salary and cumulative salary, along with all salary components,
for the selected year.

To generate the report, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Reporting --> Salary Statement Report`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click on `New`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, set desired `Year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
and `Month`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, set the
`description`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for pdf name. Then
Click on `Populate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to create a pdf
for each employee, which can be accessed through the smart button which
appears after populating.

![Salary Statement Report](india/in-salary-statement-report.png)

### Yearly Salary by Employee {#payroll/in_yearly_salary_report}

The Yearly Salary by Employee report provides month-wise salary details
for the selected year, including salary components and the applicable
salary structure.

To generate the report, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Reporting --> Yearly Salary by Employee`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. A `Labour Welfare Fund Report`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} pop-up window will appear. Set the
`Year`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, set
`Department`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} or
`Job Position`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to filter out the
employees. Click on `Print`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
download Yearly Salary by Employee Report.

![Yearly Salary by Employee Report](india/in-yearly-salary-by-employee.png)

# Jordan

The Jordan **Payroll** localization offers a comprehensive solution for
managing payroll in compliance with Jordanian labor laws. It supports
income tax calculations using progressive tax brackets, social security
contributions from both employees and employers and basic salary
calculations, including allowances such as housing and transportation.

## Apps & modules {#payroll/jordan_apps}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Jordan **Payroll** localization:

+------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+-----------------------+----------------+
| Name                                                 | Technical name                           | Dependencies          | Description    |
+======================================================+==========================================+=======================+================+
| `Jordan - Payroll`{.interpreted-text                 | [l10n_jo_hr_payroll]{.title-ref}         | - hr_payroll          | Includes all   |
| role="guilabel"}                                     |                                          | - hr_payroll_holidays | salary rules,  |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | leave logic,   |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | and            |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | compensation   |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | rules          |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | compliant with |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | Jordan Labor   |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | Law.           |
+------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+-----------------------+----------------+
| `Jordan - Payroll with Accounting`{.interpreted-text | [l10n_jo_hr_payroll_account]{.title-ref} | - hr_payroll_account  | Links payroll  |
| role="guilabel"}                                     |                                          | - l10n_jo             | and accounting |
|                                                      |                                          | - l10n_jo_hr_payroll  | by creating    |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | journal        |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | entries to     |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | record payroll |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | in the         |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | company\'s     |
|                                                      |                                          |                       | books.         |
+------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+-----------------------+----------------+

Before configuring the Jordan localization, refer to the general
`payroll <../../payroll>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} documentation,
which includes the basic information for all localizations, as well as
all universal settings and fields.

::: seealso
`Jordan fiscal localization documentation <../../../finance/fiscal_localizations/jordan>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## General configurations

First, the company must be configured. Navigate to
`Settings app --> Users &
Companies --> Companies`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. From
the list, select the desired company, and configure the following
fields:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the business
  name in this field.

- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Complete the full
  address, including the `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Zip
  Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields.

  :::: note
  ::: title
  Note
  :::

  Jordan does not use the `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  field, this remains blank. The `Zip Code`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} refers to the Jordanian [Postal Code]{.title-ref}.
  ::::

- `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the company\'s tax
  identification number.

- `Company ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} : Enter the
  business\'s registry number.

- `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: By default,
  `JOD (Jordanian Dollars)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is selected.
  If not, select `JOD`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the
  drop-down menu.

## Employees

Every employee being paid must have their employee profiles configured
for the Jordan payroll localization. Additional fields are present after
configuring the database for Jordan.

To update an employee form, open the `Employees`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} app and click on the desired employee record. On
the employee form, configure the required fields in the related tabs.

### Work tab

Enter the `Work Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
employee in the `Location`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section of
the `Work`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

### Personal tab

Ensure the employee has a minimum of one
`trusted bank account <employees/private-contact>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} listed in the `Bank Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field in the `Private Contact`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section.

These accounts are used to pay the employee. Payroll **cannot** be
processed for employees without a *trusted*
`bank account <employees/private-contact>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. If no trusted bank account is set, a warning appears on the
**Payroll** dashboard and an error occurs when attempting to run
payroll.

If the employee is **not** a resident of Jordan, tick the
`Non-resident`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} box. This indicates
the employee is *not* eligible for personal exemptions.

Under the `Family`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, ensure
the `Has Dependants`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} box is ticked if
the employee has any dependants, such as a spouse, children, or parents.
This ensures they receive an additional exemption on their taxable
salary.

By default, the `Is Eligible for EOS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
checkbox is ticked, in the `Personal
Information`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section, indicating the
employee is eligible for end of service benefits. If the employee is
**not** eligible, ensure the box is unchecked.

Additionally, if the employee is blind, tick the
`Is Blind`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox. This ensures the
employee\'s entire salary is tax-exempt.

### Payroll tab

#### Contract overview section

This section holds information that drives salary calculations. Ensure
the following fields are configured:

- `Contract`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Ensure the contract
  dates are populated. The contract start date populates the first
  field, and if the contract has a set end date, that is populated in
  the second field.

- `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select how the
  employee is paid.

  - Select `Fixed Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for salaried
    employees who receive the same amount each pay period.
  - Select `Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for
    employees paid based on hours worked.

  :::: tip
  ::: title
  Tip
  :::

  Set a default `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
  salary `Structure Type
  <payroll/structure-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to configure
  employees in bulk. If needed, the default can be overridden on
  individual employee records if exceptions are needed.
  ::::

- `Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the monthly wage in
  this field, in `JOD (Jordanian Dollars)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}.

- `Employee Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select what kind
  of employee the contract is for, such as `Employee`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} or `Freelance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- `Contract Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Determines how the
  employee is paid and classified, such as `Permanent`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `Temporary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Seasonal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- `Pay Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  `Jordan: Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for this field.
  This defines when the employee is paid, their default working
  schedule, and the work entry type it applies to.

![The contract overview section of the employee form of the payroll tab.](jordan/jo-payroll-overview.png)

#### Schedule section

- `Work Entry Source`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Defines how
  `work entries <../work_entries>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} are
  generated for payroll during the specified pay period. The options
  are:
  - `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Based on the
    employee\'s assigned `working schedule
    <employees/schedule>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} (e.g., 40 hours
    per week).
  - `Attendances`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Based on
    `approved checked-in hours
    <../../attendances/management>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} in the
    **Attendances** app.
  - `Planning`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Based on
    `scheduled shifts <planning/shifts>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
    in the **Planning** app.
- `Extra Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Tick the checkbox to
  allow the **Attendances** app to add any extra work entries logged by
  the employee.
- `Working Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the
  drop-down menu, select `Jordan Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, which consists of a Sunday - Thursday, 40-hour work
  week.

#### Allowances section

The following sections of benefits are considered common ones offered by
Jordanian employers. This information needs to be populated with the
information selected by the employee.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The benefits listed in this section are considered the ones most
commonly offered by companies. If other employee benefits exist that
require regular paycheck deductions, they can be added as *inputs*.
::::

Enter the monthly allowance amount for `Housing`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `Transportation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
and `Other`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} allowances.

If the employee is tax exempt, enter the annual amount that is not
subject to taxes in the `Tax Exemption`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field.

If the employee\'s salary is based on commission, tick the
`Is Commission based`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} checkbox.

#### Annual leave provision section

Every year, employees receive days off. Enter the number of days in the
`Number of Leave
days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. The default value is 14.

## Social Insurance

Social insurance rules calculate the contribution amounts that are to be
paid by the employer and employee to the
`Social Security Corporation (SSC)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. This
is only available for Jordanian employees.

The employer contributes 14.25% of the employee\'s salary to the
`Social Security Corporation
(SSC)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, while the employee contributes
7.5% of their salary, which is deducted from their payslip.

For both employer and employee contributions, the base amount on which
they are calculated is bound by a cap that gets updated every year.

## Leaves

The following leave types are available to employees working in Jordan:

- `Annual leave`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Employee\'s are
  eligible for 21 days of annual leave, and if the employee requires
