  more days, they have to be requested from HR managers accordingly.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Since the annual leave is fully paid, it is not connected to a salary
rule, but it will appear on the worked days on the payslip form and on
the PDF printout.
::::

- `Sick leave`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Employee\'s working
  in Jordan are entitled to 14 days of paid sick leave per year, with
  the possibility of an additional 14 days if hospitalized. No
  deductions are applied to the employee in those cases.
- `Other leave types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: These leave
  types are fully paid and do not affect the final payslip, but are
  tracked for reporting purposes:
  - `Maternity leave`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Paternity Leave`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Pilgrimage Leave`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
  - `Study leave`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

## Income Tax

In Jordan, employees are subject to a progressive income tax system,
where tax rates increase with higher annual income brackets.

### Tax brackets

Depending on the annual income of the employee, the following rates
apply:

  Taxable Bracket   Range
  ----------------- ---------------------
  5%                0-5,000
  10%               5,001 - 10,000
  15%               10,001 - 15,000
  20%               15,001 - 20,000
  25%               20,001 - 1,000,000
  30%               More than 1,000,000

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Tax brackets are applied progressively. This means each portion of an
employee\'s income is taxed at its respective rate within each bracket,
rather than their entire income being taxed at the rate of the highest
bracket they fall into.
::::

### Exemptions

Several factors contribute to exempting part of an employee\'s gross
income, including:

- **Jordanian residency**: Residents are entitled to a yearly exemption
  of 12,000 JOD.
- **Blindness**: Individuals who are blind are **fully** exempt from
  income tax.
- **Dependents**: An additional 12,000 JOD exemption per year for
  employees with dependents.

## Overtime

Employees are entitled to additional pay for overtime worked, depending
on when the overtime hours are worked:

- On working days: Overtime is paid at 1.25 times the regular hourly
  wage.
- On rest days: Overtime is compensated at 1.5 times the regular hourly
  wage.

These percentages are recorded in the input parameters model.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The number of overtime hours is registered as other inputs directly on
payslips.
::::

## Provisions

Provisions are the amounts computed by the employer to account for the
payments made to the employee for
`end-of-service (EOS)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} benefits or annual
leaves. It is computed on a monthly basis.

- **End of service benefit provision**: This is computed by dividing the
  monthly gross salary by 12

  $$\frac{\text{Basic} + \text{Allowances}}{12}$$

- **Annual leave provision**: This is computed by dividing the gross
  salary by 30 to get the daily salary, then multiplying that by the
  number of leave days, and dividing the result by 12.

  $$\left(\frac{\text{Basic} + \text{Allowances}}{30}\right)
  \times
  \left(\frac{\text{Number of Leave Days}}{12}\right)$$

## End of Service

At the end of the employee\'s service, if they are eligible for
end-of-service benefits, they should receive the following two benefits:

- **Unused leaves compensation**: The Annual Leave Balance is shown on
  the employee\'s record. It is based on the annual leave type defined
  in the **Payroll** app settings and is calculated as the total
  remaining allocations for that specific leave type assigned to the
  employee.

  The balance represents the total remaining leave allocated to the
  employee but does not reflect the portion of leave days the employee
  has earned up to the current month.

  When calculating the benefit value, the deserved leave balance is
  determined based on the portion of the year worked. The benefit value
  is then calculated by multiplying this deserved balance by the
  employee\'s daily rate.

  ::: example
  If an employee is entitled to 14 leave days per year and has worked
  for 6 months, they deserve 7 leave days so far. If their daily rate is
  50 JOD, the benefit value is: 7 days Ã— 50 JOD = 350 JOD
  :::

  :::: important
  ::: title
  Important
  :::

  The flow mentioned above requires the allocation for the annual leave
  to be given fully upfront in the beginning of the year for that
  employee
  ::::

- **End of Service Benefit**: The calculation begins by determining the
  total number of days the employee has worked at the company, starting
  from their joining date up to their last working day.

  The total service duration is calculated out of a 365-day year.

  The resulting period in years is then multiplied by the employee\'s
  gross salary, which includes the basic salary and the allowances
  defined in the payroll tab on the employee record.

  $$(\text{Basic} + \text{Allowances}) \times \left(\frac{\text{Number of Days}}{365}\right)$$

## Payroll configuration

Several sections within the **Payroll** app installs a Salary Structure,
Structure Type, Rules, and Parameters specific to Jordan.

### Salary structures & structure types

When the **l10n_jo_hr_payroll** module is
`installed <payroll/jordan_apps>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, a new
`Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} gets installed,
`Jordan: Monthly Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This structure
includes one `Structure Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Jordan: Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

The `Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} contains all
the individual `salary rules
<payroll/jordan_apps>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} that informs the
**Payroll** app how to calculate employee payslips.

![The United States salary structure in the salary structures list.](jordan/jo-structure-types.png)

### Salary rules {#payroll/jordan_rules}

To view the salary rules that inform the salary structure what to do,
navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Structures`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and expand the `Jordan:
Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} entry to reveal the
`Jordan: Monthly Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} structure type.
Click `Jordan: Monthly Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to view
the detailed salary rules.

![The top portion of the US salary rules.](jordan/jo-rules-top-half.png)

Each rule defines how pay is calculated, taking into account factors
such as allowances, deductions, and taxes.

### Rule parameters

Some calculations require specific rates associated with them, or wage
caps. *Rules Parameters* are capable of listing a value, either a
percentage or a fixed amount, to reference in the salary rules.

::: example
The percentage rate for employee Social Security deductions is set in
the [Jordan Social Security Employee Deduction Rate %]{.title-ref}
parameter.
:::

Most rules pull information stored in the parameters module to get the
rate of the rule (a percentage) and the cap (a dollar amount).

To view rule parameters, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Rule
Parameters`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Here, all rule
parameters are displayed with their linked
`Salary Rules`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which can be
accessed. Review the parameters associated with a rule by looking for
the `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the rule, and make any
edits as needed.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo adds updated rule parameters for the current calendar year. It is
**not** recommended to edit rule parameters **unless a national
parameter has changed**, and is different from the rule parameters
created by Odoo. Check with all national regulations *before* making any
changes to rule parameters.
::::

## Run Jordan payroll

Before running payroll, the payroll officer must validate employee
`work entries
<../work_entries>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} to confirm pay accuracy
and catch errors. This includes checking that all time off is approved
and any overtime is appropriate.

Work entries sync based on the employee\'s
`contract <../contracts>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} configuration.
Odoo pulls from the assigned working schedule, attendance records,
planning schedule, and approved time off.

Any `discrepencies or conflicts <payroll/conflicts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} must be resolved, then the work entries can be
`regenerated <payroll/regenerate-work-entries>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Once everything is correct, draft payslips can be
`created individually <payroll/process>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
or in `groups <../pay_runs>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, referred to
in the **Payroll** app as *Pay Runs*.

![The work entries for a pay run, with some time off entered in the work entries.](jordan/jo-work-entries.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To cut down on the payroll officer\'s time, it is typical to process
payslips in batches, either by wage type (fixed salary vs hourly), pay
schedule (weekly, bi-weekly, monthly, etc.), department (direct cost vs.
administration), or any other grouping that best suits the company.
::::

The process of running payroll includes different actions that need to
be executed to ensure that the amount withheld from payroll taxes is
correct, the amount that the employee receives as their net salary is
correct, and the computation of hours worked reflects the employee\'s
actual hours worked, among others.

When running a payroll batch, check that the period, company, and
employees included are correct *before* starting to analyze or validate
the data.

Once the payslips are drafted, review them for accuracy. Check the
`Worked Days & Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, and
ensure the listed worked time is correct, as well as any other inputs.
Add any missing inputs, such as commissions, tips, reimbursements, that
are missing.

Next, check the various totals (gross pay, employee taxes, benefits,
employer taxes, net salaries), then click
`Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to update the salary
calculations, if there were edits. If everything is correct, click
`Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![The worked days tab of a payslip.](jordan/jo-check-payslips.png)

### Accounting check

The accounting process when running payroll has two components:
`creating journal entries
<payroll/jo-journal>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, and
`registering payments <payroll/jo-register>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

#### Journal entry creation {#payroll/jo-journal}

After payslips are confirmed and validated, journal entries are posted
either individually, or in a batch. The journal entry is created first
as a draft.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

It must be decided if journal entries are done individually or in
batches *before* running payroll.
::::

![All payslips in a draft state.](jordan/jo-draft.png)

Thirteen accounts from the Jordan
`CoA (Chart of Accounts)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} are included
with the Jordan payroll localization:

- \`500301 Basic Salary\`: Tracks the basic wages paid to employees.
- \`500302 Housing Allowance\`: Captures housing allowance payments
  provided to employees.
- \`500303 Transportation Allowance\`: Captures transportation allowance
  payments to employees.
- \`500308 Staff Other Allowances\`: Covers employee allowances that do
  not fit any other available categories.
- \`500310 Salary Deductions\`: Reflects deductions applied to employee
  salaries (e.g., advances, fines, statutory deductions).
- \`500305 Leave Salary\`: Records salaries actually paid to employees
  while on paid leave.
- \`201022 Social Security Payable\`: Holds both employee and employer
  amounts payable for social insurance contributions.
- \`200502 Leave Days Provision\`: Accrues the cost of paid leave; the
  balance is reduced when leave is taken, and any leave not taken may be
  paid out when the employee leaves the company.
- \`200503 End of Service Provision\`: Accumulates the end-of-service
  benefit monthly, so the amount can be paid (partially or fully) when
  the employee leaves, per service length and reason.
- \`200101 Payables\`: Shows amounts payable to employees as salaries
  (unpaid salary liability at period end).
- \`500202 End of Service Indemnity\`: Captures company expenses set
  aside to fund end-of-service benefits (expense-side counterpart to the
  provision).
- \`200307 Employee Income Tax\`: Accumulates the income tax amount
  withheld from the employee\'s salary.
- \`500311 Social Security Expenses\`: Captures The total expense amount
  from payments to the social insurance authority.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `CoA (Chart of Accounts)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
configuration is done by default when installing the Jordan payroll
localization. The account codes and names can be edited to suit the
company\'s needs.
::::

If everything seems correct on the journal entry draft, post the journal
entries.

![Journal entries posted.](jordan/jo-done.png)

### Register Payments {#payroll/jo-register}

After the `journal entries <payroll/journal>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} are validated, Odoo can generate payments.

Payments can be `Grouped by Partner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
if there is a partner associated with a salary rule.

![Payslips with a status of paid.](jordan/jo-paid.png)

### Close Payroll

If there are no errors, payroll is completed for the pay period.

## Reports

No additional payroll reports unique to the Jordan payroll localization
exist. All reports are the standard preconfigured reports included with
the **Payroll** app.




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/mexico.md ---

# Mexico

The Mexico payroll localization covers salary computations for
employees, including employee and employer payroll taxes.

Before configuring the Mexico localization, review the general
`payroll documentation
<../../payroll>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, which covers basic
configurations and settings applicable to all localizations.

## Apps & modules {#payroll/mexico_apps}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Mexico payroll localization:

+------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------+------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Name                                                 | Technical name                               | Dependencies                 | Description                                                        |
+======================================================+==============================================+==============================+====================================================================+
| `Mexico - Payroll`{.interpreted-text                 | [l10n_mx_hr_payroll]{.title-ref}             | - hr_payroll                 | Adds the required fields to manage employee payroll and time off   |
| role="guilabel"}                                     |                                              | - hr_work_entry_holidays     | data.                                                              |
|                                                      |                                              | - hr_payroll_holidays        |                                                                    |
+------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------+------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+
| `Mexico - Payroll CFDI`{.interpreted-text            | [l10n_mx_hr_payroll_account_edi]{.title-ref} | - l10n_mx_hr_payroll_account | Adds the ability to sign                                           |
| role="guilabel"}                                     |                                              | - l10n_mx_edi                | `CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text |
|                                                      |                                              |                              | role="abbr"} payroll documents with the government.                |
+------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------+------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+
| `Mexico - Payroll with Accounting`{.interpreted-text | [l10n_mx_hr_payroll_account]{.title-ref}     | - hr_payroll_account         | Adds the required rules and parameters to manage local payroll     |
| role="guilabel"}                                     |                                              | - l10n_mx                    | calculations.                                                      |
|                                                      |                                              | - l10n_mx_hr_payroll         |                                                                    |
|                                                      |                                              | - l10n_mx_edi                |                                                                    |
+------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------+------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+

:::: tip
::: title
Tip
:::

Installing the `Mexico - Payroll CFDI`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} module automatically installs both the
`Mexico - Payroll`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Mexico - Payroll with Accounting`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
modules.
::::

::: seealso
`Configure the Mexico fiscal localization <../../../finance/fiscal_localizations/mexico>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## Company configurations

First, the company must be configured. Navigate to
`Settings app --> Users &
Companies --> Companies`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. From
the list, select the desired company, and configure the following
fields:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the business
  name in this field.

- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Complete the full
  address, including the `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Zip Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

  :::: important
  ::: title
  Important
  :::

  The state selected in the company\'s address is associated as the
  *work address* by default for the employee, and the one used to
  calculate payroll taxes.
  ::::

- `RFC`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the company\'s
  `RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes, or Federal
  Taxpayer Registry)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} number.

- `Company ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} : This field is not
  used in the Mexico localization, and should remain blank.

- `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: By default,
  `MXN (Mexican pesos)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is selected. If
  not, select `MXN`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the
  drop-down menu.

- `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the company phone
  number.

- `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the email used for
  general contact information.

:::: warning
::: title
Warning
:::

Ensure the information is accurate, as it is used when calculating
various taxes.
::::

## Employees

Every employee being paid must have their employee profiles configured
for the Mexico payroll localization. Additional fields are present after
configuring the database for Mexico.

To update an employee form, open the `Employees`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} app and click on the desired employee record. On
the employee form, configure the required fields in the related tabs.

### Work tab

Enter the `Work Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
employee in the `Location`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section of
the `Work`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

The state selected in this address determines which salary rules Odoo
applies when calculating taxes.
::::

### Personal tab

Ensure the employee has a minimum of one
`trusted bank account <employees/private-contact>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} listed in the `Bank Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field in the `Private Contact`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section.

These accounts are used to pay the employee. Payroll **cannot** be
processed for employees without a *trusted*
`bank account <employees/private-contact>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. If no trusted bank account is set, a warning appears on the
**Payroll** dashboard and an error occurs when attempting to run
payroll.

Ensure the `Legal Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Gender`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields are populated and
configured in the `Personal Information`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section.

Ensure the following fields are properly populated in the
`Citizenship`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section:

- `Nationality (Country)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The
  employee\'s country of citizenship.
- `SSN No (Social Security Number)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  A personal 11-digit `NSS (NÃºmero de Seguridad
  Social)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} number.
- `RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes)`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}: A personal 13-digit alphanumeric tax identification
  number.
- `CURP (Clave Ãšnica de Registro de PoblaciÃ³n)`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}: A personal 18-character alphanumeric code.

![Where all personal information is located on the employee profile.](mexico/personal.png)

### Payroll tab

#### Contract overview section

This section holds information that drives salary calculations. Ensure
the following fields are configured:

- `Contract`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The time period the
  contract is valid for. If the second field is left blank, the contract
  runs indefinitely.

- `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select how the
  employee is paid.

  - Select `Fixed Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for salaried
    employees who receive the same amount each pay period.
  - Select `Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for
    employees paid based on hours worked.

  :::: tip
  ::: title
  Tip
  :::

  Set a default `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
  salary `Structure Type
  <payroll/structure-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to configure
  employees in bulk. If needed, the default can be overridden on
  individual employee records if exceptions are needed.
  ::::

- `Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the amount and
  frequency the employee is paid.

- `Contract Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Determines how the
  employee is paid and classified, such as
  `Indefinite Term Employment Contract`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `Hourly Wage Employment`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `Seasonal Employment Contract`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}.

  :::: important
  ::: title
  Important
  :::

  The `Contract Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
  visible on payslips.
  ::::

- `Pay Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  `Mexico: Employee.`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for this field.
  This defines when the employee is paid, their default working
  schedule, and the work entry type it applies to.

- `Regime Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select the correct
  regime type (RÃ©gimen de ContrataciÃ³n) for the employee. The selected
  regime type determines the employee\'s benefits, taxes, and social
  security contributions.

#### Schedule section

- `Work Entry Source`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which creates
  `work
  entries <../work_entries>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} based on the
  employee\'s assigned `working schedule
  <employees/schedule>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} (e.g., 40 hours
  per week).

  :::: note
  ::: title
  Note
  :::

  The Mexico payroll localization is currently not able to create work
  entries from the **Attendances** or **Planning** apps.
  ::::

- `Extra Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Tick the checkbox to
  allow the **Attendances** app to add any extra work entries logged by
  the employee.

- `Working Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the
  drop-down menu, select the default work schedule. This is particularly
  important for employees available to receive overtime pay (typically
  hourly employees, not salaried).

#### Options section

Enter the `Holiday Bonus Rate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
percentage given annually ot the employee in the corresponding field.
The percentage is calculated from the employee\'s base salary.

If the employee is contributing to a `Savings Fund`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, enter the monthly amount to be contributed. The
employer typically matches this amount, and the money is placed in a
savings account that is accessible once a year to the employee.

#### Vouchers section

Some companies may offer extra benefits in the form of vouchers, which
are paid to employees for food and transportation costs. If the company
provides these benefits, configure the following fields:

- `Payment Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the
  drop-down menu, select how often the vouchers are paid out. The
  default options are either `Last Day of the Month`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, if employees are paid at the end of the month, or
  `In the period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, if the vouchers
  are broken up and evenly distributed according to the payment
  schedule, such as weekly or bi-weekly.
- `Meal Vouchers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the monthly
  amount paid to the employee towards food expenses.
- `Transport Vouchers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  monthly amount paid to the employee towards transportation, such as
  bus fare or parking fees.
- `Gasoline Vouchers`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  monthly amount paid to the employee for their vehicle\'s gas.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The monetary amount for the vouchers is the *monthly amount* given to
employees. If the `Payment Period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is
set to `In the period`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, Odoo
calculates the voucher amount for each pay period.

For example, if an employee is paid weekly, and their
`Meal Voucher`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is set to \$100, the
employee receives \$25 in every weekly paycheck.
::::

![The payroll tab of an employee form, filled out for Mexico.](mexico/payroll-tab.png)

### Infonavit / Fonacot tab

#### Infonavit section

`INFONAVIT (Instituto del Fondo Nacional de la Vivienda para los Trabajadores)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} is a government institution that assists employees with
affordable mortgage credits, which can be used to buy, build, or remodel
a home, or pay off an existing mortgage.

##### Add an Infonavit credit

To create an
`INFONAVIT (Instituto del Fondo Nacional de la Vivienda para los Trabajadores)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} credit, click `Add a line`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and a `Create an Infonavit Credit`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} pop-up window loads.

By default, the `Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
populated with `In Progress`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This
indicates the credit is active.

Next, select the `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of credit,
either a `Fixed Monetary Fee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a
`Percentage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or a
`Discount Factor`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. After this field
is configured, a corresponding field appears on the form.

Enter the `Monthly Insurance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to be
paid directly to the debt. If any additional funds are contributed by
the employee, enter the additional amount in the `Extra Fixed Monthly
Contribution`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

The last field corresponds to the `Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} selected. Enter the `Fixed Monetary
Fee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `Percentage`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, or `Discount Factor`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} in the field.

Once all fields are configured, click the
`Save & Close`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and the credit
is added to the
`INFONAVIT (Instituto del Fondo Nacional de la Vivienda para los Trabajadores)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} section.

![The INFONAVIT section filled out for an employee.](mexico/infonavit.png)

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Once
`INFONAVIT (Instituto del Fondo Nacional de la Vivienda para los Trabajadores)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} credits are fully paid, the payroll officer **must** change
the `Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of each completed line
item to `Closed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

If the payroll officer does **not** change the status, money will
continue to be contributed to the employee\'s account in all subsequent
paychecks.
::::

#### Fonacot section

`FONACOT (Fondo Nacional para el Consumo de los Trabajadores)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} is a Mexican government program that provides employees
with low-cost loans for various needs, such as home improvements,
education, or emergencies.

The
`FONACOT (Fondo Nacional para el Consumo de los Trabajadores)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} section is where employee repayments are configured.

##### Add a Fonacot credit

To add a line to the
`FONACOT (Fondo Nacional para el Consumo de los Trabajadores)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} section, click `Add a line`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and a blank line loads. The `Status`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is set to `In
Progress`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, by default.

Enter the monthly payment amount in the `Import`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field. If the employee wishes to make any additional
payments each month, enter the value in the
`Extra Monthly Contribution`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Once
`FONACOT (Fondo Nacional para el Consumo de los Trabajadores)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} loans are paid off, the payroll officer **must** change the
`Status`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of each completed line item
to `Closed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

If the payroll officer does **not** change the status, money will
continue to be taken out of the employee\'s account in all subsequent
paychecks.
::::

## Payroll configuration

Several sections within the **Payroll** app installs a *salary
structure*, *structure type*, *rules*, and *rule parameters* specific to
Mexico.

Prior to running payroll, the
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} must also be configured.

### CFDI configuration

The `CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} is a **required** electronic tax receipt that acts as a
digital invoice. The
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} **must** be certified by a
`PAC (Authorized Certification Provider)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
*before* being submitted to the Mexican Tax Administration
(`SAT (Servicio de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}).

This document serves as proof of income, expenses, and payroll, and
requires both a `UUID
(Universally Unique Identifier)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} and a
digital signature, to comply with Mexican tax laws.

First, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, and scroll to the `CFDI`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section.

Enter the `Employer IMSS ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
corresponding field, and select the appropriate
`Risk Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} using the drop-down menu.
If no risk is associated with the company, select
`Does Not Apply`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Mexico assigns different `Risk Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
based on several factors, including information cross-referenced from
previously submitted employee and employer. Consult the company\'s
payroll officer to determine the correct risk type.
::::

### Salary structures & structure types

When the **l10n_mx_hr_payroll** module is
`installed <payroll/mexico_apps>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, a new
`Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} gets installed,
`Mexico: Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This structure
includes two `Structure Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, a
`Mexico: Regular Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and a `Mexico:
Christmas Bonus`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

The `Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} contains all
the individual `salary rules
<payroll/mexico_rules>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} for each
`Structure Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which informs the
**Payroll** app how to calculate employee payslips.

![The Mexico salary structures in the salary structures list.](mexico/structure-types.png)

### Salary rules {#payroll/mexico_rules}

To view the salary rules that inform the salary structure what to do,
navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Structures`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and expand the `Mexico:
Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} group to reveal the two
available structure types. Click `Mexico: Regular Pay`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to view the detailed regular pay salary rules.

![The top portion of the US salary rules.](mexico/mx-rules-top-half.png)

Each rule defines how pay is calculated, taking into account factors
such as bonuses, allowances, vouchers, and taxes.

### Rule parameters

Some calculations require specific rates associated with them, such as
bonuses and holidays. *Rule Parameters* are capable of listing a value,
either a percentage or a fixed amount, to reference in the salary rules.

Most rules pull information stored in the parameters module to get the
rate of the rule (a percentage) and the cap (a dollar amount).

To view rule parameters, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Rule
Parameters`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Here, all rule
parameters are displayed with their linked
`Salary Rules`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which can be
accessed. Review the parameters associated with a rule by looking for
the `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the rule, and make any
edits as needed.

In Mexico, all companies are **required** to configure the following
rule parameters:

- `Mexico: Risk Bonus Rate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Prima de
  Riesgo del IMSS): The `Risk Bonus Rate`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"} is referred to as the *Occupational Risk Premium
  (Prima de Riesgo de Trabajo)*. This is the amount the company must
  contribution to the
  `IMSS (Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"}, aka the *Mexican Social Security Institute*. This amount
  is based on the company\'s *accident rate*, which is calculated using
  multiple factors, including the number of accidents the company has
  reported, and the general level of risk the type of company works
  with. The rate is determined by the
  `IMSS (Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social)`{.interpreted-text
  role="abbr"} for each company, therefore this rate **must** be updated
  when configuring the Mexico payroll localization.
- `Mexico: Christmas Bonus`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (DÃ­as de
  Aguinaldo): In Mexico, an annual Christmas bonus is given to all
  employees. The bonus must be for a minimum of 15 days of pay.
  Companies that provide a higher bonus **must** modify this value. In
  Odoo, all employees of a company recieve the same amout of paid days
  for their Chirstmas bonus.
- `Mexico: Holiday Table`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (Tabla de
  vacaciones): This rule outlines the number of vacation days an
  employee is allocated, based on their years of service. This **must**
  be modified, if needed, to reflect the company\'s paid vacation
  policy.

::: example
The `Mexico: Risk Bonus Rate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of a
company is different from the one added by default in Odoo. To update
this, navigate to `Payroll app --> Configuration --> Rule
Parameters`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}, then, filter the
results by `Mexico: Risk Bonus Rate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
and edit the `Parameter Value`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
:::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo adds updated rule parameters for the current calendar year. It is
**not** recommended to edit rule parameters (other than the four that
must be reviewed and updated, listed above) **unless a national or state
parameter has changed**, and is different from the rule parameters
created by Odoo. Check with all local and national regulations *before*
making any changes to rule parameters.
::::

## Run Mexico payroll {#payroll/run_mexico}

Before running payroll, the payroll officer must validate employee
`work entries
<../work_entries>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} to confirm pay accuracy
and catch errors. This includes checking that all time off is approved
and any overtime is appropriate.

Work entries sync based on the employee\'s
`contract <../contracts>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} configuration.
Odoo pulls from the assigned working schedule, attendance records,
planning schedule, and approved time off.

Any `discrepencies or conflicts <payroll/conflicts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} must be resolved, then the work entries can be
`regenerated <payroll/regenerate-work-entries>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Once everything is correct, draft payslips can be
`created individually <payroll/process>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
or in `groups <../pay_runs>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, referred to
in the **Payroll** app as *Pay Runs*.

![The work entries for a pay run, with some time off entered in the work entries.](mexico/mexico-work-entries.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To cut down on the payroll officer\'s time, it is typical to process
payslips in batches, either by wage type (fixed salary vs hourly), pay
schedule (weekly, bi-weekly, monthly, etc.), department (direct cost vs.
administration), or any other grouping that best suits the company.
::::

The process of running payroll includes different actions that need to
be executed to ensure that the amount withheld for funds and government
institutions is correct, the amount that the employee receives as their
net salary is correct, and the computation of hours worked reflects the
employee\'s actual hours worked, among others.

When running a payroll batch, check that the period, company, and
employees included are correct *before* starting to analyze or validate
the data.

Once the payslips are drafted, review them for accuracy. Check the
`Worked Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Salary Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tabs, and ensure the
listed worked time is correct, as well as any other inputs. Add any
missing inputs, such as commissions, bonuses, and
`ISR (Impuesto Sobre la
Renta)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} adjustments that are missing.

Next, check the various totals (gross pay, vouchers, IMSS contributions,
`CEAV (CesantÃ­a en
Edad Avanzada y Vejez)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, taxes, and gross
pay), then click `Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
update the salary calculations, if there were edits. If everything is
correct, click `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![The worked days tab of a payslip.](mexico/check-payslips.png)

### Accounting check

The accounting process when running payroll has two components:
`creating journal entries
<payroll/journal-mx>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, and
`registering payments <payroll/register-mx>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

#### Journal entry creation {#payroll/journal-mx}

After payslips are confirmed and validated, journal entries are posted
either individually, or in a batch. The journal entry is created first
as a draft.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

It must be decided if journal entries are done individually or in
batches *before* running payroll.
::::

![All payslips in a draft state.](mexico/create-draft-entry.png)

Twenty-two accounts from the Mexico
`CoA (Chart of Accounts)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} are included
with the payroll localization:

- `110.01.01 Employment subsidy to apply`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `210.02.01 Provision for vacation to pay`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `211.01.01 Provision for employer IMSS to pay`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `211.02.01 Provision for SAR to pay`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `216.01.01 Withholding or income tax for wages and salaries`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `216.11.01 IMSS withholding tax`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `601.01.01 Wages and salaries`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `601.07.01 Holiday Bonus`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `601.15.01 Pantry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `601.19.01 Savings fund`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `601.26.01 IMSS quota`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `601.27.01 Contributions to infonavit`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `601.28.01 Contributions to the SAR`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `201.01.02 Employee Reimbursement`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `205.06.02 Other Various Short-Term Credits (Fonacot)`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `210.03.01 Provision for bonus to pay`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `210.04.01 Provision for savings fund to pay`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `211.03.01 Provision for infonavit to pay`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `601.12.01 Bonus`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `601.16.02 Transport (gasoline vouchers)`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}
- `601.16.01 Transport (support)`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `601.74.01 Commissions on sales`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The `CoA (Chart of Accounts)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
configuration is done by default when a company is located in Mexico.
The account codes and names can be edited to suit the company\'s needs.
If there is no `CoA (Chart of Accounts)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
account associated with a salary rule (used in a salary structure), Odoo
uses the account [Salary Expenses]{.title-ref} to create the journal
entry, regardless of the nature of the move.
::::

If everything seems correct on the journal entry draft, post the journal
entries.

![Journal entries posted.](mexico/post-entries.png)

### Register Payments {#payroll/register-mx}

After the `journal entries <payroll/journal-mx>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} are validated, Odoo can generate payments.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

To generate payments from payslips,employee\'s **must** have a *trusted*
bank account. If the employee\'s bank account is *not* marked as
[trusted]{.title-ref}, CFDI files **cannot** be generated through Odoo.
::::

![Payslips with a status of paid.](mexico/paid.png)

### Generate CFDI XML files

After payslips have bee processed and paid, a
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} XML file must be generated, which is then electronically
submitted to Mexico\'s `SAT (Servicio
de AdministraciÃ³n Tributaria)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}.

To create the
`CFDI (Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"} file, open the individual payslip, and click the
`Generate CFDI`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button.

Once the file has been created and sent, a record is stored in the
chatter.

### Close Payroll

If there are no errors, payroll is completed for the pay period.

## Run Christmas bonus payroll

To run the annual Christmas bonus, follow the same workflow for
`regular Mexico payroll
<payroll/run_mexico>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, using the
`Mexico: Christmas Bonus`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} salary
structure.




--- SOURCE: hr/payroll/payroll_localizations/saudi_arabia.md ---

# Saudi Arabia

The Saudi Arabia payroll localization covers salary computations for
employees, including national and provincial regulations.

Before configuring the Saudi Arabia localization, refer to the general
`payroll
<../../payroll>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} documentation, which
includes the basic information for all localizations, as well as all
universal settings and fields.

## Apps & modules {#payroll/saudi_apps}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the Saudi Arabia payroll
localization:

+------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+--------------------------+--------------------+
| Name                                                       | Technical name                           | Dependencies             | Description        |
+============================================================+==========================================+==========================+====================+
| `Saudi Arabia - Payroll`{.interpreted-text                 | [l10n_sa_hr_payroll]{.title-ref}         | - hr_payroll             | Provides Saudi     |
| role="guilabel"}                                           |                                          | - hr_contract_reports    | Arabia payroll     |
|                                                            |                                          | - hr_work_entry_holidays | basics, including  |
|                                                            |                                          | - hr_payroll_holidays    | salary structures  |
|                                                            |                                          |                          | (Basic/Gross/Net). |
+------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+--------------------------+--------------------+
| `Saudi Arabia - Payroll with Accounting`{.interpreted-text | [l10n_sa_hr_payroll_account]{.title-ref} | - hr_payroll_account     | Links payroll and  |
| role="guilabel"}                                           |                                          | - l10n_sa                | accounting by      |
|                                                            |                                          | - l10n_sa_hr_payroll     | creating journal   |
|                                                            |                                          |                          | entries (per       |
|                                                            |                                          |                          | payslip if needed) |
|                                                            |                                          |                          | to record payroll  |
|                                                            |                                          |                          | in the company\'s  |
|                                                            |                                          |                          | books.             |
+------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+--------------------------+--------------------+

::: seealso
`Configure the Saudi Arabia fiscal localization
<../../../finance/fiscal_localizations/saudi_arabia>`{.interpreted-text
role="doc"}
:::

## General configurations

First, the company must be configured. Navigate to
`Settings app --> Users &
Companies --> Companies`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. From
the list, select the desired company, and configure the following
fields:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the business
  name in this field.
- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Complete the full
  address, including the `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Zip Code`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
  `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `VAT Number`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the company\'s
  unique 15-digit `VAT (Value Added Tax)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  number.
- `Company ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} : Enter the
  business\'s MoL number.
- `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: By default,
  `SAR (Saudi riyal)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is selected. If
  not, select `SAR`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the
  drop-down menu.
- `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the company phone
  number.
- `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the email used for
  general contact information.

## Employees

Every employee being paid must have their employee profiles configured
for the Saudi Arabia payroll localization. Additional fields are present
after configuring the database for Saudi Arabia.

To update an employee form, open the `Employees`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} app and click on the desired employee record. On
the employee form, configure the required fields in the related tabs.

### Work tab

Enter the `Work Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
employee in the `Location`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section of
the `Work`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

### Personal tab

Select the correct `Nationality (Country)`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} for the employee, using the drop-down menu. The
selected nationality determines the GOSI rate.

Ensure the employee has a minimum of one
`trusted bank account <employees/private-contact>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} listed in the `Bank Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field in the `Private Contact`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section.

The employee\'s *bank account* is their
`IBAN (International Bank Account Number)`{.interpreted-text
role="abbr"}, which is how employees receive their salary according to
`WPS (Wages Protection System)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
regulations.

Payroll **cannot** be processed for employees without a *trusted*
`bank account
<employees/private-contact>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}. If no
trusted bank account is set, a warning appears on the **Payroll**
dashboard and an error occurs when attempting to run payroll.

![Where bank account information is located on the employee profile.](saudi_arabia/bank-sa.png)

### Payroll tab

#### Contract overview section

This section holds information that drives salary calculations. Ensure
the following fields are configured:

- `Contract`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: The Validity of the
  compensation conditions can be updated depending on the needs.

- `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select how the
  employee is paid.

  - Select `Fixed Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for salaried
    employees who receive the same amount each pay period.
  - Select `Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for
    employees paid based on hours worked.

  :::: tip
  ::: title
  Tip
  :::

  Set a default `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
  salary `Structure Type
  <payroll/structure-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to configure
  employees in bulk. If needed, the default can be overridden on
  individual employee records if exceptions are needed.
  ::::

- `Contract Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Determines how the
  employee is paid and classified, such as `Permanent`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `Temporary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `Seasonal`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- `Pay Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  `KSA (Kingdom of Saudi Arabia)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}
  `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for this field. This
  defines when the employee is paid, their default working schedule, and
  the work entry type it applies to.

![The contract overview section of the employee form of the payroll tab.](saudi_arabia/payroll-overview-sa.png)

#### Schedule section

- `Work Entry Source`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Defines how
  `work entries <../work_entries>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} are
  generated for payroll during the specified pay period. The options
  are:
  - `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Based on the
    employee\'s assigned `working schedule
    <employees/schedule>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} (e.g., 40 hours
    per week).
  - `Attendances`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Based on
    `approved checked-in hours
    <../../attendances/management>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} in the
    **Attendances** app.
  - `Planning`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Based on
    `scheduled shifts <planning/shifts>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
    in the **Planning** app.
- `Extra Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Tick the checkbox to
  allow the **Attendances** app to add any extra work entries logged by
  the employee.
- `Working Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the
  drop-down menu, select the default work schedule. This is particularly
  important for employees available to receive overtime pay (typically
  hourly employees, not salaried).

#### Saudi payroll information section {#payroll/saudi_payroll_info}

Enter the employee\'s unique 10-digit
`Saudi National / IQAMA ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} number in
this field. This number is issued to Saudi citizens by the
`Ministerial Agency of Civil Affairs`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and is used for exporting WPS reports.

The `Annual Leave Balance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field is
not editable, and displays the employee\'s available annual vacation
days.

#### Allowances section

This section determines the various benefits the employee receives.
Enter the monthly Saudi riyal amount the employee receives from the
company for `Housing`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Transportation`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`Other`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} costs.

Enter the annual amount paid by the company for a Saudi
`Iqama`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} ([iqama]{.title-ref} is the
Arabic word for [residence permit]{.title-ref}). An
`Iqama`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is an official residency and
identification card, similar to a visa, and it is . It is required for
**all** foreign nationals to have a valid `Iqama`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to work, live, and access various services in Saudi
Arabia.

Enter the annual amount the employer pays for the employee\'s
`Medical Insurance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
corresponding field.

If the employee needs a `Work Permit`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, enter the annual fees the company pays.

#### End of service provision section

In Saudi Arabia, each employee earns a percentage of their annual salary
for each year they have worked with a company. This amount is computed
based on their salary. When they leave the company, they receive this
compensation in one lump sum.

Enter the `Number of Days`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} the
employee earns in annual compensation, in the corresponding field. The
company sets this amount aside every year, so it is available when the
employee leaves.

## Payroll configuration

Several sections within the **Payroll** app installs a Salary Structure,
Structure Type, Rules, and Parameters specific to Saudi Arabia.
Additionally, some other configurations are required to run Saudi Arabia
payroll.

### Payroll settings {#payroll/saudi_payroll_settings}

Navigate to `Payroll --> Configuration --> Settings`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} to access the **Payroll** app settings required
for Saudi Arabia.

First, the company bank account must be configured to pay employees, per
WPS regulations. Click into the drop-down space beneath the
`Establishment Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field,
and click `Create...`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This opens a
`Create Establishment's Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
pop-up window.
`Configure the company's bank account  <employees/private-contact>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, and ensure it is marked as *trusted*. Click
`Save`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to save the information and
close the window.

Next, enter the company\'s `MoL Establishment ID`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. This ID number is provided by Saudi Arabia\'s Ministry
of Labor.

Finally, select the
`time off type <time_off/time-off-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
that is used to calculate the `Annual Leave Balance`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} set in the
`employee's profile <payroll/saudi_payroll_info>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

### Salary structures & structure types

When the **l10n_sa_hr_payroll** module is
`installed <payroll/saudi_apps>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, a new
`Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} gets installed,
`KSA Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This structure
includes two `Structure Types`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
`Saudi Arabia: Monthly Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
`SA Salary Advance
And Loan Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

The `Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} contains all
the individual `salary rules <payroll/usa_apps>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} that informs the **Payroll** app how to calculate employee
payslips.

![The Saudi Arabia salary structure in the salary structures list.](saudi_arabia/structure-types-sa.png)

### Salary rules {#payroll/saudi_rules}

To view the salary rules that inform the salary structure what to do,
navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Structures`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and expand the `KSA
Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} group to reveal the two
available structure types. Click `Saudi Arabia: Monthly
Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to view the detailed salary
rules for that structure type.

![The top portion of the US salary rules.](saudi_arabia/sa-rules-top-half.png)

Each rule defines how pay is calculated, taking into account factors
such as allowances, deductions, and company contributions.

### Rule parameters

Some calculations require specific rates associated with them, or wage
caps. *Rules Parameters* are capable of listing a value, either a
percentage or a fixed amount, to reference in the salary rules.

Most rules pull information stored in the parameters module to get the
rate of the rule (a percentage) and the cap (a dollar amount).

To view rule parameters, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Rule
Parameters`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Here, all rule
parameters are displayed with their linked
`Salary Rules`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which can be
accessed. Review the parameters associated with a rule by looking for
the `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the rule, and make any
edits as needed.

The Saudi Arabia payroll localization comes with four rule parameters:

- `Saudi GOSI Company Contribution`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  This rule parameter determines the calculation of the GOSI
  contributions the employer must make for Saudi Arabia employees.
- `Non-Saudi GOSI Company Contribution`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}: This rule parameter determines the calculation of
  the GOSI contributions the employer must make for each non-Saudi
  Arabian employee.
- `Saudi GOSI Employee Contribution`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}:
  This rule parameter determines the calculation of the GOSI
  contributions the employee must make, and is deducted from their pay.
- `Saudi Arabia Overtime Rate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: This
  rule parameter determines the overtime rate for employees.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo adds updated rule parameters for the current calendar year. It is
**not** recommended to edit rule parameters **unless a national or
provincial parameter has changed**, and is different from the rule
parameters created by Odoo. Check with all local and national
regulations *before* making any changes to rule parameters.
::::

## Run Saudi Arabia payroll {#payroll/saudi_run_payroll}

Before running payroll, the payroll officer must validate employee
`work entries
<../work_entries>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} to confirm pay accuracy
and catch errors. This includes checking that all time off is approved
and any overtime is appropriate.

Work entries sync based on the employee\'s
`contract <../contracts>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} configuration.
Odoo pulls from the assigned working schedule, attendance records,
planning schedule, and approved time off.

Any `discrepancies or conflicts <payroll/conflicts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} must be resolved, then the work entries can be
`regenerated <payroll/regenerate-work-entries>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Once everything is correct, draft payslips can be
`created individually <payroll/process>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
or in `groups <../pay_runs>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, referred to
in the **Payroll** app as *Pay Runs*.

![The work entries for a pay run, with some time off entered in the work entries.](saudi_arabia/work-entries-sa.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To cut down on the payroll officer\'s time, it is typical to process
payslips in batches, either by wage type (fixed salary vs hourly), pay
schedule (weekly, bi-weekly, monthly, etc.), department (direct cost vs.
administration), or any other grouping that best suits the company.
::::

The process of running payroll includes different actions that need to
be executed to ensure that the amount that the employee receives as
their net salary is correct, any deductions or allocations are correct,
and the computation of hours worked reflects the employee\'s actual
hours worked, among others.

When running a payroll batch, check that the period, company, and
employees included are correct *before* starting to analyze or validate
the data.

Once the payslips are drafted, review them for accuracy. Check the
`Worked Days & Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, and
ensure the listed worked time is correct, as well as any other inputs.
Add any missing inputs, such as commissions, tips, reimbursements, that
are missing.

Next, check the various totals (gross pay, allowances, contributions,
etc.), then click `Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
update the salary calculations, if there were edits. If everything is
correct, click `Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![The worked days tab of a payslip.](saudi_arabia/check-payslips-sa.png)

### Accounting check

The accounting process when running payroll has two components:
`creating journal entries
<payroll/journal_saudi>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, and
`registering payments <payroll/register_saudi>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

#### Journal entry creation {#payroll/journal_saudi}

After payslips are confirmed and validated, journal entries are posted
either individually, or in a batch. The journal entry is created first
as a draft.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

It must be decided if journal entries are done individually or in
batches *before* running payroll.
::::

![All payslips in a draft state.](saudi_arabia/draft.png)

Fifteen accounts from the Saudi Arabia
`CoA (Chart of Accounts)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} are included
with the payroll localization:

- \`400003 Basic Salary\`: Tracks the basic wages paid to employees.
- \`400004 Housing Allowance\`: Captures housing allowance payments
  provided to employees.
- \`400005 Transportation Allowance\`: Captures transportation allowance
  payments to employees.
- \`400012 Staff Other Allowances\`: Covers employee allowances that do
  not fit standard categories.
- \`106012 Prepaid Employee Expenses\`: Logged as prepaid assets for
  employer-paid items that are *not* wages (for example,
  [Iqama]{.title-ref} fees and medical insurance) and expensed as
  consumed.
- \`201006 Leave Days Provision\`: Accrues the cost of paid leave; the
  balance is reduced when leave is taken, and any leave not taken may be
  paid out at end of service.
- \`201022 GOSI Employee Payable\`: Holds amounts payable for social
  insurance contributions to the GOSI, including both employee and
  employer portions.
- \`202001 End of Service Provision\`: Accumulates the end-of-service
  benefit monthly so the amount can be paid (partially or fully) when
  the employee leaves, per service length and reason.
- \`400007 Leave Salary\`: Records salaries actually paid to employees
  while on paid leave.
- \`400008 End of Service Indemnity\`: Captures company expenses set
  aside to fund end-of-service benefits (expense-side counterpart to the
  provision).
- \`400009 Medical Insurance\`: Accounts for employer expenses related
  to employee medical insurance premiums.
- \`400010 Life Insurance\`: Tracks employer expenses for
  life/occupational insurance or the employer\'s portion of social
  insurance.
- \`400014 Visa Expenses\`: Used to track employer costs for non-Saudi
  Arabian employees\' visas and related processing/renewal fees.
- \`400074 Salary Deductions\`: Reflects deductions applied to employee
  salaries (e.g., advances, fines, statutory deductions).
- \`201002 Payables\`: Shows amounts payable to employees as salaries
  (unpaid salary liability at period end).

If everything seems correct on the journal entry draft, post the journal
entries.

![Journal entries posted.](saudi_arabia/validated.png)

### Register Payments {#payroll/register_saudi}

After the `journal entries <payroll/journal_saudi>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} are validated, Odoo can generate payments.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

To generate payments from payslips,employees **must** have a *trusted*
bank account. If the employee\'s bank account is *not* marked as
[trusted]{.title-ref}, WPS files **cannot** be generated through Odoo.
::::

Payments can be `Grouped by Partner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
if there is a partner associated with a salary rule.

![Payslips with a status of paid.](saudi_arabia/paid.png)

### Close Payroll

If there are no errors, payroll is completed for the pay period.

## Employee loans and advances

Employees are able to request `loans <payroll/loans>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} or `advances <payroll/advances>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} against their salaries. *Loans* are handled by creating
salary adjustments, whereas *advances* are created and managed manually.

### Employee loans {#payroll/loans}

Employees can take out *loans* against their salary and repay the loan
with automatic deductions from future paychecks. These loans are handled
by `creating a salary adjustment
<payroll/salary_adjust_saudi>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to log the
total loan amount and set up a repayment plan, and
`creating a payslip for the total loan amount <payroll/loan_payslip_saudi>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. The employee then
`repays the loan <payroll/repay_saudi>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} in
the increments configured in the salary adjustment.

#### Create a salary adjustment {#payroll/salary_adjust_saudi}

When an employee requests a loan, first a *salary adjustment* is made,
where the total loan amount and repayment plan is configured.

To create the loan and repayment schedule, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Employees -->
Salary Adjustments`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Click
`New`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and a blank
`Salary Adjustment`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form loads.

Configure the following fields on the form:

- `Employees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down
  menu, select the employee taking out the loan.
- `Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down menu,
  select `Loan Deduction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Payslip Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the
  `SAR (Saudi riyal)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} amount to be repaid
  each payslip.
- `Duration`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Tick the
  `Limited`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} option, which reveals a
  `until`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (amount)
  `paid`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field. First, using the
  calendar selector, enter the date the repayment begins. Next, enter
  the total loan amount in the field after `until`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}. Once both fields are configured, Odoo calculates
  when the loan is fully repaid, and displays the date as follows: [end
  in \# years: (date)]{.title-ref}.
- `Note`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter any details about the
  loan in this field.

![A salary adjustment form filled out for an employee loan.](saudi_arabia/loan.png)

#### Generate a loan payslip {#payroll/loan_payslip_saudi}

After creating the salary adjustment, a button labeled
`Create Loan Payslip`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} appears above
the form. Click `Create Loan Payslip`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and Odoo automatically generates a payslip configured
for the employee loan, in the amount set up in the `salary adjustment
<payroll/salary_adjust_saudi>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

Review the payslip to ensure all the fields and tabs are correct. The
`Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} should be
`SA Salary Advance And Loan Structure`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}. The `Salary Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
tab should list a `Loan Deduction`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
and the `Total`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} should be the full
amount of the loan.

Click into the `Other Info`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, and
enter the date the employee receives the payment in the
`Payment Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

Once the payslip form is correct, click
`Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then click `Create
Draft Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and click
`OK`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the confirmation pop-up
window. Next, click `Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to mark the
payment as paid, then click `Create Payment Report`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to
`generate the WPS report <payroll/reports_saudi>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

![A configured loan payslip.](saudi_arabia/loan-payslip.png)

#### Loan repayment to employer {#payroll/repay_saudi}

From the date set on the
`salary attachment <payroll/salary_adjust_saudi>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, all future paychecks have the configured repayment amount
taken out, to go towards the loan. Once the loan is fully paid, the
deductions end.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The deductions should end after the total is repaid, according to the
salary adjustment. To ensure payments *stop* being taken out of the
employee\'s paychecks after the loan has been repaid, open the salary
adjustment record. If the salary adjustment still has a status of
`Running`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, click the
`Mark as Completed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button, and the
status changes to `Closed`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and
payments stop.
::::

### Salary advances {#payroll/advances}

Employees can request an advance of their salary, outside of the regular
pay cycle. This process is done by paying the employee with a
`manually created payslip <payroll/advance_slip>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, then the employee repays the advance either
`in full <payroll/repay_full>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} in the next
payslip, or in
`multiple payments <payroll/repay_partial>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} in subsequent paychecks until the total is repaid.

#### Create advance payslip {#payroll/advance_slip}

To issue an advanced payment, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Payslips --> Payslips`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}. Click the `New Off-Cycle`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} button and a blank
`Employee Payslips`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} form loads.

Configure the following fields on the payslip:

- `Employees`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down
  menu, select the employee taking out the advance.

  :::: note
  ::: title
  Note
  :::

  Once the `Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected,
  the `Employee Record`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field
  populates with the most recent employee version (contract).
  ::::

- `Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the drop-down
  menu, select `SA Salary Advance And Loan
  Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Next, click `Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
`Salary Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab. Select `Salary
Advance`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
`Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Next, enter any relevant
description in the `Notes`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field,
such as [Advance for auto repair]{.title-ref}. Last, enter the amount
being advanced in the `Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

Once these fields have been configured, click
`Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, then click
`Create Draft Entry`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, and click
`OK`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the confirmation pop-up
window. Click `Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to mark the
payment as paid, then click `Create Payment Report`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} to
`generate the WPS report <payroll/reports_saudi>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

![A configured loan payslip.](saudi_arabia/advance.png)

#### Automatic repayment in full {#payroll/repay_full}

When the employee\'s next payslip is generated (using the [Saudi Arabia:
Monthly Pay]{.title-ref} structure), a line is added under the [Other
Inputs]{.title-ref} tab, titled [Advanced Recovery]{.title-ref}.

The amount is based on the advance previously taken by the employee. If
the employee cannot repay the full amount in the paycheck, the repayment
can be broken up into `multiple payments
<payroll/repay_partial>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}.

#### Multiple payments {#payroll/repay_partial}

When an employee cannot repay an advance in full in a future payslip,
the employee can make partial payments until the advance is repaid. To
do this, the amount being deducted from the employee\'s paycheck must be
manually modified.

Open the employee\'s payslip, and under the
`Salary Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, modify the
amount specified on the `Advanced Recovery`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} line.

Odoo automatically calculates the remainder of the advance, and adds an
`Advanced
Recovery`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} line for the balance in the
subsequent payslip. If the employee cannot pay the second payment in
full, the `Advanced Recovery`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} line
can be edited in the following payslip.

## WPS reports {#payroll/reports_saudi}

The WPS report is a mandatory report all Saudi Arabian companies are
required to provide the government. The report confirms employee wages,
including when and how much they were paid. The WPS report can be
generated either per payslip or per pay run.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

This report is structured in accordance with the technical guidelines
issued by the MHRSD.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

To run the WPS report, the
`Establishment Bank Account`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`Ministry of
Labor Establishment ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields
**must** be
`configured <payroll/saudi_payroll_settings>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} for the company.

Ensure the `Establishment Bank Account`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} has the `Bank Establishment ID`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and `Bank SARIE Code`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} fields configured, and the bank is marked as
`Trusted`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

Ensure all employees included in the report have a
`Saudi National / IQAMA ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} set on
their employee profile.
::::

First,
`payslips or pay runs are generated <payroll/saudi_run_payroll>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}, then the `journal
entries are posted <payroll/journal_saudi>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Click the `Payment Report`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} button on
the `Pay Runs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} dashboard, the
individual pay run, or an individual payslip, and a payment report
pop-up window loads.

`Saudi WPS`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is selected in the
`Export Format`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, by default,
and the `Payment Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and
`WPS Value Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} fields are both
populated according to the selected payslips or pay runs.

The `WPS Debit Date`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is an optional
field, and specifies the date the company physically pays the employees
(transfers funds from the company account to employee accounts).

Once all fields are configured, click `Generate`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, and the WPS report is created.
