# TÃ¼rkiye

The TÃ¼rkiye payroll localization covers salary computations for
employees, including both employee and employer payroll taxes. It
accounts for federal and state regulations.

Before configuring the TÃ¼rkiye localization, refer to the general
`payroll <../../payroll>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} documentation,
which includes the basic information for all localizations, as well as
all universal settings and fields.

## Apps & modules {#payroll/turkey_apps}

`Install <general/install>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} the following
modules to get all the features of the TÃ¼rkiye payroll localization:

+-------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+------------------------------+----------------+
| Name                                                  | Technical name                           | Dependencies                 | Description    |
+=======================================================+==========================================+==============================+================+
| `TÃ¼rkiye - Payroll`{.interpreted-text                 | [l10n_tr_hr_payroll]{.title-ref}         | - hr_payroll                 | Includes all   |
| role="guilabel"}                                      |                                          |                              | salary rules,  |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | leave logic,   |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | and            |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | compensation   |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | rules          |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | compliant with |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | TÃ¼rkiye labor  |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | laws.          |
+-------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+------------------------------+----------------+
| `TÃ¼rkiye - Payroll with Accounting`{.interpreted-text | [l10n_tr_hr_payroll_account]{.title-ref} | - hr_payroll_account         | Links payroll  |
| role="guilabel"}                                      |                                          | - l10n_tr_hr_payroll_account | and accounting |
|                                                       |                                          | - l10n_tr_hr_payroll         | by creating    |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | journal        |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | entries (per   |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | payslip if     |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | needed) to     |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | record payroll |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | in the         |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | company\'s     |
|                                                       |                                          |                              | books.         |
+-------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+------------------------------+----------------+

## General configurations

First, the company must be configured. Navigate to
`Settings app --> Users &
Companies --> Companies`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. From
the list, select the desired company, and configure the following
fields:

- `Company Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the business
  name in this field.
- `Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Complete the full
  address, including the `City`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"},
  `State`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, `ZIP`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, and `Country`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.
- `Tax ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the company\'s tax
  ID.
- `Company ID`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} : Enter the
  business\'s ID number.
- `Currency`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: By default,
  `TRY (Turkish lira)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} is selected. If
  not, select `TRY`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} from the
  drop-down menu.
- `Phone`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the company phone
  number.
- `Email`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Enter the email used for
  general contact information.

## Employees

Every employee being paid must have their employee profiles configured
for the TÃ¼rkiye payroll localization. Additional fields are present
after configuring the database for TÃ¼rkiye.

To update an employee form, open the `Employees`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} app and click on the desired employee record. On
the employee form, configure the required fields in the related tabs.

### Work tab

Enter the `Work Address`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for the
employee in the `Location`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} section of
the `Work`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab.

### Personal tab

Ensure the employee has a minimum of one
`trusted bank account <employees/private-contact>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} listed in the `Bank Accounts`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} field in the `Private Contact`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} section.

These accounts are used to pay the employee. Payroll **cannot** be
processed for employees without a *trusted*
`bank account <employees/private-contact>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}. If no trusted bank account is set, a warning appears on the
**Payroll** dashboard and an error occurs when attempting to run
payroll.

### Payroll tab

#### Contract overview section {#payroll/turkey_contract}

This section holds information that drives salary calculations. Ensure
the following fields are configured:

- `Contract`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Ensure a contract start
  date is entered in the first field.

- `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select how the
  employee is paid.

  - Select `Fixed Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for salaried
    employees who receive the same amount each pay period.
  - Select `Hourly Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for
    employees paid based on hours worked.

  :::: tip
  ::: title
  Tip
  :::

  Set a default `Wage Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} in the
  salary `Structure Type
  <payroll/structure-types>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} to configure
  employees in bulk. If needed, the default can be overridden on
  individual employee records if exceptions are needed.
  ::::

- `Net to Gross`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Leave this box
  unchecked if the gross salary is based on a fixed gross and a
  dynamically computed net (Gross to Net). Activate this option if the
  gross salary is based on a fixed net and a dynamically computed gross
  (Net to Gross).

- `Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: If
  `Net to Gross`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} is unchecked, this
  field displays `Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. If it is
  checked, this field displays `Net Wage`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}. Enter the monthly amount earned by the employee.

- `Employee Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: May affect the
  working hours for the employee.

- `Contract Type`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Determines how the
  employee is paid and classified, such as `Permanent`{.interpreted-text
  role="guilabel"}, `Temporary`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, or
  `Student`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

- `Pay Category`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Select
  `TÃ¼rkiye: Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} for this field.
  This defines when the employee is paid, their default working
  schedule, and the work entry type it applies to.

![The contract overview section of the employee form of the payroll tab.](turkey/contract-tr.png)

#### Schedule section

- `Work Entry Source`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Defines how
  `work entries <../work_entries>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} are
  generated for payroll during the specified pay period. The options
  are:
  - `Working Schedule`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Based on the
    employee\'s assigned `working schedule
    <employees/schedule>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} (e.g., 40 hours
    per week).
  - `Attendances`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Based on
    `approved checked-in hours
    <../../attendances/management>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} in the
    **Attendances** app.
  - `Planning`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Based on
    `scheduled shifts <planning/shifts>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
    in the **Planning** app.
- `Working Hours`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}: Using the
  drop-down menu, select the default work schedule. This is particularly
  important for employees available to receive overtime pay (typically
  hourly employees, not salaried).

## Payroll configuration

Several sections within the **Payroll** app install a Salary Structure,
Structure Type, Rules, and Parameters specific to TÃ¼rkiye.

### Salary structures & structure types

When the **l10n_tr_payroll** module is
`installed <payroll/turkey_apps>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}, a new
`Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} gets installed,
`TÃ¼rkiye: Regular Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. This
structure includes one `Structure Type`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}, `TÃ¼rkiye: Employee`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"}.

The `Salary Structure`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} contains all
the individual `salary rules
<payroll/turkey_rules>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} that informs the
**Payroll** app how to calculate employee payslips.

![The TÃ¼rkiye salary structure in the salary structures list.](turkey/structure-types-tr.png)

### Salary rules {#payroll/turkey_rules}

To view the salary rules that inform the salary structure what to do,
navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Structures`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"} and expand the `TÃ¼rkiye:
Employee`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} group to reveal the
`TÃ¼rkiye: Monthly Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} structure
type. Click `TÃ¼rkiye: Monthly Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to
view the detailed salary rules.

![The top portion of the TÃ¼rkiye salary rules.](turkey/tr-rules-top-half.png)

Each rule defines how pay is calculated, taking into account factors
such as commissions, bonuses, taxes, and insurance.

### Rule parameters {#payroll/turkey_rule-parameters}

Some calculations require specific rates associated with them, or wage
caps. *Rules Parameters* are capable of listing a value, either a
percentage or a fixed amount, to reference in the salary rules.

Most rules pull information stored in the parameters module to get the
rate of the rule (a percentage) and the cap (a monetary amount).

To view rule parameters, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Rule
Parameters`{.interpreted-text role="menuselection"}. Here, all rule
parameters are displayed with their linked
`Salary Rules`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}, which can be
accessed. Review the parameters associated with a rule by looking for
the `Name`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} of the rule, and make any
edits as needed.

Ensure the following rules parameters are up to date with current rules
and regulations:

- `TÃ¼rkiye Minimum Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `TÃ¼rkiye SSI Base Amount Ceiling`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `TÃ¼rkiye Tax Exemption Amount`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `TÃ¼rkiye Stamp Tax Percentage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `TÃ¼rkiye Tax Bracket Rates`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
- `TÃ¼rkiye SSI Company Contribution`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}

::: example
The minimum wage is updated, and is different from the one added by
default in Odoo. To update this, navigate to
`Payroll app --> Configuration --> Rule Parameters`{.interpreted-text
role="menuselection"}, then click the rule parameter
`TÃ¼rkiye Minimum Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}. Click
`Add a line`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} and add the new
`Parameter Value`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} (minimum wage), and
reference the date the change goes into effect.
:::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Odoo adds updated rule parameters for the current calendar year. It is
**not** recommended to edit rule parameters **unless a parameter has
changed**, and is different from the rule parameters created by Odoo.
Check with all local and national regulations *before* making any
changes to rule parameters.
::::

## TÃ¼rkiye taxes

The following sections explain in detail the various employer and
employee taxes specific to TÃ¼rkiye.

### Social insurance

Social insurance rules calculate the contribution amounts that are to be
paid by the employer and employee to the
`SSI (Social Security Institution)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}. This
is **only** available for TÃ¼rkiye employees.

Social insurance consists of two main categories:

- **Social Insurance**: Employers contribute 15% of their employee\'s
  salaries to the `SSI
  (Social Security Institution)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"}, while
  employees contribute 14% of their salaries, which is deducted from
  their payslips.
- **Unemployment Insurance**: Employers contribute 2% of their
  employee\'s salaries to the
  `SSI (Social Security Institution)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"},
  while employees contribute 1% of their salary, which is deducted from
  their payslips.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Employer and employee contributions for both categories are calculated
according to a salary maximum that is revised each year. Therefore, it
is necessary to check the corresponding
`rule parameters <payroll/turkey_rule-parameters>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} to ensure all taxes are current.
::::

### Income tax

Employees in TÃ¼rkiye are subject to a progressive income tax system,
where tax rates increase with higher annual income levels.

To calculate the deductible tax amount for the current month, the
following is done:

1.  **Compute year-to-date gross amount**: This serves as the base
    amount for calculating the employee\'s taxable salary.
2.  **Determine year-to-date taxable amount**: The taxable amount is
    compared to progressive tax brackets to compute the year-to-date tax
    amount due.
3.  **Subtract prior month\'s tax**: The amount taxed in previous months
    is subtracted from the year-to-date tax to obtain the pre-exemption
    tax amount due for the current month.
4.  **Deduct exemption amount**: The exemption amount is deducted from
    the pre-exemption tax to determine the final tax due amount
    post-exemptions.

#### Tax brackets

As of 2025, and depending on the annual income of the employee, the
following rates apply:

  Taxable Bracket   Range
  ----------------- ---------------------------
  15%               0.00 - 158,000.00
  20%               158,000.00 - 330,000.00
  27%               330,000.00 - 800,000.00
  35%               800,000.00 - 4,300,000.00
  40%               above 4,300,000.00

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

Tax brackets are applied progressively. This means each portion of an
employee\'s income is taxed at its respective rate within each bracket,
rather than their entire income being taxed at the highest rate they
fall into.
::::

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Turkish employees benefit from a monthly personal income tax
**exemption**, which is adjusted each year. For 2025, the exemption
amount is TRY 3,315.70 per month, from January through July.
::::

#### Stamp Tax

Stamp tax is applied to gross salary payments in TÃ¼rkiye. The standard
rate is 0.759% (i.e. 7.59 per thousand), which is withheld from the
employee\'s gross wage and remitted to the tax authority
`GIB (Gelir Ä°daresi BaÅŸkanliÄŸi,)`{.interpreted-text role="abbr"} by the
employer.

The base amount for the stamp tax is the total gross salary amount
(including bonuses or extras).

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

Turkish employees receive a personal stamp tax **exemption**, the value
of which is updated annually. As of 2025, the exemption amount is TRY
197.38 per month, from January through July. This applies to gross
earnings up to the legal minimum wage level before calculating stamp
tax.
::::

### Net to gross

On an employee record, if the option `Net to Gross`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is enabled in the `contract
section <payroll/turkey_contract>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} of the
payroll tab, the net salary is fixed, and specified in the
`Net Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field, while the gross
wage is recalculated each month, and increases throughout the year.

The gross wage is what tax calculations are based on, so for these
employees, the monthly *net* wage does **not** change, but the monthly
*gross* amount is recalculated each month, changing the taxes with it.

In this scenario, the least amount of taxes are paid in the beginning of
the year, and taxes increase as the year progresses.

::: example
On January 31st, an employee\'s year-to-date total income is â‚º10,000.
The income tax is calculated based on the â‚º10,000, which in this example
is â‚º800. In February, the employee\'s year-to-date gross is â‚º20,000, and
the taxes are calculated based on that figure, for a total of â‚º2,000.

Since the employee already paid â‚º800 in January, the taxes due for
February are â‚º1,200 because the employee already paid â‚º800 toward that
total (â‚º2,000 - â‚º800 = â‚º1,200).
:::

### Gross to net

On an employee record, if the option `Net to Gross`{.interpreted-text
role="guilabel"} is **not** enabled in the
`contract section <payroll/turkey_contract>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} of the payroll tab, the gross salary is calculated based on
the `Wage`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} field.

The gross wage then has all the salary rules computed, to determine the
*net* wage. The taxes are then computed based on the gross wage. In this
scenario, unlike with net to gross, taxes are more consistent and do not
change that much, from month to month.

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

The gross from net calculation depends on the salary rules defined in
the `TÃ¼rkiye:
Monthly Pay`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} salary structure.
Changes made to those rules affect the computed amount.
::::

## Run TÃ¼rkiye payroll

Before running payroll, the payroll officer must validate employee
`work entries
<../work_entries>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} to confirm pay accuracy
and catch errors. This includes checking that all time off is approved
and any overtime is appropriate.

Work entries sync based on the employee\'s
`contract <../contracts>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"} configuration.
Odoo pulls from the assigned working schedule, attendance records,
planning schedule, and approved time off.

Any `discrepancies or conflicts <payroll/conflicts>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} must be resolved, then the work entries can be
`regenerated <payroll/regenerate-work-entries>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

Once everything is correct, draft payslips can be
`created individually <payroll/process>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"}
or in `groups <../pay_runs>`{.interpreted-text role="doc"}, referred to
in the **Payroll** app as *Pay Runs*.

![The work entries for a pay run, with some time off entered in the work entries.](turkey/work-entries-tr.png)

:::: note
::: title
Note
:::

To cut down on the payroll officer\'s time, it is typical to process
payslips in batches, either by wage type (fixed salary vs hourly), pay
schedule (weekly, bi-weekly, monthly, etc.), department (direct cost vs.
administration), or any other grouping that best suits the company.
::::

The process of running payroll includes different actions that need to
be executed to ensure that the amount withheld from payroll taxes is
correct, the amount that the employee receives as their net salary is
correct, and the computation of hours worked reflects the employee\'s
actual hours worked, among others.

When running a payroll batch, check that the period, company, and
employees included are correct *before* starting to analyze or validate
the data.

Once the payslips are drafted, review them for accuracy. Check the
`Worked Days & Inputs`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} tab, and
ensure the listed worked time is correct, as well as any other inputs.
Add any missing inputs, such as commissions, tips, reimbursements, that
are missing.

Next, check the various totals (gross pay, employee taxes, benefits,
employer taxes, net salaries), then click
`Compute Sheet`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"} to update the salary
calculations, if there were edits. If everything is correct, click
`Validate`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}.

![The worked days tab of a payslip.](turkey/check-payslip-tr.png)

### Accounting check

The accounting process when running payroll has two components:
`creating journal entries
<payroll/journal-tr>`{.interpreted-text role="ref"} and
`registering payments <payroll/register-tr>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"}.

#### Journal entry creation {#payroll/journal-tr}

After payslips are confirmed and validated, journal entries are posted
either individually, or in a batch. The journal entry is created first
as a draft.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

It must be decided if journal entries are done individually or in
batches *before* running payroll.
::::

![All payslips in a draft state.](turkey/create-draft-entry-tr.png)

### Register Payments {#payroll/register-tr}

After the `journal entries <payroll/journal-tr>`{.interpreted-text
role="ref"} are validated, Odoo can generate payments.

:::: important
::: title
Important
:::

To generate payments from payslips, employees **must** have a *trusted*
bank account. If the employee\'s bank account is *not* marked as
[trusted]{.title-ref}, payments **cannot** be generated through Odoo.
::::

Payments can be `Grouped by Partner`{.interpreted-text role="guilabel"}
if there is a partner associated with a salary rule.

![Payslips with a status of paid.](turkey/paid-tr.png)

### Close Payroll

If there are no errors, payroll is completed for the pay period.
